HomS 8 (BlHom 2)
B3.2.8.
Quinquagesima Sunday: Morris 1874-80, 15-25.



 1. <foreign>DOMINICA PRIMA IN QUINQVAGESIMA</foreign>.
 1. Geherað nu, men þa leofestan, hu Lucas se godspellere
sægde be þisse ondweardan tide, ge eac be þære toweardan, & hu
Drihten wolde cuman to þære stowe þe he on þrowian wolde.
 4. Þa mid þy þe hit nealæhte þære tide, Hælend
genam his twelf þegnas sundor of þæm weorode, & him to cwæþ, Nu
we faraþ to Gerusalem, & þonne beoð gefylde ealle þa halgan
gewreotu þe be mannes suna awritene wæron.
 7. & he bið geseald hæþnum mannum, þæt hie hine
bysmrian.
 8. Hie hine bindað & swingaþ & spætliað on his
onsyne; & æfter þære swinglan hie hine ofsleað; & þy
þriddan dæge he of deaþe ariseþ.
 10. Hi þa þa Cristes þegnas þeossa worda nan ongeotan ne
mehton; ac hie wæron him bediglede, forþon þe hie wæron þagyt mid
worldgeþohtum bewrigene.
 13. Þa wæs geworden þæt Hælend genealæhte Gericho.
 14. Þa sæt þær sum blind þearfa be ðon wege, &
gehyrde myccle menigo him beforan feran; þa ahsode he hwæt þæt
wære.
 16. Hie him ondsworedon & cwædon, Hit is Hælend se
Nazarenisca.
 17. He þa cleopode hluddre stefne, & þus cwæþ: Miltsa
me, Dauides sunu, miltsa me.
 18. Þa foreferendan him budon þæt he swigade; & swa hie
him swyþor styrdon, swa he hludor cleopode, & þus cwæþ: Miltsa me,
Dauides sunu, miltsa me.
 21. Hælend þa gestod, & hine het to him gelædon; &
mid þy þe he him genealæhte, he him tocwæþ, Hwæt wilt þu
þæt ic þe do?
 23. Se blinda him ondswerede & cwæþ, Drihten, þæt ic
mæge geseon.
 24. Hælend him to cwæþ, Loca nu; þin agen geleafa þe
hæfþ gehæledne.
 25. He þa sona instæpes geseh, & þa sona wæs Drihtne
fylgende; & hine herede & weorþode.
 27. & eal þæt folc þe þis wundor geseah, his noman
myccledon.
 28. Hwæt we nu gehyrdon þis halige godspel beforan us
rædan, & þeh we hit sceolan eft ofercweþan, þæt we þe geornor
witon þæt hit us to bysene belimpeþ eces lifes.
 30. Nu ær we gehyrdon þæt Hælend his þegnum sæde
his þrowunga & þa sar & ða bysmra þe he mid Iudeum adreogan
wolde.
 32. Forðon he þis dyde þæt he wolde þonne hie gesawon
his ða heardan bendas, þæt hie ne wæron on heora mode gedrefede.
 34. &, ðonne me hine gesawon sweltendne, þæt hie þonne
wæron afrefrede, he him gehet his æriste, swa he þa mid soðe gefylde,
gelice swa he ær þa þrowunge dyde.
 37. His þegnas wæron þagyt flæsclices modes, &
næron mid gastes mægene getremede.
 38. Forþon hie ne mihton þa word ongeotan þæs heofonlican
gerynes, hwæþre he getrymede heora geleafan mid þon heofonlicon weorce,
þeah hie þæt word þæs heofonlican gerynes ne ongeaton.
 41. Nu we sceolan, men þa leofestan, ða wundor gecyrran on
soþfæstnesse geleafan ures Drihtnes Hælendes Cristes, þa he þurh
his þa mycclan miht worhte beforan manna eagum.
 44. We nestan ær hwæt se blinda wæs; nu we magon þonne
ongytan hwæt þæt geryne tacnaþ.
 46. Eal þis mennisce cyn wæs on blindnesse, seoððan þa
ærestan men asceofene wæron of gefean neorxnawanges, & þa
beorhtnessa forleton þæs heofonlican leohtes, & þisse worlde
þeostro & ermða þrowodan.
 49. Drihten þa þurh his tocyme þysne middangeard onlyhte,
& eallum geleaffulum monnum heora gong gestaþelade to lifes wege,
þæt hie magon þurh þa lustfulnesse heora modes, mid godum dædum,
geearnian leoht þæs ecan lifes.
 53. Halige gewreotu us tacniaþ þas world þurh þone monan;
forþon þonne he wexeþ, he bið gelic þæm godum men þe ahopað to
þæm ecean leohte, & þonne se mona wanað, þonne tacnað he ure
deaþlicnesse, & þisse worlde wanunge.
 57. Cwæþ se godspellere, mid þy þe se Hælend
genealæhte Gericho, þæt leoht cyrde to þon blindan.
 58. Þæt tacnaþ þæt seo godcundnes onfeng ure tydran
gecynde.
 59. Þa cyrde sona þæt heofonlice leoht to þyssum menniscan
cynne, þe se æresta man forlet; & forðon God to us niþer astahg
þe he wolde þæt we wæron upahafene to his godcundnesse.
 62. Rihtlic þæt wæs þæt se blinda be ðæm wege
sæte wædliende; forþon þe Drihten sylfa cwæþ, Ic eom weg
soðfæstnesse; & se þe ne can þa beorhtnesse þæs ecan leohtes,
se bið blind.
 65. & se leofað & gelyfeþ se þe siteþ be þæm
wege wædliende, & þonne bideþ þæs ecan leohtes, & no ne
geblinneþ.
 67. Se þonne ne ongyteþ þa þeostra his agenra synna, wite
he þæt he bið wana þæs ecan leohtes, buton he gebete þæt he
ær forgiten hæfde.
 70. Cleopian we nu in eglum mode & inneweardre heortan, swa se
blinda dyde, & cweþan, Miltsa me, Dauides sunu, miltsa me.
 72. Smeagean we nu & þencan hwæt þæt tacnode,
þæt seo menigo styrde þæm blindan þæt he cleopode.
 73. Ic þe secge hwæt seo menego tacnode, þa flæsclican
willan & þa ungereclican uncysta.
 75. Þa cumaþ oft þurh deofles sceonessa ær to manna
heortan, ær Drihtnes weorc þær wunian mote; & hie beoþ on heora
mode mid mislicum geþohtum onstyrede, þæt seo stemn þære heortan
bið swiþe gedrefed on þæm gebede.
 78. Gehyran we nu forhwon se blinda leoht onfeng, & hwæt he
dyde þa hine seo menego þreade þæt he swigode.
 80. He ma cegde & geornor bæd þæt Hælend him
miltsade: þæt is þonne þæt we sceolan beon gelærede mid þysse
bysene, þonne we beoþ mid mycclum hungre yfelra geþohta abisgode, þonne
sceolan we geornlice biddan þæt he us gescylde wiþ þa þusendlican
cræftas deofles costunga.
 85. Cwæþ se godspellere, Hælend ferde þær forþ,
& þa gehyrde þone blindan cleopian, & he sona gestod, &
þæt wundor worhte þæt he þone blindan onlyhte.
 87. Gehyraþ we nu þæt seo mennisce gecynd biþ a
færende, & seo godcunde meht a staþolfæstlice stondeþ.
 89. Hwæt hæfde seo godcunde þurh þa menniscan nemne buton
þæt heo mihte beon acenned, & wacian, & arisan, & faran of
stowe to oþerre.
 91. Þonne marþon þære godcundnesse nænig onwendnesse
on carcerne wæs of þære menniscan gecynde, na las of þære
godcundan miht.
 93. He bið a wesende, & æghwær ondweard, & ælce
stowe he gefylþ & ufan oferwryhþ, & a biþ ece.
 95. Þæt us tacnaþ þæt he þurh þa menniscan gecynd
ure stefne blindnesse gehyreþ; þonne we ure synna ondettaþ & us
forgifnessa biddaþ, þonne bið he sona us efenþrowiende, & hraþe
miltsiende & forgifende ura synna.
 99. Eac is to geþencenne hwæt Drihten spræc, þa se blinda
to him com; he cwæþ, Hwæt wilt þu þæt ic þe do?
 100. Næs þæt ne þæt he nyste hwæt se blinda wolde,
se ealle þing wat, & him leoht forgeaf; ah Drihten wile þæt hine mon
bidde, se þe ær geteod hæfde þæt he þon biddendan ece lif
forgeafe.
 103. Gelimplice he us lærde & monade, hu we us gebiddan
sceoldan, & hwæþere cwæþ, Eower Fæder se on heofenum is, wat
hwæs eow þearf biþ, ær ge hine o biddan.
 106. We magan ongytan þæt he forþon us gesette þæt we
hine biddan sceoldan, þy we sceolan þonne eac, in þa tid þæs
gebedes, ure heortan geclænsian from oþrum geþohtum.
 109. Gehyran we eac þæt se blinda ne bæd goldes, ne
seolfres, ne worldglenga, ah bæd his eagena leohtes.
 110. Hwæt we witon þonne se mon bið blind, þeah he mycel
age & feala fægeres, þæt him bið mycel daru, gif he hit geseon ne
mæg.
 113. Men þa leofestan, onhyrgean we þone blindan þe on
lichoman wæs gehæled ge eac on mode.
 114. Ne biddan we urne Drihten þyses lænan welan, ne þyssa
eorþlicra geofa þe hrædlice from monnum gewitaþ, ac biddon we Drihten
þæs leohtes þe næfre ne geendað.
 117. Þis leoht we habbaþ wið nytenu gemæne, ac þæt
leoht we sceolan secan þæt we motan habban mid englum gemæne, in
þæm gastlicum þrymmum.
 119. Þæt leoht on nanre tide ne ablinneþ; oþon leohte is
fulfremednesse weg þe we on feran sceolan, þæt is se rihta geleafa.
 121. Swiþe eaþe þæt mæg beon þæt sume men þencan
oþþe cweþan, hu mæg ic secan þæt gastlice leoht þe ic geseon ne
mæg, oþþe hwanan sceal me cuþ beon þæt ic mid lichomlicum eagum
geseon ne mæg?
 125. Þæm men mæg beon swiþe raþe geondweard.
 125. Hwæt gelyfeþ se lichoma butan þurh þa sawle?
 126. Geþencean þa men þæt hie heora sylfra sawla geseon ne
magon; ac eal swa hwæt swa se gesenelica lichama deþ oþþe wyrceþ,
eal þæt deþ seo ungesynelice sawl þurh þone lichoman.
 129. & þonne seo sawl hie gedæleþ wiþone lichoman,
hwylc bið he þonne buton swylce stan, oþþe treow?
 131. Ne he hine na ne onstyreþ, syþþan seo ungesynelice sawl
him of biþ; ac sona he molsnaþ, & wyrþ to þære ilcan eorþan
þe he ær of gesceapen wæs, oþþæt Drihten cymeþ on domes
dæg, & hateþ þa eorþan eft agifan þæt heo ær onfeng.
 135. & bið þonne undeaþlic, þeah he ær deaþlic
wære þa heo hine onfeng, & sceal þeah beon gelic his geearnungum.
 137. Gehyron we nu, men þa leofestan, hwæt awriten is on Godes
bocum, þæt se mon se þe god onginneþ & þonne ablinneþ, ne
biþ he Godes leof on þæm nehstan dæge.
 139. Ac se þe god onginneþ, & on þon þurhwunaþ oþ
ende his lifes, se bið hal geworden.
 141. Forþon we habbaþ nedþearfe þæt we ongyton þa
blindnesse ure ælþeodignesse; we send on þisse worlde
ælþeodignesse.
 143. We synd on þisse worlde ælþeodige, & swa wæron
siþþon se æresta ealdor þisses menniscan cynnes Godes bebodu
abræc.
 145. & forþon gylte we wæron on þysne wræcsiþ
sende, & nu eft sceolon oþerne eþel secan, swa wite, swa wuldor, swe we
nu geearnian willaþ.
 147. Gif we willaþ nu on Drihten gelyfan, & hine ongytan,
þonne beo we sittende be þæm wege, swa se blinda dyde.
 149. Þæt is þonne þæt we sceolon þone geleafan &
þæt ondgit mid godum dædum gefyllan, þonne beo we urum Hælende
fylgende, swa se blinda wæs, syþþan he geseon mihte.
 152. Her us cyþ þæt se godspellere sæde hu Drihten
cwæþ to Petre, þa he bæd þæt he moste faran & his fæder
bebyrgean.
 154. Hælend him þa ondswarede & cwæþ, þu scealt
fylgean me, & lætan þa deadan bergean heora deade.
 155. On þon he us bysene onstealde þæt nænig mon ne sceal
lufian ne ne geman his gesibbes, gif he hine ærost agælde Godes
þeowdomes.
 158. Geþencean we eac þæt Drihten his englas gesceop, &
heofen & eorþan, sæ, & ealle þa gesceafta þe on þæm
syndon; ealle stowa he gefylleþ & ymbfehþ & neoþan
underwreþeþ, & æghwar he biþ ondweard.
 161. Hwæþere he hine to þon geeaþmedde for ure
nedþearfe, þæt he astah on medmycelne innoð þære a clænan
fæmnan,& he onfeng þa ilcan gecynde for urum lufon þe he ær
gesceop.
 164. & þa nolde he him gesceosan welige yldran, ac þa þe
hæfdon lytle worldspeda, ne hie næfdan for him lamb to syllenne, ah
twegen culfran briddas him genihtsumedan, & twegen turturan gemæccan.
 168. & hwæþere hie wæron of Dauides cynnes strynde,
þæs rihtcynecynnes.
 169. Nu we gehyrað þæt Drihten forseah þone welan þisse
worlde; & he eft æfter fæce æt þæm unlædum Iudeum manig
bysmor geþrowade.
 171. Hie hine swungon, & bundon, & spætledon on his
onsyne, & mid bradre hand slogan, & mid heora fystum beotan; & þa
wundan beag of þornum & him setton on heafod for cynehelme; & hine
þa on rode ahengon.
 175. Eal þis he þrowode for ure lufan & hælo; þy he
wolde þæt we þæt heofenlice rice onfengon, þæt þa ærestan
men forworhtan þurh heora gifernesse & oferhygde.
 177. Hwæt wille we on domes dæg forþberan þæs we for
urum Drihtne arefnedon, nu he swa mycel for ure lufan geþrowode?
 179. Monige men syndon þe cweþaþ þæt hie on God gelyfon
& hine lufian, & þonne hweþere nellaþ ablinnan from heora
unrihtum gestreonum & gitsunga, ah hie beoð upahafene on oforhygde &
eac beoþ onbærnde mid þære biteran æfest, ge eac beoþ besmitene
mid þem unclænan firenluste.
 184. Men þa men þe þyssum uncystum fylgað, ne healdaþ hie
Drihtnes bebodu ne his bysenum ne fylgeað; ac hie swiþor fylgaþ deofles
larum, & his sceonessum; symle he hie getyhþ to eallum uncystum, & to
þære lufan þisse worlde mid his leascræftum.
 188. & se þe him þonne ne wile wiþstondan, he him æt
his ende grim geweorþeþ & hine gelædeþ on ece forwyrd.
 190. Gemunon we nu ure dæghwamlican synna þe we wið Godes
willan geworht habbaþ, þæt we mid eallum mægene hie beton mid
fæstenum, & mid gebedum, & mid ælmesweorcum, & mid soþre
hreowe.
 193. Þæt bið seo soþe hreow þæt mon þa geworhtan
synna andette & georne bete.
 195. Wepan we nu, & cweþan & geþencan hu Drihten
cwæð, Eadige beoþ þa þe nu wepað, forþon þe hi beoþ eft
afrefrede.
 197. Hwæt we nu gehyraþ þæt we magon mid þære
soðan hreowe ece blisse geearnian.
 198. & eft he cwæþ, Wa eow þe nu hlihaþ, forþon ge
eft wepað on ecnesse, þæt is þæt unasecgenlice wræc &
þæt ungeendode wite, þæt þon unlædon þær geteohhod biþ;
him wære betere þæt he næfre geboren nære.
 202. Forþon we sceolan beon gemyndige Godes beboda, & ure
sawle þearfe, þa hwile þe we motan, & biddan we georne urne Drihten
þæt he us generige from þon ecan cwealme, & us gelæde on þone
gefean his wuldres.
 205. Þær is ece blis & þæt ungeendode rice; nis
þær ænig sar gemeted, ne adl, ne ece, ne nænig unrotnes; nis
þær ege, ne geflit, ne yrre, ne nænig wiþerweardnes.
 208. Ac þær is gefea, & blis, & fægernes, & se
ham is gefylled mid heofonlicum gastum, mid englum & heahenglum, mid
heahfæderum & apostolum, & mid þy unarimedan weorode haligra
martyra þa ealle motan wunian mid Drihtne in eallra worlda world.
 212. Amen.

HomS 9
B3.2.9.
Ash Wednesday: Dictionary of Old English transcript, edited from Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS. 190.



 1. Gehirað broðru þa leofestan, we mynegiað eow ealle
gemænelice godes ælmihtiges worde þæt ge don eowra sinna andetnysse
and soðe behreowsunge and þæt ge healdon þisses lengtenfæstenes tyd
ungewemmedlice and eac þæt ge gehyrsume beon godes sacerdum and eowre
hæle lareowum.
 6. Forðan se sacerd is gecyged godes engel, þæt is godes
boda.
 7. And we þe sind godes boda þeah we unwurðe beon, to us is
fram drihtene silfum þus gecweden, <foreign>Qui uos audit me audit et qui uos
spiritus me spiritus</foreign>, þæt is on englisc, Se þe eow gehirð me he
gehirð and se þe eow forsihð me he forsyhð.
 11. Eornostlice ge broðru geswicað to donne yfel and leorniað
to donne wel.
 13. Bugað fram yfele and doð god.
 13. Beoð syfre and wacyað forðon eowre wyþerwinna se deofol
swa swa grimetiende beo wærð ymbutan secende hwane he forswelige,
wyðstandað him strange on geleafan.
 16. Nimað eornostlice rihtwisnisse byrnan and soþre hælo
helm and þæs halgangastes sweord, þæt is godes word.
 18. Gecyrrað broðru þa leofestan to drihtene gode of ealre
eowre heortan and ne ortruwyge ge næfre be godes mildheortnisse.
 21. Soðlice god cwæð þurh his witegan, Nelle ic ðæs
sinfullan deað ac swiðor þæt he gecyrre and libbe, and on swa
hwilcere tide swa se sinfulla gecyrred wirð and his sinna begeomerað he
bið gehealden.
 24. Be ðan eac he cwæð on þam godspelle.
 25. Bliss biþ on heofenum, be anum sinfullan men behreowsunge
dondum.
 26. Witað eac gebroðru þæt ðam men naht ne fremað to
behreowsienne gif he æfter þære behreowsunge eft cirð to his ærran
leahtrum.
 29. Eornostlice doþ dædbote mid eadmodnisse and mid heortan
clænnysse and biddað þone arfæstan drihten þæt he beseo to eow
and unnendlice underfo eowre eadmodnisse.
 32. Warniað eac þæt ge amang eowre dædbote and eowrum
fæstene ne befeallon on ænige heafodsinne, forðon se man ðe fæst
and singað is ðam deofle gelic þe æfre fæst and æfre singað.
 35. And eac þæt ge sculon understandan amang eowre dædbote
þæt ge don swilc fæsten swilc gode licwyrðe beo and warniað eow
æfre wið druncennisse, forðan þe druncennis ne sparað nanne leahter
ac ealle sinna heo gestrinð and heo is swiðe micel heafodsin.
 40. Mine gebroðru, ge ne healdað oðerhwile rihtlice þis
halige fæsten ðurh þæt ge sceoldon oferswiðan þone deofol ac ge
hit swiðe gelome brecað and ge ne undergitað hwæt þa halgan canones
bebeodað, þæt se ðe tobricð ænne dæg on þam
lengtenfæstene sceal feowertig daga forðam anum dage agildan þæs
fæstenes ealdre gode.
 46. Forbugað æfre þa oferfille soðlice for ðære
oferfille and for ðære gifernisse wæs Adam ascofen of neorxnawange and
gif we willað ure yrfe and urne eðel þæt is neorxnawang underfon,
þonne is us þearf þæt we ðyder faron þurh oðerne weg þæt is
ðurh fæsten and forhæfednisse.
 52. Witodlice Adam forgægde his drihtenes æ þa ða he
æt of ðam forbodenan treowe and forðon drihten hine sceaf ut of
neorxnawange on wræcsið þisses lifes þær he ðolode mænigfealde
geswinc and siþþan æfter ðisses lifes geswincum on helle susle lange
heofode oðþæt Crist þe ðisne middaneard alisde hine þanon generede
and hine eft ongean lædde to neorxnawanges blisse.
 59. Æfter ðære bisne we sind gelærede þæt we ut
drifað þæge þe forgægdon godes æ and þurh heafodgilt beoþ
scildige wiðutan þis þerxwolde godes huses.
 62. And heom biþ forwirnd cyrclic ingang oþ þæt hig
geendodre openlicre dædbote eft beon onfangene mid bisceoplicre lefe on bosm
þære modorcircan swa swa Adam wæs onfangen æfter langre behreowsunge
and langre tyde heofunge into neorxnawange to halgra geferræddene.
 67. To ðære geferræddene us eac gebringe Crist se ðe
leofað and rixað mid his efenecan fæder and þam halgangaste on ealra
worulda woruld, amen.

HomS 10 (BlHom 3)
B3.2.10.
First Sunday in Lent: Morris 1874-80, 27-39.



 1. <foreign>DOMINICA PRIMA IN QUADRAGESIMA</foreign>.
 1. Men þa leofestan, her sagaþ Matheus se godspellere
þætte se Hælend wære læded on westen, & þæt he wære
costod from deofle; & mid þy þe he fæste feowertig daga &
feowertig nihta, þa hingrede hine.
 4. Se costigend þa eode to him, & him to cwæþ, Gif þu
sie Godes sunu, cweþ þæt þa stanas to hlafum geweorþan.
 6. Se Hælend him þa ondswarode, & him to cwæþ, Ne
bið on hlafe anum mannes lif, ac of eallum þæm worde þe gaþ of Godes
muþe.
 8. Þa genam hine se awyrgda gast & he hine lædde on þa
halgan ceastre, & he hine asette ofer þæs temples scylf, & him to
cwæþ, Gif þu sy Godes sunu, send þe nyþer of þisse heanesse;
forþon þe awriten is þæt þine englas þe on hondum habban, þe
læs þin fot oþsporne.
 12. Hælend him þa eft ondswarode & cwæþ, Ne costa
þu þinne Drihten God.
 13. Þæt deofol hine þa genam þriddan siþe, and he hine
lædde upon swiþe hea dune, & him æteowde eal eorþan rice &
idel wuldor þisses middangeardes, & him tocwæþ, þas ealle ic þe
wylle, gif þu feallest to me & me weorþast.
 17. Hælend him ondswerede & cwæþ, Ga þu onbæcling,
wiþerwearda; forþon þe awriten is, Weorþa þinne Drihten God & him
anum þu þeowa.
 19. Hine þa forlet se costigend, and his englas him toeodan &
him þegnedan.
 21. Men þa leofestan, cuþ is þætte hraþe Drihten,
þæs þe he of þam fulwihtes bæþe eode, þa fæstte he sona,
& þa gesetton halige fæderas & godes folces lareowas þa tid
þæs fæstenes foran to Cristes þrowunga.
 24. & hie sweotollice cyþdon þæt se egeslica domes
dæg cymeþ on þa tid þe Godes sunu on rode galgan þrowode.
 26. Ac þæt us is to geþencenne, þæt ure Drihten
æfter þæm fulwihte fæstte, & eac wæs costad.
 27. Us is þonne nedþearf þæt we fæston; forþon þe
we beoð oft costode from deofle æfter urum fulwihte.
 29. Drihten us manode mid his fæstenne, & mid eallum his
dædum, þæt we sceolan him þeowian, & deofol oferswiþan, &
us ece lif begytan.
 31. Us is þonne mid mycelre gemynde to geþencenne þæt se
ælmihtiga, se þe wæs on Godes hiwe, God Fæder efnece, onfeng
þæt hiw ure tyddran gecynde.
 34. Geþencean we eac, gif oþer nyten wære to haligienne,
& geteod to þon ecan life, þonne onfenge he heora hiwe, ac he wolde
urum hiwe onfon, swa he us ælces godes bysene onstealde.
 37. Forþon eal swa hwæt swa we to gode doþ on
mildheortnesse, oþþe on eadmodnesse, oþþe on elne gastlices mægenes,
oþþe on gefylnesse Godes beboda, oþþe on þæm welme þære
soþan lufan Godes & manna, ealle þas god cumaþ of þæm
æsprenge Godes mildheortnesse, & beoð atogen of þæm mægene
þære Halgan þrynesse.
 42. Hwæt we gehyrdon þæt se godspellere cwæþ þæt
se Hælend wære gelæded on westen, & þæt he wære costod
from deofle.
 44. Us is to gelyfenne þæt he þyder come, næs no geneded,
ne underþeoded, ac mid his wyllan; & forþon he þyder com þæt he
wolde gecompian wiþ þone awerigdan gast.
 47. Rihtlic þæt wæs þæt he eode on westen þær
ær Adam forwearþ.
 48. For þrim þingum Hælend eode on westen; forþon þe he
wolde deofol gelaþian to campe wiþ hine, & Adam gefreolsian of þam
langan wræce, & mannum gecyþan þæt se awyrgda gast æfestgaþ
on þa þe he gesyhþ to Gode higian.
 52. Mid þrim gemettum seo costung, þæt ane cwæþ,
Doð/ swa swa ic inc bebeode, þonne beo gyt swa swa God.
 54. Nu he þonne costode Godes Sunu þurh idel wuldor, ða he
cwæþ, Gif þu sy Godes Sunu, send þe nyþer.
 56. Halige men þonne ongeaton þæt he wæs soþ Godes
Sunu; forþon þe God Fæder stemn wæs gehyred æt his fulwihte, þus
cweþende: þis is min se leofa Sunu, on þæm me wel gelicode.
 59. Þonne is cuþ þæt se awergda gast ongan Godes bec
trahtian, & þa sona leah; forþon þis næs gecweden be Criste
þæt his fot æt stane oþspurne, ah halgum monnum; forþon þe englas
beoþ aa halgum mannum on fultume swa swa scyld.
 63. Se Hælend him tocwæþ, Ne costa þu þinne Drihten
God.
 63. Næs his gemet þæt he hine costode, eode swa þeah on
þa frecenesse, & wolde gecunnian hweþer he hine gefreolsian wolde.
 65. He cwæþ, þas ealle ic þe sylle, gif þu feallest
to me, and me weorþast.
 67. Eala soþlice se afealleþ se þe deofol weorþeþ.
 67. Hit is to gelyfenne þæt Drihten mihte on anre tide
dæges geseon ealles þysses middangeardes wynsumnessa, ge on golde ge on
deorwyrþum hræglum.
 70. Ac se forhwyrfda gast spræc forhwyrfedlice word, þa he
wolde þæm hean cininge & þæm heofonlican eorþlicu ricu syllan,
þæm þe þa heofonlican ricu gearwaþ eallum geleaffullum.
 73. Ah þæt manfulle wuht wolde þæt he hine weorþode se
þe stigeþ ofer þa þrymsetl heofona rices, and his fotsceamul is þis
eorþlice rice, þone nænig heonon ne sceawaþ, ac hine ealle halige
þær herigaþ & weorþiaþ on his þære hean mihte.
 77. Swa we sceolan hine mid wordum weorþian, & him on
dædum þeowian.
 78. He cwæþ, Ga þu onbæcling, & gemyne þe sylfne hu
mycel yfel þe gelamp for þinre gitsunga & oforhydo, & for þinum
idlan gilpe; & forþon ic þe ne fylge, forþon on þyssum þrim þu
eart oforswiþed.
 81. Þas cyþnesse Drihten nam of þisse wisan.
 82. Wel geheowede Dauid þæt, þa he wolde wiþ Goliaþ
gefeohtan, þa nam he fif stanas on his herdebelig, & þeahhweþere mid
anum he þone gigant ofwearp; swa Crist oferswiþde þæt deofol mid
þisse cyþnesse.
 85. Us is þonne to geþencenne þæt we þas dæda þus
gedone from Drihtne mid ealre þoncunga & mærsunga hine herian &
lufian, þæt se þe wæs ær eallum worldum geteod & geendebyrd,
wolde mid his Suna lichoman þysne middangeard alysan fram deofles anwalde.
 90. Se ilca Sunu wæs ær eallum tidum acenned fram God
Fæder, se ælmihtiga from þon ælmihtigan, & se Eca from þan
Ecan.
 92. Forþon his miht bið a ece, his rice ne bið gewemmed.
 93. Swa se witga be þam cwæþ, Man bið acenned of Iudan,
and he wealdeþ eallum þeodum: & forþon ealra þara gifa þe he
middangearde forgeaf þurh his tocyme, nis nænig mare mægen, ne þisse
menniscan tydernesse nyttre, þonne he þone awyrgdan gast oferswiþe, &
þone wælhreowan feond þisse menniscan gecynd.
 98. Forðon hine mæg nu ælc mon oforswiþan, & he
nænige mehte wið us nafaþ, buton hwylc man þurh ða unanrædnesse
his modes him wiþstandan nelle.
 101. Þurh Cristes sige ealle halige wæron gefreolsode, þa
þe him þeowiaþ on rihtwisnesse & on halignesse; swa þonne beoþ
þa synfullan genyþerade mid heora ordfuman, swa he genyþerad wearþ.
 104. Hwæt we gehyrdon þæt se godspellere cwæþ þæt
Hælend wære læded from deofle on þa halgan ceastre, & eac on
þone hean munt.
 106. Þonne þincþ þis geleaffullum mannum swiþe
andrysnlicu wise to gehyrenne; ac gif we asmeagaþ þa eadmodlican dæda
þa þe he worhte, þonne ne þincþ us þæt nan wundor.
 109. Cuþ is þæt se awyrgda gast is heafod ealra unrihtwisra
dæda, swylce unrihtwise syndon deofles leomo.
 110. Forþon nis þæt nan wundor þeah se hea Cyning & se
eca Drihten hine sylfne let lædon on þa hean dune, se hine sylfne forlet
from deofles leomum, & from yflum mannum beon on rode ahangenne.
 114. Nis þæt to wundrigenne þeah þe he wære costod, se
to þon com þæt he acweald beon wolde; forþon he mid his costunge ure
costunge oferswiþde, & mid his deaþe urne deaþ.
 116. Drihten wæs gelichomod on hrife þære a clænan
fæmnan, & buton synnum he cwom on middangeard, & eal his lif he
lifde buton synnum, þeah þe he hine lete costian.
 119. Ac us is to smeagenne þæt Drihten on þære costunge
nolde his þa myclan miht gecyþan, se þe mihte þone costigend instepes
on helle grund besencean gif he wolde.
 122. Ac mid þon worde þæs godcundan gewrites he hine
oforswiþde.
 123. Mid his geþylde he us bysene onstealde, þæt swa oft swa
we oht uneaþes þrowian æt yfflum monnum, þonne sceolan we swyþor
beon awehte & onbryrde to godcundre lare, & beon geornran þæt we
Godes bebodu healdan, þonne we urne teonan gewrecan.
 127. Us is eac to geþencenne hu mycel Godes geþyld is, & hu
mycel ure ungeþyld is; & gif us hwa abylgþ, þonne beo we sona yrre,
& willaþ þæt gewrecan gif we magon, þeah we beotiaþ to.
 129. Eala hwæt Drihten deofles costunga geþyldelice abær.
 130. Nolde he him na andswerian buton mid monþwærnesse, se
þe mihte hine sona on helle gewitnian; ac he wolde þæt his lof þe
healicor weoxe, þe he hine mid geþylde oferswiðde, swiþor þonne
he hine sona adwæscte.
 134. Ac on þæm wæs gecyþed þæt he wæs on anum
hade twegra gecynda; he wæs soþ man, þy hine dorste deofol costian,
swylce he wæs soþ God, þe him englas þegnedon.
 137. We magon ongytan on þæm ure tydran gecynd, gif þæt
deofol hine ne gesawe on ure gecynde, ne costode he hine.
 138. Weorþian we forþon Drihtnes godcundnesse, gif he nære
soþ God ofer ealle gesceafta, na him englas ne þegnodon.
 140. On þisse bysene is gecyþed þæt eallum geleaffullum
mannum englas þegniaþ, þonne hi habbaþ deofol oferswiþed.
 142. Hwæt we gehyrdon þæt þæt fasten þyses
feowertiges daga ongunnen wæs instepes þæs þe he of þæm fulwihte
astag, & þa eode sona on þæt westen; & þa gesetton cyricena
aldoras þæt fæsten foran to his þrowunga, & eac foran to þon
tocyme þæs egeslican domes dæges.
 146. Riht þæt is þæt ealle geleaffulle men þis
feowertig daga on forhæfdnesse lifgean, & eac us is to geþencenne
þæt we sceolan þa ten bebodu healdan, & þa lara þara feower
godspellera; forðon þe ure lichoma wæs gesceapen of feower gesceaftum,
of eorþan, & of fyre, & of wætere, & of lyfte.
 151. Swa we eac agyltaþ þurh feower þing, þurh geþoht,
& þurh word, & þurh weroc, & þurh willan; swylce eac feower
tida syndan on þæm geare, on þæm we oft agyltað; þonne sculon we
eft on þære forhæfdnesse & on þyssum feowertigum nihta þæt
geclænsian.
 155. Hwæt we gehyrdon nu þæt we sceolan under þæm
feowerteoþan gerime, swa swa geara beboden wæs Godes folce, syllan þone
teoþan dæl ure worldspeda þe we habban, & we sceolan ure daga þone
teoþan dæl on forhæfdnesse lifgean.
 159. Geare we witon þæt on þæm geare bið þreo hund
daga & fif & syxtig daga; gif we þonne on þæm syx wucan
forlætaþ þa syx Sunnandagas þæs fæstennes, þonne ne bið
þara fæstendaga na ma þonne syx & þritig.
 162. & gif we þa dagas fulfremedlice for Gode lifgeaþ,
þonne hæbbe we ure daga þone teoþan dæl for Gode gedon.
 164. & geþencean we þæt we ealne þysne gear lifdon mid
ures lichoman willan.
 165. Nu is þearf mycel þæt we þone teoþan dæl for
Gode gedon, & on forhæfdnesse lifian, & ure synna clænsian, &
us ece lif geearnian.
 168. Þas dagas þyses feowertiges nihta tacnaþ þas
ondweardan weorld, & þa Easterlican dagas tacniaþ þa ecean
eadignesse.
 170. & swa we nu on maran forhæfdnesse lifiaþ þas dagas,
& on andrysnum þingum beoþ on þysse worlde, swa magon we þe maran
blisse habban þa Easterdagas, & swa we sceolan þa hwile þe we
lifgaþ her on worlde.
 173. Don we urum Drihtne soþe hreowe & bote, þæt we
þurh þæt gegearnian ura synna forlætnesse, & ece lif æfter
þisse worlde on þære ecan eadignesse.
 176. Geþencean we geornlice þæt we us healdan on þas tid,
& on ælce, wiþ þa heafodlican leahtras; forþon æghwylc þara
manna þe his lif geendaþ on þyssum, þonne bið he geteod to þæm
ecan witum.
 179. Þonne sceolon we nu for þon dæghwamlicum synnum on
þas tid georne clænsian, mid fæstenne, & mid halgum wæccum,
& mid ælmessum.
 181. Swa we sceolon eac ure heortan gefyllan mid þære
swetnesse godcundra beboda, þæt on us ne sy gemeted nænigu stow
æmetig gastlicra mægena, þæt þær mæge yfelu uncyst on
eardian.
 184. Ne magon we buton þæm medmyclum synnum beon, ah we
sceolan on þas tid þas feawan dagas on forhæfdnesse lifgean, urne
lichoman & ure heortan clænsian from yflum geþohtum þæs þe we
magon.
 187. Forðon seo blis & seo oferfyll þæs lichoman
getyhþ þone mon to synnum, & seo forhæfdnes hine geclænsaþ
& gelædeþ to forgifnesse.
 189. Ne gelyfe þæs nænig mon þæt him ne genihtsumige
þæt fæsten to ecere hælo, buton he mid oþrum godum hit geece;
& se þe wille Drihtne bringan gecweme lac fæsten, þonne sceal he
þæt mid ælmessan & mid mildheortum weorcum fullian.
 193. Be þæm Esaias se witga cwæþ, Brec þinne hlaf
þearfendum mannum, & sona swa þu geseo nacodne wædlan, þonne
gegyre þu hine, & ne forseoh þu næfre þine gecynd.
 196. Hwæt we gehyrdon þæt Gode bið þæt fæsten
swyþe gecweme, gif se mon ahefþ his handa to ælmesdædum.
 198. Se mildheorta Drihten, ure Scyppend, onfehþ swiþe
lustfullice eallum þæm godum þe ænig man gedeþ his þæm
nehstan, of arfæstre heortan & mildre.
 201. & swa hwylc man swa mid godum willan fæstan mæge,
& oþres dæges metes his lichoman ofteon, þæt he þonne bliþe
þæs earman lichoman gefylle, & his þone nehstan afrefrige, on þon
þe he hine sylfne geswence, þonne biþ þæt clæne fæsten &
halig.
 205. Be þæm Iohel se witga cwæþ, Halgiaþ eower
fæsten, & medeme lac bringaþ Drihtne, þæt is, ures lichoman
forhæfdnes & ælmesdæda, seo þone earman geblissaþ.
 208. Ne magon þis þeah ealle men don; ac hit sceolan don þa
þe God þas world to forlæten hæfþ; & forþon þe he him
worldspeda syleþ, þæt hi þæs earman helpan sceolan.
 211. Þonne is nu to geþencenne on þas halgan tid, nu we urne
lichoman clænsiaþ mid fæstenum & mid gebedum, þæt we eac ure
mod geclænsian from yfelum wordum.
 213. & symle bliþe mode Godes beboda utan we behealdan,
þonne gelædeþ he us on þæt ece lif, þær we seoþþan ealle
halige sceawian motan, & þa fægeran onsyne ures Scyppendes, þær
he leofaþ & rixaþ abuton ende on ecnesse.
 217. Amen.

HomS 11.1 (Belf 5)
B3.2.11.4.
Second Sunday in Lent (Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Bodley 343): Belfour 1909, 40-48.



 1. <foreign>DOMINICA IN QUADRAGESSIMA</foreign>.
 2. Men þa leofeste, ic cyðe eow þæt ðreo þing beoð
ærest on forewearde æghwilcum men neodbehefe to habbene.
 3. An is ileafæ; oþer is hiht; þridde is soþ lufe.
 4. On þam leafe is þæt he ilefe on God Fæder
ælmihtigne, & on his Sune, & on þene Halgan Gaste, & on ða
untodæledlice þrynnesse, & on þa þurhwunigendæn Annesse.
 7. Þonne is þe hihte þæt he wislice hiht ða ecen mede;

ongean his nyxtæn þæt is ælc cristene mon.

& ure nextæ, þæt he symle on us þurhwunie.
 13. For þam, swa swa Iohannes cwæð, God is þeo soþe

 21. Witodlice æhtæ beoð heafodlæhtræs, buton þare
sume ne mæg nan mon imetodlice beon.
 22. Æræst is þæt forme, gyfernes, þæt is þare

seofoðe yrre; eahtoðe oferhyd, þeo is cwen alre yfelæ, þurh þa
oferhyd of heofenum areas þeo wundorlice englæ gesceaft.
 27. Broðor mine, þone ge to rihte andetnysse to eowre scrifte

he ær fremode.
 30. & æfter þare gemete þare dedæ he sceal þa
reowsunge deman.
 31. He sceal hine eac swa læren, þæt he of þam þwyrlice
ðance andetnysse do, & he sceal hine maniæn þæt he of þam
eahtæ heafodlæhtrum andetnysse do.
 33. & þe sacerd him sceal synderlice ælcne heafodlæhtor
nemniæn & swa of þam his andetnysse onfon, to þam þæt he habbe
rihtre intinge to forgyfene.
 36. For þam þe þeo andetnes þe hælæð, & þeo

 37. Æghwilc hiht forgifenesse stont on þam andetnysse.
 38. Ðeo andetnes is mildheortnysse weorc; heo is hæl ðæs
untrumen, & heo is læcedom ure mægnæ mid reowsunge, forþam þe
we on oðre wisan ne magen beon ihælede buton we ure synnæ andettæn
ða þe we þurhtugon.
 42. Be þare synne andetnesse, Salomon cwæð, þe þe his
scylde bihyd, ne bið he na iriht; þe þe heom soþlice andet, & heom
forlet he hæfð mildheordnesse bigeten.
 44. Broðor mine, æfter þare andetnesse þeo reowsung is to
underfonne.
 45. Be þare þe Hælend on his godspelle cwæð, Doþ

 47. Swa Iohannes ðe fulluhtere cwæð, Weorcæð medemæ
wæstmæs reowsungæ.
 48. Þæt is þe medeme wæstm reowsunge þæt mon þa
forðwitenæ synnæn biwepæ & þa ylcæ eft ne fremmæ, swa
swa þæt godcunde writ cwæð, Ne ec þu na synnæ ofer synnæ.
 51. Ac Drihten þurh Ysaiam þone witegæ cwæð, Beoð
aðwægene, & þurhwuniæð clæne.
 52. Soþlice þe bið aþwogen & þurhwunæð clæne,
þe ðe ðare forðwitenæ synnæ bewæpð, & he eft þa
bewopenæ ne ðurhtihð.
 54. Ac þe bið iþwegen, ant ne biþ clæne, þe ðe
biwepð þa ðurhtogene synne, & þonne git ne forlæteþ, ac
æfter ðam tearum þa ylcæ þe he biweop he eft þurhtihð.
 57. Soþlice is to witænne þæt þæt biþ ðeo soþe

 58. Þeo soðe reowsung ne biþ on þare geare ryne iscryfen,
ac on þæs modes biternysse, forþan ðe God ne sæcð na swa swyðe
þare tide lenge, ac he þencð hu mucel þeo lufe beo þare syferlicnesse
on þare heortæn þæs reowisgendæn.
 61. Witodlice, þeah hwa synful beo & arleæs, gif he to
reowsunge cyrræn wyle, ne ortrowige he him ðæt he ne mage him

 64. Soþlice ða ðe on ðissere worulde reowsunge doþ,
þam symle Godes mildheortnesse hælpæð.
 65. Þam reowsigendum witodlice is þeo wæcce to biganne,
forþam ðan ðe heo to heofenum up ahæfð þæs reowsiendæn

 67. Forþan us dafenæþ ðæt we waciæn symle, swa swa

wæs risende to andetnesse ofer þa domæs þinre rihtwisnesse.
 70. Be þare wæccen swylce þe Hælend eac þare monnæ
mod awæhte þe from deofles anwealde to alysen beoð, þus cwæðende,
<foreign>Beatus ille seruus quem cum uenerit dominus</foreign>.
 73. Eadige beoð þa þeowæs þone þe laford forð
cymeð, gif he heom wacende imet.
 74. To soþan ic eow sæcge ofer alle his god he heom set.

repsunge/, oððe to middre nihte, oððe on hancrede, oððe on

 79. & næs na þæt an þæt hæ þam apostolum

forþan þe ðeo estfulnes þare weccæn is ihiwcyðlicod alle monnum;

 89. Æfter ðissum weccæn þa festene beoð hihtlice to
lufigenne/.
 89. Be þare lofe, Ysidorus cwæð þæt festen is swiðe
god; hit is heofonlic weorc, & heofene rices duræ, & hiwung þare

 92. Þæt festen þe þe hit rihtlice bigæð, he biþ to

 93. Þurh ðet festen beoð þa læhtræs astræhte &

 100. Swiðe raðe heo beoð oferswiðde þurh þa
forhæfdnessE.
 101. Soþlice is to witenne þæt ðæt mycel fremede
þæt ðet folcc on Niniue þare byrig fæste ðry dagæs; þurh
ðet heo earnodon þæt heo Godes mildheortnysse bigeten & heoræ

 103. Israele folc fæsten ær þaræ easterlicæn tide

 106. Moyses feste on ðam westene, þurh ðet he earnode
iheræn þa heofenlice gerynu.
 107. Dauid þe kyning æfter ðare ðurhtogenæn synnæ

 110. Crist sylf fæste feowertig dagæ & feowertig

 112. Petrus feste, þurh ðet he earnode þone engel iseon þe

 113. Johannes þe godspellere feste, þurh ðæt he earnode

 115. Paulus feste, þurh ðæt he earnode beon gehæled on
ðare blindnesse, & fulluhtes underfon.
 116. Hieronimus cwæð swa longe swa Adam hine forhæfde
þæt he ðæs applæs ne onburigde he wunode on neorcxnæwonges
ifean; sone swa he ðæs ofetes onbyrigde, swa wæs he ut idrifen.
 119. To witenne is witodlice þæt þæt festen is mid gode
weorcum Gode anfencge.
 120. For þam þæt is ðet fulfremede festen, ðeo mid
ælmessen & bedum þone heofen þurhfærð, & to þæs
hyhstæn Godes setle becymð.

þam bedum ge beoð iclensode, & mid þam redinge ge beoð itimbrode.
 125. Soþlice is to witenne þæt syngallice gebedu mycel
fremeð mid Gode, swa swa Paulus þe apostol cwæð, þæs rihtwisen
bed mycel fremeð ætforen Gode.
 127. Witodlice Moyses hine bed, & ahwyrfde Godes yrre fram

 129. Eac swilce Helias hine bed þæt hit ne reignde ofer

monæþ.
 131. & eft he bæd þæt þeo heofen sealde ræignæs
& ðeo eorðæ hire wæstmæs.
 132. Jonas hine bed on þæs hwæles innoðe, & he
ðonen alysed wæs.
 133. Daniel hine bed on ðeræ leonæ sceaþe & he
earnode beon ihæled.
 134. Ezechiæs þe kyng hine bed on his untrumnesse, & him
ehte God fiftene gear to life.
 135. Witodlice swa hwa swa wule symle mid Gode beon, he sceal hine
ilomlice biddan & redan.
 137. Forþam þonne we us biddæþ, þonne spece we wið
Gode; ant þonne we redæþ, þonne specð God to us.
 138. Æt þam ytemestan, broðor mine, her æfter
fyligæð þeo mongung be þare ælmessæn lofe.
 140. Augustinus cwæð, þeo ælmesse is swiðe halig
weorc.
 141. Heo geycð þa andweardan god; & heo sylð synne

þæs monnes mod; & heo geondbrædaþ þa gemæru; & heo alle
þing clænsæð.
 144. & heo alyseð þone mon from deaþe & from wite;
& heo geðeodaþ to þam englum; & deoflæ from ascyfð; &
heo is unofer innendlic weal ymb þa sawlæ.
 146. Swa swa Ieronimus cwæð, þeo ælmesse
geondfæræð þone heofen, & heo cnyseð heofene rices duræ,
& heo awecð þone engel, ongean cumende, & heo cigæð God to
fultume.
 150. Witodlice ðreo cyn beoð ælmessenæ; an is lichamlic,
þæt is ðæt mon þam wædligendan sylle to gode þæt he mage;
oþer is gastlic, þæt is þæt mon forgife þam ðe wið hine
agyltæð; þridde is þæt mon þam gyltendan styre, & þa
wædligendan on rihte brincge.
 153. Þas ðing us dafenæþ gefyllan mid þæs fultume,
þe mid Fæder & mid Sune & mid þam Halge Gaste leofæþ &
rixæð þurh alræ woruldæ woruld, a on ecnesse, a buton ende, Amen.

HomS 11.2 (ScraggVerc 3)
B3.2.11.5.
Second Sunday in Lent: Scragg 1992, 73-83.



 1. Broðor þa leofestan, ic cyðe þæt þreo þing synt
ærest on foreweardum æghwylcum men nydbehefe to habbanne.
 2. <foreign>I</foreign> is geleafa, oðer is hiht, þridde soð lufu.
 3. On ðam geleafan is þæt he gelyfe on God, fæder
ælmihtigne, & on sunu & on þone halgan gast & on þa
todældan þrynesse & on þa þurhwuniendan annysse.
 5. Þonne is se hiht þæt he wislice gehihte þa ecan meda.
 6. Þonne is seo soðe lufu þæt he sie gefylled mid
þære godcundan lufan & his nehstan.
 7. For þam þe we sint ealle on þam fulluhte Godes bearn
gehalgode, to þam þæt we sien gastlice gebroðor an fulfremedre soðe
lufan æfter Gode.
 9. Ðy we sceolon symle wunian on þære godcundan lufan &
ures nehstan, þæt he symle on us þurhwunige, for þam, swa swa Iohannes
cwæð: God is seo soþe lufu, & se þe wunaþ on ðære soðan
lufan, he wunaþ on Gode & God wunað on him.
 14. Broðor mine, <foreign>VI</foreign> þing synt nydebehefe to habbanne
þære halgan cristenlican æwfæstnesse & ealra mæst on þyssum
halgum lengtenfæstene.
 16. <foreign>I</foreign> is andetnes, oðer is hreowsung, þridde is wæcce,
feorþe is fæsten, <foreign>V</foreign> sint gebedu, <foreign>VI</foreign> is ælmesse.
 17. Sio andetnes is to donne be eallum þam sinnum þe man
awðer þurhtyhð, oððe an geþohte oððe on spræce oððe on
worce.
 19. Witodlice eahta synt heafodleahtras, butan þara sumon ne
mæg ænig man uneaðlice gemet bion.
 20. Ærest is þæt forme gifernes þæt is þære wambe
frecnes, oðer is dyrne geligre, þridde is sleacmodnes & unrotnes,
feorðe gitsung, <foreign>V</foreign> idel wuldor, <foreign>VI</foreign> æfest, <foreign>VII</foreign> irre, <foreign>VIII</foreign> oferhygd,
sio is cwen eallra yfla.
 23. Þurh þa oferhygde of heofonum gehreas þæt wundorlice
engla gesceaft.
 25. Broðor mine, þonne ge rihtre andetnesse to eowrum scriftum
becumen, þonne sceal he eow geornlice ahsian mid hwylcum gemete oððe mid
hwylcum intingum syo syn þurhtogen wære þe he geandette þæt he
ær gefremede, & æfter þam gemete þære dæde, he sceal him
þa hreowsunge gedeman.
 29. He sceall hine eac swa læran þæt he of þam
þweorlicum geþohtum andetnesse do, & he sceal hine manian þæt he
of þam eahta eafodleahtrum andetnesse do, & se sacerd him sceal
synderlice ælcne leahtor genæmnan & swa of þam his andetnesse
anfon.
 33. For þam þe God wilnaþ ure andetnesse to þam þæt he
hæbbe rihtne intingan us to forgifanne, for þam þe sio andetnes þe
gehæleð, & sio andetnes þe gerihtwisað, & sio andetnes sylð
forgifnesse þam synnum.
 36. Æghwylc hyht forgifnesse on þære andetnesse forstent.
 36. Sio andetnes is mildheortnesse worc.
 37. Hio is hæl þæs untruman, & hio is læcedom ura
mægena mid hreowsunge, for þan we on oðre wisan ne magon bion
gehælede nimðe we ura synna andetten, þa þe we ðurhtugon.
 40. Be þæra synna andettnesse Salomon cwæð: se ðe his
scylda gehydeð, ne bið he na geriht.
 41. Se ðe soðlice hie geandet & hie þonne forlæt, se
bið mildheortnesse begytend.
 43. Broðor mine, æfter þære andetnesse to underfonne is
sio hreowsung.
 44. Be þære se hælend cwæð on þam godspelle: Doð
hreowsunge, for þam heofona rice nealæceð.
 45. & Iohannes se fulluhtre cwæð: Wyrceaþ medeme
wæstmas hreowsunge.
 46. Þæt is se medema wæstm hreowsunge þæt man þa
forþgewitenan synna bewepe & þa ilcan eft ne fremme, swa swa þæt
godcunde gewrit cwið: Ne geic þu þa synne ofer þa synne.
 49. Ac dryhten þurh Esaiam þone witigan cwæð: Beoð
aþwegene & þurhwuniaþ clæne.
 50. Soðlice se bið aþwegen & wunaþ clæne se ðe
þa/ forþgewitenan synna bewepeð, & he eft þa bewopenan ne
þurhtyhð.
 52. Ac se bið þwegen & ne bið clæne se ðe wepþ
þa ðurhtogenan synna & hie þeah þonne gyt ne forlæteð, ac
æfter þam tearum þa ilcan þe he ær beweop, he eft þurhtyhð.
 55. To witanne is soðlice þæt ðæt bið sio soðe
hreowsung sio þurh wisnesse bið gedon.
 56. Sio soðe hreowsung ne bið na on þara geara rime
gescrifen, ac on þæs modes biternesse.
 57. For þam God ne secð na swa swiðe þæra tida lenge, ac
he þencð hu mycel sio lufu sie þære syferlicnesse on þære heortan
þæs hreowsiendan.
 59. Witodlice, þeah þe hwa sie synfull & arleas, gif he to
hreowsunga gecyrran wille, ne tweoge him forgifenesse begitan þurh Godes
mildheortnesse.
 61. Soðlice þa þe on þisse worulde hreowsunge doð, þam
simle Godes mildheortnes gehelpð.
 64. Þam hreowsiendan is sio wæcce witodlice to beganne, for
þam þe hio to heofonum up ahefð þæs hreowsiendan wæstmas.
 65. For þam us gedafenaþ wacian symle, swa swa Esaias se witega
cwæð: Of þære nihte min gast wacaþ to ðe, dryhten, for þan þe
leoht sint þin bebodu ofer eorðan.
 68. Eft Dauid cwæð, se witiga: <foreign>Media nocte surgebam</foreign>, To
middere nihte ic wæs arisende þe to andettanne ofer þa domas þinre
rihtwisnesse.
 70. Be þære wæccan eac swylce se hælend þara
tolysendra mod aweahte, þus cweðende: <foreign>Beatus ille seruus quem</foreign>, Eadige
beoð þa þeowas þa þe þonne se hlaford cymð he hie wæccende
gemet.
 73. To soðan ic eow secge, ofer eall is god geset.
 74. & eft he cwæð: Ic lufige þa þe me lufiað, &
þa þe ær to me waciaþ, þa gemetaþ me.
 75. Waciaþ, for ðy, an gyrnesse, for þam ge nyton hwænne
dryhten cumende bið, on repsunge oððe to middre nihte oððe to
hancredes oððe on ærnemergen, þy læs, þonne he cume, he eow
slæpende gemete.
 78. & næs na þæt an þæt he ðam apostolum sylfum
þas lare bebead.
 79. Þa wæccan he eft gecydde, þus cweðende: þeah ic eow
þa wæccan beode, eallum ic hie beode.
 80. To witanne is þæt ðæt nis þæt an þæt an
wordum he lærde þa wæccan, ac eac swylce mid his agenre bysene he
getrymede, swa swa þæt þæt godspell cyð þætte se hælend
wære nihterne an gebedum waciende.
 84. Broðor mine, for þan is eallum geleaffullum mannum to
wacienne, for þam þe sio estfulnes þære wæccan is gehiwcuðlucud
eallum halgum.
 86. For þam hie witon þæt þæt nis idellic ær to
arisenne & ær leohte to wacienne, for þam dryhten gehet þone
heofonlice beah þam waciendan.
 89. Æfter þissum gehyhtlice fylgað þa fæstenu, be
þara lofum Isidorius cwæð: Þæt fæsten sie swiðe god; hit is
heofonlic worc & heofona rices duru & hiwung þære toweardan
worulde.
 91. Þæt fæsten, se ðe hit rihtlice begæð, he bið
to Gode geþydd, & he bið þissum middangearde afremdod, & bið
gastlice gefremed.
 93. Þurh þæt fæsten bioð þa leahtras astreahte, &
þæt flæsc bið geeaðmed & þæs diofles costung
oferswiðed/.
 95. Hieronimus cwið: Þæt fæsten geclænsaþ þæne
lichoman & gemidlað þa uncysta, & þa godcundan mægenu
ongebringð.
 97. Agustinus cwæð: Þæt fæsten geopenaþ þa
heofonlican gerynu & ut ascyfð þa yflan leahtras & þa sawle
onlyhteð.
 98. Witodlice þa fæstenu sint strange gescotu angean þæs
diofles costungum.
 99. Swiðe raþe hie bioð oferswiðde þurh þa
forhæfdnesse.
 101. Soðlice to witanne is þæt ðæt fæsten myclum
framaþ, þæt þæt folc on Niniuen þære byrig gefæston þry
dagas, þurh þæt hie geearnodon Godes mildheortnesse begitan & hira
synna forgifnesse.
 104. Israhela folc gefæston ær þære Easterlican
symbelnesse, þurh þæt hie geearnodon þa Readan Sæ drigum fotum
þurhfaran & hira fynd ge seon besencte on þære ylcan sæ.
 106. Moyses gefæste on þam westenne, þurh þæt he
geearnode gehyran þa heofonlican geryno.
 107. Dauid se cyning æfter þære þurhtogenan synne
gefæste, þurh þæt he geearnode þa ylcan scylde gedilegan, swa he
sylf cwæð: Ic eaðmedde an fæsten mine sawlæ.
 110. Crist sylf gefæste <foreign>xl</foreign> daga & <foreign>xl</foreign> nihta, þurh
þæt he oferswiðde þone wiðerwinnan, & him sona englas
þenedon.
 111. Petrus gefæste, þurh þæt he geearnode þone engel
geseon, se hine of þam carcernne alysde.
 113. Iohannes se godspellere gefæste, þurh þæt he
geearnode þa godcundan gerynu gehyran, swa him se engel bodude.
 115. Paulus gefæste, þurh þæt he geearnode bion
gehæled of þære blindnesse & fulluhtes onfon.
 116. Hieronimus cwæð: Swa lange swa Adam hine gehæfde
þæt he þæs æples ne abyrgde, he wunude on neorxnawonges gefean.
 118. Sona swa he þæs ofætes onþah, swa wæs he drifen.
 120. Broðor þa leofestan, swiðe god is þæt fæsten mid
gebede.
 120. For þam sio gemetfæstnes is halwendlic, & swa hwæt
swa bið to swiðe & ofer gemet, þæt bið frecenlic.
 122. To witanne is weotodlice þæt þæt fæsten mid godum
worcum is Gode swiðe andfenge.
 123. For þam þæt is þæt fulfremede fæsten þæt
mid ælmessan & mid gebedum þone heofon þurhfærð, & to
þæs hehstan Godes þrymsetle becymeð.
 126. Æfter þam fæstenne, broðor mine, synt þa
fæstenu to beganne, swa swa Isidorius cwæð: Mid þam gebedum ge beoð
geclænsode & mid þam rædingum ge bioð intimbrede.
 128. Soðlice to witane is þætte singallice gebed myclum
fremaþ mid Gode, swa swa Paulus se apostol cwæð: Þæs rihtwisan
gebed miclum fremaþ beforan Gode.
 131. Weotodlice Moyses hine gebæd & he ahwyrfde Godes yrre
fram Israhela folce, þa hie hie to ðam diofolgylde gebædon & God
forleton.
 133. Eac swylce Elias hine gebæd þæt hit ne rinde ofer
eorðan, & he mid his gebedum þone heofon beleac þreo gear & syx
monoð; & eft he abæd þæt se heofon sealde renas & sio eorþe
hire wæstmas.
 135. Ionas hine gebæd on þæs hwæles innoðe & he
þanon alysed wæs.
 136. Daniel hine gebæd on þæra leona seaþe &
geearnode beon gehyred.
 137. Ezechias se cyning hine gebæd on his untrumnesse & him
geicte God <foreign>XV</foreign> gear to life.
 139. Wiotodlice swa hwa swa wile symle mid Gode bion, he sceal
gelomlice hine gebiddan & rædan.
 140. For þam þonne we us gebiddaþ, þonne sprecaþ we wið
God, & þonne we redaþ, þonne spricþ God wið us.
 143. Æt þam ytemestan, broðor mine, heræfter fylgð sio
manung be þære ælmessan, sio is fylness & fulfremednes ealra godra
weorca.
 144. Be þære ælmessan lofe Agustinus cwæð: Sio
ælmesse is swiðe halig weorc.
 146. Hio geicð þas andweardan god, & hio sylð synna
forgifnesse, & hio gemanigfealdaþ geara fyrstas, & hio hylt þæs
mannes mod, & heo geondbrædeð þa gemæru, & hio eal þing
geclænsaþ, & hio alyseð þone mannan fram deaþe & fram witum,
& hio hie geþydeð to þam englum & dioflu fram ascyfð, & hio
is unoferwuniendlic weall ymb þa sawle & þa dioflu fram adrifð, &
hio laðað englas to fylste.
 151. Swa swa Hieronimus cwæð: Sio ælmesse geondfærð
þone heofon & hio cnysseð heofona rices duru, & hio awecð þone
engel ongeancumende, & hio God gecigð to fultume.
 154. Witodlice, þreo cyn synt ælmessena: an is lichamlic,
þæt is þæt man þam wædliendan sylle to gode þæt he mæge;
oðer is gastlic, þæt is þæt man forgife þam þe wið hine
gegylteð; þridde: þæt man þam gyltendan gestyre & ða
dwoliendan an rihtan gebringe.
 159. Þas þing us gedafenað gefellan mid þæs
hælendes/ fultume þe mid fæder & mid suna & mid þam þam
halgan/ gaste leofað & rixað a in ecnesse þurh ealra worulda
woruld aa butan ende, amen.

HomS 12
B3.2.12.
Second Sunday in Lent: Dictionary of Old English transcript, edited from Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Hatton 114.



 1. Men þa leofestan, uton nu gehyran hu ure drihten wæs
sprecende in þas drihtenlican tid ymbe mancynnes hælo and hu he
geðrowian wolde for us and hu he his apostolum sæde ærðon þe he
þrowian wolde.
 5. Segð her on þissere bec þæt þa earman iudeas ure
drihten ahengon on þa soðfæstan rode and hi hine slogon mid bradum
handum on his neb and hi mid heora spatlum spiwon on his andwlitan and hine on
bysmor axoden hwæþer he wære iudea cyning, and hi him dydon þyrnene
helm on his heafod.
 12. Eal þæt he þrowode forþon ðe he geseah þæt eal
þyssere worulde lif wæs mid synnum oferflowen for þære oferhyde Euan
and Adames.
 15. Leofan men, on domes dæge eorðe bið bifiende and ealle
eorðware beoð arisende of heora byrgene ægðer ge gode ge yfele, ge
iunge ge ealde, ge trume ge untrume.
 18. And heo beoð þonne ealle swyðe forhtiende hwider heo
þonne hwyrfan sculon and þonne bið drihten sittende on his þam
wuldorlicum heahsetle and him þonne hwearfiað his englas þusendmælum
abuton and hy beoð mid swyðe beorhtum stefnum singende.
 24. Þæt bið ealra swega swyðost forðon þær bið
synfullum gastum to ondrædanne.
 26. Swa þonne eac bið soðfæstum gastum wuldor gesewen
þonne þa halgan organa beoð hleoðriende and drihtnes cempan beoð
wuldriende and deofla beoð hreowsiende and se sealmwyrhta bið hearpiende
þæt ealle beorgas tolidað and steorran ahreosað of heofonum and stanas
formeltað and eal wætera þrym byð gewiten aweg and eal þeos woruld
þonne æt ende and ealra worulda rim bið arunnen and seo drihtenlice rod
bið æteowed eallum eorðwarum.
 35. Ðonne bið se micla dom geworden and ealle deade men
arisað and ða dracan beoð hwearfiende and þonne æfter þon mot se
blaca leg oferþecgan eal þeodland, þonne bið swyðe mycel þrym on
heofonum and swyðe wundorlic sang on þam heofoncundan swege and onginnað
þonne ut faran ealle side hergas.
 42. Sculon þonne ealle gemænelice to þam micclum sinoðe
þær ealra sawla gehwylc sceal ealle his dæda areccan ge gode ge yfele
swa hwæt swa he of his lifes frymðe geworhte þær þonne ure
æghwylc mæg his agenne synna sceawian þa þe we leahterlice
geworhtan.
 47. Swylce þonne eac þa oðre þa ðe be gastlicum fostre
leofodon and hi wæron god ondrædende, þonne nele drihten þa næfre
forlæton þa ðe hine lufian willað and þonne ealle þa heardan
hergas beoð gesamnode on þam domdæge earme and eadige.
 52. Þonne bið Sanctus Petrus se heofonlican apostol, Cristes
þegna yldest æt þam heofoncundan setle se bið cweþende to drihtne,
Min drihten mycel is seo menigo þe þu on middanearde gescope.
 56. And þonne andswarað drihten Sancte Petre þam apostole and
he cweð to him, Nu ic wille witan to þissum dæge hwa eorðlicra manna
min bebodu gehealdon wolde and ðonne cweð Sanctus Petrus, Min drihten nu hy
synt ealle gesamnode on þine gesyhðe þonne bið Sancta Maria eac
standende seo heofonlica fæmne æt drihtnes heahsetle and þa feower
godspelleras.
 64. Se yldesta is genemned Sanctus Matheus se awrat Cristes boca
þone ærestan dæl.
 66. Hy beoð fleogende ymb drihtnes wuldorhelm utan and Sanctus
Michahel bið swyðe þencende hwæt þæra sawla him gegan wille,
forðon þe he sceal æghwylce saule to drihtnes cneowum gelædan and
cweð to drihtne, Her is nu seo sawul seo ðe þe wæs lufiende of hyre
lifes frymðe.
 71. Þonne gebletsað drihten þa sawle and hatað hine
þæt helm gebringe on his anwalde in þa fægran eardungstowe þær
heo mot gladian and blissian.
 74. He cwæð se æþele lareow þæt ealle þa sawla
swylcere blisse onfengon þa þe drihten lufian willað and his bebodu
heoldan and gelæstan.
 77. Ðonne gelædeð Sanctus Michahel eft oðre siðe swyðe
synfulle sawle beforan drihtene and eal seo menigo gesyhð lædan þa sawle
to him.
 80. And þonne cweð drihten to þam heahengle, Hwæt þeos
sawul swyðe unfægeres hiwes is.
 82. Þonne andswarað se encgel drihtne and he cweð, þis is
seo sawul seo ðe þe næfre lufian nolde.
 84. Þonne hateð drihten þa sawle lædan to þære stowe
þe heo ær geearnod hæfde.
 85. Þonne clypað Sancta Maria to hyra suna urum drihtne
hælende Criste þæt is se Nazarenisca hælend, and heo cweð to him,
Min drihten, hwæt þu wast þæt þu to þinum gingrum gecwæde
þeahhwylce eorðlice menn fram ðe gewiten hæfdon gyf hi eft gecyrran
woldon to þe þæt hi wurdon englum gelice.
 92. Þonne æfter þissum wordum þus gesprecen onginneð se
heofonlica scyppend acsian ealle eorðbuende hwæt hi him to lacum brohton.
 95. Þonne, men þa leofestan, age we myccle nydþearfe þæt
we geþencan nu hu we him þonne andswarian wyllað forþon þe he ure
tyddernys secan ealle þa ðe on lichaman acennede wurdon rihtgelyfendra.
 99. Nu we magon gehyran hu cuðlice he us geearnode lif æfter
deaþe gif we hit sylfe gearnian wyllað mid godum dædum.
 102. And þonne gyt bið drihten sprecende to mancynne and he
cweð, Her is seo rod seo ðe ic on ahangen wæs and on minum handum is
orgyte hu þa iudeas me drehten mid mænigfealdum witum swa me no gecynde ne
wæs þæt ic wære on <foreign>XXX</foreign> scillinga geseald.
 108. Uton nu þonne, men ða leofestan, þis ongytan nu we
syndon on þyssum drihtenlican temple gegaderode þæt we hit habban on
urum heortum singalice þæt we þencan hwæt we him to lacum bringen in
þyssum halgan lenctenfæstene þe drihten gescop eallum rihtgelefendum
mannum to gefean and to myrhðe eallum mannum þæra þe on god gelyfað
and heora andetnyssa doð heora scriftum þonne magan hi heora sawla ecelice
gehælon and eac þa synne gebetan þa ðe hy ær leahterlice
gefremedon.
 119. Sanctus Matheus sæde se godspellere þæt eorðlice
menn magon heora synna adiligian mid halgum fæstenum and mid soðum gebedum
and mid ælmes dædum and mid haligra cyricena socnum and mid andetnysse.
 124. And we sculon gelefan on ænne god se ðe on heofonum is
ecelice gewuldrod mid godfæder on halgum gaste and he is mid deorwyrðum
gimmum gefrætewod se þe we his þrowungetid wurþiað.
 127. And he is se eca dema ealra lifigendra þæra þe æfre
geboren wurde and frefrend ealra gasta and he is æþele ofer ealle oðre
cyningas and he is læce ealra lifiendra.
 131. Forðon nu is mycel nydþearf þæt we his bebodu healdan
and gelæstan and uton lufian hine ofer ealle oðre þing, þonne
geleanað he hit us þær us leofast bið.
 134. Sy him lof and wuldor a on ealra worulda woruld a butan ende
amen.

HomS 13 (Ass 11)
B3.2.13.
Third Sunday in Lent: Assmann 1889, 138-43.



 2. Gehyrað nu, men þa leofestan, hu þas halgan bec eow
myngiað þone weg ætywiað and eac in gelædað to heofena rice, and
hu ge magon þa yfelu þisses middaneardes forbugan and gode gefylstendum to
ðam ecan life becuman.
 5. Clypað ure drihten þurh his witegan swiðe stiðlice to
ðam preostum, þe godes folce wisian scylan, þæt heo eow myngian and
cyðan eow soðfæstnesse weg, and þus cweð: <foreign>Clama, ne cesses, quasi
tuba; exalta vocem tuam et adnuntia populo meo peccata eorum</foreign>, ðæt is on
urum geþeode: Clypa, ne ablin ðu, ac ahefe up þine stefne swa beme and
cyð minum folce heora synna.
 10. Gif þu þonne nelt þam unrihtwisan his synna cyðan, þu
bist his sawle scyldig.
 11. Her ge magon gehyran, broðru ða leofestan, þæt ealle
godes mæssepreostas and biscopas and oðre godcunde lareowas synd on
mycelre frecednysse, gif heo eow godes bebodu ne cyðað.
 14. Be ðam cweð drihten þurh þone witegan: <foreign>Audiens ex ore
meo sermonem meum, adnuntiabis eis ex me, non ex te</foreign>, ðæt is on urum
geþeode: Of minum muðe gehlystendum þu bodast hym mine spræce of me,
næs of þe.
 17. Nu ge magon ongitan, hwylcne ege þa mæssepreostas habbað
toweardne, þonne god wile girnan to hym ealra þara sawla, þe hym her on
life betæhte synd.
 20. Þonne we witan, þæt anra manna gehwylc mæg
earfoðlice be his agenre sawle gescead agyldan on domes dæg.
 21. Forþam us is micel þearf, þæt we eow þone weg
cyðen and þæt siðfæt ætywen, þe ge þurh magon to ðam ecan
life becuman.
 23. And eac eow is to warnienne, forðan gif hit us is frecenlic,
þæt we hit eow ne cyðen, hit is eow micele mare frecednes, þæt ge
nellen gefyllan, þæt we eow to eowre sawle þearfe cyðað.
 26. Þonne þurh þone witegan is gecweden: Gif þu bytst þam
synfullum, þæt he of his unrihtan wegum gecyrre and he gecyrran nelle of
his unrihtwisnessum, he swelt and þu hæfst alysed þine sawle fram his
witum.
 29. Ealra ærest sceal ælc cristen man witan and on his
heortan trumlice healdan þæt æreste bebod and þæt mæste,
þæt is, þæt he lufige his drihten mid ealre heortan and mid eallum
mode and mid eallum mægne.
 33. And oðer bebod is þysum fulgelic, þæt is, þæt
ælc man lufige his nextan swa hine sylfne.
 34. Nu wenð manig man, þæt þis sy gecweden be his
freondum, þe him gesibbeste synt and þurh mægrædenne nehste.
 36. Ac hit nis be ðam gesibban na swiðor gecweden, þonne be
ðam fremdan.
 37. Ac ure ælc is oðres nehsta þurh þone rihtan geleafan,
þe we to urum drihtne habbað, and we synd gebroðru gecigede, forðy þe
god is ure fæder on heofonum.
 39. Þy cweð se hælend on his godspelle: <foreign>Omnia quæcumque
vultis, ut faciant vobis homines, ita et vos facit illis</foreign>, ðæt is on urum
geðeode: Don ge oðrum mannum ælc ðara þinga, þe ge willan,
þæt hy eow don.
 43. Se man hæfð rihte lufe and soðe, þe god lufað ma,
þonne hine sylfne, and his nyhstan swa swa hine sylfne, and nanum oðrum men
ne deð, butan swa swa he wile, þæt man him do.
 45. Gif ge þonne þas ðreo forman bebodu on eower mod
asettað and mid healicre arwurðnesse and mid micelum gefean onfon willað,
þonne magon ge mid godes fultume becuman to oðrum godum dædum.
 48. Nu is eac to witanne, broðru þa leofestan, lenctentide mid
swiðe micelre begymene healdan, þæt we þurh nan þing nænne dæg
þis fæsten ne abrecon, ne on æte, ne on drence, butan sunnandagum.
 52. On ðam nis nan fæsten geboden.
 52. On oðre tide men gewuniað, þæt hy þurh oðra manna
lufe hwilum fæsten forlætað; on þisse tide hit ne mæg nateshwon
beon forlæten.
 54. On oðre tide is on æghwylces mannes willan and on his
scriftes dome gesett, hu he for his synnum fæste.
 56. On ðisse tide gif man ne ful fæst, man forgymð godes
agen bebod.
 57. On oðerre tide se ðe wel fæst, gestrynð him mede æt
gode.
 58. On þisse tide se ðe rihtlice ne fæst, he gestrynð him
helle wite, butan hit for untrumnesse oððe for geogoðe sy, forðam þe
ure drihten gehalgode þas ilcan dagas þurh Moysen and Heliam and þurh
hine sylfne, þæt heora ælc gefæste feowertig daga and feowertig
nihta.
 62. Earnostlice is to warnienne wið þæt, þe manega men on
gewunan habbað, þæt synd þa ðe wenað, þæt hy fæstende synd
rihtlice, gif hy etað, sona swa hy þæt belltacen gehyrað þære
nigoðan tide, þæt is seo nontid.
 65. Ac hit nis na to gelyfanne, þæt hy fæstende synd
rihtlice, butan hy æfter hyra mæssan þæs æfenes tid wurðunga
gebiden.
 67. Ac þa þe þis fæsten a riht healdan willað, þonne
scylon hy ærest gan to heora scriftan and hym unforwandodlice his synna
ealle geandettan, þe he æfre fram geogoðe oð ðas elde gedon
hæfð, oððe on geþance, oððe on worde, oððe on weorce, ealle
be his wisunge gebetan and a geswican.
 72. Þonne beoð hy Cristene, gif hy þis eall gelæstað,
and hy scylon embe þa nigoðan tide heora mæssan gestandan and æfter
þam heora æfenþenunga, syððan don heora ælmessan swa forð, swa
him fyrmest gehagie.
 75. And þonne mid miclum godes ege gangan to heora mete and
þær don, swa se hælend on þam godspelle beot and þus cweð:
<foreign>Cavete, ne graventur corda vestra in crapula et ebrietate</foreign>, ðæt is on
Englisc: Warniað, þæt eowre heortan ne beon gehefegode on oferfylle and
on druncennesse.
 79. And se man, þe næbbe, of hwan he mæge rumlice
ælmessan syllan, ne onðracige he forðam, þeh he lytel hæbbe.
 81. Þonne drihten us mede behet, gif we þam þearfan, þe
ðæs neod bið, geræcað cuppan fulle coles wæteres, and for ðy
he cwæð be ðam colan wætere, þæt nan man ne ðorfte hine
beladian, þæt he fæt næfde, on hwy he hit wyrman mihte.
 84. Do gehwa georne on godes est, beþam þe hine fyrmest
onhagie.
 85. And þæt is to witanne, þeah ðe seo ælmesse on
ælcne sæl god beo gedon, huru þinga man sceal on þissum dagum hy
dælan swa forð, swa mannes mihta fyrmeste beoð.
 88. Þonne hit be ðam awriten is: <foreign>Abscondite eleemosynam in
sinu pauperis et ipsa orat pro vobis ad dominum</foreign>, ðæt is on Englisc:
Behydað þa ælmessan on þæs þearfan greadan and heo gebit for eow
to gode.
 91. And ure drihten cweð eft on oðre stowe þurh his witegan:
<foreign>Frange esurienti panem tuum et egenos vagosque induc in domum tuam</foreign>, He
cweð: Brec þinne hlaf þam hingriendan and þa wædlan and þa
ælþeodigan gelæd in to þinum huse.
 95. Midþam þe he cweð: Brec þinne hlaf, he getacnað,
þæt þu scealt of þam þone þearfan aretan, and þeah þu mare
næbbe, þonne ænne hlaf.
 97. Men ða leofestan, hit nis na riht on Cristenum folce,
þæt sume scylon mid oferæte and mid oferdrence beon oferlede and sume
hungre cwylmede.
 99. Þonne we ealle synt anes drihtnes ðeowas and mid anum
wyrðe gebohte, þæt is mid his agenum blode, þe he for eall mancyn
ageat, and gif we wel doð, þonne mote we ealle to anre eadignesse becuman.
 102. For hwi ne mot se ðearfa onfon þines metes, þe mid ðe
is to onfonne heofona rice?
 104. Hwi ne mot se ðearfa onfon þine ealdan gewæda, þe mid
ðe is to onfonne þæs undeadlican gegyrlan on neorxnawange?
 106. Hwi nis se wyrðe, þæt he onfo þinra metelafe, þe
mid þe is to cumenne to engla gebeorscipe?
 107. Broðru þa leofostan, utan us gegearwian on þyssum dagum,
þæt we synd on ðam mæran æriste ures drihtnes þurh clænnesse
wlitige and fægere and þurh soðe lufan scinende and mid ælmesdædum
aclænsode and mid eallum godum weorcum gefrætewode.
 111. And ælce yrsunge and andan and hatunge and ealle yfelnesse
utan aworpan fram urum heortum eal swa atter and gelomlice mid rihtum geleafan
and mid godum willan to cyrcan cuman and þær mid micelre geornfulnesse
æt gode biddan forgifennesse ealra þara gylta, þe we dæghwamlice
wyrcað.
 115. And wite ælc man swiðe georne, þæt he cunne his
Credan, on ðam he sceal geandettan his rihtan geleafan, and his Pater Noster,
on ðam he sceal him æt gode are biddan ge þisses lifes, ge þæs
toweardan.
 119. And ælcum men is swiðe to warnienne wið idele spræce
and þæt man idele leoð ne singe on ðysum dagum, þe ymbe
hæðenscipe and ymbe galscipe geworhte syndon.
 121. And næfre nan man ne geþristlæce ænigne deofles
bigencg to donne, ne on wiglunge, ne on wiccedome, ne on ænegum idelum
anginne.
 123. And þæt nan man ne sece to nanre wellan, ne to nanum
stane, ne to nanum treowe, ne nan man his cild þurh þa eorðan ne teo,
forðam se ðe þæt deð, he betæcð þæt cild eallum deoflum
and seo moder forð mid.
 127. Ne nan man nane neode ne sece, butan to gode sylfum and to his
halgum.
 128. Ac þonne ge to cyrican cumen, þonne bringe ge eowre
ælmessan to godes weofode, swa eow fyrmest gehagie, forðam drihten cweð:
<foreign>Non apparebis in conspectu meo vacuus</foreign>, ðæt is on Englisc: Ne ætyw
þu þe on minre gesihðe idelhende.
 131. And doð gelomlice eowre andetnesse eowrum scrifte and hine
biddað, þæt he eow to gode þingie, þæt ge motan eowra synna
forgyfnesse geearnian.
 134. Men ða leofestan, to hwy synd we elles on ðisne middaneard
acenned, butan þæt we scylan mid micelre eadmodnesse urum drihtne hyran
and swa hwæt swa we þurh ungewis oððe þurh hwylce dysignesse gedon
habban, þæt eadmodlice mid micelre hreowsunga and mid godum dædan betan
þa hwile, þe us god þæs fyrstes geunne.
 139. Healdan we nu georne godes æ and his bebodu and þam
þærto wisien, þe us underþeodde synt, forðam þe ure drihten behet
þam þe hine lufiað and his bebodu healdað, þæt hy motan æfter
þam æriste habban ece lif and neorxnawanges gefean mid fæder and mid
suna and mid halgum gaste a worulda woruld a butan ende.
 144. Amen.
