HomS 14 (BlHom 4)
B3.2.14.
Third Sunday in Lent: Morris 1874-80, 39-53 and 195.



 1. <foreign>DOMINICA TERTIA IN QUADRAGESIMA</foreign>.
 1. Geheraþ nu, men þa leofestan, hwæt se æþela lareow
sægde be manna teoþungceape; he cwæþ, Nu nealæceþ þæt we
sceolan ure æhta & ure wæstmas gesamnian, don we þonne geornlice
Drihtne þancas þe us þa wæstmas sealde.
 4. & syn we gemyndige þæs þe us Crist sylfa bebead on
þyssum godspelle; he cwæþ þæt we symle emb twelf monaþ ageafon
þone teoþan dæl þæs þe we on ceape habban.
 7. Hwæt ure Drihten hine gemedemode, þæt he us sealde ealle
þa wæstmas þe eorþe forþbringeþ; þeah he hie mannum missenlice
dæle, hwæþere he bebead þæt we symle emb twelf monaþ gedælan
for his noman þone teoþan dæl on urum wæstmum, & on cwicum
ceape.
 11. Ne bæd he no þæs forþon þe him þæs ænig
þearf/ wære, ac forþon he wolde ægþær ge ofer heofenum, ge ofer
eorþan, us his miltse gecyþon.
 14. Us is þonne mycel nedþearf þæt we gebugon to him,
& þæt we motan brucan his wuldres fægernesse.
 16. Swa Drihten sylfa wæs sprecende þurh witgan, he cwæþ,
Bringaþ ge on min beren eowerne teoðan sceat.
 17. Hwylc beren mænde he þonne elles buton heofona rice?
 18. & he swa cwæþ, Gedoþ þæt eow sy mete gearo on
minum huse.
 19. Hwæt mænde he þonne elles, buton þæt we gefyllon
þæs þearfan wambe mid urum godum?
 21. Þonne ne hingreþ us næfre on ecnesse, ac he us ontyneþ
heofenes þeotan, & he us syleþ his wæstma genihtsumnesse.
 23. & be þissum þingum eallum geþenc, þu dysega mon,
hwæt yfela bebead Drihten æfre, þæt his lar nære wyrþe þæt
hi mon gehyrde?
 25. Þonne sægþ on þissum bocum þæt Drihten sylf
cwæde þæt þis mennissce cyn ne sceolde agimeleasian þæt hie
sealdon heora wæstma fruman for Gode.
 28. & gif we þæt nu ne doþ, þonne wyrce we us myccle
synne on þon.
 29. & us is get wyrse þæt we urne ceap teoþian, gif we
willaþ syllan ure þæt wyrste Gode.
 30. Cwæþ se æþela lareow, Weorþiaþ ge eowerne Drihten
God mid gedafenlicum þingum, & onsecggæþ ge him mid
soþfæstnesse wæstmum, þonne gefylleþ Drihten eower beren mid
genihtsumnesse.
 33. Ne þurfon ge wenan þæt ge þæt orceape sellon
þæt ge under Drihtnes borh syllaþ, þeh ge sona instæpes þære
mede ne ne onfon.
 36. Hit is þeh wen þæt feala manna þence hwylcum edleane
he onfo æt Drihtne, oþþe hu God him þæt eft forgyldan wille,
þæt he ær for his noman sealde þæm earman.
 38. Gif ge þonne gelyfaþ, cwæþ Drihten, þæt eow
þæt to gode gelimpe þæt ge her on minum naman syllaþ, þonne biþ
hit eow nyt geseald, & hit ariseþ eowrum saulum to hundteontigfealdre
mede.
 41. Gif ge þonne tweogaþ be þæm ælmessum þe ge for
Godes noman syllaþ, & ge eow ondrædaþ þæt ge onfon to lytlum
leanum, þonne forleosaþ ge þa ælmessan þe ge nu for Gode syllaþ,
& hie eow to nænigre are ne belimpeþ.
 45. On þissum godspelle sægþ þæt ure teoþan sceattas
syn earmra manna gafol.
 46. Agifaþ nu teoþan dæl ealles þæs ceapes þe ge
habban earmum mannum, & to Godes cyrican, þæm earmestan Godes þeowum
þe þa cyrican mid godcundum dreamum weorþiað; forþon seo cyrice sceal
fedan þa þe æt hire eardiaþ.
 50. Geseoþ nu hu bliþe þa earman beoþ, þonne hi mon mid
mete & mid hrægle reteþ; myccle bliþre bið seo sawl þæs
mannes, þonne hire man þa ælmessan fore dæleþ; forþon be
þære ælmessan & be þæm fæstenne heo lifian sceal a buton
ende.
 54. Se þe buton ælmessan & fæstenne leofað se bið
on helle cwelmed, & he næfre ræste nafaþ.
 55. Swa Sanctus Paulus cwæþ þætte God hete ealle þa
aswæman æt heofona rices dura, þa þe heora cyrican forlætaþ,
& forhycggaþ þa Godes dreamas to geherenne.
 58. Forþon ne þearf þæs nanne man tweogean, þæt seo
forlætene cyrice ne hycgge ymb þa þe on hire neawiste lifgeaþ.
 60. Forþon, broþor mine þa leofestan, syllaþ ge eowere
teoþan sceattas þyder; & þær Gode dælaþ þam þe heora
hadas mid clænnesse healdan, & Godes lof mid rihte began willaþ.
 63. Swa se æþela lareow bebead þæt man Godes æwe mid
rihte heolde, & Godes cyricean fæste tremede, ge læwede men, ge
gehadode.
 65. Þa mæssepreostas þe Godes cyricena lareowas beoþ, þa
sceolan heora scriftbec mid rihte tæcan & læran, swa swa hie ure
fæderas ær demdon.
 67. Ne wandige na se mæssepreost no for rices mannes ege, ne for
feo, ne for nanes mannes lufon, þæt he him symle rihte deme, gif he wille
sylf Godes domas gedegan.
 70. Ne sceal he eac beon to georn deadra manna feos, ne to lyt
þancian heora ælmessan, forþon þe hie wenaþ þæt he heora senna
alysan mæge.
 72. & þa lareowas sceolan synnfullum mannum eadmodlice
tæcan & læran, þæt hie heora synna cunnon onrihtlice geandettan;
forþon þe hie beoþ toþon mislice, & sume swiþe unsyferlice,
þæt se man wandaþ þæt he hi æfre asecgge, buton se
mæssepreost hie æt him geacsige.
 77. Eala, cwæþ Sanctus Paulus, þæt biþ deofles
goldhord, þæt mon his synna dyrne his scrifte; forþon þæm
wiþerweardan beoþ þæs mannes synna gecwemran þonne eal eorþlic
goldhord.
 80. Se mæssepreost se þe bið to læt þæt he þæt
deofol of men adrife, & þa sauwle raþost mid ele & mid wætere
æt þon wiþerweardan ahredde, þonne bið he geteald to þære
fyrenan ea, & to þæm isenan hoce.
 83. Þonne sægde Sanctus Pauwlus þæt he gesawe naht feor
from þæs mæssepreostes sidan, þe we ær bufan emb spræcon,
þæt he wære getogen mid þon isnan hoce on þære picenan ea,
oþerne ealdne man.
 86. & þone læddon feower awyrgde englas mid mycelre
reþnesse, & hine besencton on þa fyrenan ea æt his cneowa; & hie
hine hæfdon geþreatodne mid fyrenum racentum þæt he ne moste
gecweþan, Miltsa me, God.
 90. Þa cwæþ se æþela lareow to þæm engle þe hine
lædde, Hwæt is þes ealda man?
 91. Se engel him to cwæþ, Hit is an biscop se dyde mare yfel
þonne god; he onfeng for worlde mycelne noman, & þæt eal forheold,
& his Scyppend þe him þone noman forgeaf.
 94. Þonne sægde Sanctus Paulus þæt se biscop nære
miltsiende wydewum, ne steopcildum, ne nanum Godes þearfan; þa wæs him
forgolden æfter his agenum gewyrhtum.
 97. & her sægþ on þyssum bocum, þæt þæm
biscopum þe her on worlde syndon, swyþe gelice gegange þæm biscope
þe Paulus on þære fyrenan helle geseah, gif hi nellaþ healdan Godes
æwe, swa swa him haligu gewreotu bebeodaþ.
 100. Se biscop sceal, þe wile onfon Godes mildheortnesse &
his synna forgifnesse, þrafian þa mæssepreostas, mid lufe ge mid laþe,
þæt hie healdan Godes æwe on riht, & þone hired þe hie ofor
beoþ.
 103. & þa læwedan men þe hie aldormen ofer beon sceolan,
þæt hie þæm ne geþafian þæt hie heora lif on woh lifgean,
þæt hie on him sylfum onstellan gode bysene þæm folce.
 106. Forþon se goda lareow sægde, þonne se mæssepreost
oþþe se biscop wære gelæded on ece forwyrd; þæt hi þonne ne
mihtan nawþer ne him sylfum, ne þære heorde þe hi ær Gode healdan
sceoldan, nænige gode beon.
 110. Hwane manaþ God maran gafoles þonne þone biscop?
 111. Forþon þe se biscop biþ Godes gingra, & he biþ
efenhalig his apostolum, & efnhlete his witgum, gif he ne geþafaþ
þæt Godes folc heora lif on woh lybban.
 113. Swa Sanctus Paulus sægde, þæt Crist sylfa bebude Moyse
þæt he oþrum lareowum sægde, gif hi þæt Cristene folc mid lufan
ne mihton gecyrron þæt hi Godes æwe on riht geheoldan, þæt hit
þonne manige yfele men mid heora feore gebohtan, þonne gecyrde þæt
oþer folc on Godes þonne soþan þeowdom.
 118. Swa se æþela lareow sægde, þæt se cyning & se
biscop sceoldan beon Cristenra folca hyrdas, & hi from eallum unrihtwisum
ahweorfan.
 120. & gif mon þonne ne mihte hi to rihte gecyrron, þæt
hi heora wohdæda geswican woldan, þonne sceal æghwylc man betan his
wohdæda be his gyltes andefne.
 123. Se biscop & se mæssepreost gif hi mid rihte willaþ
Gode þeowian, þonne sceolan hi þegnian dæghwamlice Godes folce,
oþþe huru embe seofon niht mæssan gesingan for eal cristen folc, þe
æfre from frymþe middangeardes acenned wæs, & Godes willa sy
þæt hi foreþingian motan.
 127. Þonne onfoþ hi from Gode maran mede þonne hi from
ænigum oþrum lacum don; forþon þe Gode is his folc swyþe leof; &
þa þe on heofenum syndon, hi þingiaþ for þa þe þyssum sange
fylgeaþ, & hi beoþ on ealra eorþlicra gebedrædenne þe Cristene
wæron, oþþe gyt syn.
 132. & hi næfre on heora synnum ne swyltaþ; & Godes
mildheortnes biþ ofer hi, & ealra haligra.
 133. & God hafaþ alyfed eorþlicum mannum þæt hi motan
bletsian eal Cristen folc, & him gelome godcunde lac forebringan; forþon
hi syndon Godes bearn gecegede, & on ealra haligra geþoftscipe.
 136. & þis weorc biþ deoflum se mæsta teona; forþon
þe hi habbaþ manega saule on heora gewaldum þe him wile git God miltsian
for heora mægena weorþunga, & for eorþlicra manna gebedum, &
ealra haligra, & for his mycclan mildheortnesse.
 140. Cwæþ se halga lareow, Ne ablinnan we, manna bearn,
þæt we Gode cwemon, & deofol tynan, dæges & nihtes, & mid
Cristes rode tacne us gebletsian, þonne flyhþ þæt deofol fram us;
forþon him biþ mara broga þonne ænigum men sy, þeah hi mon slea mid
sweorde wiþ þæs heafdes.
 145. & eallum Cristenum mannum is beboden þæt hi ealne
heora lichoman seofon siþum gebletsian mid Cristes rode tacne, ærest on
ærnemorgen, oþre siþe on underntid, þriddan siþe on midne dæg,
feorþan siþe on nontid, fiftan siþe on æfen, syxtan siþe on niht
ær he ræste, seofoþan siþe on uhtan; huru he hine Gode bebeode.
 150. & gif þa lareowas þis nellaþ fæstlice Godes folce
bebeodan, þonne beoþ hi wiþ God swyþe scyldige; forþon þæt Godes
folc sceal witon hu hi hi sylfe scyldan sceolan wiþ deoflu.
 153. & þa lareowas beoþ syþþan domes wyrþe, gif hi
nellaþ þæt folc læron þæt hi heora synna geswicon, & Godes
bebodu healdan.
 155. Se biscop sceal beodan mid þon mæston bebode þæm
mæssepreostum, gif hi hi sylfe willon wiþ Godes erre gehealdan, þæt
hi secggan þæm Godes folce þæt hi Sunnandagum & mæssedagum
Godes cyrican georne secan, & þær þa godcundan lare lustlice
gehyran.
 159. Ne sceolan þa lareowas agimeleasian þa lare, ne þæt
folc ne sceal forhycggan þæt hi to him hi geeaþmedon, gif hi willon
Godes forgifnesse habban.
 162. Forþon þær mon þæt godspel sægþ, maniges
mannes heorte biþ onbryrded, & God biþ milde þæm monnum þe mid
eaþmodre heortan on hine gelefaþ.
 164. Þonne sceolan þa biscopas & þa mæssepreostas
gehwylces hades men georne þreatigean, & him bebeodan, þæt hi Godes
domas on riht healdan, þa Godes þeowas heora tidsangas & heora cyricean
mid rihte healdan, & þa læwedan swa him mid rihte tobelimpe.
 169. Gif him mon þonne hyran nelle, þonne mot se mæssepreost
hit wrecan, swa hit her beboden is, gif se Godes þeow nelle þære cyrican
on riht þeowian, þæt he þonne mid læwedum mannum onfo þæs
heardestan þeowdomes.
 172. & þis sceal se mæssepreost nede bebeodan, oþþe
þæs Godes þeowes synna onfon, & he biþ þonne seoþþan
þæm englum gelic, þe geo Gode wiþsocan, & þa wurdon on helle
besencte.
 175. Þonne sæde þæt se æþela lareow be þæm
ilcan, þæt hi oþre men be þon læron mihton, & se bisceop &
se mæssepreost beoþ þonne wiþ God gehealdene.
 178. Moyses onfeng scinendum wuldorhelme, forþon he symle þa
nyrugde þe God oferhogodan.
 179. Se þe Godes bebod oferhogaþ, he biþ on hæþenra
onlicnesse, & manig deofol on him eardaþ.
 181. Cwæþ Sanctus Paulus, Mycel biþ þæs apostolican
hades bebod; forþon þe Drihten cwæþ to him þæt swa hwylcne swa he
on eorþan gebunde, þæt se wære on heofonum gebunden; & swa
hwylcne swa he on eorþan alysde, þæt se wære on heofonum onlysed.
 185. Þonne lære ic eow, broþor mine, þæt ge syllon
eowre teoþan sceattas earmum mannum þe her for worlde lytel agan, þonne
blissiaþ ealle halige ofer eow, & God sylf biþ mid eow, & ge mid
him, & ge onfoþ eowerra synna forgifnessa.
 189. & swa hwylc man swa nele his ceapes & his wæstma
þone teoþan dæl for Godes naman dælan, þonne ne bið þæm
seald Drihtnes mildheortnes, ne his synna forgifnes.
 192. Ah he bið mid witum þread æfter his deaþe, &
ealra his æhta þonne idelhende, & him þonne beoþ ealle mid nede on
genumene.
 194. & æghwylcum men is beboden þe on ænigum þingum
cræftig sy, oþþe on maran wisdome oþþe on læssan, þonne agife
he symle Drihtne þone teoþan dæl, for his ðæm eorþlicum
gestreonum, & for þæs ecan lifes wæstmum; forþon simle Drihten
manaþ æghwylcne man þæs ðe he him her syleþ.
 199. & gif we þonne lustlice & rumlice þa welan
dælaþ earmum monnum, þe us God ær sealde, þonne onfo we ægþer
ge eorþlice mede ge eac heofenlice.
 201. Eala, cwæþ se æþela lareow, þu dysega man, &
þu unsnottra, to hwon bescyredest þu þe twyfealdre bletsunga, þa þu
heruwdest Godes bebodu?
 203. For hwon ne geþohtest þu þæt hit is eal Godes?
 204. Eala þu gitsigenda, & þu welega, hwæt dest þu
þe, gif Drihten on þe genimþ þa nigan dælas, & þe læteþ
þone teoþan dæl anne habban?
 206. Forþon þæt biþ buton synne þæt mon þa nigan
dælas on þam men genime, þonne he þæs teoþan dæles Gode
forwyrneþ.
 208. Hit is awriten on Cristes bocum þæt Drihten sylf cwæde
þæt þa teoþan sceattas wæron on urum agnum domum, ge on lande, ge
on oþrum þingum, ge on oþrum gestreonum; forþon symle æt þæm
ytmestan dæge eal hit him wyrþ to teonan þæm þe his Gode wyrneþ.
 213. Gif we þonne bliþe & rummodlice hi dælan willaþ
earmum mannum, þonne ontyneþ us Drihten heofenes þeotan, & he us
sendeþ ufan his bletsunga; & ure hwæte, & ure wingeardas, &
ealle ure eorþan wæstmas beoþ gebletsode, gif we beoþ riht donde;
& he us eac gesceldeþ wið eallum feondum.
 218. Hwæt æghwylc mon wile þæt him Drihten selle ealle
his þearfe, & hine ne lyst his willan wyrcean þæt he on his naman
dæle þæt he him ær sealde.
 220. For hwon ne magon we geþencan þæt seo eorþe is
Godes?
 221. & Godes is þæt yrfe þe we big leofiaþ; & we
ealle syndon his.
 222. & on his onwealde is eal þes middangeard, & þas
windas & ðas regnas syndon ealle his þa þe eorþan wæstmas
weccaþ, & þære sunnan hæto þe þas eorþan hlyweþ, &
ealle gesceafta syndon his, & he hi ealle geworhte, & on his anwalde
hafaþ.
 226. & ure Drihten is swiþe gemyndig ealra þara gifena þe
he us tolæteþ; and we æt þæm ytmestan dæge eall agyldan sceolan
þæt he us ær on eorþan sealde, & he us þonne forgyldeþ swa we
nu her doþ, ge godes ge yfeles.
 229. Men þa leofestan, for hwon ne magon we geþencan, gif we
ane hwile beoþ on hwylcum earfoþum þær we ures feores ne wenaþ,
þæt we þonne his are biddaþ, & us bið þonne leofre þonne eal
eorþan wela, gif he us arian & miltsian wile?
 233. For hwon ne magon we geþencan hwylc þæt wite bið,
þe næfre nænig ende ne becymeþ?
 235. Þonne manige ic nu mid godcundre stefne, cwæþ se
æþela lareow, þæt ge eow alesan of eowrum synnum, ær þon þe ge
deaþe swelton; forþon þe hit nu swiþe nealæceþ urum endedæge.
 238. & us is swiþe uncuþ hwæt ure yrfeweardas &
lastweardas getreowlices don willon æfter urum life, gif we hit sylfe ær
agimeleasiaþ; forþon syndon feawa þe þæm deadan getreowe weorþon.
 242. Forþon oft hit gesæleþ þæt his æhta weorþaþ
on þæs onwealde þe he ær on his life wyrrest uþe, hwilum þurh
wifes geweald, hwilum þurh weres; & mon þonne nohtes wyrþe his saule
ne deþ ne his goldes, ne his seolfres, ne his eorþwelena, gif he ær nele
þone selestan dæl for hine sylfne Gode gedælan, þa hwile þe he her
on life biþ.
 247. Þonne þæs monnes saul ut of his lichoman gangeþ, þe
him wæron ær his æhta leofran to hæbbenne þonne Godes lufu,
þonne ne gefultmiaþ þære saule þara gimma frætwednes, ne þara
goldwlenca nan þe his lichoma ær mid oforflownessum gefrætwod wæs,
& þa eorþlican gestreon swiþor lufode þonne he his gast dyde,
oþþe urne Drihten þe hine gesceop.
 253. Þonne weorþaþ him ealle þa eorþlican gefean, &
þa mycclan spræca & ofordruncennessa, þa hleahtras & þa
arleasan gylpas þe he ær lufode, weorþaþ him þonne ealle on heaf
gehwyrfede, forþon þe he ær nolde ongytan þone towerdon deaþ, &
þone mycclan ege, & þone bifigendan domes dæg.
 258. Broþor mine, cwæþ Sanctus Paulus, ongytaþ nu þysne
cwide, loca hwæt þe sy her on worlde swetast & leofast gesewen þinra
æhta, þara þu scealt Gode his dæl ageofan þe hit þe ær
sealde.
 261. Gif þu þæt ne wilt don, æfter þinum deaþe hit
weorþeþ þe swiþe bitere forgolden; forþon þæt biþ swiþe
dysig man & unsnottor on his life, se þe lufaþ þas eorþlican welan
& ne lufaþ God þe hit him eal sealde.
 264. Manna freondscipe biþ swiþe hwilwendlic, & swiþe
scendende; forþon ure yldran swultan & swiþe oft us from wendan, ah se
þe Godes freondscipe begyteþ, ne þearf se næfre wenan þæt he him
onwended weorþe, ac a ece standeþ.
 268. Soþ is þæt is eow secgge, swa hwylc man swa nele
Drihten lufian, & his æhta for his naman dælan, þonne genimeþ hi
Drihten mid mycclum teonan on him.
 270. & swa feala earmra manna swa on þæs rican neaweste
& þæs welegan sweltaþ, & he him nele syllan his teoþungsceatta
dæl, þonne biþ he ealra þara manna deaþes sceldig & myrþra
beforan þæs ecan Deman heahsetle.
 274. Forþon þe he heold ær his æhta him to wean & to
wlencum, & forwyrndon þam Drihtnes þearfum.
 276. Se mon se þe wile þone heofonlican gefean begytan, agife
he symle mid rihte þone teoþan sceat Gode, & dæle þeah his
ælmessan forþ of þon nigeoþan dælon, & sylle earmum mannum his
beodlafa, & his ealde hrægl, þonne biþ hit eft him togeanes
gehealden on þæm heofonlican goldhorde.
 280. & swa hwæt swa us God sylle mare þonne we nede brucan
sceolan, dælon we þæt symle þæm þe læsse habban; ne sylþ he
hit us to þon þæt we hit hydon, oþþe to gylpe syllan, sam hwylcum
mannum þe naht swiþe God ne lufiaþ.
 284. Ah we hit sceolan syllan to Godes cyrican, & þæm
earmestum mannum dælon, þonne is þæt god, ge her on worlde, ge eac on
þære toweardan.
 286. Þa welan, & þæt mycele gylp, & seo
unrihtgitsung, & þæt man þæm earman forwyrne, þæt is eal
swiþe mycel synn beforan Gode.
 289. Wiþsacaþ nu þam leasum welum, & þam unalyfdum
gestreonum, swa þa halgan dydon þe on þyssum life naht ne sohton ne ne
gyrndon to hæbbenne, buton þæt hi on heofona heanessum gebrohton eal
þæt hi on eorþan begeaton þurh Godes fultum.
 293. Nis eow þonne forboden þætte æhta habban, gif ge
þa on riht strenaþ; forþon Gode is swiþe leof þæt ge þa earmum
mannum syllon, & mid eowrum æhtum geearnian þæt ge þone ecan
gefean begytan motan, þe Drihten on is mid his halgum, & mid eallum þam
þe his bebodu healdan willaþ & gelæstan.
 298. Þæm Drihtne sy lof, & wuldor, & sibb, on ecnesse
in ealra worlda world, a buton ende.
 299. Amen.

HomS 15 (Belf 6)
B3.2.15.
Fourth Sunday in Lent: Belfour 1909, 50-58.



 1. <foreign>DOMINICA SECUNDA IN QUADRAGESSIMA</foreign> Men þa leofeste we
wyllæð her specan feawum wordum be þam ðrym þingun, þe allum
monnum beoð neodbehefe to witænne, & to habbenne; þæt is leafa,
& hiht, & lufe.
 4. Riht ileafæ is þæt mon ilyfe on Fæder & on Sune
& on Haligne Gast, þæt heo ne beon na ðreo Godæs, ac is an
Almihtig God, þe ðe sceop heofenæs, & eorðan, & sæ, &
allæ þa ðing ðe on þam bið.
 7. Þe hiht is þæt mon hopige to þam ecen life, & on
þam unasegendlice mede þe Drihten hæfð ihaten ælc þare ðe mid
gode willæ & mid gode dedæ his wille wurcæð her on worulde.
 10. Ðeo lufe is ðonne þridde; þæt is þæt we beon
ifulleD mid þare soþan lufe to Gode & to ure nextum; we sceolen symle
on ðissere lufe wuniæn, for þam ðe Iohannes þe fulluhtere cwæð
þæt God wunige on ðam þe ðas lufe hæfð, & he on Gode.
 13. Men, nu we iheræð ðæt God on us eardigæn wule,
& we on him, is us swiðe mycel ðearf þæt we us sylfe weorðe don
him to eardungstowe, & þæt we on him eardigan moten.
 16. Þurh ðas six þing sceal ælc cristene mon hine sylfne
gearwigan & clænsigæn, þæt he wyrðe beo þæt God on him
wunige.
 18. Þæt is andetnes, & dædbot, & halige weccæn,
ant festene, & gebedu, & ælmessededæ.
 19. Ðeo andetnes is to donne be allum þam synnum þe
ðurhtogene beoð, oððe on þance, oððe on spæce, oððe on
dæde.
 21. God wilnæð andetnesse, for ðam þe he wyle ure gultes
forgifæn.
 22. Ðeo andetnes us deþ, ægðer ge heo us hæleð, ge
heo us rihtwisæð; & eac heo sylþ us ure sunne forgifennesse.
 24. Al þære forgyfenesse tohopæ is on þare
andetnessæ; for þig we ne magon na hale wurðan on ðam toweardan life,
buton þurh andetnesse.
 26. Be þam cwæð Salomon, ðe þe bihyd his synnæ &
heom nele andetten, ne wurð he nefre ofer eorðan iriht; ac þe ðe his
synnæn andette & heom forlet, he bigyt Godes mildheortnesse &
forgifenesse.
 29. Æfter þare andetnesse mon sceal underfon dædbote.
 30. Be þære cwæð þe Hælend on his godspelle,
<foreign>Penitentiam agite, adpropinquabit enim regnum celorum</foreign>; þæt is on ure
ðeodum, Doþ dædbote, forþam ðe heofene rice neahlæcð.
 32. And Iohannes þe godspellere cwæð, Doþ swylce
westmæs swylce beon dædbote wurðe.
 34. He deþ ðonne þa wæstmæs þe beoð dædbote
wurðe, ðe þa idonæn gyltæs bewæpæð, ant heom eft ne
geætlæcæð.
 35. Swa hit on oðre stowe be þam icwæden is, <foreign>Ne adicias
peccatum super peccatum</foreign>; þæt is, Ne ecæ þu þa synne ofer synne.
 37. For þam þe mon þe ða synne edlæcð þe he ær
bette & geswikennesse behaten hæfde, ant hit is æfter bocenæ
sagum ilice geþeawod þam hunde þe æt þæt he ær speaw.
 40. Ure Drihten cwæð eft þurh Ysayam þone witegæ,
<foreign>Lauamini & mundi estote</foreign>; Aþweað eow & beoð clæne.
 40. Þe mon hine aðweahð ant bið clæne, þe ða
forðawitene gyltæs bewepæð & mid tearum aðweahð, & eft
ne ædlæchð þæt he ær beweop.
 42. & þe mon hine ðweahð & ne bið na clæne,
þe ðe bewepæð þa gultæs þe he ær dyde, & na þe raðor
ne forlætæð, ac æfter þam tearum þa ylcen synnæn edlæcð
þe he ær biweop.
 44. Eornostlice is to witenne þet þæt is soð dædbot
þe mon mid mycele stiðnesse deþ, & næfre æft þæt unriht ne
þurhtyhð þe he ær lufode.
 46. Nis na þeo dædbote be þare geare itæle idemed, ac bi
þare biternesse þæs modes.
 48. Forþam ðe God ne sceawæð þa loncsumnesse þare
tide, ac he gesmeað þa wilnunge & þa geornfulnesse þæs modes.
 49. Þeah ðe þenne hwylc mon beo swiðe synful, & arleas,
& unrihtwis, ne sceal he him tweonigæn þæt he ne mage Godes
mildheortnesse bigitæn, gif he wyle to dædbote cyrræn.
 52. Forþan ðe Godes mildheortnes helpð ælcne þare þe
on þisse life wyle dædbote don.
 53. & þa ðe her on life forhogiæð oððe
forscamiæð þæt heo nellæþ reowsunge don & heoræ gyltæs
bewepan, witodlice heo sceolon reowsiæn & wepæn on helle wite, þer
heo ne magen nane mildheortnesse geearniæn.
 56. Be þare stowe þe Hælend cwæð on þam godspelle,
<foreign>Ibi erit fletus & stridor dentium</foreign>, þer biþ eagene wop & toðane
grisbatung.
 58. & þer nan oðer þinc ne biþ isegen, buton edwit
& onrop.
 59. & þer ne bið nan oðer þing ihyrd, buten brune,
& chile, & þurst, & hungor, & alle earmþe swa fela swa nan
mon oðrum secgan ne mæg, þe deofle igearowedan beoð & his iferen,
þæt beoð þa ðe his larum her on life fuliæð & him to
ælcum unrihte gelæstæþ.
 63. Men, us is swiðe mycel to warnigenne wið þone ormeten
brogan þare ungeendedlicræ hellewitæ; & we sculon mid mucele
dædbote wið ure Drihten þingiæn þæt we moten þa wite forbugon
& to þam ece life bicumen.
 66. Nu þencð monig mon on his mode, þenne he þis
iheræð, Hwi sceal ic don mycele dædbote?
 68. Ic nabbe nænne healicne gylt idon.
 68. Ac ne cwæðe nan mon þæt, forþan þe nan mon ne
biþ swiðor biswicon þenne þe ðe hine sylfne selostne tællæð;
& eac we witan þæt we gyltæs wurcæð dæghwamlice, na
ðæt an mid ydele dedum, & eac mid ydele spece.
 72. Þonne þe Hælend be þam cwæð on þam godspelle,
<foreign>Omne ociosum uerbum quod locuti fuerint homines, reddent rationem de eo in die
iudicii</foreign>; þæt is on ure þeode, Bi ælc ydele worde þe men
specæð, heo sculen gylden gescead on domes dæge.
 75. Mid þare dædbote mon sceal lufian halige weccæn;
forþan þe ða wæstmæs ðe of þare weccæn cumæð
ahebbæð to heofenæn riche ðene þe heom lufiæð.
 78. Is eac monnum to witenne þæt ðæs monnes wæcce þe
wacæð for his oferfulle, ant for oferdrynce, & for unrihte ðance,
ant for unnytte spece, ant eac for monige oðrum unnyttum wordum, &
weorcum, nis to nane wæcce iteald; ac heo is iteald to deofles weorce.
 82. For þam ðe ðe deofol ne slæpæð næfre, ac a he
bið wacigende & syrwigende hu he moncun mage biswiken; swa swa þe
apostol be þam cwæð, <foreign>Circuit querens quem deuoret</foreign>; He cwæð
þæt he beo a farende & sæcende hwylcne he forswolegen mage.
 86. Ac us gedafenæð þæt we waciæn, swa swa þe
witegæ cwæð, <foreign>Media nocte surgebam ad confitendum tibi super iudicia
iusticie tue</foreign>; þæt is, on ure geþeoden, Drihten ic wæs arisende to
middere nihte to andettene ðe bi þine rihtwisnesse dom.
 89. Þonun us mynegæð þe Hælend on ðam godspelle his
leorningcnihtæs to wacigenne, & þus cwæð, <foreign>Beati serui illi quos
cum uenerit dominus inuenerit uigilantes</foreign>; He cwæþ, Eadige beoð þa
ðeowæs þe heoræ Drihten heom wacigende imet, þenne he cymæð;
for þam þe he heom set ofer alle his gode, þæt is ofer alle
neorcxnæwonges murhðe.
 94. And cwæð æft on oðrum stowum, <foreign>Vigilate ergo, quia
nescitis in qua hora dominus uester uenturus sit</foreign>; þæt is on ure
geþeodum.
 96. Wacigæð; forþam þe ge nyten on hwylcere tide eower
Drihten cymeð; hwæðer he cyme on efen, oððe on middere nihte,
oððe to hancrede, oððe on dægræde; þyg læs ðe he eow
slæpende finde, þenne he cymæð.
 99. Þenne is us mid þisse wæccan swiþe to smeagenne &
to leornigenne embe ure Drihtines bodu & ilomlice to biddenne; forþam
þe sanctus Paulus cwæð þæt þæt singale ibæd mycel fremode
mid Gode.
 102. Swa hwylc mon swa wyle symle mid Gode wuniæn, he sceal
ilomlice hine to Gode biddan, & ilomlice Godes æ smeagen.
 104. & þe þe reden cunne, þe ræde; þe þe nan ne
cunne he lyste þam redendan.
 105. Hwæt, we iheræð þet þa unrihtwisæn gitseræs
and reaferæs geond weorulde smealice acsiæð, ant eacc heoræ
scattæs syllæð, wið þan ðe him man cyðe hwanon heo magon
þa teorigendlican goldhord geeacniæn.
 108. & þonne heo hit mest igæderot habbæð, þonne
sceolen heo þurh sum ungelimp þisses lifes æll hit forlæten; &
heo his of þisse life nan þing mare mid heom ne lædæð, buton ða
synnæ, & ða ecæ nyþeruncgæ heom sylfum.
 112. Þonne is swiðe mycel ðearf þæt we ilomlice smeagen
& leorniæn hu we magen ure Drihtines bodum rihtest healdæn, & us
to him sælost biddan, for þam ðe we magon þurh ðæt us
gæderigen ðonne unateorigendlice goldhord, & þa ecan blisse mid Gode
& mid alle his halgum.
 116. Men, we sculon eac mid oðre godum dedum swiðe georne
fæsten lufigen, & hureþingæ on þas halgæn tid; forþam þe
hit adiglæð þa unðeawæs, & hit oferswyþ alle deofles
costungæ.
 119. Swa Hieronimus be þam cwæþ, þæt ðæt fæsten
aclænsige þæs monnes heortan & þone lichame; & hit
amydlæþ/ ða lahtræs, & hit awæcð þa halgan mægnu.
 121. Augustinus cwæð þæt þa halgan festen beoð
swyþe stronge flan ongean deofles costungæ, & heom mon swiðe raþe
ofercymæð mid þare forhæfdnesse.
 123. Þæt is to witænne, þæt ða festenu mid oðre
godum dedum beoð swiðe anfencge; & þæt fulfremede fæsten þe
idon biþ mid ælmesdedum & mid gebedum færæð to heofenum, &
hit bicymæð to Godes þrymsetle.
 126. Æræst heo yeð ða andweardan god; & heo
gegearuwæð þare synne forgifennesse; & heo gemonigfealdaþ þæs
monnes gear; & heo geweligæþ ðæs monnes mod; & heo tobræd
his gemæru; & heo clænsæþ alle his gyltæs.
 130. & heo alysæð hine from deaþe, & from ece wite;
& heo ascyræð hine from deoflæn, & heo þud hine to engle
werode.
 131. Þeo ælmes is ðreoræ cynne; an is lichamlic, þæt
mon þam þearfum sylle þæt to gode mage; & þa twa beoð
gastlice.
 133. Oþer is þæt mon forgife þam ðe wið him
agyltæð.
 134. Oþer þæt mon þone unwisæn & þone
dwelligendan þreage & hine to rihte wæge cyrre.
 135. Gif we þenne ðas six mægnu healdæþ & heom
geornlice lufigæþ, þone wunæþ God mid us, & we mid him, na
þæt an on þisse andwearde life, ac eac on þam toweardæn.
 138. Þær ne bið nan wiðerwinnæ, ne nan drefednesse, ne
nan unrotnes; ac þær habbæð alle halige fulfremede lufe &
fulfremedne wille mid Fæder, & mid Sunu, & mid ðam Halgum Gaste; a
on alræ woruldæ woruld a buton ende.
 141. AMEN.

HomS 16 (Ass 12)
B3.2.16.
Fifth Sunday in Lent: Assmann 1889, 144-50.



 2. Men ða leofestan, us is on ælcne sæl geornlice to
smeagenne and to hycgenne, hu we þurh haligra boca tæcunge ures drihtnes
willan mid godum dædum and mid halgum mægenum gefyllan magon and huru on
ðisse halgan tide, þe eallum mannum to hreowsunge and to dædbote geset
is.
 5. Us is ðonne swiðe gedafenlic, þæt we gelomlice ure
circan secan and ðær mid micelre eadmodnysse and stilnysse us to urum
drihtne gebiddan and godes word gehyran.
 8. And se ðe on oðrum ðingum abisgad sy oððe to ðam
ungehænde, þæt he dæghwamlice his circan gesecan ne mæge, he huru
ðinga on ðam sunnandagum and on oðrum freolsdagum þider cume to his
uhtsange and to mæssan and to æfensange and na to nanum idelum geflite,
ne to nanum woruldlicum spræcum, ac to ðam anum, þæt he his synna
gode andette and hira forgifnysse bidde and ðære halgan þenunge mid
micclum godes ege gehlyste.
 14. And siððan mid ælmæsdædum gange him to his
gereorde and mid micelre syfernysse and gemetfæstnysse his goda bruce and na
mid nanre oferfylle, ne mid oferdrince, forði ðe Cristenum men nis nan
ðing wyrse, ðonne druncenscipe.
 18. Men ða leofestan, we willað eow warnian and us sylfe alysan
mid gode and ælcne ðæra læran, ðe us hyrcnyan wile, þæt hi
fram ðam unþeawe gecyrran and hi sylfe mid syfernysse healden.
 21. Þonne is manna gehwilcum to witanne, þæt ælc
ðæra manna, ðe ðæne deofollican unðeaw hæfð, þæt he
wile on his gebeorscipe þurh his halsunge and ðurh his neadunge gedon,
þæt oðre men nimað mare, ðonne hit gemet sy, sceolon agildan gescead
gode ægðer ge be him silfum, ge be eallum ðam þe hi to ðam
geneadiað.
 26. Besceawigen nu ða druncengeornan, þæt hi synt micele
mættran, ðonne nytenu, ðonne ða nytenu nellað nan ðing mare
drincan, ðonne him ðearf bið, and se earma man wile drincan ðreo swa
feala, ge feower swa feala, swa his nead wære.
 29. And he eac on anum dæge mid ungesceade and mid micelre synne
forspilð þreora daga oððe feowera andlifene, and þæt nære na to
agitenne, ðeah seo andlifen forspilled wurde, gif ða men for gode ne
forwurdon.
 33. Us is to witanne, men ða leofestan, þæt gif ða
druncengeornan men heora druncennyssa geswican nellað and micele dædbote
don, ac þurhwuniað on ðam oferdrincum æt heora ende, hi næfre mid
gode nane reste ne begytað on ðam toweardan life, ac hi buton ælcere
tweonunge sceolon on ecnysse forwurðan, forðan hit ne mæg na beon leas,
þæt Paulus se apostol cwæð: <foreign>Neque ebriosi regnum Dei possidebunt</foreign>;
þæt is on urum geðeode, þæt næfre druncengeorne nagon godes
rice.
 40. Ðonne cwyð Sanctus Agustinus: Toforan eallum oðrum
ðingum ic eow bidde and ðurh þæne ondrædendlican domes dæg is
eow halsige, þæt, swa oft swa ge eow gemænelice gebeorscipas
gegearwiað, ge ða fatu ðæs micclan gemetes, ðe þreo men oððe
feower.
 44. And eac hi hwilum beoð buton ælcum gemete, hwilum willes,
hwilum geneadode gewuniað of to drincanne, of eowrum gebeorscipe awurpað
eall swa attor, forðan ðe se ungesælige gewuna belaf of hæðenra
manna biggenge.
 47. And swa hwylc man swa ðis geðafað, oððe on his agenum
gebeorscipe, oððe on oðres mannes, ne tweonige he na, þæt he ne
offrað deofle, forðan ðe þurh ðisne drync beoð ægðær ge
ða sawle ofslagene, ge ða lichaman gewanhalode.
 51. He bytt eft on oðre stowe, þæt manna gehwylc besceawige
mid him sylfum, hu hefig synn seo druncennys is and hu feala unðeawa heo on
ðam men gebringð, and þæt nan man ne geðafige, þæt he ðære
druncennysse oferswiðed wurde.
 54. Ðonne ða druncengeornan, na þæt an, þæt hi on
ðam toweardan life mid ecum tintregum tocwylmede synt, ac eac hy synt on
ðisum andweardan life mid mænigfealdum untrumnyssum gewæhte.
 57. And ðas ðing he sægð na þæt an læwædum
mannum, ac eac gehadedum, forðan ðe hit is ðe wyrse, þe manega
preostas, ðe synt þære micclan endebyrdnysse, þæt hi sceolon
oðrum mannum ðære syfernysse god bodian, nabbað naðer ne ða sceame
for mannum, ne ðæne ege for gode, þæt hi hit sylfe ærest ne don,
and eac oðre swa feala, swa hi mæst mægon, oferdrenceað.
 63. Ac witan ða men, þe ðyllice synt, gif hi nellað hi
sylfe gebetan, þæt hi sceolon nede ðolian ece susle ge for him sylfum,
ge for eallum ðam þe hi ðærto tyhtað.
 66. And he cwyð eft: Eala, hu earm and hu bewependlic is
þæra manna lif, þe ofer þæt riht, þe eallum mannum gemetlice
geðenud bið, onginnað, swilce hi nicumene syn and swilce hi ealles
dæges ær nahtes ne onbirigdon and þurh mistlice naman mare drincað,
þonne him neodþearf sy.
 70. Na þæt an ðurh libbendra manna naman, ac eac þurh
engla and haligra manna, wenað, þæt hi him micelne wurðscipe mid ðam
gegearwian, gif hi hio sylfe mid swiðlicre druncennysse oferlecgað, and
nyton, þæt nane men ne doð halgum englum and halegum mannum swa hefigne
teonan, swa ða ðe on heora naman hira agene sawle ðurh oferdrinc
ofsleað.
 75. Men ða leofestan, us is swiðe micel ðearf, þæt we
eadmodlice hyrcnian ðysum eadigan lareowum and ðysum halgum bocum and us
sylfe forhabban fram þisum unðeawe, forðan ðe þa ðe hira bebodu
lustlice gehyran willað and getreowlice gefyllað, hi habbað ece mede mid
gode and mid his halgum.
 80. And ða ðe hit forhicgað and hit don nellað, hi habbað
ece susle mid deofle and mid his englum.
 81. Men ða leofestan, we mynegiað eac ælcne getreowfulne
man, þæt he gelomlice lufige cumliðnysse and nanum cuman ne forbeode,
þæt he ne mote on his huse gerestan, forðan ðe manega gode gelicodon
þurh þæt, þæt hi cuman onfengon and him arwurðlice þenodon.
 85. And ure drihten is to cweðenne, þonne he to ðam dome
cymð: <foreign>Hospes eram et suscepistis me</foreign>; þæt is on urum geðeode: Ic
wæs cuma and ge onfengon me.
 88. Witon ðonne ða ðe cumliðnysse geornlice for godes lufan
begað, þæt hi Crist sylfne on ðam cuman onfoð.
 89. Ælcum geleaffullum men is eac swiðe to warnigenne wið
manaða, forðan ðe hi synt swiðe forbodene ægðer ge on ðære
ealdan æ, ge on ðam godspelle.
 92. Manega men tellað to lytlum gylte, þæt hi oðre men mid
manaðum beswicen, ac witun hi, þæt hi beoð eal swa miceles wites
scyldige, swa ða manslagan and ða unrihthæmeras and ða oferdrinceras.
 95. Eac is manna gehwilcum þearf, þæt he hine forhæbbe
fram leasum cyðnyssum, forðam hit is swiðe hefig gylt and fram urum
drihtne sylfum forboden, ða he wið Moysen spræc on ðære dune, þe
man hæt Sinai, and ðus cwæð: <foreign>Non falsum testimonium dices</foreign>; þæt
is: Ne sæge ðu na lease cyðnysse.
 99. And Salomon cwæð, þæt leasa gewita ne sceolde beon
ungewitnod, and swa hwilc man swa sægð leasunga on his nehstan, his
leohtfet bið acwænced on ðam ytemestan dæge.
 102. And se ðe þæt soð wat and hit for æniges
woruldlices mannes ege forsugað, he gecigð godes yrre ofer hine.
 104. Ægðer is ðonne scyldig wið god ge se ðe þæt
soð bediglað, ge se ðe ða leasunga sægð, forðan ðe se ðe
ða leasunga sægð, wile derian, and se ðe þæt soð wat, nele
fremian.
 106. On feower wisan bið rihtwisnys on dome forhwyrfed: for ege
and for gytsunge and for hatunga and for lufe.
 108. Ðonne bið seo rihtwisnys ðurh ege forhwyrfed, þonne se
dema forhtað for æniges anwealdes þingum, þæt he na dear soð
asecgan and riht gedeman.
 110. Hio bið forhwyrfed for gytsunge, þonne þæs deman
heorte bið mid sumere mede ablend and eac forðan þe he wile ðæne
unscyldigan a woh bereafian.
 113. Heo bið eac forhwyrfed for hatunge, ðonne se dema
gewilnað, þæt he wile ðam unscyldigan for sumum oðrum þinge
derigan.
 115. Bið seo rihtwisnys þurh lufe forhwyrfed, þonne se dema
bewereð his freond and his magas ongean riht and ða fremdan mid unrihte
bereafað.
 117. Mid þisum feower ðingum bið rihtwisnys oftust on dome
forhwyrfed and unscyldige men gederede.
 118. And miccle swiður synt to bemænenne þa ðe þa earman
ofðricceað mid unrihte, þonne þa ðe þæne teonan þoliað,
forðan ðe þa ðe þæne teonan þoliað, geendiað hredlice þa
hwilwendlican yrmðe, ac ða þe hi mid unrihte bereafiað, beoð
betæhte ecum ligeum.
 122. Witun ðonne þa ðe ðyllicne gylt þurhteoð, þæt
hi synt mid þære ilcan dædbote to clænsigenne, þe ða manslagan
and þa unrihthæmeras and ða oferdrinceras and þa manswaran.
 125. Þæt is þæt hi sceolon seofon gear mid micelre
angsumnysse hreowsian oððe hi man sceal ut of godes circan anydan and fram
ealra getrywfulra manna gemanan awurpan.
 127. Be ðisum þinge cwæð se hælend on ðam godspelle:
<foreign>Quid prodest homini, si universum mundum lucretur, animæ vero suæ
detrimentum patiatur</foreign>; þæt is on urum geðeode: Hwæt fremað þam
men, þeah ðe he ealne middaneard gestryne, and his sawul þolige ece
forwyrd?
 131. Witodlice þa men, þe ðyllice gyltas doð, þeah hi
fram oðrum mannum syn geðuhte arfæste, hi synt him sylfum swiðe
wælhreowe, þonne hi nellað heora earman sawle gehelpan, þe sceal on
ðam ungeændudan witum ealle þas unrihtan dæda þolian.
 135. Men, us is swiðe þearle to efstanne, þæt we ure lif
and ure þeawas gebeterian and þæt we bewepan, þæt we ær to yfele
gedydon, and ofer þis ðære syngunge geswican, forðan ðe god ne
besceawað na, hwilce we ær wæron, ac he besceawað, hwilce we beon,
þonne we dælan sceolon sawle and lichaman.
 140. Þæt is to witanne, þæt god ne secð na þæs
godan weorces angin, ac he secð þæne ænde, forðan ðe ælc man
sceal beon demed be ðam geearnungum, þe he hæfð, þonne he of ðisum
life hwyrfan sceal.
 143. Sume men onginnað god to donne, ac hi hit endiað yfele,
swa Iudas dyde.
 144. He wæs ærest apostol and syððan he sealde urne
drihten to cwale and on ænde hine sylfne on grine aheng.
 146. And sume men onginnað yfel to donne, ac hi hit geendiað
wel, swa Paulus dyde.
 147. He wæs ærest godes circena ehtere and syððan he
wæs bodigend and acoren lareow.
 148. Þæt is ðæs godan weorces mægen, þæt man
þæron ðurhwunige æt his ende, swa ure drihten on ðam godspelle
cwyð: <foreign>Qui perseveraverit usque in finem, hic salvus erit</foreign>; He cwæð,
þæt se beo hal on ðam toweardan life, þe her ðurhwunað on godum
dædum.
 152. Gif we god beginnað and we on ðam þurhwuniað æt
urum ende, þonne licað gode ure drohtnung.
 154. Efste þonne ælc man, þæt he anrædlice
gefulfremige þa god, þe he beginne, þæt he þurh þæt geearnige,
þæt he onfo þære ecan mede on heofonan rice.
 156. Þa us gegearwige se drihten, þe mid fæder and mid sunu
and mid þam halgum gaste leofað and rixað on ecnysse a buton ende.
 158. Amen.

HomS 17 (BlHom 5)
B3.2.17.
Fifth Sunday in Lent: Morris 1874-80, 55-65.



 1. <foreign>DOMINICA V IN QUADRAGESIMA</foreign>.
 1. Her segþ hu se æþela lareow wæs sprecende; he
cwæþ, Men þa leofestan, ærest us gedafenaþ þæt we gehyron þa
word haligra gewreota, & syþan æfter þon ful medomne wæstm agifan
& agildan.
 4. Hu nyt bið þæm men þeh he geornlice gehyre þa word
þæs halgan godspelles, gif he þa nel on his heortan habban &
healdan, gif þeh se wyrtruma þære halgan gesegene of his heortan biþ
alocen & onweg anumen?
 7. Hu mæg he gastlicne wæstm þonne habban & healdan,
gif he ne wile hine him to Gode gelyfan, & mid inneweardre heortan gemunan
& geþencan hu Dauid se sealmsceop ongan smeagan & þencan, hwylce
þæs godan mannes weorc & his dæda wæron.
 11. & he forþon þus cwæþ: Se mon se þa
soþfæstnesse mid his muþe sprecþ, & hie on his heortan georne
geþencþ, gelæsteþ, & he afylleþ þa inwitfullan word of his
tungan, þæt beoþ þa men þa þe Godes rices geleafan habbað &
healdaþ; forþon hi noldan heora nehstan beswican þurh þa facenfullan
word.
 17. Maniges mannes wise bið þæt he wile symle to his nehstan
sprecan þa word þe he wenþ þæt him leofoste syn to gehyrenne, &
þonne hwæþere þencþ hu he hine eþelicost beswican mæge þurh
þa swetnesse þara worda.
 20. Deofles wise bið þæt he wile symle þone unwaran man
beswican þurh þa swetnesse þara synna, & eft he wile hit him mid
grimnesse & mid yfele eall forgyldan.
 23. Manige men beoþ þe þa word þære halgan gesægene
lustlice gehyraþ, & þeah hrædlice hie forgytaþ þæt hie hwene
ær ymbhygdigum earum & ingeþancum gehyrdon reccean & secggan.
 26. Forþon hie gastlicne wæstm ne beraþ, ne mid him
nabbað; forþon þe þæt halige sæd on him gedwan & gewat,
þæt him ær of þæs lareowes muþe wæs bodad & sægd;
forþon seo gehyrnes & seo geornnes ne bið nyt on þæm ungelyfdum
mannum, & on þæm gymeleasum; swa Dauid se sealmsceop cweþende
wæs.
 31. Manige men beoð þe beforan oþrum mannum hwæt hugu god
begangaþ, & raþe hie hit anforlætaþ; forþon þe Crist sylfa
cwæþ þæt he nelle gehyran þæs gimeleasan, & þæs
forgytenan mannes gebedrædene.
 35. Ne þæt to nahte nyt ne biþ þæt man godne mete ete
oþþe þæt betste win on gebeorscipe drince, gif þæt gelimpeþ
þæt he hit eft spiwende anforlæteþ, þæt he ær to blisse nam
& to lichoman nyttnesse.
 38. Swa we þonne þa gastlican lare unwærlice ne sceolan
anforlætan, þe ure saul big leofaþ & feded bið; swa se lichoma
buton mete & drence leofian ne mæg, swa þonne seo saul, gif heo ne
bið mid Godes worde feded gastlice hungre & þurste heo bið cwelmed.
 42. Forþon myccle swiðor we sceolan þencan be þæm
gastlicum þingum þonne be þæm lichomlicum.
 44. Se lichoma on þisse worlde þingum gewiteþ, swa þonne
seo saul mid gastlicum þingum on ecnesse leofaþ; seo eft onfehþ hire
lichoman on þæm ytmestan dæge, & mid þæm sceal beon riht
agyldende for ealles þæs lichoman dædum.
 48. Manige men beoð heardre heortan þe þa godcundan lare
gehyraþ, & him mon þa oft bodaþ & sægþ, & hi hi þonne
agimeleasiað; þa þonne eft nænige lade gedon ne magon on þon
bifigendan domes dæge, ah sceolon þonne mid deoflum in ece wite
gefeallan.
 52. Forþon began we ure mod from þære lufan þisse worlde
synlustum & gitsungum, þe læs us þisse worlde lufu aþeode from
þære lufe þæs ecan lifes, & þæs ecan leohtes þe God mid
his halgum on heofenum on wunaþ, & mid eallum þæm saulum þe her on
worlde mid rihte to Gode gecyrraþ, & heora synna mid hluttre mode
geondettaþ, & wiþ Gode gebetaþ.
 57. Hwæt we witon þæt ælc wlite & ælc fægernes
to ende efsteþ & onetteþ þisse weorlde lifes; forþon se lichoma
ealdaþ & his fægernes gewiteþ & on dust bið eft gecyrred, swa
þonne se wlite & seo fægernes þære saule þe on ecnesse wunaþ
on heofena rices gefean, & þær mid Criste blisseþ & scineþ.
 62. Forþon, men þa leofestan, ic eow bidde & halsige
þæt anra manna gehwylc sceawige hine sylfne on his heortan, swigende
mode, hwylc se deadlica lichama biþ, þonne seo saul of bið, & seo
fægernes þe he her on worlde lufade, swylc þes blowenda wudu & þas
blowendan wyrta.
 66. We witon þæt Crist sylfa cwæþ þurh his sylfes
muþ, þonne ge geseoþ growende & blowende ealle eorþan wæstmas,
& þa swetan stencas gestincað þara wuduwyrta, þa sona eft
adrugiaþ & forþ gewitaþ for þæs sumores hæton.
 70. Swa þonne gelice bið þære menniscan gecynde þæs
lichoman, þonne se geogoþhad ærest bloweþ & fægerost bið, he
þonne raþe se wlite eft gewiteþ & to ylde gecyrreþ, & he
þonne siþþon mid sare geswenced bið, mid mislicum ecum &
tyddernessum.
 74. & eal se lichoma geunlustaþ þa geogoðlustas to
fremmenne þa þe he ær hatheortlice lufode, & him swete wæron to
aræfnenne.
 76. Hie him þonne eft swiþe bitere þencaþ, æfter þon
þe se deað him tocymeþ Godes dom to abeodenne.
 78. Se lichoma þonne on þone heardestan stenc & on þone
fulostan bið gecyrred, & his eagan þonne beoþ betynde, & his
muþ & his næsþyrlo beoþ belocene, & he þonne se deada byð
uneaþe ælcon men on neaweste to hæbbenne.
 81. Hwær bið la þonne se idla lust, & seo swetnes
þæs hæmedþinges þe he ær hatheortlice lufode?
 83. Hwær beoþ þonne þa symbelnessa, & þa idelnessa,
& þa ungemetlican hleahtras, & se leasa gylp, & ealle þa idlan
word þe he ær unrihtlice ut forlet?
 85. Ealle þa gewitaþ swa swa wolcn, & swa swa wæteres
stream, & ofer þæt nahwær eft ne æteowaþ.
 87. Þyllic bið se ende þæs lichoman fægernesse, þe nu
dysige men & unwise swiþe lufiaþ.
 88. Forþon hi ne besceawiaþ no hu late hi on þysne
middangeard acennede wurdon, & hu raþe hi him eft of gewitan sceolan,
& on hwylcum sare hi acennede fram medder wærun, & on hwylcum
geswince hie eft lifiaþ, & hu þes middangeard daga gehwylce fealleþ
& to ende efsteþ.
 93. Hwæt is þæt lif elles þysses middangeardes buton
lytelu ylding þæs deaþes?
 94. Eal swylce seo lange mettrumnes biþ þæs seocan mannes,
þonne hine god forlætan nele eþelice lifian, ne he þeah swyltan ne
mote, & swa þeah hwæþere oþ þone deaþ he hine tintregaþ,
swylc is þæt lif þysses middangeardes.
 97. Swyþe soþlice we magon geþencan þæt hit biþ
deaþes ylding, swiþor þonne lifes.
 99. Hwylc man is þæt mæge ariman ealle þa sar & þa
brocu þe se man to gesceapen is?
 100. On synne he bið geeacnod, & on his modor sare he bið
acenned, on hungre, & on þurste, & on cyle he bið afeded, on
gewinne & on swate he leofaþ, on wope & on unrotnesse & on sare
his lichoma sceal her wunian.
 103. & þonne se synnfulla on þæm helle fyre cwicsusle
his lif geendaþ.
 104. Wa biþ þonne þæm mannum þe ne ongytaþ þisse
worlde yrmþa, þe hie to gesceapene beoþ, & hie nellaþ gemunan
þone dæg heora forþfore, ne þone bifgendan domes dæg, ne hie ne
gelyfaþ on þæt ece wuldor þæs heofenlican rices.
 108. Ne hie ne ongytaþ þæt hi on fruman to Godes hiwunga
gesceapene wæron, & eac to þon ecan life, næs na to þon ecan
deaþe.
 110. & hie ne besceawiaþ þætte a seo duru þæs
heofonlican rices biþ ontyned þæm rihtgelyfendum monnum & þæm
riht dondum; & eac swa heo biþ belocen þæm synnfullum mannum &
þæm unrihtwyrcendum.
 113. & hie na ne besceawiaþ þæt se gifra helle bið a
open deoflum & þæm mannum þe nu be his larum lifiaþ, þæt
beoð, myrþran, & manswaran, & þa þe wohhæmed nu begangaþ
mid oþerra ceorla wifum, & mid þæm mannum þe beoþ Criste to
brydum gehalgode, seoþþan hi mon mid þæm halgan wrigelse bewrihþ.
 118. Sægd is þæt se ilca wiþerwearda þe him ær þa
synna lærde, þæt se hi mote eft mid mycclum witum witnian, buton hie
hit ær gebeton willon; þonne cwæþ se æþela lareow þæt hi
mihton mid fæstenum, & mid gebedum, & mid teara gytum, ealne deofles
willan oforswiþan.
 123. On helle beoþ þeofas, & flyteras, & gitseras þe
on mannum heora æhta on woh nimaþ, & þa oformodan men, & þa
scinlæcan þa þe galdorcræftas & gedwolan begangaþ, & mid
þæm unwære men beswicaþ & adwellaþ, & hi aweniaþ from
Godes gemynde mid heora scinlacum, & gedwolcræftum; þær beoþ eac
yfele gerefan þa þe nu on woh demaþ, & rihte domas soþfæstra
manna onwendaþ, þa þe ær rihtlice gesette wæron.
 130. Be þæm demum Crist sylf wæs sprecende; he cwæþ,
Deme ge nu, swa swa ge willon þæt eow sy eft gedemed on þon ytmæstan
dæge þisse worlde.
 132. Cuþlice se yfela dema onfehþ medmycclum feo, &
onwendeþ þone rihtan dom for þæs feos lufon.
 134. Sægd is þonne þæt he onfo þære ecan
genyþerunga mid deoflum; forþon þe he ær on þissum middangearde his
willan worhte, & þonne sceal on ecum witum wunan abuton ende.
 136. Þær he hæfþ weallendene leg, & hwilum cyle
þone grimmestan, eal sar & sace, hungor & þurst, wop & hream,
& weana ma þonne æniges mannes gemet sy þæt hie ariman mæge.
 139. Ne þearf he þær næfre leohtes wenan, ne þæs
freondes þe hine æfre of þæs grimman deofles gewealdum alesan
mæge; for þæm gewinne þe he ær wiþ God wan & godes boca lare
gelyfan nolde.
 142. Forþon, men þa leofestan, us is mycel þearf to witenne
þæt Iudas nu is cwylmed mid deoflum on þæm ecum witum; forþon þe
he Crist bebohte for feos lufon; swa þonne nu mid him byrnan sceolan þa
þe heora sylfra saula forhycggaþ for feos lufan, & unrihtgestreon
lufiaþ.
 147. Hi habbaþ demena naman, & sceaþena dæda; forþon
hi beoþ betuh him sylfum slitende wulfas, þonne hie for feos lufan earmne
fordemaþ buton scylde.
 149. Him wæs mid rihte beboden þæt hi sceoldan symle
þæm unriht dondum mid grimnesse steran, þeofum, & manswarum, &
unrihthæmendum, & þæm mannum þe gedwolcræftas begangaþ,
& þæs geswican nellaþ; þam mannum sceolan þa deman grimlice
styran.
 153. Nis þæt no be eallum demum gelice to secggenne; forþon
þe sume myccle swiþor rihtaþ Godes folc þonne hie reafian earme &
unscyldige, & hie demaþ heora domas mid Godes ege, & mid his haligra,
swiþor myccle þonne for feos lufan; & hie gescyldaþ þa unscyldigan,
& þa scyldigan þearlwislice demaþ.
 158. Þa deman beoþ swiþor to herigenne þonne to leanne;
forþon hi willaþ styran þæm ungelyfedum mannum þa þe nu
unwærlice & gemeleaslice Gode hyraþ.
 161. Þa deman beoþ on Godes fultome æghwær, ge þæt
hie him selfum heora synna bebeorgaþ, ge eac oþre syngiende rihtaþ.
 163. Forþon on domes dæg hi beoþ from Gode þysne cwide
geherende þe he cwiþ: þu goda þeow, & þu getreowfulla, ga þu nu
on þone ecan gefean þæs heofonlican þrymmes, þe þu ær on worlde
mid geleafan to me & to minum halgum, mid rihtum ondgite geearnodest.
 167. Þonne sceal ure anra gehwylc beran his dæda beforan
Cristes heahsettle, & ealra his haligra, & þonne we sceolan riht
agyldan for ealles ures lifes dædum þe we æfre ær geworhtan on
þisse worlde; forþon us syndon nu to bebeorhgenne þa myccllan synna,
þæt we þe eþelicor þa medmycclan gebetan magon.
 172. Manige men wenaþ þæt morþor sy seo mæste synne.
 173. Ac us is to witenne þæt þreora cynna syndon morþras,
þæt is þonne þæt ærest, þæt man to oþrum læþþe
hæbbe, & hine hatige, & tæle behindan him sylfum; forþon seo
synn biþ swiþe mycel þæt man oþerne hatige & tæle; sægd is
þæt hit sy wyrtruma ealra oþerra synna.
 177. Swiþe seldon ænig man wile beon andetta þæt he
æfestig sy, oþþe tælend.
 178. Se mon se þe oþerne acwelþ, & instæpes hine
sylfne ongyteþ, þæt he mycel man & myccle synne gedon hæbbe,
monige men þonne oft to dædbote & to andetnesse gecyrraþ, & him
forgifenesse æt urum Drihtne abiddaþ; forþon nis nan tweo þæt he
forgifnesse syllan nelle þam þe hie geearnian willaþ.
 183. Witodlice þa æfstigan men, & þa tælendan, þeh
hi syn þæs morþres scyldige, hi hit him to nanre synne ne gelyfaþ.
 185. Þa æfstigan, þeah hi syn deaþes scyldige, hie heora
scylda ne ongytaþ; forþon þe hie næfre forgifenesse æt Gode ne
biddaþ.
 187. Þeo deaþberende uncyst us is eallum to onscunienne, þe
læs hi us besencean on helle grund.
 188. Cuþlice þæt wuldor þysses middangeardes is sceort
& gewitende; Drihtnes wuldor þonne, & his rice þurhwunaþ on
ecnesse.
 190. Þær is þæt ece leoht buton þeostrum, þær is
geogoþ buton ylde, þær is þæt æþele lif buton geendunge,
þær is gefea buton unrotnesse.
 192. Ne biþ þær hungor, ne þurst, ne wind, ne gewenn, ne
wætres sweg, ne þær ne bið leofra gedal, ne laþra gesamnung.
 194. Ac þær biþ seo ece ræste, & haligra symbelnes
þær þurhwunaþ.
 195. Þær is þæt unasecggenlice rice þe God syleþ
eallum ðæm þe hine lufian willaþ.
 196. Lufian we hine þonne mid eallre ure heortan megolnesse,
þonne lufaþ he us on heofenum mid eallum his halgum.
 198. A to widan feore sy urum Drihtne lof, & wuldor, &
weorþmynd, abuton ende, on ecnesse; Amen.

B3.2.18.3.
Palm Sunday: Dictionary of Old English transcript, edited from Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Bodley 340.



 1. <foreign>Dominica ramis palmarum Passio domini nostri iesu cristi
secundum matheum</foreign> Men ða leofestan þis is ures drihtnes þrowung
hælendes Cristes æfter Matheus gerecednysse.
 3. He cwæð, se hælend, to his þegnum, Witað ge þæt
æfter twegra daga fæce Eastron geweorðað, and mannes sunu bið
geseald þæt he si ahangen.
 5. Þa wæron gegaderode þa witan on ðone cafertun þæs
ealdormannes, se wæs gecweden Caiphas, and hi þær geðeaht worhton
þæt hi woldon þone hælend mid facne beswican and offslean.
 9. Hi cwædon þæt hi noldon on ðam symbeldæge þæt
don/, þy læs þæt folc onstyred wurde.
 10. Þa wæs se hælend on Bethania on Simones huse þæs
licþroweres, þa eode an wif to him and hæfde an elefæt mid swiðe
deorwurðne smyringe, and heo hit geat ofer his heafod.
 13. Þa gesawon þæt his þegnas, and hi wæron swiðe
yrre, and hi cwædon, Hwæt; þeos forswellednys mihte beon wið feo
geseald and þearfum gedæled.
 16. Þa cwæð se hælend to heom, To hwan yrsige ge wið
þis wif?
 17. Soðlice god weorc heo wæs wyrcende on me.
 18. Þearfan ge habbað symle mid eow, ac witodlice ne hæbbe
ge me mid eow.
 19. And þeos smyring sceal beon mid minum lichaman, on minre
byrigenne.
 21. And soðlice swa hwær swa þis Godspel bið gebodod on
eallum middanearde, þær bið gesæd hire gemynd.
 23. Þa eode an of ðam twelf apostolum se wæs gecweden Iudas
Scarioð, and cwæð to ðam ealdormannum and to ðam witum, Hwæt
wille ge me sellan and ic eow selle þone hælend?
 26. Þa cwædon hi þæt hi woldon him sellan þrittig
seolfer sticca, and he ða sohte forð hu he hine beswican mihte.
 28. Þa cwædon þa þegnas to ðam hælende, Hwær wilt
þu þæt we gegearwian þe þas Eastron?
 30. Þa cwæð se hælend, Gað in ðas ceastre to ðam
men, and secgað him þæt ic wille wyrcan þas Eastron mid him mid minum
þegnum.
 32. Þa dydon þa þegnas swa him se hælend bebead, and
gegearwodon him þær þa Eastron.
 34. Þa soðlice wæs geworden on æfen þæt se hælend
sæt æt his gereordum, and him to cwæð, Soðlice ic eow secge
þæt eower an me is belæwende to deaðe.
 37. Þa wurdon hi ealle swiðe geunrotsode and heora ælc
cwæð, Cwyst þu eom ic hit drihten?
 38. He him andswarode and cwæð, Se ðe his hand deð on
minan disce se me seleð, and witodlice hit gegæð be him swa swa hit
awriten is.
 41. Soðlice þeah hwære þa þam menn þe þurh hine
mannes sunu bið geseald.
 42. Betere him wære þæt he næfre mann acenned næ
wære.
 43. Þa andswarode him Iudas þe hine sealde, and cwæð,
Cwyst þu eom ic hit drihten?
 45. Þa cwæð se hælend, þæt þu cwæde.
 45. Þa genam se hælend hlaf and hine bletsode and bræc and
sealde his þegnum, and cwæð to heom, Onfoð þis and þicgað, þis
is min lichama.
 48. And he onfeng calice and hine bletsode and Gode þancas dyde
and sealde his þegnum, and cwæð, Drincað of ðysum ealle, soðlice,
þis is min blod to ðære niwan gecyðnysse, þæt for mannum bið
agoten on forgifnysse synna.
 52. Soðlice ic eow secge, ne drince ic heononforð of ðysum
wincynne ær on ðam dæge þe ic eft drince mid eow niwe win on mines
fæderrice.
 55. And þa mid lofsangum gecwedenum, hio eodon on ðære dune
Oliueti, and þa cwæð se hælend to him, Ealle ge me æswice
geræfniað on ðysse nihte.
 57. Swa hit awriten is, swilce man ofslea þone hyrde þonne
beoð þa sceap to scacene, and æfter þam þe ic arise ic eow to cume
on Galilea þære mægðe.
 60. Þa cwæð Petrus to him, þeah ðe hi ðe ealle swicen
næfre ic þe ne swice.
 62. Þa cwæð se hælend to him, Soð is þæt ic secge
þæt on ðisse nihte ær ðan se hana singeð þriwe þu me
wiðsæst.
 64. Þa cwæð Petrus, ær ðan ic swelte mid þe, ær ic
þe aswice.
 65. Gelice ealle þa þegnas þæt ilce cwædon.
 66. Þa com se hælend mid heom on ðone tun se is gecweden
Gezamani.
 67. Þa cwæð he to his þegnum, Sittað her oð ðæt
ic gange þider and ic me þær gebidde.
 67. And hi wæron swiðe geunrotsode.
 68. Þa cwæð se hælend to heom, Unrot is min sawul oð
deað.
 70. Onbidað her and waciað mid me.
 70. And he eode and hine gebæd and com eft to his þegnum, and
gemette hi slæpende and cwæð to Petre, Hwi ne mihton ge ane tid wacian
mid me?
 73. Waciað, and gebiddað eow þæt ge ne gangan on
costunga.
 74. Witodlice in gast fus, and min flæsc untrum.
 75. And eft he eode and hine gebæd, and com eft, and gemette hi
slæpende, and heora eagan wæron swiðe gehefegode, and he þa
þriddan siðe eode and hine gebæd, and þa com eft to his þegnum, and
cwæð, Slæpe ge nu eallunga and restað eow.
 79. Nu to genealæceð seo tid þæt mannes sunu bið
geseald on synfulra handa.
 80. Arisað and uton gangan nu to genealæcað se ðe me
selleð.
 81. Þa com Iudas se ðe hine sealde, and mid him com micel
mænigo mid sweordum and mid stengum fram þam ealdormannum asende.
 84. Þa cwæð Iudas Scarioð læwend, Swa hwylcne swa ic
cysse nimað þone.
 85. And sona he eode to ðam hælende, and cwæð, Wes þu
hal lareow?
 86. And hine cyste.
 86. Þa cwæð se hælend to him, þu freond, to hwan come
þu?
 87. Hi ða eodon to ðam hælende, and hine bundon.
 88. Þa Petrus ut abræd his sweord and sloh Malchus þone
þeow, and his eare of asloh.
 89. Þa cwæð se hælend to him, Gecyr þin swurd on his
scæðe.
 91. Soðlice ealle þa ðe onfoð sweord mid sweorde hi
forwurðað.
 92. Ac hwi ne wenst þu þæt ic ne mihte biddan minne fæder
þæt he me gegearwode ma þonne twelf þusenda weroda engla on fultum to
gefeohte.
 95. Þa cwæð se hælend to ðam mænigum, Nu ge comon
mid sweordum and mid stencgum and me gegripon, and dæghwamlice mid eow ic
sæt and lærde eow on minum temple and ge me ne namon.
 98. Ac soðlice þis is eall geworden þætte wæron
gefyllede þa gewritu þæra witegena.
 100. Þa þegnas þa ealle forleton þone hælend and him
fram flugon, and hi ða læddon þone hælend gebundenne to Caiphan þam
ealdormenn and þam witum.
 102. And Petrus wæs feorran fyligende oð ðone cafertun, and
þær æt ðam gate gesæt mid ðam þegnum þæt he wolde geseon
þone ende.
 105. And hi ða sohton ealle lease gecyðnyssa ongean þone
hælend þæt hio hine to deaðe gesealdon, and þær mænige lease
cyðeras to eodon, þa æt nextan comon þær twegen lease cyðeras,
and cwædon.
 108. Þes cwæð, Ic mæg towurpan Godes tempel, and æfter
þreora daga fæce eft hit getimbrian.
 110. Þa aras se ealdor þæra sacerda and cwæð to him, Ic
ðe halsige þurh God þæne lifigendan þæt þu secge us gif þu sy
Crist þæs lifigendan Godes sunu.
 113. Þa cwæð se hælend to him, þæt þu cwæde.
 114. Soðlice ic secge eow heononforð þæt ge geseoð
mannes sunu sittende on ða swiðran healfe Godes mægenes þrimmes and
cumende mid wolcnum on heofonas.
 117. Þa sona se ealdorman slat his hrægl, and þus cwæð,
He yfel sacode.
 118. Hwæt beðurfon we nu ofer þis leasra cyðera?
 119. Nu we gehyrdon his yfelsacunga.
 120. Ac hwæt is eow geðuht be ðam?
 120. Þa andswaredon hi ealle and cwædon, Deaðes he is
scyldig.
 121. Þa spætton hi on his ansyne and mid fystum hine swungon,
sume bradum handum on his neb slogon, and cwædon, Sæge us þu Crist,
hwylc is se ðe þa sloh?
 124. And Petrus sæt þærute on ðam cafertune, and þa
eode to him an mennen, and cwæð, Come þu mid þam Galileiscan
hælende.
 126. And he wiðsoc beforan him eallum, and cwæð, Nat ic
hwæt þu mænst.
 128. Þa eode þær oðer mænnen to ðære duru and
cwæð to ðam þe þærute wæron, þes wæs mid þam
Nazareniscan hælende.
 130. And eft he wiðsoc mid aðswara, and cwæð þæt he
ne cuðe þone mann.
 131. And æfter lytlum fæce þa ðe þær stodon hi
cwædon to Petre, Soðlice þu come mid þam hælende.
 133. Þin spræc þe swutelað.
 134. And he ða gyt ætsoc mid aðsweringe, and cwæð
þæt he ne cuðe þone man, and þa sona se hana creow.
 135. Þa wæs Petrus swiðe gemyndig þæs wordes þe se
hælend cwæð, ær ðan se hana singe þriwa þu me wiðsæest.
 138. And he þa ut eode, and ongan wepan swiðe biterlice.
 139. And þa on ærnemerigen hi worhton geþeaht ongean þone
hælend þæt hi hine to deaðe gesealdon.
 141. And hi hine þa læddon gebundenne to ðam Pontiscan
Pilate, þam gerefan.
 142. Þa geseah Iudas se ðe hine sealde þæt he wæs
fordemed, þa wolde he don dædbote and gebrohte þa þrittig seolfer
sticca þam ealdormannum, and cwæð, Ic syngode þa ic sealde þæt
rihtwise blod.
 146. And hi cwædon, Hwæt wilt þu us þæt witen?
 147. And hi ða awurpon þam seolfor sticcan in to ðam
temple.
 147. And he ða ut eode and hine sylfne on grine aheng.
 148. And þa ealdormen þa cwædon, Nis na þis feoh alyfed to
donne on ure madmcyste, for ðan hit is blodes wurð.
 151. Þa worhton hi geðeaht and gebohton þær mid an land
heore tigelwyrhtum, þæt land is gecweden Acheldemahc, for ðan ðe hit
is blodes land oð ðisne andweardan dæg.
 154. Þa wæs gefylled þæt ær wæs gecweden þurh
Hieremiam þone witegan þæt he sceolde beon geboht mid þrittigum
seolfer sticcum swa hit ær wæs gewitegod fram Israhela bearnum.
 157. Þa stod se hælend beforan þam gerefan, and he cwæð
to him, Eart þu cyning Iudea?
 159. Þa cwæð to him se hælend, þæt þu cwyst.
 160. And he wæs gewreged fram þam ealdormannum and þam
witum.
 161. Þa cwæð to him Pilatus, Ne gehyrst þu hu feala ongean
þe secgað þas gecyðnesse?
 162. And þu him ne andswarast mid ænige worde.
 163. Þa sceolde se gerefa on ðam symbeldæge forlætan
þam folce ænne gebundenne ræpling swylcne hi sylfe woldon.
 165. Þa wæs þær an mære ræpling, se wæs gecweden
Barrabban.
 167. Þa cwæð Pilatus to ðam folc, Hwæðerne wille ge
þæt ic eow forlæte þe þone hælend se is gecweden Crist, þe
Barrabban?
 169. Þa bædon hi ealle Barrabban and þone hælend
forspildon.
 170. Þa gyt cwæð se gerefa, Hwæðerne wille ge þæt
ic eow forlæte of ðam twam?
 172. Þa cwædon hi ealle, Barrabban.
 172. Þa cwæð Pilatus, Ac hwæt do ic be ðam
hælendende se is gecweden Crist?
 174. Þa cwædon hi ealle, Si he ahangen.
 174. Þa cwæð se gerefa to heom, Hwæt dyde he yfeles?
 175. Hi swyðor cleopodon ealle, and cwædon, Sy he ahangen.
 176. Þa onfeng he wætere and he þwoh his handa and cwæð
beforan þam folce, Swa unscyldig ic wille beon þyses rihtwisan blodes, swa
min hand is þises wæteres.
 180. Þa andswarode him eall þæt folc, and cwædon, Sy his
blod gefah ofer us and ofer ealle ure bearn.
 182. Þa forlet he him to Barrabban, and þone hælend hi
swungon, and sealdon þæt he wære ahangen.
 183. Þa witan ða þæs gerefan onfengon þone hælend on
ðam dome, and hi gesamnodon to him ealne þone þreat.
 186. Þa unscryddon hi hine and befengan hine mid wolcreadan
sciccelse and sealdon him awundenne beah of ðornum, and setton ofer his
heafod, and hreod on his swiððran hand.
 189. And hi gebigdon heora cneowu beforan him, and cwædon on
bismer, Wes þu hal cynnig Iudea þa spætton hi on, and na hreod
and/ ton his heafod mid and æfter þan hi ongyredon hine þy
sciccelse, and hine gegeredon his ægenum hrægle, and gelæddon hine
þæt hi hine ahengon.
 194. Þa gemetton hi ænne Cyreneiscne mannan, se wæs on
naman Symon and hi hine nyddon þæt he nam þa rode and he hi bær to
ðære stowe seo is gecweden cwealmstow, and heafodbollan stow, and hi
sealdon him win drincan wið geallan gemenged, and þa ða he hit onbyrigde
þa nolde he hit drincan.
 199. Þa he ahangen was þa todælde hi heom his reaf mid
hlote/.
 200. Þa wæs se cwide gefylled þe wæs þurh þane
witegan gecweden, <foreign>Diuiserunt sibi uestimenta mea et super uestem meam miserunt
sortem</foreign>; Hio todældan him mine reaf and ofer min hrægl hi sendon hlyt.
 204. And hi þær sæton and hine heoldon and setton ofer his
heafod on bismer, þis is cyning Iudea.
 205. And hi ða ahengon mid him twegen sceaðan, oðerne on ða
swiðran healfe, oðerne on ða wynstran healfe, and þa forð bigferendan
hi yfelsacedon on hine, and hrysedon heora heafod, and cwædon, Uuah; ær
þu cwæde þæt ða des towurpe Godes tempel and æfter þreora
daga fæce eft hit getimbrian?
 211. Gif þu sy Godes sunu gehæl þe sylfne, and astih of
ðisse rode, and we gelyfað on ðe.
 212. And eac þæm gelice hi on bismer cwædon, Manige
oðre he hale gedyde, and hine sylfne he ne mæg gehælan.
 214. Gif he Israæele cyning is, astige nu of ðære rode and
we gelyfað him.
 216. He truwað on God, ahredde hine; Nu he wille sæde
þæt/ he geodes sunu.
 217. Eac swilce þa sceaðan þe mid him hangedon him oðwiton
þæt he wæs gecweden Crist and wæs on rode gesewen.
 219. Þa fram þære sixtan tide þystro gewordene wæron
ofere ealle eorðan oð ða nontide.
 220. Þa to ðam yferan none þa clypode se hælend mid
micelre stemne and cwæð, <foreign>Heli, heli, lema zabdani, hoc est deus meus,
deus meus, ut quid me dereliquisti</foreign>; he cwæð, Min God, Mi God, to hwi
forlete þu me?
 224. Þa cwædon þa ðe þær stodon and þæt
gehyrdon, Nu he clypað Heliam, þæt he cume and hine alyse.
 226. Þa eode an and nam an fæt and fylde mid ecede, and bead
him to drincenne.
 227. Þa oðre cwædon, Læt, þæt we geseon hwæðer
her cume Helias nu and hine alyse.
 229. Se hælend þa clypode oðre siðe mid micelre stemne,
and onsende his gast, and þæs temples wahrift wearð todæled on twa,
and seo eorðe wearð aræfnod and stanas to and þa lichaman arison
þæra haligra sawla, and seo mænigo haligra þe ær slepon þa
arison and heo eodon syððan hi arison geond ealle þe halgan ceastre.
 235. And þa se hundredes ealdorman þa ealle þa ðe mid him
wæron þætte hi beheoldon þone hælend, þa hi gesawon þa
eorðbifunge, hi him ondredon swiðe, and cwædon, Soðlice þæt is
Godes sunu.
 238. Þa wæs þæra wifa feala þe on ðone hælend
gelyfdon, feor þanon of Galileum, þæt wæs Maria Magdalene, and Maria
seo Iacobisce and Iosepes modor, and Zebedeus sunu modor.
 242. Þa wæs æfen geworden, and com se welega man of
Abarimathiam þære ceastre, se wæs gecweden Iosep, and he wæs
þæs hælendes þegn.
 244. Þa eode he to Pilate þam gerefan, and hine bæd þæt
he moste onfon þæs hælendes lichaman.
 246. And he hine him sona ageaf, and hi ða sona to ðære rode
becomon and heo him sona to aleat, and þær onfengon þæs hælendes
lichaman and hine bewundon on sinde on ðam clænostan and mærestan
hrægle þe on middanearde gewurde, and hi asetton hine in ða byrgenne,
þe wæs gecorfen on ðam beorhtan stane, and þær wæs Maria
Magdalene and seo oðer Maria, and sæton ofer þa byrgenne.
 254. And þa soðlice on ðone oðerne dæg æfter lytlum
fæce þa comon þa ealdormen and þa witan of Pharisea to Pilate, and
cwædon, Hlaford, we oncnawað nu þæt se swica cwæð to us þæt
he wolde on ðam þriddan dæge of deaðe arisan.
 258. Þa cwæð he on eornoste, Gað to and healdað þa
byrgenne oð ðone þriddan dæg, þæt nane strange ne cuman his
þegna þæt hi hine forstelan and þonne eft cweðen þæt he of
deaðe arise.
 261. And hi þa namon swiðe micelne stan and fortrendon
þære byrgenne duru and hi þær ofer gesæton and hæfdon þær
on gebroht þæs hælendes lichaman þe nu leofað and rixað mid
fæder and mid sunu and mid þam halgum gaste a in ealra worulda woruld
soðlice buton ende, Amen.
