HomS 19 (Schaefer)
B3.2.19.
Palm Sunday: Schaefer 1972, 113-52.



 1. <foreign>De Passione Domini</foreign> Men ða leofestan, gehirað nu hu drihten
wæs sprecende on þas tid to his geferum, & hu he witegede þæt
æfter twam þingum eastron wæron þæt wæs se mannes sunu geseald
to ahonne, se is hælend nemned.
 5. Þa hi þa gegadorode wæron þa bisceopas & þa
ealdormen þæs folces in anum cafertune, & se bisceop wæs nemned
Kaifas.
 5. Þa didon hi swiþe micele þeahtunge imbe urne hælend,
þæt hi hine woldon mid inwitte beswican to þam þæt hie hine
acwealdon.
 7. Þa cwædon sume þa men, Eala, nelle we on þisne
simbeldæg, þi læs wen sy þæt micel ungerec si on þissum folce.
 10. Mid þi þi hælend wæs in Bethania lande, on Simones
huse þæs untruman, þa geeode him an wif to, seo hire hæfde elefæt
on handa þæt wæs deorwerðre smiringe full.
 12. Þa geat heo hit ofer þæs hælendes heafod be him
sittendun.
 13. Þa þæt gesawon his gingeran, þa wurdon hi swiþe
unrote, & hi cwædon, hwæt is þeos farlorenes þæt ðis wif
deð?
 15. Hwæt, heo þis mahte on micel weorð becypan &
þonne þearfendum mannum gedælan.
 16. Þa wiste hira geþancas, & cyþþa to him, Hwæt is
eow uneaðe æt þissum wife?
 17. Hwæt, heo wæs god worc wircende on me.
 17. Simble ge habbað þearfan mid eow, ac ge ne habbað me
simble.
 18. Þæt heo dide minum lichoman to smirenesse.
 19. And heo bicnede þæt he sceolde beon on byrgenne aleged.
 20. Soð is þæt eow secge, þær þis godspell bið inne
ræd geond ealle middangeard, bið hire gemindwurþig hwæt heo dide on
me gemind.
 23. Þa eode an of his <foreign>XII</foreign> geongerum, þæs nama wæs Iudas
Scarioð, iode to þara sacerda ealdormannum, & he cwæð to him,
Hwæt wille ge me sillan gif ic hine iow gesille & belæwe urne
Drihten?
 25. Hi þa ealle anmodlice him togenes oncwædon, We þe
gesillað <foreign>XXX</foreign> scillinga on silfre.
 27. And þa þanon þa sohte he þa gelimplican tide þæt
he hine let to deaðe gesillan.
 29. Þa se hælend æt æfengereordum sæt mid his twelf
geonrum, ongan þa sprecan to his geongrum, & he swa cwæð, Soð ic
eow secge, ðæt an is mid eow þe me hæfð gesealdne.
 31. Þa þæt ða gehirdon his geongeran, þa wurdon hie
swiðe geunrotsode, & ælc cwæð sundorlice, Drihten, eom ic hit?
 33. Þa answarode him hælend & he cwæð, Se þe me mid
his handum hrineð, swa hit be him awriten is, on þissum disce, se me
belæweð.
 35. Þonne se mannes sunu gæð, wala þam men þe mannes
sunu gesealdne hafað.
 36. Selre him wære þæt he na nære.
 36. Ða siþesð andswarode him se Iuda se ðe hine gesealdne
hæfde, & he cwæð, Sægest þu, lareow, þæt ic þæt si?
 38. Þa cwæð him hælend to, þu þæt cwæde.
 38. He þa hælend to þam æfengereordum anfeng hlafe, &
þone gebletsode, & tobræc, & sealde his gingrum, & cwæð,
Etað ge ealle of ðissum hlafe, þis is min lichama.
 41. And he onfeng kalice, & gebletsode win of wætere, &
sealde his geongerum, & cwæð, drincað ge ealle of þissum, ðis is
min blod on ðisse niwan æwe þæt bið þonne for manegum agoten an
forgifnesse ure sinna.
 44. Soð is þonne þæt ic eow secge, þæt ic ne drince
forðheonone an þisse mæðe ær þon þe ic eft mid eow drince on
mines fæder rice.
 47. And hi þa drihtene lof sungon & sægdon, & ferdon
in þa dune þe is nemned Montem Olifete.
 48. Þa ongan hælend sprecan to his geongerum & he swa
cwæð, Soð is þæt eow secge, ealle ge me doð geswinc on þisse
nihte, is gewriten be me, swa man ofslea þone hirde & todrife þa sceap
ðæs hyrdes, swa bið þæt hie me willað besirwan, & ic eft
æfter dome arise & ga beforan eow ond hie.
 52. Þa cwæð Sanctus Petrus, þeah hie þe ealle geswicen,
ic ana þe næfre ne swice.
 53. Þa cwæð him hælend to, Soð is þæt ic ðe
secge, þæt þu me onsæcest on þisse nihte þriwa ær þon þe
se hana singe.
 55. Þa cwæð him eft Petrus to, Hwæt, me gedafenað
þæt ic swelte mid þe þonne ic þe onsæce.
 56. Eac swa ilce ealle his geongeran þæt cwædon.
 58. Þa cwom hælend on þone tun þe is gietsamani genemned,
þa ongan he sprecan to his geongerum, & he cwæð, Sittað ge nu
her ane gewealdene hwile & ræstað eow, oð ðæt ic ga & me
gebidde.
 61. Genam him þa Petrus mid & Sebeðæges suna twegen,
ongan þa sona swiþe unrotsian & an swiðe micelum unsælðum
wæsan, & cwæð, Min sawl ys unrot, oð deað; habbað me, &
waciað mid me, min gast is swiðe fuus & min lichoma is swiðe untrum.
 64. And þa eode he lythwon from him, & feoll ða ofer his
anwlitan, & gebæd hine þissum wordum, & he cwæð, Fæder,
gif ðe ieðe si, gewite þeos þrowung fram me, si swa þeah swa þu
wolde, næs swa ic wolde.
 67. And þa cwom hælend to his geongerum & mette hi
slæpende/, & he cwæð þa to Sancte Petre, Forhwon ne meahtest þu
ane tid wacian mid me?
 69. Waciað ge nu, & gebiddað eow þi læs ge gegangen on
deofles anweald.
 70. And he cwæð, Min gast is swiðe fuus & min lichoma
untrum.
 71. Feoll ða eft ofer his andwlitan & gebæd hine mid þam
ylcan wordum.
 72. Þa eode he æft oþre siðe, & gebæd hine, &
cwæð, Gif þe ieðe sy, gewite þeos þrowung fram me, sy þeah swa
þu wolde, næs swa ic wolde.
 74. Com ða eft to his gingrum & mette hie slæpende,
forþon þe hi wæron swiþe gehefgude mid þære hefgan worulde þe
him toweard wæs, þeah þe hi ða gita niston.
 77. Eode þa ðriddan siðe & gebæd hine mid þam ylcan
wordum.
 78. Cwom þa eft to his gingerum, & cwæð to him, Slapað
ge nu þa, & ræstað eow, forþon nu nealæceð seo tid þæt
mannes sunu bið geseald firenfullum monnum on hond him, wið feo.
 80. Arisað nu, & utun gaan, forþon þe nu nealæceð se
ðe me gesealdne hæfð.
 82. Ða eode se Iuda ut, & he hine lædde to þan
ungeafullan heap Iudea folces þa wæron mid sweordum & mid strengum
gewæpnode, swa hie wæron sende fram þara sacerda ealdormannum &
fram þam unwitum þæs folces.
 85. Þa sealde se Iuda him þæt to beacne, & he cwæð,
Witon ge þæt se þe ic cessende beon, þæt þæt is se hælend
þi ge niman sceolon, forþon hie hine gecnæwan ne mihton betweoh his
gingeran.
 88. Þa wæs an stow þe hælend lufode sundorlice þa
fæstentid.
 88. Þa wolde he þa stowe gegan ær þon þe hi hine namon.
 89. Þa he him eft to geeode, þa cwæð him hælend to,
Hwæt secað ge?
 90. Þane Natarenisca hælend.
 91. To soð is þæt eow secge, þæt ic þæt eom.
 91. Þa urnon hi underbæc & afeollon, & he eode forð,
singende his gingeran.
 92. Þa hie him to geeodun, þa cwæð him eft hælend to,
Hwæne secað ge?
 93. Þa cwædon hie, þisne hælend, þone galileiscan
hælend.
 94. Þa cwæð he, Soð þæt ic eow secge, þæt ic
þæt eom.
 95. Þa urnon hie oðre siðe underbæc & afeollon.
 96. And he eode forð singende, & fulleode þa stowe þe he
to wolde ær his þrowunge.
 97. Þa þriddan siðe þa geeode him se Iuda to, se þe hine
gesealdne hæfde, & cwæð to him, <foreign>Aue rabbi, & osculatus est
eum</foreign>.
 99. Cyste hine þa mid þam worde.
 99. Þa cwæð him Hælend to, <foreign>Amice, et quod uenisti</foreign>; He
cwæð, To hwæs com þu endemes hider nu þus?
 101. Þa setton hie hira handa on þone Hælend, & hie hine
namon, & hie hine bundon.
 103. Þa wæs an Hælendes gingra þæs nama wæs
Petrus.
 103. Þa gebræd he his sweorde & asloh anes þara sacerda
ealdormannes þæt swiðre eare of, þæs nama wæs Malcus haten.
 105. Þa cigde him Hælend þone Malhcum to, & gehælde
his eare.
 106. And he cwæð to Petre, Petrus, hwirfe þin sweurd on
þine scæþe, swilc eowre swilce wæpne anfehð to þam þæt he
mid feohtan wolde, ic gedem þæt he self farwirð on þam wæpne eac.
 109. Wenstu þæt ic ne meahte abiddan æt minum fæder
<foreign>XII</foreign> eored engla gif ic feohtan wolde?
 110. Þa cwæð se Hælend to þam folce, Hwæt, ge earme
comon to me swa to oþrum sceaþan, mid sweordum & mid stingum
gewæpnode?
 112. Hu, ne sæt ic ælce dæg þæs fæstentid on
eowrum temple & eow lærde?
 113. And hwon ne namon ge me þær?
 113. Ac þa gewritu sculon beon gefillede, þa be me awritene
wæron.
 115. Ealle his gingran hie hine farflugon & forleton, swa
þæt sceapheorde deð þonne him wulf on becimð.
 116. Petrus ana he him folgade feorran, & he wæs ingangende
in on þone cafertun þa þara sacerda ealdormannes, & sæt
þærute, & gebæd hine, & wirmde hine, forþon þe hit wæs
ceald weder & micel cyle on þa tid þe ure Hælend þrowode.
 120. Þa ðæra sacerda ealdormen hi sohton swiðe lease
gewitnesse wið Hælend þæt hi hine woldon mid inwitte beswican to
þam þæt hi hine woldun acwellan.
 122. Þa comon þær twegen ungemetlease, ða cwædon hie,
Eart þu þæt ðu gulpe þæt ðu meahtest godes tempel tobrecan
& æft on <foreign>III</foreign> dagum getimbrian?
 124. Hælend, he swigode.
 125. Ða cwæð him to þara sacerda ealdorman, Ac forhwon ne
geandswarast þu us æt sumum worde?
 126. Hwæt, þu gehierst þæt ðe man micela spræca to
hæfð & micela gewitnessa to sæið.
 127. And Hælend he swigode.
 127. Þa cwæð him eft to þara sacerda ealdorman, Ic þe
halsie, under lifiendne god, þæt þu cweþe gid ðu sie Crist Godes
sunu.
 129. Þa cwæð him Hælend to, þu þæt cwæde.
 130. Soð is þonne þæt ic eow secge, þæt þu gesiehst
git mannes sunu lifiende on þa swiðran healfe his fæder
mægenþrimmes & cumendne on heofonwolcnum.
 132. Þara sacerda ealderman he slat his agen hrægl on him
silfum, & he cwæð, þis is yfelsacung eallenga, & ge gehirdon
þas yfelsacunge.
 134. Hwæt, hit is eow gesewen & swa cweden.
 135. And hie þa ealle andswaredon, þæt Iudisce folc his
rices, ða andswaredon hie & cwædon, He is deaðes scildig.
 136. Sume hie spiwon ofor his andwlitan, sume hie slogon bradum
handum on his neb, sume hine mid fistum beoton, & hie cwædon, Witga us
nu, gif ðu sy Crist Godes sunu, hwæt is se þe wirst sliehð?
 139. He swigode.
 140. Petrus he eode near & wolde geseon on hwam Hælendes
þing wære.
 141. Þa geeode him an man to & cuæð, Eart þu her mid
þis Nazareniscan Hælende?
 142. And he þa ærest oðsoc beforan him eallum & swa
cwæð, Nat ic hwæt þu sægest.
 143. Þa eode eft hwene near on oþre stowe & wolde geseon on
hwam þæs Hælendes þing wære.
 144. Þa geeode him to oþer mennen, & cuæð, Eart þu
her mid þies Hælendan Criste, þis galea cyninge?
 146. Þa mid swiþe micelre aðsware he hine ladude ða
þriddan siðe.
 147. Þa geeode him to se Malhcus þe he ær on dæg
gewundode, þa cwæð se, Eart þu se Petrus se se me todægge
wundodest?
 148. Hu, ne gecnawe ic þe full geare?
 149. And þin spræc þe hafað cuðne gedon.
 149. Þa mid swiþe micelre aðsware he hine ladude & he
cwæd, Ne can ic þone mannan, ne ic þæs gespreces naht ne gecnawe.
 151. Þa efter lytlum fæce, þa sang se hana.
 152. Þa was Petrus gemindi þara wurda þe Hælend him ær
to spræc; ær þam þe se hana singe, þriwa þu onsæcest min.
 154. And eode þa ut of þam kafertune & weop swiðe
biterlice.
 155. On mergenne, þam gewurdenum þingum, þa didon hie micele
geþeahtunge ymbe urne Hælend þæt hie hine woldon acwellan, & hi
hine ageafon þam Pontiscan Pilate þam gerefan.
 157. Þa þæt geseah se Iuda þe hine gesealdne hæfde,
þæt he swa swiðe gescyldod wæs, þa wæs he to hreunesse
gelæded, genam þa þæt <foreign>XXX</foreign> scillenga & gebrohte þara sacerda
ealdormannum & cwæð, Ic singode þa ic þæs soðfæstan mannes
blod gesealde.
 161. Þa andswaredon hie, & hi cwædon, Hwæt sægest
þu nu us þæs?
 162. Hwæt magon we his þe nu don?
 162. Þa genam he þæt <foreign>XXX</foreign> scillenga & forwearp on hira
tempel, & he arn & aheng hine silfne.
 163. Þa ðæra sacerda ealdermen didon swiðe micele
geþeahtunge ymb þæt sealfor, & hie cwædon, Hu ne witon we
fulgeare þæt hit nis us alyfed to aganne, forþam þe hit is his blodes
weorþ.
 166. Þa gewerð hi ealle þæt hy gebohton þæt land mid
þe is nemned Acheldemah.
 167. Þæt land hie to þon gebohton þæt elðeodigra
manna lichoman on byridon.
 169. Hælend he stod beforan þam gerefan, & he hine ahsode
& cwæð, Eart þu Iudea kining?
 170. Þa cwæð him Hælend to, þu þæt cwæde.
 170. Þa wæs þæs folces gewuna fram ðam edmældæge
þæt him mon simle anne forgeafe þara þe þonne on bendum wæron.
 172. Þa þær wæron þær hie twegen on bendum, oþer
wæs Barabba se sceaþa, oþer wæs Hælend.
 173. Þa cwæð him to Pilatus, Hwæþerne þissa tuegea
wille ge þæt ic eow forgyfe þe þisne Barabban þe þisne Hælend?
 175. Þa cwædon hie, Barabban.
 176. Ac hwæt wite ge þissum Hælende se is genemned Crist?
 176. Ealle hie cigdon & cwædon, Sie he ahungen.
 177. Þa cwæð him se refa to, Hwæt hæfð he to yfle
gedon?
 178. Hi cigdon micele swiðor to & cwædon, Si he ahangen.
 179. Þa þæt geseah Pilatus, þæt him nan wiht ne
gespeow, ac swa he furþur spræc, swa hie mare ungerec worhton.
 180. Þa onfeng Pilatus wætere & ongan þwean his handa,
& cwæð, Ic wille beon unscildig þeses soðfæstan mannes blodes,
& ic wille þæt ge þæt ealle geseon.
 183. He licette mid his tungan & sirede inwit mid his heortan.
 183. Þa andswarodon hie & cwædon, Si his blod ofor us
& ufer ure bearn.
 185. And þa forgeaf he him Barabban, & Hælend he him ageaf
beswongenne to þam þæt hie hine on rode ahengon.
 187. And þa cempan him onfengon, & hie hine læddon to hira
moterne, & hie hine ongyredon his agenum hrægle & hie hine gegyredon
mid wolcenbaswum godwebbe.
 189. And mid hreode hi hine slogon, & gebigdon cnewum hie hine
bismeroden.
 190. And þirnenne coronan hi didon him on heafud, & hie
cwædon, Hal westu, Iudea kining.
 191. Æfter þon þe hie hine swa gebysmerodne hæfdon, þa
ongyredon hie hine þy hrægle & hi hine gegyredon his agenum hrægle,
& hie hine læddon to þære stowe þær hie hine ahon woldon.
 194. Þa metton hie ænne Cyriscmannan þæs nama wes
Simonem, þone hi namon & niddon hine to þan þæt he bære þa
rode, & þa dide he swa oþ þæt hie comon to þære stowe þe is
golgotha nemned.
 196. And hio is on Ebrisc <foreign>Caluarie</foreign> genemned.
 198. Sona þa hie þæder comon, þa sealdon hie him eced
wið geallan gemenged to drincanne.
 199. Æfter þam þe he wæs on rode ahangen, þa dældon
hie his hrægl & sendon hliete ofer his hrægl.
 200. And æfter þam þe he wæs on rode ahangen, þa wæs
se cwide gefelled þe se sealmscopwirhta cwæð, <foreign>Diuiserunt sibi</foreign>.
 202. Hie dældon min hrægl, & hie sendon hlietas ofor min
hrægl.
 203. And þa asettan hie þis gewrit on huhs ofer his heafod on
þære rode, & hie cwædon, Hal wæs þu, Iudea kyning.
 205. And hi ahengon twegen sceaþan on twa healfa his, oþerne on
þa swiþran healfe, oþerne on þa winstran.
 207. Þa se sceaða þe him hangode on þa swiðran healfe
þa onhilde he his heafod on þære rode to him swa swa he meahte & he
cwæð, Drihten min, gemine me mid þy þe þu on þin rice becume.
 209. Þa cwæð him Hælend to, Soð is þæt ic þe
secge, ðæt þu bist mid me on neorxnawanges gefean ær Simon Petrus.
 211. Þa se sceaða þe him hangode on þa winstran healfe þa
onhielde he his heafod on þære rode fram him swa swa he meahte, Hwæt
þu earma eart, for unlæde þe þe hine are bitst, & he ne mæg him
silfum nane Gode.
 214. And se sceaþa him hangode on ðam winstran healfe, se hine
edwitgode on middum folce, & hie cwædon, Gyf þu si Israela kyning,
astih of þære rode, & gehæle þe selfne, þonne gelifað we on
þe, þæt þu sy godes sunu.
 218. Þa he þa wæs ahangen æt þære ðriddan tide
þæs dæges, æt þam underne, þa fram ðære syxtan tide
þæs dæges, fram þam middandæge, oð ða nigoþan tide, oþ
þone non, ofor eallne middangeard þistro gewurdene wæron.
 221. Þa æt þære nontide, Hælend mid swiþe hlutre
stefne he cigde & cwæð, <foreign>Eli, Eli, Eli, lamat sabathanig? Hoc est,
deus meus, deus meus, ut quid dereliquisti me</foreign>; þæs wordes gerecnes is
þæt he cwæð, Min god, min god, tohwon forgeate þu me þus?
 224. Þa cuædon hie sume þus þe þær stodon, Nu he
cigþ Elias his witegan.
 226. Sum nam spingan & filde mid ecede & sette on his
muð & sealde him drincan.
 227. Sum nam spere, stang on his sidan, þæt þær dropude
ut æghwæþer ge blod ge wæter, forðon sceal æt ælcere
mæssan beon ægþer ge win ge wæter ægþer wið oþer gemenged.
 229. Sume hy cuædon, Hwæt, we nu geseoð gif þin Elias
cimþ & þe gefreolsað.
 231. Hælend ærest mid swiþe hlutre stæmne.
 231. Hlutre stæmne he cigde & his gast asende.
 232. & ðæs temples wahrift tebærst fram ufeweardun
oð/ neoðeweard, & þa stanas wæron bærstende, & þa
birgelsas wæron geopenude & þær wæs swiðe micel
eorðhrernes/ geworden.
 235. Nu þa se centurius þe ðær wæs wæron hy
cuædon/, þis is soðlice Godes sunu.
 236. & þær wæron þa wif þe Galilea lande: Maria
seo Magdalenisce, & Maria seo suna modur.
 239. Dæge þa com þær sum swiþe freawælig mon fram
þam lande þe is Abarimathia genemned, þæs nama wæs Iosep.
 240. Se wæs ær Hælendes geongra & his discipul.
 241. Þa eode he to Pilatusse & bæd hine þæt he hete
hine agifan Hælendes lichoman, & þa dide he swa.
 243. & he þone onfeng & he hine bewand on swiþe
hwitere scetan & he hine alegde on niwon birgeles þe næfre ær
nænig lichoma on aleiged ne wæs.
 245. He þa þone bergels swiþe georne mid stane beleac.
 246. & þær wæs soðlice ymbe þone byrgels Maria
seo Magdalenisce & seo oþeru Maria.
 248. Þa þi dæge þa þara sacerda ealdormenn eodon to
Pilatusse/ & cwædon, Wæs þu gemindig, lareow, þara worda þe se
beswica/ þe spræc, þæt he wolde þy þriddan dæge of deaðe
arisan.
 251. Hat nu healdan þa dæg þy læs cumen & hine on
us slæpendum forstælen & þon þara mihta þæt he meahte
of/ deaþe arisan.
 253. Þonne si se gedwola wirsa þonne he þa healdan þone
birgels oð þone þriddan dæg.
 255. Þa þy þriddan dæge an dægered.
 255. Nalles þonne he ana arisen ne wæs ac swiþe monige halie
lichoman arisene heofoncundan Hirusalem.
 257. Þam Drihtene sie wuldor & weorðmind, in ealra worulda
worold, a butan ende, Amen.

HomS 21 (BlHom 6)
B3.2.21.
Palm Sunday: Morris 1874-80, 65-83.



 1. <foreign>DOMINICA SEXTA IN QUADRAGESIMA</foreign>.
 1. Her sægþ, men þa leofestan, be þisse halgan tide
arwyrþnesse, hu se mildheorta Drihten, & se Alysend þysses menniscan
cynnes hine sylfne geeaþmedde þæt of hehþe þæs fæderlican
þrymmes to eorþan astag, to þon þæt he wolde þrowian for ealra
manna hæle, & us gefreolsian from deofles þeowdome, & us
æteowan his mihte & his willan; & hu, unforhte mode, he
genealæhte þære stowe þe he on ðrowian wolde for ure onlesnesse,
& deofles genyþerunge.
 8. On þyssum dæge ure Drihten Hælend wæs weorþod &
hered from Iudea folce; forþon þe hie ongeaton þæt he wæs Hælend
Crist, þurh þæt wundorgeweorc þe he Lazarum awehte of deaþe þy
feorþan dæge, þæs þe he on byrgenne wæs.
 12. Þa bæron hie him togeanes blowende palmtwigu; forþon
þe hit wæs Iudisc þeaw, þonne heora ciningas hæfdon sige geworht on
heora feondum, & hie wæron eft ham hweorfende, þonne eodan hie him
togeanes mid blowendum palmtwigum, heora siges to wyorþmyndum.
 17. Wel þæt gedafenode þæt Drihten swa dyde on þa
gelicnesse; forþon þe he wæs wuldres cyning.
 18. Þysne dæg hie nemdon siges dæg; se nama tacnaþ þone
sige þe Drihten gesigefæsted wiþstod deofle, þa he mid his deaþe
þone ecan deaþ oferswiþde, swa he sylf þurh þone witgan sægde; he
cwæþ, Eala deaþ, ic beo þin deaþ, & ic beo þin bite on helle.
 22. Mycelne bite Drihten dyde on helle þa he þyder astag, &
helle bereafode, & þa halgan sauwla þonon alædde, & hie generede
of deofles anwalde, þa he to þeowdome þyder on fruman middangeardes
gesamnode wæron.
 26. He hie eft alædde of helle grunde on þa hean þrymmas
heofona rices.
 27. Iohannes, se deora þegn, us cyþde on þæm godspelle,
& þus cwæþ: Hælend cwom syx dagum ær Iudea eastrum, to
Bethania þær Lazarus wæs forþfered, & he hine awehte of deaþe.
 30. Martha his sweostor þa gearwode þam Hælende
æfengereordu; & hire sweostor gesæt big Hælendes fotum, þære
nama wæs Maria; forþon þe heo wolde gehyran his word & his lare.
 33. Martha wæs geornful þæt heo þon Hælende to
gecwemnesse þegnode; heo gestod beforan him, & him tocwæþ, Hwy nelt
þu geman þæt min sweostor me læt ane þegnian?
 36. Cwæþ to hire þæt heo me fultumie.
 36. Hælend hire þa ondswarode, & cwæþ, Martha,
Martha, wes þu behydig & gemyndig Marian þinga, þæt is, þæt
þu scealt on æghwylce tid Godes willan wercan, þæt an þe is selost
þæt þu Gode licie.
 40. Maria hire geceas þone betstan dæl, se ne bið næfre
fram hire afyrred.
 41. Lazarus þær wæs ana sittende mid Hælende, & mid
his þegnum; Maria genam an pund deorwyrþre smerenesse, & smerede
þæs Hælendes fet, & eft mid hire loccum drygde.
 43. Þa wæs eall þæt hus gefylled mid þon swetan stence
þære deorwyrðan smerenesse.
 45. Hælendes þegna sum þa wæs swyþe gebolgen, se wæs
haten Iudas se Scariothisca; forþon he com of þæm tune þe Scariot
hatte; he cwæþ, To hwon sceolde þeos smyrenes þus beon to lore gedon?
 48. Eaþe heo mehte beon geseald to þrim hunde penega, &
þæt gedæled þearfendum mannum.
 50. Ne cwæþ he þæt na forþon þe him wære ænig
gemynd þearfendra manna, ah he wæs gitsere, & se wyresta sceaþa;
forþon þa apostolas hine letan heora seodas beran þæt hie woldan mid
þon his gitsunga cunnian.
 53. He wæs eac se wyresta gitsere, þe he gesealde wiþ feo
heofeones Hlaford & ealles middangeardes.
 55. Hælend him þa ondswarede, & cwæþ, Tohwon syndon
ge þyses weorces swa hefige; god weorc heo wæs wyrcende on me.
 57. Symle ge habbaþ þearfan, gif ge willaþ teala don, ah ge
nabbaþ me symle, ac lætaþ þis þus wesan to cyþnesse minre
bebyrgednesse.
 59. Soþ is þæt ic eow secgge, þæt þis godspell sceal
beon sægd & bodad geond ealne middangeard; forðon þis wæs gedon
on min gemynd.
 61. Þæt Iudisce folc þa wiste þæt Hælend com to
Lazares ham, foran þa þyder; næs þeah na for his lufon, ac for
fyrwetgeornnesse þæs wundres, & woldan geseon Lazarus þone þe he
ær of deaþe awehte.
 64. Ða wæs gefylled þæt ær gecweden wæs, þis folc
me weorþaþ mid wordum, & is þeah heora heorte feor fram me.
 66. Þa ealdormen þa þohtan, & þa witan, þæt hie
woldan Lazarus acwellan; forþon þe manige men gelyfdon on Hælend þa he
hine of deaþe awehte.
 69. Þa com þyder on morgen mycel menigo for þon
symbeldæge.
 70. Hælend þa þonon ferde to Hierusalem, mid þy þe hie
þæt gesawon, hie naman blowende palmtwigu, & bæron him togeanes,
& him to onluton, & hine weorþodan swa cinige geriseþ.
 73. Þa he þa genealæhte Gerusalem, þa becom he ær to
Betfage þæm tune neh Oliuetes dune.
 74. Hælend þa cwæþ to his twam þegnum, to Petre &
Iohanne, Gangaþ nu on þas ceasterwic þe inc ongean standeþ, þonne
gemete gyt þær eoselan gesælede & hire folan; onsælaþ hie
& to me gelædaþ; & gif inc hwa þæs wiþcweþe, secggaþ
þæt Drihten þæs ah þearfe, raþe hie mon þonne forlæteþ to
me.
 79. Þis wæs geworden, forþon þæt se witedom wære
gefylled þe ær gecweden wæs, Secggaþ Siones dohtrum þæt heora
cining cymeþ, milde & monþwære, & biþ sittende ofor eoselan
folan þæs nytenes.
 82. His þegnas þa dydon swa he him bebead, læddon him to
þone eosol, & gedydon þæt he þær on gesittan mihte.
 84. Eal þæt folc þæt þær beforan ferde, streowodan
heora hrægl him togeanes, sume naman þa twigu of þæm treowum, &
streowodan on þone weg.
 86. Seo menigo þe þær beforan ferde, & seo se þær
æfterfylgde, ealle hie cegdon, & cwædon, Hælend, Dauides Sunu,
þu eart gebletsad on Drihtnes naman, hæl us on heanessum.
 89. Mid þy þe Hælend þa eode on þa ceastre, eal seo burh
wæs onstyred, & þa ceasterware cegdon & cwædon, hwæt is
þes mihtiga þe her þus mærlice fereþ?
 92. Þæt folc him ondswarode & cwæþ, Hit is se
Nadzarenisca witga of Galileum, se sceal beon gehered ofor ealle þeoda, &
geweorþod ge of cilda muþe meolcsucendra.
 94. He þa ineode on þæt halige Salemannes templ, & þa
ut awearp þa sceomolas þara cypemanna, & þa setl þara mynetera,
& cwæþ, Min hus sceal beon gebedhus geceged, & ge hit doþ
sceaþum to scrafum.
 98. Him þa to eodan blinde & healte, & he hie raþe
gehælde.
 99. Eal þis wæs geworden toþon þæt we sceoldan ures
Drihtnes wundor oncnawan, & mid mycelre lufan hine arwyrþian.
 101. Cwæþ se godspellere, Hælend com syx dagum ær
eastrum to Bethania; on þon is getacnod þæt he com on þære syxtan
ylde on þysne middangeard mancyn to alysenne.
 103. Ne forlet ure Drihten þysne middangeard na leng buton
lareowum þonne twa hund wintra, ac he sende hehfæderas & witgan þa
hine toweard sædon.
 106. Swa he þonne þa syx dagas ær his þrowunga synderlic
weorc ælce dæge cyþde, ærest on þæm Sæteres dæge he
awehte Ladzarum of deaþe, & on þæm drihtenlican Sunnandæge þe
nu ondweard is, he wæs to cinge ongyten & gehered, ge of cilda muþe
gecnawen & weorþad.
 110. & on þæm æfteran dæge he awergde þæt
fictreow, on þæm he nanne wæstm ne funde; þæt getacnaþ þa
synfullan þe nabbaþ nanne wæstm godra weorca.
 113. Þy þriddan dæge he cwæþ to his þegnum, Nu on
twam nihtum biþ mannes sunu geseald on synfulra hand.
 115. Þy feorþan dæge he wæs on Simones huse þæs
licþroweres, þærin geat þæt wif þa deorwyrþan smerenesse on his
heafod.
 117. Þy fiftan dæge he þwoh his þegna fet, & sæt
mid him æt þæm æfengereordum, & his lichoman him sealde on
hlafe, & his blod on wine.
 119. & þe syxtan dæge Iudeas hine ahengan on rode,
þær he his blod ageat for ure hæle, & us alesde of deofles
þeowdome.
 121. Cwæþ se godspellere, Martha & Maria getacniaþ þis
lænelice lif & þis gewitendlice; Martha onfeng Crist on hire hus
þæt heo him þegnode.
 123. Hwæt tacnaþ heo buton þa halgan cyricean, þæt synd
geleaffulle menn þa gearwiaþ clæne wununga on heora heortum Criste
sylfum?
 125. He cwæþ, Ic eardige on him, & ic beo heora God on
ecnesse.
 126. Be þæm se apostol cwæþ, Se ælmihtiga God secþ
þa clænan heortan him on to eardienne; þonne ne mæg þæt Godes
templ beon besmiten, ac se Godes man sceal beon fulfremed on rihtwisum
weorcum.
 130. Cwæþ se writere þæt Maria gename an pund
deorwyrþre smyrenesse, & smyrede mid þæs Hælendes fet, & mid
hire loccum dregde; þa wæs eal þæt hus gefylled mid þon swetan
stence.
 133. Þeos smerenes wæs geworht of ehtatene cynna wyrtum,
þær wæron þreo þa betstan ele, & nardus, & spica, seo is
brunes heowes & godes stences, & þæt næfre ne afulaþ þæt
mid hire gesmered biþ.
 136. Þis wæs us gedon to lifes bysene, & gif we nu
willaþ ure saula smerian mid mildheortnesse ele, þonne magon we bringan
Drihtne unforwealwodne wæstm godra weorca.
 139. Gemunon we symle þæt we þa god don þe us Godes bec
læraþ, þæt is þonne, fæsten and halige wæccan, &
ælmessylena æfter urum gemete; & mid manegum oþrum gastlicum
mægenum we magon geearnian þæt we urum Drihtne bringaþ godra weorca
swetne stenc.
 143. Maria seo þe sæt be Hælendes fotum þæt heo wolde
geheran his word & his lara, heo tacnaþ þa halgan cyricean on þære
toweardan worlde, seo biþ gefreolsod fram eallum gewinnum, & heo biþ on
þære sceawunga anre þæs heofonlican þremmes, & heo resteþ on
onsyne ures Drihtnes, & hine hereþ unablinnendlice.
 148. Þæt cyþde Iohannes se godspellere, þæt he geherde
engla þreatas Gode lof singan, & þus cweþan, Wyrþe þu eart,
Drihten God, þæt þu onfo wuldor, & are, & mægen, &
bletsunga, & dæda þancunga, ealra þinra gesceafta þe þu
gesceope, on heofenum & on eorþan, æfter þinum willan.
 153. Lazarus, þe Crist awehte þy feorþan dæge þæs
þe he on byrgenne wæs ful wunigende, he getacnaþ þysne middangeard, se
wæs mid þon gewunon þære heofogoston gewemmednesse synna & mana
full.
 156. Efne swa seo hefige byrþen siteþ on þæm deadan
lichoman þære byrgenne & þæs deaþes, & hie se stan &
seo eorþe þrycce, swa sæt þonne seo unaræfnedlice byrþen synna on
eallum þysum menniscan cynne ures Drihtnes Hælendes Cristes.
 160. Nu we sceolan onherian Marian þære þe smerede
Hælendes fet, & mid hire loccum drygde; þæt is þonne, þæt we
sceolan god weorc wyricean, & rihtlice libban, þonne fylge we Drihtnes
swæþe, þæt is gif we oþre men teala læraþ, & hie be urum
larum rihtlice for Gode libbaþ, þonne bringe we Drihtne swetne stenc on
urum dædum & larum.
 165. Swa Paulus se apostol cwæþ, Drihtnes fet we magon
smerian, gif we willaþ oþrum geleaffullum teala don, & helpan þæs
earman se þe bet mæge, & beon symle efenþrowgende oþres
earfoþum, swylce eac on oþres gode beon swiþe gefeonde.
 169. Cwæþ se godspellere þæt Iudas wære swyþe
gebolgen for þære smerenesse; he cwæþ þæt nyttre wære
þæt hie man gesealde to þrim hunde penega, & þa þonne gedælde
þearfendum mannum.
 172. Iudas hæfde onlicnesse þara manna þe willaþ Godes
cyricean yfelian & strudan, & hwæþere se þe wæs lareow, &
soþfæstnesse bysen, & cining ealre clænnesse, forlet mid him beon
þone godwracan þeof.
 175. Ac mid þære bysene, he gecyþde þæt soþfæste
men habbaþ mid him þeofas & synfulle men; & hwæþere hie
sceolan heora yfel geþylde arefnan on him selfum.
 178. Crist us onstealde geþyldelice bysene; ne cwæþ he na to
Iudan, þis þu cwist for þinre gitsunge & for þinre stale; ac he
cwæþ, Læt þis þus wesan, god weorc heo wæs wyrcende in me.
 181. Mid þyssum wordum he gecyþde þæt he wolde beon
swyltende; he cwæþ, Symle ge habbað þearfan, ac ge me symle nabbaþ.
 183. Ne biþ seo halige cirice næfre buton þearfan.
 184. Þa ane men habbaþ Crist on heora heortan, þe geteode
beoþ to þon ecean life.
 185. Crist sylfa cwæþ, Symle ge me habbaþ mid geleaffullum
mannum ondweardne, þurh þone mægenþrym minre godcundnesse;
hwæþere seo beholene ondweardnes ne gewat from us.
 188. Manige men hine habbaþ þurh þæt halige fulwiht, &
þurh rihtne geleafan Cristes onsægdnesse, þe we æt þæm weofode
nimaþ; ac þa men þa þe on woh lifiaþ, nabbaþ hie na Crist on heora
heortan, ac hie gearwiaþ deoflum eardunga, & him selfum ece wite.
 192. Cwæþ se godspellere, þa ealdormen þara sacerda
þohtan þæt hie woldan Lazarum ofslean, & þa unlædan noldan
geþencean þæt Drihten hine mihte eft aweccean, swa he hine ær of
sawle deaþe awehte þurh þone mægenþrym.
 196. Matheus se godspellere sægde, þa Hælend wolde
genealæcean Gerusalem, þa com he ær to Betfage.
 197. Wel þæt gedafenode þa he of heofenum to eorþan cwom,
þæt he wolde þrowian for þis mennisce cynn, & þære tide
nealæhte ure alesnesse.
 199. Betfage, se tun, getacnaþ þa halgan cyricean on þære
biþ sungen þæt halige geryne, & men þær heora synna andettaþ,
& him þær forgifnesse biddaþ.
 202. We gehyrdan ær þætte Hælend sende his twegen
þegnas; þa tacniaþ halige lareowas, þæt hie sceolan þurhwunian on
rihtum geleafan & on fulfremedlicum weorcum, & hie sceolan læran
Godes lufan & manna, buton þæm twam ne mæg nan man becuman to
þæm ecean life.
 206. He cwæþ: Gaþ on þa wic þe beforan inc stondeð.
 207. Hwæt Drihten þa cynelican burh forhogodlice naman nemde;
forþon oft wic beoþ on manegum stowum medmyccle gesette; seo ceaster
þonne wæs heh & aldorlic; ah forþon Crist þa mycclan burh &
þa halgan Gerusalem swa forhogdlice nemde, forþon þe þa burhware him
wæron for heora ungeleafan & mandædum swiþe forhogde &
ungecorene.
 213. & eac he wiste þæt wite þæt him toweard wæs,
& þæt þæt seo burh sceolde abrocen weorþan & bereafod, swa
he his apostolum sægde, þa hie emb þone þrym & emb þa
fægernesse þæs temples & ðære burge to Criste spræcan,
& cwædan þæt hit wære þrymlic geweorc & fæger.
 218. Drihten him þa ondswerede & cwæþ, Hwæt ge nu
geseoþ ealle þa fægernessa þissa getimbra, soþ is þæt ic eow
seccge; þæt þæt geo weorþeð for þyses folces synnum &
mandædum, þæt ealle þas getimbro beoþ toworpene, & her ne bið
forlæten stan ofor stan, þæt ælc ne sy fram oþrum adon.
 222. Swa swa hit seoþþan gelamp <foreign>xl</foreign> wintra æfter þon ðe
hie Crist on rode ahengon, & for manna hælo lichoman deaþ he
þrowode.
 224. A he onbad, þurh þa mycclan geþyld, þæt feowertig
wintra hweþer hie gecyrran woldan, oþþe ænige hreowe & dædbote
don þæs mycclan yfeles & manes, þe hie wið heora Drihten gedydon,
& eac wiþ manige his haligra.
 228. Þa he þa geseah þæt hie nænige bote ne hreowe don
noldan, ah hie for þon heora yfelum þurhwunedon, Drihten þa sende on hie
maran wræce þonne æfre ær ænigu oþru gelumpe, buton Sodomwarum
anum.
 231. Þæt wæs þonne þa Titus com mid Romana herige,
& him wræc þæt hie heora cyning on rode ahengon.
 233. Þa leode þa flugon þa hie þone here toweardne wiston
on þa burh Gerusalem.
 234. Titus þa se casere embsæt þa burh utan mid herige,
& þær lange gewicode, oþþæt hie hungre swultan þe on
þære byrig wæron; and hie for þæm hungre þa burh werian ne
mihton, ac se casere hie þa abræc, & þæs folces þæne
mæstan dæl ofslog.
 238. Wæs þara manna eallra þe þær ofslegene wæron
& hungre swultan, mid wifmannum & wæpnedmannum, endleofan siþum
hund teontig þusenda; & þa hi gyt genaman þæs folces þe
þær to lafe wæs, & him selost licodan, hund teontig þusenda, and
mid him læddon on hæftned; & ehtatyne syþum hund teontig þusenda
hi tosendon, & wið feo sealdon wide into leodscipas.
 244. Ealles þæs folces wæs, þe se casere Titus innon
Ierusalem beferde, þrittigun syþum hund teontig þusenda, & þæt
eal for Godes wræce fordyde, & þæt land gesetton swa hie sylfe
woldon.
 248. Wæs þæt wite swa strang, swa Godes geþeld ær
mycel wæs.
 249. Drihten cwæþ to his þegnum, Gyt gemetaþ eoselan
gebundene & hire folan, lædað hine to me.
 250. Hwæt tacnaþ se eosel þe Drihten Crist on sittan wolde,
buton þæt geleaffulle folc Iudea, and eac oþor manig þa þe beoð
Gode underþeodde on godum willan, & þæs wyrþe beoþ þæt hie
heofon cining on heora heortum beran?
 254. He hie gereceþ to eallum godum, and he hie gelædeþ on
sibbe gesyhþe; forþon þære burge nama þe is nemned Gerusalem is
gereht sibbe gesyhþ, forþon þe halige saula þær restaþ.
 257. He cwæþ þæt his þegnas dydon swa he him bebead.
 258. Cuþlice þæt tacnaþ þæt þas lareowas ne sceolan
Godes domas nawþer ne na wanian ne ne ecan, buton swa hie God sylf gesette.
 260. Þa lareowas sceolan heora agenne lichoman swencean on
forhæfdnesse, & godes lifes bysene onstellan þæm þe him
æfterfylgeon, & Drihtnes weg gegearwian to heora modum.
 263. Hwæt tacnaþ seo menigo þe þær beforan ferde, buton
þæt Iudisce folc on þæm wæs se halga heap hehfædera &
witgena, þa þe Cristes tocyme wiston & foresægdon, & þa wundro
þe he worhte, & his þrowunga, & his æriste, & his
upastignesse.
 267. Ealle hie cleopodan & cwædon anre stefne: Hælend,
Dauides sunu, þu eart gebletsod, þu þe come on Drihtnes naman, hæl us
on þæm hehstan.
 269. Þæt æfterfylgende weorod tacnaþ ealle þaþe
seoþþan æfter Cristes cyme wæron to gode gecyrrede.
 270. Nu þonne sceolan cleopian ealle geleaffulle mid clænre
heortan & mid hlutrum gebedum, & mid lare haligra gewreota, þa þe
hine lufian & ongelyfan.
 273. Hie cwædon, hæl us on þon hehstan, efne swa swa hie
openlice cwædon, Hæle us on eorþan, þu þe godcund mægen hafast
on heofenum.
 275. Eac us is to ongytene þæt hie cwædon, Hæl us on
eorþan we þe synt on lichomum lifgende, & eac þa þe on helle synt
biddaþ þinre onlesnesse & þinre hælo, & swa dydon fram fruman
middangeardes.
 279. Wel þæt gedafenode þæt þæt ærre folc
cwæde & eac þæt æfterre, Gebletsad þu eart, þu þe come on
Drihtnes noman; forþon hit wæs an geleafa & an hiht on þa halgan
þrynesse ær Cristes tocyme.
 282. & æfter þon we singaþ rihtlice on his lof, Hæl
us on þæm hehstan.
 283. Eal seo stihtung wæs gefremed on þære soþan
onflæscnesse for gefyllnesse þæs heofonlican eþles.
 285. Þa halgan ær Cristes cyme on hine gelyfdon, & hine
lufodan, & hine toweardne sægdon, & mid his þrowunga hie wurdan
alesde of helle wite, & mid his æriste gehælde.
 288. We þonne synt þe þær æfter fylgeaþ; & we
witon eall þis þus geworden, forðon we sceolan on hine gelyfan, &
hine lufian, & we eac witon þæt he is toweard to demenne, & þas
world to geendenne.
 291. Nu we habbaþ myccle nedþearfe þæt he us gearwe
finde.
 292. We witon ful geare þæt we sceolan on þisse sceortan
tide geearnian ece ræste, þonne motan we in þære engellican blisse
gefeon mid urum Drihtne, þær he leofað & rixað abuton ende, on
ecnesse, Amen.

HomS 22 (CenDom 1)
B3.2.22.
In Cena Domini: Assmann 1889, 151-63.



 2. Sægeð on ðysum bocum be ðære arwurðnysse þyses
halgan dæges and be ðære unasecgendlican mildheortnysse ures drihtnes
hælendes Cristes, hu arfæstlice he on ðysum dæge manncynne
eadmodnysse bisne onstealde.
 5. Swa he us æghwylces godes bisne beforan onstealde, dyde he,
swa se soða lareow don sceolde.
 5. He æghwæðer ge he us mid his wordum lærde, ge eac mid
his bisenum beforan tacnode, hu we don sceoldon.
 7. Þonne wæs on ðysum dæge, þætte ure drihten
ælmihtig god hine sylfne to ðan geeadmedde, þæt he to manna fotum
onhnah and his þegna fet þwoh, swa we nu heræfter geheran magon, hu
arwurðlice se eadiga godspellere Sanctus Iohannes, se ðe synderlice Cristes
dyrling wæs, þa drihtenlican þenunge æfter þysse endebyrdnysse
sægeð and þus cweð: <foreign>Ante diem festum paschæ sciens Iesus, quia
venit hora, ut transeat ex hoc mundo ad patrem</foreign>, ær ðam symbeldæge
þæra eastrona, þe hi on ðære ealdan æ weorðodon, þa wiste se
hælend, þæt seo tid com, þæt he of ðysum middanearde on heofonas
to godfæder feran wolde, þanon he næfre sona wæs þurh his þa
ecan godcundnysse.
 18. He drihten wolde ærest her on middaneard gebreman and
geweorðian þa Iudeiscan æfter þære wisan, þe on ðære ealdan
æ beboden wæs, and þonne wolde þære ende gesettan and þonne
wolde eac þysse niwan frymð gesettan, þa we nu weorðiað on drihtnes
ciricum, þæt is þæt he wolde his sylfes lichaman and his blod
gehalgian manncynne to hælu and to life.
 23. Sceolon we þæt witan, þætte se halga lichama ures
drihtnes, þe we nu on cirican þicgað, þæt is þæt halige husul,
þætte þæt wæs ærest on ðysum dæge gehalgod mancynne eces
lifes to wedde, forðan æghwylc þæra manna, se ðe þam rihtlice
onfehð, æghwylc þæra onfehð eces lifes wed.
 28. <foreign>Cum dilexisset suos, qui erant in mundo</foreign>, He drihten lufode
his þa halgan, þa ðe on ðysum middanearde wæron.
 29. Rihtlice þæt is gecweden, forðan þe he ða lufan to
ðæs forð wið heo gecydde, þæt he efne lichamlicne deað for
heora hælo geðrowade.
 31. Þa gefylde he sylf þone cwide, þe he ær cwæð:
<foreign>Maiorem namque hac dilectione nemo habet</foreign>, He cwæð: Ne mæg nan man
wið oðerne maran lufan gecyðan, þonne þæt hwylc mann his sylfes
feorh for his freond sette.
 35. Hwæt, he þonne þa lufan ure drihten swiðe healice
wið eall mancyn gecydde, þa he, swa ic ær sæde, se heofonlica cyning
for ealra manna hælu lichamlice deað geðrowade.
 37. Forðan we sceolon nu þære micclan lufan urum drihtne
singallice þancian, æghwæðer ge mid wordum, ge mid dædum, ge eac
mid ealre heortan meagolnysse.
 40. <foreign>In festivitate Iudeorum facta est cena domini</foreign>, On Iudea
symbelnysse wæron geworden drihtnes æfengereordu.
 41. And se hælend wæs hlionigende æt ðam gereordum mid
his apostolum and mid heom mete þigde.
 43. Þa wæs se ealda feond his inwites and his facnes swiðe
gemyndig.
 44. Sænde þa hine sylfne on ðæs mannes heortan, þe
Iudas wæs gehaten, and hine lærde, þæt he sceolde drihten to deaðe
belæwan.
 46. Wæs he þes ilca Iudas þa mid þam hælende æt
ðam gereordum.
 47. And he wæs ær on ðæra twelf apostola rim geteald,
ær he þa hine sylfne swiðe earme and unlædlice of ðære gemanan
and of ðære gemynde ealra godes gecorenra adwæscte and adilgode, þurh
þæt þe he mid his þweorre heortan þone wealdend and þone heorde
heofonas and eorðan swiðe arleaslice on synfulra manna handa to cwale
gesealde.
 52. He cwæð se godspellere, þæt se deofol hit sænde on
ðæs mannes heortan, þe Iudas wæs gehaten.
 53. Næs na, þæt se feond him openlice utan to spræce
þurh earena gehyrnysse, ac his heortan and his modgeðanc innan to ðan
lærde and scynde, þæt he hine drihten to deaðe belæwde.
 56. And eall þæt se deofol þær mynte manncynne to ðam
mæstan yfele gedon, eall þæt eft mancynne to ðam mæstan gode
geeode, forðan ðe ure drihten þurh his lichamlice þrowunge us ealle of
ecum deaðe generede.
 59. <foreign>Sciens, quia omnia dedit ei pater in manu sua</foreign>, He wiste,
þæt him godfæder eall on his handa and on his anwealde gesealde.
 61. Ealle godcundlice gesceafta standað on drihtnes gewealdum,
forðan ðe he is se ilca god, se ðe ealle gesceafta gesceop and geworhte.
 63. Ealle þing he ætsamne gesihð and sceawað and ealle
þing him beoð opene and cuðe.
 64. Nis æniges mannes modgeðanc to ðæs deagol, þæt
hit him behyded sy.
 66. He drihten þæt ongeat and geseah, þæt se deofol
þone Iudas lærde, þæt he hine belæwde.
 67. Ac þæt he þeah hwæðere geðyldelice abær and
gemetfæstlice scirde, forðan þe he þæt wiste, þæt hit æfter
his geteohhunge agan sceolde.
 69. Wiste he, þæt he on his sylfes gewealdum and on his
godcundre mihte hæfde æghwæðer ge ðone læwend, ge ðone
lærend, ge eac þa sylfan, þa ðe hine eft afengon, be eallum þam he
don mihte, swa swa he wolde, and he wiste, þæt he heo ealle hæfde on
his anwealde.
 73. And eall þæt yfel and ealne þone nið, þe heo wið
hine gefremedon, eall he drihten þæt þurh hine sylfne mancynne to gode
gecyrde, forðan ðe godes miht is, þæt he ana mæg æghwæt to
gode gecyrran.
 76. <foreign>Et quia a Deo exivit et ad Deum vadit</foreign>, And he wiste, þæt
he fram godfæder on middaneard asended wæs and þætte he eft to
godfæder feran wolde.
 78. Soðlice þeah ðe he drihten us hider on middaneard
eadmodlice gesohte on menniscne lichaman, hwæðere swa þeah he englas
blissode on he rice and him þær wuldre and gefean heold.
 81. And þeah ðe he eft of ðysum middanearde to godfæder on
heofonas ferde, hwæðere he her on worulde mid his gecorenum wunað,
forðan his mihte synt, þæt he æghwær sy and he þurh his
godcundnysse æghwær andweard bið.
 85. <foreign>Surgit a cena et posuit vestimenta sua</foreign>, He ða aras se
hælend, cwæð þa se godspellere, fram þam gecorenum and his hrægl
asette.
 87. He cwæð, þæt he his hrægl asette.
 87. He mænde, þæt he hit on anre stowe alede.
 88. Mid þy he getacnode, þæt he wolde his þone halgan
lichaman on deað gesettan for ealles mancynnes hælu.
 90. He hwæðere eft þone ilcan lichaman swiðe wlitigne and
wundorlicne gefremede þurh his þa halgan ærist.
 91. <foreign>Et cum accepisset linteum, praecinxit se</foreign>.
 92. He ða onfeng line and hine mid begyrde, þæt is, þæt
he onfeng þære mæstan strengðu, mid þære he þysne middaneard
alysde.
 94. And we eac witan, þæt þæt bið þegnes riht,
þonne he wile teala þenian, þæt he hine sceal to ðan gyrdan and
gearwian, þæt he mæge oðrum mannum gedafenlice þenian.
 96. To ðan se heofonlica cyning ælmihtig god us hider on
middaneard gesohte on menniscum lichaman, þæt he us wolde þurh his
tocyme ece lif þenian and forgeofan, swa he gedyde þurh his þa halgan
þrowunge and þurh his þa eadmodan lare, þe he mancynne her on
middanearde sæde and cydde.
 101. <foreign>Deinde misit aquam in pelvem</foreign>, He ða het geotan wæter on
mundleow and ongan his þegna fet þwean and þæran mid þy line, þe
he wæs begyrded.
 103. Hwæt, he drihten on ðysse dæde þa his word and
þone his cwide fægere gefylde, þe he ær sylf cwæð: <foreign>Non veni
ministrari, sed ministrare</foreign>, He cwæð: Ne com ic na to ðan on middaneard,
þæt ic wolde, þæt me menn þenedon, ac þæt ic wolde mannum
þenian.
 107. On ðære eadmodlican bisene is æteowed, þæt men
sceoldon him betweonon beon eadmode and þætte seo idele oferhygd þyses
middaneardes sceal beon geflemed þurh þa eadmodnysse þæs þenigendan
Cristes.
 110. <foreign>Venit ergo ad Simonem Petrum</foreign>, He ða com to his ðegne,
þe Petrus wæs gehaten.
 112. Næs na, þæt he latost to him come, ac he ealra
ærest to him eode, and he ærest æt him ongan heora fet þwean,
forðan ðe he wæs þæra apostola ealdorman.
 114. Geearnode he þy syððan, þe he drihten heora ealra
modgeðances cunnode and be him sylfum hi ealle befran, hwæt hi wendon,
þæt he wære.
 116. Þa cwæð Petrus him to andsware: <foreign>Tu es Christus, filius
Dei vivi</foreign>, þu eart Crist, þæs lifigendan godes sunu.
 118. Þa on ðære drihtenlican andetnysse geearnode he þone
ealdordom ealra godes ciricena and þa cægian heofona rices.
 119. He drihten com to Petre, swa ic ær sæde and wolde his
fet þwean.
 121. Þa cwæð he Petrus to him: Hu mæg þæt, min
drihten, swa beon, þæt þu mine fet þwea?
 122. Efne swa swa he cwæde: Ic eom þurh mine tydderlice gecynd
lichamlic man and þu eart ece god ealra gesceafta.
 124. Nis þæt forðan gedafenlic, þæt þu to minum fotum
onhnige.
 125. Cwæð he Crist to him: þæt þæt ic her do, nast
þu þæt geta, for hwan ic swa do; þu hit þonne wast hwæðere
æfter þysum and ic hit þe gesecge.
 127. He drihten geseah forhtian þæs his þegnes mod for his
þære eadmodlican þenunge.
 128. Þa trymede he hine mid his þa gewunelican arfæstnysse,
þæt he geðyldelice bidan sceolde, hwænne he him eft þæt geryne
gesæde þære eadmodlican þenunge.
 131. Þa cwæð him Petrus to: <foreign>Non lavabis mihi pedes in
aeternum</foreign>, Min drihten, ne þwehst þu næfre mine fet.
 132. He forhtade, swa ic ær cwæð, for ðære drihtnes
eadmodnysse; þuhte him þæt wundorlic and egeslic, þæt se heofonlica
cyning to his fotum onhnigan sceolde.
 135. Se man ana wæs, þætte eadmodnysse wiðsoc and
hwæðere for hyrsumnysse geðafode.
 136. Cwæð him to se hælend: Gif ic ne þwea þine fet,
þonne nafast þu dæl mid me.
 137. On ðysum is gecyðed, þæt seo onðwægennyss
þæra fota gastlice tacnað gehwæðer ge lichaman clænnysse, ge eac
sawle, efne þan gelicost, þe he cwæde: Gemune þu and onget, þæt
ælc þæra manna, se ðe æfter þysse worulde mid me on heofona rice
eardian sceal, þæt he þonne sceal nu ær þurh minne fultum and
þurh mine geofe fram his synnum geclænsod beon, þa cwæð he Petrus
to him: <foreign>Domine, non tantum pedes meos</foreign>.
 144. Drihten, næs na þæt an, þæt þu mine fet þwea,
ac þu eac þweh mine handa and min heafod.
 145. Efne swa swa he cwæde: Nu ðu, drihten, þus egeslice
beotast, þæt ic elles næbbe dæl mid þe, buton þu mine fet
þwea, nis nu ænig dæl mines lichaman, þæt ic þe wiðsacan
wille, þæt þu hine þwea, ac þu hine ealne þweh.
 148. Þa cwæð he Crist to him: Se man, se ðe aþwægen
bið, ne bið him þæs þearf, þæt hine man eft þwea, ac he
þonne bið eall clæne.
 150. Hwæt mænde he drihten on ðam wordum?
 151. Hwæt, we witan, þæt ne bið ænig man to ðæs
clæne aðwægen, þæt he þæs hwæðere næbbe þearfe,
þæt he hine eft þwea.
 153. Ac he mænde, swa ic ær cwæð, þa gastlican
onþwægennysse, þæt is þæt halige fulwihtes bæð and synna
forlætennysse, forðan se man, se ðe rihtlice gefulwad bið, se bið
eall clæne.
 156. Ne sceal hine man eft fulwian, ne þæt alefed nis.
 156. Ac þa synna and incan, þe him syððan gelimpað,
þonne sceal he ða þurh clæne andetnysse and þurh medeme bote and
þurh his tearas hi eft aðwean, þæt he eft þurh þæt clæne
geweorðe.
 159. <foreign>Et vos mundi estis, sed non omnes</foreign>, and ge syndon clæne,
cwæð he Crist to ðam his þegnum, næs na hwæðere ealle.
 161. Her on ðysum cwide wæs þæra apostola toscadennys.
 162. Ealle hi wæron clæne buton Iudas ana.
 162. He wæs læwa and myrðra and furðon he hine sylfne
swiðe unlædlice mid grine aheng and awyrigde and swa ungesæliglice to
ecan deaðe and to ecum witum wæs geniðerad.
 165. Forðan he drihten þæt cwæð, þæt hi ealle
næron clæne, forðan þe he þæt geare wiste, hwylc heora þæt
wæs, þæt hine belæwan mynte, swa he æghwilcne ænne man
sceawað, æghwæðer ge ða dæda utan, ge eac ða heortan and
þone modgeðanc innan, <foreign>Postquam ergo lavit pedes eorum</foreign>.
 169. Æfterþan þe se hælend þa hæfde heora fet
geþwagen, þa onfeng he eft his hrægle and hine mid gegerede.
 171. On ðam wæs getacnod, þæt æfterþam þe he ure
drihten for ealles mancynnes hælu lichamlice deað geðrowade and he
þysne middaneard aðwoh and generede mid his þy deorwurðan blode,
þæt he þa eft onfeng his þam unwæmman gegerelan, þæt is his
þam halgan lichaman, þe he ær for manna hælu on ðrowade, þone he
eft wundorlicne and undeadlicne gefremede þurh his þa halgan ærist.
 177. <foreign>Et cum recubuisset iterum, dixit eis: Scitis, quid fecerim
vobis</foreign>, þa se hælend hine þa gegered hæfde, þa gesæt he eft
æt ðam gereordum and to ðam apostolum cwæð: Witan ge, hwæt ic
eow dyde?
 180. Ic wolde mid þam gecyðan, þæt ge þæt wisten, nu
ic eowre fet þwoh, þe eower drihten and eower lareow eom, þæt eower
sceal æghwylc oðres fet þwean.
 182. And ic eow þæt dyde to bisene, þæt ic me to ðam
geeadmette, þæt ic eow nu mid eadmodnysse þenade, þæt eower
æghwylc sceal swa oðrum mid eadmodnysse þenian.
 185. On ðysum cwide us is openlice gecyðed and æteowed,
þæt we þæs habbað miccle nedþearfe, þæt we symle tiligen on
æghwylce tid mid ælmihtiges godes fultume, æghwæðer ge geonge ge
ealde, ge heane ge rice.
 188. Þæt we sibbe and lufan and eadmodnysse us betweonan
healden and þæt ure æghwylc on oðres god fægnige and æghwylc
oðrum to gode fultumige and eac þætte æghwylc man wið oðerne
arful sy, ge on wordum, ge on dædum, ge on ðeningum, ge on ælcum
þæra goda, þe he him to are gecweðen oððe gedon mæge.
 193. Eac swylce we sceolon þysne cwide swa ongytan, þæt we
on ðam gemete, þe he drihten us ure synna forlæteð þurh andetnysse
and þurh bote, þæt we þonne sceolon swa urum þam nextan forlætan
ealle þa eornesse and þa æfþancan, þe hi wið us gewyrcað.
 197. Ac uton nu tilian, þæt we don æfter þære
drihtenlican bisene, swa he us bebead.
 198. Uton we æghwæðer ge ealle are, ge ealle eadmodnysse on
urum dædum healdan and don wið ure þa nextan, þæt is wið ealle
men, þe gefulwade syndon.
 200. And uton forlætan and forgeofan ealle þa æfðoncan
and þa eornesse, þe oðre men wið eow gefremmen.
 202. <foreign>Amen, amen dico vobis: Non est servus maior domino suo</foreign>,
Soð is, soð is, þæt ic eow secge, cwæð se hælend to ðam his
þegnum, þæt se þeowa ne bið þonne betera, ne þonne riccra,
þonne se his hlaford, ne se ærendraca þonne selra, ne ðonne wurðra,
þonne se ðe hine sendeð.
 206. Efne swa swa he cwæde: Huru ge synd þonne beteran, þe
ic, þe eower drihten and eower lareow eom.
 208. Nu ic þæt ne forhogode, þæt ic eow þus mid
eadmodnysse þenode, þæt eower þonne þæt ne sceal ænig
forhycgan, þæt he oðrum mid eadmodnysse þenige æghwæðer ge
ðas þenunge, ge ælce þæra þe he him to gode geðenian mæge.
 211. Nu ge þas þing witan, eadige ge beoð, gif ge heo
gelæstað.
 212. Soðlice þa menn beoð eadige, þa ðe godes bebodu
gefyllað, forðan ðe hi onfoð ecere mede and ecum gefean æfter
þysum life.
 214. He drihten wat, hwa his æ healdeð and hwa þa
begangeð, swa he sylf heræfter to his apostolum be ðam cwæð: <foreign>Non
de omnibus vobis dico</foreign>, Ne cweðe ic na þas þing be eow eallum; ic wat,
hwæne ic geceose.
 217. On ðeosum wordum se ungesæliga Iudas wæs openlice
oncunnen, se ðe þurh his inwit and þurh his facen ælmihtigne drihten
to deaðe gesealde, þæne þe is mennisces cynnes alysend and ealra
gesceafta reccend and hyrde.
 221. He cwæð se hælend be ðam ilcan Iudan: <foreign>Qui manducat
mecum panem</foreign>, He cwæð: Se man, se ðe þigeð þysne hlaf mid me, he
ahefð his helan wið me.
 223. Wa ðam þe þurh þæne bið mannes sunu to deaðe
geseald.
 224. Miccle him wære betere, þæt he næfre on ðas
woruld acenned ne wære.
 225. Efne swa ungesæliglice se ungetreowa Iudas þam lareowe
deað sætade, swa him eall his lif to ungesælðum and to ermðum
wearð.
 227. <foreign>Amen, amen, dico vobis, quia unus ex vobis me tradet</foreign>, Soð
is, soð is, þæt ic eow secge, þæt eower an me to deaðe selleð.
 229. Openlice he drihten beforan him eallum sæde þætte
Iudas wende, þæt þam hælende bemiðen wære, and swa dysigne and
swa heardre heortan, þæt he þæs hwæðere nænige hreowe dyde,
ne nænig andgit hæfde.
 232. Þa locedan þa discipulas him betweonan and wæron on
heora modgeþance swiðlice afyrhte and gedrefde, swa hit nænig fyren
wæs, and ymb þæt þohton, be hwylcum heora he þæt word
gecwæde.
 235. Wiste he drihten ana, hwa his læwend and myrðra wæs,
swa swa him nan þing bemiðen beon mæg.
 236. Þa wæs þara discipula an ofer þæs hælendes
bearm hlionigende.
 237. Wæs þæt þes ilca Iohannes, se ðe þis æfter
endebyrdnysse sægeð, lufade hine se hælend synderlice.
 239. Þa becnade Sanctus Petrus him, þæt he sceolde æt
ðam hælende geacsian, be hwilcum heora he þæt word gecwæde,
willnedon þa apostolas symle æghwylc riht and soðfæstnysse to
witanne.
 242. And hi miccle ma drihtnes wordum gelyfdon, þonne him sylfum,
forðan heora æghwylc be heom sylfum synderlice þus cwæð: <foreign>Numquid
ego sum, domine</foreign>, Ac ic hit, drihten eom?
 244. Butan Iudas ana, he swigade lengest, forðan þe he wæs
on his wordum þam oðrum swa ungelic, swa he wæs on his geearnungum,
þeah ðe he ealra latost and eac bealdlicost cwæde: <foreign>Numquid ego sum,
rabbi</foreign>, Sægest þu lareow, þæt ic hit sy?
 248. Þa cwæð he Crist him to andsware: <foreign>Tu dixisti</foreign>,
þæt þu cwæde.
 249. Þa hlionode Sanctus Iohannes ofer þæs hælendes
breost, swa ic ær sæde, acsode hine þa and him to cwæð: Min
drihten, hwylc ure is þæt, þæt þa dæde gedon mynteð, þæt
he ðe belæwe?
 252. Þa andswarode him se hælend and him to cwæð: Se hit
is, se ðe ic þysne bedeptan hlaf ræcan wille.
 254. Bestang þa þone hlaf, þe he him on handa hæfde, on
þæt sealtfæt, þe him beforan stod, and þa sealde þam
Scariothiscan Iudan and he hine þa sona ætt.
 256. And æfter þam breades sticce eode him on þæt
wiðerwearde deofol.
 257. And he þa sona þanon ut gewat, swa he syððan fram
eallum his ræde gewiten wæs.
 258. Þa ongan he drihten heom endleofenum openlice his þa
halgan þrowunge secgan and eall þa þing, þe he wolde and geteohhad
hæfde, þæt be him geweorðan sceolde.
 261. Sægeð man eft to merigenne, hu þæt geworden
wære.
 262. Ac uton nu geþæncan, men, be ðære bysene, þe se
hælend þam Scariothiscan Iudan þone hlaf sealde, þæt us is on ðam
micel wærlicnys getacnad and æteowed on ðære onfangennysse ures
drihtnes lichaman, þæt is þonne þæs halgan husles.
 265. Uton forðan tilian, þæt we syn clæne and unwæmme
þam to onfonne, swa swa þa oðre apostolas wæron, næs na swa swa
Iudas wæs, to þan þæt we magon and moton beon dælneomende godes
rices mid urum drihtne hælende Criste, se ðe ealle þas þing for
mancynnes lufan and hælu mildheortlice abær and gemetfæstlice
aræfnede.
 270. God us gefultumige, þæt we to him becuman moten, se ðe
leofað and rixað a on ecnysse god, Amen.

HomS 23 (CenDom 2)
B3.2.23.
In Cena Domini: Bethurum 1957, 366-73 (App. I).



 4. Mine gebroðru ða leofestan, ge sculon to soðon ðis
witan, hwanon wære ongunnen ærest þeos bisne, þæt biscopas ut
adrifon of cyrcan sinfulle men on þam Wodnesdæge þe we hatað <foreign>caput
ieiunii</foreign>, þæt is, Lengtenes heafod, & æfter gefilledre wurðre
dædbote on þunresdæg ær Eastron, þæt is on ðisum dæge, eft
underfengon into circan þa ylcan sinfullan.
 10. Soðlice þa ða ure Drihten, þe is ælmihtig God,
gesceop þone forman man Adam, he gesceop hine ealne haligne & rihtwisne
& undeadlicne.
 12. Seo halignis & rihtwisnis & seo undeadlicnis didon Adam
habban Godes silfes anlicnysse & gelicnesse.
 14. And forðan cwæð God ærðam he gesceope Adam: Uton
wircan man to ure anlicnisse & gelicnisse; þæt is uton wircan man
haligne & rihtwisne & undeadlicne.
 16. And þas his anlicnesse us bebead Drihten to habbenne þa
ða he cwæð on his godspelle, <foreign>Estote sancti, quia et ego sanctus sum</foreign>;
þæt is, Beoð halige, forðon ic eom halig.
 19. Eornostlice forðan þe God gesceop Adam swa godne & swa
haligne, we rædað þæt he asende hine into neorxnawange to þam
þæt he him ðær on tilian sceolde & his gyman.
 22. Soþlice on ðam ilcan neorxnawange him forgeaf Drihten ealne
wuldor.
 23. Ðær he geseah englas & wið hig spræce, &
næfre he ne swulte, gif he ne singode.
 24. Ðær he gehyrde Drihten silfne wið hine sprecende &
him bebodende swilce gehirsumnisse þæt he næfre ne æte of ðam
treowe ingehydes godes & yfeles.
 27. Ac þa on ðære ylcan tide þe Adam þis bræc &
wið God singode, þa adraf hine Drihten, þe is bisceop ealra bisceopa, of
neorxnawange & him to cwæð: On swate ðines andwlitan þu scealt
ðines hlafes brucan.
 30. Ac hwæt dide Adam siððan he wæs adræfed of
neorxnawange?
 31. Gewislice he dide swyðe lange dædbote geond syx hundred
geara fæc & þonne gyt mare.
 33. Æt nyhstan æfter his forðsiþe he wæs asend on
hellicne cweartern, þær he lange tyd heofode & besargode þæt he
for his gilte forleas neorxnawang.
 35. And swa lange he wæs ðær besargiende &
behreowsiende, oð þæt ure Drihten Hælend Crist, se ðe is ealra
bisceopa bisceop, hine unband þurh his halgan ðrowunge & hine alysde of
witum hellicra ðeostra & him eft ageaf neorxnawang.
 39. Eornostlice, gebroþru mine þa leofestan, we bisceopas
beoð ures Drihtenes Hælendes Cristes speliendas on þisum middanearde,
& we beoð asende & gehadode on his stede.
 42. & forðan us geaf Drihten æfter þam apostolum anweald
manna sawla to bindenne & to unbindenne & bebead us þæt we þa
godan men getimbrion & aræron on Godes huse, & þæt we þa
synfullan awyrtwalion & ut flymon of circean, þæt is, of Godes huse.
 46. Soðlice þus cwæð Drihten þurh Hieremian his witegan
to ælcum bisceope: Efne ic gesette þe ofer þeoda & ofer ricu,
þæt ðu awirtwalie & getimbrie & utflime & arære on Godes
huse.
 49. Understandað, leofan men, mid godum wyllan þæt þæt
we eow willað secgan.
 51. Forðon sende God ælmihtig Adam into neorxnawange, þæt
on ðam ylcan neorxnawange wurdon acennede ealle þa gecorenan & þæt
hi ðonne wircan sceoldon Godes wyllan oð to þære fullan ylde &
þanon faran to þam heofenlican eðle.
 54. And gewislice swa hig diden gyf Adam ne agylte.
 55. Mine gebroðru, þa ylcan bisne ures Drihtenes Hælendes
Cristes we biscopas habbað on circan, & þa synfullan habbað Adames
bisne.
 58. Witodlice, swa swa Godes sunu lædde Adam haligne &
rihtwisne into neorxnawange, swa eac we & oðre Godes sacerdes lædað
men into cyrcan þe beoð gehalgode & gerihtwisode on ðam halgan
fulluhte.
 61. Forhwan læde we þæge men on cyrcan þe ær wæron
towordene halige þurh fulluht buton forðam ylcan intingan þe Drihten
lædde Adam on neorxnawang; þæt is, þæt he him ðær on tylode,
& þæt he gymde þær neorxnawanges?
 65. Swa eac we sacerdos forðon lædað gefullode men into
circan, þæt hig on ælcne tyman wircon on þære circan Godes wyllan
& þæt hig gymon þære cyrcan, þæt is, heora cristendomes.
 67. God ælmihtig gesette Adame æ þæge he sceolde healdan
þurh gehyrsumnysse.
 69. Hwilce æ, buton þæt he ne æte of ðam treowe
ingehydes godes & ifeles?
 70. Swa eac God gesett eow ðurh us æ þæge ge sculon
healdan on cyrcan.
 71. Hwilce æ gesett eow Drihten to healdenne þurh us, þæt
is, þurh ure mynegunge?
 73. Witodlice þas æ he gesett eow to healdenne on ðare he
ðu cwæð: Ne ofsleh þu.
 74. Ne unrihthæme ðu.
 74. Ne stel ðu.
 75. Ne sege þu lease gewytnisse.
 75. Ne swera þu man.
 75. Lufa þinne Drihten God of ealre þinre heortan, & lufa
ðinne nehstan swa swa ðe sylfne.
 77. Leofan men, þas bebodu ealle eow gesette Drihten þurh us,
þæt ge hig healdon & wyrcon þurh gehyrsumnysse.
 79. Ac hwæt dide Drihten be Adame forðon þe he ne heold þa
gehyrsumnysse?
 80. Gewislice he adraf hine ut of neorxnawange, wepende &
heofigende & swyðe unrotsiende.
 81. Swa eac we biscopas adræfað eow ut of Godes circan,
forðon ðe ge ne healdaþ þa gehyrsumnysse Godes beboda, & we
singað æfter eow þæt Drihten sang æfter Adame.
 84. Þa ða he adraf hine of neorxnawange, þa he ðus
cwæð: <foreign>In sudore uultus tui uesceris pane tuo</foreign>; þæt is: On swate
þines andwlitan þu scealt þines hlafes brucan.
 87. Ac hwæt dide Adam siððan he wæs adræfed of
neorxnawange?
 88. Gewislice he dide mycele dædbote to þon þæt he
wære wyrðe þæt hine God eft onfenge into neorxnawange.
 90. And ge ealswa þæs þe we truwiað didon dædbote on
þyssum lengtenfæstene þæt ge beon wyrðe in to gangenne on cyrcan
& gemænsumian Drihtenes lichaman & blode; & eow forði
blyþelice eft underfehð eowre modor, þæt is, seo halige cyrce, betwyh
hire bearnum þe sindon Godes bearn gewiscendlice, þæt is, betwyh Godes
gecorenum.
 95. Ðæt ge sculon swaþeah witan þæt swa swa se eadiga
Ambrosius cwæð þæt nan bisceop ne mæg unbyndan þa dædbetan
buton heora behreowsung beo wyrðe to unbindenne.
 98. And forðon we secgað eow ðis, þæt gyf ge nabbað
git swylce behreowsunge gedon þe Gode lycie, þæt ge hig eowres agenes
wylles fuldon.
 100. And gyf ge ne magon fæstan, ge magon huru don ælmissan
seo alyse eowre sawla of helle.
 102. Ðæt ge sculon eac understandan, þæt ge næfre na
mare ne don on eowre dædbote buton swa mycel swa eow wæs beboden.
 104. Ac æfter þære dædbote ge moten be eowrum agenum
wyllan mare don, swa swa didon þa halgan þe weredon hæran &
forhæfdon hig from flæsce & wine & fæston oð æfen for
gewilnunge þæs ecean lifes.
 107. Mine gebroðru, efne nu is Adam eft underfangen on þam
heofenlican neorxnawange for ðære myclan & þære geswyncfullan
behreowsunge þe he dide, & for ðære ylcan behreowsunge he geearnode
to onfonne geferrædene mid Godes halgum & þam geleaffulum þe mid
Cristes blode synd alysede.
 112. And ge, Gode þanc, nu todæg beoð eft underfangene on
cyrcan swylce into neorxnawange for eowre behreowsunge.
 114. And nu forðon þe ge on þissum dæge hider samod comon
to onfonne eft þære halgan cyrcan geferrædene & eowre synna
forgyfennisse, & forði comon mid ealre gewylnunge þæt ge magon onfon
swa mycele blysse on þissere Easterlican freolstyde, & þæt ge magon
gemænsumian of Drihtenes lichaman & blode, forþi ðonne ne sceal on
eow belyfan ænig heafod syn, ac ge sculon biddan myd eadmodre bene God
ælmyhtigne þæt he geunne eow þæt ge don moton swylce behreowsunge
& swylce dædbote þe Gode licye & eow fremie to þam ecan life.
 123. Ðæt eow geunne se mildheorta Drihten, þe leofað &
rixað on ealra worulda woruld, amen.
