HomS 25
B3.2.25.
In Sabbato sancto: Dictionary of Old English transcript, edited from Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Bodley 340.



 1. Men ða leofestan, magon we hwylcum hwega wordum secgan be
ðære arwurðnysse þisse halgan tide, and þeoses halgan dæges þe
nu þyses morgenes andweard bið.
 4. And þeah ðe us syn ealle þa halgan drihtenlican tida, and
eac his þæra haligra þa ðe ymb twelf monað beoð mid hea lofe to
weorðienne and to wuldrienne, hwæðere þeos is ofer ealle oðre heah,
and halig, and geond ealne middaneard on drihtenlicum ciricum rihtlicost to
wurþienne.
 10. Weorðedan we ær to wintre æt geolum þæne
drihtenlican gebyrddæg, þa he us luflice and eadmodlice hider on
middaneard gesohte on menniscne had, and on menniscum lichaman.
 13. Þonne wæs on ðas halgan tid þæt we nu on
andweardnysse wurþiað, þæt he ure drihten mancynne swa cuðlice
gecydde lif æfter deaðe.
 16. And þeah ðe he hit ær beforan þurh his þa halgan bec
toweard sæde, and gehete, he þæt þonne nu on ðeosse wundorlican
symbelnysse openlice gecydde þurh his sylfes lichaman ærest þe he ær
onfeng to his Godcundnysse, and eac þurh manegra oðera haligra manna, þa
ðe eac mid him of deaðe arison, and efne soðlice manna wæron.
 23. Swa Sanctus Matheus be ðan cwæð, <foreign>Multa corpora
sanctorum qui dormierunt surrexerunt cum cristo</foreign>.
 24. Þætte efne mænige lichaman haligra manna þa ðe
miccle ær forðferede wæron mid him drihtne of byrgenum arison, and
forð eodon.
 27. And heo þær manegum mannum on Hierusalem æteowdan, and
him wiðspræcon.
 28. Þonne sægð Sanctus Matheus se Godspellere þeosne
halgan lection be ðære gerynelican arwurðnysse drihtnes æristes, hu
seo geworden wære, and þus cwæð, <foreign>Vespere autem sabbati que lucesscit
in prima sabbati uenit maria magdalene et altera maria uidere sepulcrum</foreign>; He
cwæð, þy æfenne þæs reste dæges se ðe lihteð on ðæne
ærestan reste dæg, þa com Maria seo Magdalenisca, and oðer Maria
þæt wæs Cristes lichamlice modor to ðære byrigenne, and þa
wæs micel eorðhrernys geworden þa se drihtenlica ærist gelamp.
 38. And drihtnes engel astah of heofonum and eode to ðære
byrgenne, and þone stan aweg awelede þe sy byrgen mid betyned wæs, and
þa gesæt ofer þam stane.
 42. <foreign>Erat autem aspectus eius sicut fulgor et uestimenta eius sicut
nix</foreign>; þæs engles ansyn wæs swa beorht and egeslic swa legetu, and his
hrægl wæron swa hwit swa snaw, and for þam egsan þæs engles
ansynes þa weardas wæron afærede and hellheorte, and efne swa forht swa
heo deade wæron.
 47. <foreign>Respondens autem angelus dixit mulieribus, nolite timere uos</foreign>;
þa andswarode he se engel, and cwæð to ðam halgan wifmannum, Ne
ondrædað eow, ic wat, he cwæð, þæt ge secað þone
Nazareniscan hælend þe for manna lufan ahangen wæs.
 52. Nis he her þurh lichamlice andweardnysse.
 52. Ac he aras swa he ær sylf sæde þæt he eft þy
þriddan dæge of deaðe arisan wolde.
 54. <foreign>Venite et uidete locum ubi positus erat dominus</foreign>; Cumað nu
hider, cwæð he, and geseoð þa stowe þe se drihtenlica lichama on
geseted wæs, and gangað þonne hraðe and secgað his þegnum þæt
seo ærist is soðlice geworden, and þæt heo foran on Galileam on
ðæt þeodland þær heo hine ærest geseon sceolon swa ic eow nu
sæde.
 60. Heo þa dydon þa halgan wif swa him se engel bebead, and
eodon fram þære byrgene mid egsan and mid fyrhtum and mid miccle gefean.
 62. Þa com he Crist him togeanes grette heo þa and him
cwæð to, Wesað hale.
 64. Þa eodon þa halgan wif to him Criste, and hine be his fotum
genaman, and him to gebædon.
 65. Þa cwæð he Crist to heom, Ne ondrædað ge eow, ac
gað nu and secgað minum gebroðrum þæt heo faran on Galileam þær
heo ærest me geseon sceolon.
 68. Nu we gehyrdon þæt stær anlepig þeoses halgan
lectiones reccan and secgan.
 70. Uton þonne eac nu þone traht þær to gehyran, and þas
halgan rædinge eft hwilcum hwega wordum ofer cweðan, þæt we þy
eðelicor magon ongytan hu þis eall gedon and geworden wære.
 73. Hwæt we gehyrdon þæt se Godspellere cwæð, þæt
Sancta Maria Cristes lichamlice modor, and þa oðre wifmen þa ðe eac mid
hire wæron, þæt heo to ðære byrgenne comon þy æfenne þæs
reste dæges, se ðe lihteð on ðone ærestan reste dæg.
 78. He mihte cweðan þy dæge þe to morgenne bið.
 79. Swa Marcus se oðer Godspellere cwæð, <foreign>Orto iam sole</foreign>;
þæt hit wære æt sunnan upgange.
 80. Lucas cwæð, <foreign>Valde diluculo</foreign>; þæt hit wære swiðe
ær on morgene.
 82. Þonne cwæð Iohannes, <foreign>Cum adhuc tenebre essent</foreign>;
þætte þa gyta wæron þeostro.
 83. Þa heo þa halgan wif to ðære byrgenne comon, and þa
drihtenlican ærist gewordene gesawon, ne wæs þæt æniges liges
tacen, þeah ðe þa Godspelleras þæt sumum wordum to dældon and swa
ungelice cwædon.
 87. Ac heora æghwylc þæs soð sæde, for ðan ðe heo
Sancta Maria and þa oðre wifmenn þa ðe eac mid hire wæron, ealle
þa niht wacedon, and gelomlice to ðære byrgenne eodan and eft fram, for
ðære micclan lufan þe heo to him drihtne hæfdon.
 92. And eac for ðam hihte þære æriste þe he Crist him
ær toweard sæde þætte æfter his þrowunge geweorðan sceolde.
 94. Heo þreo ealle þæt gelice cwædon and ane andgyte
þeah ðe heo hit sumum wordum to cwæden.
 96. Hwæt we witan þonne hit on morgene ærest dagian
onginneð þæt þonne gyt beoð þeostru.
 98. Hwæt þæt þonne bið eac swylce swiðe ær on
morgenne, ge efne æt sunnan upgange, for ðan þæt leoht and seo dagung
hwanon cymð þæt elles buton fram þære sunnan, þeah ðe we
þonne gyt þa sunnan sylfe geseon ne magon.
 102. For ðan seo sunne hafað þonne mid þy heofone þas
eorðan utan ymbswifen, and ymbcerred, þonne astigað heo þanon eastan up
swa we geseon magon.
 105. Ac he Sanctus Matheus ana þæt deagollice and gerynelice
spræc, and cwæð þæt hit wære þy æfenne þæs reste
dæges, and wæs hwæðere on ærnemerigen swa þa oðre
Godspelleras sædon.
 108. Ac for ðan he þæt cwæð, þe hit þa wæs
þære nihte æfen, swa þæs dæges æfen bið þonne seo niht
cymð, swa þonne bið eac þære nihte æfen þonne se dæg
cymð.
 111. <foreign>Vespere autem sabbati</foreign>; He cwæð þi æfenne þæs
reste dæges, se ðe lihteð on ðone ærestan reste dæg.
 113. Hwæt we witan symle þonne hit æfnað þonne
þeostrað hit næs na leohteð, and þæt leoht wanað næs na
wexeð.
 115. Sanctus Matheus þæt ana deagollice and gerynelice
spræc be ðære weorðunge þysse halgan nihte, efne swa swa heo eall
gastlice onlihted beon sceolde, þurh þa gefealican wyrde þære
drihtenlican æriste, þe on ðysse halgan nihte ende geworden wæs þa
hit furðum dagian ongan.
 121. Hwæt we þæt witan and eac leorniað þætte ær
beforan æt frymðe worulde seo niht symble fylgde þone dæg, æfter
þære endebyrdnysse þe heo æt frymðe on gesceapene wæron.
 124. Ac þa seo drihtenlice ærist gewearð on ðysse halgan
nihte ufanweardre, þa wæs syððan a ðurh þæt seo endebyrdnys
oncerred þara tida and syððan a se dæg fylgde þa niht, swa we nu
þa drihtenlican niht næmniað sunnan niht and þonne eft on morgenne
þone dæg hatað Sunnandæg.
 129. And we swa eall þæt rim þæra dogra æfter
þære endebyrdnysse tellað.
 131. Is þæt micel becnung gastlicra þinga seo oncyrnys
þæra tidu, for ðan mancynn wæs æt frymðe worulde efne swa hit on
lihte and on dæge gesceapen and geseted wære.
 134. Þa he ure drihten þa menniscan gecynd to his sylfes
anlicnysse gesceop on snyttru and on wisdome and on foreþancolnysse.
 136. Ac syððan mancynn þa eft æfter þan on deofolgyld
gecyrdon, and þurh mænigfealde synne fram heora scyppende gewitan, þa
wæs efne on ða anlicnysse swa seo swearte niht æfter þam hluttrestan
dæges leohte come.
 141. And syððan a ðeostru þære ungeleafsumnysse on
manncynne sæton, oð þæt se ælmihtiga God hine sylfne to ðan
geeadmedde, þæt he us hider on middaneard gesohte on menniscum hade and on
menniscum lichaman.
 145. He us þa æghwæðer ge mid wordum ge mid bisenum
lærde, hu we of synnum and of deofles anwealde acerran sceoldan, and eac
helle tintregu befleon and þæt heofoncunde wuldor begytan.
 148. Swa Sanctus Paulus se apostol cwæð, <foreign>Nox precessit dies
autem adpropinquauit</foreign>; He cwæð, Seo niht forð gewat þære
ungenihtsumnysse.
 151. Ac nu se dæg genealæceð soðes wisdomes.
 152. Uton us for ðan fram aweorpan ealra þeostra weorc, and
þæt man ealra yfelra dæda, and uton us gegearwian and gefrætewian
mid þam wæpnum þæs soðan leohtes, þæt is mid drihtnes
geleafan, and mid godum dædum, to ðam þæt we magon gangan bealdlice,
and arwurðlice swa swa on dæges leohte.
 157. For ðan se dæg bið symble getacnod to soðfæstes
mannes life, and seo niht to synfulles mannes.
 159. <foreign>Que lucessit in prima sabbati</foreign>; Se ðe lihteð, cwæð
se Godspellere, on ðone ærestan reste dæg.
 161. Hwæt wæs se æresta reste dæg þe he on ðam
wordum mænde, buton þæt wæs se halga drihtenlica dæg þe we nu
Sunnandæg nemniað.
 163. For ðan se wæs ærest daga on ðysse niwan æ
mancynne to reste geboden, for ðære arwurðnysse þære drihtenlican
æriste.
 166. Wæs se eac ærest daga gesceapen æt frymðe worulde
and ealle þa gastlican wyrde þa ðe syððan æfre on ðysum
middanearde mæste and hehste gewurdan, ealle mæste þa gewurdan on ðam
drihtenlican dæge on Sunnandæge.
 171. For ðan æghwylc þære manna, se ðe þone nu
healdan nyle mid are and mid rest and on weorðunge, þonne abrecð se Godes
æ and his haligra gesetnysse.
 174. Þæt wæs on ðam dæge þe to merigene bið,
þætte Sancta Maria and þa halgan wifmen mid swetum wyrtum, and mid
deorwurðum smyrenyssum, to ðære drihtenlican byrgenne coman þæt heo
his þone halgan lichaman mid þam smyrian woldan, þy læs he brosnian
mihte.
 179. Mid þy wæs getacnod þæt we ealle þe on ðone
ilcan drihten gelefað and his naman andettað, þæt we hine sceolon
þurh halige lustas and þurh manige halige dæde gelomlice secan, and mid
ure mod geðance ofer ealle oðre þing to hycgan and to hihtan.
 184. <foreign>Et ecce terre motus factus est magnus</foreign>; He cwæð on ðam
Godspelle þætte þa wære micel eorðrernys geworden þa seo
drihtenlice ærist gelamp.
 186. Hwæt we þæt on Godes bocum gesewen habbað þætte
hwene ær beforan nu on ðysum frigen dæge, þa he ure drihten for
ealles mancynnes hælu deað geðrawade, þæt þa eac micel
eorðrernys gewearð, and þeos eorðe eall gebifode, and aforhtade for
ðære micclan wyrde.
 192. And þeos sune sylf and ealle þa heofonlican tungol heora
leoht behyddan, and þæt man and þæt morðor geseon noldon þe her
men on eorðan wið heora scyppend fremedon.
 195. Ac efne æt middum dæge þa se dæg beorhtast and
leohtast beon sceolde, þa geðeostrade he and efne fæstlice genihtade
ofer eallne middaneard a fram middum dæge oð non.
 199. Wæs on ðan getacnað and gecyðed hu þeostre and hu
blinde Iudea heortan wæron, þa ðe ures drihtnes cyme ær toweardne
sædon, and on heora bocum geleornode hæfdon, and þa hwæðere swylc
man and swylc morðor dydon.
 203. Swylce eac wæs on ðære eorðhrernysse getacnod þa
eorðlican heortan manna, þa ðe þurh ungeleafsumnysse fram Gode gewitene
wæron, þætte þa sceoldon beon eft þurh his þrowunge to hreowe and
to bote gecyrde, and eft þurh hine drihten to ecere hæle becuman.
 208. <foreign>Angelus enim domini descendit de cælo</foreign>; Hwæt we
gehyrdon þæt se Godspellere cwæð, þæt drihtnes engel come of
heofonum, and þa eode to ðære byrgenne.
 211. And þone stan aweg adyde þe seo drihtenlice byrgen betyned
wæs, and þa gesæt ofer þam stane.
 213. Næs na þæt se engel þider to þan come þæt he
urum drihtne fultumian sceolde æt þære his æriste.
 215. Ac seo ærist wæs ær geworden ær se engel þær
come.
 216. Ac to þan he þyder com þæt he þære drihtenlican
æriste beon gewita, and þam mannum cyðan and secgan swa he þa dyde.
 218. And eac to ðan þæt he þa byrgenne ontynde and þone
stan aweg adyde, þæt men mihton þy eðelicor ongytan þæt seo
drihtenlice ærist soðlice geworden wære.
 221. Sægeð oðer Godspellere þæt se stan wære swiðe
micel þe Iudeas þa byrgenne mid betyndon and gefæstnedan.
 223. And þa æfter þan eodan to ðan heora unlædan
gerefan þe Pilatus wæs gehaten, brohton him feoh, and þa on oll and on
edwit swa bismerlice be ðam hælende to him spræcon and þus cwædon,
Min domine we magon gemunan þæt se æswica cwæð, þæt he wolde
þy þriddan dæge of deaðe arisan, ac hat nu healdan his lichaman, þy
læs wen sy þæt his þegnas cumen on niht to, and hine forstele.
 230. And þonne syððan sy se neara gedwola wyrse þonne se
ærra.
 231. Tealdon heo earme and heo unlæde þæt se drihten and se
wealdend mihte on byrgenne beon bemiðen and behyded, þone þe ealle
gesceafta ymbfon and ymbgripanne magon.
 235. <foreign>Et sedebat super eum</foreign>; He sæde se Godspellere þæt se
engel sæte ofer þam stane.
 236. Næs na þæt he werig wære for ðan þe he hine
ær onweg adyde, ac he mid þy his setle getacnade haligra manna ærist,
hu wlitige and hu wundorlice heo beoð æfter þysse worulde.
 239. For ðan halige men þeah ðe heo nu ær her on worulde
mænigfealde sorhge and earfoðnysse þrowian, hwæðere him bið ece
rest witud and agen, siððan he þis deadlice lif forlæteð.
 243. <foreign>Erat autem aspectus eius sicut fulgor, et uestimenta eius
sicut nix</foreign>; þæs engles ansyn, cwæð se Godspellere, wæs swa beorht
and swa egeslic swa swa ligetu, and his hrægl wæron swa hwit swa snaw.
 247. Se engel getacnode mid þy egeslican onseone and mid þy his
beorhtan gegyrlan, þæt se drihten se ðe he ða his ærist gewordene
sæde, þæt se nu hwænne swiðe egeslice and swiðe strange and
swiðe heardwendlice on synfullum mannum heora leahtras, and heora facenfullan
dæda wrecað, and þæt he eac ealle his þa halgan swiðe
arfæstlice and mildheortlice afrefrað.
 253. And for ðan he se engel on swa egeslicum onsyne æteowde,
þæt þæra wearda mod sceolde beon þy forhtra, þa ðe Iudeas
þær setton þæt þa byrgenne healdan sceoldan.
 257. Swa swa hit be ðan on ðeosum halgan lectione gecweden is,
þæt for ðam egsan þæs engles ansynes þa weardas wæron
afærede and hellheorte, and efne swa forhte gewordene swa heo deade
wæron.
 261. <foreign>Vestimenta autem eius sicut nix</foreign>; He cwæð þæt
þæs engles hrægl wæron swa hwit swa snaw.
 262. Næs na þætte engles syn mid lichamlicum hræglum
gegerede, oððe him þæs ænig þearf sy, for ðan ðe hi ealle
syndon gastlicre gecynde.
 265. Ac he se engel mid þy his beorhtan gegyrlan tacnade hu
wlitige and hu wundorlice þa eadigan sawla beoð æfter þysse worulde
syððan heo þis deadlice lif forlætað.
 268. Swa Sanctus Iohannes se apostol cwæð, <foreign>Data sunt illis
stole albe et dictum est illis ut requiescerent</foreign>; Him beoð gesealde,
cwæð he, syndrie hwite gegerelan and beorhte, and him bið gecweden to
þæt heo restan and gefeonde bidan, oð þæt þæt rim sy gefylled
heora efen þeowa.
 273. For ðan, he cwæð, syndrie beorhte gegyrlan for ðan
halige menn þonne hi of lichaman gangað, þonne heora sawle ane wuldor
onfoð, ac þonne þæt geweorðað nu hwonne æt domes dæge,
þæt he ure drihten æghwilcne lichaman of byrgenum aweceð and forð
lædeð.
 278. And þa ilcan sawle onsendeð þe him ær on wæs,
þonne heo onfoð syððan twyfealde eadignysse on heora rice, þæt is
þonne þæt heo a syððan ecelice mid lichaman and mid sawle wuldres
brucað, ealle þa ðe ær mid lichaman Gode þeowiað, and heora lif
mid rihte libbað.
 283. And for ðan he se engel hine on swa beorhtum gegyrelan
æteowde þæt þæra haligra wifa mod sceolde beon þy unforhtra and
þe swiðor afrefred þe heo þyder mid geleafan and mid lufan to ðære
byrgenne coman.
 287. Swa he for ðan swiðe arwurðlice and mildheortlice to him
spræc, and heo lærde þæt heo næron to forhte.
 289. Ac þæt heo mid gefean þam drihtnes þegnum þa
ærist gewordene sædon, and het hi faran on Galileam on þæt
þeodland þæt heo hine drihten ærest geseon sceolden.
 292. Swa he ær his þrowunge sylf gesæd hæfde.
 293. <foreign>Et exierunt cito de monumento cum timore et gaudio magno</foreign>;
Heo ða eodan þa halgan wifmenn swa him beboden wæs, eodan ofestlice fram
þære byrgenne mid egsan and mid fyrhtu, and eac mid geleafan, and þæs
hælendes þegnum þa drihtenlican ærist gewordene sædon.
 299. Þa com he Crist togeanes þam wifum grette heo þa sona
fægrum wordum, and him cwæð to, Hauete, wesað hale.
 301. Tacnode he ure drihten on ðam þæt æghwylc þæra
manna þe nu on godum dædum gangan wile, þætte æghwylcum þæra
þurh his geofe fultum ongean cymð, and hine to ecum life gelædeð.
 304. He cwæð þæt he heo fægrum wordum grette and þus
cwæde, Wesað hale, efne swa swa he cwæde, habbað sibbe and onfoð
bletsunge, and þæt witað þæt seo awerigednys þe ðam ærestan
men þurh heora agyltnysse geworhtan and on mancynne gebrohtan þæt seo is
nu adwæsced and adilgad þurh me and þurh minne ærist.
 310. <foreign>Illi autem accesserunt et tenuerunt pedes eius, et
adorauerunt eum</foreign>; þa eodan þa halgan wif to him Criste, and hine be his
fotum genaman, and him to gebædon.
 313. Wæs on ðan cuð þæt he hæfde soðne lichaman
æfter þære his æriste þa heo him hrinan mihton, and þonne hwene
ær beforan sægð þæt he ut of ðære byrgenne swa betynedre
arise and ut eode.
 317. Wæs on ðan gecyðed þæt se his lichama wæs þa
undeadlic, æfter þære æriste.
 319. Þa he of ðære byrgenne swa betynedre ut gangan mihte,
wæs se his lichama þære ilcan gecynde þe he ær wæs.
 321. Ac he wæs hwæðere wundorlicra geworden þurh þa
undeadlicnysse.
 322. <foreign>Respondens autem iesus mulieribus nolite timere</foreign>; þa
cwæð Crist to ðam halgan wifum, Ne ondrædað eow, cwæð he, ac
gað and secgað minum gebroðrum þæt heo faren on Galileam on þæt
þeodland þæt heo me geseon sceolan.
 327. Hwæt we nu magon on ðysum wordum ongytan þa micclan
eadmodnysse ures drihtnes þe he wið mancynn gecydde.
 329. Þe men þe þæs wyrðe ne syndon þæt we his
þeowas sien gecwedene, and he hwæðere us him to broðrum and to bearnum
nemde.
 331. Ic þæt swiðe micel ar and wurðmynt þæt we men
magon beon Gode sylfum to broðrum and to bearnum genemde.
 333. Ac uton gemunan þæt we sceolon mid halgum dædum and
mid soðfæstum us þa wurðmyndo geearnian, ealle þa ðe nu willað
beon bilewite and mildheorte him betwynan, and arfæste wið oðre men.
 337. Heo habbað Godes lufan and manna on rihtne had, ealle þa
beoð þurh þæt Gode sylfum to broðrum and to bearnum gewordene, and
hi moton to widan feore beforan Cristes sylfes ansyne gefean and blissian.
 341. Swylce eac ealle þa ðe nu synne and mandæde fremmeð
and heo oferhydige and inwitfulle beoð, and unarfulle wið oðre men and
þeofet and unriht geligeru begangað, and earme men forneomað and
fordemað, ealle þa beoð þurh þæt deofle sylfum to broðrum and to
bearnum genemde and gewordene.
 346. Uton gemunan hu sarlice and hu geomorlice se ealda feond
manncynnes, ure þa ærestan ealdras, Adam and Efan, neorxnawonges
fægernysse bereafode, and heo mid his facne and inwite beswac and
forlærde, þæt heo on ðære byrignysse þæra beweredra blæda
heora scyppendes bebod ælmihtiges Godes awegan and oferferdon.
 353. And þa þurh þæt of ðam eadiglican life and of engla
gesiðscipe on ðas sarlican woruld and on ðas niðerlican wræce
aworpene, and asende wurdon, þe we nu her onlibbað and drohtniað.
 356. Geefne se gylt gewearð to ðan grim manncynne þætte ne
wæs syððan æfre ænig mennisc lichama þætte ne sceolde deað
þrowian.
 359. Ne þæt gyta sarlicra wæs þætte ne wæs æfre
ænig to ðæs halig mann on his life, þæt he hwæðere to heofona
rice moste, ær ðan þeos halige drihtnes æristtid geworden wæs.
 362. Ac þa halgan men and þa gedefan þa ðe ær beforan
þan Gode and fullfremede wæron, þonne heo of lichaman eodan þonne
wæron hi on ræste gelædde.
 365. Næs na hwæðere on heofonan rice, ac heo þære
frofre bidon and to ðære hihtan hwænne se on middaneard come, se ðe
æghwæðer ge him þe ær wæron heofona rices duru ontynde, ge
þæt he þonne eac þam þe nu gyta lifigenda on lichaman wæron
þone weg cuðne and openne gedyde to heofona rice.
 371. Ure drihten þæt geare on ðære ealdan æ his þam
halgum gehet and him þone gefean and þa frofre toweard sæde, þæt he
us hider on middaneard secan wolde on menniscum lichaman.
 375. He þæt þa æt nextan swiðe arfæstlice and
swiðe mildheortlice gefylde, geefne þy furþor þe he sylf on ðas
halgan tid for mancynnes hælu deað geðrowade on ðam frige dæge þe
nu wæs.
 379. And he eft þæs þy þriddan dæge of deaðe aras on
ðam arwurðan dæge þe nu þysum morgenne bið, and he þurh þæt
ealle þa of ðam grimman þeowdome helle wita to ecum life and to
ungeendadlicum friðe alysde and generede, þa ðe on his lufan rihtlice
awuniað and his bebodu medumlice and fulfremedlice healdan willað.
 385. For ðan þæt is swiðe rihtlic and swiðe gedafenlic
þæt æghwylc mennisc tunge þæs ælmihtigan drihtnes þrym and
his mycelnys, mid lofum and mid wurðmyndum her geandette.
 388. Ac uton nu cerran to ura sylfra gewitnysse, gif we hwylce
synne hæbben ungeandette and ungebette, þæt we þonne þa clænlice
geandettan and medumlice gebetan.
 391. Uton beon arfulle and mildheorte us betweonum, lufian us sylfe
rihtlice and urne drihten ofer ealle oðre þing.
 393. And manna gehwylc þurh hine sylfne God do, æghwylc
oðerne to Gode tyhte and lære, for ðan þæt is swiðe rihtlice
þætte þa men þe þæt mynteð, þæt heo God on ecere sibbe
geseon and gefeon, þæt þa him sien betweonum sibsume, arleasra manna
þæt is þæt heo betweonum figen and hatigen.
 399. For ðan ðe heo beoð deofles gewyrhtan, and heo heora lif
libbað him sylfum to sceande, and efne swa heo heora feondum þurh heora
synne georner hyrnað, swa he heom æt nextan grimra geweorðeð.
 403. Uton nu tilian mid Godes fultume þæt we mid unwæmre
heortan and mid clænre ingewitnysse to drihtnes wigbede gangan moton, and
þæt þam halgan husle onfon, þæt us is her on middanearde geseald
eces lifes to wedde.
 407. And buton þæs weddes onfangennysse næfre ænig man
Godes rice gestigeð, for ðan æghwylc þæra manna se ðe þam
rihtlice onfehð ælc þæra onfehð eces lifes wed, and æghwylc
þæra þe him unmedum to gedyrstigað, þonne onfehð se strængre
Godes fæhðu and ecere forwyrde wræce.
 412. For ðan we sceolon geðæncan þa hwile þe we moten
and hit on urum gewealde sy þæt we þa þing don þe us to ecere
hælu gelimpan mote, ær ðan us færinga deaðes þeostro fornime and
forgripe.
 416. Uton gemunan þætte ure nænigum his Goda æfter
þeosse worulde to fela ne ðynceð, þonne he þæra on ecnysse brucan
sceal þe he ær on ðeosse medmicclan tide for Gode gedyde.
 420. Ne magon we æt Domesdæge þonne ure drihten geldeð
æghwylcum anum men æfter his sylfes gewyrhtum na hwæðer ne gold ne
seolfor for us syllan ne nænige woruldspeda.
 423. Ac we þonne þæt deoreste wed ageofan sceolon manna
gehwylc, his sylfes lichaman and sawle.
 425. Uton la tilian þæt we þonne sy to life næs na to
deaðe gedemde.
 426. Uton þancian þam ælmihtigum drihtne ure alysnysse, and
tilian þæt we næfre mid synnum forwyrde þa gife ure alysnysse.
 429. Þe ðe wæron mid þy deorwurðestan Cristes blode
alysde, swa Sanctus Paulus se apostol cwæð, þæt he drihten ne sparode
his agene bearne.
 431. Ac he hine for us eallum to deaðe gesealde, for ure ecere
hælu.
 432. Þæs him sy symle lof and wuldor and seo mæste þanc
wurðesta herenys a buton ende in ealra worulda woruld, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

HomS 26 (BlHom 7)
B3.2.26.
Easter Day: Morris 1874-80, 83-97.



 1. <foreign>DOMINICA PASCHA</foreign>.
 1. Men þa leofestan, þis eastorlice geryno us æteoweð
þæs ecean lifes sweotole bysene, swa we nu gehyran magon forþ reccean
& secggean, þæt nænigne tweogean ne þearf þæt seo wyrd on
þas ondweardan tid geweorþan sceal, þæt se ilca Scyppend gesittan
wile on his domsetle.
 5. Him biþ beforan andweard eal engla cynn & manna cynn,
& eac swylce werigra gasta.
 6. & þær beoð asmeade æghwylces mannes dæda.
 7. & se þe nu biþ eaþmod & gemyndig Drihtnes
þrowunge & his æriste ealle mode, se sceal heofonlicre mede onfon.
 9. & se þe nu forhogaþ þæt he Godes bebodu healde,
oþþe ænig gemynd hæbbe Drihtnes eaþmodnesse, se þær sceal
heardne dom gehyran & seoþþan on ecum witum wunian, þara næfre
ende ne cymeþ.
 12. Þonne is þeos tid ealra tida hehst & halgost, & on
þas tid we sceolan habban godcunde blisse & eac worldcunde, forþon þe
Drihten of deaþe aras mancynne to bysene æfter his þrowunga, &
æfter þæm bendum his deaþes, & æfter þæm clammum helle
þeostra; & þæt wite & þæt ece wræc asette on þone
aldor deofla, & mancyn freolsode.
 18. Swa se witga Dauid be þisse tide witgade, & þus
cwæþ: Ure Drihten us gefreolsode.
 19. & he geendode þæt he lange to þæm awergdum gastum
gebeotod hæfde, & he mannum gecyþde on þas ondweardan tid ealle þa
þing þe æfre ær from witgum gewitgode wæron, be his þrowunga
& be his æriste, & be his hergunga on helle, & be his wundra
manegum þe ær gesægde wæron, eall he þæt gefylde.
 24. Uuton nu gehyran & geþencean hwæt he dyde, & mid
hwy he us freo gedyde.
 25. Næs he mid nænigum nede gebæded, ac he mid his sylfes
willan to eorþan astag, & her manige setunga & searwa adreag æt
Iudeum, æt þæm unlædum bocerum.
 28. & þa æt nehstan he let his lichoman on rode mid
næglum gefæstnian, & deaþ he geþrowode for us, forþon þe he
wolde us þæt ece lif forgifan.
 30. & he þa onsende his þone wuldorfæstan gast to helle
grunde, & þær þone ealdor ealra þeostra & þæs ecean
deaþes geband & gehynde, & ealne his geferscipe swyþe gedrefde,
& helle geatu & hire þa ærenan scyttelas he ealle tobræc, &
ealle his þa gecorenan he þonon alædde, & þara deofla þeostro he
oforgeat mid his þæm scinendan leohte.
 36. Hie þa swiþe forhte & abregde þus cwædon: Hwonon
is þes þus strang, & þus beorht, & þus egesfull?
 38. Se middangeard þe us wæs lange ær underþeoded, &
us deaþ mycel gafol geald.
 39. Ne gelomp hit na ær þæt us swylc deaþ geendod
wære, ne us næfre swylc ege ne wearþ ær to helle geendebyrded.
 41. Eala nu hwæt is þes þe þus unforht gæþ on ure
gemæro?
 42. & nis no þæt an þæt he him ure witu ondræde,
ac he wile eac oþre of urum bendum alesan.
 43. Wene we sy þis se þe we wendon þæt þurh his deaþ
us sceolde beon eall middangeard underþeoded.
 45. Gehyrstu ure aldor?
 45. Þis is se ilca þe þu longe for his deaþe plegodest,
& þu us æt endestæfe mycel herereaf gehete.
 47. Ac hwæt wilt þu his nu don?
 47. & hwæt miht þu his onwendan?
 48. Nu he hafaþ ealle þine þeostro mid his beorhtnesse
geflemed, & eal þin carcern he hafaþ tobrocen, & þa þe þu
ær on hæftnede hæfdest, ealle þa he hæfþ onlysde, & heora
lif he hæfþ to gefean gecyrred; & þa us nu bysmriaþ þa þe
ær on urum bendum sworettan.
 52. Tohwon læddest þu hider þeosne þe on his cyme ealle
his gecorene he hafaþ to þære ærran blisse gecorene?
 54. Þeah hie ær þæs ecan lifes orwene wæron, hie synt
nu swiþe bliþe.
 55. Nis her nu nænig wop ne nænig heaf gehyred, swa hit ær
gewunelic wæs on þisse wite stowe.
 56. Eala nu, þu ure aldor, þa þine welan þe þu on fruman
begeate æt þæs ærestan mannes egeleasnesse & unhyrsumnesse,
& æt neorxna wanges anforlætnesse, ealle þa he hafaþ nu on þe
genumene, & þurh Cristes rode is eal þin blis to unrotnesse geworden.
 60. Þonne þu wysctest þæt þu wistest Crist on rode
ahangenne, nystest þu no hu monige earfoþa us eallum æt his deaþe
becuman sceoldan.
 62. Þu woldest symle þone besmitan þe þu nan wiht yfles on
nystest.
 64. Tohwon læddest þu þeosne freone & unscyldigne
hider?
 64. Nu he hafaþ on his hidercyme ealle scyldige fordemde &
gehynde.
 66. Þa sona æfter þon þe seo arlease helwarena stefn
wæs gehyred & heora gnornung, þa wæs buton ælcere yldinge for
Drihtnes cynedomes tocyme þætte ealle þa isenan scyttelas helle loca
wurdan tobrocene.
 69. & þa sona instæpes seo unarimedlice menigo haligra
saula þe ær gehæftnede wæron to þæm Hælende onluton, &
mid wependre halsunga hine bædon, & þus cwædon: þu come to us,
middangeardes Alysend, þu come to us heofonwara hyht, & eorþwara, &
eac ure hyht, forþon us geara ær witgan þe toweardne sægdon, & we
to þinum hidercyme hopodan & hyhtan.
 75. Þu sealdest on eorþan mannum synna forgifnessa.
 76. Ales us nu of deofles onwalde & of helle hæftnede.
 76. Nu þu for us astige on helle grund, ne forlæt þu us nu
on witum wunian, þonne þu to þinum uplican rice cyrre.
 78. Ðu asettest þines wuldres myrecels on worlde, sete nu þin
wuldres tacn in helle.
 79. Næs þa nænig ylding toþon þa þeos ben wæs
gehyred, þa sona seo unarimede menigo haligra saula mid Drihtnes hæse
wæron of þæm cwicsusle ahafena, & he gefylde þone ealdan feond,
& on helle grund gebundenne awearp.
 83. Þa halgan sawla þa mid unasecggendlicum gefean cleopodan to
Drihtne, & þus cwæþon: Astig nu, Drihten Hælend Crist, up, nu
þu hafast helle bereafod, & þæs deaþes aldor on þyssum witum
gebundenne/.
 87. Gecyþ nu middangearde blisse þæt on þinum upstige
geblissian & gehyhton ealle þine gecorenan.
 88. Adam þagyt & Eua næron onlysde, ah on bendum hie
wæron hæfde.
 89. Adam þa wependre stefne & earmlicre cegde to Drihtne,
& cwæþ: Miltsa me, Drihten; miltsa me for þinre mycclan
mildheortnesse, & adilega mine unrihtwisnessa; forþon þe anum ic
gesyngade, & mycel yfel beforan þe ic gedyde.
 93. Ic gedwolede swa swa þæt sceap þæt forwearþ.
 94. Sec nu þinne þeow, Drihten, forþon þe þine handa me
geworhtan & geheowodan.
 95. Ne forlæt þu mine saule mid hellwarum; ac do on me þine
mildheortnesse/, & alæd me ut of þyssum bendum, & of þyses
carcernes huse, & of deaþes scuan.
 98. Drihten Hælend þa wæs miltsigende Adame, & raþe
his bendas wæron onlysde.
 99. & befealden to Hælendes cneowum, he cwæþ, Min saul
bletsaþ Drihten; & ealle mine þa inneran his þone halgan naman.
 101. Þu þe arfæst eart geworden eallum minum
unrihtwisnessum, þu þe gehældest mine adla, & min lif of þære
ecean forwyrde þu onlysdest, mine geornnesse mid gode þu gefyldest.
 104. Eua þagyt on bendum & owope þurhwunode; heo cwæþ:
Soþfæst eart þu, Drihten, & rihte syndon þine domas; forþon þe
mid gewyrhtum ic þas þrowige: ic wæs mid weorþmende on neorxna wange,
& ic þæt ne ongeat; ic wæs wiþermede & unwisum netenum gelic
geworden.
 109. Ac þu Drihten scyld minre iugoþe & min, onunwisdomes
ne wes þu gemyndig, ne ne ahwyrf þu þine onsyne, ne þine mildheortnesse
from me, ne þu ne gecyr on erre from þinre þeowene; gehyr þu arfæsta
God mine stefne, mid þære ic earm to þe cleopie; forþon on sare &
on geomrunga min lif & mine gear syndon fornumene.
 114. Drihten, þu wast mine geheowunga, þæt ic eom dust &
axe, gif þu mine unrihtwisnesse behealdest.
 116. Ic þe halsige nu, Drihten, for þinre þeowene, Sancta
Marian, þa þu mid heofonlicum wuldre geweorþodest.
 117. Hire innoþ þu gefyldest nigon monaþ mid ealles
middangeardes weorþe; þu wast þæt þu of minre dehter, Drihten,
onwoce; & þæt hire flæsc is of minum flæsce, & hire ban of
minum banum.
 120. Ara me nu, min Drihten, for hire wuldres weorþmyndum, ara me
ungesæligost ealra wifa, & min Scyppend miltsa me, & genere me of
þysses deaþes bendum.
 123. Drihten Hælend þa wæs miltsiende Euan, & raþe
hire bendas wæron onlysede.
 124. Heo cleopode þa & þus cwæþ: Sy þin nama,
Drihten, gebletsad on worlde; forþon þe þin mildheortnes is mycel ofor
me; nu þu generedest mine saule of þære neoþeran helle.
 127. Abraham þa se heahfæder, mid eallum þam halgum saulum
þe fram worlde fruman gehæftnede wæron, bliþre stefne cegdon, &
cwædon: We ondettaþ þe, Drihten, & þe hergeaþ; forþon þe
þu us alesdest from deaþes fruman, & þu us gewelegodest mid þinum
tocyme.
 131. Mid þon þe Drihten þa þa herehyhþ þe on helle
genumen hæfde, raþe he lifgende ut eode of his byrgenne mid his agenre
mihte aweht, & eft mid his unwemmum lichoman hine gegyrede.
 134. & he hine his gingrum æteowde, forþon þe he wolde
ælcne tweon of heora heortum adon.
 136. & he eac æteowde þa wunda & þara nægla dolh
þæm ungeleaffullum mannum, forþon þe he nolde þæt ænig
ortrywnes wære emb his æriste.
 138. & þa æfter þon on manigra manna gesyhþe he astag
on heofenas, & he gesæt Godfæder on þa swiþran healfe, þonon he
næfre næs þurh his godcundnesse, ac he symle þær gestaþelod
wæs; forþon hyhton nu & blissian eall geleaffull folc, forþon þe
for us Cristes blod wæs agoten.
 143. Uton we ealle wynsumian on Drihten we þe his æriste
mærsiaþ; forþon þe he his godcundnesse nan wiht ne gewanode, þa he
þone menniscan lichoman onfeng, & us of deofles anwalde alesde.
 146. Nu we gehyraþ, men þa leofestan, hu manigfeald þing
Drihten for us geþrowode, þa he us mid his blode abohte of helle
hæftnede.
 148. Uton we forþon geþencean hwylc handlean we him forþ to
berenne habban, þonne he eal þis recþ & sægþ æt þisse ilcan
tide, þonne he gesiteþ on his dom setle; þonne sceolan we mid ure anre
saule forgyldan & gebetan ealle þa þing þe we ær ofor his bebod
gedydon, oþþe þæs awægdon þe we don sceoldan.
 153. Uton nu geþencean hu mycel egsa gelimpeþ eallum gesceaftum
on þas ondweardan tid, þonne se dom nealæceþ, & seo openung
þæs dæges is swiþe egesfull eallum gesceaftum.
 155. On þæm dæge gewiteþ heofon & eorþe, &
sæ, & ealle þa þing þe on þæm syndon, swa eac for þære
ilcan wyrde gewiteþ sunne & mona & eal tungla leoht aspringeþ.
 158. & seo rod ures Drihtnes bið aræred on þæt
gewrixle þara tungla, seo nu on middangearde awergde gastas flemeþ.
 160. & on þæm dæge heofon biþ befealden swa swa boc,
& on þæm dæge eorþe biþ forbærned to axan, & on þæm
dæge sæ adrugaþ, & on þæm dæge eall heofona mægen biþ
onwended & onhrered; & syx dagum ær þissum dæge gelimpeþ
syllice tacn æghwylce ane dæge.
 164. Þy ærestan dæge on midne dæg gelimpeþ mycel
gnornung ealra gesceafta, & men gehyraþ myccle stefne on heofenum swylce
þær man fyrde trymme & samnige; þonne astigeþ blodig wolcen mycel
from norþdæle, & oforþecþ ealne þysne heofon; & æfter
þæm wolcne cymeþ legetu & þunor ealne þone dæg; &
rineþ blodig regn æt æfen.
 169. On þæm æfteran dæge biþ gehyred mycel stefn on
heofenum fyrdweorodes getrymnesse, & eorþe biþ onhrered of hire stowe,
& heofon biþ open on sumum ende on þæm eastdæle.
 172. & mycel mægen forþcymeþ þurh þone openan
dæl, & þone heofon oforþecþ & oforwryhþ æt æfen; &
blodig regn & fyren fundiaþ þas eorþan to forswylgenne & to
forbærnenne.
 175. & seo heofon biþ gefeallen æt þæm feower endum
middangeardes; & eall eorþe bið mid þeostrum oforþeaht æt þa
endlyftan tid þæs dæges.
 178. & þonne cweþ eall folc; Arige us nu & miltsige se
Drihten þe on engla endebyrdnesse wæs gehered, þa he on Betleem wæs
acenned.
 180. Þa cleopodan hie & þus cwædon: Wuldor sy Gode on
heanessum & mannum on eorþan þam þe godes willan syn.
 182. Þy þriddan dæge seo eorþe on þæm norþende
& on þam eastende sprecaþ him betweonum; & þa neolnessa
grymetiaþ, & þa eorþan willaþ forswelgan.
 184. Þonne biþ eall eorþan mægen onwended, & mycel
eorþhrernes bið on þæm dæge geworden.
 185. Þy feorþan dæge ofor undern beoþ myccle þuneras on
heofnum; & þonne gefeallaþ ealle deofolgyld.
 187. & þonne hit biþ æt sunnan setlgange, & þeah
hweþre nænig leoht ne æteoweþ; & mona biþ adwæsced; &
beoþ þeostra forþ gewordene ofor ealle world; & steorran yrnaþ
wiþersynes ealne þone dæg; & men hie magan geseon swa sutole swa on
niht þonne hit swiþe freoseþ; & þonne on þæm dæge hatigaþ
þisse worlde welan & þa þing þe hie nu lufiaþ.
 193. Þy fiftan dæge æt underne se heofon tobyrst from
þæm eastdæle oþ þone westdæl; & þonne eall engla cynn
lociaþ þurh þa ontynnesse on manna cynn.
 195. Þonne geseoþ ealle menn þæt hit wile beon æt
þisse worlde ende.
 196. Fleoþ þonne to muntum & hie hydað for þara engla
onsyne, & þonne cweþaþ to þære eorþan, & biddaþ þæt
heo hie forswelge & gehyde, & wyscaþ þæt hie næfre næron
acennede from fæder ne from meder.
 199. Swa hit geara be þon on Cristes bocum gewitgod wæs, &
þus cweþaþ: Eadige syndon þa men þa þe wæron unberende, &
eadige syndon þa innoþas þa þe næfre ne cendon, & þa breost
þa þe næfre meolcgende næron.
 203. & þonne hie cweþaþ to þæm dunum & to
þæm hyllum: Feallaþ ofor us, & us bewreoþ & gehydað,
þæt we ne þurfon þysne ege leng þrowian æt þyssum englum.
 206. Nu is eal gesyne þæt we ær behyded hæfdon.
 206. Þy syxtan dæge ær underne þonne biþ from feower
endum þære eorþan eall middangeard mid awergdum gastum gefylled, þa
fundiaþ þæt hie willon genimon myccle herehyþ manna saula swa
Antecrist ær beforan dyde.
 210. & þonne he cymeþ þonne beotaþ he þæt he wile
þa saula sendan on ece witu þa þe him heran nellaþ; & þonne æt
nehstan biþ he sylfa on ecne wean bedrifan.
 212. Swa þonne þy dæge cymeþ Sanctus Michahel mid
heofonlicum þreate haligra gasta, & þa þonne ofsleaþ ealle þa
awergdan, & on helle grund bedrifaþ for heora unhyrsumnesse Godes beboda
& for heora mandædum.
 216. Þonne geseoþ ealle gesceafta ures Drihtnes mihte, þeah
þe hie nu mennisce men oncnawan nellan ne ongytan.
 218. Þonne æfter þeossum þingum biþ neh þæm
seofoþan dæge; & þonne hateþ Sanctus Michahel se heahengl blawan
þa feower beman æt þissum feower endum middangeardes, & awecceaþ
ealle þa lichoman of deaþe, þeah þe hie ær eorþe bewrigen
hæfde, oþþe on wætere adruncan, oþþe wildeor abiton, oþþe
fuglas tobæron, oþþe fixas toslitan, oþþe on ænige wisan of
þisse worlde gewiton.
 224. Ealle hie sceolan þonne arisan, & forþgan to þam
dome, on swylcum heowe swa hie hie ær hie sylfe gefrætwodan.
 226. Næs na mid golde ne mid godwebbenum hræglum, ac mid
godum dædum & halgum we sceolan beon gefrætwode, gif we þonne
willaþ beon on þa swiþran healfe Drihtnes Hælendes Cristes mid
soþfæstum saulum & gecorenum, þa he sendeþ on ece leoht.
 230. Forþon we sceolan nu geþencean, þa hwile þe we magan
& motan, ure saula þearfe, þe læs we foryldon þas alyfdon tid,
& þonne willon þonne we ne magon.
 233. Uton beon eaþmode & mildheorte & ælmesgeorne,
facen & leasunga & æfeste from urum heortum adoon & afyrran,
& beon rihtwise on urum mode wiþ oþre men; forþon þe God sylfa
þonne ne gymeþ nænges mannes hreowe; ne þær nænige þingunga ne
beoþ; ac biþ þonne reþra & þearlwisra þonne ænig wilde
deor, oþþe æfre ænig mod gewurde.
 238. & swa myccle swa þæs mannes miht beo mare, & he
biþ weligra on þisse worlde, swa him þonne se uplica Dema mare tosecþ,
þonne he him sylfum reþne dom & heardne geearnaþ & begyteþ, swa
hit be þon gecweden is: Se mon se þe nu demeþ þæm earmum buton
mildheortnesse, þonne biþ þam eft heard dom geteod.
 244. Uton nu, men þa leofestan, þas þing geþencean swiþe
snotorlice & wislice, þæt we þurh soþfæste dæda & þurh
mildheortnesse weorc urne Deman mildne gemeton, & þurh eaþmodnesse
& þurh þa soþan lufan Godes & manna us þa ecean eadignesse
geearnian mid urum Drihtne, þær he leofað & rixaþ a buton ende on
ecnesse, Amen.

START_TEXT

HomS 27
B3.2.27.
Easter Day: Schaefer 1972, 249-59.



 1. Men ða leofestan her segð on ðisum bocum hwæthwega be
þysum halgan Easterdæge þe  we nu todæg wurðiað and
mærsiað.
 2. Swa gecweden is on þisum unarimedum wundrum under his
anwealde, and sealde him ealle eorðan mid nytenum and sæ mid fixum and mid
hire gecyndum and sealde him sunnan and monan on his þeowdome.
 6. And þæt he mihte libban buton geswince and buton deaðe
wunian and anra gehwilc on strængðe tælmete mihte wunian and libban
swilce he þrittig wintre wære and symble habban leoht buton þeostrum and
dæg buton nihte.
 9. And efne swa þa tida on hærfæst mid wæstmum and mid
blostmum beoð gefyllede swa him wæron ealle god gesealde oð ða æt
nextan he forheold godes bebodu swa him drihten ne bebead þurh þæs
deofles lare.
 12. Ac þurh unwisdom he gesyngode beforan gode and þa æfter
þam nænige hreowsunge he ne dyde þæs gyltes.
 14. Swa hit is awriten on halgum bocum se ðe synne deð and þa
ne beteð se bið þære synne þeow oð ðæt he hi eft gebeteð
gode to willan.
 16. Swa þonne men ða leofestan æfter þam þeowdome
drihten god wæs ariend and helpend menniscum cynne. and swa swa on ðam
sixtan dæge adam gesceapen wæs and he on þam sixtan dæge gesyngode
æfter þan.
 19. And on þam sixtan dæge cain acwealde abel his broðor and
on þam sixtan dæge sodoma burh and Gomorra godes englas bærndon for
godes yrre mid fyres lige.
 21. And on þam sixtan dæge iacobes suna hi endleofone becipton
heora twelftan broðor ioseph Ægiptum on þeowdom wið þrittigum
scillingum. and on þam sixtan dæge se unlæda iudas becypte urne
Hælend.
 24. And on þam sixtan dæge petrus se apostol wiðsoc urum
Drihtne þriwa, and eft sona he gelyfde.
 25. And on ðam sixtan dæge ure drihten wæs on rode ahangen,
and on þam sixtan dæge þeostru wæron gewordene ofer eorðan fram
ðære sixtan tide oð ða nigoðan tide, and stanas wurdon tobrocene,
and eorðbyrgenna wurdon opene on gewitnysse ures drihtnes þæs þe nu
todæg of deaðe aras on þisne drihtenlican Easterdæg.
 31. Þæt is þonne wurðungdæg and gebletsod dæg swa
we ær beforan bodedon and sædon be þam mænigfealdum tacnum þe on
ðam dæge getacnode wæron.
 33. Ærest æt fruman he geworhte heofonas and eorðan, sunnan
and monan, and ealle gesceafta, and þa seofon heofonas mid nigon engla
endebyrdnyssum.
 35. Þone seofoðan heofon he geworhte him sylfum on to sittenne,
þæt is þonne þære halgan þrynnysse heofon on þam sit se
ælmihtiga god se ðe þone man of eorðan slime geworhte, and eorðan
gesette mid hire wæstmum and wriðas mid treowum, and ealle þa
wæstmbærenda gesceafta, palmtreow and ealle blowende wyrta.
 39. On þam drihtenlican dæge ealle þa wurc drihten gefylde
and hine þa gereste on þone seofoðan dæg and he hine þa gehalgode
eallum mannum to ræstedæge.
 42. And on þone drihtenlican dæg ure drihten wæs gefullod
on iordanes streame, and on ðone drihtenlican dæg he genam þone fruman
þæs fæstenes þe he gefæste feowertig daga and nihta ær
Eastron.
 45. And on ðone drihtenlican dæg iohannes se godspellere
geseah fægere gesihþe on þam iglande þe hatte Pathmos, and þurh
þæt he gesette þa halgan boc Apocalipsis.  and eac he geseah þa feower
godspelleras ures drihtnes on his ymbhwyrfte and he geseah þa seofon
candelstafas and þæt hiw mannes bearnes þæt is þone god sylfan.
 49. His loccas wæron swa hwite swa swiðe hwit wull and his
ansyn wæs swa fæger swa sunne and his eagan wæron swilce se reada lig
þæs fyres and his stemn wæs swilce manegra wætera geþunn.
 52. & on þone Drihtenlican dæg he geseah micel gesihþe
on heofonum & þa fæmnan sancta marian seo wæs beorhtre þonne
sunne & on hire heafde heo hæfde þone coronan þæra twelf
steorrena.
 55. And on ðone Drihtenlican dæg iohannes geseah metan þa
burh þa heofonlican hierusalem mid gyldenre rode and þa wæron on
ðære byrig twelf gatu of ðam <foreign>XII</foreign> gimstanum geworhte þurh synderlice
þing.
 58. And seo strætlanu is on ðære byrig of clænum golde
geworht, Seo leng and seo widnys and seo hehþo syndon gelice twelf mila
ælces þinges.
 61. And on þone Drihtenlican dæg hine ætywde se hælend
þam halgan apostole sancte petre be þære sæ þe tiberiadis hatte.
 63. And on þone drihtenlican dæg þære eastrena ure
drihten aras of deaðe and þurh þa rode his þrowunge þæs ecan lifes
ærest he gecydde se ðe nu todæg us generede of adames gylte.
 65. And nu todæg crist eode on helware and þa isenan
forescyttelsas he þær tobræc and towearp and Leviathan þæra deofla
ealdorman he geband and Iudam þe hine belæwde on þam dimman þrosme
þære sweartan dypan he besencte and he þa genam Adam and Euan and mid
him up alædde mid heora tudre and teame.
 70. Nu todæg men ða leofestan wæs gefylled se cwyde
þæs halgan witegan Isaias þam mannum on þam lande eardigendum under
þæs deaðes sceade.
 72. Micel leoht nu todæg him wæs up cumen and þæt folc
þe þa on helle on þystrum sæt micel leoht hi þa gesawon.
 73. Be þyses dæges leohtes micelnysse nu todæg wæron
wundrigende þa hiwscipas on helle forðan hi næfre ær ne gesawon swa
fæger leoht swa hi þa gesawon and hi þa swa cwædon, Hwæt la is
þes wuldres cyning buton hit si se ælmihtiga god.
 77. And eac hi swa cwædon, Geseoð ge þæt we geseoð urne
ealdorman Leviathan.
 78. Se ðe ær wæs wealdend ofer us he is nu gebunden mid
isenum racenteagum and his þegnas mid him.
 80. Swa þonne men ða leofestan helware wæron be drihtnes
tocyme se ðe þone ærestan man generede.
 81. Swa cwæð se halga apostol sanctus paulus, Se æresta man
wæs of eorðan eorðlice gesceapen, þæt þonne wæs adam.
 82. Se æftera man wæs of heofonum heofonlic, þæt is
crist sylfa, se ðe of heofonum astah on eorðan and hine geeadmedde
menniscum hiwe to onfonne and þurh his þrowunge eall mancyn alysde and swa
manna gehwilcum gedafenat to arisanne of his gyltum.
 88. Eac swilce we sceolon andettan ure synna beforan urum
scriftum.
 89. And þa læcedomas urum sawlum we sceolon geornlice secan
ægðer ge on worde ge on weorce þæt we magon orsorglice gan to ures
drihtnes weofde and þær cristes lichaman and his þæt gebletsode blod
niman and þicgan swa he sylfa cwæð, Se man se ðe þigeð minne
lichaman and drincð min þæt halige blod se wunað on me and ic beo on
him.
 93. He halgode hlaf ær his þrowunge and todælde his
discipulum and þus cwæð, Etað þisne hlaf, hit is min lichama and
doð þis on minum gemynde.
 96. Eft he bletsode win on anum calice and cwæð, Drincað
ealle of þisum, þis is min blod þæt bið for manegum agoten on synna
forgyfennysse.
 98. Eft syððan þa apostolas dydon swa swa crist het þæt
hi halgodon hlaf to husle and win on his gemynde, eac swilce heora
æftergengan ealle bisceopas and sacerdas be cristes hæse halgiað hlaf
and win to husle on his naman mid þære apostolican bletsunge.
 102. Soðlice se hlaf and þæt win þe beoð þurh heora
mæssan gehalgode oðer þing hi ætywað menniscum andgytum wiðutan
and oðre þing hi clipiað wiðinnan geleaffullum modum wiðutan.
 104. Hi beoð gesewene hlaf and win ægðer ge on hiwe ge on
swæcce ac hi beoð soðlice æfter þære halgunge cristes lichama
and his blod þurh gastlice gerynu.
 107. Hæðen cild þe man fullað ne bryt hyt na his hiw
wiðutan ac hit bið swaðeah wiðinnan awend and aþwogen on ðam fante
fram eallum synnum.
 109. Swa is eac þæt halige fantwæter oðrum wæterum on
hiwe gelic ac þurh þæs sacerdes bletsunge genealæcð þæs halgan
gastes miht and hit syððan aþwyhþ þa sawle fram eallum synnum þurh
gastlice mihte.
 113. We rædað on ðære bec þe is gehaten <foreign>uita patrum</foreign>
þæt twegen munecas bædon æt gode sume swutelunge be þam halgan
husle and þa æfter þære bene hi gestodon him mæssan.
 115. Þa gesawon hi licgan on ðam weofde an cild and godes engel
stod mid anum sexe anbidigende oððæt se preost þæt husel tobræc,
þa toliþode se engel þæt cild on þam disce and his blod into ðam
calice geat and þa hi to þam husle eodon.
 119. Þa wearð hit awend sona to hlafe and to wine and hi hit
þigdon gode þancigende þære geswutelunge.
 121. Eac we rædað þæt sanctus gregorius abæd æt
criste þæt he ætywde anum tweonigendan wife micle geswutelunge be þam
halgan husle, heo eode to husle tweonigendum mode.
 123. Þa abæd se halga gregorius æt gode þærrihte
þæt him bam wearð ætywed seo snæd þæs husles þe heo
þicgan sceolde, swilce þær læge on þam disce anes fingres lið eal
blodig and þæs wifes twynung wearð sona gerihtlæced.
 127. Forðan þonne men ða leofestan micel neadþearf us is
þæt we us geornlice clænsien and gemedemien ær þam tocyme þæs
halgan husles þurh hreowsunge and þurh ælmyssan and þurh fæsten
and ne agymeleasien we þa teoðan sceattas to syllanne for godes lufan swa
se apostol cwæð.
 131. Efne swa þæt wæter fyr adwæsct swa deð eac seo
ælmysse þa synne þy us þonne gedafenað men þa leofestan þæt
we ondrædon þa andweardnysse godes and his engla and hu he andswarigende
byð þam arleasum gastum and þus cwæþende gaþ fram me ge awyrgde on
þæt ece fyr on hellewite and on þone ecan ungefean.
 135. Þa syndon deoflum gegearwode and eallum heora geferum,
þær is toða gristbitung and þa singalan þystru.
 137. And he þonne cwyð ure drihten to ðam arleasum, Ic wæs
hungrig and ne sealdon ge me mete and ic wæs þurstig and ne sealdon ge me
drincan and ic wæs nacod þa ne wruge ge me mid eowrum hræglum.
 140. Þonne cweðað þa unrihtwisan men to him, Hwænne
gesawon we þe drihten god swa þearfiendne, þonne andswarað him ure
drihten and swa cwyð, þonne ge hit ne dydon minum þam earmestum þearfum
þe ic eow to sende þonne ne dydon ge hit me.
 143. Soð ic eow secge, Ne can ic eow.
 145. Men ða leofæstan we us sculun ondrædan þysne
andweardan cwyde þe drihten þonne cwyð þonne he demende byð
lifigendum and forðgewitenum and efne swa he nu todæg of deaðe aras swa
he becymð on ða ilcan Easterniht swa hit on þam godspelle awriten is.
 149. Drihten cymð swa se þeof cymð þonne he stelan wile.
swa ungecyþed he byð æghwilcum men, ge se dæg ge seo niht swa him
byð þæs þeofes cyme.
 151. Be þysum dæge þonne wæs micel word gecweden, wella
þu micela dæg and þu egeslice niht on þam beoð astyrede eall heofona
mægen.
 153. And be þæs dæges þrymme and his ege is awriten and
gecweden þæt se an dæg byð swa lang geþuht swa þusend wintra.
 155. Men ða leofestan on þam dæge drihten demð þrym
hiwscipum þæt is heofonware and eorðware and helware.
 156. And on ðam dæge ealle deade arisað and æfter þam
hi beoð standende and andettenne heora dæda beforan þam hehstan and
þam æðelestan cristes heahsetle.
 158. Þær manna gehwilc his dæda forð sceal beran swa gode
swa yfele swæðer  he ær dyde.
 160. And þonne æfter þan ure drihten god gelaðað and
gecigð ealle his gedefan and gecorenan on þæt ece lif and on þa ecan
gefean and þus him to clypað, <foreign>Uenite Benedicti patris mei percipite regnum
quod uobis paratum est ab origine mundi</foreign>, Cumað ge gebletsode and onfoð
mines fæder rice þæt eow fram þyses middaneardes fruman gegearwod
wæs.
 166. And þonne þa halgan mid heahsittendum and mid englum and
mid heahfæderum and mid þam halgan apostolum and mid eallum halgum
wuniað on ðære ecan and on ðære langsuman sibbe and blisse þæs
singalan dreames.
 169. He þonne drihten wile þæt ealle men hale and gesunde
sin and he nele þæt ænig forweorðe ac ealle he wile gelædan and
gelaþian on þæs ecan lifes gefean þæra þe her willað rihtlice
and clænlice æfter boca bebodum libban.
 172. Þær he nu mid þam clænum þam rihtwisum leofað
rixað mid Fæder and mid Suna on annysse haliges gastes a on ecnysse buton
ælcum ende, Amen.

START_TEXT

HomS 28
B3.2.28.
Easter Day: Schaefer 1972, 212-26.



 1. Nu we habbað eow gesæd anfealdlice þæt godspel ðe se
diacon rædde nu ætforan us eallum hu crist on þysum dæge of deaðe
aras.
 3. Nu wylle we eow gyt secgan hu he to helle astah & þone
deofol geband & þanon gelædde ealle ða þe him her on life gecweme
& gecorene wæron.
 6. Hit gewearð swa þæt deofol beswac and forlærde þa
twegen frumsceapene menn adam and euan ðe we ealle of coman swa þæt hi
godes bebod abræcon and weron him ungehyrsume and deofle gehyrsume.
 8. Þa wæs eall mancyn deaðe scyldig and forworht to helle
forþam ðe hi godes bebod tobræcon.
 10. Ða þuhte ðam deofle þæt he ahte ealles middaneardes
geweald forðam næs nan mann on ðisum life swa halig ne swa mære
þæt he ne sceolde to helle faran swa hraðe swa he of þisum life ferde
oðþæt Crist com & us alysde.
 14. And þæt wæs eac swutol þa se deofol lærde herodes
cinincg þæt he het acwellan ðone mæran witegan iohannem ðone
fulluhtere þe crist mid his agenan muðe þus geherode.
 16. Betweox wifa bearnum ne aras nan mærra mann ðonne iohannes
se fulluhtere se wæs for soðfæstnesse and for cristes læððe
ofslagen and acweald and þa sona se ealda feond his sawle to helle
gelædde.
 20. Ða cwæð he to his geferan, Geseoð nu, þis is
þæs sawle be ðam wæs cweden þæt betweox were and wife ne arise
nan mærra wer þonne iohannes wære se fulluhtere.
 22. Ne gemette ic eac æfre æningne ðyllicne mid mannum
fram ðam dæge þe ic adam þone ærestan mann beswac ac geseoð nu
þæt he næfde nane strencðe wið me.
 25. Nu ðeahhwæðere is gyt an man onmang iudeum þe is
gecweden þæt he sy godes sunu and þæs ic oft on manegum þingum
fandode and ic hine swyðor man afandode þonne godes sunu and
ðeahhwæðere wundorlican ðonne ic æfre ær æningne oðerne
gesawe.
 28. Nu gif ic mæg þone hider bringan ne ondræde ic me
þæt æfre heonon feorð si acenned of menn ænig ðara þe mage his
heafod wið me upp ahebban.
 31. Nu wylle ic for anes faran to iudeum and hi læran and heora
ealdorbiscopas tyhtan þæt hi him on leogan and hine to heora ealdormannum
forwregan niðfullice þæt hi hine to deaðe syllan and on hrode ahon and
hine þonne þæron acwellan.
 34. And sona swa he acweald bið þonne wille ic his sawle hider
mid me gelædan þonne bið þæt swylc lac swylce næfre ær ne com
of eorðwarum to helle.
 37. Ða sona swa crist þæs lifiendan godes sunu on rode
ahangen wæs þa asende he his þone halgan gast and mid his godcundnesse
þa sawle ahydde and bemað þæt hig se deofol geseon ne mihte ne his
godcundnesse undergyton.
 40. Ða wæs se deofol swyðe micclum gebyld and þus cweþ
þa he geseah crist on þære rode hangian, His þis na god ac is man, nu
forlitlan, ic miccle maran mann to helle gelædde.
 43. Ic wille nu swa ðeah faran and his onfon.
 44. Þa for he swiðe ofermodilice and mid ðam þe he mynte
hine to onfonne, þa hrædlice wearð se ilca ealda feond þe adam on
neorxnawonge ær mid facne and mid his leasungum forlærde.
 46. And beswac wearð mid ecum bendum gebunden and mid ecum
geniðeringum geniðerad fram þam æfteran adame þæt wæs se þe
he underfon wolde þæt is ure drihten crist se ðe lytle ær on
ðære rode acweald wæs.
 50. Næs he na swa mid mægne ofercumen swa swa he mid rihte
gehyned wæs and afylled mid cwicsusles geniðerunge.
 51. Swa se hælend sylf be þam cweþ, Hwæt gemetiest þu
yfeles on me, forhwon hrine ðu on me swa swa hit be ðam gecweden is, se
ðe on oðres mid unrihte geræsð se his agen þurh þæt oft
forlyseð.
 55. Ða wæs se ealda feond þyses middaneardes bereafod and
ealles þæs freodomes ðe he on helle hæfde.
 56. And þa wæron ealle þing underþeod urum drihtne
hælende crist se ðe be him sylfum mycele ær sang and þus cweþ, <foreign>Si
exaltat us fuero omnia traham ad me ipsum</foreign>, þæt is on englisc, gif
þæt gelimpð þæt ic beo on rode up ahafen þonne teo ic ealle
þing to me.
 60. Ealle þing he to him teah ða þa he on rode gefæstnod
wæs and he his gast to god fæder asende, þa syððan hi wæron
ealle gesceafta underþeod ægðer twegra ge heofonwaru ge eorðwaru ge
hellwaru.
 63. And he ða freo astah fram þam nyðerlican witum syððan
he hæfde geondfaren þa ðystru and þa gemæro hellegrundes.
 65. Þa ða awyrigdan hellegastas and þa earman on þam
heolstre geflymde wæron, þa wæs gefylled seo witegung þe ær
beforen gesungen wæs and cweden, <foreign>Cadent alatere tuo mille et decem milia ad
dextris tuis ad te autem non ad propinquabit</foreign>, þæt is, fram ðinre sidan
gefeallað þusenda.
 69. And fram þinre swyðre sidan gefeallað tyn þusenda þa
þa drihtne ne genealæceð þa he þone ealdor ealles wrohtes and þone
ordfruman ælces yfeles ecere nyðerunga geniðerod and mid ecum bendum
gebunden hæfde.
 72. Þa wæs gefylled þæt gefyrn worulde be criste gesungen
wæs and gewitegod.
 73. <foreign>Super aspidem et basiliscum ambulabis et conculabis leonem et
draconem</foreign>, þæt is, ðu tredst leon and dræcan.
 75. Gehereð we nu þæt ðam deofle ægðer þyssa naman
wel geðwæreð.
 76. Seo leo bið cyng & ealdor ealra reðra wilddeora swa
þonne se deofol bið ealdor & wealdend ealra yfelra manna.
 77. Se draca mid his þam geættredan orðe geswencð menn swa
se deofol mid his ungelefan blæde ealles mancynnes staðel afyrsode and
awyrde and of þam stealle þæræ godcundlican fægernysse awearp and
aweg adraf.
 81. Ða se heap ðæra earmra gasta and þæra
wiðerweardra beheoldan þone niwancuman urne drihten hælend crist
swyðe beorhte and leohte scynende and þa wæron þa earman gastas
swyðe afyrhte and abregde and þus cwædon, Hwanon is ðes beorhta and
þes leohta and þes stranga middaneard syððan he wæs us underþeod.
 85. Næfre ær he us þyllic gafol ne geald ne us næfre
ær þyllice lac hyder ne onsende.
 87. Hwæt is ðes þe her swa unforht gæð on ure gemæro
and ec ofer þæt urne ealdor mid bendum gebunden ne hæfð.
 88. Ac ic wene is wen þæt ðis is se ylca be þam ure ealdor
nu hwene ær sæde þæt he þurh his deað ealles middaneardes
anweald onfenge.
 90. And gif hit ðes is þonne is ures cempan cwyde on
wyðerweardnysse gecyrred mid ðy þe him wæs geþuht þæt he mihte
hine oferswyðan þa wæs he him sylf fram þysum oferswyðed and
gefylled.
 94. Eala ure ealdor is ðisse be þæs deaðe þu a
fægniende wære and on þæs deaðe þu ðe mænige herereaf fore
gehete.
 95. Hwæt is la þæt ðu dydest.
 96. Forhwon woldest þu ðis onginnan nu he ealle ðine ðystru
mid his beorhtnesse geflymde.
 97. Gehyr nu ure ealdor þa ðu þine welan ðe þu on þam
ærestan men begeate ðurh forhogodnysse godes beboda.
 99. Nu ðu þæt forlure þurh rodetreow, geseoh nu þæt
eall ðin blis þe losade mid þam ðe þu crist on rode ahenge ac ne
mihtest ðu næfre geseon ne ðe gifeðe næs þa forwyrde þines
rices.
 102. Ðu hine on deað gelæddest butan ælcere scylde and
þu ðær gylt beheolde þar þu næfre nænne ne fundest.
 103. Forhwon dorstest þu him æfre æt hrinan.
 105. Þa æfter ðysse spæce þære wælgrima deofla
ðe heora ealdra wiðspræcan unarimendre mænigu haliges folces þa
ðe wæron gehæfte on helle wependre stemne and mid micele halsunge
þone hælend bædon and þus cwædon, Nu ðu to us come middaneardes
alysend.
 109. And nu þu to us come þone þe we dagena gehwylcne to
hopedon and nu ðu to us come þu ðe on middanearde synfullum mannum
forgyfennesse sealdest.
 111. Alys nu forðferde and þa ðe on helle gehæfte synd nu
þu for us to hellwarum nyðer astyge and nelle þu næfre ure wana beon
þæt ðu þinne ðone mildan ansyne us fram ne acyrre.
 113. Ðu ðe þines wuldres tacen on hrodere gecyddest drihten
sy þin mildheortnys ofer us swa swa we aa fæstlice on ðe gehihtað
forðon þe mid þe is lifes will and on ðinum leohte we leoht geseoð.
 116. Drihten gemunðu þine gesomnunga ða þe ðu on fruman
gescope and ne gemunðu na ure ealdan unrihtwisse ac onfoh us raðe mid
þinre micclan mildheortnysse forðan þe we synd swyðe heane gewordene.
 119. Drihten alys us and ne beo þu ure synna na gemyndig for
þinum ðam halgan naman.
 121. Þa æfter þam wæs gehyred seo ben and seo halsung
unarimendre ða þe gehæfted wæron and sona hrædlice þurh
drihtnes hæse of þam bendum alysde wæron.
 123. And hi ða to drihtnes cneowum alotene wæron and hi
þingadon geornlice and mid unasegcendlicre blisse clypedon and þus
cwædon, Drihten þu ðe tobræce ure bendas þe we heriað and
lufiað and þanciað þæt ðu us ne dydest æfter urum synnum ne us
ne gulde æfter urum unrihtwisnyssum.
 128. And þa gyt adam and eua næron alysde of þæs wites
bendum, þa adam geomeriendlicre and earmlicre stemne clypade to drihtne and
cweþ, Gemiltsa me min drihten on þinre þære miclan mildheortnysse and
on þare menigu þinra miltsa, adilga mine unrihtwisnyssa forðon þe ic
þe anum gesyngade and ic yfele dyde beforan ðe.
 132. Ic dwolade swa swa þæt unwise sceap and forwearð and
losade.
 133. Alys nu mine bendas forðon þe þine handa me geworhtan
& me gehiwodon & ne forlet ðu na on helle mine sawle ac þine
mildheortnysse on me gecyð & me gelæd of þyses cwearternes huse
& of þyses deaðes sceade.
 137. Hwæt Ða ure drihten adame gemiltsade and hine of þam
bendum alysde and he þa to ðæs hælendes cneowum aleat and þus
cweþ, Bletsie min sawl drihten and ealle mine innoþas his ðæne halgan
naman se is milde geworden minum unrihtwisnyssum se gehælde ealle mine ecas
se alysde min lif of forwyrde se gefylde on godum minne willan.
 142. Þa gyt eua þurhwunode on wope and cweþ, Drihten þu
eart rihtwis and þin dom is riht forþon ic mid gewyrhtum ðas witu
þrowige, ða þa ic wæs on are ne ongeat ic hit na.
 144. Ic eom wiðmeten unwisum nytene and ic eom nu him gelic
geworden.
 145. Ac ne gemun ðu min drihten þa gyltas mines geogeðhades
and minre dysinysse and ne acyr ðu þa ansyne ðinre mildheortnysse fram me
and ne ahyld þu þe on yrre fram ðinre þeowene.
 148. Min drihten gehyr ðu þa stemne þe ic to ðe clypige
forðan min lif gewat on sare and mine gear on geomerunge synd geendode.
 150. Drihten þu wast þæt ic eom gedrorenlic dust gif ðu
hylst mine unrihtwisnysse.
 151. Hu mæg ic hit ðonne acuman ænigra þinga oððe
aberan, þu wast mine gyltas and mine dysinyssa and hi næran beforan ðe
ahydde ne bemiðene.
 153. Geara me min drihten for þinre modor lufan of ðære þu
wære geeadmet þæt ðu menniscne lichaman underfenge.
 154. Heo onfeng flæsce of minum flæsce and ban of minum
bane.
 155. Ara me min drihten þeah þe ic wære ungesæligast
ealra wifa.
 156. Geara me forðan þe ðu eart min god and min scyppend,
miltsa me forðam þe ðu man fram mannum wære, alys me forðan þe
ðu woldest mann beon to ðam þæt ðu menn alysdest.
 160. And þa wæs se hælend sona mid mycelre mildheortnysse
astyrod and hy ða hrædlice alysde of þæs wites bendum.
 161. And heo ða geornlice onleat to þæs hælendes cneowum
and þus cweþ, Drihten si ðin nama gebletsod on worulde forðon þe
þin miltheortnyss is micel ofer me and þu generodest mine sawle of
þære nyðerlican helle.
 165. Þa ahof abraham his stæfne upp and cweþ to þam
ymbstandendum, Andettað drihtne þæt he is soð god and his
mildheortnys/ wæs ær eallum woruldum.
 167. And nu gyt bið a a to worulde þa astah se hælend of
þære helle and he hæfde þær gebunden and genyðerad deaðes
ordfruman and he ða hrædlice ða gehergadan mid him gelædde of
deaðes gryne.
 170. And he sealde mannum ða gife þæs ecan lifes and he þa
ðone ealdon feond nyðer gefylled hæfde.
 172. We habbað oft gesæd and gyt secgað þæt cristes
rihtwisnys is swa mycel þæt he nolde niman manncynn neadunga of þam
deofle butan he hit forworhte.
 174. He hit forworhte þa ða he tihte þæt folc to cristes
cwale þæs ælmihtigan godes.
 175. And þa ðurh his unscæððigan deað we wurden
alysde fram þam ecan deaðe.
 176. Gyf we us sylfe ne forpærað, þa getimode þam reðan
deofle swa swa deð grædigan fisce þe gesihð þæt æs and ne
gesyhð þone angel ðe on þam æse sticað, bið þonne grædig
ðæs æses and forswylhð þone angel forð mid þam æse.
 180. Swa wæs þam deofle he geseah ða menniscnysse on criste
and na þa godcundnysse, þa sprytte he þæt iudeisce folc to his slege
and gefredde þa ðone angel cristes godcundnysse þurh ða he wæs to
deaðe ac cod and benemed ealles mancynnes þære ðe on god belyfað.
 185. Ne wene nu æfre ænig mann þæt drihten crist ealle
þa of helle gelædde þe he ðær gemette ac þa ane ða þe heora
lif her on worulde rihtlice leofedon þa he ðanon gelædde.
 187. And he þær forlet morðwyrhtan and dyrne forligras and
rihtes geleafan wiþersacan and þeofas and gitseras and þa ðe heora
yfeldæda betan nellað þa he næfre þanon alyseð.
 191. Ac swa se witega cwæð be cristes hade, <foreign>o mors ero mors
tua morsus tuus ero inferne</foreign>, þæt is on englisc, eala þu deað ic beo
þin deaþ and þu hell ic beo þin bite.
 193. Soþlice se hælend wæs þæs deaþes deað
forþam mid his deaðe he oforswaþ þone ecan deað, he wæs helle bite
forþam he þær dæl genam and þær eac dæl forlet.
 196. Ðæt wæs þonne þæt he þær geleafulra manna
sawla onfeng and sinfulle þær forlet.
 198. Ac wen is þæt sum man swigende wille þencan and
dyrnunga cweðan, Hwa is þæt of helle hider come and þæt sæde
þæt hit eall þus gelumpen wære.
 200. Þam is þonne mid rihte to answarienne þæt us is se
getriwesta gewita, seo soðfæstnys sylf, þæt is þonne ure drihten
hælend crist se on helle astah and þanon eft lifiende com.
 202. And æfter his æriste his ðegnum æteowede, and mete
mid heom onfenge and be godes rice sprecende wæs and mid heom wæs
feowertig daga æfter his æriste and cydde heom þis eall and oðre
þinge mænige þyssum gelic.
 206. Mid þam ðe engla weorod and heahengla werod gesegon þone
hælend astigan mid unarimendre mænigu on heofona rices heannysse, þa
cwædon hi, hwæt is þes wuldres cyning.
 208. Ne cwædan hig hit na þy þæt hi nystan hwæt he
wære ac hi wundrigende þæt cwædan be him.
 209. Ða andsweredan heom þa halgan and þus cwædan, Hit is
ælmihtig drihten, he is wuldres cyning and he ðas herehuðe of helle
generede and þeostra ealdor mid ecum bendum gebundene hæfð.
 213. Blissige nu eall mancynn forðam þe cristes blod wæs
agoten for ealles mancynnes hæle and blissian huru þa ðe his æriste
gelyfað and weorðiað.
 215. Se leofað and rixað mid fæder and mid þam halgan
gaste on þrynnesse ðrymme þurh ealra worulda worold, Amen.

HomS 30 (TristrApp 2)
B3.2.30.
In Letania maiore: Tristram 1970, 430-37.



 1. <foreign>De letania maiore</foreign>.
 1. Leofan men, ðas dagas synd gehaten letanie þæt synd
gebeddagas.
 2. On þissum dagum we sceolon biddan ure eorðlicra wæstma
genihtsumnysse and us sylfum gesundfulnysse and þæt gyt mare is ure synna
forgyfennesse.
 5. And we rædað on bocum þæt se gewuna þissa gangdaga
wurde aræred on þone timan þe gelamp on anre burhscire þe uigenna is
genamod.
 7. Þæt wearð mycel eorðstyrung and feollon gehalgode godes
cyrcean & manega hus hruran and comon wilde deor and tosliton and abiton
ealles to fela þurh godes yrre and ðæs cyninges botl wearð mid
heofonlicum fyre forbærned and fela ungelimpa gewearð for folces synnan.
 13. And þa bead se biscop mamertus þreora daga fæsten and
þæt man halidom sceolde wyrðlice styrien and mid ælmeslacum georne
god gladian and þæt manna gehwylc unsceodum fotum þam halidome sceolde
eadmodlice fylian and ealle to criste geornlice clypian.
 17. And sona swa þæt gedon wæs þa wæs swutele gesyne
þæt heom god syðþan uðe lisse and miltse.
 19. Ne wearð næfre syððan þanon forð eft swylc
gedrecednys innan þam lande ac wearð þæt to bysne wide and side
þæt man þanon forð þa gangdagas on gewunan hæfde.
 23. Leofan men, nu bidde ic and lære ælcne cristene man
þæt he þissa þreora daga fæsten rihtlice gehealde ælce dæge
to nones and to anes mæles butan hwa for ylde oððe for iuguðe oððe
for unhæle gelæstan ne mæge.
 26. Gyf þonne þissa þreora þinga ænig hwylcne man lette
þæt hine to þam fæstene ne onhagie þonne is hit alefed þæt he
mot mete þicgan on þa gerad þe he his ælmessan sylle and nænne
oðerne man him to ne spanne to ðam gereordum butan þær hwylc oðer
mettrum man sy þe þæt fæsten aberan ne mæge.
 33. Gyf þonne se hala mid þam unhalan þone mete þigeð
þonne wurþað hig begen þurh þæs mettruman unmihta beswicene.
 35. And nis nanum men alefed for nanre neode þis fæsten to
abrecane ne mid ælmessan to alysenne butan hine þæra þreora þinga
hwylc forwyrne, yld oððe iuguð oððe unhæl.
 39. Leofan men, se halga apostol iacobus mynegode us ealle
freondlice on þam pistole þe man ær rædde and us eac luflice lærde
þæt we georne began ure agene þearfe.
 42. He cwæð, <foreign>Confitemini alter utrum peccata uestra</foreign>,
ðæt is on englisc, anddettað georne, he cwæð, eowre synna eow
betweonan.
 44. And ælc for oðerne he cwæð gebidde georne þæt
eow god ælmihtig gesundfulnysse geunne.
 46. For þam ic secge eow þæt rihtwises mannes gebedu
fremiað swyðe mycclum.
 47. Elias on ealddagum se halga wæs man eall swa we synd and he
abæd þeah æt gode þæt he forwyrnde þam wiðerweardan folce þe
he mid wunode feorðe healf gear ælces renes.
 51. And he abæd eft syðþan æt þam soðan gode þæt
he renas forgeaf & eorðlice wæstmas.
 52. Ðær is swutol þæt haliges mannes gebedu magan mycles
wealdan.
 54. Se halga apostol sæde eac on þissum pistole þæt gyf
hwylc man gehwyrfeð oþerne fram gedwylde, þæt is fram deofles larum,
he alyst witodlice his sawle fram deaðe and fela synna fordiligað.
 57. Ac, leofan men, understandað eow sylfe swyðe georne
þæt ge rihtlice and wærlice þæt gehealdon þæt eow mæst
þearf is to gehealdenne þæt is rihtne cristendom and rihtne geleafan on
god ælmihtine þe ealle þing gescop and geworhte.
 62. Leofan men, se halga godspellere, lucas, rehte on þissum
godspelle þe man nu ær rædde hu ure drihten hwilum to his leornicnihtum
spræc.
 64. He cwæð, gyf besorh freond cymð to oðres huse on midre
nihte and he næfð him to donne swa swa he wolde þonne gæð he and
biddeð his neahgebur þæt he him alæne hlaf for ðære neode his
cuman þe him to com.
 68. Ðonne andwyrdeð se oðer þær wiðinnan and cwæð
þæt he ne mæge arisan, segð þæt his dyre synd fæste and his
cild on heora reste ac bideð þæt he hine na ne swence.
 72. Gyf he þonne se oþer for ðon georne clypað and cnucað
þonne æt nehstan arist he for ðam onhrope and getiþað þæs þe
him neod bið.
 75. Be þissere bysne ure drihten lærð us hwæt we don
sceolon.
 76. Ðæt is þonne, þæt we sceolon clypian and biddan
georne gelome god ælmihtig þæt he ure neoda gecnawe and ure læsta
gebete.
 78. And gyf we ægðer ge mid wordum ge mid weorcum rihtlice and
geornlice clypiað þonne wile he ure bena sona gehyran.
 80. Ac butan seo heorte rihtlice hycge and weorc þam wordum
fylstan ne behealdeð þa word naht swyðe mycel.
 82. Swa he sylf on his godspelle swutollice sæde and ðus
cwæð, <foreign>Non omnis qui dicit domine domine</foreign>, ðæt is on englisc, ne
færð na ælc þæra into heofonum þe gelome clypað to criste ac
se ðe wyrceð godes willan and on þam þurhwunað forð oð ende se
witodlice færð on an to heofonum.
 88. Leofan men, utan clypian georne oft and gelome and earnian
georne þæt god ælmihtig ure bena gehyran wylle, uton gelomlice
geþencan þone egeslican dom, þe we ealle to sceolon and utan understandan
þæt hit þær to nealæcð georne.
 93. Ðeos woruld is eall wyrse þonne heo wæs and
dæghwamlice heo yfelað swyðe for ðam þe hit sceal gewyrðan.
 95. Þæt gefyrn awriten wæs, <foreign>Ueniet tempus quale non fuit</foreign>,
ðæt is on englisc, swa egeslic tima cymð to mannum swa næfre ær on
worulde ne gewearð.
 97. Þæt is on antecristes timan and se tima wyrð on worulde
sorhful and egesfull for ðam þe antecrist bið sylf deoful and ðeah
mennisc man geboren.
 101. Leofan men, her segð eac on þyssum bocum be ðære
mycclan arwyrðnysse ures scyppendes hu eadmodlice he ymb mancynn hogode for
ðam þe he hit gescop and geworhte.
 104. And he wolde þæt seo gesceaft ongeate heora scyppend se
ðe he to life gescop on neorxnawanges gefean þær he hi undeadlice
gestaðelode.
 106. And þeah hwæþre þurh deofles beswicenysse gelamp
þæt seo mennisce gesceaft of þam undeadlican life hider nyðer gefeoll
and her on sare and on yrmðum syðþan cendon and leofedon and syðþan
æfter heora life to helle and to ecum deaþe bedrifene wurdon oð þæt
se wuldorlica cyning se ðe is ealles middaneardes alesend onbærnde
mænig gastlic leohtfæt mancynn to onlihtenne to þon þæt nænig
deofla dimnes ne bysgode þam ðe þæt leoht þære soðfæstnysse
ongytan woldan.
 116. Gehyrað nu broðor mine hwylc þa leohtfatu wæron þe
he ure drihten onbærnde on þissum middanearde mancynn to onlihtanne.
 118. Þæt wæron ærest heahfæderas þa wæron
gefylde to godum weorcum and ðeawum þa þe godes folc lærdon geond
þysne middaneard.
 120. Þanon onwocon witegan þa wæron gelærde þurh þone
halgan gast and na læs þæt an þæt hy ðæs folces synna
þreadan ac eac swylce þone cristes tocyme ures hælendes bodedon.
 123. And æfter þon wæron halige apostolas þa ðe he
sylfa geceas to þam þæt he ure drihten hi of his sylfes muðe lærde
and geond þysne middaneard sende to hælenne and to lærenne eall mancynn
and him ðus to cwæð, <foreign>Euntes docete omnes gentes</foreign>, farað nu and
lærað geond ealle þeoda hwæt sy to lufianne oððe to forganne, hu
men magon þa ecan witu befleon and ða ecan reste geearnian heora sawlum on
heofonanrices gefean.
 131. And ða æfter þissum wæron soðlice gesette halige
biscopas and mæssepreostas and diaconas and mænige leorneras geond godes
cyrcan þæt we nu magon ongitan and witan hwæt us is to donne oððe
to forganne.
 135. Gehyrað nu broðor mine and ongytað for hwan us is gesett
þeos tid to weorðianne fram þam halgan easterdæge oþ ðas tid þe
we nu weorþiað.
 137. Se ælmihtiga godes sunu se ðe undeadlice æt þære
tide aras and oft and gelome mid his gingrum wæs and hine sylfne undeadlice
æteowde and he eadmodlice and geornlice lærde ealle þeoda to
heofonanrices gefean.
 141. Ðonne syndon us þas þry dagas to þon gesett þæt
we sceolon þa halgan cristes þegnas onhyrgan, þæt is þæt we
sceolon ure woruldweorc forgan fram underne oð non and to godes cyrcan cuman
and for urum synnum þingian and forð mid þam halgum reliquium gan swa us
þa halgan apostolas mynegodon to weorþianne urne hælend and his þa
halgan.
 147. For ðon þe nu ealle eorðan wæstmas growende syndon
and blowende geopenade and þæt ure bileofan syn growende and gebletsode to
hælo ures lichoman and sawle.
 150. For ðon us is þeos tid geset ure sawla hælo on to
biddanne and ures lichoman bletsunge and ura woruldgoda genihtsumnesse mid
godcunda lofsange and mid þam halgum reliquium we sculon beon gode
lofsecgende and cristes rodetacen forðberan and his þa halige godspell and
oðre halignessa mid þam we sceolon bletsian ure þa eorðlican speda
þæt synd æteras and wudu and ure ceap and eall þa þing þe us god
forgyfen hafað to brucanne þe we bileofian sceolon.
 159. Utan we nu symle þang secgan urum scyppende his miltsa for
ðon þe he us swyðe lufode ofer ealle oðre gesceafta þa ðe nu under
heofonas hwolfe syndon.
 162. He sylfa us gescop and us geworhte þa we næron and he us
gesihte þa we forwordene wæron and he us abohte of hellewitum and of
deofles anwealde mid his ðy deorwyrðan blode and us opene gedyde þone weg
to heofonanrice.
 166. For ðon we sculon ongytan hu mycel neadþearf us wæs his
tocymes to ure alysednysse.
 167. La, hwylc mihte beon hefigre nydþearf þonne se eca deað
and hwylc mihta beon hefigre wite þonne ure synna and se hearda þeowdom
oððe hwylc mihte beon mare wælgrimmes þonne ure hæftnydnes on
helleþeostrum.
 171. Cuðlice we wæron on deofles þeowdome and we wæron on
helle fæðmum of þæm he us alysde and us lif sealde on heofonanrice.
 174. Leofan men, se witega cwæð be heofonarice and be
hellewite þæt næfre nære gemet on heofonanrices wuldre swa mycel
unwynsumnes on ænigum laðe oððe on hungre oððe on þurste
oððe on cele oððe on hæte oððe on ece oððe on adle oððe
on ænigum laðe gewinne ðæt wære swa mycel swa anes lytles fugeles
sweg.
 179. Swylce he cwæð se ylca witega þæt næfre nære
on hellewitum swa mycel wynsumnes swa anes lytles fugeles sweg.
 182. Wa þam þe geearnoð hellewite.
 182. Ðær is ece bryne grimme gemencged and þær is ece
gryre, þær is granung and wanung and a singol heaf, þær is ealra
yrmða gehwylc and ealra deofla geþring.
 185. Wa ðam þe þær sceal wunian on wite.
 186. Betere him wære þæt he man nære æfre geworden
þonne he gewurde for ðam nis se man onlife þe areccan mæge ealle þa
yrmða þe se gebidan sceal se ðe on þa wite ealles bereoseð and hit is
ealles þe wyrse þe his ænig ende ne cymð æfre to worulde.
 191. Eala leofan menn, uton don swa us mycell þearf is beorgan us
georne wið þone egsan and helpan ure sylfra þa hwile þe we magon and
motan þe læs we forweorðan þonne we læst wenan.
 194. Ac utan lufian god ofer ealle oðre þing and his willan a
wyrcan swa we geornost magon.
 195. Þonne geleanað he hit us swa us leofast bið þonne we
æfre betst beþurfon.
 197. Him symle sy lof and wuldor in ealra worulda woruld abutan
ende, amen.

END_TEXT
