HomS 31 (Willard)
B3.2.31.
In Letania maiore: Willard 1935, 38-54.



 1. Uton nu geþencan, broðor mine, hwylc ure eard is in þissum
middanearde.
 2. Efne he is þon gelic þe hwylc man hine gestaðelie in
oðres mannes huse, nat he na hwylce dæge oððe on hwylce tid him bið
to gecweden, Gang ut forþam þis nis þin hus þe þu on eardest.
 7. Næfst ðu her leng nænige wununge.
 7. Ne we nytan þe geornor on hwylce tid we ðis læne lif
alætan sceolon.
 9. We mihtan eaðe mid micclum egesan forhtian, forðam þe
sceal anra manna gehwylces ende gewurðan, and him þonne bið eft þær
his sylfes dædum demed, swa god, swa yfel, swa he ær gefremede, godes
oððe yfeles.
 14. Ge soðfæstum mannum ge unsoðfæstum, ge ricum ge
heanum, him cumað togeanes his sawle twegen englas, oðer bið Godes
encgel, se bið swa hwit swa snaw, oðer bið deofles encgel, se bið swa
sweart swa hræfen oððe silharewa.
 18. And heora byð ægðer myccles geferscypes.
 19. Hi þonne habbað mycel geflit ymbe ða sawle, on
hwæðere geferræddene heo beon scule.
 21. Gyf þonne þa deoflu þæt ongytað, þæt heo sceal
beon on heora geferscype, þonne beoð hi ealle efenhleoþriende and swyðe
bliðe, and þa englas beoð swyðe sarige and unrote gewordene.
 26. Ðonne cweþað þa deoflu þus, <foreign>Noster est ille homo.</foreign>
ðæt is on ure geþeode, þæt hi cweþað, ðis is ure mann,
forðam þe heo urum larum gelefde.
 29. And heo wæs wiðerweard and receleas and ungehersum
æghwylcum þæra manna þe hine tela lærde, and to his sylfes ræde
tihte, and to Godes willan getrymede.
 32. Hi ðonne, þa deoflu, secgað and reccað eall þa yfel
þe he æfre gefremede, and hi hit eall on heora bocum awriten habbað, and
ðus cweþað, <foreign>Suscitate animam de corpore grauiter.</foreign> ðæt is,
Aweccað nu grimlice þa sawle of þam lichoman, and syllað hyre miccle
fyrhtu and brogan and ongrislan, and gelædað hi to þære egesfullan
stowe, þær heo gesyhð eall yfel and ealle tintrega and hellebrogan.
 41. Ne mæg seo sawul þonne nawiht geseon in þas woruld, ac
heo on þeostrum and on gedwolan swyðe unbliðe færð, and ðus
cweð, <foreign>Magna (45) est ista angustie</foreign>; ðæt is, heo cweð, Eala, hwæt,
þis is mycel nearones.
 46. Hire þonne sona andswariað þa deoflu, and ðus
cweþað, Mare þe is toward, þonne we ðe gebringað mid urum
ealdredeofle, se is gebunden in þam nyðemestan hellegrunde mid þære
mænigo his gemæccan.
 51. Ðonne cweð seo sawul þus oðre siðe, <foreign>Magne sunt
tenebre iste</foreign>; Eala, hwæt; þis syndon mycele þeostru.
 53. Hire þonne andswariað þa deoflu, and ðus cweþað,
Maran þe syndon toweardes, þonne we þe gelædað in þa neoðemestan
þeostru, þær bið eagena wop and toða gristbitung.
 57. And heo þonne gyta, seo sawul, þriddan siðe þus cweð,
<foreign>Asperum est iter</foreign>; Eala, hwæt; þis is grimlic siðfæt þe we on
syndon.
 60. Hyre þonne sona andswariað þa deoflu, and ðus
cweþað, ðe is mycle grimlicre toward, þonne þu gesihst þa grimnesse
þines siðfætes, and ðu byst þæra soðfæstra husa benumen, and
ðu byst gelæded in þa witu hellecarcernes.
 65. Ðonne æfter þam gelædað þa awyrgedan gastas þa
sawle to helle, and ðus cweþað Todælað eow on twegen heapas, oðer
hyre sy beforan farende, oþer æfterfyliende.
 69. And hi singað þone sang þe Dauid sang in þam sealme,
and ðus cwæð, <foreign>Quid gloriaris, in malitia, et cetera</foreign>; ðæt is, hi
cweþað þus, þa awyrgedan gastas, to þære sawle, Hwæt wuldrast
þu in wean, þu þe wære ær mihtig on wohnesse?
 74. Ælce dæge þin tunge hogade unrihtwisnesse, and swa swa
þæt scearpeste scerseax, swa þu mid hire facn and inwit fremedest.
 77. And þu lufadest niþas and nearoþancas, and ðu lufadest
ealle forhwyrfednesse word mid þinre tungan.
 80. Forðon þe nu God wiðworpeð, and þe of þinum
lichoman huse ut ascufeð.
 82. Utan nu gehyran, mine þa leofestan gebroðra, hu þæs
soðfæstan mannes sawl on þam lichoman his þæs halgan hordfætes
utgangende bið.
 85. Heo bið swa beorht swa sunne.
 86. And hi ða Godes englas and ða awyrgedan gastas swyðe
ymbeflitað.
 87. Gyf þonne þa englas geseoð þæt seo sawl bið heora
geferscypes wyrðe, hi þonne onginnað secgan and rædan swyðe
freondlice eall þa god þe heo æfre fram frymðe hyre lifes oð hire
daga ende gefremede, and heo hit eall on heora bocum awriten habbað.
 93. And Sanctus Michahel þonne þa sawle gelædeð to þam
heahsetle ures Drihtnes Hælendes Cristes, þær heo gesihð eall þa
god þe heo æfre ær gefremede.
 97. Ðonne sona þa awyrgedan gastas swyðe unhydige to helle in
ece wite forðgewitað.
 99. Ðonne cweþað þa halgan englas þus, <foreign>Noster est hic
homo</foreign>; ðis is ure mann, forðam þe heo was gastlice mildheort, and heo
nawiht to yfele ne dyde, ac heo wæs eall god donde, in fæstene and on
clænnesse, in geþylde and on soðre lufu Godes and manna.
 104. Ðonne cweþað þa englas <foreign>Suscitate animam leniter de
corpore</foreign>; Awreccað þa sawle liðelice of þam lichoman, þæt heo ne
geseo nænine egsan ne næni sar, ne heo nænne tweon næbbe ymbe hyre
fare.
 109. And todælað eow nu on twegen dælas, oþer hyre sy
beforan farende, oðer æfterfyliende, and singað hyre þisne sang, þus
cweþende, <foreign>Beatus quem elegisti et assumpsisti</foreign>; ðæt is, hi cweþað,
Drihtnes englas, Eadinesse þu ðe gecure and genama in þinum huse.
 114. Ðonne cweð seo sawul þus, <foreign>Magna est lumen huius
letitiæ.</foreign> Eala, hwæt.
 116. Ðis is mycel leoht, and ðis syndon fægere geferan.
 117. Hire þonne andswariað þa englas and ðus cweþað,
Leohtre þe is toward þonne þu gesihst Godes beorhtnesse and his engla,
and þin ansyn bið to heora ansyne ecelice gestaðelod.
 121. Ðonne cweð seo sawul oðre siþe, <foreign>Magna est
lætitia</foreign>; ðæt is, Eala, hwæt.
 123. Þis is mycel bliss.
 123. Ðonne andswariað hyre þa englas, and cweþað, Mare
þe is toward þonne þu gesihst engla blisse, þa ðe cumað ongean mid
mycelre blisse and songe.
 126. And hi þonne mid heora gegyrlan ymbfoð þa sawle swyðe
hwite and beorhte.
 128. Ðonne cweð seo sawul þriddan siðe þus, <foreign>Dulce est
iter ad (130) Dominum</foreign>; Eala, hwæt, þis is swete siðfæt on to farenne
to Drihtne and swyðe wynsum.
 131. Hyre þonne þa englas andswariað and cweþað, ðe is
mycele mare toward and wynsumre, þonne we ðe gelædað to þære
soðfæstra eardinge.
 134. Ðonne gelædað þa englas þa sawle in þone
wuldorlican gefean neorxnawanges, þær heo forð wunað and ricsað mid
Godes þam gecorenan buton ælcum yfelum and earfoðum, a oð ende,
þæt restað haligra manna sawla oð domesdæg.

HomS 32 (Baz-Cr)
B3.2.32.
In Letania maiore: Bazire and Cross 1982, 131-35.



 1. Men ða leofestan, we magon gehyran secgan be ure sawle
þearfe forþon us is neodþearf þæt we on þisse tide, þa hwile
þe we moton and magan, þæt we geornlice us clænsian and frætewien
us sylfe mid godum dædum to þam ecum leohte.
 4. Eac us is þearf þæt we on ælce tid ure synna andetten
and beten, and hwæðre we sceolon onsundrum on þas halgan dagas to urum
Drihtne clypian and biddan þæs ecan lifes urum sawlum and þæs ecan
heofonan rices, þæt we on soðre hreowe ure synna andettan and beten.
 7. And we for þæm gerime þæs hweorfendan geares ymbe XII
monað þas halgan dagas weorþiað mid godcunde lofe and mid gastlicum
sange, and ða halgan reliquias beran Gode to lofe and his halgum.
 10. And we sculon eadmodlice biddon ealle þa halgan on heofonum
þæt hi us syn þingeras wið þone ælmihtigan Drihten þære
halgan þrynnesse.
 12. And we sculon biddan eac ealle halgan þæt hi us æteowen
þa heofonlican mildsunge heora fultumes, þæt we magan and moton þurh
heora bene geearnigen þæt we deofles niþas oferswiðen and us ece lif
geearnigen.
 15. Forðan is gedafenlic cristenum folce þonne hi gesamnigen hi
to heora sawle þearfe þæt hi þonne georne gehyren Godes worda and
ðæra halgena gewrita.
 17. Ðonne magon we on þisse worulde geearnian ure synna
forgyfenesse and ures lichoman hælo and gesibsum lif and eorðan
wæstmas, and, þæt us ealra mæst is, ece eadignes æfter þisse
worulde.
 19. Swa ure Drihten on his godspelle cwæð, Doð hreowe eowra
synna; þonne genealæcað ge heofona rice.
 21. And eft he cwæþ, Mara gefea bið Godes englum on heofonum
þæt an synfull mann to bote gecyrre þonne be nigon and hundnigontig
þe næfre ne agylton.
 23. Hwæt us þonne nu is myccle betere þæt we to þære
bote gecyrran þa hwile þe se læcedom on ure mihte seo.
 24. Forðam Drihten is swyðe mildheort and arfæst and we him
syndon swyðe leofe gyf we tela wyllað; and we hine magon swyðe hraðe us
to mildheortnesse gecigan mid godum dædum.
 26. þeah ðe we hine ær mid synnum abulgan, he wile sona
onfon þa soðan hreowe and bote; ac hwæþere ne sceolan we beon to
swyðe balde on unrihtwisnesse and ure synna mid synnum ne ecan, and þæt
þencan and cweþan þæt we magon ures lichoman lust fremman þa hwile
þe we on geogoðe syn and þonne on elde we doð soðe hreowe.
 31. Hwæt mæg beon mare dysignes þonne æni mann þis on
his mode geþence?
 32. Hwylc mann is þe wite þone ytemestan dæg his lifes?
 33. Forðam ealle menn no on elde ne gewitað, ac on mistlicum
hadum hi of worulde gewitað, and þonne on domesdæge hi beoð gemette on
þæm ylcan geearnungum þe hi ær on eorðan geearnedon and ðær
for eallum riht agyldað.
 36. Men þa leofestan, us is mycel neodþearf ymbe þæt to
þencene/, þeah ðe we butan synnum beon ne magon, þæt we næfre ne
syn bescyrede þæs ecan rices; forðam on domesdæge þis mennisce cynn
byð on twa tosceaden beforan Drihtnes þrymsetle, oþer dæl on þam
swyðran healfe, oþer on þa wynstran.
 40. Beoð þonne Cristes þa gecorenan him on þa swyðran
healfe; ðæt beoð heahfæderas and witegan and þa apostolas and þa
martiras and eall se halga heap se ðe god ariht geheold, and hi þonne
swyðe bliðe beoð.
 42. Witon þæt hi habbað þone awyrgedan gast oferswiþed
and heom beoð heora synna forgyfene and hi geseoð þone wynsumlican
Scyppend mid englum and mid heahenglum.
 45. Swylce we eac agan myccle þearfe þæt we moton on heora
gemanan beon.
 46. Swylce eac beoð þa synfullan asceadene on þa wynstran
healfe þæs Scyppendes.
 47. þær beoð þonne gemette þa woruldstrangan kynegas and
caseras and woruldwelige gitseras and unrihthæmede and struderas and
werigcwedende and oferdrinceras, and ða æfestegan and ða leasan hi sylfe
þær ongytað.
 50. Hwæt willað hi þonne cweþan beforan þam reþan
Deman þonne hi nabbað naht to syllanne buton heora lichoman and sawle?
 52. Ac uton we nu forðan, menn þa leofestan, urne Drihten
lufian and his bebodu healdan eallum mægne. Drihten us mid swa micelre lufan
lufað; he wilnað þæt we ealle hale syn and gesunde and to þære
soþan hreowe gecyrran and to þam soðan andgyte his godcundnesse.
 55. Drihten wile þæt ure lif sy gestaðelod on clænnesse
and on soðfæstnesse; nele he þæt se synfulla mann on his synnum
þurhwunige and æfter his deaðe on ecum witum swelte.
 57. Ac he wyle þæt we in þisse lænan tide geearnien
þæt we on ecnesse ne forwurðan.
 58. Se arfæsta Drihten and se mildheorta ne bideð he æt us
gold ne seolfor ne nænig woruldgestreon, ac he wilnað þæt we
clænsien ure sawla and ure lichaman, þæt we magon heo him swa clæne
agyfan swa he hi us ær clæne befæste.
 62. Menn þa leofestan, we sceolon mid monigfealdum godum ure
sawla clænsian, mid fæstenum and mid ælmesdædum and mid clænum
gebedum; forðon se monn se þe gelomlice to Drihtne clypað, þonne
breceð he deofles mægn and his costunge him fram aflemeð.
 65. Se monn þe cleopað him to mid inweardre heortan ne sceal he
no wenan þæt God his bene nelle gehyran.
 66. Swa we be ðon magon ongytan þæt Ionas se witega wæs
under sæs yðum in hwæles hryfe, and he ða to Drihtne cleopode and he
sona his stefne gehyrde.
 68. Forðon se monn se ðe hine gelomlice to Gode gebiddeð,
þonne aflemeð he fram him ealles feondes costunga.
 70. Swa se mann se ðe his ælmessan singallice for Gode
syleð, þonne adwæsceð he his synna swa mon mid wætere adwæsceð
byrnende fyr.
 73. Uton we nu forðon, men þa leofestan, neoman sibbe and lufe
us betweonan, forðon on þam bið eall Drihtnes bebod mæst; uton neoman
clænnesse and gesceadwisnesse ealra godra weorca, forðon butan þæm ne
mæg næni man Gode lician; and don we singallice Godes willan, þæt we
þæt geearnigen þæt we motan beon bliðe beforan þam heahsetle
þæs ecan Cyninges, þær bið þusend þusenda engla werodes.
þonne þær ætstondað ealle gesceafta mid ege and mid fyrhtum, and
þær bið þæt gescead gecorenra and synfulra; ðær bið þæt
mæste gemot, and ælces monnes dæda þær beoð forðgelædde.
 80. Forðon nu arisan we fram þæm slæpe and symle se
ytemesta dæg wunige on urum heortum, forðon us bið ungewiss hwæðer
we moton fram ærnemergen, þonne we arisað, lyfian oð æfen; and swa
bið eac uncuð on þære nihte fyrste hu us gelimpe.
 84. Swa ure Drihten on his godspelle be ðon cwæð, Waciað
on ælce tid and eow gebiddað, forðon ge nytan þa tid hwænne Drihten
cymð to demanne þisne middaneard, hwæðre hit bið þe on æfen
þe on middeniht þe on hancred þe on morgen; ac beoð gearwe forðon on
þa tid þe ge ne wenað se Mannes Sunu cymð.
 88. Ac behealdað eow þy læs he eow slæpende gemete, and
ne gehefiað eowre heortan on oferfylle and on oferdrynce, and fram eallum
þissum yfelum ahebbað eow.
 90. Forðon se monn se ðe nyle þus don, he hine æteoweð
eft in þæm dome scyldine þonne he byð gesewen, ure Hælend, on his
þæm domsetle to wræce þam synfullan mannum and to edleane þam
gecorenum.
 94. On þæm dæge byð mycel ege æteowed eallum manncynne
þonne hi sceawiað  Godes Sunu cumendne on heofones wolcnum on micclum
mægne and on þæm mestan Godes þrymme.
 96. Ðonne beforan him eall eorðe forbyrneð and eall heofona
mægn stranglice beoð onstyred on þæm micclan domesdæge, and seo
rod þe ure Drihten on þrowode, seo byð æteowed ofer Cristes gesyhðe,
and se þyrnena helm on his heafde and þa wunda on his sidan ealle þa
beoð opene.
 100. And þonne cweð se eca Dema, eala þu mon, gehrstue? ic
þe gescop and geworhte mid minum handum of eorðan lame, and ic ageat minne
gast on þine þa eorðlican limu, and ic þe gestaðelode betweox
neorxnawonges wiste, and ðeahhwæðre þu wære me herwiende; and ic
eac on fæmnan bosme astah and ðær wæs lichomlice acenned for ðinre
hælo, to þan þæt ðu me gelic wære geworden.
 105. Ic wæs mid claðum bewunden and on binne geseted and monig
mislic sar for ðe geþrowode, to þam þæt ic wolde ða synne þine
forlornesse adwæscan.
 107. Ic wolde þæt ic ðe fram ecum deaðe alysde.
 107. Geseoh nu minra nægla swæð þe ic on rode for ðe
genæglad wæs.
 108. Her ðu miht geseon þa wunda þe ic gewundod wæs and
ða rode on þære ic for ðe deað geþrowode.
 109. Ic onfeng eall middaneardlicu sar to þan þæt ðu
wære on heofonum wlitig.
 110. Forhwon forlure ðu þæt ic for ðe geþrowode,
oððe forhwan onfenge ðu unþancwyrðlice þa gife þinre alysnysse?
 112. Ne ofþinceð me nu no min þrowung; ac agyf me þin lif
forðon ic min for ðe gesealde; and agyf me þine sawle þa ðu mid
synnum acwealdest and gewemdest mid fyrenlustum.
 114. Oððe forhwan ahenge þu me mid þære hefegan rode
þinra hleahtra?
 115. Miccle hefigre me is seo rod þinra synna þonne me si seo
ðe ic lichamlice mid wyllan gestah and for ðe deað on geþrowode!
 117. Æfter þissum wordum he þonne anra gehwylcum demeð swa
he þonne wile.
 118. Hwær magon hi þonne on þam dæge behydan, þa
arleasan men and ða synfullan, þa ðe nu forhicgað þa Godes domas?
 119. Hwæt þam monnum þonne bið sarlice gegan þa ðe on
þisse andweardan worulde him sylfum geearniað ece witu and ða heardan
eardungstowe mid deoflum on helle, forðon seo hæftnes heora yrmða
wunað in worulda woruld.
 122. Ne þær on þæm egeslicum witum nænig stefn bið
gehyred buton heof and wop, and næni rest gemeted buton biter attor and ece
cwealm.
 125. Ac uton we biddan urne Drihten, þone mildheortan Scyppend,
þæt he ontyne þa earan ure heortan to his þære halgan lare to
onfonne, and heo syðþan fæstlice on urum heortum wunige.
 127. And we oðre men georne monigen to þam godcundan gode,
þæt we þonne ætgædere magon mid þæm godum to þæm
heofonlican eþle, þær we urne Drihten ecelice geseon moton.
 130. Þær us næfre syðþan hunger ne þurst wyrdeð, ne
adl ne æce ne deofles costung ne leofra gedal ne sorh ne winn ne þeostru;
ac þær beoð lofsingende engla þreatas and swete symbelnes ealra
haligra, and ðær þonne anra gehwylc swa miccle bliðra bið swa he
ær mare gewinn and earfoðu her on worulde aræfnede for Godes naman.
 134. Ðonne ealra cyninga Cyning ealle þa þe he gearwe
gemeteð, he mid him gelædeð on his þæt ece rice.
 136. Men þa leofestan, geþence we geornlice and smealice
forhwan eall cristen folc þas andweardan tide þus lufiað and weorþiað
and ða halgan reliquias folgiað.
 138. Butan tweon swutolice we magon þurh þa halgan gesamnunga
ongytan þa ecan reste, and æghwylcum þara bið heofona rices duru
ongean untyned þe þa halgan reliquias mid geleafan folgiað.
 140. We þonne, men ða leofestan, habbað nedþearfe þæt
we mid soðre lufan and mid rihtan geleafan þa gesamnunge secan and ða
godcundan lare gehyran.
 142. þonne beo we æt urum ytemestan dæge gewlitegode mid
Godes þæm gecorenum, be þæm is awriten and ðus cweden, ðær
þa soðfæstan men scinað and leohtað swa beorhte swa sunne on
þæs uplican Fæder rice.
 145. Ac uton nu tilian, men þa leofestan, geornlice þa hwile
þe we magon, þæt we motan blissian mid urum Drihtne and mid eallum his
halgum, þær is ece bliss and ece rest a in worulda woruld, a butan ende.
Amen.

HomS 33 (Forst)
B3.2.33.
In Letania maiore: Forster 1913, 128-37.



 1. Men þa leofestan, þis sinden halige dagas mid eallum
cristenum folce.
 2. & swa cwæð se halga lareow, Hwet we gemunan magan,
þæt we oft gehyrdon secgan, for hwon wise men þurh haliges gastes gife
gesetton þas halige gangdagas þry to festenne & on to gangenne æfter
þære halegan Drihtnes rode & to his haligra reliquium, þa nu
forðgeborene sindon geond eall middaneard fram geleafullum mannum togeanes
his halgan upstige, þe nu on þunresdæg biþ, þæt he his þone
halgan lichaman ahof up in heofene hyhðo & he fore ure lufan deað
geþrowade & geræfnode.
 10. & þurh his mægenþrimm he æft of deaþe aras
& his gingrum hine ætywde & hy mungode þere gastlican lare, þe
he hym ær his þrowunge segde, & þry & þrittig wintra on
þissum middangearde he wæs.
 13. Æghwylces godes bysene he onstalde.
 14. & forþon mid menniscum lichoman he hine gegerode ofer his
godcundnesse, þæt he eac þurh þæt manum forgeafe, þæt hi þe
eþelicor ingang hæfdon.
 17. Forþon we sceolon biddan hine for his þera haligan roda
weorþunga & his upstige, þe nu to morgen biþ.
 18. & ealle halgan we sceolan biddan, þæt hi mid us eac
bidden ælmihtigne Drihten, þone ecan cyning, þæt he us gescilde wið
gedwolan & wið deofolgyld & wið heþene þeoda & wið
arleasum hungre & heregunge, & þæt he us sibbe forgife &
smyltnesse lif.
 22. & eac swylce we hine biddan, þæt he us gescilde wið
grimnesse misenlicra yfela & wita, þaraþe he on middangeard sendeþ
for manfulra manna synnum.
 26. To þissum dagum þurh haligne gast þis fæsten &
þas gangdagas geset weron, swa we oft on bocum gehyrdon secgan.
 28. & swylce mid þere halgan þrinnesse & rode & mid
his halegra reliquium, þe we mid gangað, we sceolan mid halgum sangum
bletsian ure land & Drihten bidden, þæt þa wæstmas, þe on
eorðan syndon, geþeon motan mannum to gode & to helpe.
 32. Uton we hine nu georne biddan, nu he us forgeaf, þæt we
þissere tide gebidan moston, þæt he us his yrre fram ahwyrfe & his
mildheortnesse us to læte on eallum urum life ge on þissum andweardan ge
on þam toweardan.
 36. Men þa leofestan, gehyrað lifes bebodu, & þa ecan
lare lustlice onfoð, & ongytað þone cwide þes soþan dæman,
þe we bedydrian ne magon; forþon Drihten þus cweð, Seþe oferhogeð
þone lareow, ondrede he him þone heofonlican deman, þæt is Drihten
God.
 40. His leorneras weron lareowas genemnede, forþon hi us þa
halgan lare of Godes bocum secgað & þes heofoncundan cyninges tocyme
bodiað.
 42. Forþonþe he cymeþ to demanne eallum middangearde,
forþon þone soþan deman urne Drihten we us ondredon sceolan.
 44. & for his dome we sceolan forhtian & þone micclan
& þone langan domesdæg.
 46. Warnian we us, ærþonþe he cume; & tilian we georne,
þæt we þonne gemette synd on godum weorcum dædum, forþonþe
þæt is se myccla Drihtnes domesdæg & ealles mancynnes.
 49. Þæt is yrmþe dæg & gnornunge dæg, &
unrotnesse dæg & cwanunge dæg & nearonesse dæg &
bytternesse dæg & earfoðnesse dæg & gesomnunga dæg
heofonwara & eorðwara & helwara.
 52. & þæt is gewrixles dæg lichaman & sawla.
 53. & ne bið nænig mægþ þæs mycclan mancynnes
gegaderod on þam dæge, þæt hine þer gescyldan mæge.
 54. Ne þa snyttero ne þa gleawnes ne nænig man nah swa mycel
rice on þissum middanearde, þæt he hine þær beladian mage beforan
þare andweardnesse þera halgan þrinnesse.
 57. Ðæt is cyðnesse dæg ealles mancynnes þurh gesceafte
fyres & wæteres & windes & þunorrade swiþe strang.
 59. Þæt is bemena dæg & hire leoðringa.
 60. Þysne dæg we us on mycelre rernesse toweardne ongytan
magon be mænifealdum þingum, þe us oft & gelome he cyþað.
 63. Be þam dæge Drihten sylf cweð, Arisaþ þeod wið
þeode & rice wið rice.
 64. Þone bið þær þeoda geþring & mænigfeald
reohnes geond mænig stowa.
 65. Þas eorðlican tacnu we nu gewordene oft sceawiað.
 66. Þone geweorðaþ þas tacnu syfon dagum ær þam dome.
 68. On þam ærestan domesdæges tacne bið mycel stefen
gehyred of þam heofones tungle, se hateþ firmamentum.
 69. & blodig wolcn astigaþ norþan, & mycele þunorrade
& lygytu blycetaþ; & þæt wolcn bærneþ ealne heofen; &
hit þonne onginnaþ rinan blodigan regne.
 73. On þam æfteran dæge stefen biþ gehyred of heofonum,
& eorðe bið onhrered; & heofoncund leoht oferhæfð ealne
middaneard oþ þes dæges æfen.
 76. On þam þriddan dæge æt þere æfteran tide
þæs dæges on heofonum ætyweð fyrentacen, & of eorðan
deopnesse astigeð mycel sweflen lyge; & æt þam feower healfum
þisses middaneardes se heofon tobersteþ; & mycel sweg cymþ &
gesweorc; & of helle astigeþ mycel dymnesse & fulnesse stenc, &
oferhæfð þas eorðan ane tide dæges.
 82. Þonne ongytað synfulle men hyre forwyrð & forwyrhtu.
 83. On þam feorþan dæge fram norðdæle þisses
middaneardes mycel hream astigð hellegasta.
 84. Þonne fealleð eall heþenra manna deofolgyld on þam
dæge.
 86. On þam fiftan dæge æt þære fiftan tide dæges
mycel samnunga cumaþ & þunorrade swyþe mycele; & steorran
feallaþ of heofonum; & þeostre bið swiþe mycel; & þæt lyft
biþ onhrered.
 89. Þonne ealle þeoda wiðsacaþ þisse worulde; & hi
ongitaþ þonne Drihtnes mihte.
 91. On þam sixtan dæge æt þere sixtan tide dæges.
 92. Þes heofon tohlyt fram eastdæle oþ þæne westdæl;
& eall engla werod cymþ ofer eorðan & sceadaþ þa soðfestan
men fram þam arleasan.
 94. Þonne þa arleasan men fleoð þæt heofoncunde werod hi
sylfe to behydenne on dunum & on beorgum, & cweðaþ, Untyn þu
þe, la eorþe, & forswelh us, þylesþe we fundene beon.
 98. On þam seofoþan dæge æt þere seofoþan tide
dæges bið domes tacen, & æt þam feower healfum þisse
middaneardes feower englas standaþ & blawaþ feower byman.
 100. Þonne befealdaþ þes heofon togædere, swylce man ane
boc betine.
 102. & se sunne bið onwended on þeostru, & se mona on
blod; & steorran of heofonum feallaþ.
 103. & eall heofoncund mægen þonne onhrered bið.
 104. Drihten cymð þonne on micclum megenþrimme, & fyr on
his ansyne scineþ & blyceð; & on his ymbehwyrfte bið swiþe
mycel hrerenes.
 106. Þonne arisað ealle þa men, þaþe mid gebregdnessum on
deaþe swulton, fram þam feower healfum þisses middangeardes, þæt
syndon, þaþe on þissum life on fyre forbærnede wæron oþþe on
wætere adrencte weron oþþe on rode ahangene weron oþþe on morþe
ofslagene weron oþþe wildedeor fræton oþþe fugelas tobæron, ealle
þa þonne æt þera bymene stefne arisaþ & þurh fyres leoman to
Godes dome gaþ.
 113. Ðer ætstandaþ þusend þusend engla & mycel megen
heahengla & ealle halige & soþfeste Godes witegan &
heahfæderas & apostolas.
 115. Ðonne ætyweð Drihten þa rode, þe he on þrowade;
& þer scineð leoht ofer eallne middangeard.
 117. & he ætyweð þa wunda on his sidan & þæra
nægla wunda, swa þa on his handum & fotum, þe he mid wes on rode
gefæstnod, swa blodig, swa hi weron on þam forman dege.
 121. Ðonne cwið se eca cyning to anra gehwylcum, Men þa
leofestan, sege me, hwet geworhtest þu oþþe hwet gecwede þu oþþe
hwet gedydest þu?
 123. Syle wedd be þissum eallum, þe ic for þe dyde & for
þe þrowade.
 125. Ðonne andswaraþ se man urum Drihtne & cwið, Nebbe ic
ænig wedd to syllanne, nimþe mine.
 126. Þonne bið boc ontyned on ansyne þes hexhstan cyninges.
 127. On þere boc beoð awritene æghwylces mannes dæda,
eall þæt he to gode dyde oþþe to yfele gedyde on þisum middangeard.
 129. Þer se broþer þam oþrum ne mæg gehelpan, ne se
fæder þam suna, ne þa neahmagas ne þa madmgestreon.
 131. Ne þysse worulde æhta ænigne man þer gescyldan ne
mæg oþrum.
 132. Ac Drihten gyldeþ anra gehwylcum men æfter his sylfes
gewyrhtum.
 134. Þonne soþfeste & gecorene men forðberaþ heora
wuruca hyrsumnesse, & Drihtnes halige martiras heora þrowunga &
þæra carcerna nearownessa & manige earfoðe, þe hi adrigon for
Drihtnes naman.
 137. Gehadode men beraþ heora hyrsumnesse & forwyrnednesse
þyssa woruldlicra þinga & heora þa singalan weccan & þa
drihtenlican bebodu & hyra þa gastlican þeowdomas.
 140. Læwede men, þaþe her rihtlice hyra lif libbaþ, hi
berað heora ælmesdæda & hluttor lif & clene on ansyne þes
hehstan scyppendes.
 143. Ðonne cwið se eca cyning, <foreign>Venite benedicti patris mei,
percipite regnum, quod uobis paratum est ab origine mundi</foreign>, cume ge, gebletsode
mines feder, & onfoð þæt rice, þæt eow is gearu imaced of
frumþa þissere worulde.
 147. Ðonne þa arleasan & þa synfullan hi berað nearowne
wæstm & sceandfulne on ansyne þes heahstan scyppendes.
 148. Ðonne cwið se heofona <foreign>Drihten, Discedite a me, maledicti,
in ignem eternum</foreign>, Fare ge fram me, awyrigde.
 150. & hi þonne ahwyrfaþ fram haligra manna dreame &
swiþe heofigende hellewitu secaþ, þær is deað butan life, &
þeostru buton leohte, & hreow buton frofre, & yrmþe buton ende.
 153. Ðer ne ongit se feder þone sunu; ne se sunu þone
fæder ne wurðaþ; ne seo dohter þa modor ne lufað; ne seo moder þa
dohter ne miltsað.
 156. Ac anra gehwylc his sylfes yrmþa heofað, forþonþe
hellefyr nefre ne biþ adwesced, ac a þa dracan & þa wyrmas þara
arleasra manna sawla slitað; & hi nefre ne beoð sweltenda.
 159. Ðer is eagena wop & toþa gristbitung; & þer is
welera þurst, wita stow.
 161. Of þissum tintregum, men þa leofestan, tilien we us to
gescyldene, & us gewarnige, þa hwile þe we lifes leoht habban moton,
þelæs us feringa þas þeostru forgripen.
 163. & mid geornfullum mode tyligen we ure sylfra, swa lange
swa we libbon moton, mid godum dedum to gewyrcenne, þæt we heofonarice
geearmian moten mid urum Drihtene & eallum his halgum.
 167. Ðer is ece bliss & engla sangum geswiþerod, &
unasecgendlic gefea, & Godes lof, & unawendenlic wynsumnyss & se
soþe fegernes, swa us cyðde sanctus Iohannes, se Drihtnes dyrling.
 170. He sceawode heofonarices wuldor, & he on heofonum wes,
& he cweð, Ic geseo niwne heofon & niwe eorþan & þa halgan
ceastre paradisum Ierusalem, þæt is paradisum, seo wes fram Gode
gefretewod.
 174. & heo wes befangen mid swiþe micclon wealle; & twelf
gatu weron on þere ceastre, þa wæron geworhte of twelf cynna gymmum.
 176. & seo ceastre wes ymbeseald mid Godes beorhtnesse; &
hire staþol wes of eallum deorwyrþum stanum gefretewod; & hyra
worþias weron þes hluttrestan goldes.
 178. & on þere ceastre sunne ne lihteð ne mona; ac Godes
beorhtnesse hi onlihteð.
 180. & seo beorhtnes wes þæt soþe lamb, þæt wes se
ælmihtiga Drihten.
 181. Þer ineodon ealle þeode & eorðcyningas; hi comon
& gesegon Godes wuldor & his megenþrim.
 182. & hi saldon Gode weorþunga.
 184. & æfter þon cweð sanctus Iohannes, Ic geseah men
gangan of eallum þeodum, þa weron beswapene ealle mid hwitum ræglum
& clypodon & cwedon, Sy helo urum Drihtne & þanc, þe sitteð
ofer þissum heahsetle; forðon us is mycel neodþearf.
 189. Men þa leofestan, þæt we bidden þa heofoncundan
gesamnunge, þæt hi us eac þingian to þam ælmihtigan Drihtne.
 191. & sanctus Michael þone heahengel uton we us on fultum
cigen, se is hyrde neorxnawonges & Ebrea þeoda & æghwilces godes
mannes sawle.
 193. He geweald hæfð, & he nefre hy ne forlæt, ær he
hi gebringe beforan Drihtnes heahsettle.
 194. & þer he is & weardaþ ealra halegra sawla, &
seo ece bliss unasecgendlic on heofonarice, & þæt herigendlice rice
& þæt smylte & þæt gesibsume, þæt God hæfð
gegearcod his halgum & mid his megenþrimme gefretewod.
 199. Men þa leofestan, herigen we nu þone ælmihtigan Drihten
& lufien we hine & wurþian.
 200. He is cyning ealra cyninga; & he is scyppend ealra
gesceafta gesegenlicra & ungesegenlicra; & he is fegerest ealra
blostma; & he is snottro þære soþan lufe; & he is engla
symbelnes; & he is wuldor þæra eadigra apostola; & he is leoht
þæra haligra martira; & he is neorxnawanges ece gefea; & he is
helo ealra untrumra; & he is alysend þæra gehæftendra; & he is
ealra þinga leoht & ealra tida.
 208. Bidden we nu, men þa leofestan, urne Drihten wuldres kyning,
þæt he us gehwyrfe to his mildan willan & he sy ure mildsigend &
ure frefrigend to his his mildheortnesse, þæt he us gelæde, þær we
on þam ecan gefean beon moton mid him & mid eallum halgum wunian on
wuldre & on weorðmynte.
 213. He is Drihten sylfa, seþe leofað & rixad mid suna
& mid þam halgan gaste a butan æghwylcum ende, Amen.

HomS 34 (ScraggVerc 19)
B3.2.34.
Monday in Rogationtide: Scragg 1992, 315-26.



 1. Men ða leofestan, us gedafenaþ ærest þæt we gemunen
& gereccen be Gode ælmihtigum, þe geworhte heofonas & eorðan
& ealle gesceafta, þone we sculon gelyfan þrynlicne on hadum &
anlicne on spede: oðer is soðlice se had ælmihtiges fæder, oðer is
ælmihtiges suna, oðer ys ælmihtiges haliges gastes, &
þeahhwæðere we sceolon andettan anne God on mægenþrymme & on
mihte & on godcundnesse, for þam se fæder ys ece God, & se sunu is
ece God, & se haliga gast ys ece God.
 8. Ealle þry, se fæder & se sunu & se haliga gast,
wæron æfre efenece & æfre beoð, & hie þry an God syndon.
 9. Fram þam, þurh þæne & on þam syndon geworhte
ealle þa þinc þe gesewene syndon & ealle þa þe ungesewene syndon,
þa ne mæg nan eorþlic man ealle asecgan.
 12. Ærest on frymþe he geworhte heofonas & eorðan &
sæ & ealle þa þinc þe on him syndon, & ealle þa englas þe
on heofonum syndon.
 13. & ealle þa ðe of englum to deoflum forsceapene wurdon,
ealle he hie of him sylfum mid his oroðe ut ableow - & þone þe he
foremærostne hæfde ofer ealle þa oðre englas þe Lucifer wæs
haten, þæt ys on ure geþeode leohtberend gereht, ac he eft, þa he hine
sylfne his scyppende gelicne don wolde & him þrymsetle on norðdæle
heofona rices getimbrian wolde, of ðam he ricene afeoll.
 19. & ealle þa ðe æt ðam ræde mid him wæron
& him æfter besawon, ealle hie wurdon of englum to deoflum forsceapene
& on helle bescofene, þær hie on ecnesse witu þoliað, for ðam
þe hie forhogedon hira scyppend, ælmihtigne God.
 23. Syððan he geworhte of eorðan lame þone ærestan man
þe æfre wæs, þone he be naman Adam nemde, & him on bebleow
liflicne/ gast.
 25. & him ealle eorðan gesceafta on geweald sealde &
sæs fixas, þæt hie him hyrsumian sceoldon.
 26. & he him eallum naman gesceop, ægðer ge nytenum ge
fugelum ge fixum, & hie ealle gyt be ðam naman fram eallum mannum synt
genemnede ðe him Adam æt frymðe gesceop.
 29. & dryhten ælmihtig of Adames wynstran sidan genam
þæt ribb þe he þæt wif ofgeworhte þe Eua hatte.
 30. Of ðam twam þurh Godes mihte is ealles middangeardes folc
framcumen.
 31. & him God forgeaf þæt hie ealles geweald agan moston
þe on eorðan wære, butan anes treowes bleda þe is genemned lifes
treow, & we hit nemnað fictreow.
 34. Þæt treow ys on middan neorxnawange.
 34. Be ðam treowe Crist sylf forewarnode ægðer ge Adam ge
Euan, & him sæde bam þæt swa hwylcum dæge swa hie ðæs
treowes bleda æton, hie sceoldon forweorðan.
 37. & hie eac swa dydon.
 37. Ac ða se deofol geseah & wiste þæt him God swa mycel
forgifen hæfde, & he sylf beswicen wæs & þa þe mid him of
heofonum gefeollon, þa ðohte he to beswicanne hie, eall swa he sylf
beswicen wæs.
 40. Gehweorrfde hine sylfne þa on anre nædran hiwe, & hie
butu beswac & forlærde.
 41. Sæde him þæt swa hwylcum dæge swa hie þæs
treowes bleda æton, þæt hie wæron syððan þam gelice þe hie
geworhte.
 43. Ac hit him wearð biterlice forgolden on hyra life ge eac
æfter, ægðer ge him ge eallum mancynne þe him fram cwom, oð ures
dryhtnes tocyme.
 45. Nigon hund wintra & þritig wintra Adam lifde on þysse
worulde on geswince & on yrmþe, & syððan to helle for, &
þær grimme witu þolode fif þusend wintra & twa hund wintra
&/ eahta & xx wintra.
 49. Men þa leofestan, us is nu for þy mycel nydþearf, nu we
þus þurh Godes mihte ealle ætgædere syndon, þæt we gecyrren of
yfele to gode, & gehyren mid eallum eaðmettum godcunde lara & þam
georne fylgen, & us æt Gode & æt eallum his halgum mihta bidden,
þy læs us deoflo æfter urum forðsiðe ongean wurpon þæt we oft
ætgædere ealle wæron, & us beforan halige lara gehyrdon rædan,
& we na ðe beteran næron ac þe mættran.
 55. Ac utan us wendan, men þa leofestan, to beterum þingum,
& forlætan eallo yfolo þing, & don god swa forð swa we fyrmest
magon, & to Gode & to eallum his halegum þæs georne earnian.
 58. Us ys georne to witenne & to gehlystenne for hwylcum
þingum we ðas gangdagas healdað & barefote gað þus on geares
fyrste þas þry dagas.
 60. Se feorða is dryhtne sylfum for his mæran upstige of
eorðan to heofonum gehalgod.
 61. & mid hwylcum þingum we hie healdan sceolon, us is georne
to witanne.
 62. We hie sceolon healdan on mycelre eadmodnysse & on myclum
geþylde & on soðre lufe & on eallre clænnesse lichoman &
sawle & on godum wæccum & nytwyrðum & on fæstenum & on
halgum gebedum & on ælmesdædum & on eallre godnesse & on lufe
Godes & manna.
 66. Manegum haligum mannum þas gangdagas syndon wiðmetene, ac
us is lang þæt eall to gereccanne.
 68. Utan þeah us georne wið deofol scyldan eallum tidum &
us ongean his yfelan lara Godes mildheortnesse biddan dæges & nihtes.
 69. Se deofol dæges & nihtes winnð ongean us mid his
geleafleste; uton we winnan ongean hine mid geleaffulnesse.
 71. He winnð mid ofermodnesse; uton we ongean mid eaðmodnesse.
 72. He us gegearwað galnesse; uton we ongean clænnesse.
 73. He gegripð manfulnesse; uton we ongean rihtwisnesse.
 73. He us on bebringeð yrsunge; uton we fylgean geþylde.
 74. He us on asent gytsunge; uton we began mildheortnesse.
 75. He us myngað to gifernesse; uton þær ongean gehealdan
forhæfednesse.
 76. & æfre ongean his yfelan willan uton wyrcan Godes
willan.
 77. Eall we sceolon efestan to Godes templum swa swiðe swa ða
bion doð to hira hyfe, to þam þæt we magon getreowlice onbyrgean þa
swetnesse þæs gastlican huniges of ðam godcundum rædingum.
 81. We gelyfað, men þa leofestan, þæs þe we ræddon on
halgum bocum, þæt swa hwa swa on þis þrim dagum to Godes temple cymð
& him þær his synna forgifenessa æt Gode bitt mid eallre heortan
hyldo & mid eallre eadmodnesse, þæt him God þæra synna
forgifenessa sylle þe he ær on twelf monðum gedyde.
 85. & hit is eac awriten þæt nan mann hine ne sceal
georwenan þæt him God miltsian nelle, þeah he þusend synna ongean his
willan geworht hæbbe.
 87. Þeah hwæðere ne forgifð he hie us butan we þe
ricenor him fram gehweorfen.
 88. Us syndon syndorlice on ðyssum dagum forbodene, þeah hie on
ælcere tide forbodene syn þeah swiðor on þysse tide, idele spæca
& tæflunga & gebeorscipas, & þæt nan mann o þyssum dagum
blod ne forlæte ne ne geþristlæce ænig man ætes oððe wætes
to onbyrigenne ær þære nigoðan tide & ær he mæssan hæbbe
gehyred, & barefotum Cristes bec & his rodetacna & oðre halige
reliquias eadmodlice gegret hæbbe.
 95. Ælcum, ge geongum ge ealdum, þis fæsten is beboden
þæt hie hyt sceolon healice healdan, & hyt þe ma to abrecenne nagon
þe ðæt lenctenfæsten.
 97. Wite gehwa swa he geornor sceal Gode þeowgean & healic
fæstenu fæstan, þæt þe geornor deofol wile gebringan on þam men
þæt he hit gehealdan ne mæge.
 99. Þy we beodað Godes bebode & eallra his haligra,
þæt nan þara cristenra manna þe þis gehyre him beforan rædan
oððe elleshwara hit him gereccan, ne geþristlæce he þis fæsten to
abrecenne, be þam þe he wille him for Gode geborgen habban.
 104. Men þa leofestan, uton gemunan þone cwide þæs eadigan
apostolys Petris; he cwæð: Se deoful us symle ymbeþridað.
 105. Uton nu gehealdan georne þis fæsten, neah þam þe hit
awriten is on haligum bocum þæt þa fæston þe þurh þæs
witigan lare to Gode gecyrdon, & þæt fæsten swa fæston swa him
wisode se witega se wæs haten Ionas.
 109. Be ðam is on bocum awriten þæt God þurh haligne gast
hine het faran to sumere mærre ceastre seo wæs Niniue haten, &
þær sceolde bodigean Godes bebodu.
 111. Ac for þam þe ðæt folc wæs awyrged &
æbreca, he him swiðe ondred & þæder faran ne dorste.
 113. For ðam þe God wæs swiðe yrre þære ceasterleode,
ða wolde he for þi Godes bebodu forfleon.
 114. Ac him com to cyððe þæt he hie forfleon ne meahte.
 115. He þeah on fleame wæs, oð he to sae becwom, & him
þær scip gebohte, & mid þam scipmannum him þohte ofer sæ to
seglgenne.
 117. Ac he ne mihte, swa he gemynt hæfde, Godes willan
forfleon.
 117. Ac sona swa he wæs in agan on þæt scyp, þa gereste
he hine on anum ende, & þa sona swa þa menn þe on þam scipe
wæron ut on þære sæs dypan gesegled hæfdon, þa onsende God
mycelne ren & strangne wind & grimme yste on þa sæ, swa þæt
þæt scip ne mihte naþer ne forð swymman ne underbæc, for
unhyrsumnesse þæs witigan þe Ionas wæs haten.
 123. Þa for þam þa ondredon þa scipmen him swiðe
þearle; hluton him þa betwynan for hwylces hiera gyltum him swa getimod
wære.
 124. & þa behluton hie hit sona to Iona, þam witigan, &
he his nan þing nyste.
 126. Ða wundrodon hie sona þæt se hlyt ofer þone Godes
þegn gefeoll.
 127. Awrehton hine þa of slæpe & rehton hit him eall,
& he þafode þæt hine man wearp ut on þa sæ, þa he ongiten
hæfde þæt he nahwar God forfleon meahte, & hie him fore
gebædon.
 129. & hine sona an mycel hwæll forswealh, & he wæs
on him þry dagas & iii niht.
 130. & syððan, eal swa hit God wolde, seo sæ þone fisc
ferede oð he com to þam ilcan eðle þe he ær on bodian sceolde, se
witega, & hine þær ut of him aspaw ofer þære sæ staðe.
 133. & he ða sona on þreora daga fyrste þurhfor þa
mæran & þa myclan burh, & bodode on þære Godes bebodu, swa
þæt se cyng þære ceasterware mid hire on God gelyfde on eallre
heortan, & he bebead þæt hie ealle fram þam yldestan oð þone
gingestan þreora daga fæsten healdan sceoldon.
 137. & he aras of his cynesetle & him fram his cynereaf of
awearp & hine mid hæran ymbscrydde & to Gode georne cleopode mid
eallre þære burhware.
 139. & he bebead ærest þæt ægðer ge þa menn ge
ealle þa nytenu þe hie ahton sceoldon þry dagas & þreo niht on an
fæstan.
 141. & hie ða swa dydon, & him ða God his
mildheortnesse geaf, & him fram þæt fyrene clyne adyde þe ofer þa
ceastre wæs on þam genipe hangiende, þæt sceolde forniman ealle þa
burhware & forbærnan binnan feowertigum dagum butan hie to Gode gecyrran
woldon.
 145. Ac hie dydon swa him to donne wæs, gecyrdon to Gode
ælmihtigum, & he him sona his mildheortnesse forgeaf, swa he symle deð
ælcum þara þe he ongyt þæt him on eallum mode to gecyrreð.
 149. Eac we ræddon on halegum bocum þæt on sumere ceastre
þe wæs Uienna haten, on þære wæs sum bisceop se wæs nemned
Mamertus.
 151. Be ðam is awriten þæt ðæt folc þe he bewiste
wearð þearle mid færlicum deaðe fornumen, & swa mycel wearð seo
untrumnes & se færlica deað ofer eall þæt folc þe he bewiste,
þæt þa þe oðre to eorðan bæron þæt sume hie feollon deade
ofer þæs deadan byrgenne þe hie þonne byrgdon & sume hamweard be
wege forðferdon, swa þæt nan þara þe oðerne to eorðan bær ham
mid þam life ne com.
 156. Þa bæd se bisceop Mamertus ealle þa bisceopas þe on
ðam earde wæron mid wependre stefne þæt hie ealle & hira folc
þry dagas fæston & bædon hira dryhten þæt hie ealle alysde
fram þam myclan & þam færlican deaðe.
 160. & hie ða ealle swa dydon, & gesetton þa him
betwinan þæt man a syððan sceolde þas þry gangdagas healdan
fullice mid fæstenum & mid ælmessylenum & mid cyricsocnum &
mid eadmodlicum gange & mid reliquiasocnum & mid eallum godum weorcum.
 163. & hie sona æt Gode geearnodon ece hæle &
þæs færlican deaþes afyrrednesse.
 165. Nu we habbað gehyred for hwi þas gangdagas erest
bebodene wæron to gehealdenne.
 166. Geceose nu gehwa swa hwæðer swa he wille, swa þæt
betere swa þæt mættre.
 167. Ne beode we nanum mannum nane niwe bebodu.
 168. Do gehwa swa him sylfum for Gode gebeorhlicost þince, gif he
hwylcum bysenum & þylcum larum fylgean nelle.
 170. Georne we witon þæt Gode licaþ swa mycle mare swa
man mare for his lufum to gode gedeð, & he us gelæt on heofona rices
gefean æfter urum forðsiðe gif we his willan her on worulde oð urne
endedæg gewyrcaþ.
 173. Þær is ece med, & þær is lif butan deaðe &
geogoð butan ylde & leoht butan þystrum & gefea butan unrotnesse
& sybb butan ungeþwærnesse & orsorhnes butan deaþes ege to
lybbenne, & þær is ece gesælignesse mid fæder & mid þam
suna & mid þam haligan gaste a butan ende, amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

HomS 35 (Tristr 4)
B3.2.35.
Monday in Rogationtide: Tristram 1970, 173-85.



 1. <foreign>Feria II in letania maiore</foreign>.
 1. Men ða leofestan, us is swiðe mycel neodþearf þæt we
gehyron sumne dæl þyses gastlican gewrites þe her us forð læreð
and manað to ure sauwle þearfe and eac swylce be þissere tide halignysse
and be hyre arwurðnysse þe gecweden is on gastlicum gewritum þurh
gastlice leorneras to þære gastlican gesetnysse þæt þas þry dagas
wæron letanias genemned.
 9. Us is þonne swyðe mycel neodþearf on æghwilce tide
þæt we habban mid us soðe sibbe and soðe eadmodnysse and þæt we
geearnian mid urum hlutrum gebedum and mid ure heortan onbryrdnysse and mid
urum clænum ælmæssum þurh þa cyrican gesetnysse þæt we
gemunon and geþencan swa us mynegiað ure lareowas þæt we biddan þone
ælmihtigan drihten his mildheortnyse and gebletfæstnysse lifes ge
gastlices ge woruldlices.
 18. Uton we þonne geþencan þæt we mihton drihtene mid
þære mæstan eadmodnysse on þas þry dagas geornfullice gehyran for
ðissa daga wurðunge þæt he ure bene gehyre.
 22. Uton we þonne on þysum dagum and on æghwylce tide
gehyran and gehealdan his beboda.
 24. Uton gehyron æt ærestan and geþencan þone cwyde þe
he sylf on his godspelle cwæð and us bebead ofer eallne middaneard þam
þe his beboda healdan wyllað þæt ure æghwilc gecume æt urum
reliquium and nænig mann hine sylfne þanon ne sceade fram þam halgan
gemote drihtenes sylfes and þam cyriclicum þe on ymbhwyrfte bið cristes
reliquium halgum and þam apostolicum and þær halgan cristes rode swa we
leornodon.
 33. And getreowlice we magon ongytan þæt se ælmihtiga
drihten swyðe mænigfealdlice gyfe gemetfæstum mannum dyde hyder on
þisne middaneard and for ðan he swa dyde for þan he wolde þæt þeos
clæne gesceaft ongeate hyre þone ecean scyppend.
 39. For ðan ðe he manncynne onlyhte mænige gastlice
leohtfatu and sende hider on þisne middaneard for þan þe he wold
gedwæscean þa deorcnysse and synne þysternysse fram urum heortum
scyrran þurh his þa halgan and þa gastlican leohtfata.
 44. And swylce he eac wolde þæt we þises leohtes
andweardnysse geearnodon þæt we moston on þære toweardnysse mid him
sylfum and mid his þam halgum þæs ecan leohtes brucan.
 48. Mænig mann on þysum gemote wunað and hwæðere
næfð þæt andgyt hwæt þa gastlican leoht synd buton hit hym seo
gastlicenysse gerece swa hit gecweden ys on gastlicum gewritum þurh gastlice
leorneras þæt us wæron to leohtfatum gesette ure heahfæderas Abel,
Enoch, Melchisedech, Noe, Abraham, Jsaac, Iacob.
 54. Hi us onlihton and onstealdon eallra goddra weorca bysne.
 56. Eac þa wæron godes þa halgan witegan þa þurh þone
halgan gast us lærdon.
 57. And hi us fore sædon ealles þises middaneardes
fægernyssa and his wynsumnyssa.
 59. And eac swylce hy us fore sædon ealles þises middaneardes
þysternyssa/ and his synna and his gedwolan and þonne nalæs þæt an
þæt hi us tacnodon ymbe þyses andweardan middaneardes gesetnysse.
 63. Ac hi us eac sædon ymbe þa toweardnysse þæs
forhtigendan domes and þone soðfæstan deman crist sylf.
 65. And eac þyssere tacnunge hy eac getacnodon hwylc wæs
heofona rice to geearnienne and hwylc wæs hellewite to befleonne on þa
gelicnysse þe se witega cwæð be heofona rice and be helle þæt
næfre nære on heofona rices wuldre swa micel unwynsumes on ænigum
laðe oððe on hungre oððe on þurste oððe on cyle oððe on
hætan oððe on adle oððe on ænigum laðe gewinne þæt wære
swa mycel swa anes lytles fugeles sweg.
 74. Swylce he cwæð se ylca witega þæt nære næfre on
hellewyte swa mycel wynsumes swa anes fugeles sweg.
 77. Swylce eac wæron us to leohtfatum gesette cristes apostolas
þa wæron onsende on þysne middaneard geond myssendlice þeoda þurh
crist sylfne for ði þonne þæt hi sceolon menn trymman and læran and
fullian and deofolscype nyðerian and þeo deofolican lustas adwescan and
drihtenes rice bredan swa swa crist sylf to his apostolum sprecende wæs and
þus cwæð, Ic eow sende on þeode and on oðre on þa gelicnysse
æfter eorðlice wisan.
 86. Þe eorðlican ic onsende an sceap on wulfa heap.
 88. Ne wæron hy swa fræcne onsended for ðon ðe hi
hæfdon þæt gastlice mægen and þone heofonlican fultum cristes
sylfes.
 91. Þone fultum hi geearnedon þurh þæt þe hy wæron
cristes willan wyrcende for þan hi sittað on heofonan rices wuldre on þa
swyðran healfe god fæder þar hy him nænig lað ne ondrædað ne
hunger ne þurst ne adle ne deofles costunga ne him þar ne byð næfre
nanes godes wana ne him næfre þæs lifes and þære wynsumnysse
nænig ende ne geyrnð.
 99. Broþor mine, hwæt we leornodon þæt cristes apostolas
wæron mennisce menn on þa gelicnysse þe we syndon.
 101. We þonne leornodon þæt hi geearnodon þæt rice and
þæt setl þæt hi on wuniað on heofonan rices wuldre mid þam ylcum
dædum þe us alyfede syndon gyf we us sylfe ne forgymleasiað godra
dæda.
 105. Ne synd we næfre to ofermode on urum yfelum dædum ac we
hraðe to þære anddetnysse and to þære bote gecyrron.
 109. Micel gegearnung þæt is menniscum menn þæt he
geearnige mid godum dædum to þam ælmihtigan drihtene þurh his anes
mægen mid godes fultume þæt he mæge mid þi apostolican hade ealle
þa heorde þe he gode healdan sceal and fram hellewite generian.
 114. Swa cristes apostolas dydon and habbað geearnod þæt
heora æghwylc an mæg eallum manncynne geþingian þæt him se
hælend forgyfeð ealle heora synna.
 118. Uton we þonne, broðor mine, on þas halgan tide
geornfullice and eadmodlice biddan þone ælmihtigan drihten his
mildheortnysse.
 120. And we eac biddan þa halgan apostolas þa wæron on
gebyrdon æfter lichamlicre wisan us gelice.
 122. And hi us wæron to leohtfatum gesette þæt hy syndon
ure þingeras to þam lyfgendan gode þæt we beon gehælede of urum
synnum/ for drihtenes mildheortnysse and for bene þæra haligra apostola
and for weorðunga þissere halgan tide.
 128. Swylce eac us syndon to lareowum gesette ure þa gehalgodon
bisceopas þa us trymmað and lærað to þam ecean rice gyf we him mid
eadmodnysse þeowiað willað.
 132. And eac swylce us syndon to lareowum gesette ure
mæssepreostas þa beoð dæghwamlice anwearde toforan urum eagum þa us
cænnað þurh þone halgan gast and trymmað to þam ecean life.
 136. Menig mann nafað þæt andgyt hwæt seo acennednysse
sy.
 137. We beoð acenned lichamlice þurh fæder and þurh modor
hider on þisne middangeard æfter þam we beoð acennede gastlice be
lichamlice and be eorðlice.
 140. Þreo acennednyssa beoð gastlice swa drihten sylf on hys
godspelle sprecende wæs and þus cwæð, Ne mæg se eorðlica mann on
necnysse mid me wunian on minum rice butan he sy acenned þurh wæter and
þurh haligne gast.
 145. Æghwylc þæra þe on me gelyfað and gefullod bið
þurh wæter and fæder namann and on sunu and on þone halgan gast se
bið on necnysse mid me gehæled.
 148. Þæt is seo forme accennednyss gastlicu þonne we
onfoð fullwihte æt ure mæssepreosta þenunge.
 150. Þonne is seo æftre accennednyss gastlicu syððan se
mann gewintrod bið and þæt geseald hafað þæt he andette his
scrifte ealle his synna syððan he bið godes þeowa geciged for þan
ðe se soða anddetnyss æt frymðe eallra gastlicra læcedoma.
 155. Þonne is seo þridde accennednyss æfter þam soðan
andetnyssa syððan se mann gewintrad bið and he hine sylfne gemedmað
þurh þa soðan anddetnysse and þurh his scriftes fultum þæt he
bið andfenge drihtenes sylfes lichaman and his blode þonne he hafað
fullice ealle þa hadas þe hine to þan ece life gelædað.
 162. He geanlicode his lichaman heofonlican hlafe and he onlihte
his blod wine on lifes calice and us þa onsende hider on þisne middaneard
to earnan and to wedde eces lifes.
 166. And swylce us wæron to leohtfatum gesette and to lareowum
þa halgan godspelleras þurh þæara lare we magon witan hwæt we
lufian sceolon and hwæt we gedon sceolon and hwæt we forgyfan sceolon and
mid hwylcum dædum we magon hellewite befleon.
 170. Swa he drihten sylfa on his godspelle sprecende wæs be
þyssere halgan tide and be his godspellerum and þus cwæð, for þan ic
þas gangdagas sette for þan þe ic wille þæt mine leorneras and mine
godspelleras secgon and bryman þæt ece lif.
 175. And ic wille æghwylcum gemiltsian þe ðas halgan tide
weorðiað and on me gelyfað and mid godspellerum gelyfan willað.
 178. For þon, broðor mine, on þas andweardan tide beoð
reliquias haligra manna upp ahafene and forð aborene mid leofsange and mid
gastlicum sange on sunderlice stowa gehwilce swa hwær swa hi gesette
beoð.
 183. Us is þonne swyðe mycel nydþearf þæt we mid swiðe
mycelre eadmodnysse urum reliquium folgion and þam þeowian.
 186. Swa we magon ongytan be sumre eorðlicre bysne gyf menn him
beoð betweonan ungesibsume him þone secað sona æfter menniscre wisan
gemotstowe and dom gedemed bið and gesibbað hi.
 190. Syððan sceal ælc mann gelæstan swa se dema him
bebeodað and þæt gemot bið þonne eall gesybod.
 192. Be þære bysne we magon ongytan þas halgan tide for
þan ðe þas dagas syndon ure gemotdagas gastlicra gemota þonne bið ure
gastlice gemotstow on ymbhwyrfte ure reliquia.
 195. Swa on cyrican swa butan swa on hwylcre stowe hi on gesette
beoð.
 197. Wite þonne þæt æghwylc mann þæra þe on
þysum gemote wunige and þis godspell gehyreð þæt he eac þam georne
mid eadmedum ontyne þære heortan earan to manunge þyses godspelles and
to þæs gastlican deman cristes sylfes.
 201. His domas he on gastlicum gewritum us gesette and þurh
gastlice leorneras us ontynde.
 203. Gyf we þas gastlican domas gelæstað willað þe crist
sylf on his godspelle beodað on þisse gemotstowe þonne beoð we beforan
cristes heahsetle on þam myclan dome þam soðfæstan deman gecorene and
we þonne motan gehyran þone cwyde þe he sylf cwæð to þam þe he
sette on þa swyðran healfe, cumað ge gebletsode to mines fæder rice
þæt eow wæs gegearwod fram middaneardes fruman.
 212. Broðor mine, us is swyðe mycel nydþearf þæt us
þys godspell gerecce mid hwylcum dædum.
 214. We sceolon þone soðfæstan deman weorðian and him
þeowian.
 216. Aerest on þysse halgan tide þe nu onweard his and swa hyt
gecweden hys on þysum godspelle þæt we sceolon upp ahebban and forð
beran ure halgan reliquias ða menn þe synd on endebyrdnysse to gastlicum
lofe gelæred.
 221. And þonne on ymbwyrfte þæra gastlicra lofsanga eall
folc gewunie and nan mann hine sylfne ne sceade fram þam gastlican gemote
butan hit seo nyd si þe mare and manna gewitnyss þæt he him fylian ne
mæge.
 225. For þan ðe ælcum þæra bið heofonan rices duru
ontyned þe mid soðan geleafan þam halgum reliquium fyliað.
 227. And ægwylc mann gehealde clænlice his fæsten þas
þry dagas oð ða nontide and þonne þicge þa mettas þe he hwilon
þæt lengtenfæsten þe se hælend on þrowode feowertig daga and
feowertig nihta tosomne for eall manncynn.
 233. Uton we nu þone geþencann þæt we swyðe medemlice
gedydon þæge tide ge ure fæsten ge ure ælmessan ge ure beda ge ure
gelastas for namann þæs ælmihtigan drihtenes swa we magon ongytan be
þære eorðlican bysene ærest be urum fæstene.
 239. Se mann se ðe ðenceð þæt he leohte candele gewyrce
þæt he mæge lyhtan mid nihtlicum þystrum on his huse þonne
gewyrceð he him godne tapor and hine þonne smyreð þonne bið se tapor
þurh þa smyrunge onbyrhteð and seo þystru his huses bið onlyhted.
 244. Nafast ðu æt þam tapore nænig leoht ne nænig recc
gyf he þære smyrennysse ne underfehð.
 246. Swa þonne bið þam menn þe cwyð þæt he wile
fæstan for naman þæs ælmihtigan drihtenes and þonne þone dæg
þe he þæt fæsten on fæsteð þonne bið he þone dæg
geunrotsod on his mode and on his þeawum wiðerweard.
 250. And þeah þe he þone cristes þearfan geseo þænne
þencð he þæt he nelle ægðer ge fæsten ge eac þone þearfan
gefrefrian and aretan þonne gelimpæð his þeowum oððe freomenn
þæt he hafað ymbehydig ærende to þam fæstendan menn.
 255. Þonne þencð he, Ne wille ic mine ærende abeodan ær
his hrif gereordod sy for þan þe hi oft onleton ongyton þæt hi
wæron on heora fæstene geunblissod.
 259. Broðor mine, ne bið swylc fæsten gecoren þam
soðfæstan deman.
 260. Ac gyf þu wille medomlice fæstan for naman þæs
ælmihtigan drihtenes þonne gefylst þone cwyde þe on þam sealme
gecweden wæs, drihten, forlæt me mine scylda on þa gelicnysse þe ic
forlet ælcum þeara þe wið me agyltað.
 265. Swa sceal se mann don se ðe wyle rihtwislice fæstan for
naman þæs ælmihtigan drihtenes.
 267. Ac se mann se þe þencð þæt he clænlice fæste
and þonne eac þenceð to wrace worda and dæda þam þe ær wið
hine agylton and ne wile forgyfennysse syllan and mildheortnysse and gefean
syllan ealra þeara yfela worda and dæda þe he æfre wið cristes
willan geworhte, þæt fæsten bið gelic þam unsmyredan tapore se
þære beorhtnysse ne onfehð.
 275. Swa bið þam gaste his weg to þam ecean life gebyrhteð
gyf se man bið on fæstene geunrotsod.
 278. For ðon us is swiðe mycel nydþearf þæt we swyðe
eadmodlice gedon ure fæsten ge ure ælmyssan ge ure hlutran gebeda ge ure
unlustas for naman þæs ælmihtigan drihtenes.
 281. Gyf we swa wyllað don and þas lare gelæstan þonne
magon we geearnian mid þam lastum forgyfennysse eallra þæra unnytta
lasta þe we ær on twelf monðum on unnytt geeodon.
 285. And eac swylce we magon geearnian þurh ure clæne
fæsten forgyfnysse ealra þæra unnytt æta þe we on twelf monðum
geðigdon eac swa we magon geearnian ednywunge and geblettfæstnysse eallra
ure eorðlicra gestreona.
 289. And eac þæt mare is eallra ura synna forgyfnysse gyf we
ne forgymeleasiað on þas andweardan tide godes þeowdomas.
 293. Ealne godes dom we magon þurh þreo þing gehealdan
þæt syndon þa þreo þing þæt se mann hine gehealde on godum
geþohtum and on godum weorcum and on godum dædum.
 296. Se goda geþoht onbryrdeð þæs mannes heortan to þam
godum dædum.
 299. Broðor mine, þysum we magon geearnian þæt we moton
lyfian and on blisse beon mid drihten sylfum and mid his þam halgum on
heofonan rice þam þe leofað and rixað on eallra worulda woruld a butan
ende, amen.

END_TEXT

HomS 36 (ScraggVerc 11)
B3.2.36.
Monday in Rogationtide: Scragg 1992, 221-5.



 0. Spel to forman gangdæge.
 1. Men ða leofestan, þis syndon halige dagas & halwendlice
& ussum sawlum læcedomlice, & us geriseð þæt we hie wel
begangen mid fæstenum & mid gebedum & mid reliquiasocnum & mid
usse eaðmodlice gange.
 4. For þan sanctus Petrus se ealdorapostol ærest us gesette to
healdanne ðas dagas & to beganganne for hæðenra manna gedwilde, for
þan þe hie hiera wiggild & hiera diofulgild on ðas dagas weorðedon
& beeodon, & we nu for þam þingum sculon þas dagas mærsian
& weorðigan & mid þam gesettum godum þe to þyssum dagum
gelimpaþ.
 9. Syndon us nu for þan bec gesette þæt we þurh ða
sculon geleornigan urne þane ecan ræd.
 10. Swylce us hafað gesæd  ure dryhten manega gastlice
blacernas þa us sculon lihtan mid heofonlicre æfæstnesse & mid
haligre lare, þætte nænig man on gedwolan þeostro ne ðurhwunige se
ðe soðfæstnesse lioht gesion wile.
 13. Þæt syndon þa blacernas þe us hafað ure dryhten
forgifen to anlyhtanne ða dimnesse mancynnes ungetreownesse?
 15. Ðæt syndon heahfæderas & witigan & apostolas
& bisceopas & mæssepreostas & þære godcundan lareowas &
manega Godes cyrican.
 17. & þam rihtum larum & ðam halegum bysenum we
habbað mycle nydþearfe þæt we hyrsumien, & ondrysenlice we
þæt halige godspel gehyren, & fæste we hit on urum heortum
gestaðolian.
 21. Uton nu gemunan hu us ece dryhten on his godspelle lærde
& þus cwæð: <foreign>Non qui ceperit, sed qui perseuerauerit usque in finem
saluus erit</foreign>, Nales se man se ðe onginneð gode dæde & eft
forlæteð, ac se þe þurhwunaþ on godum dædum, se bið hal
geworden.
 24. & swa swa ða dæghwamlican synna ne bioð wunigende,
swa ðonne eac þa dæghwamlican læcedomas ne syndon na wuniende.
 27. Twa tida on hiera endebyrdnesse is her on worulde a singalice
fyllað: <foreign>Tempus flendi et tempus ridendi</foreign>, þæt is wopes tid & oðer
hleahtres tid.
 29. Ne magon we ða hleahtras a singalice habban.
 29. & ic wat geare þætte æghwylc man wyle þætte he
gesio soðne gefean on þyssum middangearde, ne he nu is ne he æfre
wæs ne he æfre bið.
 32. Ac secen we soðne gefean þær þær he is, ðæt is
Crist sylfa on heofena rices hyhðo.
 33. Swa he þonne, dryhten sylfa, gecwæð, se ðæt gewin
& þa frofre soðfæstra manna on his godspelle wæs ðus
foresecgende: <foreign>In hoc mundo pressuram habebitis; mundus hic gaudebit; uos
autem tristes eritis, sed tristitia uestra conuertitur in gaudium</foreign>, Ge sculon
habban foreþrycnesse on þyssum middangearde, & þes middangeard
gefyhð & ge bioð unbliðe, & hwæðere ge bioð unsiofiende,
hio gecyrreð eft eow on gefean.
 39. Swa þonne, men þa leofestan, winnen we on þyssum
andweardan life, þeah þe hit unyðe sie, Gode us fultumiendum þæt we
don symle þætte god sy, þæt we þurh þæt mægen mid gefean
& mid wynsumnesse wæstmas godra wiorca on þære toweardan worulde
gesamnigan, æfter þan þe hit in sealmum awriten is: <foreign>Qui seminant in
lacrimis, in gaudio metent</foreign>, Ða ðe sawað on tearum, hie eft on gefean
ripað.
 46. For þæs ærestan mannes synnum, Adames, we wurdon
aworpene of neorxnawanges eðle & on þas wræcworuld sende, & we
swa syndon on þyssum middangearde swa we her nænig eðel ne habbað.
 48. Be ðon Paulus se apostol cwæð: <foreign>Dum sumus in corpore
peregrinamur/ a domino</foreign>, He cwæð, sanctus Paulus: Þenden we bioð on
lichoman, we bioð þiodige fram Gode.
 51. We magon heonon us geearnian þone ecan eðel & þone
soðan gefean.
 52. Ne magon we þæra ægðer her on worulde agan, ac we
sculon on þære toweardan gesittan þæt us is on eðle gehealden.
 54. To hwan sculon we secan on þyssum middangerde leornesse
gefean on heofenum?
 55. Uton we nu forð tilian þæt we geearnien þæt we
becuman moton gesæliglice to þam ecan & to þam ealdorlican eðle,
þær ure magas wilniað þæt hie us gesion, & ure gefion moton
usse yldran, þa syndon heahfæderas & witegan & apostolas, þær
ure bidaþ ure ceasterliode, þæt syndon englas & heahenglas, &
þær is sio wundorlice ceaster Hierusalem, þær ure bideð mid
aþenedum earmum ure dryhten hælend Crist.
 61. Uton nu for þan efstan þæt we dioful oferwinnen.
 63. We sculon, la, geþencan þæt we syndon gastlice cypemen.
 63. We sculon ceapian mid þyssum eorðlicum þingum þa
hiofenlican goldhordas & mid þyssum hwilendlican þingum þonc ecan
welan & þa awuniendan cypemen hie sculon bion þonne hie ham cumen mid
gesundum ceapum orsorge; swa we þonne sculon bion swiðe hycgende &
swiðe sorgfulle, ða hwile þe we her sien, in earnunga eces lifes,
þæt we þonne eft mægen bion gefionde in hiofenlican ham þæs
uplican rices.
 70. Ne þynce us for þan æfre to lang þæt geswinc &
þæt gewin her on worulde, for þan þe þæt cymeð to ende, &
þa meda ne cumaþ æfre to ængum ende þe us goldene bioð beforan
þam gewinnum.
 73. For ðam, men þa leofestan, forlæten we unnytne hleahter
& blisse.
 74. Is us mycel nydþearf þæt we þæt eft mid tearum
& mid heafe wepen & beten, for þan þe dryhten on his godspelle
þus cwæð: <foreign>Ue uobis qui ridetis nunc quia lugebitis et flebitis</foreign>, He
cwæð: Wa eow þe nu hlihhaþ, for þan þe ge eft heofað &
wepað.
 77. Efne swa he openlice cwæde: Ða men þe mæstne dream
& mæstne welan & mæste blisse butan Godes ondrysnum up ahebbað
her on worulde, hie þonne eft mæst unrotnesse butan ende & mæstne
ungefean butan ænigre blisse hie onfoð & aræfniað.
 82. For þan, men þa leofestan, þa hwile þe we her lifigende
sien/, utan we us biddan Godes mildheortnesse, þæt he us sende swa in ða
lufan þæs ecan lifes, þæt we ma lufien þone ecan eðel þonne
þis andwearde lif & ma þencen symle be ðam toweardan life þonne be
þyssum þe we her on lifiað.
 86. Ðis syndon swares & geswinces dagas, swa we hit sylfe
ongytan magon on þam manigfealdum unieðnessum þe dæghwamlice on manna
cynn fealleð on misgewidrum for manna gewyrhtum.
 89. Magon we nu ongitan, men þa leofestan, þætte ure ealra
ende swiðe mislice toweard nealæceð.
 90. Nu syndon þa Godes cyrican bereafode & þa wiofeda
toworpene þurh hæðenra manna gehresp & gestrodu, & þa weallas
syndon tobrocene & toslitene & þa godcundan hadas syndon gewanode for
hyra sylfra gewyrhtum & geearnungum.
 93. & nalas þæt an Godes þeowas ane syndon, ac eac
swylce cyningas & bisceopas & ealdormen, þa þe ðysse þeode
rædboran syndon, hie habbað þa godcundan hadas & þæt Godes folc
gestroden & bereafod for leasum tyhtum & lyðrum metsceattum.
 97. & we þonne nu for ure ealra gewyrhtum þas egeslican
þing & þas ondrysenlican her on worulde þrowigað.
 100. For þan we habbað mycle oferþearfe þæt we ðas
þing ealle mægene geþencen þe we nu hwile her ymb spræcon.
 101. Lufigen we nu þy geornlicor þas haligan dagas & þy
we magon mycel god ussum sawlum on him gestrynan.
 103. Þancien we ussum dryhtne wordum & dædum þysse
gesamnunge, & þæt we gebidan moston þysse halgan tide.
 105. Tilien we nu for ðan þæt we hie gedeflice begangen mid
gastlicum mægenum þe ðær to geset is.
 106. Se God us to ðam gefultumige þe ofer us ealle liofað
& rixað, amen.

END_TEXT

HomS 37 (Baz-Cr)
B3.2.37.
Tuesday in Rogationtide: Bazire and Cross 1982, 140-43.



 1. <foreign>Feria Tertia De Letania Maiore</foreign> men ða leofestan þys syndon
halige dagas and halwendlice us to begangenne and to healdenne þurh rihtne
geleafan mid fæstenum and mid ælmessylenum, swa urum sawlum nydþearflic
is.
 4. Utan geþencan hu ælmihtig God for us þrowode and
geþafode: ærest þa he wæs on heofona rices hyhðu up ahafen and on
his wuldre unonwendedlic, þa geeadmette he hine to þan þæt he
syðþan on þisne middaneard wæs acenned and to menn geworden.
 7. And he ða her on worulde wæs þrowigendlic monn, and gyt
he hine sylfne geeadmette to þon þæt he wolde for mancynnes þearfe
geþrowian and hine sylfne lætan for ealles middaneardes are and alysnesse
ahon and acwellan.
 11. Ærest he þæt geþafode his agenum willan, þæt
hine mann for ure þearfe genam and geband, and he wæs mid swipum beswungen
and hine man on þæt neb hræhte, and hine man mid bradum handum on
þæt neb sloh and him þyrnene helm for oðerne cynehelm on þæt
heafod sette.
 14. And eall he þæt eadmodlice for ure þearfe geþrowode
and micle maran and mænigfealdre þing þonne ic nu on þisse hwile
areccan mæge oððe asecgan, þa þe he for mancynnes hælo and are on
him sylfum aræfnode and forbær.
 17. And þæt her ealra mæst is, swa ic ær sæde,
þæt hine man for ure ealra neodþearfe and for ealles middaneardes
alysednysse on rode gealgan aheng and gefæstnode; and hine man eac þær
mid spere gewundode.
 20. And he þa his þæt halige heafod onhylde and his gast on
his Fæder hand ageaf and on his geweald bebead.
 21. And eac to helwarum nyþer astah and ðone ealdan
wiðerweardan feond þær geband and getigde; and mænige halige sawla
þæra manna þe him ær her on worulde gehyrdon and gecwemdon he þonon
up ateah to heofona rices hyhðo and to his wuldre gelædde.
 26. Forðon, men þa leofestan, us is swyðe mycel þearf
þæt we ealle þa þing geþencan and asmeagan geornlice and eadmodlice,
and him þæs symle inweardlice þancas secgan ealra þæra þinga þe
he for mancynnes þearfe mildelice on him sylfum forbær and geþrowode.
 29. And we symle geornlice his þa halgan and þa godcundan
bebodu agan to gefyllanne and to gehealdenne on us sylfum.
 31. Ne syndon nænie on þissere worulde ne on þissum life
þæs fæstlice and ðæs mislice þing þæt hi symle
fullhrædlice aweg ne gewitan; þonne bið þæt swyðe scandlic and
swyðe bysmorlic þæt man þæt lufige and on þam hangie þe he
gesyhð þæt him daga gehwylce fram higeð and efsteð.
 34. Ac uton we micle swyðor habban godcunde lufe betwyx us;
forðam þe ic sæde ær, for urum lufon ealles middaneardes fruma and
ende to þissere eorðan astah, and þa eac on þissere worulde for urum
lufon deað þrowode and on him sylfum aræfnode.
 38. Uton we þonne forðon, men þa leofestan, geornlice
tiligean þæt we for his lufe and for his willan us sylfe and ures lichaman
lustas and willan on us sylfum cwylmen, and þæt we eac for his lufon and
for his willan ealle þa lustfulnessa þissere andweardan tide and þissere
gewitendan forseon and forhycgan, þæt we of ðam wacran and of þam
wyrsan to þam beteran and to þam selran becuman moton, of ðissum
lichamlicum þingum to þam godcundan, and of þisses middaneardes life to
his gesælignysse and to þam hihte þæs toweardan lifes and þæs
ecan æristes becuman magan and moton.
 45. Ac utan hyhtan us and þeodan us to ælmihtigum Gode and to
his are and to his forgyfnysse.
 46. Forðon se sealmscop þæt lærde and swa cwæð,
Cumað ge and uton us gebiddan and forðgangan beforan ælmihtigum Gode and
hreowsian for urum synnum and mandædum; and don we godcunde gyfe to ðon
þæt we Godes are and his miltse begytan magon and moton.
 50. And uton aweorpan fram us þone yfelan and ðone grimman
gewunan and us mid godcunde mægne gearwian, þæt we þæt heofoncunde
lif geearnian magon, and þæt we ne þurfon beon Gode on þa wynstran
hand gesette ne þone cwyde gehyran þe he to þam cwyð.
 54. leofan men, ac efston we mid fæstenum and mid
ælmesdædum þæt us seo hell ne forswelge.
 56. God ælmihtig is swyðe mildheort and manþwære.
 56. Ac hwæðere he on domesdæg byð swyðe reþe and
swyðe rihtwis; and þy he bið domesdæg gehaten forþan ðe Drihten
sylf on þæm dæge demeð eallum eorðwarum, þa þe he ær sylfa
hider gescop and geworhte, swa hwæðer swa hi on þissere worulde ær
geworhton swa heofona rice swa hellewite.
 60. Send þonne his englas to feower dælum þisses
middaneardes and ðær his ða heofoncundan byman blawað, and þonne
ealle eorðware up arisað of ðæm ealdum eorðscræfum and of
ðæm ealdum eorðdenum þe we on gehydde wæron.
 63. Þonne bið eal þes middaneard swyðe onhrered and
onstyred; duna myltað swa weax deð on fyre, sæs beoð adrugode and
steorran hreosað of heofonum swa snaw deþ on eorðan þonne hit swyðost
sniwoð, and stanas formyltað, and seo sunne bið on þeostru gecyrred and
se mona ne sylð nænne sciman of him, and seo heofon bið toborsten fram
eastdæle middaneardes oð þone westdæl, and ðonne ealle heofonwaru
and eorðwaru beoð swyðe forhte gewordene.
 69. And þonne oðre siðe ure Drihten hider on þisne
middaneard becymeð to demanne mid mycelre menio engla and heahengla, apostola
and martyra.
 71. And he þonne his þæt heofonlice werod him on þa
swyðran healfe gesetteð and þa manfullan beoð on þa wynstran healfe
gecyrred.
 73. And he þonne on his fotum and on his handum þa dolhswaþu
forð æteoweð, and ðus sprecende bið and ðus cwyð, Eala, þu
man, forhwon noldest þu þas wunda gelacnian þas ic for ðe þafiende
wæs, to þon þæt ic ealle þine wunda gelacnode?
 76. Oððe forhwan noldest ðu þysne þyrnenan helm me of
þæm heafde alysan, to þan þæt ic ðe of hellehæfte nearwan
alysde and of deofles anwealde?
 78. And he þonne eft oðre siðe swyðe mycclum and swyðe
reðum wordum sprecende bið to þæm þe him on þa wynstran healfe
gesette byð and ðus cwyð, Gewitað ge, awyrgedan gastas, fram me in
þæt forwyrde lif and in þa nyðemestan helle, of þissum godcundan
gemanan, on deofla gemanan and of þissum heofonlican heape in þone hellican
þreat.
 84. Ne cweð he þonne na þæt eow wæs gegearwod fram
fruman þisses middaneardes, ac he cwyð þæt wæs gegearwod fram
fruman þisses middaneardes deoflum and his gescolum.
 86. Ðær is þonne heof and wop and cyrm and granung and
cwanung and toða gristbitung, and ðær is seo singale niht, and ðær
syndon þa ecan þystru and ðær ne bið næfre nænig leoht
geseald; ac þær bið se hearda hungor and se bitera þurst.
 89. And ðær is wanunga and wita ma þonne æniges mannes
earan ahlystan magon ne nanes mannes tunga nis to þam swyft, þeah þe he
hæbbe XII heafdu and ðæra heafdu æghwylc hæbbe XII tungan and
ðæra tunga æghwylc hæbbe XII stefna and ðæra stefna gehwylc
hæbbe snyttro Salomones; ne magon hi þeahhwæðere ealle þa wean and
ða witu ariman ne areccan þe þa earman and ða werigan sawla geþafian
and þrowian sculon.
 95. And nan þæra wita mare ne byð þonne þæt ure
Drihten him næfre eft on gemyndum ne byð ne ne becymð.
 96. þæt is yrres dæg and æfstes dæg and þæt is
susle dæg and þæt is se bitera bifigenda dæg and se cwacienda dæg
and se forhtigenda domesdæg.
 99. Tylian we nu forðon, men þa leofestan, mid fæstenum and
mid ælmesdædum and mid cyriclicum wæccum and socnum and mid
eorðlicum leohte, þæt we magon and moton æt þam ælmihtigan Gode
geearnian þæt we moton on domesdæge beon on his swyðran healfe
gesette and þone cwyde gehyran þe he to þam cweð þe þonne on his
swyðran gesette beoð.
 103. He cweð, Cumað ge gebletsode, þe mine bebodu heoldon,
and onfoð freolice mines Fæder rice þæt eow wæs fram fruman
þisses middaneardes togeanes gegearwod.
 105. Geunne us þonne se ælmihtiga God þæt we to ðam
heofonlican eþle becuman magon and moton, þær he leofað and ricsað
mid Fæder and Suna and mid þam Halgan Gaste aa on ecnysse in ealra worulda
woruld, a butan ende. Amen.

END_TEXT
