HomU 15.1 (Scragg)
B3.4.15.1.
Scragg 1992, edited from Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Hatton 115, fols. 140-47, VercHom 9 MS. L: Scragg 1992, 159-83.



 1. Usse lareowas & usse leorneras & þa halgan apostolas
& ure bisceopas beodaþ eallum þæm mæssepreostum þe heom
underþeodde syndon þæt hi heora hadas on riht gehealden, & gode
bysne ætywan Godes folce þe ge rihtan sceolon, & þæt ge ne
geþafien þæt hi hiora lif on unriht libben, & þæt ge hit him ne
cyþen þær hi hit doþ & wyrceaþ.
 5. Þonne ærest we beodaþ þæt ge god don & yfel
forlæten, & lufiaþ eowerne drihten & eowre þa nyhstan, eal
cristen folc, mid eallum mode & mid eallum mægene, & scyldaþ eow
wið þa uncysta þara eahta heafodleahtra, þæt is oformodnes &
manslæhtas & mæne aðas, unrihthæmed, morðor & gitsunga,
lease gewitnessa, nið & yrre, stala & tælnessa &
drycræftas.
 11. & þa ðe nu swylcera synna andetnessa & rihte
dædbote her ne doþ, hi þonne mid deofle gesigaþ on helle, þær nis
nauþer ne andetnes ne forgifnes.
 13. Nu bidde we eow & myndgiaþ þæt ge don soðe
dædbote eowra synna, for þon hell hafað seofon witu: þæt forme wite
is ece hungor, oþer is ece þurst, þridde is ece cyle, feorþe is fyres
hæto, fifte is ece wyrma slite, syxte is ece fulnes, seofoþe ece smyc
& þrosm.
 17. & se preost se þe hæbbe nunnan oð his ende, oððe
læwde man se þe hæbbe cyfese ofer his æwe, oððe hwa him to
gesybne man hæbbe oð his endedæg, syn hi ealle amansumude of ealra
heofonwara haligdome & eorþwarena.
 20. Ne gesinge þær nan man nane mæssan þær hi inne
syn, ne husl ne gehalgodne hlaf ne sylle, ne hi nan man ne byrge binnan
gehalgodan mynstre, ne furþum to hæþenum pytte ne bere, ac drage butan
cyste butan hi geswicon.
 23. & gif ða mæssepreostas þissa ænig mid him witon
& nellaþ him styran & forbeodan hira unriht, oððe feoh æt
nymaþ, oððe gif þa ðe ure spræce sprecan sceolon & him feoh
æt nymaþ & forswigiaþ & nellaþ us hit cyþan, þonne syn hi
ealle amansumade of Godes bletsunge & of ure, buton hi hit gebetan willon.
 29. Wa, la, þam mannum þe mid deoflum sculon habban hyra
eardungstowe, þær bið sar butan frofre & ermþa butan are &
weana ma þonne æniges monnes gemet sy þæt hit asecgean mæge.
 31. Swa hit awriten stondeþ & þus cweden.
 32. Se salmscop us sang þysne cwide be deaþes onlicnesse &
be helle gryre.
 34. Ðonne syndon þreo deaþas leornode on bocum: an þara
deaþa bið þæt mon swelte on his synnum; ðonne bið oðer deaþ
þæs lichoman & þære saule gedal; ðonne bið se ðridda deaþ
þæt he bið on helle cwylmed, þær ne mæg nænig sawl hire
waldend herian for þon sare þe hire onsiteð.
 38. Ðonne sindon þreo lif leornode on bocum be soþfæstum
monnum: an lif him bið be flæsce; & oðer him bið be Godes willan;
& him bið þæt ðridde lif on þære toweardan worulde mid eallum
halgum.
 42. & se deaþ is to ondrædanne for þon nænig mon nis
þæt hine mæge befleon.
 43. Þeah se mon eardige on middum burgum & on middan his
mægþe betweoh hundteontigum þusenda manna mid wepnes ecgum, & þeah
he si hundteontig þusenda fæþma under eorþan in iserne cyste belocen,
hwæþere he sceal sweltan.
 46. & se deaþ is iunglic, for þon þe cild sweltaþ &
unmagan, & he is freolic & þeowlic, for þon cyningas sweltaþ
& þeowutlingas, & se deaþ ys eac snotorlic, for þon þe dwolan
sweltaþ & uþwiotan, & se deað is unrotlic & bliðelic, for
þon þe synnie sweltaþ & halige.
 50. Þæt is wel wyrðe þæt he sy unrot þæm
synfullum for þæm him næfre æfter ne cumaþ ne beforan ne beoþ
gemette for þære gemetnesse þara ecean tintrega þær hi sceolan beon
aa butan ende.
 53. & se deað bið bliðe halgum mannum for þon gesceade
wið eorþwelum, þe him ær wæron fræmde on mode, & for
þære onseone heora waldendes.
 56. Þonne eal monna cyn ne mæg wordum asæcgan ne ariman
þæs deaþes gryre for þæm gedalum þe on him syndon.
 57. Þæt æryste gescead bið lichomon & saule.
 58. Þæt bið syþðan uncuþ hwæþer seo saul
gemeteþ swa god swa yfel, swa hire gegearwod bið & hire geearnung
wæs on worulde.
 60. For þæm æghwylcum bið sundorstow geteod þa ðe he
him selfa ær geworhte.
 61. Þonne is þæt þridde gescead wið eallum
eorþweolum.
 62. Ac se deaþ bið egeslic for þære biternesse, for þon
he betyneþ þa eagan from gesihþe & þa earan from gehernesse &
þa geaglas from sprece & þa fet from gange & þa handa from weorce
& þa nysþyrlu from swæcce, & þonne æt nyhstan he betyneþ
ealra scyldygra saula on helle.
 66. Eala, wa þæm þe his ende þyllic sceal beon.
 67. Þonne syndon fif hella onlicnessa her on worulde leornode on
bocum.
 68. An is worc noma, for þon an is micel cwealm þe hine
tosceadeþ & afylleþ þæt him syþðan ne lysteþ ne goldes ne
seolfres, ne he ne wunsumaþ þisses woruldlican þrymmes, þeah he him sy
eal to gelæded.
 71. Þonne bið þære æfteran helle onlicnesse her on
worulde oferyldo nemned, þonne him þa earan adeafiaþ þa ðe ær
mehton geheran fægre sangas, & seo tunge awlyspaþ seo þe ær
hæfde ful recene spræce, & þa fet aslapaþ þa þe ær
wæron swifte & hræde to gange, & þa handa þindaþ þa
þæ ær hæfdon hwæte fingras, & þæt feax afealleþ
þæt ær wæs long on wæstmum, & þa teð ageolugiað þe
ær wæron on hwitum hiwe, & þæt orþ afulaþ þe ær wæs
on swetum swæcce.
 78. Þonne is þære ðriddan helle onlicnesse deaþ noma; ne
areð hine metes gifernes ne gestreon ne ricetere.
 79. Þonne is seo feorþe hell byrgen genemned; þæs huses
hrof is genyþrod for þon hit him siteþ onufan on þæm breostum, &
his gestreona þæt wyrreste þæt bið þonne hine mon besiweð on
anum hrægle.
 82. Siþðan hine mon gebringæþ æt ham, hafaþ him
þonne syþðan þreo gebeddan, þæt bið greot & molde &
wyrmas.
 84. Þonne is þæt fifte hell susl nemned, for þon þeah
seofun men syn, mid twam & hundteontigum gereordum swa ealles middangeardes
is, & wære þara æghwylc a to life gescepen, & þara æghwylc
hæbbe seofun heafdu þara ælc seofun tungan & þara ælc sy
iserne stæfne, þa ne magon ealle atellan helle wito.
 89. Heo is swa micel swa from heofnas hrofe oð niðer on þas
eorþan.
 90. & þeah þæt lengost treow stonde on middangearde on
þæm hehstan clife oððe munte, & þonne mon gebinde þa fet
þæs monnes to ufewardum þæm treo þe wære ane niht on helle,
& him þonne læte hangian þæt heafod adun þæt him sige
þæt blod on syx healfa ut þurh þone muþ, & hine þær sece
elc þara yfla þe æfre on eorþan fram anginne secgean gehyrde &
hine þonne þa sæyþa cnyson & beaten þe heo mid hire brogan
forþbringæþ, þonne wile he þis eall lustlice geþafian, þeah he
scyle syx þusenda wintra & eac þæt ðusend þe domesdæg on
gewyrþ, wið þon þe he næfre ma þa helle ne gesece.
 99. For þon wa þam þe beoð gelædde to þære stowe.
 99. Eala, wa þæm þe cunnon godspel secgean & Godes folc
læran & ne willaþ for heora gemelæste.
 101. Þæm bið wa æfre geborenum þe hit ne wille mid
inneweardre heortan geheran & healdan.
 102. On helle bið wop butan frofre, hreownes butan are, þær
bið þeowdom butan freodome, & unrotnes butan gefean.
 104. Ne bið þær cyninges worþung ne ealdes wurþnes ne
iunges hersumnes ne gesibbes lufu for þon sare þe hire onsiteþ.
 106. La hwæt, we us huruþinga ne ondrædaþ þæt we
dæghwæmlice geseoþ beforan urum eahum ure nehstan sweltan, &
þenne þæm lænan lichoman bið laðlic legerbed gegearwod & in
þære caldan foldan lið gebrosnod, & þæt læne lic þær
weorþeð to fylnesse & grimmum gylstre & þæm wælslitendan
wyrmum to mete.
 110. Hwæt, þæt þonne bið sarlic sar & earmlic gedal
lices & saule gif se earma innera mon, seo sawul, sceal slidan in þa
ecean helle & in þa ecean witu mid ðone awergdan gast Antecrist, &
þær mid deofle drohtnaþ habban, in morþre & in mane, in susle
& in sare, on wean & on wyrmum, betweonan deaþum & deoflum, in
bryne & on biternesse, in balwum & on bradum lege, in earmþum &
on earfeþum, & on sweartum bryne & on swiltcwale, on sarum &
sorgum & on fyrenum ægldum, on fylnessum & on fracoðnessum, &
on toþa gristbitunge & in tintergum & on eghwylcum ormodnessum
earmra saula, on cele & on wanunge, on hungre & on þurste, on hæto
& on nacodnesse, on nearunesse & on ecre forwyrde, on arleasnesse
& on missenlicum cynna witum, & in fæþme þæs beornendan
dracan se þe is deoful cweden.
 123. Uton us for þon bewarnian þæt micle deoful Antecrist
mid helle witum, & wuton beon gemyndige usra sylfra saula in gehealdnesse
Godes beboda.
 125. Uton forletan yfel & don god, on þon þe we þuruhteon
mægen.
 126. Forlæten we morþor & mæne aþas & oferhygde,
æfeste & andan & idelne gylp & arleasnesse & oferfylle &
unrihtwisnesse & unnytnesse & unrihthæmed & ærætas &
ealogalnesse & oferfylle & unsibbe & dyrne geligre &
drycræftas & deofulgeld, druncennesse & gedwolan, fracoddæde
& gitsunge & gifernesse, leahtor & leasunge & laþwende
niþas & heteþoncas & treowleasnesse, & æghwylce synne
þissum gelice þa þæm lichoman bið eaþe in to slidenne.
 132. Þær bið ofergyten ealle þa god þa ðe men on
eorþan ær lufedon.
 134. Þonne is leornod on bocum þæt an deoful sæde anum
ancran be helle wite mid hire tintregum.
 135. He cwæþ þæt nære þes middangeard eall mid his
wæstmum næs þon mara þe se seofoþa dæl eorþan þæs þe
wæter ne geseceþ.
 137. Þonne is se mycela garsecg se þe ymbe þas eorþan utan
ligeð swiþe ormetlice mycel & nys þæs middangeard þon mara be
him þe an prica on weaxbrede.
 140. Þa cwæþ þæt deoful to þæm ancran: þeah mon
þone garsecg mid isernum weallum utan betyne, & hine þonne fyres afylle
up oþ heofnes hrof, & hine þonne utan besette mid smiþbylium &
heora æghwylc oðrum ætrine, & sy to ælcum þara man togeset
& ælc þara manna hæbbe Samsones strenge (& se Samson ealle
Fillestina/ þeode gererde & heora duguþe afylde, & he hæfde
twelf loccas & on ælcum locce he hæfde twelf manna mægen) &
man þonne sette iserne þele ofer þæs fyres hrof & þæt sy eall
mid mannum afylled & heora æghwylc hæbbe hamor on honda, & hit
þonne aginne eal samod brastlian & þa bylias blawan & þæt fyr
dynian & þa hamoras beatan, hweþere for eallum þyssum gedyne ne
mæg seo sawl awacian seo þe wæs ær ane niht on helle.
 152. For þæm is wa þam þe helle geseceð, & bið wel
þæm/ þe hi forgæþ & mote heofona rice gesecean, þæt man ne
mæg wordum asæcgean.
 154. Þær bið lif butan deaþe & iugoþ butan yldo
& hælo butan sare & dæg buton nihte.
 155. Ne þearf mon þær leohtes sunnan ac þær bið
leoht genoh of ælmihtegum dryhtne geond eal heofna rice.
 156. Þær beoþ þa wuldorlican sangas ealra ðrymma.
 157. Þær næfre ne bið ne hungor ne þurst, ne cyle ne
gryre, ne bryne ne broga, ne atol ne yld, ne granung ne gnornung.
 160. Þa cwæþ þæt deoful to þæm ancran: Þeah
smætegylden mor sy æt sunnan upgange on neorxnawonge, & se oferlicge
ealle eorþan, & cynebearn sitte onufan þæm, & þæt sy on
middre ylde, & þeah he mote sittan oþ ende his lifes, & he
hæbbe Salomones wlite & his wisdom, & him sy eal middaneard on
gewæald geseald mid þæm gestreonum þe heofonas behwealfeþ, &
him ælc stan wære gylden, & him ealle streamas hunige flowen, &
him þonne on eorþan nære nænig wiðerbroga, & þeah him sie
ealle sangcræftas to gesamnode þæt hine afrefrian, & him sie ealle
swetnessa/ mid eaðnessum geboren, þeah nyle he on eallum þyssum wuldre
gewunian gif he wæs ane niht on heofonum.
 171. Þonne soðlice ure drihten is to þon mildheort & we
syndon him to þon leofe gif we tala doþ & wel wyllað, þæt he
sona wile ussum þingungum onfon.
 173. Swa he seolfa cwæþ: Nelle ic þæs synfullan monnes
deaþ, ac ic wille þæt he leofge & sy gecyrred from his synnum.
 175. For þon þam þe butan andetnessa & butan dædbote
heora lif geendiaþ her on worulde, þonne ne becumaþ heo æfre to
ængum life ne to ænigre reste, ac heo beoþ sceofone in þa ecan
tintrego helle wites.
 178. Uton we þonne geearnian, þa hwile þe us God þisses
lifes geunnan willæ, þæt we ne syn æfre mid arleasum monnum &
synfullum witned, ac we geearnien þæt we moten mid rihtwisum monnum &
mid mildheortum becuman to þære ecan eadignesse & rixian mid ure
drihtne aa on wuldres wonge butan ælcum ende.

HomU 16 (Kluge)
B3.4.16.
Kluge 1885, 472: Kluge 1885b, 472-4.



 1. Warna þe wið þa wyrðmyntas þe þu butan gylte heldan
nemiht.
 1. Healicnys wyrðmynnta is leahtra micelnys on maran wite se mara
bið gecwylmed.
 2. Se læssa is gifennissa ner.
 3. Ða mihtigan witodlice mihtelice wita þoliað and se
stiþaste dom gewyrð þam þe oðra wealdað ðam þe micel bið
geseald him bið micel æt of gesoht ðam þe mare bið befæst.
 5. Him bið mare æ of gan wurðmyntas witodlice æfter
fræcednisse beoð adrogone.
 6. Hrædlice bið se andweald on frecednisse hrædlice bið
þolað he hrire.
 7. Swa micele witodlice swa mara wurðmynt swa miccle maran beoð
fræcednissa.
 8. Swa hehre treow swa strenglucur fran windum astyred and his
bogas rædlucur beoð tobrocene.
 10. Hegran styplas on swæran hryre niðer sigað.
 10. Ða hehstan duna gelolicum ligeræscum beoð for slegene.
 11. On ricne man hrædlice fealð anda.
 12. Se wulderfulla hrædlice sirgungum geopenað, wuldor
witodlice andan acenð, anda gewislice fræcednissa.
 13. Ðeh þe æni on wurulde wuldre scine þeh þe he on
purpuran and on golde glitinie, ðeh þe he on deorwurðum girlan
gefrætowod ofer hlifie, þeh þe he beo mid folce utan ymtrymmed, ðeh
þe he beo mid waciendra meniu gescild, þeh þe he beo mid ungerimum
gyhyrsumiendra mæniu ymtrymed, ðeh þe he beo mid weredum orsorh
þehweðere he æfre on wite wunað and on nearunisse and æfre on
gnornunge and on orleahtre, on godewebbenum beddum he hlinað ac þehweðere
oft gedrefeð, on plum feðerum he lið ac þeh weðere oft æblæce,
on gyldenum beddum he rest ac oft rædlice gedrefed.
 21. Gewæde is þises middangeardes gesælð and litel is
þisse worulde wuldor, gewitenlic and tydder is hwilwendlic miht.
 23. Sege la, wær synd cyningas, hwær ealdormenn?
 23. Hwær synd caseras?
 24. Hwær synd welie menn woruldþinga?
 24. Her synd woruldrican?
 24. Hwær synd welie middangeardes?
 25. Ealswa sceadu hi gewitan, ealswa swefen hi fordwinon.
 26. Hi synd gesohte and hi nesynd gemette.
 26. Welan to fræcednisse gelaþiað, welan to forwyrde
gedragað, welfeala for welan on orleahter becomon, welmanegum welan deað
acendon.
 28. Næfð he næfre modes stilnesse þe hine sylfne
eorðlicum carum þeott.
 29. Ða carfulnyssa witodlice þæt mod gedrefað and
astyriað.
 30. Seo miht witodlice þære carfulnysse næfre þolað
angsumnyssum.
 31. Gif þu wille beon stille negewilna þu ænig þing woruld
þinges.
 31. Æfre þu æfst modes stilnysse gif þu fram þe awyrpst
middangeardes care.
 32. Æfre þu bist on ecere stilnysse gif þu þe ætbryst
fram eorðlicra dæda gehlyda.
 34. Næfre welan nebeoð butan synne begytene, ne nan þa
eorðlican þing nemæg butan synne gebrytsnian.
 35. Ðearle seldsene is þæt þa welan agniað to reste
onetton ðaþe hi sylfe mid eorðlicum carum bewindaþ hi hi sylfe fram
godes lufe ascyriað.
 37. Seþe on woruldþinga lufe bið gefæstnod nateshwon he on
god negelustfullað.
 38. Woruldþinga witodlice fram godes gimene awendað.
 39. Nemæg ænig crist lufian samod and worulde.
 39. Earfoðe is heofenlicum carum and earðlicum samod þywian,
earfoðelic is god samod and middangeard to luuigenne.
 41. Nemæg æghweþer gelice beon gelufod.
 41. Forþi wiðsac woruldþingum for godes ege and forhafa þe
for gode fram woreldcarum gecneordlæce þæt þu gode þeowige.
 43. Butan hremininge worulde nan caru þe fram godes lufu ne
ætbrede nan carefulnys woruldþinga þe fram godes gimene gelatige.
 45. Awurpp fram þe swa swa wæt swa god angin mæg lettan.
 46. Eallum mode ascuna and geniþera þæt middangeard
lufað.
 46. Beo þu dead middangearde and middangearde þe.
 47. Middangeardes wuldor swa swa deað fram awurp.
 48. Oferswið þe fram þises lifes lufe swaswa gebyrgið.
 48. Nafa þu worulde care.
 49. Swaswa forðfaren ascire þe fram ælcere eordlicere
mangunge.
 50. Forseoh libbende þa þingc þe þu æfter deaðe habban
nemiht.
 50. Swa hwæt swa þu hæfst hafa to mildheortnysse þæt
þin mægen gehelpe þearfan wædlunge.
 52. And gif þu hwæne gelogodne on nead þearfe ongitst and
gif þu hwæne on wædle beþreafodne and gif þu hwæne on ænigum
þigum aidlodne acnæwst and gif þu hwæne ofþrihtene oððe
geeadmedne gesihst mid þam gehelpe neforseoh þu ænine, ne forhoga
ænine, nanne forlæt þu gelærne fram þe, nan unrot gewite fram
þe, nan fram þe gescind gehworfe.
 57. Ealle gemæne, eallum syle and eallum geearca.

END_TEXT

HomU 17.1 (Kluge E)
B3.4.17.1.
Kluge 1885, 474: De sancto Iohanne (Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS. 198): Kluge 1885b, 477-9.



 1. <foreign>De sancto Johanne.</foreign>.
 1. Sanctus Johannes geseah ofer garsegc swilce hit land wære.
 1. Þa genam hine se engel and gebrohte hine to Paradisum,
þæt is, neorxnawonge.
 3. Paradisum nis naðor ne on heofonum ne on eorþan.
 3. Feowærtig fædma heah wæs Noes flod ofer ða hehstan
dune þe on worulde is.
 4. Seo dun is on bocleden gehaten Armenia.
 5. Nu is Paradisum feowærtig fædma hehgra þonne Noes flod
wæs.
 6. Paradisus hangað betwynon heofonan and eorðan wundorlice,
swa hit se ealwældend gesceop.
 7. Paradisus is eall efenlang and efenbrad.
 8. Nis ðær naðor ne dæl ne dune, ne þær nebið snaw
ne forst ne hagol ne ren, ac þær is <foreign>Fons Vite</foreign>, þæt is, lifæs
wylle.
 9. Ðonne Kalendas Januarii otun gæð, þonne flowæð seo
welle swa fægere and swa smoltlice swa hunig and na deopre þonne mon
mæg wætan his finger forwyrdne ofer þæt land eall.
 12. Hio floweð ælce monað ana siðe.
 12. Þonne se monaþ in cymeð Januarii and þær is se
fægere wuduholt þe is on bocum gehaten <foreign>Radiansaltus</foreign>.
 14. Þær is ælc treow swa riht swa bolt and swa heah
þætte næfre ne on eorðan nan man geseon meahte ne eac hwilces cynnes
hio syndon.
 16. Nefealð þær næfre leaf of, ac a he bið singrene,
wlitig and wynsum, welena unrim.
 18. Paradisus is uprihte on eastewearde ðysse worulde.
 18. Nis þær ne mete ne hungor, ne þær niht næfre
necymeð, ac a simble dæg.
 19. Sunne þær scineð seofanfealdlucor and beorhtlicor ðone
her deð.
 20. Ðær wuniaþ on godes ænglas unrim mid þam halgum
saulum oþ Domæsdæg.
 21. Ðær wunað on an fæger fugol, Fenix haten.
 23. He is mycel and mære swa se ælmihtiga hine sceop.
 24. He is hlaford ofer eall fugelcynn.
 24. Ælcere wucan æne siþe se fægre fugol hine baþað
in þam lifæs wylle, and þonn fleogeð se fugel and asett hine on
þæt heagoste treow þe is on Paradisum ongean þa hatan sunnan.
 27. Þonne scinæð he swa sunnanleoman and glitenað swa
swylce he sio eall gylden.
 29. His fiðera syndon ænglas feðerum gelice.
 30. His breost and his bile beorht syndon fægere and fage
æghwilces cynnes.
 32. Hwæt, his eagan eþelice sendon swa clæne swa cristal,
lo, and swa scire swa sunnanleoma.
 34. His fet syndon blodreade begentwegen and se bile hwit.
 36. Hwæt, se fægera fugol fleogeð of his earde seþe is
fægerlice Fenix haten.
 38. Witodlice wunað he on Egyptaland fiftene wucan fæste
ætgædere.
 40. Ðonne cumaþ to him swylce hi cyning wære, fægniaþ
and folgiaþ eall fugolcynn.
 42. Hwæt, þæt fugolcynn eall fægere Fenix gretaþ,
writigað and singaþ onbutan him, ælc on his wisan ænne heriaþ.
 45. Ðonne færð þæt folc feorran swiþe, wafiaþ and
wundriaþ, wellcumiað Fenix, hal wesþu Fenix, fugela fægerest.
 47. Feorran hidercumen.
 48. Ðu glitenast swa read gold, ealra fugela cyning, Fenix
gehaten.
 50. Ðonne wercað hio of weaxe, writiað Fenix, metað Fenix
and hine mærlice þær wordum heriað, fugela fægerest, Fenix haten.
 54. Ðonne fagniaþ þær fugelas ealle fægere and fage,
fela ætgedere, feallað to fotum, Fenix gretað.
 57. His stæfn is swa beorht swa byme and his sweora swilce
smæte gold, and his forebreost fægre gehiwod swylce marmorstan mærost
cynnes.
 61. And him an ræd hiow rudaþ on þam ricge, goldfylle gelic
glitonaþ Fenix.
 63. Hwæt þes fugol ferde fægere to his lande ymbe fiftene
wucan.
 64. Fugelas manige, eall embuton efne ferdon ufene and neoþone
and on ælce healfe.
 67. Ða hio becomon þær heora cyning sceolde, fenix se
fægere, fugol gehaten, faraþ forþ into Paradisum þæt is under
heofonan hama hegost.
 71. Ða wunede þær on Paradisum Fenix se fægere, fugel
eall halig, and þæt fugelcynn eall ferdon heom hamweard, ælc to his
earde, aredon Fenix.
 75. Nu sagað her Sanctus Johannes soðum wordum, wislice and
wærlice swa se wertacen þæt six þusend her on worolde Crist
forestihte ðone æfre embe an þusend geara farað Fenix se fægra
fugel/, wlitig and wundorlic.
 81. Þynceð him þæt he forealdod sy and gaderað þonne
ofer eall Paradysum togædere ealle þa deorwurðan bogas, and macaþ
mycelne heap togædere.
 83. And þurh Godes mihte se hate sunne scineþ and þurh þara
sunnan hatnesse and hire lioman se heap wyrðeþ onæled þe he, se halga
fugol Fenix, geworht hafað.
 85. He feallað þonne onmidd þæt fyr and wyrðaþ
forbærned eall to duste.
 86. Ðonne on þone þriddan dæg ariseð se fægere fugol
Fenix of dæðe and bið edgung and farað to þam lifes wylle and
baþaþ hine þær inne and him wexan onginnað þa feþera swa
fægere swa hio æfre fægereste wæron.
 90. And þus a emb þusend wintra, he hine forbærneþ and eft
forfæger ediung up ariseþ.
 91. And nafaþ he nenne gemacan ne nan man ne wat hweþer hit is
þe carlfugol þe cwenfugol buton Crist sylf.
 92. He is þas halgan fugeles Fenix gehaten, wlitig and wynsum,
swa hine eallwealdend gesceop and þus dreogan sceal drihtnes willan.
 94. Nu is us andgyt forgyfen, mancenne, fugelas heriaþ Crist.
 95. Nu gedafenað us þæt we herian urne drihten mid
ælmæssan and mid halgunge bedum and mid eallum þingum þæt witon
þæt gode leof is and gescildan us wiþ ða eahta heahsynna þæt we
þa nefremman, þæt is, morþor and stala, mane aþes and unrihtgitsunge
and unrihthæmedu and gifernesse, leasunga and attorcræftas, dyrne ligera
and twispæce and ofermodignæss, beorgan we us wiþ ealle þas heahsynna
and lufian urne drihten mid eallum mægene and mid eallum mode, se god þe
leofað and rixaþ, seðe on heofonum is heah and halig ealra cyninga
cyning.
 104. Crist us generie þæt we on wynne wunian moton, seðe
leofað and rixað soðlice mid fæder and sunu and mid þam halgan gaste
a buton ænde, amen.

HomU 17.2 (Kluge G)
B3.4.17.2.
Kluge 1885, 474: De sancto Iohanne (London, British Library, MS. Cotton Vespasian D.XIV): Kluge 1885b, 475-7; corrections by Warner 1917, 146-8.



 1. Sanctus Johannes geseh ofer garseg swylc hit an land wære.
 1. Þa genam hine se ængel and gebrohte hine to neorxenewange.
 2. Neorxenewange nis naðer ne on heofene ne on eorðe.
 3. Seo boc sægð þæt Noes flod wæs feowrtig fedmen heh
ofer þa hegesta dunen þe on middenearde synden and neorxenewang is feowrtig
fedme herre þone Noes flod wæs.
 5. And hit hangeð betwonen heofone and eorðen wunderlice, swa
hit se eallwealdend gescop.
 6. And hit is eall efenlang and efenbrad.
 7. Nis þære naðer ne denne ne dune, ne þære nebyð ne
forst ne snaw ne hagel ne reign ac þær is <foreign>fons uite</foreign>, þæt is lifes
welle.
 9. Þonne kalendas Januarii inn gað þonne flowð seo welle
swa fægere and swa smoltlice and na deoppere þone mann mæig gewæten
his finger on forewarde ofer eall þæt land.
 11. And swa gelice ælce monðe ane siðe þonne se monð inn
cumð seo welle onginð flowen.
 12. And þær is se fægere wudeholt þe is genemmed
<foreign>Radionsaltus</foreign>.
 13. Þær is ælc treow swa riht swa bolt and swa heh þæt
nan eorðlic mann negeseh swa heh, ne seggen necann hwilces cynnes heo
synden.
 15. Nefealleð þær næfre leaf of, ac heo byð singrene,
wlitig and wynsum, welena unrim.
 16. Neorxenewange is upprihte on eastewearde þisse wurlde.
 17. Nis þær ne hete ne hunger, ne þær niht nefre nebyð,
ac simble dæig.
 18. Sunne þær scineð seofen siðe brihtlycor þone on
þissen earde.
 19. Þær wuneð on godes ængles unrim mid þan halgen
sawlen oðð domes dæig.
 20. Þær wuneð on an fugel fæger, Fenix gehaten.
 22. He is mycel and mære swa se mihtige hine gescop.
 23. He is hlaford ofer eall fugelcynn.
 23. Ælcere wuca ane siðe se fægere fugel hine baðeð on
þære lifes welle, and þonne flihð se fugel and gesett uppe þæt
hegeste trow ongean þære haten sunne.
 25. Þonne scinð he swa sunne leome and he gliteneð swilc he
gyldene seo.
 26. His feðeren synden ængles feðeren gelice.
 28. His breost and bile brihte scineð fægere and fage, feawe
synden swylce.
 30. Hwat, his eagene twa æðele synden swa clæne swa
cristal, and swa scire swa suneleome.
 32. His fet synden blodreade begen and se bile hwit.
 34. Hwæt, se fægre fugel flihð of his earde, seþe is
fægere Fenix gehaten.
 36. Þonne wuneð he witodlice on Egipte lande fiftene wucan
feste togædere.
 38. Þonne cumeð him to swaswa to heora kinge fageninde swyðe
eall þæt fugelcinn, fægere gegreteð ealle Fenix, writigeð and
singeð ealle abuten him, ælc on his wisen.
 42. Ealle hine herigeð.
 43. Þonne ferð þæt folc feorrene, swyðe wafigeð and
wundrigeð, wylcumigeð fenix, hal beo þu Fenix, fugele fægerest.
 46. Feorren þu come.
 47. Þu glitenest swa read gold, ealra fugela king, Fenix
gehaten.
 49. Þonne wyreceð heo of wexe and writeð Fenix and meteð
hine fægere þær se madme stant.
 51. Þonne fagenegeð þære fugeles ealle fægere and fage,
feale togædere fealleð to foten, Fenix greted.
 54. His stemne is swa briht swa beme, and his sweora swylce smete
gold, and his forebreost fægere geheowed swylce marmelstan mæres cinnes.
 58. And him on read heow rudeð on þan hrynge, goldfelle gelic
gliteneð Fenix.
 60. Þonne færð eft se fugel fægere to his earde emb
fiftene wucan and fugeles manige ealle him abuten efne ferden ufene and
nyðene and on ælce healfe oððet heo nehiget neorxenewange.
 65. Þær inn gefærð Fenix, fugele fægerest and eall
oðer fugelcinn to heora earden gewænded.
 67. Nu sæigð her Sanctus Johannes soðen worden, swa se
wyrhte cann þæt æfre binnen an þusend wintren þynceð Fenix
þæt he forealdod seo, gegadered togædere ofer eall paradis þa
deorwurðe boges and heapeð tosamne.
 70. And þurh godes mihte and þære sunne leome se heap byð
onæled.
 71. And þonne fealleð Fenix on middan þæt micele fyr and
wurð forbærned eall to duste.
 72. Þonne on þan þriddan dæge ariseð se fægere fugel
Fenix of deaðe and byð eft edgung and færð to þære lifes welle
and baðað hine þær inne.
 75. And him wexed on feðeren swa fægere swa heo æfre
fægerest wæren.
 77. Þuss he deð æfre binne þusend wintren, he hine
forbærnð and eft edgung upp ariseð.
 79. And næfð he nænne gemaca and nan mann newat, hweðer
hit is þe karlfugel þe cwenefugel but god ane.
 81. Þes halge fugel is Fenix gehaten, wlitig and wynsum, swa hine
god gescop.
 83. And þuss he sceal drigen drihtenes wille, seþe is on
heofone heh and halig, ealra kinge king.
 85. Crist us generige þæt we on wynne wunigen mote mid þam
þe leofeð and rixeð a bute ænde, amen.

HomU 18 (BlHom 1)
B3.4.18.
Morris 1874-80, Blickling Homily no. 1: Morris 1874-80, 3-13.



 1. Gecynd onwrigen, & seo syn adilegod.
 1. Ond wæs se dom oncyrred Euan ungesælignesse þæt hire
wæs togecweden, þæt heo cende on sare & on unrotnesse þa hire
bearn, Maria cende þonne Drihten on blisse; Eua cende þurh firenlust.
 5. Maria cende þone mildheortan & þone unsceþþendan
Crist on hire innoþe; Eua bær tearas on hire innoþe.
 6. Maria brohte þurh heo þone ecean gefean eallum middangearde;
Eua cende hire bearn on sare; forþon þe heo on synnum ge eacnod wæs.
 9. Se Halga Gast seow þæt clæne sæd on þone
unbesmitenan innoþ; forþon heo fæmne cende, forðon heo wæs fæmne
geeacnod; ægþer wæs wundor, ge þæt heo butan gebrosnunga wæs
geeacnod, & on þæm cnihtgebeorþre heo a clæne þurhwunode.
 13. Gabriel wæs þissa brydþinga ærendwreca.
 13. Hwæt cwæþ he to hire, oþþe hwæt gehyrde heo,
þær he cwæþ, Wes þu hal, Maria, geofena full, Drihten is mid þe.
 15. & from þisse halettunge heo wæs geeacnod; forþon
þe he hire þa ecean hælo on his tungon brohte.
 17. Deofol þonne þurh þa attor berendan næddran, mid hire
þære yfelan sceonesse & facne, beswac þone ærestan wifmon;
forþon wæs se engel sprecende to ures Drihtnes meder & þus
cwæþ, Wes þu hal, geofena ful; Drihten is mid þe.
 21. Seo geofu wæs broht for þære synne þæs ærestan
wifes.
 22. Heo wæs ful cweden næs æmetugu, forðon þe heo
wæs mid gife gefylled, & seo synn wæs adilegod.
 23. Gehyron we nu to hwylcum gemete seo arwyrþe fæmne &
seo halige, on hire cantice gefeonde and blissigende, sang & þus
cwæþ, þa hingrigendan he gefylleþ mid godum, & þa welegan he
forlæteþ on idelnesse.
 27. He cwæþ se engel to hire, Wes þu hal, Maria, geofena
ful; Drihten is mid þe, on þinre heortan & on þinum innoþe, &
eac on þinum fultome.
 29. Ac blissa þu, fæmne, forðon þe Crist of heofona
heanessum & of þæm engelicum þrymmum on þinne innoþ astigeþ;
and he hine to þon geeaþmedeþ þæt he of his þæm fæderlican
sceate þe him to meder.
 33. Þy þe he hine onfehþ, ne beluceþ he hine no; ac se
geleafa sceal beon fram eorþan up to heofonum areaht.
 34. Hwæt we nu gehyrdon þæt se heofonlica cyning ineode on
þone medmycclan innoþ þære a clænan fæmnan, þæt wæs
þæt templ þære geþungennesse & ealre clænnesse.
 37. He cwæþ se engel to hire, Wes þu gebletsod betuh eall
wifa cynn; forþon se wæstm þines innoþes is gebletsad.
 39. On þæs engles wordum wæs gehyred þæt þurh hire
beorþor sceolde beon gehæled eall wifa cynn & wera.
 41. Seo æreste modor þyses menniscan cynnes wræcwite
middangearde brohte, þa heo Godes bebodu abræc; & on þis wræcwite
aworpen wæs.
 43. Heo hæfde hire sylfre geworht þæt mæste wite &
eallum hire cynne, ge þæt wite wæs to þæs strang þæt
æghwylc man sceolde mid sare on þas world cuman, & her on sorhgum
beon, & mid sare of gewitan; ond nu þeos halige fæmne Sancta Maria
brohte eallum geleaffullum þæs bletsunga & ece hælo.
 48. Lufian hie nu forþon eall wifa cynn & wera, & hie
weorðian, wordum & dædum for.
 49. Mycel bewreah, heo onfeng on hire medmycclan bosm God Fæder
Sunu, þone ne magon befon heofon and eorþe.
 51. Lufian we urne Sceppend & hine herian æfter urum gemete,
ealle mægene, swa we gehyran magon þæt seo halige fæmne dyde, seo
hine lufode mid inneweardre heortan.
 54. & bliþe mode heo sang on þæm cantice & þus
cwæþ, Min saul mycclaþ Drihten & min gast wynsumaþ on God minum
Hælende; forðon he sceawode þa eaþmodnesse his þeowene.
 57. Of þon me eadige cwædon ealle cneorisna; forþon he me
mycel dyde se þe mihtig is, & his noma halig, ond his mildheortnes is
mycel on Israhelum, and on eallum monna cynne þe him hine ondrædað.
 61. Drihten com on middangeard mid Israhela cynne, and him eces
lifes bysene onstealde, & hie to heofona rice laþode, þurh his
wundorgeweorc & þurh þa godspellican lare.
 63. Ond hie nu his lare forhogodan, & him æfest to genaman,
and hine on rode ahengon.
 65. & he þurh his þrowunga þone ealdan gedwolan
oforswiþde, & deofles rice geneþerode on þyssum middangearde.
 67. & þær wæs Euan wop ute betyned þurh þære a
clænan fæmnan, þær is to tacne, þæt heo Maria æfter þæs
engles bletsunga & halettunga lange smeade, & swigende ðohte hwæt
seo halettung wære.
 70. Se heofonlica ærendwreca hire þa cyþde & þus
cwæþ: Ne ondræd þu þe, Maria, þu þe gemetest gife beforan Gode;
ðu cennest sunu þone þu nemnest Hælend.
 72. Mid þy þe heo gehyrde þone fruman ðæs godcundan
tuddres, þa cwæþ heo þus: Hu mæg þis þus geweorþan, forþon
þe ic nænigne wer ne ongeat?
 75. Þa cwæþ se engel to hire, Se Halga Gast cymeþ ufon on
þe, & þæs Hehstan mægen þe embseleþ, þæt bið halig
Godes Sunu genemned.
 77. Eft he cwæþ, Openige nu þin se fægresta fæþm
& se clæna, & sy þæt geteld aþened þines innoðes, &
seo onblawnes þære heofonlican onfæþmnesse sy gewindwod on þe.
 80. Ond seo gecyndelice hætu þurh þæt mægen þas
Halgan Gastes seo gestilleþ on þe, & sy þin þæt fæþmlice
hrif mid eallum fægernessum gefrætwod.
 82. Seo rædnes þære rosan lixeþ on þe, & seo
hwitnes þære lilian scineþ on þe, & mid eallum missenlicum afeddum
blostmum sy se Cristes brydbur gefrætwod.
 85. Se engel þa eft cwæþ, ondswara, þu fæmne, to hwon
yldestu middangeard to onlyhtenne?
 86. & Drihtnes engel bideþ þinre geþafunga.
 87. Hwæt þu nu gehyrdest hu hit beon mæg þæt se Halga
Gast cumeþ ufan on þe, & þæs Hehstan mægen þe ymbscineþ,
& þu cennest cyning ealra clænnessa, & þinne mægþhad no ne
gewemmest.
 90. Iu geara heofonrices duru, þe ic wæs þurh hider onsended
belocen standeþ þurh þa ærestan men, nu heo sceal þonne þurh þe
ontened beon.
 92. Eala þu eadige Maria, eall þeos gehæftworld bideþ
þinre geþafunga.
 93. Forþon þe God þe hafaþ to gisle her on middangearde
geseted, & Adames gylt þurh þe sceal beon geþingod & þæm
þe geara abolgen wæs for manna synnum, þæt he þone halgan ham
beleac.
 96. Þurh þe sceal beon se ingang eft geopenod, & þu
gehelpest þysses menniscan cynnes; forþon se heofonlica Cyning gearwaþ
þinne innoð his Suna to brydbure, & on þæm brydlocan mycelne
gefean.
 100. & he forgifeþ eall swa hwæt swa þes middangeard
ær wiþ hine æbyligða geworhte.
 101. Eala men þa leofestan, mycel wæs þes ærendwreca,
& mycel ærende brohte he; forþon his nama wæs gereht Godes
strengo.
 103. Wel þæt wæs gecweden, forþon þe se hæfde
mægen ofer ealle gesceafta þe he towearde sægde & bodode; & his
rices ongin, ne his mihte, ne his mægenþrymmes næfre gewonad ne
weorðeþ, ac hi bið aa ece.
 107. Þonne cyþeþ se godspellere þæt seo eadige fæmne
Sancta Maria forhtode, & bifigendre stefne eaðmodlice ondswarode, &
þus cwæþ: Ic eom Drihtnes þeowen, geweorþe me æfter þinum
wordum.
 110. Eala hwæt þær wæs fæger eaðmodnes gemeted on
þære a clænan fæmnan.
 111. Se engel hire sægde þæt heo sceolde modor beon hire
Scyppendes, & heo hie sylfe to ðeowene genemde.
 113. & he þa se heofonlica ærendwreca eft ham cerde on
ða uplican ricu, þonon þe he ær sended wæs.
 114. He þa Drihten on þære fæmnan brydbure, & on
þæm gerisnlican hehsetle onfeng lichoman gegyrelan to his godcundnesse.
 117. Þa wæs gesended þæt goldhord þæs
mægenþrymmes on þone bend þæs clænan innoðes; & he þa
æfter nigan monða fæce forðeode, swa se witga be þon cyþde, &
þus cwæþ: Drihten asette on sunnan his hus, & of þæm uteode swa
swa brydguma of his brydbure.
 121. Þæt wæs þonne þæt se wuldorcyning on
middangeard cwom forþ of þæm innoþe þære a clænan fæmnan,
& þa swa se hyhtenda gigant, swa Drihten on middangearde bliðe wunode
oþþæt he becom to þæm heahsetle þære rode on þæm upstige
eall ure lif he getremede.
 125. He sealde his þone readan gim, þæt wæs his þæt
halige blod, mid þon he us gedyde dælnimende þæs heofonlican rices;
ond þæt geweorþeþ on domes dæge þæt he cymeþ to demenne
cwicum & deadum.
 128. Þonne forhtiaþ ealle gesceafta, ge heofonware ge
eorþware.
 129. Gifeon we þonne on þone gemanan Godes & manna, &
on þone gemanan þæs brydguman & þære bryde, þæt is Crist
& seo halige cyrice.
 132. Arweorþian we Crist on binne asetene; forþon þe þurh
þa eaðmodnesse feowerfealdlice mid geleaffullum he gefylde þysne
middangeard.
 134. Weorþian we eac þa claþas his hades, of þæm wæs
ure gecynd geedneowod.
 135. Weorþian we Sancta Marian; forþon þe heo is us to
herianne & to eadgienne, forþon þe heo engla þreatas eadige bodedon.
 137. Swa is to lyfenne þæt englas hie georne beheoldan of
þæm dæge þe hie wiston þæt heo seo eadige Maria geeacnod wæs
of þæm Halgan Gaste.
 139. On hire wæs gefylled þætte on <foreign>Cantica Canticorum</foreign>
wæs gesungen, & þus gecweden: Salomones reste wæs mid weardum
ymbseted, þæt wæs mid syxtigum werum, þæm strengestum þe on
Israhelum wæron & anra gehwylc hæfde sweord ofer his hype for
nihtlicum ege.
 144. Eno nu hwæt wæs seo Salomones ræste elles buton se
halga innoð þære a clænan?
 145. Þone innoþ geceas & gesohte se gesibsuma cyning ure
Drihten Hælend Crist.
 146. Ac hwæt mænde þæt syxtig wera strongera þe
þær stondende wæron ymb þa reste for nihtlicum ege?
 148. Þæt wæs þonne þæt seo halige fæmne wæs
ymbseald mid þon heofonlican campweorode engla þreatas to healdenne;
forþon þe hie wiston þæt on hire eardode se heofonlica cyning, swa
þonne þa heofonlican englas sceldað & healdað ealle halige sawla on
þære se gesibsuma cyning eardað.
 153. On þissum dæge astag þæt heofonlice goldhord on
þysne ymbhwyrft fram þæm heahsetle ure Gescyppendes þæt wæs
Crist þæs lifgendan Godes Sunu, se com to wlitignesse & to weorþunge
his bryde, þæt syndon þonne ealle halige.
 157. Forðon lufian we urne Drihten mid eallum urum life, &
ofer ealle oþru þing; forðon þe he hine sylfne toþon geeaþmedde for
his ðære mycclan mildheortnesse þæt he us gesohte on þas
ælþeodignesse, & us sealde halwendne geþoht & heofonlice
bebodu.
 161. Forðon we sceolan eall ure lif on eaþmodnesse healdan,
æfter þære bysne þære halgan Godes cyningan; forþon heo ongeat
þæt se lifigenda Godes Sunu hie hæfde gesoht, þa wæs heo on eallum
þingum þe eaþmoddre.
 164. Swa heo on þæm wordum cyðde, þa heo Drihten herede,
& þus cwæþ: Gemycclige min saul Drihten.
 166. Ne herede heo hine no mid wordum anum, ac mid ealre heortan.
 167. Lufian we hine nu & his noman mycclian næs no on
gesundum þingum anum, ac eac swylce on wiðerweardum þingum, þonne ne
læteþ he us no costian ofer gemet.
 170. Gif we þurh eaþmodnesse eall aræfnaþ, þonne biþ
Drihten ure se trumesta staþol, & se selosta scyld, wið eallum deofles
costnungum.
 172. Heo cwæþ, ic eom mines Drihtnes þeowen; geweorþe me
æfter þinum wordum.
 173. Þæt wæs anrædlicu eaþmodnes þæt heo sylf hie
þeowen nemde, & hire cyðde se engel þæt heo wæs gecoren to
meder hire Scyppende; & he hire cyþde þæt heo wæs seo eadgeste
ofer eall wifa cynn.
 177. Wel þæt geras þæt heo wære eaðmod þa heo
þone eaþmodan cyning bær & ðone mildheortan, se be him sylfum
cwæþ to his þegnum, Leorniað æt me, forðon þe ic eom mildheort
& eaþmod.
 180. Wel þæt eac gedafenaþ þæt he to eorþan astige
þurh þa clænan leomu þære halgan fæmnan þæt we þe gearor
wiston þæt he is ordfruma & lareow ealre clænnesse; & we
þæs gelefað & geare witon þæt swa hwylc man swa mildheortnesse
nafað, nu biþ þær Cristes eardung ne his wunung on þære heortan.
 185. Nu þonne, men þa leofestan, gelyfan we on urne Drihten,
& hine lufian, & his bebodu healdan, þonne bið on us gefylled
þæt he sylfa cwæþ, Eadige beoþ þa clænan heortan, forþon
þe hie God geseoð.
 188. On þære gesihðe wesað ealle geleaffulle, and his
blisse ne bið nænig ende, ah hie a motan mid him gefeon, þær leofað
& rixað a buton ende on ecnesse, Amen.

END_TEXT

HomU 19 (BlHom 8)
B3.4.19.
Morris 1874-80, Blickling Homily no. 8: Morris 1874-80, 97-105.



 1. Gode & his sylfes synna geeceþ.
 1. & us is eac mycel nedþearf þæt we geþencean hu
Drihten us mid his þrowunga alesde from deofles onwalde, þa he on rode
galgan astag, & his þæt deorwyrðe blod for ure hælo ageat.
 4. Forþon we sceolan weorðian þæt halige sigetacen Cristes
rode & æfterfylgeon & biddon ure synna forgifnessa ealle ætsomne,
swa he for us ealle þrowade on ðære rode, & ealle þa saran edwita
& þa heardan þrowunga, þe he adreag æt þæm unlædan folce
Iudea, eal he þrowode þæt forðon þe he wolde us from ecum witum
generian, & us gelædon on þa ecean eadignesse.
 10. Ac hwæt is þæt þæm men sy mare þearf to
þencenne þonne embe his sauwle þearfe, & hwonne se dæg cume þe
he sceole wið þæm lichomon hine gedælon, & hwylce latteowas he
hæbbe, & hwyder he gelæded sy, þe to wite, þe to wuldre.
 14. Sweotollice we magon ongeotan þæt þa syndon heowcuðe
þe we geseon ne magon.
 16. Swa eac monegum men genihtsumað þisse worlde gestreon æt
his ende, þeah hwæþere he sceal winnan & sorgian, hwonne se dæg
cume þæt he sceole þæs ealles idel hweorfan, buton he ær hwæt
mid godum willan for Gode gedyde.
 19. Þonne is ungelic be þon ecan life, þæt mæg begeotan
ælc man þara þe her wile mid godum willan Godes bebodu healdan, & se
þe hit begyteþ þon bið ece eadignes geseald.
 22. Us is þonne nedþearf þæt we secan þone læcedom
ure sauwle; forþon þe Drihten is swiðe mildheort se us trymede &
lærde: he cwæþ, Nelle ic þæs symfullon mannes deað, ac ic wille
þæt he libbe & to Gode gecyrre.
 26. Forðon we sceolan mid ealle mod & mægene to Gode
gecyrran & don soðe bote ure yfeldæda, þonne forgifeþ us Drihten
ure synna forgifnesse & ece lif æfter þisse worolde.
 28. Eaþmodgiaþ eow sylfe under þære mihte Godes handa,
þonne genyreþ he eow of eallum deofles costungum; forðon þe Drihten
næfre ne forsyhþ þa eaþmodan heortan ne þa hnescestan.
 31. Men þa leofostan, geþenceaþ þæt ge gelomlice
winnað, & a embe þæt sorgiað þæt we urne lichoman gefyllan
& gefrætwiað; þonne gelimpeð þæt eft æfter feawum dagum
oþþe feawum gearum, þæt se ilca lichoma byð on byrgenne from wyrmum
freten & forglendred.
 36. Forþon us is myccle mare nedþearf þæt we winnon ymbe
ure saule þearfe, seo biþ ge ondweard on heofnum beforan Gode & his
englum.
 38. Ic eow halsige, cwæþ Agustinus, þæt ge gongan to
byrgenne weligra manna, þonne magon ge geseon sweotole bysene.
 40. Hie wæron welige on þyssum middangearde, & heora
wlenca wæron swiþe monigfealde on landum & on wingeardum, & heora
hordernu wæron mid monigfealdum wlencum gefylde, & heora bliss &
heora plegan wæron swiðe genihtsume.
 44. Behealdað nu georne eall þæt is from heora eagum
gewiten.
 45. Hie hæfdon manige glengas deorwyrþra hrægla.
 46. Eac swylce hie hæfdon wif & cyfesa, & heora
fyrenlustas, & wiste, & plegan, & oforgedrync, & dyslice &
unrædlice halsunga; & mislice blissa hie hæfdon on hiora gedrynce;
& heora underngereordu & æfengereordu hie mengdon togædere.
 49. Ac hwyder gewiton þa welan, & þa glengas, & þa
idlan blissa?
 50. Oþþe hwyder gewiton þa mycclan weorod þe him ymb ferdon
& stodan?
 51. & hwær syndon þa þe hie heredan, & him olyhtword
sprecan?
 52. & hwær com seo frætwodnes heora husa & seo
gesomnung þara deorwyrþra gimma, oþþe þæt unmæte gestreon
goldes & seolfres, oþþe eal se wela þe him dæghwamlice gesamnodan
ma & ma, & nystan ne ne gemdon hwonne hie þæt eall anforlætan
sceoldan?
 57. Oþþe hwær com heora snyttro & seo orþonce glaunes,
& se þe þa gebregdnan domas demde?
 58. & seo wlitignes heora ræsta & setla, oþþe seo
manigfealde licetung heora freonda, & seo myccle menigo heora þeowa,
& seo scylfring heora leohtfata þe him beforan burnon, & ealle þa
mycclan þreatas þe him mid ferdon & embþrungon?
 62. Ealle þa syndon nu from heora eagum gewitene, & ofor
þæt næfre efngemyndige hider eft ne cumaþ, ah heora lichoman
licggað on eorðan & beoþ to duste gewordne, & þæt flæsc
afulað, & wyrmum awealleþ, & neþer afloweþ, & beoþ
gewitene from eallum heora gefogum, & þær noht elles ne wunað, buton
þæt an þæt se þe gesælig bið mæg hine sylfne be þære
bysene læran, & eac þæt gyt mare is, þæt hie sceolan æfter
þæm wlencum ece edwit þrowian, buton him seo soþe hreow gefultmige.
 70. Forðon, men ða leofestan, don we soþe hreowe & bote
ure synna, þa hwile þe we on þyssum life syn; alesan we ure saule þa
hwile þe we þæt lif & þæt weorþ on urum gewealde habban, þe
læs se deaþ ær cume, & we þonne æt somne forleosan þæt
lif & þæt weorþ, & þonne syn gelædde mid urum feondum on
ece forwyrde.
 75. Ne þearf þæs nan mon wenan þæt hine oþer mon
mæge from ecum witum alesan, gif he sylf nele his synna to bote gecyrran
ær þæm ende his lifes.
 77. Forþon we sceolon nu beon gemyndige ure saula þearfe, þa
hwile þe we moton, forþon þe æghwylc man sceal on worlde geearnian
þæt him þæt god mote to ecum medum gegangan, þæt him his freond
æfter gedeþ.
 81. Se getreowa man sceal syllan his god on þa tid þe hine
sylfne selest lyste his brucan; & þæt sceal þonne beon gedon mid
swiðe godum willan þæt man Gode deþ, þonne beoð Gode ondfenge þa
god þe him mon æfter deþ; & Drihten þonne swiþe bliþlice ealle
þa god mannum geleanað mid twyfealdre mede eces lifes.
 85. Eac we magon geþencean þæt þæt hefigre is, þæt
man mid mandædum & mid synnum him sylfum geearnige edwit, þonne mon
mid godum & soþfæstum dædum geearnige him þa ecean ræste
æfter þisse worlde; þonne sceolon we singallice gemunan þone
egesfullan domes dæg, se cumeþ nu ungeara; & we þonne beoþ
standende beforan Drihtnes þrymsetle, & anra manna gehwylc sceal
forþberan swa god swa yfel swa he ær dyde, & þonne edlean onfon be
his sylfes gewyrhtum.
 93. Þonne sceolon we nu gemunan ure nydþearfe, & geneh
geþencean emb ure saula þearfe þe læs ure deaþ urum feondum to
gefean weorþe.
 95. Men, geearnian we nu þæt ure se ytmesta dæg sy engla
gefea, & us seo upplice eadignes onfo.
 97. Gecyrron we nu to Drihtnes willan; forþon he us swyþe
mildheortlice forþlaþode, & þus cwæþ, Gecyrraþ to me, þonne
gecyrre ic to eow.
 99. He þonne gecyrde to us, þa he hider becom of his Fæder
rice, & hine ungyrede þæs godcundan mægenþrymmes, & gegyrede
hine þeowlice mid þære menniscan tydernesse.
 102. Þa he geseah þæt eal manna cynn on missenlicum gedwolum
from heora Scyppende gewitene wæron, ne forseah he hie na, ac he wiste
þæt hi wæron to deaþe gearwe.
 105. Þa gelaþode he hie to ecean life, & ealre
eaðmodnesse bysene he us on þæm manigfealdum wundrum onstealde, þe he
worhte.
 107. & þa mæstan lufan & mildheortnesse he us
gecyðde, þa he lichomlicne deaþ geþrowode & eal mancyn alesde, ge
þa þe ær wæron Godes þa gecorenan geara on helle, & a on hine
gehyhtton, & his tocymes wyscton & wilnodan þæt he hie of þæm
nearwan þeostrum alesde, swylce he us eac æt his þrowunga of deofla
onwalde alesde.
 112. Nis þæt þonne nænig man þæt þurfe þone
deopan grund þæs hatan leges & þæs heardan leges gesecean, buton
þa þe heora sylfra ræd on ofergeotolnesse Godes beboda forlætað.
 115. Hwæt we nu gehyrdon of hwylcum hugu dæle secggan be
þæm eadmodnessum & mildheortnessum, & hwæþre nis nænig man
þæt asecggan mæge þa miltsa & þa lufan, þe he wið þis
mennisce cyn gecyþde; & ne bideþ he æt us nænig oþor edlean
buton þæt we urne lichoman & ure saule swa unwemme him ageofan on
domes dæg, swa he hie ær gesceop & us ætfæste.
 121. Forþon we sceolan nu beon, þa hwile þe we on þysse
worlde wuniaþ, Godes beboda swyþe gemyndige & ure saule þearfe.
 123. & on eallum tidum secggan we him þanc ealra his miltsa
& his eaðmodnessa & his geofena þe he us forgeaf, & his noman
we sceolan weorþian mid wordum & mid dædum & mid ealle mægene
him þeowian.
 126. Þonne forgifeþ he us þæt we motan to widan feore his
þa wuldorfæstan onsyne mid sibbe sceawian, swa he sylfa cwæþ, Ic eom
þysses middangeardes lif, se þe fylgeþ me ne gæþ he on þeostro, ah
he hafaþ leoht eces lifes.
 130. Þæt is þæt wuldorfæste lif þætte englas,
& heahenglas, & heahfæderas, & witgan & ealle halige on
Drihtnes onsyne wuniaþ.
 132. Þær biþ a ece gefea buton unrotnesse, & geogoþ
buton yldo.
 133. Ne biþ þær sar ne gewinn, ne nænig uneþnes, ne
sorg ne wop, ne hungor, ne þurst, ne ece yfel.
 134. Ne þær mon his feond findeð, ne his freond
forlæteþ.
 135. Ac þær wunian mot se þa stowe geseceþ, mid engla
sibbe on ecean wuldre for urum Drihtne se leofað & rixað mid God
Fæder & mid þon Halgan Gaste abuton ende, AMEN.

END_TEXT

HomU 20 (BlHom 10)
B3.4.20.
Morris 1874-80, Blickling Homily no. 10: Morris 1874-80, 107-15.



 1. Men ða leofostan, hwæt nu anra manna gehwylcne ic myngie
& lære, ge weras ge wif, ge geonge ge ealde, ge snottre ge unwise, ge
þa welegan ge þa þearfan, þæt anra gehwylc hine sylfne sceawige
& ongyte, & swa hwæt swa he on mycclum gyltum oþþe on medmycclum
gefremede, þæt he þonne hrædlice gecyrre to þam selran & to
þon soþan læcedome.
 6. Þonne magon we us God ælmihtigne mildne habban; forþon
þe Drihten wile þæt ealle men syn hale & gesunde, & to þon
soþan andgite gecyrran.
 9. Swa Dauid cwæþ, þa eaðmodan heortan & þa
forhtgendan & þa bifigendan & þa cwacigendan & þa
ondrædendan heora Scyppend, ne forhogaþ þa næfre God ne ne forsyhþ;
ah heora bena he gehyreð, þonne hie to him cleopiað & him are
biddaþ.
 13. Magon we þonne nu geseon & oncnawan & swiþe
gearelice ongeotan þæt þisses middangeardes ende swiþe neah is, &
manige frecnessa æteowde & manna wohdæda & wonessa swiþe
gemonigfealdode.
 16. & we fram dæge to oþrum geaxiað ungecyndelico witu
& ungecynelice deaþas geond þeodland to mannum cumene, & we oft
ongytaþ þæt ariseþ þeod wiþ þeode, & ungelimplico gefeoht on
wolicum dædum.
 19. & we gehyraþ oft secggan gelome worldricra manna deaþ
þe heora lif mannum leof wære, & þuhte fæger & wlitig heora
lif & wynsumlic.
 21. Swa we eac geaxiað mislice adla on manegum stowum
middangeardes, & hungras wexende.
 23. & manig yfel we geaxiaþ her on life gelomlician &
wæstmian, & nænig god awunigende & ealle worldlicu þing swiþe
synlicu; & colaþ to swiþe seo lufu þe we to urum Hælende habban
sceoldan, & þa godan weorc we anforlætaþ þe we for ure saule
hæle began sceoldan.
 27. Þas tacno þyslico syndon þe ic nu hwile big sægde be
þisse worlde earfoþnessum & fræcnessum, swa Crist sylfa his geongrum
sægde, þæt þas þing ealle geweorþan sceoldan ær þisse worlde
ende.
 31. Uton we nu efstan ealle mægene godra weorca, &
geornfulle beon Godes miltsa; nu we ongeotan magon þæt þis nealæcþ
worlde forwyrde; forþon ic myngige & manige manna gehwylcne þæt he
his agene dæda georne smeage, þæt he her on worlde for Gode rihtlice
lifge, & on gesyhþe þæs hehstan Cyninges.
 36. Syn we rummode þearfendum mannum, & earmum
ælmesgeorne, swa us God sylfa bebead þæt we soþe sibbe heoldan, &
geþwærnesse us betweonon habban.
 38. & þa men þe bearn habban læran hie þam rihtne
þeodscipe, & him tæcean lifes weg & rihtne gang to heofonum.
 40. & gif hie on ænigum dæle wolice libban heora lif, syn
hie þonne sona from heora wonessum onwende, & fram heora unrihtum
oncyrron.
 42. Þæt we þurh þæt ealle Gode lician, swa hit eallum
geleaffullum folcum beboden standeþ, næs na þam anum þe Gode sylfum
underþeodde syndon mid myclum hadum, biscopas, & cyningas, and
mæssepreostas, & heahdiaconas, ac eac soþlice hit is beboden
subdiaconum & munecum.
 47. & is eallum mannum nedþearf & nytlic þæt hie
heora fulwiht hadas wel gehealdan.
 48. Ne beo nænig man her on worldrice on his geþohte to modig,
ne on his lichoman to strang, ne niþa to georn, ne bealwes to beald, ne
bregda to full, ne inwit to leof, ne wrohtas to webgenne, ne searo to
renigenne.
 52. Ne þearf þæs nan man wenan þæt his lichama mote
oþþe mæge þa synbyrþenna on eorþscrafe gebetan.
 54. Ah he þær on moldan gemolsnaþ & þær wyrde
bideþ, hwonne se ælmihtiga God wille þisse worlde ende gewyricean, &
þonne he his byrnsweord getyhþ & þas world ealle þurhslyhþ, &
þa lichoman þurh sceoteð, & þysne middangeard tocleofeð, &
þa deadan upastandaþ, biþ þonne se flæschoma ascyred swa glæs, ne
mæg ðæs unrihtes beon awiht bedigled.
 59. Forðon we habbaþ nedþearfe þæt we to lange ne
fylgeon unwitweorcum, ac we sceolan us geearnian þa siblecan wæra Godes
& manna, & þone rihtan geleafan fæste staðelian on urum heortum
þæt he ðær wunian mæge & mote, & þær growan &
blowan.
 63. & we sceolan andettan þa soþan geleaffulnesse on urne
Drihten Hælende Crist, & on his ðone acendan Suna & on ðone
Halgan Gast, se is efnece Fæder & Sunu.
 66. & we sceolan gehyhtan on Godes þa gehalgodan cyricean
& on ða rihtgelefedan, & we sceolan gelyfan synna forlætnessa
& lichoman æristes on domos dæg.
 68. & we sceolan gelefan on þæt ece lif & on þæt
heofonlice rice þæt is gehaten eallum þe nu syndan godes wyrhtan.
 70. Þis is se rihta geleafa þe æghwylcum men gebyreð
þæt he wel gehealde & gelæste; forðon þe nan wyrhta ne mæg
god weorc wyrcean for Gode buton lufon & geleafan.
 73. & us is mycel nedþearf þæt we us sylfe geðencean
& gemunan & þonne geornost, þonne we gehyron Godes bec us beforan
reccean & rædan, & godspell secggean, & his wuldorþrymmas
mannum cyþan.
 76. Vton we þonne georne teolian þæt we æfter þon ðe
beteran syn & þe selran for ðære lare ðe we oft gehyrdon.
 78. Eala men ða leofostan, hwæt we sceolan geðencean
þæt we ne lufian to swyþe þæt þæt we forlæton sceolan, ne
þæt huru ne forlætan to swiþe þæt we ecelice habban sceolan.
 80. Geseo we nu forgeorne þæt nænig man on worlde
toðæs mycelne welan nafað, ne toðon modelico gestreon her on worlde
þæt se on medmycclum fyrste to ende ne cume, & þæt eall
forlæteð þæt him ær her on worlde wynsumlic wæs, & leofost
to agenne & to hæbbene.
 85. & se man næfre toðon leof ne bið his nehmagum &
his worldfreondum, ne heora nan hine to þæs swiþe ne lufað þæt he
sona syþþan ne sy onscungend, seoþþan se lichoma & se gast
gedælde beoþ, & þincð his neawist laþlico & unfæger.
 88. Nis þæt nan wundor; hwæt biþ hit la elles buton
flæsc seoððan se ecea dæl ofbiþ, þæt is seo sawl?
 90. Hwæt biþ la elles seo laf buton wyrma mete?
 91. Hwær beoþ þonne his welan & his wista?
 92. Hwær beoð þonne his wlencea & his anmedlan?
 92. Hwær beoþ þonne his idlan gescyrplan?
 93. Hwær beoþ ðonne þa glengeas & þa mycclan
gegyrelan þe he þone lichoman ær mid frætwode?
 95. Hwær cumaþ þonne his willan & his fyrenlustas ðe
he her on worlde beeode?
 96. Hwæt he þonne sceal mid his saule anre Gode ælmihtigum
riht agyldan, ealles þæs þe he her on worlde to wommum gefremede.
 98. Magon we nu geheran secggean be sumum welegum men &
worldricum; ahte he on þysse worlde mycelne welan & swiðe modelico
gestreon & manigfealde, & on wynsumnesse lifde.
 101. Þa gelamp him þæt his lif wearð geendod, &
færlic ende onbecom þisses lænan lifæs.
 103. Þa wæs his nehmaga sum & his worldfreonda þæt
hine swyþor lufode þonne ænig oþor man, he þa for þære
langunga & for þære geomrunga þæs oþres deaþes leng on þam
lande gewunian ne mihte.
 106. Ac he unrotmod of his cyþþe gewat & of his earde,
& on þæm lande feala wintra wunode, & him næfre seo langung ne
geteorode, ac hine swiþe gehyrde & þreade.
 108. Þa ongan hine eft langian on his cyþþe, forþon
þæt he wolde geseon eft & sceawian þa byrgenne, hwylc se wære
þe he oft ær mid wlite & mid wæstmum fægerne m geseah.
 111. Him þa tocleopodan þæs deadan ban, & þus
cwædon, Forhwon come þu hider us to sceawigenne?
 113. Nu þu miht her geseon moldan dæl & wyrmes lafe,
þær þu ær gesawe godweb mid golde gefagod.
 114. Sceawa þær nu dust & dryge ban, þær þær
þu ær gesawe æfter flæsclicre gecynde fægre leomu on to seonne.
 116. Eala þu freond & min mæg, gemyne þis & ongyt
þe sylfne, þæt þu eart nu þæt ic wæs io; & þu byst
æfter fæce þæt ic nu eom.
 118. Gemyne þis & oncnaw þæt mine welan þe ic io
hæfde syndon ealle gewitene & gedrorene, & mine herewic syndon
gebrosnode & gemolsnode.
 120. Ac onwend þe to þe sylfum & þine heortan to ræde
gecyr & geearna þæt þine bena syn Gode ælmihtigum andfenge.
 122. He þa swa geomor, & swa gnorngende, gewat from þære
dustsceawunga & hine þa onwende from ealre þisse worlde begangum, &
he ongan godes lof leornian & þæt læran, & þæt gastlice
mægen lufian; & þurh þæt geearnode him þa gife Haliges Gastes,
& eac þæs oþres saule of witum generede, & of tintregum alesde.
 127. Magon we þonne, men þa leofestan, us þis to gemyndum
habban, & þas bysene on urum heortum staþelian, þæt we ne sceolan
lufian worlde glengas to swiþe ne þysne middangeard; forþon þe þeos
world is eall forwordenlic & gedrorenlic & gebrosnodlic &
feallendlic, & þeos world is eall gewiten.
 132. Uton we þonne geornlice geþencean & oncnawan be
þyses middangeardes fruman, þa he ærest gesceapen wæs, þa wæs he
ealre fægernesse full, & he wæs blowende on him sylfum on swyþe
manigfealdre wynsumnesse, & on þa tid wæs mannum leof ofor eorþan,
& halwende & heal smyltnes wæs ofor eorþan, & sibba
genihtsumnes, & tuddres æþelnes.
 138. & þes middangeard wæs on þa tid toþon fæger
& toþon wynsumlic, þæt he teah men to him þurh his wlite &
þurh his fægernesse & wynsumnesse fram þon ælmihtegan Gode; &
þa he þus fæger wæs & þus wynsum, þa wisnode he on Cristes
haligra heortum, & is nu on urum heortum blowende swa hit gedafen is.
 143. Nu is æghwonon hream & wop, nu is heaf æghwonon,
& sibbe tolesnes, nu is æghwonon yfel & slege, & æghwonon
þes middangeard flyhþ from us mid mycelre biternesse, & we him fleondum
fylgeaþ & hine feallendne lufiaþ.
 147. Hwæt we on þam gecnawan magon þæt þeos world is
scyndende & heononweard.
 148. Uton we þonne þæs geþencean, þa hwile þe we magon
and/ moton, þæt we us georne to gode þydon.
 149. Uton urum Drihtne hyran georne, & him þancas secggan
ealra his geofena, & ealra his miltsa, & ealra his eaðmodnessa &
fremsumnessa þe he wiþ us æfre gecyþde, þæm heofonlican Cininge
þe leofað & rixaþ on worlda world aa buton ende on ecnesse, AMEN.

END_TEXT

HomU 21 (Nap 1)
B3.4.21.
Napier 1883, no. 1: Napier 1-5.



 1. Adam se æresta man wæs gesceapen on neorxnawonge and for
his sylfes synnum þanan adræfed on þas wræcworuld and on eall þa
earfeðu, þe we for his synnum and ure sylfra siððan drugon, and he ða
syððan þa gefean þæs heofonlican eðles, þe he ær sceawode,
þanonforð geseon ne mihte.
 6. Ða þa he on neorxnawonge wæs, he wæs mid heortan
clænnesse and mid heofenlicre gesyhðe eadigra engla gefera and godes word
gehyrde; ac eft, þa he hider adræfed wæs fram þæm modes leohte,
þe he mid gefylled wæs ær, he wearð myccles syððan lange
benumen.
 11. We þa syðþan of ðæs ylcan mannes flæsce on þas
wræclican woruld acende wurdon, and we ða geacsodon be þam heofonlican
eðle, and we geacsodon his geceasterwaran beon godes englas, and we geacsodon
þæra engla geferan beon þa gastas soðfæstra and fulfremedra manna.
 16. Ac flæsclice men, forðon þe hy þa ungesynelican ne
magon angytan, heo þonne tweogað, hwæþer hit soð sy, þe ne sy,
þæt hi mid lichamlicum eagum ne geseoð.
 19. Ac Adam se æresta man ne þorfte he na tweogan, þeah ðe
he ut adrifen wære of neorxnawonges gefean, and ðeah he hit ne gesawe,
þa he gemunde swaðeah þæt ylce, þæt he ær geseah, and þæt
he ær anforlet.
 22. Ac ða syððan, þa þe he gestrynde, þa hit ne
gemundan, ac þeh hy gelyfdan be his segene, þe hit ær geseah,
untweogendlicor, þonne þa heora segene eft gelyfdon, þe æfter heom
acende wæron.
 26. And syððan æghwylc fæder þeh sæde his suna, and
ðone æftran aa tweode ma, þonne þæne ærran, forðon heora
nænig þæron wæs ægþer ge mid saule ge mid lichoman, swa swa
Adam wæs.
 29. Ac we synd þam gelicost gescapene on þisse worulde, þe
sum cyning hate sum forworht wif don on carcern, and þæt sy bearneacen,
and heo þonne cenne cniht, and se þonne sy ðær afeded, oð he sy
twentigwintre oððe gyt yldra.
 34. Hwæt, he þonne naht oðres ne wat, butan þæt he
þærinne geseah.
 35. Ðeah ðe his modor him secge, þæt heo gesawe sunnan and
monan, steorran and streamas, muntas and feldas, fleotende fixas and fleogende
fugelas and yrnende hors, wyrmas and wildeor and eal, þæt we geseoð, ic
wat, þæt hine wile tweogan, hwæðer heo him soð secge.
 40. And, gyf se cniht oþerne þærinne gestryneð and
ðæm segeð, þæt he sylf ne gesawe, ac his modor him sæde,
þæt heo hit eall sylf gesawe, he þonne gyt swyðor tweod, þonne se
ærra.
 43. Hu, ne mæg se cyning þonne þæne tweon eaðe
gebetan?
 44. Onlucan þæs carcernes duru: þonne magan hy þæt eall
geseon, þæt him ær gesæd wæs.
 46. Ðæt is þonne þæm gelicost, þe we nu on carcerne
syn betynede on þisse worulde, and eft þonne se gast wyrd ut of ðam
lichoman alæd, þe he nu mid befangen is, þonne bið us gesawen,
þæt us ær gesæd wæs, þeah þe we hit nu geortrywan, forðy
þe we hit geseon ne magon.
 51. Ac ealles to lytel andgyt bið þeah on ðæs mannes
heortan, þe nele soðes gelyfan, þeh he sylf his agenum eagum eal ne
gesawe, þæt soðes is geworden.
 53. La, hwæt byð betweonan mannes and nytenes andgyte, gyf he
nat ne witan nele, butan þæt he on starað?
 55. Ac se byð wita, se ðe soð asmeað, and se ðe fela wat
þæs, þe ær wæs and æfter gewurðan sceal.
 57. And swutule eac mæg gecnawan be mistlican tacnan, se þe
wile soð witan, þæt þa habbað god lean æfter heora liffæce,
þa ðe wisdomes gymað þa hwile, þe hy libbað, and þa ðe gode
hyrað and godes lage healdað and soþes gelyfað and georne þæt
smeageað.
 62. And sylfe we gesawon þæs swutele bysene: we gesawan for
oft æt sumra þæra byrgenan, þe gode wel gecwemdan, manege gefettan
lichamlice hæle, and þær wurdan hale, þe ær wæran limmlaman,
þæs þe we sylfe wistan ful georne; blinde gefettan, þæt hy locedan
brade, and halte wurdan hale, and mistlice gebrocade hæle geforan æt
halgra manna banan.
 68. Be þam man mæg gecnawan and be ma þinga, þæt
þær syndan mihta, mærþa and myrhþa, þær ða motan wun an
æfter heora liffæce, þe godes willan wyrcað and wisdomes gymað þa
hwile, þe hy libbað.
 72. Ac þa beoð adwealde and þurh deofol beswicene, þe
þæs ne gelyfað, ac wenað, þæt se man scyle deadlice swyltan, efne
swa nyten, and syþþan ne þolian ne yrmðe ne myrhðe, ne ænig lean
habban þæs, ðe he worhte on lifes fæce þa hwile, þe he mehte.
 76. Ac soþ is, þæt ic secge: of eorþan gewurdan ærest
geworhte þa, ðe we sylfe ealle of coman, and to eorþan we scylan ealle
geweorþan and syþþan habban swa ece wite aa butan ende, swa ece blisse,
swa hwæþer we on life æror geearnedon.
 81. God ure helpe, amen.

END_TEXT
