HomU 22 (Nap 23)
B3.4.22.
Napier 1883, no. 23 (parts): 'To eallum folce': Napier 116-19.



 1. Utan gelæstan ælce geare ure sulhælmessan fiftene niht
on ufan eastran and ure geoguðe teoþunge be pentecosten and ure
eorðwæstma be emnihte oððe huru be ealra halgena mæssan, and seo
ælc heorðpening agifen be Petres mæssedæg to ðam biscopstole
ælce geare and ciricsceattas to Martinus mæssan and leohtgesceot þreowa
on geare: ærest healfpeningwurð wexes to candelmæssan and eft on
easteræfen and þriddan siðe to ealra halgena mæssan.
 9. And healde man ælces sunnandæges freolsunge fram
sæternesdæges none oð monandæges lihtincge and ælcne oðerne
mæssedæg, swa he beboden beo.
 11. Sunnandaga cypincge we forbeodað eac eornostlice and ælc
folcgemot, butan hit for mycelre nydþearfe sy.
 13. And þæt man ælc beboden fæsten healde, sy hit
ymbrenfæsten, sy hit lenctenfæsten, sy hit elles oðer fæsten, mid
ealre geornfulnesse.
 16. And to Sancta Marian mæssan ælcere and to ælces
apostoles mæssan fæsten, butan <foreign>Philippi et Jacobi</foreign> we ne beodað nan
fæsten for ðam easterlican freolse; and ælces frigedæges fæsten,
butan hit freols sy.
 20. And we forbeodað ordal and aðas freolsdagum and ymbrendagum
and lenctendagum and rihtfæstendagum and fram <foreign>aduentum domini</foreign> oð
<foreign>octabas epiphanie</foreign> and fram <foreign>septuagessima</foreign> oð fiftene niht ofer eastran.
 23. And beo on þam halgan tidan, eallswa hit riht is, eallum
cristenum mannum sib and som gemæne, and ælc sacu getwæmed.
 26. And eac we lærað, þæt cristenra manna gehwylc
understande, þæt he æfter forðsiðe butan sawulsceatte ne licge on
mynstre, ac gelæste man a þone sawelsceat æt openum pytte.
 29. We biddað for godes lufan, þæt ælc cristen man
understande georne his agene þearfe, forðam ealle we scylon ænne timan
gebidan, þonne us wære leofre, þonne eall, þæt on middanearde is,
þær we a worhtan þa hwile, þe we mihton, georne godes willan; ac
þonne we scylan habban anfeald lean þæs, þe we on life ær
geearnoden.
 35. Utan beon arfulle fæder and meder and beon on gebyrge earmum
wudewum and steopcildum and helpan georne earmum mannum, ælþeodigum and
utan cymenum.
 38. Utan hlywan ofcalene and wæfan nacode and syllan mete þam
gehingredum and drenc þam ofþyrstum.
 40. Utan frefrian ahwænede and hyrtan ormode, alysan gehæfte,
gif us to ðam gehagie; and seoce geneosian and forðferede þearfan
mildheortlice cestian and syððan bebyrian.
 43. Se ðe þus deð, he deð him sylfum micle þearfe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

HomU 23 (Nap 24)
B3.4.23.
Napier 1883, no. 24 (parts): 'To folce': Napier 122, lines 4-10.



 1. Utan don, swa us mycel þearf is, habban us a on gemynde þone
timan, þe us toweard is.
 2. Ðonne se earma lichama and seo sawel hi todælað, þonne
us forlætað ealle ure weoruldfreond and nede scylon: ne magon hy us
þonne ænige gode, ac bið æt gode anum gelang eal, hwæt we gefaran
scylon.
 6. Him symle sy lof and wuldor in ealra worulda woruld a butan
ende, amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

HomU 24 (Nap 25)
B3.4.24.
Napier 1883, no. 25 (parts): 'To folce': Napier 122-4.



 1. To folce.
 2. Leofan men, understandað ærest, hu mycel þearf is
cristenum mannum, þæt hy heora fulluhtes gescad witan, and þæt hy
rihtne geleafan cunnan and ðæne fæstrædlice healdan.
 5. Forðam nah ænig man mid rihte to fullianne hæþenne
man, gyf he ylde and andgyt hæfð, þæt he geleornian mæg, hwæt
fulluht mæne, and hwæt riht geleafa sy, ær þam byre, þe he wite
eal, hwæt hit behealde; ac syððan he bið fulluhtes wel wyrðe,
syððan he mid rihtan geleafan hit wel understandeð.
 10. Ðonne agan þa micle þearfe, þe on geogoðe gefullode
weorþað, þæt hi georne leornian, þæt hy heora fulluhtes gescad
witan, syðþan hy ða ylde and þæt andgyt habbað, þæt hy
leornian magan.
 14. Forðam se man, þe ne can þæs gescad, he ne færð
naht, butan he geleornige, þæt he cunne his cristendom witan.
 16. Ac þæt bið cristenes mannes þearf, þæt he smeage
aa ymbe cristendom georne and acsie georne, hwæt him sy to donne and hwæt
to forganne, and smeage gelome, hu þeos woruld ærest gewurde, and swa
forð, þæt he wite, hu Crist to mannum come, and eal, hwæt he on life
adreah for ure þearfe, and hu he for us deað þrowode, and hu he of
deaðe aras, and hu he to heofonum astah, and hu he þanan eft to ðam
miclum dome cymð, þe we ealle to sculon.
 24. On þam dome witodlice he eowað us his blodian sidan and his
þyrlan handa and ðæne þyrnenan helm and ða sylfan rode, þe he for
ure neode on ahangen wæs, and wile þonne anrædlice witan æt us, hu
we him þæt geleanodon, and hu we urne cristendom gehealden habban.
 29. Wel þam þonne, þe hyne wel gehealden hæfð, and wa
ðam þonne, þe his ær nolde giman, swa swa he sceolde.
 31. Ac utan don, swa us mycel þearf is, habban æfre fulne hiht
on god ælmihtigne and rihtne geleafan and lufian hine ofer ealle oþre
þincg and his wyllan wyrcan, swa we geornost magon, þonne habbað we
heofonan rice a buton ænde, amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

HomU 25 (Nap 27)
B3.4.25.
Napier 1883, no. 27: 'To eallum folce': Napier 128-30.



 1. To eallum folce.
 2. Eala leofan men, understandað, þæt soð is, hit wæs
nu fela geara, þæt on þisse þeode rixode unrihta fela, and we eac
forðam habbað fela bersta and bismra gebiden, and gif we ænige bote
gebidan sculon, þonne mote we þæs to gode earnian bet, þonne we ær
þisum didon.
 7. Forðam ær þisum wæs gehwar swicdom swiðra, þonne
wisdom, and þuhte hwilum wisost, se þe wæs swicolast and se þe
litelicost cuðe leaslice hiwian unsoð to soðe and undom deman oðrum to
hynðe.
 10. Ne bearh nu for oft gesib þam sibban þe ma, þe fremdan,
ne fæder his bearne ne hwilum bearn his agenum fæder, ne broðor
oðrum; ne ure ænig his lif ne fadode, swa swa he scolde.
 14. And þi is þisse ðeode fela hearma onsæge.
 14. Ne dohte hit ær þisum inne ne ute, ac wæs here and
hungor, bryne and blodgite on gewelhwilcan ende oft and gelome; and us stalu
and cwalu, hol and hete and ripera reaflac derede swiðe þearle, and us
unwidera for oft weoldon unwæstma.
 19. Forþam on þisum earde wæs, swa hit þincan mæg,
unrihta fela and tealte getriwða æghwar mid mannum.
 21. Fela syn forsworene and swiðe forlogene and wed eac abrocene
oft and gelome; and þæt is gesyne on þisse þeode, þæt us godes
irre hetelice on sit, gecnawe, se þe cunne.
 24. Ac uton don, swa us þearf is, beon ymbe þa bote, geswican
unrihtes and gebugan to rihte, þonne geearnige we, gif we þæt willað,
sona godes mildse.
 27. Uton helpan ure silfra þa hwile, þe we magon and motan,
þi læs we forwurðan, þonne we læst wenan.
 28. La leofan men, hwæt, we ful georne witan, þæt nu fela
geara men na ne rohton for oft, hwæt hi worhton.
 30. Ac wearð þes ðeodscipe swiðe forsingod þurh
morðdæda and þurh mandæda, þurh stala and ðurh strutunga, þurh
gitsunge and þurh gifernessa, þurh mansilena and þurh fela misdæda,
ðurh manslihtas and þurh mægslihtas, þurh hlafordswicas and þurh
searocræftas, þurh swicdomas and þurh undomas, þurh hadbricas and
ðurh æwbricas, þurh siblegera and þurh mistlice forligru.
 37. And eac syn þurh aðbricas and þurh wedbricas forloren and
forlogen ma, þonne scolde.
 39. Ac uton geswican georne unrihtes and wið god þingian, swa
we geornost magon: he us gefilste þurh his mildheortnesse, swa his willa sy,
amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

HomU 26 (Nap 29)
B3.4.26.
Napier 1883, no. 29: Napier 134-43.



 1. Her is halwendlic lar and ðearflic læwedum mannum, þe
þæt læden ne cunnon.
 3. Men ða leofestan, gehyrað, hwæt us halige bec beodað,
þæt we for godes lufan and for his ege ure lif rihtlice libban and mid
eaðmedum urum drihtne hyron and urne cristendom and ure fulluht wel healdon,
þæt ure æda beon gode gecweme, and we mid eadmedum urum scrifte ure
synna andetton and georne betan mid fæstene and mid ælmessan and mid
ciriclicre socne and mid geornfulnesse godes beboda and ure lareowa.
 10. And uton eallon mægne us scyldan wið ofermodignesse,
forðam þe hy awurpon iu englas of heofonum, and hi wurdon þærrihtes to
deoflum forsceapene.
 13. Forði is ælcum men oferþearf, þæt he him georne
wið þone leahter gebeorge, þe læs þe him beo forwyrned his sawle
reste on domes dæg.
 15. And utan don, swa us mycel þearf ys, forbugan geornlice þa
synleahtras, þe us forbodene synd, þæt is unrihthæmed and
ærætas and oferdruncennessa and idel gylp and stala and reaflac and
leasunga and mæne aþas and lyblac and ealle þa unþeawas, þe deoflu
on mancynn gebringað.
 21. We halsiað eow and beodað, þæt ge god lufian and him
eallunga gehyrsume beon, forðam us ys neod, þæt we eow rihtlice
tæcon, and eow ys oferþearf, þæt ge hit rihtlice healdon, and
þæt eow næfre se deofol to ðam beswican mote, ne þæt ge næfre
huru ne læton ænige synne ungeandet, þæra þe ge æfre geworht
hæbbon, ne sy heo næfre to ðam mycel ne to þam lytel, ne heo næfre
ne þince eow to þan hefig ne to ðan uneaðelic ne to ðam fracodlic,
þæt ge æfre læton ænig ðing ungeandett.
 30. Utan nu, leofan men, geþencan þone nacodan lichoman, þe
we on ðas woruld brohton, þæt we hine sceolon eft ealswa nacodne
alæton, butan we þe geornlicor nu us sylfe mid godum dædum bewreon þa
hwyle, þe he us þyses geswincfullan lifes geunnan wille.
 34. And uton geþencan, þæt us ys uncuð seo tid and se
dæg, þe we sceolon þas lænan woruld forlæton and to godes dome
gelædde beon, and sceolon þær ðonne mid ure sawle riht agyldan ealra
þinga gehwylces, þæs ðe we ær mid urum lichoman on uron life
gefremedon.
 39. Ðonne ne bið nan þing, þæs þe we æfre
gefremedon godes oððe yfeles, godes ælmihtiges eagum bedihlod.
 41. Forðam we biddað eow and beodað on godes naman and on his
haligra, þæt ge beorgan eow wið þone egefullan godes dom and ealle
eowre synna andetton, þæt ðe ge æfre gefremedon ofer godes willan and
of eowre sawle þearfe geworhton gewealdes oððe ungewealdes, þæt se
deofol eow nage naht on to bestelenne on þam ytemestan dæge eowres lifes
ungeandettes ne on þam egeslican domes dæge.
 49. Selre us ic mycele and ðearflicre, þæt we ure gyltas
andetton anum men her on life, þonne we sceolon eft on þam dome þrowian
sceame beforan gode on his dome and beforan eallum heofonwarum and eorðwarum
and helwarum.
 53. Ðær nan man ne mæg nænig ðing forhelan ne
bediglian, ac ðær sceal æghwylc man onfon þam rihtan dome his agenra
gewyrhta, swa godes, swa yfeles, swa he her on worulde ær geearnode, swa
wrace, swa ece wite, swa ece lif mid gode on heofonum.
 57. Uton geþencan, to hwam þa gewurdan, þe beforan us
wæron, and to hwam we gewurðan sceolon.
 59. And gyf hwylc man sy, þæt ne cunne his <foreign>pater noster</foreign> and
his credan, beo he swyðe geornlice embe, þæt he hit leornige, forðam
nan man ne mæg him sylfum rihtlice to his drihtne his þearfe geærndian,
buton he cunne <foreign>pater noster</foreign> and credan.
 64. And fæstað eower lenctenfæsten rihtlice to nones ælc
man, þe beo ofer <foreign>xii</foreign> wintre, and ða feower ymbrenu on twelf monðum,
þe eow rihtlice asette synd, and ðæra haligra martyra mæsseæfenas,
þe for Cristes lufon martyrdom þrowedon and man eallum folce to healicum
freolse byt.
 69. And we cyþað eow, þæt god ælmihtig cwæð his
agenum muðe, þæt nan man ne mot abyrgean nanes cynnes blodes, ne fugeles
ne nytenes, þe eow alyfed ys þæt flæsc to nyttienne; ælc
þæra, þe abyrgð blodes ofer godes bebod, sceal forwurðan on
ecnysse.
 73. Nu, leofan menn, uton don, swa man us bit and lærð,
geþencan, hu feallendlic and hu lænendlic and hu hreohlic þeos woruld
ys.
 76. Uton don, swa us mycel þearf ys, ondrædon us þone
micclan dom and ða micclan wita, þe þær beoð þam earmsceapenan for
heora ærdædum gegearwode; and hu egeslice and hu andryslice se healica
cyningc þær gedemeð anra gehwylcum for ærdædum; and hwylce þa
forebeacn beoð, þe Cristes cyme cyþað on eorðan.
 82. Eall eorðe bifað, and ealle duna dreosað and hreosað,
and ða beorgas bugað and myltað, and se egeslica sweg ungerydre sæs,
and ðær þonne ealra manna mod myclum bið gedrefed, and eall upheofon
bið sweart and gesworcen and swyðe geþuhsod, deorc and dimhiw and dwolma
sweart.
 87. Ðonne ahreosað ealle steorran nyðer, and seo sunne
forswyrcð sona on morgen, and se mona næfð nane lihtincge.
 89. And ðonne cumað hider adune of heofonum deað beacnigende
tacn and bregað þa earman; þonne cumað ealle engla þreatas, stiðe
astyrode standað abutan, eall engla werod ecne embtrymmað þone mæran
kyning mihte and ðrymme.
 93. Sit þonne se mæra heofonlica dema on his heahsettle helme
gewurþod; and we beoð him þonne færinga beforan brohte æghwanon
cumene to his ansyne, and ðær sceal ælc underfon dom be his dædum.
 97. Nu, leofan men, uton habban us on mycelum gemynde, hu mycel se
broga bið ætforan godes domsetle, þonne ðær stent ealra hergea
mæst heortleas and earh, amasod and amarod, mihtleas and afæred.
 100. Þonne bið gebann mycel þyder aboden, eall Adames cynn
eorðbugjendra, þe on foldan wearð æfre gefeded, oððe modor
gebær to manlican, oððe þa ðe wæron oððe woldon beon oððe
towearde geteald wæron awiht.
 104. Þær swutelað ælc cild, hwa hit formyrðrode.
 105. Þær beoð þonne ealra manna digle geþancas geopenode
on þære dægtide.
 106. Eall, þæt seo heorte hearmes geðohte oððe seo tunge
to teonan geclypode oððe mannes hand man gefremode on þystrum healum
þissere worulde: eall, þæt he forsceamode her on life, þæt he
ænigum men geypte oððe gecydde, þæt bið þonne þær eallum
open ætsomne unbehelendlice, þæt man ær her lange hæl.
 112. And eac þonne bið gefylled eall uplic lyft ætrenum
lige, færð þæt fyr ofer eall, ne byð þær nan wiðersteall; ne
nan man næfð þæra mihta, þæt ðær ænige wyrne do, þonne
se fyrena lig byrnð and braslað read and reðe and efsteð, hu he
synfullum susle gefremme.
 117. Þonne nele ne wrecenda lig and se deoflica bryne ænine
forbugan, buton he æror beo her afeormod and ðonne þyder cume þearle
aclænsod.
 119. Ðonne of fela þeodum folc ormætlice mycel hyra synnigan
breost swyðe beatað forhte mid fystum for heora synlustum.
 122. Þær beoð þonne þearfan and ðeodcyningas, earme
and eadige ealle afærede.
 123. Ðær hæfð ane lage se earma and se eadiga, forðon
hi ealle habbað ege þone mæstan.
 125. Nu we magon sylfe þus to urum lichaman sprecan: hwæt dest
þu, la flæsc, oððe hwæt drihst þu nu?
 126. Hwæt miht þu on þa tid þearfe wepan?
 127. Wa ðe nu, ðu þe þeowast ðissere worulde and her on
galnysse leofast.
 128. Hwi ne forhttast þu ðe fyrene egesan and þe sylfum
ondrætst swiðlice witu, þa drihten geo deoflum geworhte, awyrgedum
gastum, womma to leanes?
 131. Ne mæg nan eorðlic man eall areccan þa earmlican witu
and ða fulan stowa on þære grimman susle on helle.
 133. Ðær synd sorhlice tosomne gemencged se þrosmiga lig and
se þrece gycela, swiðe hat and ceald helle to middes.
 135. Hwylon þær eagan ungemetum wepað for þæs ofnes
bryne, hwylon eac þa teð for mycclum cyle manna þær gnyrrað.
 137. Ðuss atelic gewrixl þa earmsceapenan men on worulda woruld
wendað þærinne on forsworcennesse sweartes þrosmes and ðæs
weallendan pices weana to leanes.
 140. Ne byð þær nan stefn gehyred, buton stearc and heard
wop and wanung for wohdædum.
 142. Ne byð þær ansyn gesewen ænigre wihte, buton
þæra deofla, þe cwylmað þa earman.
 143. Ne byð þær aht inne, buton lig and cyle and laðlic
fulnes, ne hi mid heora nosum ne magon naht elles gestincan, buton unstenca
ormætnessa.
 146. Ðær beoð þa waniendan weleras afylde ligspiwelum
bryne on þam hellican fyre, and hi wælgrimme wyrmas slitað, and heora
ban gnagað byrnendum toðum.
 149. Ne bið þær leohtes an lytel spearca, þam earmum
ænig frofer; ne arfæstnys ne sibb ne hopa ne ænig gladung.
 151. Flyhð se frofur aweg, ne byð þær fultum nan, þæt
wið þa biteran þing gebeorh mæge gefremman.
 153. Ne byð þær ansyn gemett ænigre blisse, ac þær
bið angryslic ege and fyrhto, sarig mod and swiðlic gristbitung; þær
beoð ealle unrotnyssa, adl and yrre and æmelnys; and ðær synnige eac
sawla on lige and on blindum scræfe byrnað and yrnað.
 157. Ðonne beoð ealle agene þing þissere worlde, þæt
leof wæs ær, hit byð lað þonne, and þæt werige mod wendað
þa gyltas swyðe mid sorge and mid sare.
 160. Ac se byð gesælig and ofersælig, se ðe mid gesyntum
swylce cwyldas and witu mæg wel forbugan and ðonne mot habban heofonan
rice, þæt is hihta mæst.
 163. Þær niht ne genimð næfre þurh þystru þæs
heofonlican leohtes sciman, ne cymð þær sorh ne sar ne ænig geswinc
ne hungor ne ðurst ne hefelic slæp, ne byð þær fefor ne adl ne
færlic cwyld ne nanes liges gebrasll ne se laðlica cyle.
 167. Nis ðær hryre ne caru ne hreoge tintregu.
 168. Ne byð þær liget ne laðlic storm ne winter ne cyle ne
þunor.
 169. Ne byð þær wædl ne lyre ne deaðes gryre ne yrmð
ne angsumnys ne ænig gnornung.
 171. Ac þær is ece wuldor and wyrðmynt and ece lif betweox
heahfæderum and haligum witegum.
 173. Nu, leofan men, hwa is æfre, þæt hæbbe swa hearde
heortan, þæt he ne mæge him ondrædon þa toweardan witu?
 175. Hwæt is us la selre, þonne we ealne weg ure synna beton
and hi mid ælmessan georne alyson, forðam þe þeos woruld ateorað and
ealle þa þing, þe on hyre syndon?
 179. Sum halig man wæs gelæd on gesyhðe; þa geseah he
sume earme sawle ut fundigende of hyre lichaman, ac heo ne dorste ut gan,
forðam þe heo geseah þa awyrgedan gastas beforan hyre standan.
 182. Ða cwæð an þæra deofla to hyre: hwæt is þin
þriding?
 183. Hwi nelt ðu ut gan?
 184. Wen ys, þæt Michael se heahencgel cume mid engla
þreatum and wyle þe geniman of us.
 185. Ða andwyrde sum oðer deofol and cwæð: nese, ic wat
ealle hyre weorc, and ic wæs dæges and nihtes mid hyre and hi bewiste,
and heo a ful georne hlyste minre lare and georne fyligde.
 189. Seo earme sawul beseah uppan þone deofol and earmlice
clypode: wa me earmre, þæt ic æfre geboren sceolde wurðan, oððe
þæt ic æfre sceolde niman eardungstowe on þis fulestan and on þis
wyrstan lichaman, þe wæs a nymende earmra manna æhta on unriht.
 194. Eala þu earma lichama and wurma mete, a þu wunne æfter
eorðlicum welum, and a ðu geglengdest þe mid eorðlicum hræglum and
forgeate me.
 196. Þonne ðu wære glæd and reod and godes hiwes, þonne
wæs ic blac and swyðe unrot; þonne þu smercodest and hloge, þonne
weop ic biterlice.
 199. Eala þu earma lichama, nu þu scealt gewurðan to fulan
hræwe and wyrmum to mete; and ic mid sare and mid geomerunge sceal to helle
beon gelæd.
 202. Se lichama ongan þa swætan and mislic hiw bredan.
 203. And se deofol hludre stefne clypode and cwæð: stingað
stranglic sar on his eagan, forðam, swa hwæt swa he unrihtes geseah,
þæt wæs eall sylfwilles.
 205. Stingað hine scearplice on þone muð, forði, swa
hwæt swa hine lyste etan oððe drincan oððe on unnyt sprecan, eall he
hit aræfnode.
 208. Stingað hine mid sorhlicum sare on his heortan, forðam
þe on hyre ne wunode arfæstnys ne mildheortnys ne godes lufu.
 210. Ða deoflu feredon þa earman sawle þa to þystrum; þa
geseah heo be þam wege mycele beorhtnyssa; þa axode heo þa deoflu, þe
hi læddon, hwæt seo beorhtnys wære.
 213. Hi cwædon: ne ongytst ðu, þæt hit ys heofonan rices
gefea, þanon þu wære ær cumen to þinum lichaman, þe þu on
eorðan on wunodest?
 216. Nu ðu færst þurh þa beorhtan wegas, ac ðu næfst
þær nane wununge.
 217. Nu ðu gehyrst engla þreatas, and ðu gesihst ealra
haligra beorhtnessa, and ðu næfst þær nane gemanan.
 219. Heo ongan þa wependre stefne cweþan: wa me earmre,
þæt ic æfre middaneardes leoht geseon sceolde, and þæt ic swa
mycele beorhtnesse forlætan sceolde.
 222. Ða deoflu hi ða læddon and bescuton hi anum fyrenan
dracan innan þone muð, and he hi þærrihte forswealh and eft aspaw on
þa hatostan brynas hellewites.
 225. Uton nu, leofan men, gebeorgan us wið swilce eardungstowe
and wendon anrædlice to urum drihtne and forlætan ælc unriht and don
to gode, lochwæt we magon.
 228. And uton onettan and efstan, þæt we mid eallum haligum
mægnum magon and motan þa deoflican searwa on þisum life oferwinnan, and
þæt we on ðam toweardan life glædlice geblission mid urum ecan
drihtne.
 231. We sceolon gewilnian symle þæs ecan lifes, forðam þe
on þam life syndon gode dagas, ne swaþeah manega dagas, ac an, se ne
geendað næfre.
 234. Ðeah þe hwa wylle her on life habban gode dagas, he ne
mæg hi her findan, þeah ðe he si welig for worulde, forðan þe he
bið oððe untrum oððe hohfull, oððe his freond him ætfeallað,
oððe his feoh him ætbyrst, oððe sum oðer ungelimp on þisum life
him becymð, and þærtoeacan he him ondræt his deaðes symble.
 240. Uton wendan us to urum drihtne, he us wyle mildelice underfon,
gyf we wyllað on his naman ure synna andettan and ælces unrihtes geswican
and ure misdæde betan, swa ure scriftas us tæcon.
 243. And uton biddan urne drihten for his myclan mildheortnesse and
for ealra his halgena lufon and geearnunga, þæt he gemiltsige us
synnfullum and ure mod to his willan gestrangie and us on þisre worulde to
his willan gehealde and æfter þissere worulde reste forgyfe and us
næfre of ðisere worulde ne forlæte, ær we þurh his mildheortnesse
forgyfennesse habban ealles þæs, þe we æfre ongean his mæran
willan geworhton on worde oððe on weorce oððe on geðance.
 252. Heofonan heahcyning and ealles middaneardes alysend, gemiltsa
us synfullum, swa swa ðin milda wylla sy, and geunne us, þæt we moton
geearnian mid fæstum geleafan and mid fæstenum and mid ælmesdædum
and mid oðrum godum weorcum, þæt we moton becuman to þære ecan
reste.
 257. Ðær is ece leoht buton þystrum; nis ðær adles
granung, ac þær is geogoð butan ylde; þær is ece lif butan
ateorunge and ece gefea butan ælcum ende.
 260. Ne bið þær unrotnes æfter gefean, ac þær
ðurhwunað aa seo ece bliss; ne byð þær hungor ne þurst ne ænig
gewinn, ac þær byð seo ece rest, and haligra symbelnys þær
þurhwunað a butan ende.
 263. Uton we nu hine mid eallum mægne and mid eallum mode
lufian, þonne gearað he us æt þam dome.
 265. Si him wuldor and lof a butan ende on ecnysse, amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

HomU 27 (Nap 30)
B3.4.27.
Napier 1883, no. 30: 'Be rihtan cristendome': Napier 143-52.



 1. Be rihtan cristendome.
 2. Mycel is nydþearf cristenum mannum, þæt hi heora
cristendom rihtlice healdan and Cristes cyrican æghwar georne griðian and
friðian.
 4. Ealle we habbað ænne heofonlicne fæder, þæt is god
sylfa, and þæt we swuteliað swa oft, swa we oftost <foreign>pater noster</foreign>
singað.
 6. And ealle we habbað ane gastlice modor, seo is <foreign>ecclesia</foreign>
genamod, þæt is godes cyrice; and ða we sculon æfre lufian and
weorðian and hy gelomlice secan us sylfum to þearfe and næfre hyre
derian wordes ne weorces.
 10. Forðam ælc þæra byð godes sylfes feond, þe bið
godes cyrcena feond and ðe godes cyrcena riht wanað oððe wyrdeð,
eallswa hit awriten is: <foreign>inimicus enim Cristi efficitur omnis, qui
ecclesiasticas res usurpare iniuste conatur</foreign>.
 14. Ac utan don, swa us þearf is, utan god lufian and godes
cyrcan weorðian and werian and godes lagum fyligean and ealle ure wisan
rædlice fadian.
 17. And ðonne is ærest ræda fyrmest, þæt manna gehwylc
ofer ealle oðre ðing ænne god lufie and ænne geleafan anrædlice
hæbbe on þæne, þe us ealle ærest geworhte and mid deorwyrðum
ceape eft us gebohte.
 21. And riht is, þæt manna gehwylc oðrum beode þæt
riht, þæt he wille, þæt man him beode.
 23. And eac we agan þearfe, þæt we geornlice smeagean on
æghwylce wisan, hu we symle magan godes agene beboda rihtlicost healdan, and
eall þæt gelæstan, þæt þæt we behetan, þa we fulluht
underfengan, oððon þa, ðe æt fulluht ure forespecan wæron.
 27. Ðæt is þonne ærest þæt, þæt man behateð,
þonne man fulluhtes gyrneð, þæt man aa wile deofol ascunian and his
unlara georne forbugan and ealle his unlaga symle aweorpan and ecelice
wiðsacan ealles his gemanan.
 31. And manisiðes sona þæræfter mid rihtan geleafan
soðlice swutelað, þæt man þananforð aa wile on ænne god æfre
gelyfan and ofer ealle oðre þing hine a lufian and æfre his larum
geornlice fyligean and his agene beboda rihtlice healdan.
 35. And þonne bið þæt fulluht, swylce hit wedd sy ealra
þæra worda and ealles þæs behates, gehealde, se ðe wylle.
 38. And soð is, þæt ic secge, englas beweardiað
þananforð æfre manna gehwylcne, hu he gelæste æfter his fulluhte
þæt, þæt man behet ær, þa man fulluhtes gyrnde.
 40. Utan þæt geþencan oft and gelome and georne gelæstan
þæt, þæt we behetan, and utan word and weorc rihtlice fadian and ure
ingeðanc clænsian georne and að and wed wærlice healdan and gelome
understandan þæne myclan dom, þe we ealle to sculon, and beorgan us
georne wið þæne weallendan bryne hellewites and geearnian us þa
mærða and ða myrhða, þe god hæfð gegearwod þam, ðe his
wyllan on worulde gewyrcað, amen.
 49. Uton eac symle geþencan on urum mode, hu se eall wealdenda
drihten þurh his myclan mildheortnesse hine sylfne for ure ealra þearfe and
neode to men gehiwode on þisum middangearde þurh ða eadigan fæmnan
Sanctan Marian butan ælces weres gemanan.
 53. And hu he deað underfeng for us, and hu he us alysde fram
deoflum and fram hellewite mid his þam deorwurðan blode, and hu he nyðer
astah to helwarum and us alysde of gomum þæs ecan deaþes, and hu he
þone deofol and helle mid his weagesiðum ofþrihte.
 58. And na þæt an, þæt he us þanon alysde, ac eac
swylce he us behet þa ecan meda þæs heofonlican rices, gyf we hit
geearnian wyllað.
 60. Uton efstan nu, þæt we magon him gewrixl agyldan on swa
mycclum, swa he us gefultumian wylle, ongean ealle þa god, þe he us
forgyfen hæfð.
 63. We syndon deadlice menn and to duste sceolon on worulde
wurðan wurmum to æte; and of eorðan we sceolon eft ealle arisan on domes
dæge and drihtene sylfum ætywan ealle, þæt we ær dydon, and
beoð þonne mid urum sawlum ece symle earme oððe eadige, swa hwæðer
swa we her on worulde ær urum endedæge geearniað.
 69. Witodlice drihten sylð þam ece blisse, earmum ge eadegum,
þe hit geearnian wyllað her on life.
 71. Uton eac beorgan us wið unrihthæmed and gescyldan us wið
þa bealewan synne and wendon georne to beteran cræfte.
 73. And uton ælce ofermodignysse forfleon and unnytte word,
æfste and andan, forðam seo ofermodignys ys for gode and eac for worulde
ealra cræfta wyrst and gode laðost.
 76. Þurh ða ofermodignesse mære englas on heofonum wurdon
geo forsceapene to atelicum deoflum and besceofene on helle grund, þær hi
sceolon ecelice witu þolian, forðam þe hi forhogedon þone ecan drihten
and him sylfum þær rice mynton.
 80. Ac him se ræd ne geþeah, ac se stiðmoda cyning, drihten
ælmihtig, awearp of ðam setle þone modigan feond and of ðam wuldre eac
þæs heofonlican rices.
 83. And ealle, þa ðe mid him æt ðam ræde wæron, hi
wiston þe geornor witum besette on þære byrnendan helle, wið hwæne
hi winnon ongunnon.
 86. Uton georne lufian þa ðing, þe god lufað, and ða
lætan and ascunian, þe gode laðe synd.
 87. Uton beon eadmode and ælmesgeorne and wise on wordum and on
dædum eac and bliðum mode on halgum hige wæccan lufian and ure cyrican
secan and urum gebedum fylian.
 91. Forðam þæt halige gebed and seo hlutre lufu godes
ælmihtiges and seo ælmessylen, þe mann for godes lufon gedeð,
geglencgað and gebringað þa soðfæstan sawla on wuldre and on blisse
on þam ytemestan dæge þises woruldrices, þe se eallwealdenda drihten
on demeð æghwilcum men be his agenum gewyrhtum.
 96. We habbað geræd and geleornod on halgum bocum, þæt
swa mycel, swa ys fram heofonum to þissere eorðan, þæt seo hell ys twa
swa deop, and heo ys ealswa wid eac.
 99. Wa byð þam, þe þær bið geteohhod to and ðær
symble wunian sceal.
 101. Ðær ne byð sybbes lufu to oðrum, and nys þær
ænig man, þe þær sy gemyndig drihtenes ælmihtiges for ðam sare,
þe he on wunað.
 103. Þær beoð þa sawla forgytene fram eallum þam, ðe
hi ær cuðon on eorðan.
 104. Hit segð eac on halgum bocum, þæt an deofol arehte anum
ancran ealle helle gryras and yrmða and þara synfulra sawla tintregan and
susla.
 107. And he sæde, þæt eal þes middaneard nære þe
mare driges landes ofer þone mycelan garsecg, þonne man ænne prican
apricce on anum bradum brede.
 110. And nys þes middaneard buton swylce se seofoða dæl ofer
þone mycelan garsecg, se ðe mid his ormætnysse ealle ðas eorðan utan
emblið.
 112. And he se deofol þa gyt cwæð to þam ancran.
 113. Gyf ænig mann wære ane niht on helle and he eft wære
æfter þam of alædd, and ðeah man þone garsecg mid isene utan
ymbtynde and þone ealne gefylde mid fyres lige up oþ ðone heofones hrof
and utan embsette hine þonne ealne mid byligeon and heora æghwylc oðres
æthrinan mihte and to æghwylcum þæra byligea wære man geset and
se hæfde Samsones strengðe, se wæs ealra eorðwarena strengest, þe
ær oððe syððan æfre gewurde.
 121. And þeah man þonne gesette an brad isen þell ofer
þæs fyres hrof, and þeah hit wære eall mid mannum afylled and
ðæra æghwylc hæfde ænne hamor on handa, and þeah man bleowe mid
eallum þam byligeon and mid þam hameron beote on þæt isene þell and
se lig brastlode, ne awacode he næfre for eallum þisum, to ðam werig he
wære for þære anre nihthwile.
 128. Mycelum ys to warnigenne us eallum wið swylce eardungstowe.
 129. Þis eall se deofol asæde and arehte þam ancran.
 131. Understande, se ðe wylle, his agene neode and ðearfe.
 132. Ealle þa tungon, þe æfre clypedon and spræcon,
syððan Adam leofode se forma mann, þe Crist ærest gescop, þeah hi
gyt on þysum life wæron, and ða þe nu gyt syndon, and ða þe
towerde syndon, ær domes dæg cume, ealle hi ne mihton asecgan and
areccan, hu wa þam sawlum byð, þe on helle beon sceolon.
 137. Uton us warnian symble wið þa hellican witu and geþeodan
us to ðam uplican rice, forðam þe þær ys seo bliss and þæt
wuldor, þæt nan eorðlic mann ne can ne ne mæg mid his wordum areccan
and asecgan þa wynsumnysse and blisse þæs heofonlican lifes.
 142. Þa geongan men hopiad, þæt hi moton lange on þissere
worulde libban, ac se hopa hi bepæcð and beswicð, þonne him leofost
wære, þæt hi lybban moston.
 145. Se ealda man him mæg gewislice witod witan, þæt him se
deað genealæcð for ðære oferylde, þe him on sihð; forðam þe
he mæg oncnawan and ongytan be manegum þingum, þe him þonne deriað.
 148. Him amolsniað and adimmiað þa eagan, þe ær wæron
beorhte and gleawe on gesihðe.
 150. And seo tunge awistlað, þe ær hæfde getinge
spræce and gerade.
 151. And ða earan aslawiað, þa þe ær wæron ful swifte
and hræde to gehyrenne fægere dreamas and sangas.
 153. And þa handa awindað, þa ðe ær hæfdon ful
hwæte fingras.
 154. And þæt feax afealleð, þe ær wæs fæger on
hiwe and on fulre wæstme.
 155. And þa teð ageolwiað, þa ðe wæron ær hwite on
hiwe.
 156. And þæt oreð stincð and afulað, þe ær wæs
swete on stence.
 158. Nis ænig swa rice mann on ðisum life, þæt he ne
sceole his unþances ealle his æhta alætan and on unmyrhðe his lif
geendian.
 160. Æghwylc man, ge se rica ge se heanra, sceal þurh sar
sweltan; and ðeah hwa mihte oððe moste libban her on life fela þusend
geara, ne þincð him on þam toweardan life eft, buton swylce hwa his eage
bepriwe.
 164. Her on worlde ne mæg nan þing ece beon, forðam þe
þeos woruld nis ece; and ne þurfon we na þæs wenan, þæt ure
drihten us nelle þæra leana gemanian, þe he us her on eorðan forgyfen
hafað.
 167. Ðam þe he mycel to forlæt, myceles he wyle hine
manian.
 168. Ðeah þe þas caseras oððe rice cyningas oððe
ænige oðre wlance men him haton gewyrcan heora byrgene of marmanstane and
utan emfrætewian mid readum golde, þeahhwæðere se deað hit eal
todælð.
 172. Þonne bið sel gleng agoten, and se þrym tobrocen, and
þæt gold tosceacen, and ða gymmas toglidene, and ða lichaman
gebrosnode and to duste gewordene.
 175. Forðam nis naht þyses middaneardes wlite and ðissere
worlde wela; he ys hwilwendlic and gewitendlic, ealswa þa rican men syndon
her on worulde.
 178. Hwær syndon þa rican caseras and cynegas, þa ðe geo
gefyrn wæron?
 179. Hwær syndon þa ealdormen and ða ofermodigan and ða
rican gerefan, þe þa laga and bebodu gesetton?
 181. Hwær syndon demra domstowa?
 181. Hwær ys heora ricetere and heora prass and orgol, buton on
moldan beþeaht and on witum gecyrred?
 183. Hwær com þisse worlde wela?
 184. Hwær com þissere eorðan fægernys?
 185. Hwær comon, þa ðe swyðost æhta tyledon and oðrum
eft læfdon?
 186. Ðas hean mihta her on worulde afeallað and ahreosað and
to lore wurþað.
 187. Swa læne ys seo oferlufu eorðan gestreona; efnes hit
bið gelic rena scurum, þonne hi nyðer of heofonum swyðost dreosað and
eft raðe eall toglidað, þonne bið fæger weder and beorht sunne; swa
tealte syndon eorðan welan, swa todæleð se lichoma and seo sawul.
 192. Ðissere worulde wela wurðeþ to nahte, and ðas
eorðlican þing wurðaþ to sorge eallum þam, þe hy to swyðe
lufiað.
 194. Hit is ealra wundra mæst, þæt we syndon swa heardre
heortan, þæt we symle ne wepon and forhtian þa toweardan wita and us
þa æfre ondrædon and on gemynde habban.
 197. Nis us nan þing selre on þysum life, þonne we hreowe don
ure synna and hi mid ælmessum georne alyson her on life, þæt we ne
þurfon eft þa ecan witu þrowian and ðolian.
 200. Nis nan man swa rice on eorðan and swa mihtig and mære,
þæt he ne sceole deaðes abyrgean; and mid ure sawle anre we sceolon riht
agyldan on domes dæg.
 203. Wa byð hyre þonne earmre, gyf heo ana stent ealra godra
dæda bedæled on domes dæg beforan gode and beforan eallum his halgum.
 206. Ðær þonne beoð on us sylfum gesyne and opene ealle
þa gyltas, þe we æfre gefremedon and gedydon on þisum life ongean
godes willan, buton hi beon ær her on worulde gebette gode to willan and us
sylfum to þearfe.
 210. Ðær þonne ne mæg ænig man oðrum gehelpan, se
fæder þam suna ne se sunu þam fæder, ne seo modor þære dehter ne
seo dohtor þære meder, ne nan ne mæg oðrum; ac anra gehwylcum men
byð gedemed æfter his agenum gewyrhtum.
 214. God wyle swaþeah gemiltsian æghwylcum synfullum menn,
þe his synna her andet his scrifte and dædbetan wyle and æfre geswican
þæs unrihtes, þe he ær worhte and dyde.
 217. Eal man sceal aspiwan synna þurh abryrde andetnysse, ealswa
man deð unlybban þurh godne drenc.
 219. Ne mæg se preost ænigum synfullum men wel dædbote
tæcan, ær he gehyre his synne þe ma, þe ænig læce mæg
ænigne untrumne mann wel lacnian, ær he hæbbe þæt attor ut
aspiwen, þe him oninnan bið.
 223. Uton andettan ure synna þa hwile, þe we magon and moton,
and æfre geswican and don to gode, lochwæt we magon, þonne gebeorge we
us sylfum wid ece wite and geearniað us heofonan rice.
 226. Uton lufian cyrcsocne oft and gelome and lybban þam life,
þe ure scrift us wisige, and secan hi gelome and acsion georne, hwæt us sy
to donne.
 229. Helpe gehwa his sylfes georne þa hwile, þe he mage and
mote; gebuge ælc cristen man georne fram unrihte to rihte.
 231. Eac se ðe þurhwunað on godum dædum forð oð his
ende, he þæs sceal habban ece edlean mid Criste sylfum.
 233. Nu us ys eallum soð asæd and areht, we agon mycele
þearfe, þæt we hit eac understandon, swa ure agen þearf ys.
 235. God us ealle gestrangie and getrymme to ure agenre þearfe
and us gehealde, swa his wylla sy.
 237. God ys ealra cristenra manna fæder, and he þæt
gecydde, þa þa he asende his agen bearn Crist of heofonum, and her wearð
mann geboren þurh þæt clæne mæden Sanctan Marian, þe næfre
nahte weres gemanan, and he for eal manncynn deað þrowode and us ealle þa
ðurh his deað alysde of ðam ecan deaðe and us ealle gestrynde to þam
ecan life.
 244. Ðurh clæne mæden Crist wearð geboren, and ðurh
clæne fulluht we syndon ealle cristene gewordene; þæt we sceolon eac on
ealre clænnysse healdan, gyf we ænige miltse begytan sceolon æt gode.
 247. Crist þrowode for us synleas, þonne moton we be gewyrhtum
fela for urum synnum þrowian and ðolian and æt gode geearnian, þæt
he us for his micclan mildheortnesse huru wið ecne deað ahredde and us on
þam toweardan life reste geunne.
 252. Uton us habban symble on gemynde þone timan, þe us toweard
ys, þonne se earma lichama and seo werige sawul hi totwæmað and
todælað, þonne us forlætað ealle ure woruldfrynd, ne magon hi us
þonne ænigum gode, ac bið æt gode anum gelang eall, hwæt we
gefaran sceolon.
 257. Geþence gehwa him sylf, hu sceort and hu earmlic þis
læne lif ys.
 258. Ne yldon we na fram dæge to dæge, þæt we to gode ne
gecyrron, forðam we us nyton witod lif æt æfen ne we nyton, þonne we
to ure reste gað, hwæþer we moton eft dæges gebidan.
 261. Ne us ne þearf na twynian, þæt we gebyrian ne sceolon
oððe heofonwarena cyninge oððe hellewites deoflum æfter urum
forðsiðe.
 264. Hit ys sorhlic and earmlic eallum cristenum mannum to
gehyrenne eal, þæt man us foresegð embe Cristes þrowunge and embe his
hidercyme and embe hellewitebrogan, þæt we syndon swa heardre heortan,
þæt we ne magon ongytan þa godcundan lare, þe us man lærð and
laþað to urum drihtne fram deofles anwealde.
 270. Us ys eallum swyðe micel þearf, þæt we understandon,
þæt hit to ðam dome nu georne genealæcð, þe drihten sylf to
cymð, þonne he wyle æt us witan, hu we him geleanod habbon eall,
þæt he for us þrowode and ðolode on þisum life.
 274. We habbað oncnawen fela þæra foretacna, þe Crist sylf
foresæde, þæt cuman sceolde on ðisne middaneard; and eac he sæde
for micelne egsan, þe gyt towerd is.
 277. He sæde, þæt æfter þisum fæce gyt gewurðan
sceal swa egeslic tima, swa næfre ær nes, syððan ðeos woruld
gewearð.
 279. Utan don, swa us mycel þearf ys, lufian god ælmihtigne
and healdan his bebodu georne, þonne geearnige we us ece blisse on heofona
rice mid drihtene sylfum, se ðe leofað and rixað a butan ende on ecnesse,
amen.

HomU 28 (Nap 31)
B3.4.28.
Napier 1883, no. 31: Napier 152-3.



 1. We willað nu secgan sume bysne to þisum.
 1. An munuccild wunode mid manegum gebroðrum on Mauricius
mynstre, þæs halgan martyres, þæt is on Muntgiu, swa men farað to
Rome.
 4. Ða hæfde þæt munuccild swiðe mærlice stemne, and
his modor gecom to þam mynstre for oft and gehyrde gelome hyre leofan sunu,
hu myrge he sang mid þam munecum symle; and hyre wæs myrge on hyre mode
þurh þæt.
 8. Ða gelamp hit æt nixtan, þæt hit of life gewat to
þam heofonlican life, and heo ne gehyrde na syððan hyre leofan sunu
stemne; and heo sorhfull þa axode æt þæs mynstres abbode, hwær
hyre sunu wære, oððe hwæþer he dead wære.
 12. And he hyre andwerde: ne beo ðu hohful, la wif, þin sunu
leofað.
 14. And heo ða hopode, þæt heo gehyran sceolde hyre suna
stemne be ðam, þe he gecwæð.
 15. Ac þa ða heo ne mihte þæt munuccild gehyran, þa eode
heo eft to þam abbode sarig, and heo hine befran: for hwi ne mæg ic
gehyran mines suna stemne, gyf he soðlice leofað?
 18. Ða abæd se abbod æt þam ælmihtigan gode, þæt
hyre sunu sang swyðe hlude of heofonum, þæt seo modor gehyrde, hu myrge
he sang, and oncneow þa soðlice, þæt hyre sunu leofode mid þam
ælmihtigan gode, þam ðe he ær þeowode.
 23. Þam ys wuldor and wyrðmynt a to worulde, amen.

END_TEXT

HomU 29.1 (Nap 36)
B3.4.29.2.
Napier 1883, no. 36: 'Be mistlican gelimpan': Napier 172-5.



 1. To eallum folce.
 2. Gif hit gewyrþe, þæt on þeodscipe becume healic
ongelimp for manna gewyrtan, here oþþe huncger, manncwealm oððe
orfcwealm, bryne oþþe blodgyte oþþe ungelimplice gewyderu oþþe
færlic coþa oþþe færlic deaþ, þonne sece man a þa bote to
gode sylfum.
 6. Ealra þincga ærest gebuge man to rihte and ælc unriht
forlæte, þonne do man georne, ealswa Dauid cincg dyde, leornigendum mode
fo/ on dædbote, þa þæt folc agilt hæfde; and ealswa Niniueue,
nyman wyllan to lice and fæste swiþe ieorne.
 11. God is swiþe milde.
 11. Niniuete wæron forsingode swiþe, ah hi dydon, swa heom to
donne wæs, fæstan þry dagas on ann and þingodan iorne wiþ god, and
god ælmihtig þa heom eallum gemildsode þurh þæt strange fæstan
and be hreowsuncge, þe hi dydon.
 15. Ute don eac swa, ealswa hi dydon, swa oft swa hit neod sig,
ealswa nu is micel neod ofer eal þysne eard, þonne beode mann sona þreora
daga fæsten to berenan hlafe, to sealte and to grenan wyrtan and to
ofete/.
 19. And sece gehwa his scrift swiþe ieorne and unsceoddum fotum
georne to godes cyrcan, and ga man mid haligdome ut and mid haligwætere, and
sceote man ælmessan, be þam þe man geræde, swa æt soluh penig, swa
sylflende hlaf æt hreocendum heorþe, swa elles hwæt, swa witan þonne
to þearfe and gerædan for ealles folces neode, hwilan be mannes
teoþuncge, hwilan be mannes efenwihte, hwilan be freodmenn, hwilan an, hwilan
oþer witan sceolan rædan folce to þearfe.
 27. And mæssepreosta gehwylc do, swa hit micel þearf is, on
his mæssesancgum clipie to Criste, and ealle godes þeawas mid sealmsange
þingian iorne, and godes þearfan anrædlice gebiddan for þam, þe heom
god doþ, and þeowlincgas þa þry dagas ælces weorces beon frige wið
þam, þe hig þæt fæstan þe lustlicor fæstan, wyrcan heom sylfan
þæt, þæt hi willan.
 34. And gif hi þonne na þæt fæsten rihtlice ne healdan,
þonne þolian hi þære hide.
 36. And gif frigman swa fræc sig, þæt þæt fæsten
tobrece oþþe his ælmessan rihtlice na gelæste, swa hit gelagod sig,
bete þæt, swa se scirbisceop and eal scirwitan rihtlicost deman, swa
þæt oðre manega beon gestyrde be þam.
 40. And manna gehwilc dæle iorne godes þearfan þone sylfan
mete, þe he wolde brucan, gif him þæt fæsten swa geboden nære.
 42. And huru is mæst þearf, þæt man fram unrihte gebuge
to rihte, and na sig nan gehadod man to þam dyrstig, þæt he æfre life
ænigan men þis fæsten to abrecenne buton he si untrum; and gif hit
ænig man deþ, þonne mæig he wenan him sylfan, þæt him godes
grama fullice on becume.
 47. Uton niman us nu ealle bysne be Saule þam cinicge, þe god
hine sende into anum leodscype, and sceolde eall fordon, þæt on þam
earde wære.
 49. Þa budon his witan eallan þam folce þreora daga
fæsten, þæt hi sige mostan habban æt gode ofor heora feondan.
 51. Þa nyste na Ionaþas þæs cincges sunu, þæt hit swa
geboden wæs eallan þam folce, ah abyrigde þa on þam lande anes dropan
huniges; and þa þurh þysne gilt na mihte næfre þæt israhelisce
folc habban sige ofer heora feondan, ah wearþ feala þusenda manna ofslagen
of Saules folce þurh þisne ylcan gilt.
 57. Nu ma we ealle niman swiþe soþe bysne be þysan ylcan and
be manegan oþrum þingum, þe men noldan godes beboda healdan, swa swa hi
scoldan and swa swa heom geboden wæs fram heora lareowe, þæt feala
þusenda forwyrðaþ oft þurh anes mannes gilt.
 62. Þonne hit biþ geboden fæstan for ealles folces neode,
and sum man hit þonne tobrycþ þurh his gifernesse, þonne hæfþ eal
folc, se scyldiga and se unscyldiga, micele wræþe æt gode þurh his
ænne gilt, þe he nolde healdan þa þincg, þe heom for folces neode
geboden wæs.
 67. Ah uton we nu gecyrran to Criste mid inwerdere heortan and
heonanforþ ælces yfeles geswican and rihtlæcan us sylfe on eallan
þingan, þæs þe we don magon, and biddan god ælmihtig, þæt he
us gemiltsige æt eallum urum sennan, and þæt he us ahrædde of
þære miclan ancsumnesse, þe we oft habbað þe we nu on sindon.
 72. Drihten, hlaford Crist, alys us ealle þurh þine micelan
mildheortnesse, and þæt we motan þinne willan gewyrcan, ær we of
þisan life gewitan.
 75. Halig drihten, gemiltsie us eallan, amen.

HomU 29.2 (Nap 35)
B3.4.29.3.
Napier 1883, no. 35: 'Be mistlican gelimpan': Napier 169-72.



 1. Be mistlican gelimpan.
 2. Gyf hit geweorðe, þæt on þeodscype becume healic
ungelimp for manna gewyrhtan, here oððon hunger, bryne oððon blodgyte,
unwæstm oððon unweder, orfcwealm oþðon mancwealm þurh færlice
uncoða, þonne sece man þa bote aa to gode sylfum.
 6. Ealra þinga ærest ga man to scrifte and gebuge man to rihte
and unriht forlæte, huru heafodmen and gehadode men and ðonne do man
syððan, swa swa dyde Dauid and eac mænig oðer, geomerigendum mode
clypige man to Criste.
 10. And ealswa Niniuete, gyf man þæt geræde, gold and
glencga alecge man þa hwile, and ælce wigwæpna and idele renca and
æghwylce woruldsaca læte man stille, and nime man hæran oððon
wyllen to lice and fæste swyðe georne and ælmessan dæle.
 14. God is swyðe milde.
 14. Niniuete wæron forsyngode swyðe, ac hy dydan, swa heom
þearf wæs, gewendan to rihte fram eallum unrihte and fengan on fæsten
and ðingedan georne geomerigendum mode, and þæt mæg to bysne.
 17. Utan don eac swa, swa oft swa þæs neod sy, beode man sona
þreora daga fæsten, and hwilum læs, hwilum ma, be þam þe seo neod
sy, and sece gehwa his scrift swyðe georne and unscodum fotum georne godes
cyrican dæges and nihtes.
 21. And ga man mid reliquium ut and mid letanian, and sceote man
ælmessan, be ðam þe man þonne to þearfe geræde.
 23. Swa æt heafde þeninc, swa æt heorðe peninc, swa æt
sulhgange peninc, swa æt faldgange pening, swa gesyfledne hlaf gyf man
þæt geræde æt hreocendum heorðe, swa elles hwæt, ðinga be
ðam we witan þonne to ðearfe gerædan.
 25. Hwilum weaxgescot, hwilum flexgescot, hwilum mealtgescot,
hwilum melagescot, hwilum ælmesbæð, hwilum þearfena fotþweal and
elles ælmesgedal and hwilum be teoþunge, hwilum be mannes efenwihte,
hwilum be freotmen, hwilum be healffreon, and hwilu man, hwilum oðer witan
scylan rædan folce to þearfe.
 29. And sacerda gehwylc do, swa hit þearf is, on his
mæssesangum sona swyðe georne clypige to Criste, to æghwylcre neode man
hæfð on cyricbocum mæssan gesette, and tilige man georne mid þam and
mid halgum gebedum aa, þonne þearf sy & þæt is hwene betere,
þonne man to wiccan and to wigleran tilunge sece æt ænigre neode.
 36. And ealle godes þeowas don, swa hit neod is, mid sealmsangum
þingian georne for ealle þas þeode and æt ælcum tidsange aþenedum
limum sumne sealm singan <foreign>preces</foreign> and <foreign>collecta</foreign> and geornlice biddan are and
miltse ealre þysse þeode.
 40. And godes þearfan myngie man gelome, þæt hy eac to
Criste clypian swyðe georne and anrædlice gebiddan for ða, þe heom on
godes est ælmessan syllan.
 42. And for ealle þas þeode þingian hy georne, and ælces
mannes þeowetlingas ealle þa ðry dagas, þe þæt fæsten aboden
sy, weorces beon gefreode wið cyricsocne and wið þam, þe hy þæt
fæsten þe lustlicor gefæsten and wyrcan heom sylfum þæt, þæt
hy willan and clypian to Criste eac swyðe georne.
 47. And gyf hi þonne þæt fæsten rihtlice ne gefæstan,
þolian þære hyde, oððon hydgyldas.
 48. And gyf frigman swa fræc sy, þæt he þæt fæsten
abrece oðþon his ælmessan rihtlice ne gelæste, swa swa hit gelagod
sy, gebete þæt swa scire witan sylfe geceosan oððon þus, gyf hit
beon mæge: bonda mid þryttigan penigan, þegen mid <foreign>xxx</foreign> scillingan,
gyf man swa geræde.
 53. And, swa hwar swa þæt feoh up arise, dæle man on godes
est æghwylcne penig, and manna gehwylc dæle on godes est georne godes
þearfum þæne sylfan mete, þe he wolde brucan, gyf him þæt
fæsten swa geboden nære.
 57. And huru is mæst þearf, þæt man fram unrihte gebuge
to rihte and yfeles geswice and godes lage healde and godcundre lare gyme
swyðe georne and rihtlice gelæste eall, þæt man behate on godes est
to donne.
 61. God us gehealde, amen.

HomU 30 (Nap 38)
B3.4.30.
Napier 1883, no. 38: Napier 180.



 1. Her is git oþer wel god eaca.
 2. La leof, a is swa betere, swa cristenra manna ma geornor to
Criste sece his þearfe æt æghwilcere neode.
 4. And do gehwa mid his scriftes geþeahte georne on godes est to
gode, þæt he don mæge.
 5. And andette his sinna unforwandodlice manna gehwilc swiðe
gelomlice and bete swiðe georne, swa swa him man tæce, and ælces
unrihtes þurh godes fultum georne geswice.
 8. And clænsige his heortan gehwa fram æghwilcum niðgraman
and hetelican yrre.
 10. And, gif he hwam abulge, gebete þæt georne and girne to
godes þeowum, þæt hy him siððan <foreign>absolutionem</foreign> macigan.
 12. And þonne mæg he glædlice æfter þam gancgan to
husle him silfum to þearfe.
 13. And aa is swa betere manna gehwilcum, swa he oftor to ðam
gearwige hine silfne, forðam þe hit is ealra læcedoma selost, þe
æfre gewurde, þam, þe þæs geearniað, þæt he his afon mot him
silfum to þearfe.

HomU 32 (Nap 40)
B3.4.32.3.
Napier 1883, no. 40: 'In Die Iudicii': Napier 182-90.



 1. <foreign>In die iudicii</foreign>.
 2. Leofan men, utan don, swa us ðearf is, beon swiðe gemyndige
ure agenre þearfe and geþencan gelome, hu læne þis lif is, and hu
egeslic se dom is, þe ealle menn to scylan on þam micclan domdæge,
þonne god demeð manna gehwylcum be ærran gewyrhtan.
 6. Ðæs dæges weorc byð egesfull eallum gesceaftum, swa se
apostol cwæð: <foreign>in quo omnis creatura congemescit</foreign>.
 8. In þam dæge heofene and eorðe cwaciað and heofiað and
ealle þa ðing, þe on him syndon.
 10. And in þam dæge þa hleoðriendan ligettas
forglendriað þone blodgemengedan middaneard and þæt mancyn, þe nu
is in idelum gylpe and on synnlustum and in þam wohgestreonum goldes and
seolfres beswicen, and þæs him naht ne ondrædað, ac him orsorh
lætað/.
 15. And in þam dæge þæt earme mancynn and þæt
synfulle ofer him sylfum heofiað and wepað and waniað and hi þonne
swyðe forhtiað, forþam ðe hy ær noldon heora synna gebetan.
 18. And on þam dæge on þam fyrenan wylme sæ forhwyrfeð
and eorðe mid hyre dunum and heofonas mid heora tunglum, and eal forsyngod
mancynn þonne forswelgeð seo fyrenlust heora ærran gewyrhta, and
unrihtwise deman and gerefan and ealle þa wohgeornan woruldrican mid heora
golde and seolfre and godwebbum and eallum ungestreonum þonne
forweorðað.
 25. And in þam dæge singað þa byman of þam feower
sceatum middaneardes, and þonne ealle men arisað of deaðe; and, swa
hwæt manncynnes swa eorðe ær forswealh oððe fyr bærnde and sæ
besencte and wilde deor fræton and fugelas tobæron, ealle on þam
dæge arisad of deaðe.
 30. In þam dæge ure drihten cymð in his þam micclan
mægenþrymme mid þam <foreign>ix</foreign> endebyrdnyssum heofonwara þæt byð
mærlice and wundorlic mægenþrym, and þonne bið he þam synfullum
swiðe wrað æteowed, and þam soðfæstum he byð bliðe gesewen.
 35. And þonne þa Judeas magon swutele geseon þone, þe hi
ær ahengon and acwealdon.
 36. And se soðfæsta dema þonne demeð anra gehwylcum
æfter his agenum gewyrhtum, swa swa we leorniað on halgum gewritum:
<foreign>reddet deus unicuique secundum opera sua</foreign>; þæt is on Englisc: he forgylt
þonne anra gehwylcum æfter his agenum gewyrhtum.
 41. And in þam dæge ures drihtnes ansyn byð, swa we ær
sædon, reðe and egesfull þam synfullum gesewen, and he byð bliðe and
milde þam soðfæstum æteowed, þæt is, þam, ðe him to
ðære swiðran healfe þonne beoð gelædde.
 45. Þa fyrenfullan witodlice him beoð þonne on dæg on
þære wynstran healfe gehwyrfede, and he þonne hrædlice heom to
cwyð: farað ge awyrgedan on þæt ece fyr, þe wæs deofle geearwod
and eallum his geferum.
 49. La hwæt, þonne þam synfullum þinceð, þæt nan
wiht ne sy þæs hates ne þæs cealdes ne þæs heardes ne þæs
hnesces ne þæs wraðes ne þæs wynsumes ne þæs eaðes ne
þæs/ earfoðes ne þæs leofes ne þæs laðes, þæt hig
þonne mihte fram ures drihtnes lufan asceadan, gif hi þonne þæs
wealdan mihton.
 54. And þa ungesæligan yrmingas nellað nu þæt
geþencan ne his willan be sumon dæle wyrcan, hu hig eaðe magon.
 56. Eala hwæt, þæt is ofer eal gemet to smeagenne and to
sorgianne and on mycelre care to cweðanne, þæt ða earman synfullan
sceolon þonne sare aswæman fram ansyne ures drihtnes and ealra haligra and
fram wlite and fram wuldre heofena rices and þanon gewitan in þa ecan
tintregu helle wites.
 62. La hwæt, manna mod syndon earmlice aþystrode and adysgode
and gedwealde, þæt hi æfre sceolon lætan þæt þone
deaðberende deofol mid ungemætre costnunge hig to þan gedwellan,
þæt hy swa mycele synna fremman, swa hy nu doð, and nellað þæs
willan gewyrcan, þe hyg of eorðan lame geworhte and mid his gaste
geliffæste and him ece lif begeat.
 68. La, hwæt þence we, þæt we us ne ondrædað þone
toweardan dæg þæs micclan domes?
 70. Se is yrmða dæg and ealra earfoða dæg.
 71. In þam dæge us byð æteowed seo geopenung heofenarices
and engla þrym and helwihta hryre and eorðan forwyrd, treowleasra gewinn
and tungla gefeall, ðunorrada hlynn and se þeostra þrosm, ðæra lyfta
leoma and þæra ligetta blæst.
 75. Seo graniende gesceaft and þæra gasta gefeoht, seo
grimme/ gesyhð and seo godcunde miht, se hata scur and helwara hream,
þæra beorha geberst and þæra bymena sang.
 78. Se brada bryne ofer ealle woruld and se bitera dæg, se micla
cwealm and þæra manna man, seo sare sorh and þæra sawla gedal, se
sara sið and se sorhfulla dæg, þæt brade bealo and se byrnenda grund,
þæt bitere wite and se blodiga stream, feonda fyrhto and se fyrena ren,
hæðenra granung and reafera wanung.
 84. Heofonwara fulmægen and heora hlafordes þrym, þæt
ongrislice gemot and seo egesfulle fyrd, se reða wealdend and se rihta dom,
ure fyrena edwit and þæra feonda gestal, þa blacan andwlitan and
þæt bifiende wered, se forhta cearm and þæra folca wop, þæra
feonda grimnes and se hluda heof, þæt sarige mancynn and se synniga
heap.
 90. Seo graniende neowelnys and seo forglendrede hell, þæra
wyrma ongrype and þæra sorhwita mæst, se niðfulla here and se
teonfulla dæg.
 92. On þam dæge us byð eall þyllic egsa æteowed, and
þa synfullan þonne woldon geswican georne, gif hig mihton; and him þonne
wære leofre, þonne eall middaneard to æhte geseald, þæt hy
næfre acennede ne wæron fram fæder and meder.
 96. La hwæt, we nu ungesælige syndon, þæt we us bet ne
warniað, and þæt we ne ondrædað us þe swyðor, þe we
dæghwamlice geseoð beforan urum eagum ure þa nehstan feallan and
sweltan.
 100. And þonne sona þam lichaman bið laðlic legerbed
gegyrwed, and in þære cealdan foldan gebrosnað, and þæt lic
þær to fulnesse weorðeð and þam wælslitendum wyrmum weorðeð
to æte.
 103. Þonne bið sorhlic sar and earmlic gedal lices and sawle.
 104. And, gif þonne seo sawl huru slidan sceal in þa ecan wita
mid þam werian and awyrgedan gaste and þar þonne mid deoflum drohtnoð
habban in morðre and on mane, in susle and on sare, in wean and on
wyrmslitum betweonan deadum and deoflum, in bryne and on biternesse, in
bealewe and on bradum ligge, in yrmþum and on earfeðum.
 110. On swyltcwale and in sarum sorgum, in fyrenum bryne and on
fulnesse, in toða gristbitung and in tintregum, in angmodnysse earmra sawla,
on cyle and on wanunge, in hungre and in þurste, on hæte and in
earfoðnesse, in neowlum attre and in ecere forwyrde, in arleasnysse and in
mislicum wita cynne, on muðe and on fæðme þæs deaðberendan
dracan, þe is deofol genemned.
 117. Eala leofan menn, utan warnian us swiðe and georne beorhgan
wið þone egsan, and utan geornlice yfeles geswican and þurh godes fultum
to gode gedon þone dæl, þe we don magon.
 120. Uton man and morðor æghwar forbugan and ealle
fracoddæda swiðe ascunian.
 121. And utan don, swa ic lære, uton god lufian inwerdre
heortan, eallum mode and eallum mægne and godes lage healdan; and uton
gecnawan, hu læne and hu lyðre þis lif is on to getruwianne, and hu oft
hit wurð raðost forloren and forlæten, þonne hit wære leofost
gehealden.
 126. Ðeos woruld is sorhful and fram dæge to dæge a swa
leng swa wyrse, forþam ðe heo is on ofstum, and hit nealæcð þam
ende, and þi heo wære wurðe, þæt hig ænig man ne lufode ealles
to swiðe ac lufian we georne þæne hehstan cyning and þæt upplice
rice, and ondrædon we us symle þæne toweardan dom, þe we ealle to
sceolon.
 132. On þam dome ure drihten sylf eowað us sona his blodigan
sidan and his þyrlan handa and þa sylfan rode, þe he on ahangen wæs,
and wyle þonne æt us witan, hu we him þæt geleanedon.
 136. Wel þam þonne, þe gode ær gecwemdon, swa swa hi
sceoldon; hi þonne syððan eac ece edlean þurh godes gyfe þanonforð
habbað betweoh englum and heahenglum aa to worulde on heofena rice, ðar
næfre leofe ne todælað ne laðe ne gemetað, ac þar halige heapas
symle wuniað on wlite and on wuldre and on wynsumnesse æfre.
 142. Þar byð mærð and myrhð and ece blis mid gode sylfum
and mid his halgum in ealra worulda woruld a butan ende, amen.

END_TEXT

HomU 33 (Nap 41)
B3.4.33.
Napier 1883, no. 41: 'Verba Ezechiel prophete de pigris aut timidis vel neglegentibus pastoribus': Napier 191, lines 20-23.



 1. Ne dear ic nu for godes ege soðes gesweogian, ac licige, swa
hit licige, soð ic wille secgan, gime, se þe wille, forðam se bydel, þe
forsweogað his hlafordes gewilboda, a he mæg him wenan hetelices leanes.
