HomU 34 (Nap 42)
B3.4.34.
Napier 1883, no. 42: 'De temporibus Anticristi': Napier 191-205.



 1. <foreign>De temporibus Anticirsti</foreign>.
 2. Leofan men, us is micel þearf, þæt we wære beon
þæs egeslican timan, þe nu towærd is.
 3. Nu bið swyðe raðe Antecristes tima, þæs ðe we wenan
magan and eac georne witan, and þæt bið se egeslicesta, þe æfre
gewearð, syððan þeos woruld ærest gesceapen wæs.
 6. Be þam egeslican timan Matheus se godspellere soðlice þus
cwæð: <foreign>in diebus illis erit tribulatio talis, qualis non fuit ab initio
mundi nec postea erit</foreign>; ðæt is on englisc, þæt swylc yrmð and
earfoðnesse bið þonne on worulde, swylce næfre ær næs ne eft ne
geweorðeð.
 11. He bið sylf deofol and þeh mennisc man geboren.
 12. Crist is soð God and soð man, and Antecrist bið soðlice
deofol and man.
 14. Se sylfa deofol, þe on helle is, se wyrð on þam
earmsceapenan men Antecriste and bið soðlice ægðer ge deoful ge man.
 16. Nu mage we eow eac secgan be þæs deofles anginne, hu he
geboren bið and afedd, swa swa we on halgum bocum funden habbað; and us
halige men, þe beforan us wæron, oft rædlice on heora gewritum
myngiað and sæcgað, þæt Antecrist sceal beon acenned of Iudeiscum
cynne and of Danes mægðe.
 21. Swa swa seo witegung sægð: <foreign>fiat Dan coluber in uia,
cerastes in semita</foreign>, þæt is on englisc: sy Dan snaca on wege and
næddre on pæðe.
 24. Þæt is þonne swa to understandenne, þæt, swa swa
seo atterberende nædre ligeð on ðam wege and wyle þa wegfarendan mid
hire ættrigum toðum slitan oððe þeahhwæðere þa ungehyrtan of
heora wege aflyman, swa þonne Antecrist, þonne he cymð, he wile ealle
ða men, þe to gode willað, oðer twegra oððe mid lotwrencum fram
gode awendan oððe mid mislicum tintregum hy earmlice acwellan.
 31. He bið acenned of fæder and of meder flæsclicum
gemanan, swa swa oðre men, and na, swa lease men sæcgað, þæt he beo
acenned of mædene anum.
 34. Ac he bið mid synnum begyten and mid synnum acenned and eall
on synnum afedd.
 35. His fæder hine strynð be his agenre freodehter, and he
bið his moder twam sibbum getæht, þæt he bið ægðer ge sunu ge
broðer.
 38. Soðlice, þonne he gestryned bið, þonne færð se
deofol forð mid into his moder innoðe, and þær he hine healt and
weardað inne.
 40. And æfre fram þam timan, þe he gestryned bið, a he
bið mid him and hine næfre ne forlæt.
 42. And, ealswa se halga gast com to Sancta Marian ures hælendes
Cristes moder and hy mid his mihte ofersceadewade and mid godcundnysse gefylde,
swa þæt heo sceolde geeacnian of þam halgan gaste and, þæt heo
acende, wære godcund and halig, swa se deofol befylð into Antecristes
moder innoðe and hy eall ymbutan ymbtrymð mid deoflicre mihte, and swa him
sylfum he hi geahnað, þæt deofle samod wyrcendum heo þurh man
geeacnoð on innoðe.
 50. And þæt, þe bið of hire acenned, eall hit bið
unrihtwis and eall yfel and eal forloren.
 52. Ðanan is se deofles man gehaten forwyrdes bearn, forðan swa
mycel/, swa he mæst mæg, he forspilð mancynnes, and he sylf æt
endenyhstan mid ealle forwyrð.
 54. Nu ge gehyrdon, hu he bið geboren; hlystað nu, and ic eow
secge þære stowe naman, þe he bið on geboren.
 56. Swa swa drihten ure alysend foresceawode him þæt castel
þa cynelican Bethleem, to ðan þæt he wolde þær on þære
byrig menniscnesse underfon and to ðan hine sylfne gemedemian, þæt he
wolde þær beon geboren soð man, se ðe is æfre soð god and æfre
bið ungeendod, swa se deofol þam forlorenum men, þe Antecrist is gehaten,
foresceawað gelimplice stowe, þe he on sceal beon geboren.
 64. Þære stowe nama is Babilonia genemned.
 64. Þæt is seo burh, þe ælc yfel of cymð, and ordfruma
and ende ealles yfeles on hire bið upp asprungen.
 66. On þyssere byrig Babilonia, þe hwilon wæs æþelost
and wuldorfullost burh ealra burha and Persa rices heafod, bið Antecrist
geboren.
 69. And on ðam twam burhum Bethsaida and Corozaim, hit sægð,
þæt he bið afedd, and þær he wunað ærest.
 71. Þa burha ðreade Crist mid his halgan muðe, þa þa he
þus cwæð: <foreign>ue tibi Bethsaida, ue tibi Corozaim</foreign>; þæt is on englisc:
wa ðe, la wa, Bethsaida, and wa ðe, Corozaim.
 74. Antecrist hæfð mid him drymen and unlybwyrhtan and
wigleras and þa, ðe cunnan galder agalan, þa ðe hine mid deofles
fultume fedað and lærað on ælcre unrihtwisnesse and facne and
manfullum cræfte.
 78. And awyrgede gastas beoð his latteowas and his geferan butan
ælcere totwæmednesse.
 79. Ðonne færð he to Hierusalem þære burh mid miclum
þrymme to ðan, þæt he wile eall cristen folc to him gebigan mid his
lotwrencum and fram rihtum geleafan awendan, gif he mæg.
 82. And gif he þonne þæt ne mæg, þonne onginð he hy
to pinianne on mistlicre wisan and eac fela ofslyhð haligra manna, forðam
þe hi nellað gebugan fram þam soðan gode to him.
 86. He geedstaðelað niwe tempel, þær þær Salomon se
mæra cyng hæfde ær aræred þæt mære tempel þam
ælmihtigum gode to lofe; and þærinne he gesit and hine sylfne swa up
ahefð, þæt he cwyð, þæt he sy þæs ælmihtigan godes sunu.
 90. And æfter Moyses lage he hine læt ymbsniðan mid
scearpum flinte; and forþan he deð þæt, þæt he wile, þæt
þa earman iudeiscan men scylan wenan, þæt he sy soð Crist, forðam
he swa eadmodlice heora lage gefylð on ða wisan.
 94. He awent ærest him to cyningas and þa heafodmen, and
syððan he gebigð þurh heora ege and fultum eall mæst þæt oðer
folc to him.
 97. Ealle þa stowa, þe se soða Crist lufode and oftost on
wunode, þa he towyrpð, and þa him beoð laðoste, forðan þe he wile
amyrran mid his gedwylde eall, þæt se soða Crist ær bodade and
gesette to rihte.
 100. Syððan he þus up ahafen bið, he sent his bodan geond
ealne middaneard, and his hlisa and gryremiht and bodung bið fram sæ to
sæ; þæt is, of eastdæle to westdæle and fram suððæle to
norðdæle middaneardes.
 104. He wyrcð eac þurh deofol fela tacna and wundorlice wundra
and laðlice, swylce swa næfre ær ne gehyrede wurdon ne gesawene.
 107. He deð, þæt fyr cymð færlice ufan, swylce hit of
heofonum cume, and egeslice forswælð fela þinga on eorðan.
 109. And treowa he deð færlice blowan and eft raðe
asearian.
 110. And sæ he deð on lytelre hwile beon ungemetlice and
ungecyndelice swyðe astyrode, and þærrihte eft sona smylte.
 112. And mistlice gesceafta he awent of heora gecyndum: wæter he
deð, þæt yrnð ongean stream.
 114. Þas lyfta and windas he astyrað to ðan swiðe, þæt
mannum þincð heora deað leofra, þonne ðone egesan to gehyranne.
 116. Deade men he arærð on manna gesihðe, to ðan þæt
he wyle on dwolan gebringan, gif hit swa beon mihte, þa þe gode gecorene
wæron, sona swa hy geborene wæron.
 119. Ðonne tweonað fela manna, ge furðon ðam godes
gecorenum, for ðam micclum and mænigfealdum gedwyldum, þe hi geseoð
and gehyrað, hwæðer he sy se soða godes sunu oððe na ne sy, se
ðe mannum behaten wæs on þyssere worulde ende, þæt he of clænum
mædene sceolde beon geboren.
 124. Ac men magon oncnawan be his unrihtwisum larum and dædum,
þæt he ne bið na soð god.
 126. He winð ongean godes gecorenan on þreo wisan, þæt is
mid ofermætum ege and mid swæslicum gifum and mid gedwyldlicum
scincræftum.
 128. He sylð þam, þe on hine gelyfað, goldes and seolfres
genyhða/.
 130. And þa, þe he ne mæg to him gebigean mid golde ne mid
seolfre ne mid godwebgyrlum, þa he wyle mid egeslican ogan mid ealle
oferswiðan.
 132. And þa, þe he ne mæg naðer ne mid lufe ne mid ege
fram gode awendan, ætforan þam he wyrcð mænigfealde wundra, þæt
he þurh þær hy to gedwolan awende.
 135. Ða þonne, þe he ne mæg on nane wisan fram rihtan
geleafan to him gebigan, þonne tintregað he þa on mænigfealde wisan.
 137. And ælcne geleaffulne man he genyt, þe he geaxian mæg,
þæt he sceal him abugan oððe earmlice deað þrowian þurh sweordes
slege oððe fyres bryne oððe wyrma slite oððe wildeora bite oððe
þurh unasecgendlice yrmða earmlice þrowian.
 142. Ðonne bið swylc yrmð and earfoðnes, swylc swa næfre
ær næs, syððan men ærest geborene wæron, oð ðone timan.
 144. Feorðehealf gear se deofles man rixað on middanearde, and
swa lange he winð ongean god and godes þeowas; and he ahefð hine sylfne
ofer ealle, þa ðe hæðene men cwædon, þæt godas beon sceoldan
on hæðene wisan; swylc swa wæs Erculus se ent and Apollinis, þe hi
mærne god leton; þor eac and Owðen, þe hæðene men heriað
swiðe.
 150. Ofer ealle þas he hine ænne up ahefð, forðan he
læt, þæt he ana sy strengra, þonne hi ealle.
 152. And na þæt an, þæt he hine ofer hi ealle ahebbe, ac
ofer þa halgan þrynnesse, seo ðe is ana to to gebiddanne, to herianne and
to weorðianne; þæt is fæder and sunu and halig gast, an ælmihtig
ece god, wyrhta and wealdend ealra worulda.
 156. Swa þæt he sit, swa we ær cwædon, on godes temple
æteowiende hine, swylce he god sylf sy, se ðe Iudeum gefyrn wæs
behaten.
 159. Ðonne se deofol þus wett, þonne asendeð god twegen
mære witegan to middanearde, þa syndon gehatene Enoch and Elias, ðe god
hæfde gehealden fela hund wintra, to þan þæt hy scylon þonne mid
heora lare mancynne gebeorgan, þæt hit eall ne forwurðe endemes
togædere.
 164. Ðas mæran godes men Enoh and Elias gestrangiað þa
geleaffullan godes þeowas mid godcundlicum wæpnum togeanes þæs
deofles wrencum.
 166. And hy hi mynegiað and lærað and mid stiðum mode
stranglice wiðstandað þam swican Antecriste, swa þæt hy gehwyrfað
þone mæstan dæl Israhela folces to rihtum geleafan, þa þe lange
ær ungeleaffulle wunedon, forðan hi oncnawað þonne, þæt hy
wæron to sare beswicene þurh ðæs sweartan deofles scincræft.
 172. Ðonne bið gefylled, þæt þe be heom gefyrn awriten
wæs: <foreign>si fuerit numerus filiorum Israhel, sicut arena maris, reliquie salue
fient</foreign>; ðæt is, þeah ðe israhelitisc folc beo swa mænigfyld, swa
swa sandcysel, þe lið on sæstrande, þæt þe þonne to lafe bið,
hit bið gehealden.
 177. Þonne se feond Antecrist þis gesihð, þæt þæt
iudeisce mancyn fram him gebuhð and to ðam soðan gode gehwyrfð, þe
heora yldran ær ahengan be þæs ealdan deofles lare, ðonne gramað
him þæt swyðe hearde.
 181. And eac he wat, þæt fela manna witan full geare,
þæt he is deofles bearn and na godes sunu, þeah ðe hi fela ne durran
him fram hwyrfan and for ðara tintregena mænigfyldnesse, þe hi
geseoð, hu he ða godes gecorenan dæghwamlice tintregað.
 185. Ðonne onginð he to pinianne togenes þam twam godes
þegnum Enoh and Eliam, and hy æt nyhstan ofslihð, swa swa godes
geþafung bið, and heora lichaman licgað unbebyrgede, and þam þriddan
dæge hi arisað of deaðe and to heofonum up astigað eall ansunde.
 190. Þonne mæg heora wiðerwinnan sceamian, þonne hi hi
geseoð mid sigores wuldre to heofonum astigan.
 192. Be þam awrat Iohannes se godspellere on ðære bec, þe
man hat apocalipsin, þus cweðende: locahwonne þara godes þegna Enoh and
Elias tima cumen bið, þæt heora bodung geendod bið, þæt wilde
deor, þa of ðære neowelnesse up cymð, feohteð togeanes heom and
æt nyhstan oferswyð hy and ofslyhð hy.
 198. Þæt wilde deor getacnað þone deofles man Antecrist,
and, syððan hi ofslagene beoð, he bið ehtende ealra godes þeowena,
swa þæt hy to him gebugan scylon oððe earmlice deað for godes naman
þrowian.
 201. He onginð deoflice to wedanne dæges and nihtes, swa swa
se deð, þe wat, þæt he mot lytle hwile rixian.
 203. He forbyt ælcum men aðor to bycganne oððe to
syllanne, butan he on his foranheafde habbe his mearce.
 205. Ðonne his lease witegan, þe beoð mid deofles gaste
afylde, arærað him anlicnesse, and þærto hi genydað men to
gebiddanne, forðan se deofol sylf sprecð þurh ða deadan anlicnesse.
 209. And, þonne he þus wett, þonne cumað up of helle
egeslice mycele deor, swylce swa næfre ær gesawene næron oð ðone
timan.
 211. Hi beoð gewæpnode on ða wisan, þe man hors
gewæpnað, þonne man to wige þencð.
 212. Hi habbað on heafde helmas steape, and heora breosta beoð
mid byrnum befangene.
 214. Heora heafda beoð mannes heafdum gelice, and hi habbað
tæglas þam wyrmum gelice, þe men hatað þrowend.
 216. Heora fyðera swegað, swa swa wæteres dyne, and hy
habbað teð leonum gelice.
 217. Hi fleoð swiftlice, and heora grymetung bið gelic
crætena cearcetunge.
 219. And hy feriað þone awyrgedan engel on hrycge, þone men
awestend hatað; hi farað ofer ealne middaneard fif monðas fulle.
 221. And he asent geond middaneard ridendne here, to ðan þæt
hy scylon þriddan dæl mancynnes ofslean, þæt syndon þonne twentig
þusend siðan tyn þusenda.
 224. Heora horsa heafda beoð leona heafdum gelice, and heora
tæglas beoð nædrena heafdum gelice, and fyr and swefl and deaðberende
smic gæð of heora muðe.
 227. Ðonne æfter þan gegaderað se godes wiðersaca ealle
þeoda to gefeohte ongean þone heofonlican cyning on ðære stowe, þe
man hat Ermagedon, ac hy weorðað ealle mid uplicum fyre forbærnde.
 230. And godes ælmihtiges grama becymð ofer þæs deofles
bearn Antecrist æt nyhstan, swa swa se apostol Paulus awrat be him þus
cweðende: <foreign>quem dominus Iesus interficiet spiritu oris sui</foreign>; þæt is on
englisc, þæt drihten hælend ofslihð hine mid his worde.
 235. Swa hweðer swa he bið ofslagen þurh miht ures drihtnes
agenes bebodes oððe Michael godes heahengel hine ofslea, þurh ðæs
lifigendan godes miht he bið ofslagen and na þurh nanes engles mihte.
 239. Bec sæcgað, þæt se godes wiðersaca Antecrist bið
ofslagen on Oliuetes dune innan his getelde upon his heahsetle wið þa ylcan
stowe, þe ure drihten hælend Crist astah up to heofonum to his halgan
fæder eallum þam geleaffullum mannum, þe ðær neah wæron, on
lociendum.
 244. And rihtlic bið, þæt se godes wiðersaca Antecrist
fealle niðer into helle to ðam ealdan deofle his fæder fram þære
stowe, þe he swa modiglice mid woge him geahnode, forðan Crist godes sunu
astah ær þanon up to heofonum to his halgan fæder.
 248. Eow is eac to witanne, þæt domes dæg ne bið na sona
æfter Antecristes forwyrde, ne eac drihten ne cymð þonne gyt eallum
mancynne/ to demanne, ac æfter Danieles witegunge he sylð mannum fyrst to
gebetanne and heora synna to behreowsianne, þe ær þurh þæs deofles
lare bepæhte wæron, þæt hi god forsawon and þam wiðersacan
olehtan; þæt secgað bec, þæt sy <foreign>xl</foreign> daga fyrst.
 255. And raðe æfter þam, þæs ðe bec sæcgað,
geweorð se micla dom, and þeos woruld geendað.
 257. We agan þy swyðe micle þearfe, þæt we wið swylcne
ege wære beon and eac ða warnian, þe swylc nyton, swylc toward is,
forðam þe hit is nyr þam timan, þonne ungelærede men gelyfan
wyllað/.
 260. Eac ic sæcge to soðe, þæt deofol wile ælces
mannes geþanc, gif he mæg, swyðe gelettan, þæt he hit na ne
understande, þeh hit him man secge, ne hine wið þæt ne warnige.
 264. And þurh þæt wyrð mæst manna beswicen, þe hi ne
beoð swa wære ne swa wel gewarnode ær, swa swa hi beþorfton.
 266. La hwæt, we nu ungesælige syn, þæt we us bet ne
warniað wið þone egsan, þe toweard is, and þæt we us ne
ondrædað þone toweardan dæg þæs miclan domes.
 269. Se is yrmða dæg and ealra earfoða dæg.
 270. And we geseoð and gelomlice gecnawað be ðam tacnum, þe
Crist sylf foresæde, þæt hit georne nealæcð to ðam dome, þe he
sylf to cymð; and we witan, þæt þærto gesamnod wyrð eall
heofenwaru and eall eorðwaru and eall hellwaru, and sceal þonne manna
gehwylc gescead agyldan ealra þara dæda, þe he her adreh ær on life.
 276. Ne bið þær bedigled þæt digleste geþanc, þe
ænig man æfre geþohte, butan hit ær geandet and gebet wære.
 278. Eall middaneard bið þonne on dæg byrnende, and ælc
man sceal þonne on dæg of deaðe arisan, þe æfre on life wæs, and
þurh þæt fyr to ðam dome faran.
 281. Ðær bið þonne on dæg gryre se mæsta, forðam
þurh godes mihte bið eall astyred ge heofenwered ge eorðwered ge
hellwered, and eall hit bið bifiende and cwaciende.
 284. Ac ðær gewyrð þurh godes mihte raðe tosceaden
þæt wered on twa, and scylon þa forwyrhtan, þe her on life noldan
gode gehyran ne godes lage healdan, ac deofle fyligdon, ðonne scylon eac
habban þæt, þæt hi ær gecuran; þæt is, þæt hy þonne
scylon to helle faran mid sawle and mid lichaman and mid deofle wunian on helle
witum.
 290. Þær is ece bryne grimme gemencged, and þær is ece
gryre, þær is wanung and granung and a singal sorh.
 292. Wa ðam, þe þær sceal wunian on wite; him wære
betere, þæt he æfre on worulde man ne gewurde, þonne he gewurde.
 294. Nis se man on life, þe areccan mæge ealle þa yrmða,
þe se gebidan sceal, se ðe on ða witu ealles behreoseð, and hit is
ealles þe wyrse, þe his ænig ende ne cymð æfre to worulde.
 298. Ðider scylan manslagan and þider scylan manswican; þider
scylon æwbrecan and þa fulan forligeras; þider scylan mansworan and
morþwyrhtan.
 300. Ðider scylan gitseras, ryperas and reaferas and þas
woruldstruderas; þider scylon hlafordswican and þa unrihtdeman, þe
demað æfre be ðam sceattum and swa wendað wrang to rihte and rihte to
wrange/.
 304. Ðider scylan þeofas and þeodsceaðan; þider scylan
wiccan and wigleras, and raðest is to sæcgenne, ealle þa manfullan, þe
ær yfel worhton and noldon geswican ne wið god þingian.
 307. Wa heom þæs siðes, þe hy men wurdon.
 308. Ac do nu manna gehwylc, swa hit micel þearf is, geswice
yfeles and bete his misdæda þa hwile, þe he mage and mote; god is
swyðe mildheort and wyle swyðe gemildsian and mycel forgifan þam, þe
mid inweardre heortan yfeles geswicað and geornlice betað.
 313. Ac wa þam, þe on yfele þurhwuniað and nan þing ne
betað, æt heora ende hy scylon witodlice mid ealle forwurðan.
 315. Eala, eala, gesælig bið þæt wered, þe þonne on
domdæge asyndred wyrð fram deofles gemanan, þæt syn ða
gesæligan, þe god lufiað and his bebodu healdað; hi scylon þonne
þæs ece lean habban, and he heom þonne on dæg luflice geþancað,
þæs ðe hy on life him rihte gehyrdon.
 320. And he raðe æfter cwyð oðrum worde to þam, ðe his
willan ær gefremedan: farað nu, he cwyð, mid me into heofena rice,
þæt eow is gegearcod to ecan edleane eowres geswinces, þe ge for minum
lufan ær on worulde adrugon.
 324. And hy þonne farað mid gode sylfum and mid his englum and
mid eallum halgum on ecne gefean heofona rices.
 326. Ðær næfre leofe ne gedælað, ne laðe ne
gemetað, ne næfre dæg æfter dæge, ne niht æfter nihte, ac
þær bið ece bliss and ece wuldor and ece gefea mid urum drihtne and mid
his þam halgum heapum a on worulda woruld a butan ende, amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

HomU 35.1 (Nap 43)
B3.4.35.1.
Napier 1883, no. 43: 'Sunnandæges spell' (Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS. 419 and 421, pp. 1, 2): Napier 205-15.



 1. Sunnandæges spell.
 2. Her sægð on þisum drihtnes ærendgewrite, þæt fyr
cymð sume þissa hærfesta ofer manna bearn.
 3. And hit gefealð ærest on Sceotta land, and hit þær
forbærnð ealle ða fyrenfullan, þa ðe nu god gremiað mid
sunnandæges weorcum and sæternesdæges ofer non.
 6. And hit þonne færð on Brytwealas and gedeð þær
þæt ilce.
 8. And þonne hit færð on Angelcyn and gedeð þær
þæt ilce, þe hit dyde þam oðrum þeodum twam.
 9. Ðonne hit færð suð ofer sæ geond þæt
þeodland, and hit þær forbærnð þæt mancyn, swa hit her ær
dyde.
 12. Forðam, men þa leofestan, geþencan we, þæt an diacon
wearð forðfered on Sceotlande, and he wæs fif wucan dead and onwoc þa
eft of deaðe and spræc to mannum.
 15. And he sæde fela wundra, þe he geseah on ðære oðre
weorulde, and næs ænig word, þæt ænig man on hine funde, butan
hit wære eall soð, þæt þæt he sæde.
 18. And næs syððan, þæt he æniges eorðlices metes
abyrigde, ne he næfre syððan butan cyrcan ne com.
 19. And þæs diacones nama wæs Nial haten.
 20. And se diacon sæde fram þysum fyre, emne swa we rædað
on sunnandæges spelle, ðæt drihten sylf gewrat iu gewrit, þæt he
wolde ealle synfulle men forbærnan.
 23. And þonne sæde se diacon, þæt þæt fyr cymð
forðan ofer manna bearn, þy þe men gelefað to hwon drihtnes sylfes
ærendgewrites, þe he sylf to Sanctus Petrus cyrican asende.
 26. Ac heo him wiðsacað, swa sume men iu geara dydon þam
heahfædere, þa he ðone miclan flod bodade menniscum cynne huru
hundtwelftigum wintrum, ær he come and ealle men adrencte butan ehta
mannum.
 30. Ðonne Noe þis mannum sæde be ðam flode, þæt he
wolde ealle synfulle menn adrencan, þonne hlogen men his worda on bysmer and
cwædon, þæt he luge.
 33. Swa þonne wenað nu manige men, þæt þes diacon leoge
be þam fyre, þe drihten sylf hine secgan het manna bearnum.
 35. Ac men him nellað gelefan þe ma, þe heo Noe dydon, ær
þæt fyr heom on sitt, swa þonne iu men ne woldon gelefan Noes worde,
ær ealle wolcnu and ealle heofones þeotan wæron mid wætere gefylde,
and ealle eorðan æddre onsprungon ongean þam heofonlican flode.
 40. And hit þa ongan rinan feowertig daga and feowertig nihta
tosomne þy mæstan rene; and seo eorðe weoll ongean þam heofonlican
flode swa swyðe, oð ðæt þæt wæter wæs heahre, þonne
ænig munt æfre wære.
 44. And þa forðam adruncon ealle cwice wihta, þe betwyx
heofonan and eorðan wæron butan ehta mannum ðæt wæs Noe and his
wif and heora þreo suna, Sem and Cham and Iafeth, and heora þreo wif and
ælces cynnes twa gemacan, þæt þeos weoruld mihte of hym awæcnian.
 49. Ac þæt is lang and wundorlic to sæcganne, hu þa
wurdon generede in þære Noes earce, þa ðe þær to lafe
oðstodon.
 51. Ðonne nu gegangeð þam mannum, þe þyses fyres cyme
nellað gelefan, þæt heo ealle forbeornað.
 53. Hwæt, Crist sylf hine to ðan geeadmedde, þæt he wrat
gewrit on ðam seofoðan heofone swyðe eorlicum wordum for sunnandæges
weorcum and sæternesdæges ofer non.
 56. Forðan se an dæg wæs swiðe oft gehalgod eallum godes
gesceaftum to reste butan deoflum and hæðenum sawlum, þa næfre reste
ne onfoð; and þis he awrat eall mid gyldenum stafum menniscum cynne.
 60. And forðam men habbað heo sylfe swyðe stranglice wið
god awerged and wið ealle his halgan, forðan þe heo nellað healdan
þone halgan sunnandæg mid rihte fram nontide þæs sæternesdæges
oð monandæges lihtincge.
 64. Forðan drihten Crist swor þurh his þa halgan þrynnesse
and þa soðan annesse: se man, se ðe ne wolde healdan þone halgan
sunnandæg mid rihte, þæt he wære awerged in ða neoðemestan
hellewitu.
 67. And he swa cwæð: ic sende hæðen folc ofer eow, and
þa eow benimað eowres eðles and eowres lifes; and ic sende on eowrum
husum cwealm and hungor and untimnesse and fyr, þæt forbærnð ealle
eowre welan.
 71. Hwylc fyr mænde Crist elles, butan þæt ilce, þæt
se diacon foresæde?
 72. And he cwæð: gif we nu woldan swa lyt gelefan drihtnes
sylfes ærendgewrites, swa men iu dydon þæs flodes tocyme, þonne
becymð þæt fyr hraðe ofer manna bearn.
 76. And se an broga bið strengra to aræfnanne, þonne
æfre ænig ær in middanearde become; and men sweltað butan þam fyre
for ðæs þunres ege anum and þære ligette and for ðæm
ormætlicum cwealme, þe heo geseoð beforan heora eagum.
 81. La leofan men, utan us warnian georne þa hwile, þe we
magon.
 82. Us gebyreð, þæt we ælces þinges ure geoguðe
teoðunge rihtlice gode betæcan, ure sulhælmessan <foreign>xv</foreign> niht on ufan
eastran and ure geoguðe teoðunge be pentecosten.
 85. And sy ælc heorðpening agifen be Petrus mæssedæg to
þam biscopstole ælce geare, and cornteoðung be emnihte oððe latest
be ealra halgena mæssan, and æfre þone teoðan æcer, ealswa seo
sulh hit gega, and cyricsceattas to Martinus mæssan, and leohtgesceota
þreowa on geare: ærest healfpeningwurð wexes to candelmæssan and eft
on easteræfen and þriddan siðe to ealra halgena mæssan.
 91. And healde man ælces sunnandæges freolsunga fram
sæternesdæges none oð monandæges lihtinge and ælcne oðerne
mæssedæg, swa he beboden beo.
 94. And sunnandaga cypincge we forbeodað eac eornostlice and
ælc folcgemot, butan hit for mycelre neodþearfe sy.
 96. And þæt man ælc beboden fæsten healde, sy hit
ymbrenfæsten, sy hit lenctenfæsten, sy hit elles oðer fæsten, mid
ealre geornfulnesse.
 98. And to Sancta Marian mæssan ælcere and to ælces
apostoles mæssan fæsten, butan to Philippi and Jacobi we ne beodað nan
fæsten for ðam easterlican freolse, and ælces frigedæges fæsten,
butan to Philippi and Jacobi we ne beodað nan fæsten for ðam easterlican
freolse, and ælces frigedæges fæsten, butan hit freols sy.
 104. And we forbeodað ordal and aðas and wifunga freolsdagum
and ymbrendagum and lenctendagum and rihtfæstendagum and fram <foreign>aduentum
domini</foreign> oð <foreign>octabas epiphanie</foreign> and fram <foreign>septuagesima</foreign>, oð fiftene niht
beon geeastrode.
 106. And eac we lærað eornostlice, þæt cristenra manna
gehwylc understande, þæt he æfter forðsiðe butan sawlsceatte on
mynstre ne licge, ac gelæste man a þone sawelsceat æt openum pytte.
 109. Leofan men, eac ic bidde for godes lufan, þæt ælc
cristen man understande georne his agene þearfe, forðam ealle we scylan
ænne timan gebidan, þonne us wære leofre, þonne eall, þæt on
middanearde is, þær we a worhton þa hwile, þe we mihton, georne godes
willan; ac þonne we scylan habban anfeald lean þæs, þe we on life
ær geearnoden.
 116. Ac utan beon on gebyrge earmum wudewum and steopcildum and
helpan georne earmum mannum, ælþeodigum and utan cumenum.
 118. Utan hlywan ofcalene and wæfan nacode and syllan mete þam
gehingredum and drenc þam ofþyrstum.
 120. Utan frefrian ahwænede and hyrtan ormode, alysan
gehæfte, gif us to þam onhagige, and seoce geneosian and forðferede
þearfan mildheortlice cystian and syððan bebyrian.
 123. Se ðe þus deð, he deð him sylfum micle þearfe.
 124. Forðam an tima cymð ure æghwylcum, þæt us wære
leofre, þonne eall, þæt we on worulde wiðæftan us þonne
læfað, þær we a worhton þa hwile, þe we mihton, þæt gode
licode.
 127. Ac þonne we scylon habban anfeald lean þæs, ðe we on
life ær geworhton.
 129. Wa ðam þonne, þe ær geearnode hellewite.
 129. Ðær is ece bryne grimme gemencged, and þær is ece
gryre, þær is ece ece and þær is sorgung and sargung and a singal
heof; ðær is benda bite and dynta dyne, þær is wyrma slite and ealra
wædla gripe, þær is wanung and granung, þær is yrmða gehwylc and
ealra deofla geþring.
 134. Wa ðam þonne, þe þær sceal wunian on wite; betere
him wære, þæt he mann nære æfre geworden, þonne he gewurde;
forðam nis se man on life, þe areccan mæge ealle þa yrmða, þe se
gebidan sceal, se ðe on þa witu ealles behreoseð; and hit is ealles þe
wyrse, þe his ænig ende ne cymð æfre to worulde.
 141. Ðis gewrit sægð get forð, þæt drihten swore að
swiðe, gif men ne woldon get geswican untidweorces, þæt god wolde sendan
ærest hungor and adla on manna ceap, ær þæt fyr come on heo, and
heo/ mid mislicre seocnesse æt mannum genyman.
 145. And þis he deð, forðam þe se sunnandæg is swiðe
micelum gecoren eallum godes gesceaftum, forðam þe he wæs ealra daga se
æresta, and he bið eft se nexta.
 148. And on þone dæg drihten of deaðe aras; and forðon he
wæs syððan eall genemned to sunnandæge fram þæs
sæternesdæges/ none oð ðæs monandæges lihtincge, forþan þe
drihten on þam dæge of deaðe aras.
 151. And þæt bið gedon, þæt þusend daga bið gedon
to anum sunnandæge; and þonne on þam dæge forbyrnð heofon and
eorðe and sæ and ealle þa gesceafta, þa ðe on hym syndon.
 155. And drihten cymð on þam dæge to us, and he us þonne
myngað þæs sunnandæges weorces and þæs sæternesdæges ofer
non and þære monannihte.
 157. And on þone dæg wæs Adam gesceapen, se æresta man.
 158. And on þone dæg Moyses oferfor þa readan sæ mid his
werode drygum fotum, and his feond adruncon behindan him in þære sæ.
 161. And on þone dæg drihten ongan ærest Israhela folc
fedan/ mid mannan þam heofoncundan mete.
 162. And drihten cwæð, þæt six dagas syndan, þæt eow
is alefed eowre weorc on to wyrcenne, ac se seofoða is min se halga
restendæg.
 165. And ealle, þa ðe on ðam dæge doð heora weorc,
þonne beoð þa deaðe sweltende; and se deað bið on helle deopnesse.
 167. And healdað ge, Israhela bearn, minne restendæg and
mærsiað hine in eowrum cynne, forðan se eca treowa is betwux me and
Israhela bearnum.
 170. And soðlice on six dagum wæron geworhte heofonas and
eorðe/ and ealle þa gesceafta, þa ðe on hym syndon; and þa on þam
seofoðan dæge ablan drihten fram ælcum weorce.
 173. And þa gebyrede hit on sume tide, þæt Dathan and Abiron
and Choreb, þa ðreo ealdormen, noldon wurdian þone halgan sunnandæg,
swa swa hym beboden wæs ægðer ge þurh Moyses ge þurh urne drihten
sylfne.
 177. And hy wurdon godes wyðerwinnan and forheoldon teoðunge
and ælc oðer þing, þe to godes handa belimpan sceolde; and þa
forwurdon hy sona, and seo eorðe þa tobærst under hym, and hy þa
feollon þurh ða eorðan nyðer mid eallum heora werode, and hy wurdon
ealle besencte mid sawle and mid lichaman in helle deopnesse.
 183. Swa þonne nu gegangeð manna bearnum, þæt heora sawle
beoð besencte in helle deopnesse, gif heo ne wyllað healdan þæs
sunnandæges bebod and sæternesdæges ofer non and þære
monannihte.
 186. And þæt is eac cuð, þæt Iordanis seo ea, þe
Crist wæs on hire gefullad on sunnandæge, þæt heo getacnað
þæs dæges halgunga, forðon nis an stæpe, þæt heo wille
oferyrnan fram nontide þæs sæternesdæges oð ðæs monandæges
lihtincge.
 191. And drihten asende on sunnandæg his apostolon þone halgan
gast on fyres ansyne.
 192. And on þam dæge wurdon todælede manna gereordu; and
ær wæs eall weoruld sprecende on an gereord, and nu synd gereord twa and
hundseofontig.
 195. And is eac cuð, þæt for þæs dæges halgunge and
weorðunge ealle hellware onfoð reste, gif heo æfre fulluhtes onfangen
hæfdon, fram nontide þæs sæternesdæges oð monandæges
lihtincge.
 198. And me þis is lang to secganne and to writanne, hu oft se an
dæg wæs gehalgod, and hu oft he wæs forboden þurh god sylfne and
þurh his halgan, þæt him man on ne worhte.
 202. And Nial sæde, se diacon, se wæs fif wucan on heofonum,
he sæde, þæt god sy for sunnandæges weorcum and sæternesdæges
ofer non ealra swiðost abolgen, and þæt he forðam swiðest sende
misgelimpu on manna bearn.
 206. And he sæde, þæt for manna ungeleaffulnesse synd ealle
þas eorðlican þing acerrede, þæt heo ne syndon, swylce heo iu
wæron.
 208. And drihten sende his agen hangewrit on Sanctus Petrus
heahaltare in his circan, þær mæst manna færð, þæt he get
wolde his mildheortnesse on us gecyðan and us sæcgan, hu we us gehealdan
sceoldan wið godes yrre, and hu he wið us gedon wolde, gif we ne woldan
healdan sunnandæges bebod and sæternesdæges ofer non and þære
monannihte.
 214. Ða wæs þæt gewrit þus awriten mid gyldenum stafum:
<foreign>amen, amen, dico uobis</foreign>; soð is, soð is, þæt ic eow secge: gif ge
healdað þone sunnandæg mid rihte, þonne ontyne ic eow heofona rices
duru, and ic eow sylle manigfealde wæstmas minra bletsunga on eowrum husum
to nytte oð ende eowres lifes.
 220. And gif ge beoð gehwyrfde to me and to minum halgum, swa
hwæs swa ge me biddað on minum naman, eall ic hit eow selle.
 222. And ic blissige on eow and ge on me; and ge beoð halige,
forþan ic eam eower drihten, and nis ænig oðer butan me.
 224. And ic swerige þurh mine mihte and þurh mine englas,
cherubin and seraphim, þa clypiað freabrihtum stefnum and þus cweðað:
<foreign>sanctus, sanctus, sanctus dominus, deus sabaoth</foreign>.
 228. Ða cwæð drihten god: þurh heora mihte ic swerige, gif
ge ne healdað þone sunnandæg mid rihte, þonne cymð ren and
hagolstanas ofer eow, and micel fyr bið onæled ofer eow.
 231. And ic þonne forbærne ealle þa fyrenfulle, þa ðe
foran to unriht wyrceð, oððe on þam dæge him hlaf baceð oððe
hine baðað oððe his fex efesað oððe hine scerð oððe on
þam dæge oðerne swingð oððe his hus feormað, oððe he
unalyfedlice gegæð on þam dæge, þæt he sy werig, oððe
ænig unriht gefremme on þam dæge.
 237. Ða þe hit doð, þonne beoð þa awergede fram me in
þa ecan witu and heora bearn butan ende.
 239. Men þa leofestan, syn we þonne gemyndige ure sawle
þearfe ægðer ge his rædes ge his mildheortnesse.
 241. And iu geara ure yldran ne woldan sunnandæges bebodu
healdan; þa wearð drihten hym swyðe eorre, swa swa hit be us awriten is,
and he ða sende of heofonum beornende ren and swælende leg, and he
acwealde mid þy brogan mycelne dæl þisses mennisces cynnes.
 245. And þa he geseh manna forwyrd, þæt heo wæron
cwelende/ in þam fyre, þa gereaw him eft, þæt his handgeweorc swylc
sar þrowian sceolde; þa anam he þæt fyr fram manna bearnum.
 249. And eft ymbe lytel ongan mancyn eft abeligan god for
sunnandæges weorcum, and þa ongan drihten writan þæt gewrit bufan
þam seofoðan heofone be sunnandæges weorcum, swa hit her beforan
sægð.
 252. And nu doð men þam gelicost syððan, swylce hit wære
idel spell and unsoð.
 254. Nu he þonne gyt hine to ðam geeadmedde, þæt he Nial
þone diacon of deaðe awehte, to ðam þæt he mihte cyðan godes folce
þæt towearde yrre.
 256. And þa ðe nu get ne gelefað þisses, þonne bið
heom, swa swa þam bocerum bið, þa ðe nellað heora boccræftas godes
folce wel nytte gedon.
 259. Forðon þæt godes folc sceal becuman to lifes wege
þurh þa godspellican lare, and æghwylcum men is beboden þurh god
sylfne on Cristes naman and on þære halgan þrynnesse naman and on
þære soðan annesse naman and on drihtnes rode naman, þe he sylf on
þrowade, ðæt swa hwylc man, swa þis godspell hæbbe on his gewealde,
þæt he hit cyðe godes folce swyðe genehhe swa þurh hyne sylfne, swa
þurh oðerne gelæredne man, swa he þonne eðest mæge.
 267. And gif he þonne gemeleas læt licgan þis gewrit unnyt
gode and godes folce, þonne cweð se hælend and að swerað, þæt
he sy awerged fram him and fram his halgum.
 271. Men þa leofestan, hwæt, Florentius se papa and Petrus se
biscop wæron on ða tid on Rome, þa þis gewrit becom on Sanctus Petrus
weofod, and heo wæron þa selestan and þa gecorenestan witan ægðer
ge gode ge mannum.
 275. Soðlice heo wæron gewitan, þæt þis halige gewrit
of heofonum com, and heo ða forðan þus cwædon and micclum cyddon: wit
sweriað þurh ðone micclan anweald mihtiges drihtnes and þurh þa
halgan rode, þe Crist for manna hælo on þrowade, þæt hit is soð,
þæt wit secgað, ðæt fram nænigum eorðlicum handgeweorce næs
seo boc awriten, ac on Sanctus Petrus hehaltare hit wæs funden þus awriten
mid gyldenum stafum.
 282. Hwylc man is þonne æfre, butan his heorte sy eall mid
deofles strælum awrecen, þæt he wene, þæt se halga papa and se
biscop dorston swerian mænne að þurh swa miclan mægenþrymme?
 286. And hit gebyrede on ða tid, þe þis gewrit becom on
Sanctus Petrus weofod, þæt eall seo stow wearð onrered, and heo abifode
eall, and seo byrgen wæs open geworden and unhlidod, þær Sanctus Petrus
lichama inne læg.
 289. And gif ge nellað gelefan, men þa leofestan, þæs
ærendgewrites, þonne ne geþencað ge na, hu þæt deofol þam
ancre sæde, hwylc hit in helle wære to wunianne.
 292. Ðæt gelamp iu, þæt an halig ancer genam ænne
deofol and began hine ðreatigan, þæt he him sæde, hwylc hit on helle
wære.
 295. And þa cwæð se deofol to ðam ancre: ne mæg
nænig man wordum asecgan fram þam susle, þe in þære helle is.
 297. Ða cwæð se deofol to þam ancre: þeah ðe seofan
men sittan on middanearde, and heo mihton sprecan on æghwylcere þeode,
þe betwux heofonum and eorðan wære þara is twa and hundseofontig and
þara manna æghwylc a to life gesceapen wære, and þara æghwylc
hæfde seofon heafda, and þara heafda gehwylc seofon tungan, and þara
tungena gehwylc isene stemne, ne magon heo ariman ealle þa wita, þe on
helle syndon.
 305. Men ða leofestan, gemunan we nu forðan þone halgan
sunnandæg, forðan þe he is ealra daga fyrmest, and he wæs se
æresta, and he bið eft se nexta.
 307. Forðan, men, biddan we urne drihten ælmihtigne, þæt
he us forgife ure gyltas and ure synna, ða þe we æfre geworhtan on urum
life, þæt we magan and motan becuman to ðam ecan life þæs
heofoncundlican rices, ðær we motan a orsorhlice libban and rixian mid
urum hælende and mid eallum his halgum, mid fæder and mid suna and mid
þam halgan gaste a in ealra worulda woruld a butan ende, amen.

 1. Her sagaþ an þisan drihtnes ærendgewrite, þæt fyr
cymeþ on suman hærfeste.
 2. And hit gefeallaþ ærest on Scotta land and syþþan on

 4. And þonne færþ hit suþ ofer sæ on þa þeodland
and forbærnþ ægþer ge mancynne man and eac micelne beoleofan.
 6. An diacan wæs dead nu an unmenigum geare, þæs nama
wæs Nial.
 7. He wæs an Scotta ealonde, and he wæs <foreign>v</foreign> wucan dead; and
he þa eft of deaþe aras þurh Cristes mihte and sprec to mannum and hiom
sede fela wundra, þæs he geseah in þare oþran weorulde, þæs þe
ænig mon an hine anfindan mihte butan eal soþ, þæt he sægde.
 12. And nes siþþan, þæt he ænige eorþlices metes
anbergde, ne nefre siþþan he butan cirican ne com.
 14. And þæs diacones naman wæs haten Nial.

ealle synfulle forbernan.

selfes ærendgewrites, þe he to Sancte Petrys cirican asænde.
 20. Ac him wiþsacaþ menige men and nellaþ gelefan an þas

þæt biþ of cwican orfe and of corne and of eallum þam gestrionum, þe

 32. And þonne Noe þis mannum sæde be þam flode, swa þes

þæt þæt fyr wille cuman and ealle synfulle swyþe geunrotsian,
þonne hlogan men Noes worda, þonne he þis folce sæde be þam flode,
and bismerodan hine, and hi cwædan to him, þæt he lufe, oþ þæt
ealle wolcen and eall heofenes þiotan wurdan mid wætere gefyllede, and
ealle edran asprungan angen þam heofenlican flode.
 41. And hit agan þa rinan <foreign>xl</foreign> daga and <foreign>xl</foreign> nihta tosomne

hegre beufan eorþan, þonne se munt, þe is syxtinan fædman hegre.
 45. Se flod wæs bufan þam hegestan munde, þe is an
middangearde.
 46. And þa adruncan ealle cwice wihte, þe betwioh heofonum and

 51. And þæt is lang and wundarlic to asecgenne, hu þa wurdan

 54. Swa þonne nu gegongeþ þam mannum, þe þyses fyres

 55. Hwet, drehten hine selfne to þan geeadmette, þæt he

 67. And an þane dæg wæs Adam gescapen, se ærysta man.
 68. And an þone dæg Moyses oferferde þa readan sæ mid his

 72. And swiþe oft drehten bead þam halgan Moyse, þæt he

se iow gehalgode; and healdaþ ge forþan minne þane halgan rystedæg.
 82. And on þam dæge he awende wæter to wine.

and mærsiaþ hine in iowrum ciricum, forþon sio æce triowþ is

 104. Þa weran an þare þiode <foreign>iii</foreign> ealdormen on Israhela

 110. Þa forwurdon hi sona, and sio iorþe tobærst

 115. Swa þonne nu gegangeþ manna bearnum, þæt heora sawle

 118. Hiom weorþ swa, swa swa þare bocere sawle biþ, þe

 121. Forþon þe Crist selfa cwæþ: þeah mann anum men

lustlice gehereþ; and þam biþ wa æfre geborenum, þe hit secgan can

 131. Drehten cwæþ, þæt he come to demenne cwicum and

 134. And drihten ansende an sunnandege his apostolum þone halgan

 136. And an þam dege wurdan todælde ealra manna gehriorde; and

 138. And þæt is eac cuþ, þæt for þæs dæges

 143. And we gelyfaþ þurh godes gife, þæt hit swa sig, gif

 145. Ac þa, þa to helle becumaþ, ne cumaþ hit næfre to

 148. And hit is to lang eal to awritenne, hu oft se an dæg wes

 151. And þæt gelamp on Moyses dagum, þæt Moyses for

stod and wudede him.
 154. Þa het Moyses, þæt hine mon gebunde, and þæt hine

 156. Þa freni Moyses urne drihten, hu he þane ceorl ation

 158. Þa het ure drehten, þæt hine me dede of life.
 159. Hwæt, þa wes openlice getanad, þæt þæt biþ

 162. And Nial sede, se diacon, se wes <foreign>v</foreign> wucan an heofonum,

 167. And hit hefþ nu ofergan eal cristen folc, þæt hio

 169. Ac hiom þæs cymþ ful ær ece hunger, þam þe

 171. And drehten sende his agen handgewrit an Sancte Petres

 178. And þa wæs þæt gewrit þus gewriten mid geldenum

 182. Þa sende ic gershoppan anufan iowerne hwæte, and ge þa

 189. Eala hwæt, monnum iu stranglice gelamp for sunnandæges

adilegedan ealle wudebeorwas for sunnandeges weorce.
 192. And þa hy drehten anget, þæt men þa get noldan

eorþan, þæt hio fretan ealle eorþwæstmas butan letlan dæle.
 195. Þa andged he ure drihten, þæt men noldan þa get

and his miltse let ofer manna bearnum.
 201. Þis wæs geworden on Egipta lande.
 202. Hie þa heoldan letle wile sunnandeges bebod and brecan eft
and noldan geswican untidweorces, þa sænde dryhten <foreign>v</foreign> deor up of se, and
nes ænig man, þæt hiom wiþstandan mihte, ær þanne hie drehten

 207. Þa gelamp hit binnan feawe gerum, þæt menn eft
oferhogodan sunnandæges bebod and sæternes ofer non.
 209. Þa angan drehten selfa dihtan þæt gewrit, þe her nu
forþ sægeþ, and he cwæþ: soþ is, þæt ic iow secge, þæt

genihtsumes, and ge sweþeah noldan healdan be minan bebodum þane halgan

 214. Soþ is, þæt ic eow sæcge, þæt ic wæs
geþyldig for iow, and ge me oft tynan gededan, þanne þearfan cleopedan to
iowrum husum, and ge hi ne noldan gehyran, ne me nane mildheortnesse noldan an
heom gecyþan; and þonne ælðiodige to iow coman, þanne noldan ge
hiom nan god don.
 219. Soþ, soþ is, þæt ic iow sæcge, gef ge ne healdaþ
þane halgan sunnandæg fram nontide þæs seternesdeges oþ þæs
monandeges lihtincge, þæt ealle þa yfel becumaþ eft ofer iow, þe iow
ær an becoman and her beufan gewritene sindon.
 224. Ic eom godes sunu, and ic feola geþrowade for iow, ic wæs
an rode ahangen for iow, and ic deaþ geþrowade for iow, and ic of deaþe

 230. Þa he þanne mende þane egeslican domes deg.
 231. Hwæt, he drihten þa openlice cydde on þam worde, þa
he cwæþ, þæt an sunnandæg of deaþe arise, þæt se
sæternesdæg biþ þæs sunnandeges, siþþan hit non biþ,
forþon hit wæs sunnændæg, þa drihten self of deaþe aras.
 235. Crist selfa and ealle halgan hefdan for sunnandeg þone
dæg, þe Crist aras of deaþe.
 236. And from nontide þæs sæternesdæges oþ þæs
monandæges lihtincge ge sceolan heoldan, and gef hit eorþlice men
anwændaþ, þonne ne onfoþ hio næfre dæl drehtnes wuldres.
 239. And drehten wæs þa get forþ sprecende, and he
cwæþ: soþ, soþ is, þæt ic iow sæcge, se þe ne gehealdaþ
þane halgan sunnandeg, minne restandæg, þe ic of deaþe aras, mid rihte
fram nontide þæs sæternesdæges oþ þæs monandæges
lihtincge, þæt he biþ awerged aa in weorulde weoruld, and ic him
wiþsacæ, þonne he of þisan life gewit, and he ne hafaþ næfre
dæl mid me ne mid minan ænglum to heofonan rice.
 247. Ealle fyþerfete nytenu cleopiaþ to me, and ic hio
gehære, and hiom nillaþ reste forgefan an þone halgan sunnandeg.
 249. Soþ is iow sæcge, gef ge ne healdaþ þone halgan
sunnandeg mid rihte, þæt ic sænde gyt ofer iow micele stormas and
hagolstanas and fleogende neddran, þa ge abera ne megan, and swelicne leg;
and ic lete hæþenfolc ofer iow, þa iow fornimaþ and iowra bearn.
 254. Soþ ys, þæt ic iow sæcge, gef ge healdaþ þone
halgan sunnandeg mid rihte, mid ælmessan and mid ciricsocnum, swa mon
sunnandeg don scel, weorþian mid eallan weorþmendum minne restandæig,
þonne ontyne ic iow heofenas þeodan, and ic selle iow menigfealde
wæstmas sylle and mine bletsunge an iowrum husum to nytte a oþ ænde
eowres lifes, and ge þonne bioþ gehwærfede to me and to minan halgan,
and þonne swa hwæs swa ge biddaþ an minan naman, eal ic iow sille.
 262. And ic blissige an iow and ge on me; and ge bioþ halige,
forþon ic eam eowar drihten, and nis ænig oþer butan me anum.
 265. Soþ is, þæt ic iow sæcge, þæt ic swerige þurh
minne miht and þurh mine þa halgan ænglas, cherubin and særaphin,
þa send cleopiende beorhtum stefnum and þus cweþaþ: <foreign>sanctus, sanctus,
sanctus dominus deus sabaoth, pleni sunt celi et terra</foreign>.
 269. Þa cwæþ ure drihten: þurh hiora mihte ic swerige, gef
ge ne healdaþ þane haligan sunnandeg mid rihte, þonne cymeþ micel reng
and snaw and micele hagolstanas ofer iow, and micel fer biþ anberned ymb þa
monþas utan, þe synt hatene september and october.
 274. And ic þanne wille forbærnan ealle eower god and ealle,
þa þe an unrihtum tidum yfel wyrcaþ, oþþe he an þæm dege
oþerne swinggæþ, oððe he hus feormaþ oþþe hlafes bakeþ
oþþe swereþ oþþe cnytt, oþþe he hine baþaþ, oþþe he hine
efeseþ, oþþe he hine scirþ, oþþe he unalefedlice an þam dege
gegeð, þæt he werig biþ, oþþe he ænige unrihtnesse an þan
dæge gefremeþ; þa þe hit doþ, witan hie þanne, þæt hio bioþ
ealle awergde fram me in þa æcan wita and hiora bearn ealle butan
æghwilcum ænde.
 283. Ond eghwilcan men is beboden þurh god selfne in Cristes
noman and in þaræ halgan þrinnesse naman and in þare halgan anesse
naman and in þare halgan rode naman, þe drihten self an þrowade, se þe
hebbe þis gospel an his gewealde, þæt he hit bodige and cyþe swiþe
gelomlice godes folce swa þurh hine selfne, gef he gelæred sie, swa þurh
oþerne gelæredne mon, þonne he him to cume.
 290. And gef he þonne þæt agemeleaseþ, þæt he
lætaþ licgan þis godspyl unnet godes folce, þæt hit ne nan
mynstermon na sægþ, þonne cweþ drihten and þus aþ swor, þæt
he wære awyrged fram him and fram eallum his halgum in þa æcan witu.
 295. And þis bioþ þa monþas september and october, þæt
þys fyr an becymþ, þe se diacon ær bi segde, þæt drihten us to
sendan wolde.
 297. Florentius se papa and Petrus se bescup wæron on þa tid
on Rome, þa þis gewrit becom anufan Sancte Petres wiofode, and hie wæran
þa/ salestan witan and þa betstan gorenestan egþer ge gode ge mannum.
 301. Soþlice hie þæs wæran gewitan, þæt þis halige
gewrit of heofonum com, and hio hit fundan anufan Sancte Petres altare.
 303. And hie þa forþan þus cwædan and miclum cyþdan: wit
swerigaþ þurh þane micelan anwald ures dryhtenes and þurh þa halgan
Cristes rode, þe he for manna helo a þrowade, þæt hit is eal soþ,
þæt wit sæcgaþ, þæt fram nanum eorþlicum men þios dryhtnes
ærendboc awriten ne wæs, ne mid bocblece, ne mid nenigum eorþlicum
andweorce, ac hit wæs on Sancte Petres heahaltare funden þis gewrit þus
awriten mid geldnum stafum.
 311. Men þa leofestan, hwilc man is þonne efre, butan his
heorte se eal mid deofles strealum awrecan, þæt he wæne, þæt se
halga papa and se biscup dorstan swerigan menne aþ þus micel megen?
 315. And hit gelamp an þa tid, þe þis gewrit becom anufan
Sancte Petres wefode, þæt se stod wearþ eal onhrered, and hio abiofode
eal, and sio bergen wearþ open geworden and unhlidod, þe Sancte Petres
lichama an leg under þam weofode.
 319. And gef eorþlice men nu agemeleasiaþ þisæs gewrites
bebodes, þonne ne geþæncaþ hio na, hu strang hit biþ an helle to
bionne.
 321. Þonne manaþ us þis halige gewrit, þæt we simle
sion geynegode to ure saule þearfe and þæs ytmestan deges ures lifes and
þæs gedales lichoman and saule.
 324. And þonne we sculon ælces unnyttes riht ageldan an þene
bifigendan domes dege for eallum þam weorcum, þe we nu wiþ godes willan
wercaþ from nontide þæs sæternesdæges oð ðes monandeges
lihtinge.
 328. And eac we sculan þær riht ageldan for ures lifes dede,
þe we siþ oþþe ær efre gefremedan fram ures lifes fruman.
 330. Ne megan wy þanne ure misdeda behedan ne bedigligan, ac hio
bioþ þanne ealle opene and unwrigene beforan us, butan hio ær geanddette
bion and gebette.
 333. And us mon þanne nenigre deda grimlicor ne mengaþ, þanne
þæs seternesdeges weorces, siþþan hit non biþ, oþ þæs
monandeges lihtinge, buton manslihte and ciricbryca and hlafordswicunga.
 336. Gef we þonne, men, willaþ gewercan godes willan and þone
sunnandeg gehealdan, þonne magon æghweþer ge us heofona rices eadignesse
geearnian, ge we megan gesæliglice befleon þa deorcan and þa dimman
stowe helle tintrego, þe deofol an wunaþ mid his weagesiþum and mid þam
awergdum saulum, þa þanne noldan healdan þises gewrites bebod, þe
dryhten self awrat, ac hlestan deofles larum and noldan to gode gecyrran
þurh soþe anddetnesse and þurh soþe bote.
 345. Wa la wa biþ þam mannum, þe mid deoflum scealan habban
heora eardungstowe, þær biþ sar butan frofre and ærmþo butan are
and wæana ma, þonne hit eniges mannes gemet sie, þæt hit asecgan
mege.
 349. Dryhten.
 349. Se an heofonum rixaþ, gescylde us wiþ hellewitu, wiþ
þa ecan clammas þurh his wuldar and þurh his weorþment a buton ende,

HomU 36 (Nap 45)
B3.4.36.
Napier 1883, no. 45: 'Sermonem angelorum nomina': Napier 226-32.



 1. <foreign>Sermo angelorum nomina</foreign>.
 2. Her onginð, men ða leofestan, ymb ures drihtnes
ærendgewrite be ðære halgan þrynnesse, þe feoll of þam seofoðan
heofone þurh þone halgan heahengel Michael and wæs funden in þam
geate, þe hatte Effrem.
 5. And he hit sende þam mæssepreoste, þe hatte Achorius.
 6. And he hit underfeng and sende hit to ðære ceastre, þe
hatte Ieremiam, and to þam mæssepreoste.
 8. And he hit asende Talasius.
 9. And Tala soðlice hit asende to Ebream þære ceastre and to
þam mæssepreoste, þe hatte Lebonum.
 11. Lebonum soðlice hit asende to Cappadociam þære ceastre
and to þam mæssepreoste, þe hatte Machabium.
 12. And Machabium soðlice hit asende to þære stowe Sanctus
Michael þæs heahengles.
 14. And þanan hit becom to Rome and in ða burh and þær
wæs funden on Sanctus Petrus weofod and þus wæs awriten mid gyldenum
stafum.
 16. And soðlice þa, ðe in þære ceastre wæron, heo
ða dydon, swa heo þær gewearð, þæt heo fæsten þreo dagas and
to gode and to Sancte Petre georne sohtan mid ælmessum and mid fæstenum
and mid wæccum and mid halgum gebedum þone intingan þysses halgan
gewrites, forðan þis ærendgewrit in þissum ceastrum becumen wæs.
 22. And hit wæs forðan, þæt on þam halgan sunnandæge
þæt nan man hine to unnytnesse to swiðe ne geþeodde.
 24. Ðæt is, þæt nan man on þysne dæg on dome ne
sitte ne að ne swerige ne wyrte in lehtune ne fatige; and þeh hwam
gebyrige, þæt his fyr ut gewite, nis þæt alyfed to begetenne.
 28. And nan wif hire yrfe ne meolcige, butan heo ða meolc for
godes lufan sylle.
 29. Ne mylnum nis alyfed to eornenne ne on huntað to ridenne ne
nan unalyfedlic weorc to wyrcenne.
 31. Forðan þe for ðyssum yfelum weorcum forweorðað þas
eorðlican þing, and se bifigenda dom cymð ofer gefullad folc.
 33. And ongeotað, ge earmingas synfulle, þæt on six dagum
wæron geworhte heofonas and eorðan, sunne and mona, sæ and fixas and
ealle, þa ðe on hym syndon; and æfter eallum þissum swa gewordenum he
gesceop Adam þone ærestan man of þam lame.
 38. And þa ðy seofoðan dæge he hine gereste æfter his
six daga weorcum.
 39. And swa gedafenað ælcum men to habbenne restendæg, swa
ða halgan englas reste habbað on heofonum.
 41. Ac ic halsige on godes naman and eornostlice hate, þæt ge
gecyrran to gode mid gebedum and mid wæccan and mid fæstenum and mid
synna andettnesse eowrum scriftan and mid hreowsunge dædbota and mid
teoðunge ealra ura æhta weoruldgestreona.
 45. And mid þære halgan rode he us gesenað.
 46. And þæt fæsten, þe ða Niniuete fæston,
fæstað þa.
 47. And gif ge swa doð, þonne ahreddeð us drihten.
 48. Ge ermingas, efestað and begeotað heofena rices wuldor,
forðan dæghwamlice se deað cymð beforan eowrum eagum, and underfoð
þyssum drihtnes ærendgewrite.
 51. And gif ge nellað gebetan eowre misdæde and healdan þone
halgan sunnandæg mid rihte fram nontide þæs sæternesdæges oð
monandæges lihtincge, and gif ge nellað healdan þa godsibbrædenne,
þe ge habbað for gode and for Sancte Iohannes dæle begetene and eowre
teoðunge on riht ageofan: and gif ge þæt nellað, ic sende ofer eow
hagelstanas, and ælc an hagelstan wegeð fif pund.
 58. Ic sæcge, þæt on þam monðe, þe hatte nouembris,
þæt ge scoldan ealle forweorðan, nære þære halgan Sancta Marian
gebed and þæs halgan heahengles Michahel and þara haligra apostola
Petrus and Paulus.
 62. And þurh heora bene ge wæron alysde of þam witum, ða
þe towearde wæron.
 63. Ic cweðe to eow, gif ge willað fon to dædbote, þonne
beoð eow opene heofena geatu, and ic sylle eow hwæte and win and ele and
in/ eowrum bernum blæde and gemanigfeald god in eowrum husum; and ic eow
sylle heofona rices wuldor aa on ecnesse soðlice.
 68. And ic cweðe to þissum folce minum þam holdan and þam
leofan: gewislice ge becumað to heofona rices wuldre mid gebedum and mid
wæccum and mid ælmessa sylenum, gif ge willað ealle yfel forlætan,
ge on manslihte ge on mænum aðum, and fylstan widewum and fæderleasum
and moderleasum cildum, þæt ge motan beon mid eowrum broðrum godes bearn
gecigede.
 74. Beþænce se fæder þone sunu and se sunu þone
fæder butan yrre and butan werignesse, þæt ge þurh þæt ne synd
fordone ne to deaðe forlorene, þe ge mid yfele onginnað and þæt
næfre wel ne geendiað.
 78. Ic cweðe to eow: gað to minum cyricum mid ælmessum and
mid leohte and geherað þone halgan sang and forlætað eorre and
druncennesse and unrihthæmed and healdað þone halgan sunnandæg, and
beþencað þone bifigendan domes dæg simle beforan eowrum eagum.
 83. Ic sende eow gehadode beforan gode simble, and gif ge hym
willað gelefan.
 84. Ic eow halsige, min getreowe folc, þurh Iordane þa ea,
þær Sanctus Iohannes me þone halgan fulluht asende mid ele and mid
crisman me þurhsmyrede.
 87. And þonne he se engel cwæð to me: þis is min leofa
sunu, on þæm ic me wel gelicode, geherað him wel.
 89. And þurh þis halige gewrit ic eow halsige, þæt ge
þysum gelefan; and ic hate, þæt ge gangen to minum cyricum, and þær
ge eower geswinc sellað.
 92. And gif ge nellað swa don, þonne bende ic minne bogan, and
ic sende mine flan ofer eow, and þonne forweorðað synfulle men; and ic
sende ofer eow fleogende nædran, þa þe fretað eowre breost and eowre
blæde, þe ge big libban scylon.
 96. Ac þeahhwæðere gecerrað to me, ge synfulle, and
forlætað yfel a, forðam þæm ic mildsiende eom, minum þam
getreowum, and heo onfoð heofona rices wuldre.
 99. Gelefað þyssum wordum.
 99. Ic sænde to eow for þam halgan sunnandæge, þæt ge
ageofan ða teoðunge to godes cyrican.
 101. Forðam, gif ge nellað hy ageofan gode and his preoste, he
his min broðor and min sunu þam, ðe to me wendað, and þam, þe hit
forhealdað, beo he fram me and fram minum bebodum, ic sende ofer eow wedende
wulfas and wedende hundas, þe etað eowerne lichaman to deaðes tocyme.
 106. Ic sende on eowre hus biternesse and wanunga and granunga; and
ic þa eft nime fram eow for minre mildheortnesse, and ge gað to minum
cyricum and gecerrað to me, and ic to eow, forðam ic eam mildsiende, and ic
mildsige ælcum þara, þe mine bebodu healdað, a in ecnesse.
 111. Ic hate and ic halsige, þæt ge on sunnandæge eowre
heafdu ne þwean ne eower fex ne efesian; and gif ge swa doð, þonne beo ge
adilegad, ge and eowre sawle, of lifigendra bocum.
 115. And gif ge nellað betan, þæt ge to woge gedon
habbað, ic sende yfel on eower hus and eorre.
 116. And ic hæbbe asend þis gewrit to eow, þæt ge him
gelefan.
 117. And gif ge nyllað healdan eower word and eower wedd, ge
þonne beoð adilegode of ealra lifigendra bocum; forðan ic hæbbe aboden
eow tuwa þurh twam gewritum ær þissum, and þis is þæt ðridde,
þe ic sende nu to eow.
 122. And gif ge nellað healdan min bebod, ic sende ofer eow
geswinc and mettrumnesse on andwlitan and on eagum and on earum and on eallum
limum, þa eow habbað oð deaðes tocyme swiðe hearde.
 125. Soð is, soð is, þæt ic eow secge, þæt ic wæs
for eow on rode genægled, and þær ic þrowade for eow, and ic aras on
sunnandæg of deaðe, forðan þe se sunnandæg is restendæg and
wuldorlic dæg and lihtnesse dæg, and forðan þe on ðam sunnandæge
gescop drihten heofonan and eorðan and ealle þa gesceafte, þe on hym
syndon.
 131. On sunnandæg wæron englas gesceapene.
 132. And on sunnandæg reste Noes earce on þære dune, þe
Armenia hatte, æfter ðam miclan flode.
 133. On sunnandæg lædde drihten his folc of Egyptum þurh
ða readan sæ drium fotum, and his feond adruncon in ðære sæ.
 136. On sunnandæg let se hælend rinan mannan, þone
heofonlican mete, þe he his folc mid fedde feowertig wintra on þam
westenne.
 138. On sunnandæg is seo acennednes ures drihtnes hælendes
Cristes.
 139. On sunnandæg worhte drihten win of wætere in
Architriclines huse.
 141. On sunnandæg gefylde se hælend of fif hlafum and of twam
fixum fif þusend manna butan wifum and cildum.
 143. And on sunnandæg aras drihten of deaðe.
 143. And on sunnandæg he asende his apostolum þone halgan gast
on fyres ansyne.
 145. And on sunnandæg gesæt se hælend on ða swiðran
healfe þæs heahfæder.
 146. And on sunnandæg cwæð se hælend: openiað þas
geatu and þa fæstan scytelsas, and ic wille gan þæron.
 148. Forðan ongeotað ge þis bebod: ic bebeode eallum minum
cyriclicum larum, þæt heo beþencen drihtnes ærendgewrit; and
behealdað þone halgan sunnandæg and þa fæstendagas, þe men eow
beodað to healdenne; and eowre teoðunge ageofað to godes mynstrum,
forðan/ þe ge fulluhte onfengon; and healdað eowre clænnesse, swa ge
geheton æt fulluhtes bæðe; and gebiddað me swa georne, þonne eow
becymeð yfel, þonne do ic mine bletsunge on eow, þe me biddað.
 157. And þa hæðenan soðlice heo ne synd cristene, ne heo
god ne lufiað ne his bebodu healdan ne willað, ne heo na on hine ne
gelyfað.
 159. Soð is, soð is, þæt ic eow secge, þæt eow is
þearf, þæt ge healdan þone halgan sunnandæg mid rihte fram nontide
þæs sæternesdæges oð monandæges lihtinge.
 162. And gif ge nellað þyssum gewritum gelefan, ic sende ofer
eow wyrmas and fuhlas wedende, and þa fordoð eowre blæde, þe ge bi
libban scylan, and heo beoð eow æteowode.
 165. And ic sende hæðen folc ofer eow, þe eow ofnimað
eowre æhte and eower lif and eowere wif and cild, butan ge þa teoðunge
syllan to godes cyrican for minum lufan.
 168. Soð is, soð is, þæt ic eow secge, gif ge lesað in
lehtune wyrte on sunnandæg, ic sende nædran gefiðrede, þe etað
eowre breost oð deaðes tocyme.
 171. Gif ge ne healdað þone halgan sunnandæg, ðonne beoð
on eowrum husum acennede cild, þe ne geseoð ne ne gehyrað ne ne gað,
and ge forweorðað.
 173. And geþencað, þæt ge synd þæs oft gemyngad; and
gif ge healdað mine beboda, ealle god ic gehate and swa soðlice gelæste
þurh me.
 176. And swa hwylc mæssepreost, swa hæbbe þis gewrit and
nelle cyðan godes folce, þonne cweð se hælend, þæt his sawel
wære awerged, and his nama bið adilegad of lifigendra bocum.
 179. Ðis gewrit wæs afunden in Hierusalem, and þanan hit
becom to Rome and to Sancte Petres byrgenstowe for ure þearfe, and þus
wæs awriten mid gyldenum stafum, and of þære seofoðan heofone us to
becom, þæt ge þy fæstlicor gelyfdon.
 183. Ongeotað ge godes word, and his larum hersumiað, forðan
þe eow nealæcð se deað toweardes.
 185. And gif ge nellað gelefan, ic sende to eow beornendne ren
and sweflene leg, and eow fordeð and eowre bearn butan ende.
 187. And æfter þyssum gewrite ne cymð eow nan oðer fram
me.
 189. And gelefað þissum gewrite þurh drihten sylfne and
þurh englas and heahenglas for þæra mihte and anweald, þurh
heahfæderas and witegan, þurh apostolas and martyres and confessores and
þa halgan fæmnan and ealle Cristes þa halgan, þæt ge fullice
þysum gewrite gelyfan.
 193. Seo him drihtne simle þanc ge þæs ge ealra his geofena,
lof and wuldor a in ecnesse a butan ende, amen.

HomU 37 (Nap 46)
B3.4.37.
Napier 1883, no. 46: 'Larspell': Napier 232-42.



 1. Larspell.
 2. Men ða leofestan, Sanctus Gregorius cwæð: ic eow halsige
on ðone drihten, þe gescop heofenas and eorðan and ealle gesceafta, and
on ða halgan þrynnesse and on ða twelf apostolas and on ealle godes
halgan and on þa cyrcan, þe ge to gelyfað, and on þæt halige
fulluht, þe ge underfengon, þæt ge forlætan þa unnyttan spræca
gewurðan and þa unnyttan geþancas of eowrum heortum, þonne ge cumað
into godes cyrican.
 9. And utan mid inweardre heortan þencan ymbe þa godcundan
lare, þe us godcunde lareowas lærað and sæcgað ymbe þæt
heofoncunde rice, hu we hit begitan magon and wið deofles costnunge us
gescildan.
 13. Cyrice is þære sawle scip and sceld on domes dæg, and
heo is us gesceapen to gebedhuse, na to nanum gemothuse, butan ymbe þæt
heofoncunde rice and lare.
 16. Ðonne is hit gecweden on halgum bocum, þæt ælc man
hæfð twegen lareowas on dæg and twegen on niht, oðer us læreð to
heofona rices wuldre, þæt is godes engel, oþer us lærð to
hellewites brogan, þæs nama is deofol.
 20. Ðonne to sunnan upgange þonne bringað hy gode on gewrite,
se engel eall, þæt we on ðære nihte to gode gedoð, and se deofol
eall, þæt we to yfele gedoð and gefremmað, and wile oferstælan
þone engel, gif he mæg, mid þam yfelum weorcum.
 24. And hy cumað to sunnan setlgange and bringað gode eall,
þæt we to gode gedoð and eac to yfele.
 26. And swa hy us eac lædað into cyrican, þonne lærð us
godes engel stilnesse and gemetlice spræce and smeaunge ymbe godes beboda
and we gehyrað ures drihtnes lofsangas þærinne, and þæt we habban
gastlice þeawas and bebodu æt urum heortum and herigen urne scyppend ealra
gesceafta.
 31. Þonne lærð us se deofol unstilnesse and ungemetlice
hleahtras/ and unnytte spræce and unnytte geþancas and tælnesse and
treowleasnesse godes beboda.
 34. Ðonne se ðe oðerne tælan wille, þonne gange he
ærest on digle stowe and besceawige hine sylfne and beþence hine sylfne
and beðence, hwæðer hine ne mæge ænig man getælan.
 37. Ne bið þeah næfre nan man leahterleas ne synleas ealra
þinga.
 38. Wa ðæs mannes sawle, þe ða unnyttan spræca sprecð
and þa ungemetlican hleahtras drifð innan cyrcan, and eac þam men, þe
wyrigeð his fæder oððe his moder oððe his hlaford oððe his
biscop oððe his scrift.
 42. Ða þe þæt doð, hi beoð asceadene fram þære
heofonlican cyrican and eallum hyre gemanan to deofla gerime.
 44. Nytan hy na, hu heard wite hy ðæs to leanes habban sceolan
æfter domes dæge, butan hy hit gebetan ær heora endedæge.
 47. And us beodað ure godcundan lareowas þurh witegena word,
ægðer ge gehadodum mannum ge læwedum, ðæt ærest ða godes
þeowas, þonne heo into cyrican cuman, þæt hy habban gastlice þeawas
æt heora heortan and mynsterlice wisan on þeawlicum andgite godes beboda
eallum folce to bysne.
 52. Ðonne lærað hy us eac swa oft, swa we oftost magon,
þæt we secan ure cyrican mid ælmessum and mid urum clænum gebedum
inweardlicre heortan.
 55. And þancien we þam ælmihtigan drihtne ealre þære
are, þe he us on twelf monðum to forlætt.
 56. Ne recð god ælmihtig þære forgolpenan ælmessan ne
ðæs gymeleasan gebedes.
 58. Ðæt hine lærð se deofol, þæt he stande and
gorette and locige underbæc ut.
 59. Þæt bið gymeleas gebed, and he hit ne mæg gebetan,
forðan þe se deofol hæfð his heortan on his handa, and heo bið swa
heard swa stan oððe flint ongean godes beboda, and heo bið swa liðig
swa clað, and heo mylteð swa wex æt fyre ongean deofles lare and his
gedwolan.
 64. Ac he sceal eallum mode and eallum mægne to gode þencan
ymbe þæt heofoncunde rice and bigean his cneowa and his hleor to eorðan
and lætan his unnyttan geþancas of his mode.
 68. Wa þæs mannes sawle, þe nyle geswican unnytre spræce
and unnyttes geþances; he bið wyrsa þonne hund oððe æniges cynnes
nyten, þonne he into cyrcan cymð, forðam þe se man bið gefullad, ac
he þæt abrecð.
 72. Forðam he amyrð ægðer ge hine sylfne ge mænige
oðre men, forðam ælce man hatað þone hund and drifð hine ut of
þære cyrican, ac man ne deð þæne yfelan man swa.
 75. Sanctus Paulus apostolus wæs sprecende and sæde, þæt
him godes engel æteowde sume arlease sawle and swyðe synfulle ut gangende
of þam earman lichaman.
 78. And he geseah, þæt þær wæron micel meniu engla and
deofla; and þa fuhton swiðe þearle þa englas and þa deoflu ymbe þa
earman sawle; and þa deoflu hy genaman æt þam englum and oferstældon
hy mid hire yfelan weorcum, þe heo wyrcende wæs.
 82. And þa wæron þa englas swyðe sarige on heora mode.
 83. And þa deoflu hy potedon and þoddetton þa earman sawle
and heton hy ut faran raðe of þam lichaman swyðe heardlice and se lichama
wæs þa gyt sprecende, and he ongan swiðe yfele and bæd his deaðes
and sæde, þæt him næfre ær nære swa wa, swa him þa wæs;
and him andswaredon þa deoflu, and hy sædon, þæt him wære micele
mare and wyrse yfel toweard.
 90. Ða axode Sanctus Paulus þone engel swyðe forhtigendre
stæmne and cwæð to him: min hlaford, hwæt is seo ungesælige
sawel?
 92. Ða sæde he him, þæt he wære cyrican slitere, and
þonne he þærin com, þonne hyscte he on ða godcundan lareowas, and he
tælde ða cristenan men, þe on ðone ælmihtigan drihten gelyfdon, and
he wæs æfre unnytte word sprecende innan godes temple, and unnytte
geþancas he ðohte þærinne.
 98. And þonne se goda heap ongan singan and god herian and
ræddan godspell and sædon ymbe Cristes tocyme and ymbe his þrowunge and
his haligra, þonne sæde he, þæt hy lugon and hit worhton heom sylfe.
 101. And him ðuhte þonne seo tid to lang, þæt he hit
gehyrde and þærinne wære, and wende hine þonne aweg, þæt he ne
mihte hit gehyran.
 104. And se deofol hine lærde þonne eall þæt and lædde
hine þonne ut of þære cyrican be ðam locce.
 106. Swa oft, swa he þærinne wæs, him þuhte æfre to
lang, hwonne he moste beon ymbe þæs lichaman oferfylle and ymbe his agene
unþeawas; and he wæs æwbreca, and he nolde næfre his synna
behreowsian ne andettan his scrifte.
 110. And he sceal standan on þære fyrenan ea oð his weleras
oð domes dæg, ðær ne bið nan gefea ne nan blis, ne ðær ne
bið nan lufu.
 112. Ða cwæð se engel eft to Paule: folga me, þonne
æteowe ic ðe sumes soðfæstes mannes sawle ut gangende of þam
lichaman.
 115. Ða eodon hy.
 115. Þa ymbe lytel þa clypode se engel to Paule and cwæð
him to: loca hider.
 116. Þa locade he þider; ða geseah he þa halgan sawle ut of
þam godan lichaman gangende, and he geseah micele menigu engla and deofla,
and hy fuhton stiðlice ymbe þa halgan sawle.
 120. And þa englas hy genamon æt þam deoflum and
oferstældon hy mid hire godum dædum.
 121. And þa deoflu wendon sceamigende aweg, and hy wæron on
miclum unsælum.
 123. And þa englas wæron on swiðe micelre blisse, and hy
heton byrigean þone godan lichaman and þus cwædon: <foreign>Benedicat omnia
opera eius dominus</foreign>; ðæt is on englisc: gebletsige eall hire weorc
ælmihtig drihten.
 127. And se goda lichama wæs þa get sprecende and þancode
gode ealre þære are and þære blisse and þære lisse, þe he him
lænde.
 129. And he sæde, þæt him nære næfre ær swa eðe
ne swa myrige on nanum yfele, swa him þa wæs, and he wæs biddende his
lifes.
 131. And him andswaredon þa englas and sædon, þæt him
wære hundteontigfealdlice mare myrhð and blis toweard.
 133. Ða axode Paulus þone engel, hwæt seo gode sawel
wære.
 134. Ða sæde he him, þæt heo wære mildheortnesse
fyligende and staðolfæst on hire heortan wið deofles costnungum, and
þæt heo wære herigende æfre on hire life urne drihten and urne
scyppend ealra gesceafta and ealle his halgan.
 138. And heo lufode þa halgan cyrican and gastlice gebedu and
fæsten and ælmessan and þa godcundan heapas.
 140. And eal cristen folc heo lufode swa hire fæder oððe
moder and sæde, þæt hy wæron hire geswustra.
 142. And þonne se heap ongan singan godes lofsangas and ræddon
godspel, þonne bletsode heo hy, and hire þuhte seo tid to scort, þæt
heo ne moste gehyran ymbe Cristes þrowunge secgan and his haligra and ymbe
his tocyme, and hu heo mihte hellewites brogan wiðstandan and þæt
heofoncunde rice geearnian.
 148. And se ðe wæs cyrican ehtere and nolde gehyran ne gelyfan
on þa godcundan lare, þonne onscunode heo hine, swylce he wære hire
gefa.
 150. And heo nolde næfre cuman to godes weofode butan hire
ælmessan, forðam nan man nah to godes cyrican ne to godes weofode
idelhende/ to cumene, þæt he ne bringe be ðam dæle, þe him god
læne and him to onhagude.
 154. Forðan hit is geræd and gecweden on halgum bocum,
ðæt, swa swa wæter adwæsceð fyr, swa adwæsceð seo ælmesse
þa synne.
 157. And sceal beon seo gode sawel on Abrahames fæðmum oð
domes dæg.
 158. Be ðam we magon niman bysne be woruldþingum; se man, þe
bringð medsceat þam gerefan, se geærendað bet, þonne se, ðe
nænne ne bringð.
 161. We eow sæcgað to soðan, þæt, se ðe nele her his
synna nu andettan his scrifte and betan, swa he him tæcð, hine sceal on
domes dæg gesceamian beforan gode and eallum his halgum and eac eallum
deoflum, swa þam men dyde, þe wurde færinga nacod beforan eallon folce,
and he nyste þonne, mid hwam he þone sceamiendan lichaman bewruge.
 167. Swa him bið on domes dæg, butan he his synna ær bewreo
mid andetnesse and mid dædbote and mid ælmessan and mid geswicennesse and
mid halgum gebedum and mid fæstenum and mid manegum godum weorcum.
 171. Ða soðfæstan men þonne geseoð heora wuldor and
heora wlite and blisse hym toweard, and þa arleasan þonne geseoð heora
wite and heora suselcwale hym toweard.
 174. We magon aðwean mid ælmesdædum ure synna of urum
lichaman.
 175. And we eow biddað, for eowres drihtnes lufan, þæt ge
dæghwamlice dælan ælmessan be ðam dæle, þe ælcum men to
onhagige, þeah hit ne sy butan feorðan dæl anes hlafes, godes þances
ælmesmannum oððe wydewum oððe steopcildum oððe þeowum mannum
oððe ælþeodigum mannum.
 180. Wa ðæs mannes sawle, þe betynð his duru ongean godes
þearfan for ðam þingon, þæt hine lærð se deofol; swa him bið
betyned heofona rices duru ongean on domes dæge.
 184. Ac beon we æfre cumliðe; ure sawel bið Cristes cuma on
þam forhtigendan domes dæge.
 185. Utan lufian ure cyrican, forðam heo bið ure friðiend and
werigend wið þæt micele fyr on domes dæg.
 187. And wyrcan we simle brycge and þa betan.
 188. Ðeah se man nime ænne stan and lecge on ful sloh,
þæt se ælmesman mæge mid þam oðrum fet steppan on ða clænan
healfe, þæt him bið micel ælmesse and micel med for gode.
 191. Eac beðearf seo sawel on domes dæg rihtes weges and
clænes and staðolfæstre brycge ofer þone glideran weg hellewites
brogan.
 194. Bærnon we urne lichaman mid clænum gebedum æt urum
heortan and mid fæstenum and mid ælmesdædum.
 196. And toforan eallum oðrum þingum wite gehwa, þæt he
hæbbe clæne heortan to eallum cristenum mannum; he sceal eac lætan his
wyrignesse and lufian his gebedu, and he sceal forlætan yfele geþohtas
æt his heortan, forðan þæt yfele geþanc hine lærð se deofol.
 200. Ðonne ne beo nan man oðres mannes ælmessan to
geornfull, butan he wite, þæt he mæge ægðer gebetan ge his agene
synne ge eac oðres mannes, forþan ðe ælc man hæfð on his agenre
byrðene genoh.
 204. Ðonne geþænce ælc man himself, hu swiðe man
pinsað þa sawle on domes dæg, þonne man sett þa synne and þa sawle
on ða wæge, and hy man wegeð, swa man deð gold wið penegas.
 208. And gif þa penegas teoð swiðor þonne þæt gold,
þonne miswyrð þam men hraðe.
 209. Swa bið þære sawle and þære synne; gif seo synn
tihð swyðor, þonne seo sawel, þonne farað hy butu on forwyrd.
 211. And þa synna yrnað æfter þære earman sawle and
hire þus to cweðað: hwi noldest ðu, earme, betan ure synna, þa þu
hy onfenge þurh ure ælmessan?
 214. Hwy noldest ðu, forwyrhte, biddan þe arfulle þingeras
wið þone ælmihtigan þrym þære halgan þrynnesse and æt
þære soðan annesse?
 216. Hwi noldest ðu, ungesælige, andettan þinum drihtne and
biddan þone halgan Michael, þæt he wære þe fultumigend, and ealle
his halgan?
 219. And þonne get þus gretað grimmum stæfnum: hwæt
sceoldon þe, þeodeorðan fylnes, ure ælmessan?
 221. Ðu us gehete godcunde gebedo and clæne fæsten and
gastlice wæccan, and þu hit us aluge; and þu nystest þe sylfum ane tid
dæges witod lif æfter urum deaðe, and þu ne mihtest him wiðstandan
mid þinum golde ne mid þinum seolfre, ne, þeah þu ahtest eall þysne
middaneard to æhte, þæt þu ne sceoldest wyrmum to mete and to
gebeddan weorðan and wreon þe mid þære cealdan eorðan, þær ðu
sceoldest to fule and to fracoðe weorðan and to laðlicre ansyne eallum
þinum freondum.
 230. And we gelyfdon on ðe swa on urne drihten, and þu
hæfst us ealle beswicen and belæwed.
 231. We wendon, þæt þu wære godfyrht and hæfdest
gastlice gebæru beforan us, ac ðu hæfdest deofles geþanc æt
þinre heortan, and þu wære an licetere, and þe þuhte æfre to
lytel ure ælmesse.
 235. Ac heo þe sceal beon nu swyðe grimme forgolden, þæt
þu wære swa ungeþancfull þinum drihtne, ne þu, ne gelyfdest on ða
godcundan lare, þe þe laðedon dæghwamlice to ðam uplican rice.
 238. And þu wære swa gifre swa hund, and þu næfre nære
full þe ma, þe hell.
 240. Sceamige þe nu þinra unðeawa betwux deaðe and
deoflum.
 241. And þu wære þær morð and myrðra, ac þu ne miht
her swa beon.
 242. Ac þu his scealt nu her wite habban on þære grimman
helle mid deoflum and mid dracum and mid wælslitendum wyrmum and mid þam
grimmestan suselcwale a on ecnysse.
 245. Geþence gehwa himsylf, hu sceort and hu earmlic þis
læne lif is.
 246. Ne yldan we na fram dæge to dæge, þæt we to gode ne
gecyrron, forðam þe we us nytan witod lif oð æfen, ne we nyton,
hwæðer we motan eft dæges gebidan.
 249. Ne us ne þearf na tweonian, þæt we oðrum ne scylon
gebyrian butan tweon, oððe heofonwarena cyninge oððe hellewites deofle,
swa hwæðer swa we her geearniað.
 252. Hit is earmlic and sorhlic eallum cristenum mannum to
gehyranne and to geseonne eall, þæt man us foresægð ymbe Cristes
hidercyme and his þrowunge and ymbe hellewites brogan.
 256. And se man bið swa blind and swa deaf, and he bið swa
heard swa stan, and he ne mæg ongitan þa godcundan lare, þe hine
lærð and laðað to urum drihtne fram deofles anwealde and his
yrmðum.
 259. Æghwylcum men is to onscunianne ælc oferfyll on ælcum
timan, forðam þe heo is drihtne swyðe lað.
 261. Oferfyll bið þære sawle feond and þæs lichaman
unhæl.
 262. Se ðe his to fela nymð, he bið wodum men gelic; and hit
bið mægbana and morðslaga, and hit ne murneð for nanum men, ne for
fæder ne for meder ne for broðer ne for swuster ne for nanum gesibban
men.
 266. Ealle unsibba hit wyrcð, and hit alucð þæs mannes mod
þurh deofles costnunge.
 267. Ðonne secgað us ure godcundan lareowas, þæt hy nyton
þa tid, hwænne we of þysum earman life gewitan sceolon þe ma, þonne
se þeof wat, þe ðone oðerne lætt and lærð, hwonne seo tid
cymð, þe he hy begen on forwyrd forlæt.
 272. Swa bið þam godcundum mannum, þe us laðiað to
heofona rices wuldre, þæt hy nyton þa tid, þe se ælmihtiga god us
wyle habban and to his rice gelaðian, þær we motan beon, gif we hit
willað geearnian, on wlite and on wynne mid englum and mid heahenglum and mid
þam apostolican werode, mid fæder and mid suna and mid þam halgan gaste
a butan ælcum ende.
 279. God us to ðam gefultumige, amen.

START_TEXT

HomU 38 (Nap 47)
B3.4.38.
Napier 1883, no. 47: 'Larspel and scriftboc': Napier 242-5.



 1. Larspel and scriftboc.
 2. Leofan men, doð, swa ic eow bidde, gehyrað, þæt soð
is.
 3. Understande se, ðe wille, hit is swutol and gesyne þæt
þes þeodscipe is swiðe forsyngod; and þy is onsæge oft, næs
æne, here and hunger, bryne and blodgyte, unwæstm and unweder, stalu and
steorfa and fela ungelimpa.
 7. Ðonne is micel þearf ealre þisse þeode helpes and
rædes.
 8. Forðam to forð heo is bedæled gyt and gefyrn wæs
rædes and rihtes for gode and for worulde.
 10. And her unrihta fela rixað on lande, and nis a fela manna,
þe hogie ymbe þa bote swa georne, swa man sceolde.
 12. Ac dæghwamlice man yceð yfel æfter oðrum and unriht
ræreð and ælc riht lytleð for gode and for worulde.
 14. And þam man talað wace, þe woldan for godes ege georne
riht lufian, gif hy swa mihton, and þa syndon mæðe and munde bedælde
ealles to swiðe, forðam swicdom is swiðra, þonne sy wisdom, wide geond
þas þeode, and swa wæs to lange.
 18. Eala, eala, fela is nu ða fracodra getrywða wide mid
mannum.
 19. Ac soð is, þæt ic sæcge, gecnawe se, ðe wylle,
seldan cymð god wæstm of yfelum sæde, ne wyrð hit æfre ful god
ær on þisse ðeode, ær man aweodige þa unriht and þa manweorc,
þe man wide sæwð and gesawen hæfð be æghwylcum ende.
 23. Ac wolde man geswican þara mandæda, þonne godade hit
sona.
 25. Leofan men, se halga Iohannes cwæð: æfter þam
þusende bið se deofol unbunden.
 26. Nu is þæt þusendfeald getæl agan æfter
mennisclicum getæle, ac hit is on þæs hælendes andweardnesse,
hwænne he hit geendige.
 28. Ðæt þusendfeald getæl is fulfremed, ac se wat his
geendunge, þe ealle þing mid his agenre mihte gesceop.
 30. Manega men wenað, þæt þes middaneard scule standan on
six þusend wintrum, forðan þe god ælmihtig gescop ealle þing binnan
six dagum.
 33. Ac þæt getæl wise witan hit on oðre wisan
getrahtnedon.
 34. Ða six dagas, þe god ælmihtig gesceop þurh his agene
mihte on soðre þrynnesse, þæt is fæder and sunu and halig gast and
is an soð god rixigende and gemende ealra his gesceafta a butan ende.
 38. Ða six dagas getacniað, þæt we scylon on geswince
libban her on life and æfter þissum life for urum godum dædum mede
onfon æt urum scyppende on þam seofoðan dæge.
 41. Ælces mannes tima bið geendod binnan seofan daga fyrste;
and þonne gerest he hine, and seo sawel fehð to þam, þe se lichama
ær geworhte, oððæt se eahtoða dæg cymð; þæt is domes
dæg, þæt is se eca dæg, se langa dæg æfter þam dome, se
myriga dæg, se halgesta sunnandæg, godes dæg and ealra halgena
dæg.
 47. Ðæs dæges sawla and lichaman beoð gesamnode.
 48. Þy dæge blissiað þa, ðe sunnandæges freols
heoldan and heora lencten wel gefæsten and þa twelf ymbrendagas gode to
þance and freols and fæsten wel geheoldan.
 51. Ðonne anes gehwylces mannes dæda cyðað, hwylce
clæne beoð, hwylce fule; þæt fyr hit geswutelað.
 53. Ðonne we scylon standan beforan þam gyldenan cynestole,
þæt we agyldan gode full gescead for urum dædum, þæt we onfon
æt him swa ece wite, swa ece mede.
 55. Ðus bið eall þæt þusendfeald getæl geendod and
ealle þa deopan þing and þa bradnessa and þa langsumnessa and þara
cyninga rice and þara gerefena unriht and reaflac and deopnessa and woge
domas and prættas.
 59. Ðonne graniað and waniað þa, þe her blissedon and
fægnedon.
 60. Ðonne bið heom heora meodudrenc, win and beor eall to ecum
þurste awend.
 62. Ealle þas sorga hi magon awendan heom to blisse, gif hi her
on life to bote gecyrrað and mid ælmessum and mid mæssesangum heom to
gode hælo secað.
 65. Ðæt getæl, þe we ymbe spræce hæfdon, hit is gyt
geornlice to asmeagenne, and hit is to apinsianne, hwæt hit getacnað, gif
hit bið atrahtnod, hu hit to ðam wyrsan getæle belimpð.
 68. Hit is gecweden and on halgum gewritum geræd, þæt ehta
synd heafodgyltas.
 69. Se forma is ælces yfeles angin ord, se is <foreign>superbia</foreign>
gehaten.
 70. Se oðer <foreign>inuidia</foreign>, þæt is anda.
 71. Se ðridda is <foreign>ira</foreign>, þæt is yrre.
 71. Se feorða is <foreign>tristitia</foreign>, þæt is unrotnes.
 72. Se fifta is <foreign>auaritia</foreign>, þæt is gitsung.
 73. Se sixta is <foreign>uentris ingluuies</foreign>, þæt is oferfyll.
 74. Se seofeða is <foreign>luxuria</foreign>, þæt is galscipe.
 74. Se eahtoða is <foreign>uana gloria</foreign>, þæt is idel gylp.
 75. Manega þing we mihton secgan be þissum unþeawum, ac us
þincð gefædlic, þæt we ælcne cristenne man warnian wið þas
egeslican and þas deofollican coðe, þæt is wið þas hellican
unþeawas.
 79. Ðæt is soð and na leas, þæt swa hwa, swa ænig
þissera unðeawa begæð oð his endedæg, he sceal beon cwylmiende
mid deofle a butan ende, butan he hit gebete.
