HomU 39 (Nap 48)
B3.4.39.2.
Napier 1883, no. 48: 'Ammonitio amici': Napier 246-50.



 1. <foreign>Ammonitio amici</foreign>, þæt ys freondlic mynegung.
 2. Eala þu wynsuma man, þu æðela wer, þu godes anlicnys,
ic bidde þe, ic lære þe, ic bebeode þe: geclænsa þe, afeorma þe
ærest þine eagan fram lyðre gesihðe and cweð to drihtne: ahwyrf mine
eagan, þæt hig idelnysse ne gymon.
 6. And þine earan awend fram fulre spræce and murcnunge.
 7. Geþenc, þæt þa beoð eadige, þe gehyrað godes word
and þæt gehealdað.
 8. Gehega þine earan mid þornigum hege, þæt ys mid godes
ege, þæt þu ne gehyre lustum mode þæra twyspræcena word, swa se
witega þe lærð þus cweðende: <foreign>sepi aures tuas spinis</foreign>.
 12. Awend þine nosu fram unalyfedum stencum, þæt þu
mæge wynsumlice cweðan: syn we æðele stencas beforan godes
gesihðe.
 14. Geheald þine tungan fram awyrgednyssum and manaðum and
idelre spræce, forþan on hyre ys deað and lif.
 16. Se ðe gehealt his tungan wið unþeawas, he gehealt his
sawle fram angsumnysse.
 17. Gescyld þine handa fram blodgyte, þæt hig forð bringon
<foreign>myrram/ probatissimam</foreign>, þæt synt gode dæda.
 19. Hwæt, ic þe bidde and beode, þæt þu þine fet
gescylde wið unþeawas.
 20. Lufa sibsumnysse and geþwærnysse and geriht þine stapas
to godes wege.
 22. And geheald þine heortan caflice wið unþeawas, þæt
þu mæge þæne geseon, þe þisne cwide gecwæð: <foreign>beati mundo
corde, quoniam ipsi deum uidebunt</foreign>.
 24. Hafa godne geleafan to þam soðan gode, forþan he sceal
beon grundweall þines lifes, and se hiht sceal beon þin scyld ealles
þines lifes, and seo soðe lufu sceal beon þin wuldorbeah; mid þissum
þrym þingum þu miht cuman to þinra synna forgyfennesse.
 30. Feower þing synt ealra þinga behefost þam arwyrðan men,
þam godes frynd, þam þe þencð to þam ecan life.
 32. Þæt synt feower sweras, þa synd þus geciged on lyden:
<foreign>iustitia</foreign>, þæt ys rihtwisnys; and oðer hatte <foreign>prudentia</foreign>, þæt ys
snoternys.
 34. Þridde ys <foreign>temperantia</foreign>, þæt ys gemetgung.
 35. Feorðe ys <foreign>fortitudo</foreign>, þæt ys strengð.
 35. Ærest hyt gedafenað, þæt se man beo rihtwis, þæt
he wite mid fullum gesceade, þæt an soð god ys on þære þrynnysse
and on þære soðan godcundnysse.
 38. Þærto he sceal beon snoter, þæt he geglenge þone
wisdom mid snotornysse and gemetgige þa snotornysse mid þære strengðe,
þæt he wurðe wær wyð deofles costnunge and wis wið his
menigfealdnysse.
 42. Geþenc betwyx þissum wordum, hu sceorte and hu broclice
synt þisses lifes dagas.
 43. Nys nan þing on þissum life swa gesælig þing, swa
þæt/ is, þæt se man hine gescylde wið þa toweardan witu.
 45. Þæt þu wast, þæt þu eart ece, and þæt þin
sawl aa sceal wunian oððe on wite for þinum gyltum oððe on blisse for
þinum goddædum.
 48. And þæt þu scealt deopþanclum geþance asmeagan,
þæt þu þæt god gefylle, þe þu canst, þe læs þe god
upbrede þone godspellican cwide: <foreign>seruus, sciens uoluntatem domini sui et non
faciens, plagis uapulabit multis</foreign>; þæt ys on englisc: se cniht, þe wat,
hwæt his hlafordes willa syg, and he þæt forgægð, he byð
wyrðe, þæt he beo teartlice geswungen.
 54. Þisses ic me ondræde swyðe to gebidanne, buton me godes
gife gemiltsige.
 56. Þonne cweðe ic, þæt se mæg beon forht, þe nat,
hwæt byð godes willa, and þeah sceal to dome beon gebroht.
 58. Ðonne þu, la leofa freond, byst gefullod, þu byst godes
sawle and lichama, and god þe betæcð his englum oð þinne
endedæg.
 60. Swa oft, swa þu agyltst, hig gewendað fram þe; and hig
dæghwamlice cyðað þine dæda beforan godes gesihðe.
 62. And deofol awrit þærongen ealle þine misdæda,
þæt þin sawl and þin lichama todælað heora gemænscype.
 64. Ne cepð nan hungrig man næfre his gereordes ne swyðor,
þonne þa sceoccan doð þære sawle.
 66. Ærest stæpð se modiga deofol to mid his gefilce and
wyle wið þinre sawle campian and þe upgebredan ælc þæra
þinga, þe þu wið god agylte þurh modignysse.
 68. Þæt byð modignys, þæt ænig man forseo godes
beboda and þa forgymeleasige.
 70. Seo modignyss ys ealra unþeawa angin and ealra mægna
hryre.
 71. Æfter þam modigan unþeawe in gæð seo fule
<foreign>fornicatio</foreign>, seo hatte fylðe on englisc.
 73. Nys deofle nan unþeaw leofra and nan gode laðra, þonne
ænig cristen man gewyrce his lichaman and his sawle to deofles
eardungstowe.
 75. Se deð swa, þe his gehalgodan sawle mid þam fullwihte
besmit mid þam fulan galscipe.
 77. Ealra swyðust deofol gewylt mancyn mid þissum twam
unþeawum, þæt ys mid modignysse and galscipe.
 78. Swa god cwæð þurh Iob: <foreign>sub umbra dormit in secreto
calami, (80) in locis humentibus</foreign>.
 80. <foreign>calamus</foreign>, þæt byð hreod, and þæt tacnað þa
modigan.
 81. <foreign>loca humentia</foreign>, þæt beoð wæte stowa, þa
getacniað þu fulan gælsan.
 82. Heræfter cumað þære sawle brogan, unasmeagendlicu
yrmðu.
 83. Eall, þæt heo and se lichama to unrihte gefremedon
dæges oððe nihtes, wintres oððe sumeres, eall hyt byð þær
cuð, and byð mycel gewinn betweox deoflum and englum.
 86. Gif þæra misdæda beoð ma, þonne þæra oðra,
þonne willað þa deoflu habban þa geswenctan sawle; gif þær beoð
gemette ma þæra godra weorca, þonne þæra oðra, þonne underfoð
þa englas þa eadigan sawle mid myclum lofsange and hig gebringað to ecre
blisse.
 91. Symle þu scealt, la geornfulla godes cempa, understandan,
þæt þu hæfst wið strangne gemæne.
 93. Eall þis lyft ys full hellicra deofla, þa geondscriðað
ealne middangeard; and for wel oft hig beswicað þeawfulle weras, þæt
hig doð, þæt gode lað ys.
 96. Ac hig gecyrrað wel hrædlice þurh þæra engla
fultum, þe dæges and nihtes him abutan farað.
 97. Þonne þu, godes wer, to þinum gereorde ga, gym þu
þæs earmestan geornlicost, þe æt þinre dura sitte; hyt byð
swyðe uncuð, hu gecweme he sy gode.
 100. Beo æfre þin mete and þin rest gode betæht and mid
þære halgan rode gebletsod.
 101. Bide þinne drihten, þæt þu mæge and mote þurh
his mihte deofol and his hete ofercuman and to his miltse becuman, þær
þu hæfst miltse and blisse a butan ende.

HomU 40 (Nap 50)
B3.4.40.
Napier 1883, no. 50: 'Larspell': Napier 266-74.



 1. Larspell.
 2. We secgeað urum cynehlaforde and eallum folce cyðan
wyllað: þæt is ærest, þæt we ealle to gode ælmihtigum georne
gebugan and his beboda healdan and unrihtes ealle geswican and to ælcan
rihte us sylfe wenian and weman and don, swa us þearf is, andettan ure synna
and betan georne and þanonforð geswican, swa we eornost magon, and aa urum
hlaforde holdlice and rihtlice hyran.
 9. And þæt godes circan beon beteran mæðe and munde
wyrðe, þonne hig ær þysan wæron: þæt is, þæt cyricgrið
binnan wagum and gehalgodes cyninges handgrið stande efen unwemme.
 12. And cristenum cyninge gebyrað on cristenre þeode, þæt
he sy, eallswa riht is, folces frofer and rihtwis hyrde ofer cristene heorde.
 14. And him gebyreð, þæt he eallum mægene cristendom
rære and godes cyrcean æghwar fyrðrie and fryðie and godes are
mundie æfre and eall cristen folc sybbie and sehte mid rihtre lage, swa he
geornost mæge, and þurh ælc þingc rihtwisnesse lufige for gode and
for worulde, forþam þurh þæt he sceal sylf fyrmest geþeon and his
þeodscipe eac swa, þe he riht lufie for gode and for worulde.
 22. And him gebyrað, þæt he geornlice fylste þam, þe
riht willan, and a hetelice styre þam, þe þwyres wyllan.
 24. He sceal mandæde men þreagean þearle mid woroldlicre
steore, and he sceal morðwyrhtan, hlafordswican and manswaran, mannslagan and
mægslagan, cyrichatan and sacerdbanan, hadbrecan and æwbrecan, þeofas
and þeodsceaþan, ryperas and reaferas, leogeras and liceteras, wedlogan and
wærlogan hatian and hynan and eallum godes feondum styrnlice wiðstandan.
 30. And ægðer he sceal beon mid rihte ge milde ge reðe,
milde þam godum and styrne þam yfelum.
 32. La, þurh hwæt sceal godes þeowum and godes þearfum
frið and fultum cuman, butan þurh Crist and þurh cristenne cyningc?
 35. Þi he sceal boclarum hlystan swyðe georne and godes beboda
geornlice healdan and gelome wið wytan wisdom smeagean, gif he gode wyle
rihtlice hyran.
 38. Ælc riht cynestol stent on þrym stapelum, þe fullice
ariht stent: an is <foreign>oratores</foreign>, and oðer is <foreign>laboratores</foreign>, and þrydde is
<foreign>bellatores</foreign>.
 40. <foreign>oratores</foreign> syndon gebedmen, þe gode sceolon þeowian
dæges and nihtes for þæne cyngc and for ealne þeodscipe þingian
georne.
 42. <foreign>laboratores</foreign> syndon weorcmen, þe tilian sceolon þæs,
þe eall þeodscipe big sceal lybban.
 44. <foreign>bellatores</foreign> syndon wigmen, þe eard sculon werian wiglice mid
wæpnon.
 45. On þysum þrym stapelum sceal ælc cynestol standan mid
rihte; and, awacyge heora ænig, sona se stol scylfð; and, fulberste heora
ænig, þonne hryst se stol nyðer, and þæt wyrð þære þeode
eall to unþearfe.
 49. Ac stalige man and strangie and trymme hi georne mid wislicre
godes lage and mid rihtlicre woroldlage; þæt wyrð þam þeodscipe to
langsuman ræde.
 52. And soð is, þæt we secgað, awacyge se cristendom,
sona scylfð se cynedom.
 54. And we cyðað eac eorlan and heretogan, deman and gerefan,
þæt hig agan þearfe, þæt hi georne unrihtes geswican and
rihtwisnysse lufian for gode and for worolde and nahwar þurh undom for feo ne
for freondscipe forgyman heora wisdom, swa þæt hig wendan unriht to rihte
oððon undom gedeman earmum to yrmðe.
 59. Ac þæt hig gehadedum mannum fylstan bet to godes lagum,
þonne hig ær þysum dydon.
 61. Hit wæs nu lange, þæt wæron to wide godes laga
laðe and lara forsawne, and woroldlaga syndan innan þysan earde wraðe
forhwyrfde on æghwylcan ende; and þæt is gesyne wide and side, þæt
man god gremede mid þam unrihte ealles to lange.
 66. Betan þa nu georne, þa þe þyssere þeode nu sceolan
rædan, swa swa god wyle, gif hig gode willan rihtlice cweman and on þam
myclan dæge heom sylfum gebeorgan bet, þonne þa dydon, þe beforan
wæron, þe unriht arærdan to forwyrde heom sylfum.
 70. And we eac þæs habbað fela byrsta and bysmora gebiden,
and gif we ænige bote gebidan sceolan, þonne mote we þæs to gode
earnian bet, þonne we ær þysan dydan.
 73. Forþam ær þysan wæs gehwar swicdom swyðra, þonne
wisdom, and þuhte hwilum wisast, se þe wæs swicolost and se þe
lytelicost cuðe leaslice hiwian unsoð to soðe and undom deman oðrum to
hynðe.
 77. Ac wa heom þæs wærscipes and ealles þæs
weorðscipes.
 78. Ne dohte hit ær þysan inne ne ute, ac wæs here and
hunger, bryne and blodgyte on gewelhwylcan ende oft and gelome; and us stalu
and cwalu, hol and hete and rypera reaflac derede swiðe þearle, and eac us
unwederu for oft weoldon unwæstma.
 82. Forþam on þison earde wæs and git is, swa hit þincan
mæg, unrihta fela and tealte getrywða æghwar mid mannon.
 84. Fela syn forsworene and swyðe forlogone and wedd eac
abrocene oft and gelome; and þæt is gesyne on þisse þeode, þæt us
godes yrre hetelice on sæt, gecnawe, se þe cunne.
 88. Ac uton don, swa us þearf is, beon ymbe þa bote, geswican
unrihtes and gebugan to rihte; þonne geearnige we, gif we þæt wyllað,
sona godes mildse.
 91. And riht is eac, þæt godes þeowas, biscopas and abbodas,
munecas and mynecena, preostas and nunnan, regole fylgean and regollice lybban
oððon woruldare þolian, and þæt þa, þe rihte heora lif lybban,
þæt man þa georne fyrðrige and wurðige, and þæt þa utlagan
weorþan, þe to godes rihte gebugan nellan, buton hig to rihte gecirran.
 97. Ac gebuge manna gehwylc georne to rihte and muneca gehwylc into
his mynstre oððe of earde mid ealle gewite.
 99. And riht is, þæt ænige wæpnmen on mynecena beodderne
ne etan ne ne drincan ne læwede men on muneca, buton hit mid urum hlaforde
sy oððon elles hwylc, þe maran godes ege habbe, þæt hit for his
neaweste þe betere beo for gode and for worolde, and hyra regol huru ne sy a
ðe awyrdra.
 104. And preostas and nunnan heora lif rihtan be godes miltse and
be heora are.
 106. And ealle godes þeowas we biddað and lærað and huru
þinga mæssepreostas, þæt hig gode hyran and heora clænnysse
healdan and beorgan heom sylfum wið godes yrre and wið þone weallendan
bryne, þe wealleð on helle.
 110. Full georne hig witan, þæt hig nagon mid rihte þurh
hæmedþing wifes gemanan, ac hit is þe wyrse, þe sume habbað twa
oððe ma, and sume forlætað, þa hig ær hæfdon, and be lifiendre
cwenan eft oðre nimað, swa ænigum cristenum men ne gedafenað to donne
ne huru þam gehadedum, þe oðrum mannum riht scylan bysnian and unriht
forbeodan.
 116. Nu þincð heom þis syllic to gehyranne, forþam þe hig
habbað heora yrmðe swa on gewunan gebroht, swylce hit nan pleoh ne sy,
þæt mæssepreost lybbe his lif, swa swa ceorl.
 119. Crist sylf astealde þa clænnysse and his halgan
apostolas, þe him her on life folgedan, þe we godes þeowas healdan
scilan.
 121. Hit gewearð æfter Cristes þrowunge and æfter his
æriste of deaðe and his upstige to heofenan and æfter þæra
apostola and martyra þrowunga, þæt wearð se soða geleafa swiðe
acolad þurh deoflice gedwolmen: <foreign>id est Arrianus presbiter et Macedonius
episcopus et multi alii</foreign>.
 127. Þa gewearð hit, þæt Constantinus, se mæra casere
and se æðela Sancte Elena sunu, þære eadigan cwene, feng to rice on
Romana byrig, and he rices weold ofer ealne middaneard.
 130. Þa gegaderode he swyðe mycelne synoð on þære
ceastre, þe is Nicea genamod, for trymminge rihtes geleafan ymbe þa halgan
þrynnesse and ymbe Cristes menniscnysse.
 133. Se forma sinoð wæs, swa swa we sædon, on Nicea <foreign>ccc</foreign>
and <foreign>xviii</foreign> bisceopa; and se oðer wæs syððan on Constantinopolim <foreign>cl</foreign>
bisceopa; and se þridda wæs on Efesum <foreign>cc</foreign> bisceopa; and se feorða
wæs on Calcedonia <foreign>dc</foreign> bisceopa and <foreign>xxx</foreign> sacerda: and ealle hig wæron
haliges lifes menn.
 138. Þas feower sinoðas syndon to healdenne, swa swa þa
feower Cristes bec.
 139. And hig eac gesettan ealle þa þenunge, þe we habbað to
godes þeowdome: to mæssan and to uhtsange and to eallum tidsangum.
 142. Siððan wæron for oft oðre sinoðas wisra bisceopa
wide on worolde, ac þas wæron þa fyrmestan, and ealle hig forbudon
æfre ælc wiflac weofodþenum, þæt is bisceopum and
mæssepreostum.
 145. Ðencan þa nu, þe to þam þriste syn, þæt hig god
oferseoð and swa mæniges haliges mannes dom, swa on þyssum sinoðum
gesomnode wæron and gehwar syððan, hwylces leanes hig him wenan magon,
and eac wenan ne þurfon, ac witod witan, þæt hig yfel lean habban
scylan, buton hig geswican, and grimlice godes graman þurh þæt, þe hig
swa god gremiað, þæt hig heora lif eall libbað on unriht.
 152. Ac to fela is þæra, þe ær þisan misdydan.
 153. And se þe þæs geswican wille and clænnysse lufian,
habbe he godes miltse and to woruldwurðscipe sy he þegenlage wyrðe.
 156. And riht is, gif hwæt færlices on þeode becymð beon
hit hereræsas, beon hit færcwealmas, beon hit miswyderu oððon
unwæstmas, beo swa hwæt, swa hit beo sece man þa bote aa to gode
sylfum.
 159. And þæt ure hlaford læte asmeagean be æghwylcum
ende Englalandes ealle þa manfullan, þe nellað geswican, and þances
oððe unþances hig to rihte gebigean oððe mid ealle of earde adrifan.
 163. And we lærað and biddað and on godes naman beodað,
þæt ænig cristen man bynnan syx manna sibfæce æfre ne gewifige on
his agenum cynne ne on his mæges lafe, þe swa neahsib wære, ne on
þæs wifes nydmagan, þe he sylf ær hæfde, ne on his gefæderan.
 168. Ne on gehalgodre nunnan ne on ælætan ænig cristen man
ne gewifige æfre ne na ma wifa þonne an hæbbe, ac beo be þære anre
þa hwile, þe heo lybbe, se þe wylle godes lage giman mid rihte and wið
hellebryne beorgan his sawle.
 172. Wa þam, þe woh drifð ealles to lange, buton he geswice.
 173. And sy ælc wydewe, þe hig sylfe mid rihte gehealde, on
godes griðe and on þæs cynges; and sytte ælc werleas <foreign>xii</foreign> monað;
ceose syððan, þæt heo sylf wylle.
 176. And eac we beodað on godes ælmihtiges naman and on ealra
his halgena, þæt nan man swa dyrstig ne sy, þæt on gehadodre nunnan
oððe on mynecenan gewifige.
 178. And gif hit hwa gedon hæbbe, beo he utlah wið god and
amansumad fram eallum cristendome and wið þone cyningc scyldig ealles
þæs, þe he age, buton he þe raðor geswice and þe deoplicor gebete
wið god.
 182. And se þe eard wille rihtlice clænsian and unriht alecgan
and rihtwisnysse lufian, þonne mot he georne þyllices styran and þyllic
ascunian.
 185. And þæt man geornlice beo on æghwylcum ende ymbe
fryðes/ bote and ymbe feos bote: swa ymbe friðes bote, swa þam bondan sy
selost and þam þeofan sy laðost; and swa ymbe feos bote, þæt an
mynet gange ofer ealle þas þeode butan ælcon false; and woge gemeta and
false gewihta rihte man georne and ælces unrihtes heononforð geswice.
 192. And þæt gehwilc man his teoðunge rihtlice gelæste be
godes miltse and be þæs cynges and be ealles cristenes folces and be
þære steore, þe Eadgar gelagede.
 195. And romfeoh gelæste man æghwilce geare be Peteres
mæssan; and se, þe þæt ne gelæste, sylle þærtoeacan <foreign>xxx</foreign>
peninga to Rome and gylde þam cynge on Engla lage <foreign>cxx</foreign> scillinga.
 199. And freolsa and fæstena healde man rihtlice; sunnandæges
freols fram sæterdæges none oð monandæges lihtinge healde man
georne, and cypinge and folcgemot we forbeodað þam halgan dæge.
 202. And ymbrenfæstena healde man rihte, swa swa Sanctus
Gregorius Angelcynne sylf hit gedihte.
 204. And ealle godes gerihta fyrðrige man georne, ælc riht
arære and unriht afylle, þonne wyrð þysse þeode sona god milde.
 206. And þæt we ealle gemænelice, gehadede and læwede,
anræde weorðan for gode and for worolde and habban us gemæne sibbe and
some æfter godes rihte and ælce sace sehtan, swa we eornost magon, and ne
lætan us deofol dwelian ne twæman, swa swa he oft dyde, þonne ure
gegaderunga ær þyson wæran.
 212. Ac uton ealle anrædlice to gode bugan and hine lufian and
wurðian and urne cristendom rihtlice healdan and urne cynehlaford mid rihtan
getrywðan and ælcne hæðendom mid ealle awyrpan.
 215. And utan geþencean, þæt hit is nyr þisse worulde
ende, þonne hwa gelyfan wylle, and þæs deofles timan Antecristes.
 217. Ac deofol dwelað manna geþohtas, þæt hig to lyt
þærymbe þenceað.
 218. And, gelyfe se, þe wylle, we witan to soðe, þæt hit
þærto georne genealæcð, forþam þeos worold is sorhful and fram
dæge to dæge a swa leng, swa wyrse.
 221. Hwæt, we magon geseon, hu læne and hu lyðre þis lif
is, hu sarlic and hu sorhful and hu geswincful and hu teonful, hu tealt and hu
wrað, hu wiðerweard and hu swicful.
 225. Heo is þeos woruld on ofstum and on stormum and on adlum and
on ungewyderum, þæt nu ne beoð naht fela manna ætsamne, þæt
heora sum ne si seoc and samhal.
 228. And, þeah þæt gelimpe, þæt men sume hwile syn her
on worolde, swaþeah hig beoð aa on geswince and mid sorge, forþan þeos
woruld nære wyrðe, þæt man to hire lufe hæfde ealles to swiðe.
 231. Ðy us is mycel þearf, þe to godes bydelum gesette syn,
þæt we godes folc warnian gelome wið þone egsan, þe mannum is
towyrd, þæt is se þeodfeond Anticrist, þe læs þe hig unwære
wurðan aredode and þonne to hrædlice þurh deofol beswicene.
 236. La hwæt, is se man on life, buton hine god ælmihtig
gehealde, and he ær þe bet gewarad sy, þæt he þonne þurh deofol
beswicen ne wurþe?
 238. La, hwylc wundor bið, þeh se mennisca deofol synfullum
mote heardlice derian, þonne god geþafað, þæt he mot on his agenum
halgum swylc wundor gewyrcean, þæt Enoh and Elias þurh þone
þeodfeond gemartirode weorðað, þe god silfa fela hund wintra mid sawle
and mid lichama geheold ær to þam anan, þæt hig þonne sceoldan mid
heora lare folce gebeorgan, þæt hit eall ne forwurde endemes togædere
þurh þæne deofol, þe ealle men bregeð and ealle worold gedrefeð?
 247. Nis se man on life, þe mæge oððe cunne swa yfel hit
asecgan, swa hit sceal gewurðan on þam deoflican timan.
 249. On godes naman we biddað, þæt cristenra manna gehwilc
hine sylfne georne beþence and warnige wið þone egsan and geornlice to
gode gebuge and fram synnum gecirre, swa he geornost mæge, and geearnige,
þæt he gemanan habban mote on hefena rice, þær is ece blis and
æfre bið mid þam, þe leofað and rixað a butan ende, amen.

HomU 41 (Nap 51)
B3.4.41.
Napier 1883, no. 51: 'To eallan folke': Napier 274-5.



 1. To eallan folke.
 2. Leofan menn, lagiað gode woroldlagan and lecgað
þærtoeacan, þæt ure cristendom fæste stande, and þæt ures
hlafordes kinedom up arise, and þæt ealles folces frið wyrðe betere,
þonne hit git sig.
 5. Ic hi aginne, endie se, ðe wylle oððe bet cunne.
 6. Rihtlaga is, þæt man oðran gebeode, þæt he wylle,
þæt man him gebeode ah þæt is þam rican lað.
 7. Þis is seo lagu, þe we healdan sculan: ærest we sculan
ænne god lufian and wyrðian and ælcne oðer oferhogian; and we sculan
ænne cristendom ealle healdan and ælcne hæðene dom mid ealle
oferhogian; and we sculan ealle ænne cynehlaford rihtlice healdan and lif
and land samod ealle wyrian; and we sculan iornlice riht up aræran and
unriht iorne afyllan.
 14. Þonne wylle we ærest, þæt godes riht forð ga and
woruldriht syððan; and we wyllað, þæt mann frið and freondscipe
rihtlice healde for gode and for worulde.
 17. And, gif man abrece þæt, þe botwyrðe syg, bete hit
iorne.
 18. Open þyfðe and hlafordes searwu and abære morð
æfter woruldlagu is botleas þing.
 19. Manslagan and manswican and þa, þa heora hlaford
forlætað, þær him mæst neod byð on folces neode, and wordlagan
and wedlogan beoð ealle gode laðe, buton hi hit gebetan for gode and for
worulde.
 23. Godcunde bote sece man iorne to his scrifte; and, gif his
scrifte ofhagie, sece man to ðam leodbiscope; and, gif man furðor scule, to
þam arcebiscope; and syððan to ðam papan, gif me for micelre neode
scule; ne cunne we him syððan ne furðor tæcan, butan to þam hextan,
þæt is, to gode sylfan.
 28. And we wyllað, þæt æighwær cyricgrið stande and
gehalgodes cinges handgrið efen unwemme.
 30. Ræde ge nu forð lagan gode fyrðor.
 31. Ic wolde, gif me to anhagode.
 31. Halig drihten, gemildsa us eallan.

END_TEXT

 17. Mid hwam forgildaþ hi hig þonne, læt we nu?
 18. Wa heom þonne, þæt hi æfre underfengon þa godcunde

 19. Hu mæig blind man oþerne lædan, oððe hu mæig

HomU 44 (Nap 55)
B3.4.44.
Napier 1883, no. 55: Napier 282-9.



 2. Men þa leofestan, us is deope beboden, þæt we geornlice
mynegian and læran sculon, þæt manna gehwylc to gode buge and fram
synnum gecyrre.
 4. Se cwyde is swyðe egeslic, þe god þurh þone witegan be
þam cwæð, þe godes folce bodian sculon, þæt synd biscopas and
mæssepreostas.
 7. He cwæð be þam: <foreign>clama, ne cesses, et reliqua</foreign>.
 8. Clypa hlude and hefe up þine stemne and gecyð minum folce,
þæt hi georne fram synnum gecyrren.
 9. Gif ðu þonne þæt ne dest, ac suwast hit and nylt folce
his þearfe gecyðan, þonne scealt ðu ealra þæra sawla gescead
agyldan, þe þurh þæt losiað, þe hi habbað þa lare and þa
mynegunge, þe hi beþorfton.
 13. Ðes cwyde mæg beon swyðe gemyndelic eallum þam, þe
to ðam gesette syn, þæt hi godes folce riht bodian sculon; and folc ah
eac mycle þearfe, þæt hi wære beon þæs cwydes.
 16. Þe þæræfter gecweden is.
 17. He cwæð se witega æfter þam: gyf þu godes folce
riht bodast and þu hit gebigan ne miht to rihte, þonne gebyrhst ðu
þinre agenre sawle; and se, þe woh drifð and geswican nele, he sceal
habban þæs ece wite.
 21. Leofan menn, ic bidde eow, þæt ge geþyldelice hlystan
þæs, ðe ic nu eow secgan wylle.
 22. Hit is lang to reccenne, þæt we on bocum ymbe godes wundra
rædað.
 24. Nu wille ic þeah be sumum dæle sceortlice hit eow sum
asecgan.
 25. Uton we gemunan, hu se apostol us manode and lærde and ðus
cwæð: <foreign>ecce nunc tempus acceptabile</foreign>; nu is andfenge tid, he cwæð,
and nu syndon hælo dagas, þæt ure æghwylc an mæg him sylfum ece
lif geearnian mid urum drihtene, gyf we nu her on worulde soð and riht on
urum/ life don wyllað.
 30. Hwæt, we witan and leorniað, þæt þæt wæs
beboden on þære ealdan æ, þæt manna gehwylc sceolde symle ymb
<foreign>xii</foreign> monað þone teoðan dæl his woruldæhta for gode gesyllan; and
nu, men þa leofestan, swa þonne is nu eac swyðe god and swyðe rihtlic
to donne.
 35. Gyf þæt þonne hwylc man seo, þæt him þæt on
his mode to uneþelic þince, tylige he þonne, la, hwæþere, þæt
he huru þone teoþan dæl his daga for gode gedo.
 38. Hwæt, we witan, þæt on <foreign>xii</foreign> monþum beoð <foreign>iii</foreign> hund
daga and sixtig daga and fif dagas and eac six tida; and þises fæstenes is
twa and feowertig daga.
 40. And, gif we þonne þa six sunnandagas of adoð, þe we
swæsendo on habbað, þonne ne bið þæs fæstenes þonne ma,
þonne six and <foreign>xxx</foreign> daga; and, hwæt, þæt þonne bið se teoða
dæl þæra <foreign>xii</foreign> monþa.
 44. And se man, se ðe wile on ælce tid heardlice and
forwernedlice lyfigean, se bið fulfremed.
 46. Gyf þæt þonne hwylc mon sy, þæt him on his mode to
earfoðe þince, þæt he on ælce tid swa forwernedlice lyfige, tylige
he þonne huru, þæt he þis fæsten selost afæste, æghwæþer
ge on sealmsange ge on ælmesdædum ge on halgum gebedum ge on ælcum
þæra goda, þe he for gode to gode gedon mage, þæt we þonne ealle
motan on þas halgan tide, þe nu toweard is, æghwæðer ge for gode ge
for worulde þy gefealicor and ðe bliþelicor lifian motan.
 55. Men þa leofestan, eow eallum is cuð, þæt þes
gearlica ymbrene us gebringð efne nu þa clænan tid lenctenlices
fæstenes, on þam we sceolan ure gymeleaste and forgægednyssa urum
gastlicum scryfte geandettan and us mid fæstene and wæccum and gebedum
and ælmesdædum fram synnum aþwean, þæt we baldlice mid gastlicere
blisse þa easterlican mærsunge Cristes æristes wurðian moton and
ðæs halgan husles þigene mid geleafan underfon us to synna forgyfenysse
and to gescyldnysse deofollicra costnunga.
 65. Nu bidde ic and lære ælcne cristene man, þæt he
þas halgan lenctenlice tide gehealde mid clænum fæstene and mid
clænum geþance ælce dæge to nones and to anes mæles, buton hwa
for ylde oððe for iuguðe oððe for unhæle gelæstan ne mæge.
 69. Gyf þonne þissa þreora þinga ænig hwylcne man lette,
þæt hine to ðam fæstene ne onhagie, þonne is hit alefed, þæt
he mot mete þycgan on þa gerad, þe he his ælmessan sylle and nænne
oþerne man him to ne spane to þam gereordum, butan þær hwylc oðer
mettrum man sy, þe þæt fæsten aberan ne mæge.
 75. Gif þonne se hala mid þam unhalan þone mete þicgeð,
þonne wurþað hig begen þurh þæs mettruman unmihta beswicene.
 77. And nis nanum men alefed for nanre neode þis fæsten to
abrecane ne mid ælmessan to alysenne, buton hine þæra þreora þinga
hwylc forwyrne, yld oððe iuguð oððe unhæl.
 81. Witodlice þis feowertigfealde fæsten wæs asteald on
þære ealdan gecyðnysse, þa þa se heretoga Moyses fæste feowertig
daga and feowertig nihta tosomne, to ði þæt he moste godes æ
underfon.
 84. Eft se mæra witega Elias ealswa lang fæsten þurh godes
mihte, swa swa se oðer, gefylde, and syðþan he wearð geferod lichamlice
on heofonlicum cræte to þam uplican lyfte and cymð eft, he and Enoh,
togeanes Antecriste, to ði þæt hi þæs deofles leasunge mid godes
soðfæstnysse oferstælon.
 90. Drihten eac on þære nywan gecyðnysse fæste þurh his
godcundan mihte feowertig daga and nihta fram eallum bigleofum.
 92. Ðus wæs ure lenctenlice fæsten asteald; ac we ne magan
for ure tyddernysse þyllic fæsten þurhteon.
 94. Nu is us alyfed þurh lareowa ealdordom, þæt we
dæghwamlice on þissere lenctenlican tide ure lichaman gereordian mid
forhæfednysse and syfernysse and clænnysse.
 97. Stuntlice fæst se lenctenlic fæsten, se ðe on þisum
clænum timan hine sylfne mid galnysse befylð.
 98. Unrihtlic byð, þæt se cristena man flæsclice lustas
gefremme on þam timan, þe he flæscmettas forgan sceal.
 100. And læsse pleoh byð þam men, þæt he flæsces
bruce on lenctenfæstene, þonne he wifes bruce.
 102. Witodlice on eallum tidum gedafenað cristenum mannum,
þæt hi gode weorc began and ælmesdæda, and swaþeah swyðost on
þissum gemænelican fæstene.
 105. Se ðe on oðrum dagum sleac wære to godnysse, he sceal
huruþinga/ on þissum dagum acucian on godum biggengum.
 107. Se ðe ær glædlice mid godum weorcum hine sylfne
geglencde, him gedafenað, þæt he nu on þissum dagum geornlicor mid
weallendre lufe his godnysse gecyðe.
 110. Ne bið nan fæsten gode gecweme, buton se man hine sylfne
fram leahtrum forhæbbe.
 112. Crist sylf cwæð be sumum rican menn on his godspelle; he
cwæð: sum welig man wæs on worulde; and his wæstmas genihtsumlice
geþugon.
 114. Ða smeade se rica and cwæð: hwæt do ic, la, nu ic
næbbe, hwær ic mage ealle mine wæstmas gegaderian?
 116. Eft he cwæð: ic wylle ryman minne bertun and mine bernu
geeacnian and ðider gegaderian ealle mine wæstmas and cweþan to minre
sawle: min sawul, þu hæfst fela goda to manegra geara bryce.
 120. Gerest þe nu and et and drinc and gewistfulla.
 121. Ða cwæð god to þam rican: ðu stunta, nu toniht
þu scealt þin lif alætan.
 122. Hwæs beoð þonne þine teolunga?
 123. Swa bið, se ðe him sylfum gold hordað and nis on gode
welig.
 124. Efne þu ondrætst þe on þam gedale; ne ondræt þu
þe to dælenne, þu ðe nast, hwæþer ðu mergenes gebitst.
 126. Cyð mildheortnesse earmum mannum mid þinum begeatum; ne
forlæt se ælmihtiga god þe, se ðe þe to dælere gesette.
 128. Be þissum cwæð drihten on his godspelle: ne behyde ge
eowerne goldhord on eorðan, þær þær om and moðþan hit
awestað, and þeofas adelfað and forstelað; ac hordiað eowerne
goldhord on heofonan, þær ne cymð to ne om ne moðþe, ne þeofas ne
delfað ne ne ætbredað.
 133. Soðlice, þær þær þin goldhord is, þær bið
þin heorte.
 134. Hu mage we urne hord on heofonan behydon, buton þurh
ælmessan?
 135. Swa hwæt swa we be anfealdum godes þearfum for his lufon
syllað, he hit us forgylt be hundfealdum on þam toweardan life.
 137. Gif ealle men on worulde rice wæron, þonne næfde seo
mildheortnys nænne stede, þæt seo ælmesse ure synna lig adwæscte,
swa swa hit awriten is: swa swa wæter adwæscð fyr, swa adwæscð seo
ælmesse synna.
 141. Nis nan þearfa fram ælmesdædum ascyred.
 142. Witodlice sum earm wydewe næfde ealra æhta, buton
ænne feorðlinc, þone heo brohte to godes weofode on Cristes
andwyrdnysse; and he hi þærrihte mid his halgan muþe geherode and
cwæð: soð ic eow secge, þæt þeos earme wydewe brohte maran lac,
þonne ænig oðer man on þissum dæge, forðon þe heo brohte eal,
þæt heo hæfde, mid estfullum mode.
 148. Eft on oðre stowe cwæð drihten on his godspelle: swa
hwa swa sylð anum þurstigum men ceald wæter on minum naman, ne forlyst
he his mede þære dæde.
 151. Soðlice ne bið us to ælmessan geteald, gyf we þam
mannum syllað, þe heora neode sylfe habbað, forþan þe god ne het us
gewelgian þa hæbbendan, ac þæt we þam wædligendum gefultumodon.
 156. We wyllað ænne cwyde gyt þære godspellican
gerecednysse eow gereccan on þissum ylcan andgyte.
 157. Drihten spæc ymbe his tocyme to þam micclum dome:
witodlice/ mannes bearn cymð on his mægenðrymme, and ealle
englas/ samod mid him to ðam micclum dome, þonne sit he on domsetle
his mægenþrymnysse, and beoð gegaderode ætforan him ealle þeode,
and he tosceat hi on twa, swa swa sceaphyrde tosceat sceap fram gatum.
 164. Þonne gelogað he þa scep on his swyðran hand and ða
gæt on his wynstran.
 165. We willað eow geswutelian nu ærest, gyf eower hwylc nyte,
hwæt mannes bearn sy, þæt Crist sylf is mannes bearn, se þe is anes
mannes sunu, þære eadigan Marian on þære menniscnysse.
 168. And seo menniscnys byð gesewen on þam dome, þonne he
sylf sitt on his domsetle and ða rihtwisan on his swyðran hand gesett and
þa synfullan on his wynstran.
 171. Þonne cwyð se cyning Crist to þam, þe on his swyðran
hand standað: cumað, ge gebletsode mines fæder, and geagniað þæt
rice, þe eow gegearcod wæs fram frymðe middaneardes.
 175. Me hingrode, and ge me gereordodon; me þyrste, and ge me
scencton; ic wæs cuma, and ge me underfengon on eowrum gesthusum; ic wæs
nacod, and ge me scryddon; ic wæs geuntrumod, and ge me geneosodon; ic
wæs on cwearterne, and ge comon to me, and ge me gefrefrodon.
 180. Ðonne andswariað þa rihtwisan Criste and cweþað:
drihten, hwænne gesawe we ðe hungrine, and we ðe gereordodon?
 182. Oððe þurstine, and we ðe scencton?
 183. Oððe hwænne wære þu cuma, and we ðe
underfengon?
 184. Oððe hwænne gesawe we ðe untrumne oððe on
cwearterne, and we ðe geneosodon?
 185. Ðonne andwyrt se cyning þam rihtwisan þissum wordum:
soð ic eow secge, swa lange, swa ge dydon anum of ðisum læstan on minum
naman, ge hyt dydon me sylfum.
 188. Ðonne cwyð he eft to þam synfullum, þe on his wynstran
healfe standað: gewitað fram me, ge awyrgedan, into þam ecan fyre, þe
is gegearcod þam deofle and his awyrgedum gastum.
 192. Me hingrode, and ge me ætes forwyrndon; me þyrste, and ge
me drincan ne sealdon; ic wæs cuma, and ge me underfon noldon; ic wæs
nacod, nolde ge me wæda tiþian; ic wæs untrum and on cwearterne, nolde
ge me geneosian.
 196. Ðonne andswariað þa unrihtwisan manfullan: la leof,
hwænne gesawe we ðe hungrine oððe þurstine oððe cuman oððe
nacodne oððe geuntrumodne oððe on cwearterne, and we ðe þenian
noldon?
 199. Ðonne andwyrt se cyning heom and cweð: soð ic eow secge,
swa lange, swa ge his forwyrndon anum of þissum lytlum, swa lange ge me
sylfum his forwyrndon.
 202. Ðonne farað þa uncystigan and þa unrihtwisan into
ecere cwicsusle mid deofle and his awyrgedum englum; and þa rihtwisan
gecyrrað fram þam dome into þam ecan life mid Criste and his gecorenum
englum, mid þam hy libbað and rixiað on lichaman and on sawle on ealra
worulda woruld, amen.

HomU 45 (Nap 56)
B3.4.45.
Napier 1883, no. 56: 'De confessione': Napier 289-91.



 1. <foreign>De Confessione</foreign>.
 2. Leofa man, ic axie þe on drihtnes namen, hwylces geleafan ðu
beo to gode.
 3. Nu munegie ic ðe, leofa cild, þisse worde: ilyfst ðu on
god almihtigne, þe is fæder, and on þone soðan sunæ and on þone
halgan gast?
 5. Ic ilyfe.
 6. Gelyfst ðu, þæt alle men sceolon on domes dæga of
dæðe arisan?
 7. Gea leof, ic ilyfe.
 7. Ofðincð þe alles þæs, þe ðu to yfele hafst
iðoht and icwæden and iworht?
 9. Gea leof, al hit me ofðincð.
 9. God hit ðe forgife and me geunne, þæt ic mote.
 10. Fæst nu ælc dæge to nones and to anes meles buton
sunnandæg, and forga hwit, and forga ælc hæmedþing þas halgan tid
alce niht, and heald þe swiðe clænlice, þæt ðu mage underfon
ðet halige husel on þunnresdæg ær estron and eft on æsteræfen
and on æsterdæg, and sec þine cyrcan ilome.
 15. Nu sæcge ic þe her, hwæt ðe is to donne, hwæt to
forletenne.
 16. Lufa ðinne drihten ærest þinga mid alle mode and mid
alle mægene and mid clænre heortan and soðre lufa and þinne nextan,
swa swa þe sylfne; and beo ælmesgeorn be ðinre mæðe, and beo
manþwæra and circgeorn, and þe ðær georne to gode bide and to allum
his halgum, wið þam ðe þine synna þæs ðe forgifenron beon, and
þæt ðu þæt ece lif habban mote æfter þisses lifes ende; and ne
do þu nanum oðrum, þæt ðu nelle, þæt man ðe do.
 25. Leofa cild, þonne ðu to cyrcan cume, þonne sing þu
ðær singallice þine bedu, ne nan idel þær ne do, ne ne spec; and
gebide for þine fæder and for ðinre moder and for ðinnum scrift and
for al cristen folc and for alle cristene sawlæ, þone bist ðu on ure
bedrædene.
 29. And þu ahst to fyllene þine seofen tidsangas under dæg
and niht, þæt is, to ælcan tidsange seofan <foreign>pater noster</foreign>; þet is
þæt drihtenlice gebed, þe ure drihten sylf tæhte his leofan
leorningcnihtum, þa ða heo hine axodon, hu heo sceoldon heom biddan.
 34. And þe ðe his dægsang cunne, singe þone, swa he oftest
mage, and his credan ilome, þæt is ðe rihta leafa, þe ælc mon
cunnan sceal.
 36. And bebeorh þe wið þa æhta hæfedsynna, þæt
ðu þa ne fremme: þæt beoð morðor and stala and manaðas and
unrihtgitsung and unrihthæmed and gifernessæ and tælnessa and leasa
witnessa.
 40. And heald þu wæl þa twelf ymbrigdagas, þe on twelf
monðum beoð.
 41. And burh þe wið liblacas and attorcreftas and dyrne
geligera and twyspecnessæ and oformodignessa and geornessa oðre manne
æhta and wið ærætas and allæ galnessæ and wið alle
unsibbe.
 44. Þe ðe wyle miltsce habbæn æt gode, wið alle
þæs misdæde he hine mot and sceal georne gewarnian.
 46. Ic ðe bidde and beode eac, þæt ðu gode ælmihtigum
georne hyre, forþon þe me is mucel neod, þæt ic ðe riht lære.
 48. And þe is neodþearf, þæt ðu riht do, and þæt
ðe nefre deofol to ðam beswican ne mote, þæt ðu nefræ ne læte
unandet ænige synnæ þære, þe ðu iwroht habbe, ne beo heo
nefræ to ðam micel ne to ðam lytel ne þe nefre ne þince to ðam
hæfig ne to ðam uneaðlic ne to ðam fracodlic, þæt ðu his effre
læte ænig þing unandet.
 54. And iþenc, þæt ðu ænne nacodne licamen on ðas
weorld mid þe brohtes; and þu hi scealt eft ana alætan, buton þu
hwæt for godes lufon to gode gedo þa hwile, ðe ðe god þisses
witendan lifes onlænan wylle.
 58. And iþænc, þæt ðe is ðeo tid swiðe uncuð and
þe dæg, þe ðu scealt ðæs lænan weorld forlæten and to godes
dome iled beon and ðonne mid þinre anre sawle riht agildon alra ðinga
gehwylces, þæs ðu ær mid þinum licaman fremedest godes oððe
yfeles.
 63. Þær ne bið nan ðing godes almihtiges eagum bidiglod.
 64. Do nu, swa ic lære, ic bidde þe, forlet ælc yfel,
þæs ðe ðu mage, and do to gode þone dæl, þe ðu mæge,
þonne most ðu wununge habbon mid gode sylfum on heofenum þær, ðær
he sylf leofað and rixað mid fæder and sunæ and halig gast a on
ecnesse, amen.

HomU 46 (Nap 57)
B3.4.46.
Napier 1883, no. 57: 'Sermo ad populum Dominicis diebus': Napier 291-9.



 1. <foreign>Sermo ad populum dominicis diebus</foreign>.
 2. Leofan men, us bisceopum and eallum mæssepreostum is swiðe
deope beboden, þæt we æfre sculon mynegian and tyhtan eow, læwede
menn, georne to eowre sawla þearfe, and hu ge agan her on life rihtlice to
libbanne; and, gif we swa ne doð, þonne beo we swyðe scyldige wið god
ælmihtigne.
 7. Nu wylle we eow secgan be þæs haligan sunnandæges
halignysse, hu se ælmihtiga god hine gehalgode, and hu he wyle, þæt he
freols beo fram eallum unrihtdædum and þeowetlicum weorcum, for ic wat,
þæt hit is eow uncuðre, þonne ge þearfe ahton.
 12. Hit wæs, þæt, siððan Crist þæs ælmihtigan
godes sunu wæs astigen up to heofena rice, syððan he hæfde her
gewunad onmang mannum þreo and <foreign>xxx</foreign> wintra and healf gear, þæt men
forgymdon godes laga swyðor, þonne heora þearfa wæron, and þæs
halgan sunnandæges freols wyrs heoldon, þonne hit gode licwyrðe
wære.
 17. Ða asende se ælmihtiga god an ærendgewrit ufan of
heofenan be anum halgan engle to anum bisceope, se hatte Petrus, se wæs
biscop on Antiochia þære burh, þær þær Sanctus Petrus se apostol
ærest gesæt his biscopsetl.
 21. On þam gewrite stod eall be þæs dæges halignesse; and
þæt gewrit ne awrat nan eorðlic man, ac godes agen ængel, swa swa seo
halige þrynnys hit sylf gedihte.
 24. And eac se ængel bebead þam biscope, þæt he hit
sceolde cyðan eallum cristenum mannum, þæt men geswican heora unrihtes,
þe hi on þam halgan dæge drugan and gyt to swiðe dreogað.
 28. Nu is þis þæt angin þæs engles spræce, þa þa
he þæt gewrit þam bisceope on hand sealde.
 29. He cwæð: ic, godes engel, middaneardes hælendes boda,
beode and hate, þæt ægðer ge cyningas ge eorlas and gerefan, þe
mæst unriht dreogað, and eac ealle men ægðer ge gehadode ge
læwede, þæt hi lufian rihtwisnysse on wordum and on worcum and on
eallum þingum, and þæt hi hyran drihtne hælende Criste georne on
eallum ege, forþan þæt is ealles wisdomes angin, þæt man habbe ege
to gode.
 37. And ic beode, þæt men healdan þone drihtenlican dæg
fram eallum þeowetlicum weorcum, þæt is, fram sæternesdæges none
oð monandæges lihtinge, forþan þe se dæg wæs se forma dæg,
þe se soða scyppend, þæt is god ælmihtig, gesceop, þa þa he
ealle þing gesceop, and eac siððan fela wundra on þam dæge
geworhte/ ægðer ge ær þan þe he menniscnysse underfenge, ge eac
syððan.
 44. Ðæt is þonne, þæt he gesceop heofenan and eorðan
and englas and heahenglas and ealle heofenlice miht and endebyrdnysse on þam
dæge; and eac on þam dæge he gesceop manna sawla.
 47. And, þa þa Moyses se heretoga lædde godes folc of Egipta
lande, þa on þam dæge he hit lædde ofer þa readan sæ, swa
þæt he sloh mid anre gyrde on þa sæ, and heo toeode on twa, and
þæt folc for betwux þam twam wæterum on þam grunde ealle
drygsceode, oð hi coman to þam lande up.
 52. And on þam dæge com ærest se heofenlica mete ufan of
heofnan þam ylcan folce to bilyfan, and god hi mid þam afedde <foreign>xl</foreign> wintra
on þam westene, þe hi to foron; and se mete hatte manna.
 56. And on þam dæge wæs Crist þæs lifigendan godes
sunu geboren of Sancta Marian innoðe soð man, ealswa he is soð god,
middaneard to alisanne of deofles anwealde, þe his ær geweald ahte for
Adames gylte.
 60. And syððan he acenned wæs, he awende on þam dæge
wæter to wine.
 61. And on þam dæge he wæs gefullod.
 62. And on þam dæge he gereordade æt anum mæle fif
þusend manna of fif berenum hlafum and twam fixum, syððan he hæfde
þone bilyfan mid heofoncundlicre bletsunge þam ylcan dæge gebletsod;
and, þa þa hi ealle fulle wæron, þa bær man þær up of þan,
þe hi læfdon, twelf leapas fulle.
 67. And on þam dæge aras Crist of deaðe, syððan he
þrowade on rode for mancynnes hæle.
 68. And on þam dæge wæs þæra iudeiscra manna
geleafleasnys gewiten fram mannum, and riht geleafa asprang onmang godes
gelaðunge, syððan Crist æteowode hine sylfne Sancte Petre æfter his
æriste of deaðe.
 72. And on þam dæge sende god þone halgan gast ofer þa
apostolas ealle þær, þær hi wæron on anum huse inne belocene, and
tæhte heom, þæt hi cuðan ealle þa spræca, þe syndon swa wide,
swa middaneard is.
 76. And on þam dæge wyrð middaneard eall geendad.
 77. And on þam dæge cymð god to demanne eallum mancynne
ælcum be his agenum gewyrhtum, and farað þonne þa godan and þa
rihtwisan into ecere myrhðe mid gode and his englum, and þa arleasan
farað to helle mid deofle and þær beoð gecwylmede on cwicsusle and
eardiað þær a butan ende mid him.
 84. Nu forþam bebead drihten god eow, þæt ge healdan þone
sunnandæg fram ælcum geswinclicum worce and swyðost fram þam, þe ic
eow nu secgan wylle.
 86. Ðæt is, þæt man ah to forganne ealle fulnyssa, þe
gode laðe syndon, þæt is forliger and druncennys, mannsliht and leasung,
reaflac and stalu, unrihthæmed and geflit, æfest and ælc þæra
mandæda, þe mannum forboden is, and ælc gemot ænig mann to
fremmanne.
 91. Ac man ah cyrican and haligdom to secanne and þær hine
georne inne to gebiddanne and mid eadmodnysse hlystan, locahwæt þa
lareowas heom þær to godes lage tæcan, and a godan weorc, þe god us
beboden hæfð to adreoganne on þam drihtenlican dæge.
 96. Ic eow wylle eac eallswa cyðan, þæt man ah seoce men to
geneosianne and deade bebyrian, earmingas, þam þe onhagað, fedan and
scrydan.
 98. And, locahwa þære mihte age, he mot gehæftne man
alysan, wreccan and ælþeodige underfon, and ælc be his mihte
welwyllendlice heom god don, wudewum and steopcildum and utancumenum froferlice
fylstan to rihte.
 102. And, locahwylc cristen man sy ungesibsum, man ah on þam
dæge hine to gesibsumianne.
 104. Þis syndon þa weorc, þe gode syndon anfenge on ælcere
tide, and swyðost hig syndon to healdanne on sunnandagum, forþan se
sunnandæg is se forma dæg ealra dagena, and he bið se endenyhsta æt
þyssere worulde ende.
 108. And, gif ge þis nellað healdan, cwæð god, ic wylle
swingan eow mid þam smeartestum swipum, þæt is, þæt ic witnige eow
mid þam wyrstan wite, swa þæt ic sende ofer eow min yrre on feower
wisan, þæt is, hunger and sweordes ecge, cwyld and hæftnunge.
 113. Þæt is, þa þe ahte syndon, hi sculon fleonde on
gefeohte beon ofslagene, and þa ealdan sculan earmlice licgan heapmælum
æt ham hungre acwolene, and man sceal þa geoguðe geomorlice lædan
gehæft heanlice mid heardum bendum and swa bysmorlice bringan of heora
eðle and betæcan eow teonlice syððan on hæðenra hand heries
lafe.
 119. And syððan æfter þære earmlycan eowre geendunge,
ic besence eowre sawla on susle on helle, swa swa ic hwilon dyde þa twa burh
Sodomam and Gomorram, þe mid heofonlicum fyre her wurdan forbærnde, and
ealle þa, þe him on eardodon, æfre byrnað on helle grunde on hatan
fyre, forþan hi þone mildan god manfullice gremedon.
 125. And ealswa hit gelamp on Moyses dagum, mines gecorenan,
þæt wæron twegen men, þa wæron genemnode Dathan and Abiron; hi ic
besencte mid sawle and mid lichaman on helle grund for heora oferhigde and,
forþan hig spræcon bysmorlice be me and be minum sacerdum.
 130. And ic sende ofer eow þa þeode eow to hergianne and eower
land to awestenne, þe ge heora spræca ne cunnan, forþan þe ge ne
healdað sunnandæges freols, and forþan þe ge me forseoð and mine
beboda noldon healdan.
 134. Ac wite ge gewislice and gemune ge wel georne, þæt is
æfre fram frymðe bebead þone drihtenlican dæg to healdenne.
 136. Swa hwa swa ænige cypinge on þam dæge begæð
oððe oðre þing, þæt man claðas waxe, oððe ænig cræftig
man him on his cræfte tylige, oððe man efesige oðerne man oððe
bread bace oððe ænig ungelyfed þing bega on þam dæge, he scel
beon utlaga wið me and ealle þa, þe him to þam unrihte fylstað and
him þæt geþafiað.
 142. Forþan þa men, þe swylc þing begað, ne begytað hi
na mine bletsunge ne mine myltse, ac heom becymð færlice min grama ofer
for þæs dæges forsewennysse.
 145. And ic asende ofer eow mancwealm and orfcwealm, swa þæt
þa/ lybbendan nyton, be hwan hig lifian, and þa deadan man nat, hu man
delfe, for þære untrumnysse, þe heom an becymð eal for minra beboda
forsewennysse.
 149. For hwan nele þeos wyðerwearde þeod and þas
unrihtwisan men geþencan þa yrmða, þe towearde syndon æt þyssere
worulde ende, and hu ic geþafode, þæt twegen cyningas foran of Rome mid
here to Hierusalem þære burh, þe me wæs burga leofst, ær þan
þe hig mine beboda tobræcon, þe þære burge þa geweald ahton.
 155. Ðæt wæs, þæt Titus and Uespasianus tobræcon
þa burh and ofslogon þær hund þusend manna, and <foreign>xi</foreign> siðan hund
þusenda hi læddon þanon ealle gebende.
 158. Þis wæs gedon on þam halgan easterdæge, forþan hig
forsawon ær to healdenne þone halgan dæg mid rihte, swa swa ic sylf
ær and syððan mine boceras heom beboden hæfdon.
 161. And, gif ge gyt nellað healdan þone halgan sunnandæg,
ægðer ge freoh ge þeow, fram sæternesdæges none oð monandæges
lihtinge, ic amansumige eow ætforan minum fæder, þe on heofenan is, swa
þæt ge ne sculon habban nænne gemanan mid me ne mid minum englum
æfre to worolde.
 166. And, gif ge nellað teoðian ælc þæra þinga, þe
eow god lænð, on swa hwylcum þingum, swa ge hit begytað mid rihte, and
to godes cyrcan hit getrywelice bringan, ic benæme eow þæra <foreign>ix</foreign>
dæla, and ge sculon þæs teoþan dæles mid teonan brucan.
 171. Þæt is, þæt ic asende ofer eower land ælcne
untiman, þæt bið egeslice great hagol, se fordeð eowre wæstmas, and
unasecgendlice þunras and byrnende ligræscas, þa forglendriað eowre
wæstmas ægðer ge on wuda ge on felda.
 175. And drugoða eow cymð, þonne ge renas behofedan, and ren,
þonne eowre wæstmas wederes beþorftan.
 177. And gyt, þæt is egeslicost eow eall to geþafianne:
þæt is, þæt ungecyndelic fyr cymð færunga on eowre burga and on
tunas and forbærnð þone betstan dæl, þe ge big sceoldon libban.
 181. Nu we habbað eow gesæd be þæs halgan sunnandæges
freolse, swa swa ge habbað gehyred.
 182. Nu, swa hwa swa hæfð ænigne hyge to gode, he wile
hlistan þyssera worda, ac ic adræde, þæt ge willan heora læs
gyman, þonne ge þearfa ahton, forþan þe ge gremiað god ælmihtigne
grimlice oft mid yfelum worcum.
 186. And, ge rican men, geþencað, þæt þeos woruld is
neah þam ende, geswicað eowra unþeawa and ne awende ge ne þone dæg
to nihte ne þa niht to dæge, forþan wa eow, þæt ge æfre gewurdon
men, buton ge geswicon, ge þe awendað riht to woge and ælc woh for
lyðran medsceatte gelætað to rihte.
 192. Ge syttað ealle niht and drincað oð leohtne dæg and
swa awendað dæg to nihte and niht to dæge, swa ic ær cwæð, eall
for druncennysse and oferfylle, and swa ge eowerne beorscipe brucað on
unriht.
 196. Ac wite ge mid gewissan, þæt eow wurðað þa mycclan
bollan bytere forgoldene æt eowrum endedæge, butan ge geswican.
 198. Nyte ge ful georne, þæt ælc man scel hyran his
hlaforde and don, þæt he hine hæt, and be þan man wat, þæt he
bið his hlaford?
 200. And swa man mot oðrum twegra hyran, gode ælmihtigum and
his beboda healdan, oððe þan earman deofle anrædlice fylian; forþan
nis na ma hlafordinga on worulde, þonne twegen, god ælmihtig and deofol.
 204. Forþan, se þe godes beboda hylt, he is godes man, and he
mid gode scel habban ece blisse on heofena rice æfter þison life.
 206. And, se þe deofles worc begæð, he is deofles man, and
he scel mid deofle wunian on helle æfter þison life a to worulde.
 208. Þæt syndon godes wiðersacan: morðwyrhtan,
hlafordswican and manswaran, manslagan and mægslagan, cyrchatan and
sacerdbanan, hadbrecan and æwbrecan, þeofas, ryperas and reaferas,
unrihthæmeras, þa fulan, þe forlætað heora cwenan and nimað
oðre and þa þe habbað ma, þonne heora rihtæðelcwene, wyccan and
wælcyrian and unlybwyrhtan, unrihtdeman, þe demað æfre be þam
sceatte and swa wendað wrang to rihte and riht to wrange, and þa, þe
lufiað þa mycclan druncennysse æfre and oðra unrihta fela, þe nu
syndon lange to areccanne.
 219. And butan tweon, þæs worc þe man begæð, þam
hlaforde man hyrð; and, se þe swylc begæð, swylc ic nu rehte, he
forsihð þone soðan god.
 221. Forþam ic bidde eow and halsige þurh þone lifiendan god,
þæt ge geswicon eowres unrihtes, ær þan se earmlica deað eow
endemes ealle forgripe and eowre sawla on helle besence.
 224. And, se ðe nele nu ne ne recð godes lare, ac hi forsihð
and nele hi gehyran, ac læt him eaðelice ymbe þæt and ælce dæge
cunnað, hu he mæst mage gesyngian ongean godes wyllan, and nele his synna
andettan, ac þencð se unwara on his geþance, eallswa deofol hine
lærð, þe ælc yfel of cymð.
 230. Þæt is, ærest he hine lærð, þæt he his
synna ne andette, forþam þe he iung is; eft he cwæð to þam men:
oðre syngodon hefelicor, þonne þu, and þeahhwæðere hig leofedon
lange hwile.
 233. He cwyð þryddan siðe: do swa yfele, swa þu do, godes
mildheortnys is swiðe mycel, and he wyle þe forþi þine synna forgifan.
 236. And þurh þas unwærnysse he gebringð hine on helle.
 237. Ðreo þing syndon, þe gebringað þone ungesæligan
on helle grunde: þæt is, unclæne geþanc and idele word and yfele
dæda.
 239. And oðre þreo þing syndon, þe gebringað þone
gesæligan to heofenan rice: þæt is, halig geþanc and god spæc and
fullfremed worc.
 241. And þreo þing syndon, þe ne beoð forgifene ne on
þissere worulde ne on þam toweardan life: an is, þæt man god to tale
habbe; oðer, þæt man ærestes ne gelyfe; þrydde, þæt man
ortruwige godes mildheortnysse.
 245. Uton nu forþyg habban trumne geleafan to gode and hine
biddan, þæt he us geunne æfter urum forðsiðe, þæt we moton
becuman to his mildheortnysse, swa swa he eallum þam behaten hæfð, þe
hine lufiað and his beboda healdað; þæt is þæt uplice rice, þe
he sylf wunað on mid eallum his halgum a butan ende.
 251. And eac we sceolon biddan þa halgan fæmnan Sancta Marian
ures drihtnes moder, þæt heo us geþingie to hyre leofan bearne, hyre
scippende/, and to urum scippende þæt is god ælmihtig, forþam ðe
heo mæg abiddan æt him eall, þæt heo wyle.

HomU 47 (Nap 58)

Napier 1883, no. 58: 'Sermo bone praedicatio': Napier 299-306.



 1. Þingon eall, þæt we æfre for rihthlafordhelde doð.
 1. Eall we hit doð us sylfum to micelre þearfe, and þam bið
witudlice god ælmihtig hold, þe byð his hlaforde rihtlice hold and
getrywe; and hlaforda gehwylc eac ah swyþe micele þearfe, þæt he his
men rihtlice healde.
 5. And hit bið his agen þearf, þæt he his neadþeowum
beorge, swa he betst mæge, forþam þe hi syndon gode gelice leofe se
hlaford and se þeowa.
 8. Eallswa bealdlice clipað se þeowa on his <foreign>pater nostre</foreign>: ure
fæder, eallswa se hlaford.
 10. Us ealle he gebohte mid gelicum wurðe, þæt is, mid his
agenum blode; and ealle we syndon godes agene neadþeowan; and swa he demð
us on domes dæg, swa we her demað þam mannum, þe we her on eorþan
dom ofer agon.
 14. Þi ah æghwylc man swiðe micele þearfe, þæt hi him
beorgan, swa hi betst magon, ðam þe him sceolan hyran on þisum life;
þonne begitað hi ðe mare gebeorh æt godes agenum dome.
 18. Eac we secgað eow to soðan, þæt ælc cild sceall
beon binnon þryttigum nihtum gefullod mid rihte, buton hit ær beo.
 20. Gif hit þonne dead wurðe butan fulluhte, and hit on þam
preoste gelang sy, þe hit fullian sceolde, þonne sceall he þolian his
hades and ða dædbote betan georne æfre swa lange, swa he libbe, swa se
bisceop him wissige.
 24. Gif hit þonne þurh fæder and modar oððe æniges
mæges gemeleaste dead wurðe, þonne þolige he, se þe hit on gelang
sy, ælcere eardwununge and wræcnige of earde oððe on earde
swiðe/ deope gebete æfre his lifdagas ealle, swa bisceop him tæce.
 28. Ne nænne man man ne læte unbisceopod to lange, þe
læste him forðsið getimige, and he næbbe þa gerihtu, þe him to
gebyredon/.
 31. And witan eac þa, þe cildes onfon æt fulluhte oððe
æt bisceopes handum, þæt hi hit on rihtum geleafan gebringan and on
godum þeawum and on þearflicum dædum and æfre forð on hit wisian to
þam, þe gode licige and his sylfes þearf sy; þonne beoð hi rihtlice,
swa swa hi genamode beoð, godfæderas, gif hi gode heora godbearn
gestrynað.
 37. We moton swyþe wærlice on ælce wisan us healdan, gif we
sceolon us wið deofol gescyldan, forþam þe he bið æfre ymbe þæt
an, þæt he wile us beswican and gedon, gif he mæg, þæt he aleogan
gode ælmihtigum þæt, þæt we beheton, ða ða we fulluht
underfengon.
 42. Þeah þæt cild to þam iung sy, þæt hit sprecan ne
mæge, þonne hit man fullað, his freonda forespræc forstent him
þæt sylfe, swilce hit sylf sprece; and, butan hit gelæste, þonne hit
ylde hæfð, eall, þæt on his geoguðe gode wæs behaten, hit mot
mid ealle forwurðan.
 46. Þonne agan þa yldran þæs oferþearfe, þæt hi
heora gingran gode gestrynan and hi deofle ætwenian, forþam eall,
þæt hi to unrihte geþafiað heora gingran, eall hit bið ongean,
þæt hi gode beheton, þa hi him fulluht begeaton, and ealles þæs hi
moton stið wite þolian on þam towerdan life, buton hi hit gebeton,
þæs þe hi wealdan magon.
 53. Swyþe micele þearfe gehwylc man ah, þæt he rihtne
geleafan hæbbe on god ælmihtigne, þe is wealdend and wyrhta eallra
gesceafta, and þæt he his fulluhtes gescead wite and þæt symle
rihtlice healde and georne his gingran tihte to þam ylcan.
 57. And swa raðe, swa þæt cild mage sprecan, tæce man him
sona eallra þinga ærest his paternoster and his credan, and þæt hit
cunne hit sylf bletsian rihtlice: þonne sceal him þanonforð æfre
syððan þe bet gelimpan.
 61. Ælc cristen man hit sceall cunnan mid rihte, and, gif hwa
sy, þæt he nu gyt ne cunne, he hit leornige swyþe georne.
 63. And ne sceamige ænegum cristenum men for his ylde,
þæt he hit leornige, ac do, swa him þearf is, helpe his sylfes georne,
forþam þe he ne bið wel cristen, þe þæt geleornian nele, ne he
nah mid rihte æniges mannes æt fulluhte to onfonne ne æt bisceopes
handum, se þe þæt ne can, ær he hit geleornige, ne he rihtlice ne
bið husles wyrðe, þe ðæt on life geleornian nele, ne furðon
clænes legeres æfter his forðsiðe.
 70. Beþence gehwilc man hine sylfne and his cristendom on ælce
wisan clænlice healde.
 73. Uton geþencean, þæt we sceoldon swiðe gelomlice ure
cyricean secean, gif we ænige miltse æt gode habban sceolan oððe
æt his halgum, and ure þa clænan gebeda þærinne to urum drihtne
and to eallum his halgum asendan and syngan and to him geornlice clypian and
his miltse us geornlice biddan, þæt he us milde beo.
 78. And we sceolon georne clypian to eallum godes halgum, þæt
hi ure þingeras beon to urum drihtne.
 80. Hit is awriten and gerædd on halgum bocum, and hit is eall
soð.
 81. Hit segð, þæt se, þe nele gelomlice for godes lufan
and for his ege his agenes þances his cyricean secean and his mæssan
þærinne gestandan and gehyran and þa lare lustlice underfon, þe se
mæssepreost þam folce bodað and segð, he sceall his unþances onettan
and gan to hylle and þær æfre aa wunian syþþan mid eallum deoflum.
 87. Ælc þæra stæpa and fotlæsta, þe we to cyricean
weard for godes ege and for his lufu gestæppað, ealle hi beoð amette and
amearcode mid gildenum stafum on heofonum.
 90. Cyrice bið ure scyld and neriend on domes dæg wið
þæt micele fyr, and heo is gesceapen us git to gebedhuse, næs to
nanum gemothuse, buton embe þæt heofencunde rice.
 94. To þam rice we syndon ealle gelaðude and gehatene, gif we
to þam gesælige beoð, þæt we hit geearnian willað her on life.
 96. Uton eac betan symle ure cyrcean.
 96. Be þam þe us to onhagige.
 97. And eac we magon swyþe micele þearfe and ælmessan us
sylfum gedon, gif we willað bricge macian and þa symle botettan.
 99. Þeah se man ne nime buton ænne stan and þæne gelecge
on ful sloh, þæt se ælmesman mæge mid oðrum fet stæppan on þa
clænan healfe, þæt him byð swyþe micel ælmesse and med for
gode.
 103. Hit is forboden on halgum bocum swyþe deope, þæt nan
cristen man ne mote his ælmessan ahwæþer behatan oððe to bringan ne
his wæccan ne his broces bote secean ahwider, buton to Criste sylfum and to
his halgum and to cyrcean.
 107. Ne nan man ne mot, gif he Cristes miltse habban wile, his
ælmessan behatan to wylle ne to wydetreowe ne to stane ne næfre to anum
unalyfedum þinge, buton to godes ciricean anre.
 111. Gehadedum mannum gebyrað, gif hi ænige miltse habban
sceolan æt gode, þæt hi symle þa læwedan and þa ungelæredan
manian and mingian sceolon and him gelomlice heora þearfe asecgan, and
hwæt hi lufian sceolan and hwæt hi sceolon hatian and asceonian.
 115. Se cwyde is swiþe egeslic, þe drihten þurh þone
witegan be þam cwæð, þe godes folce bodian sceolan, þæt syndon
bisceopas and mæssepreostas.
 118. He cwæð se witega: clypiað hlude and ahebbað up eowre
stemne and cyþað minum folce, þæt hi georne fram synnum and gyltum
gecyrron.
 121. And, gif ge þonne þæt ne doð, ac forsuwiað hit and
nyllað folce heora þearfe gecyðan, þonne sceole ge eallra þæra
sawla gescead witan and agildan on domes dæg, þe þurh ðæt losiað,
þæt hi nabbað þa lare and þa mingunge, þe hi beþorfton.
 125. Þes cwyde mæg beon swyþe gemindelic eallum gehadedum
mannum, þe to þam gesette syndon, þæt hi godes folce riht bodian
sceolon; and eac ah þæt folc swiðe micele þearfe, þæt hi wære
beon þæs cwydes, þe ðæræfter gecweden is.
 129. He cwæð se witega æfter þam: gif þa gehadedan men
riht bodiað and hi þæt folc gebigean ne magon to rihte and to heora
agenre þearfe and neode, þonne gebeorgað hi him sylfum swaþeah and
heora agenum sawlum on domes dæg.
 133. And þa, þe him hlystan nellað and þæra þinga
geman and hlystan, þe man heom bodað and segð, ac willað forð on woh
and gewill drifan and geswican nyllað, hi sceolon þæs habban ece wite,
and hi næfre cuman ne motan to godes rice.
 138. Hit is lað and hefityme læwedum folce to gehiranne, and
swaðeahhwæðere gehadedum mannum is beboden deope, þæt hi cyþan
sceolan folce, hwæt on halgum bocum awriten is, and hi wisian, hu hi
rihtæwe healdan sceolan.
 142. Hit bið swyðe rihtlic lif and gode gecwemedlic, þæt
cniht þurhwunige on his cnihthade, oð þæt he on rihtre æwe
gewifige, and hæbbe þa syþþan and nane oðre þa hwile, þe seo
libbe.
 145. Gif hire þonne forðsið getimige ær him, þonne is
hit rihtast, þæt he þanonforð buton ælcum wife wunige.
 147. Sanctus Paulus se mæra godes apostol cwæð, þæt se
læweda/ man moste for neode oþre syþe wifian, ac swaþeahhwæðere
hit is forboden swyþe, þæt man þa bletsunge þærto ne do, þe to
ðære frumwifunge gesette syndon.
 151. And eac is geset swiðe micel dædbot swylcum mannum to
donne and to betenne, þe eft wifiað.
 153. And eac is ælcum preoste forboden, þæt hi beon ne
moton on þa wisan, þe hi ær wæran æt þam brydlacum, þær man
oðre siðe wifað.
 155. Be þam man mæg swiðe eaðe witan, se þe hit
underniman wile, þæt hit eallunga riht nis, þæt wer wifige oððe
wif ceorlige oftur, þonne æne.
 158. Oðre siðe, swa we ær cwædon, he mot for neode; and
hit bið to menigfeald, gewurðe hit þriddan siðe, and mid ealle misdon,
gewurðe hit feorðan siðe; and, gif hit oftur gewyrð, nyte we, hu
þæt faran mæg.
 162. Hit is fullic and fracodlic þingc and gode ælmihtigum and
eallum his halgum lað, þæt hi ne gymað heora sylfra æt þam
unþeawe, þe dysige men on ungewunan healdað, þæt hi ne gymað heora
sylfra, swa hi beþorfton, ac befylað fracodlice hi selfe and eac
geunwurðiað ge wið god ge wið men, þæt hi farað fram wife to
wife, eallswa stunte nytenu doð, þe nan andgyt nabbað.
 168. Ðeah þa dysegan and þa ungeradan his gelyfan nyllan,
eall hit byð þæs deofles lar and tihting, þæt hi swa farað.
 171. Ac swa hwilc man, swa ðæne unðeaw ær beeode, he
geswice.
 172. Þeah læwedum mannum wif si alyfed, swaðeah hi agan
micele þearfe, þæt hi understandan, hu hit is alyfed; and gehadede men
hit sceolon him asecgan, undernimð se, þe wile; and, se þe gesælig
bið, he hit healt, syþþan hit gesæd byð.
 176. Nagan læwede men þurh hæmedþingc, gif hi godes
miltse habban willað, wifes gemanan sunnannihtum ne mæssenihtum ne
wodnesnihtum ne frigenihtum ne næfre on lenctentide ne næfre, þonne
fæsten aboden sy, þe ma, þe man mot on lenctene oððe frigedagum
flæsces brucan.
 181. Ne næfre mid rihte, þæs þe bec secgað and we
geræd habbað, ne motan gesynnhiwenu on anum bedde cuman, syþþan hi to
soþan buta ongitað, þæt heo tymende na leng beon ne mæg ne ne mot.
 185. We magon niman bysene be oðrum þinge: nele nan god
eorðtilia niman his gode sæd and his clæne and sawan on þæt land,
þær he wat full geare, þæt hit næfre weaxan nele.
 188. Beþence gehwa hine sylfne, and hu him rædlicost sy to
donne.
 189. We secgað, swa we hit gerædd habbað on halgum bocum,
understent se, þe gesælig bið.
 191. Wel we witan, þæt æfre, swa we mare on þisum life
for godes ege and his lufe to gode gedoð, swa we maran blisse habbað on
þam towerdan life.
 193. Ne þurfon we na to urum mægum ne nan man to his wife
ðencean to ðam swyþe, þæt him man æfter his forðsyþe to þam
micel fore gedæle, þæt hi hine fram witan alysan, gif he ær her hine
sylfne forgymde.
 197. Uton georne dæges and nihtes biddan urne drihten, þæt
he us on þam towerdan life reste geunne; and uton habban us symle on urum
gemynde þone timan, þe us eallum towerd is.
 201. Ðonne se lichama and seo saul hi totwæmað and
todælað, þonne ænigum gode, ac bið æt gode anum gelang eall,
hwæt we gefaran sceolon.
 203. God us gestrangige and getrymme to ure agenre þearfe.
 206. Ne sceal nanum cristenum men æfre to langsum þincean,
þæt he his agene þearfe gehyre secgan and embe godes mærð smeage.
 208. Hit is lang eall to areccanne, þæt we on bocum embe godes
wundra rædað and syngað; swaðeahhwæðere we wyllað be sumum
dæle hit sum asecgan and areccean mid feawum wordum.
 211. An is ece ælmihtig god, þe gesceop heofenas and eorðan
and ealle gesceafta.
 213. On frumon he gelogode on heofena rice engla weredu micele and
mære.
 214. Þa wearð þær an þæra engla swa beorht and swa
wlitig, þæt se wæs Leohtberend nemned.
 216. Þa ðuhte him, þæt he mihte beon godes euengelica,
þe hine gesceop and geworhte, and wolde dælan rice wið god
ælmihtigne.
 218. Sona swa he þæt þohte þurh ofermodignysse, þa
worhte Crist helle him on to wunienne and eallum ðam oðrum englum, þe mid
him æt þam ræde.

HomU 48 (Nap 59)
B3.4.48.
Napier 1883, no. 59: 'Sermo Lupi': Napier 307-9.



 1. <foreign>Sermo Lupi</foreign>.
 2. Leofan men, doð, swa ic lære, gehyrað, hwæt ic wylle
secgan to þearfe, gyme se, ðe cunne, his agenre neode.
 4. Eallum cristenum mannum is mycel þearf, þæt hy godes lage
fylgean and godcundre lare geornlice gyman; and huru gehadodum is ealra mæst
þearf, forðam þe hy scylan ægðer ge bodian ge bysnian godes riht
georne oðrum mannum.
 8. Nu wylle we læran godes þeowas georne, þæt hy hy sylfe
wærlice beðencan and þurh godes fultum clænnesse lufian and gode
ælmihtigum eadmodlice þeowian and for eall cristen folc þingian gelome.
 12. And þæt hi bocum and gebedum geornlice fylgean and bodian
and bysnian godes riht georne.
 13. And þæt hy læran gelome, swa hy geornost magan,
þæt gehadode regollice and læwede lahlice heora lif fadian to þearfe
hym sylfan.
 16. And ealle cristene men we lærað swyþe georne, þæt
hy inwerdre heortan æfre god lufian and rihtne cristendom geornlice healdan
and godcundan lareowan geornlice hyran and godes lara and laga smeagean and
spirian oft and gelome hym sylfum to þearfe.
 20. And we lærað, þæt ælc cristen man geleornige huru,
þæt he cunne rihtne geleafan ariht understandan, and paternoster and
credan, be ðam þe he wylle æfter forðsiðe mid cristenra gemanan on
gehalgedan restan and gebedrædenne habban oððon ær on life husles
beon wyrðe, forðam he ne byð wel cristen, þe ðæt geleornian nele,
ne he nah mid rihte oþres mannes to onfonne æt fulluhte ne æt biscopes
handa, ær he hit geleornige, þæt he wel cunne.
 28. And we lærað, þæt man wið healice synna and wið
deoflice dæda scylde swyþe georne on æghwylcne timan; and bete swyþe
georne be his scriftes geðehte, se ðe þurh deofles scyfe on synna
befeolle.
 32. And we lærað, þæt man wið fulne galscype and wið
unrihthæmed and wið æghwylcne æwbrice warnie symble.
 34. And we lærað and biddað and on godes naman beodað,
þæt ænig cristen man binnan syx manna sibbfæce æfre ne gewifige
on his agenum cynne ne on his mæges lafe, þe swa neahsibb wære, ne on
his wifes nydmagan, þe he sylf ær ahte, ne on his gefæderan ne on
gehalgodre nunnan.
 39. Ne on ælætan ænig cristen man ne gewifige æfre ne
na ma wifa, þonne an, hæbbe, ac beo be ðære anre þa hwile, þe heo
lybbe, se ðe wylle godes lage gyman mid rihte and wið hellebryne beorgan
his sawle.
 43. And we lærað eac georne manna gehwylcne, þæt he godes
ege hæbbe symle on gemynde and dæges and nihtes forhtige for synnum,
domdæg adrædæ and for helle agrise and æfre him gehende
endedæges wene.
 47. And we lærað swyþe georne freonda gehwylcne, þæt he
fram synnum georne gecyrre and oðrum mannum unrihtes styre, and þæt he
ofer ealle oðre þing lufige his drihten, and þæt he oft and gelome
hæbbe on gemynde, þæt mannum is mæst þearf oftost to gemunanne,
þæt is, þæt hy rihtne geleafan, swa we ær cwædan, anrædlice
habban on ðone soðan god, þe is waldend and wyrhta ealra gesceafta, and
þæt hy rihtne cristendom rihtlice healdan.
 55. And þæt hy godcundan lareowan geornlice hyran and godes
larum and lagum geornlice fylgean.
 57. And þæt hy godes cyrcan æghwær georne griðian and
friðian and mid leohte and lacum hy gelome gegretan and hy sylfe þær
georne oft and gelome gebiddan to Criste.
 60. And þæt hy godes gerihta æghwylce geare mid rihte
gelæstan and freolsa and fæstena rihtlice healdan.
 62. And þæt hy sunnandaga cypinga and folcgemota on þam
halgan dæge georne geswican.
 63. And þæt hi godes þeowas symle werian and weorðian.
 64. And þæt hy godes þearfan frefrian and fedan.
 65. And þæt hi wydewan and steopcild to oft ne ahwænan, ac
georne hy gladian.
 66. And þæt hi elðeodige menn and feorran cumene ne tyrian
ne ne tynan.
 68. And þæt hi oðrum mannum unriht ne beodan ealles to
swyðe, ac manna gehwylc oðrum beode þæt riht, þæt he wylle,
þæt man him beode, be ðam þe hit mæð sy.
 71. A sy godes nama ecelice gebletsod and hym symle sy wuldor and
weorðmynt æfre to worolde.

END_TEXT

HomU 49 (Nap 60)
B3.4.49.
Napier 1883, no. 60: 'Be hæðendome': Napier 309-10.



 1. Be hæðendome.
 2. <foreign>Nemo cristianorum paganas superstitiones intendat, sed
gentilium inquinamenta omnia omnino contemnat</foreign>.
 3. Eala, mycel is nydþearf manna gehwylcum, þæt he wið
deofles larswice warnige symle, and þæt he hæðenscype georne æfre
forbuge, þæt þe he gedon mæge.
 6. And, gyf hit geweorðe, þæt cristen man æfre
heonanforð ahwar heðendom begange oððon ahwar on lande idola
weorðige, gebete þæt deope for gode and for worolde; and, se ðe to
gelome þæt unriht begange, gylde mid Englum swa wer, swa wite, and on Dena
lage lahslite, be ðam þe seo dæd sy.
 12. And, gyf wiccean oððe wigelearas, horingas oððe
horcwenan, morðwyrhtan oððe mansworan innan þysan earde weorðan
agytene, fyse hy man georne ut of þysan earde and clænsige þas þeode
oððon on earde forfare hy mid ealle, butan hi geswicon and þe deoppor
gebetan.
 17. And do man, swa hit þearf is, manfulra dæda on
æghwylcan ende styre man swyðe.
 18. Her syndan on earde godcundnessæ wiðersacan and godes lage
oferhogan, manslagan and mægslagan, cyrichatan and sacerdbanan, hadbrecan
and æwbrecan, myltestran and bearnmyrðran, þeofas and þeodscaðan,
ryperas and reaferas, leogeras and liceteras and leodhatan hetele ealles to
manege,þe ðurh mansylene bariað þas þeode, and wedlogan and
wærlogan and lytle getrywða to wide mid mannum.
 25. And ne byrhð se gesibba hwilan gesibban þe ma, þe ðam
fremdan, ne broðor his breðer oþre hwile ne bearn for oft his fæder ne
meder.
 28. Ne na fela manna ne healt his getrywða swa wel, swa he
scolde, for gode and for worolde.
 30. Ac do man, swa hit þearf is, gebete hit georne and
clænsige þas þeode, gyf man godes miltse geearnian wylle.

END_TEXT

HomU 50 (Nap 61)
B3.4.50.
Napier 1883, no. 61: 'Be cristendome': Napier 310-11.



 1. Be cristendome.
 2. <foreign>A Cristo enim cristiani sunt nominati, Cristus autem caput
nostrum est, et nos membra eius</foreign>; Crist is ealra cristenra manna heafod, and
ealle cristene men syndon to Cristes limum getealde, gyf hy heora drihtne
gecwemað mid rihte.
 6. And hy scylan swyþe georne cristendom æfre healdan mid
rihte and Cristes cyrcan secan gelome heom sylfum to þearfe and Cristes
gerihta rihtlice gelæstan.
 9. And þæt is an ærest, þæt man geteoðige
æghwylce geare þæt, þæt god sende þonne on geare folce to
þearfe on corne and on flexe and on gewelhwylcon wæstme.
 11. And arise seo æcerteoðung a, be ðam þe seo sulh þone
teoðan æcer ær geeode, be godes miltse and be ðæs cynges and be
ealles cristenes folces and be ðære steore, þe Eadgar cyng gelagode.
 15. And sy ælcere geogoðe teoðung gelæst be pentecosten
be wite and eorðwæstma be ealra halgena mæssan.
 17. And romfeoh gelæste man æghwylce geare be Petres
mæssan; and, se ðe hit ne gelæste, sylle þærtoeacan <foreign>xxx</foreign> peninga
and bringe sende to Rome and gylde þam cynge on Engla lage <foreign>cxx</foreign> scillinga.
 20. And cyricsceat gelæste man on Engla lage to Martines
mæssan: and, se ðe þæt ne gelæste, forgylde hine mid twelffealdan
and þam cynge <foreign>cxx</foreign> scillinga.
 23. And sulhælmessan gebyrað, þæt man gelæste be wite
æghwylce geare, þonne huru <foreign>xv</foreign> niht beoð agan ofer eastertid.
 25. And leohtgescot gelæste man be wite to Cristes mæssan and
to candelmæssan and to eastron, do oftor se, ðe wylle.
 27. And saulscat is rihtast, þæt man gelæste aa æt
openum græfe.
 29. And freolsa and fæstena be wite healde man rihtlice.
 30. And ealle godes gerihta fyrðrige man georne, ealswa hit
þearf is.
 31. And, gyf hwa þæt nelle, gewylde man hine to rihte mid
woroldlicre steore.

END_TEXT

HomU 51 (NapDeInfant)
B3.4.51.
Napier 1888, 154: 'De infantibus non baptizandis': Napier 1888, 154-5.



 1. We biddaþ eow men & beodaþ on godes naman þæt ge
wislicor & wærlicor don ymbe eowre hæþenan cild, þonne ge of
þis dydon þæt swa fela sawla gode ne losion swa swa her doþ betweox
eow.
 4. Nu bidde we eow on godes naman þæt ge eowre cild læton
fullian swa hraðe swa hi acennede beoð for þan þe þu nast his lif ge
wis oð mærgen.
 6. & þu dest þinum cilde mycelne hearm gif þu him þurh
þine gymeleaste heofonan rices myrhþe benæmst & hit besencst on
helle grund mid eallum deoflum on ecnysse.
 9. Þu miht þine gymeleaste wið god gebetan ac þam cilde ne
becymð næfre into heofonan rice becuman.
 11. Nu cwæþ sum man þæt he wile cepan him godra freonda
mid his cilde and abit þæs hwilon to lange for þan þe us sægð
þæt halige godspell þæt godes grama wunað ofer þone hæþenan
& betere bið þam hæþenan cilde þæt hit nime an ælmesman
þonne hit næbbe þa ecan myrhðe & hæbbe þa ecan witu.
 16. Nu is eft oþer þing þe dysige wif doþ lecgaþ heora
cild betwux him & of licgaþ hit þonne hi on slæpe beoð forðan
þe se slæpenda man nat hwet he dæþ.
 19. & we secgað þæt seo modor gif heo to þam unwær
bið mid hire breoste mæg þæt cild acwellan gif heo hit læt sucan
& wurð þonne on slepe þonne of lið þæt breost þæs cildes
fnæst oð þæt hit bið forsmorod for þan þe hit ne cann hit aweig
don þonne bið heo hire agenes cildes bana.
 24. Warnige eac seo modor þonne heo mid cilde gæð þæt
heo mid nanre higeleaste hit neamyrre, ne mid nanum hefe ne mid nanum plegan
oððe mid rade oððe mid ungerade for þam þe hit sceall eft of
deaþe arisan on domes dæg gif hit ær cwicu wæs innan þære moder
& hæfð þonne helle wite gif hit hæþen acwylð.

END_TEXT

HomU 52 (NapDeCogita)
B3.4.52.
Napier 1888, 155: 'De cogitatione': Napier 1888, 155.



 1. Se swicola deofol þe syrwð ymbe mancynn asent yfele
geþohtas & þwyrlice ongean god on þæs mannes heortan þæt he
mage hine gebringan on orwenesse þæt he ortruwian sceole be godes
mildheortnesse forþam manfullum geþohtum.
 5. Ac wite nu ge hwa þæt þa yfelan geþohtas ne magon us
derian gif hi us ne liciað & gif we hi ascuniað & to urum drihtne
clypiað.
 7. And se man þe god deþ mid godum ingehyde þæt he oþrum
men fremige on feo oððe on læne & seo læn becume to sumon laþe
þam men he bið swa þeah orsorh þe hit him ær alænde.
 10. & he hæfð his mede, his modes goodnesse þeahþe hit
þurh ungelimp þam oðrum derode.
 11. Eft se þe yfel deþ mid yfelum geþance þeah þe seo
yfele deþ oþrum men fremige se yfela hæfð swa þeah þurh his yfelan
willan þa ecan geniþerunge for his arleasnesse swa swa þa iudeiscan þe
urne drihten acwealdon us to alysednesse & him to forwyrde for heora
syrwunge embe þone soþan hælend.
 17. Eall swa þa ehteras æfter cristes þrowunge þe þa
martiras ofslogan on mistlicum witum fremodon þam halgum & hi gebrohton
to heofenum & hi sylfe fordydon on þere deopan helle.
 20. Swa eac ure ælc æt þam ælmihtigan gode underfehð
þa mede be his modes fadunge swa yfel swa god swa hweþer swa he lufode for
þam þe crist agylt ælcum be his dædæ.
