ApT
B4.1.
Apollonius of Tyre: Goolden 1958, 2-42.



 0.1. HER onginneð seo gerecednes be Antioche þam ungesæligan
cingce and be Apollonige þam tiriscan.
 1.1. An Antiochia þare ceastre wæs sum cyningc Antiochus
gehaten: æfter þæs cyninges naman wæs seo ceaster Antiochia
geciged.
 1.3. Þises cyninges cwen wearð of life gewiten, be ðare he
hæfde ane swiðe wlitige dohter ungelifedlicre fægernesse.
 1.4. Mid þi þe heo becom to giftelicre yldo, þa gyrnde hyre
mænig mære man micele mærða beodende.
 1.6. Ða gelamp hit sarlicum gelimpe: þa ða se fæder
þohte hwam he hi mihte healicost forgifan, þa gefeol his agen mod on hyre
lufe mid unrihtre gewilnunge, to ðam swiðe þæt he forgeat þa
fæderlican arfæstnesse and gewilnode his agenre dohtor him to
gemæccan.
 1.10. And þa gewilnunge naht lange ne ylde, ac sume dæge on
ærnemergen þa he of slæpe awoc, he abræc into ðam bure þar heo
inne læg and het his hyredmen ealle him aweg gan, swilce he wið his dohtor
sume digle spæce sprecan wolde.
 1.14. Hwæt he ða on ðare manfullan scilde abisgode and þa
ongeanwinnendan fæmnan mid micelre strengðe earfoðlice ofercom, and
þæt gefremede man gewilnode to bediglianne.
 2.1. Ða gewearð hit þæt þæs mædenes fostormodor
into ðam bure eode and geseah hi ðar sittan on micelre gedrefednesse and
hire cwæð to: Hwig eart þu, hlæfdige, swa gedrefedes modes?
 2.4. Þæt mæden hyre andswerode: Leofe fostormodor, nu
todæg forwurdon twegen æðele naman on þisum bure.
 2.5. Seo fostormodor cwæð: Hlæfdige, be hwam cwist þu
þæt?
 2.6. Heo hyre andwirde and cwæð: ær ðam dæge minra
bridgifta ic eom mid manfulre scilde besmiten.
 2.8. Ða cwæð seo fostormodor: Hwa wæs æfre swa
dirstiges modes þæt dorste cynges dohtor gewæmman ær ðam dæge
hyre brydgifta and him ne ondrede þæs cyninges irre?
 2.11. Ðæt mæden cwæð: Arleasnes þa scilde on me
gefremode.
 2.12. Seo fostormodor cwæð: Hwar is se fæder?
 2.13. Soðlice on me earmre is mines fæder nama reowlice
forworden and me nu forðam deað þearle gelicað.
 2.14. Seo fostormodor soðlice þa ða heo gehyrde þæt
þæt mæden hire deaðes girnde, ða cliopode heo hi hire to mid
liðere spræce and bæd þæt heo fram þare gewilnunge hyre mod
gewænde and to hire fæder willan gebuge, þeah ðe heo to geneadod
wære.
 3.1. On þisum þingum soðlice þurhwunode se arleasesta cyngc
Antiochus and mid gehywedan mode hine sylfne ætywde his ceastergewarum
swilce he arfæst fæder wære his dohtor.
 3.3. And betwux his hiwcuðum mannum he blissode on ðam þæt
he his agenre dohtor wer wæs.
 3.5. And to ðam þæt he hi þe lengc brucan mihte his dohtor
arleasan bridbeddes and him fram adryfan þa ðe hyre girndon to rihtum
gesynscipum, he asette ða rædels þus cweðende: Swa hwilc man swa minne
rædels riht aræde, onfo se mynre dohtor to wife, and se ðe hine
misræde, sy he beheafdod.
 3.10. Hwæt is nu mare ymbe þæt to sprecanne buton þæt
cyningas æghwano coman and ealdormen for ðam ungelifedlican wlite þæs
mædenes, and þone deað hi oferhogodon and þone rædels understodon
to arædenne.
 3.13. Ac gif heora hwilc þonne þurh asmeagunge boclicre
snotornesse þone rædels ariht rædde, þonne wearð se to beheafdunge
gelæd swa same swa se ðe hine ariht ne rædde.
 3.16. And þa heafda ealle wurdon gesette on ufeweardan þam
geate.
 4.1. Mid þi soðlice Antiochus se wælreowa cyningc on þysse
wælreownesse þurhwunode, ða wæs Apollonius gehaten sum iung man se
wæs swiðe welig and snotor and wæs ealdorman on Tiro þare mægðe,
se getruwode on his snotornesse and on ða boclican lare and agan rowan oð
þæt he becom to Antiochian.
 4.6. Eode þa into ðam cyninge and cwæð: Wes gesund,
cyningc.
 4.7. Hwæt ic becom nu to ðe swa swa to godum fæder and
arfæstum.
 4.8. Ic eom soðlice of cynelicum cynne cumen and ic bidde þinre
dohtor me to gemæccan.
 4.9. Ða ða se cyngc þæt gehyrde þæt he his willes
gehyran nolde, he swiðe irlicum andwlitan beseah to ðam iungan ealdormen
and cwæð: þu iunga mann, canst ðu þone dom mynra dohtor gifta?
 4.12. Apollonius cwæð: Ic can þone dom and ic hine æt
þam geate geseah.
 4.13. Ða cwæð se cyningc mid æbilignesse: Gehir nu þone
rædels, <foreign>Scelere vereor, materna carne vescor</foreign>; þæt is on englisc:
Scylde ic þolige, moddrenum flæsce ic bruce.
 4.16. Eft he cwæð: <foreign>Quaero patrem meum, meae matris virum,
uxoris meae filiam nec invenio</foreign>; þæt is on englisc: Ic sece minne
fæder, mynre modor wer, mines wifes dohtor and ic ne finde.
 4.19. Apollonius þa soðlice onfangenum rædelse hine
bewænde hwon fram ðam cyninge, and mid þy þe he smeade ymbe þæt
ingehyd, he hit gewan mid wisdome and mid Godes fultume he þæt soð
arædde.
 4.22. Bewænde hine þa to ðam cynincge and cwæð: þu
goda cyningc, þu asettest rædels; gehyr ðu þa onfundennesse.
 4.24. Ymbe þæt þu cwæde þæt þu scilde þolodest,
ne eart ðu leogende on ðam, beseoh to ðe silfum; and þæt þu
cwæde moddrenum flæsce ic bruce, ne eart ðu on ðam leogende, beseoh
to þinre dohtor.
 5.1. Mid þy þe se cyningc gehirde þæt Apollonius þone
rædels swa rihte arædde, þa ondred he þæt hit to widcuð
wære.
 5.3. Beseah ða mid irlicum andwlitan to him and cwæð: ðu
iunga man, þu eart feor fram rihte; þu dwelast and nis naht þæt þu
segst; ac þu hæfst beheafdunge geearnad.
 5.5. Nu læte ic ðe to þrittigra daga fæce þæt þu
beþence ðone rædels ariht, and ðu siððan onfoh minre dohtor to
wife, and gif ðu þæt ne dest þu scealt oncnawan þone gesettan dom.
 5.8. Ða wearð Apollonius swiðe gedrefed and mid his geferum
on scip astah and reow oð þæt he becom to Tirum.
 6.1. Soðlice æfter þam þe Apollonius afaren wæs,
Antiochus se cyningc him to gecigde his dihtnere se wæs Thaliarcus gehaten:
Thaliarce, ealre mynra digolnessa myn se getrywesta þegn, wite þu þæt
Apollonius ariht arædde mynne rædels.
 6.5. Astih nu rædlice on scip and far æfter him, and þonne
þu him to becume, þonne acwel ðu hine mid isene oððe mid attre,
þæt þu mage freodom onfon þonne þu ongean cymst.
 6.7. Thaliarcus sona swa he þæt gehyrde, he genam mid him ge
feoh ge attor and on scip astah and for æfter þam unscæððian
Apollonie oð ðæt he to his eðle becom.
 6.10. Ac Apollonius þeahhwæðre ær becom to his agenan and
into his huse eode and his bocciste untynde and asmeade þone rædels
æfter ealra uðwitena and Chaldea wisdome.
 6.13. Mid þi þe he naht elles ne onfunde buton þæt he
ær geþohte, he cwæð þa to him silfum: Hwæt dest þu nu,
Apolloni?
 6.15. Ðæs cynges rædels þu asmeadest and þu his dohtor
ne onfenge; forðam þu eart nu fordemed þæt þu acweald wurðe.
 6.16. And he þa ut eode and het his scip mid hwæte
gehlæstan and mid micclum gewihte goldes and seolfres and mid mænifealdum
and genihtsumum reafum, and swa mid feawum þam getrywestum mannum on scip
astah on ðare þriddan tide þare nihte and sloh ut on ða sæ.
 7.1. Þa ðy æftran dæge wæs Apollonius gesoht and
geacsod, ac he ne wæs nahwar funden.
 7.2. Ðar wearð ða micel morcnung and ormæte wop, swa
þæt se heaf swegde geond ealle þa ceastre.
 7.4. Soðlice swa micele lufe hæfde eal seo ceasterwaru to him,
þæt hi lange tid eodon ealle unscorene and sidfeaxe and heora waforlican
plegan forleton and heora baða belucon.
 7.7. Þa ða þas þingc ðus gedone wæron on Tiron, ða
becom se foresæda Thaliarcus, se wæs fram Antiocho þam cynincge
asænd to ðam þæt he scolde Apollonium acwellan.
 7.9. Þa he geseah þæt ealle þas þingc belocene wæron,
þa cwæð he to anum cnapan: Swa ðu gesund sy, sege me for hwilcum
intingum þeos ceaster wunige on swa micclum heafe and wope.
 7.12. Him andswerode se cnapa and þus cwæð: Eala hu manful
man þu eart, ðu þe wast þæt þu æfter axsast.
 7.14. Oððe hwæt is manna þe nyte þæt þeos
ceasterwaru on heafe wunað, forðam ðe Apollonius se ealdorman færinga
nahwar ne ætywde siððan he ongean com fram Antiocho þam cyninge?
 7.17. Ða þa Thaliarcus þæt gehyrde, he mid micclan gefean
to scipe gewænde and mid gewisre seglunge binnon anum dæge com to
Antiochian and eode into þam cynge and cwæð: Hlaford cyngc, glada nu and
blissa, forðam þe Apollonius him ondræt þines rices mægna swa
þæt he ne dear nahwar gewunian.
 7.22. Ða cwæð se cyningc: Fleon he mæg, ac he ætfleon
ne mæg.
 7.23. He þa Antiochus se cyningc gesette þis geban þus
cweðende: Swa hwilc man swa me Apollonium lifigendne to gebringð, ic him
gife fifti punda goldes, and þam ðe me his heafod to gebringð, ic gife
him <foreign>c</foreign> punda goldes.
 7.26. Þa ða þis geban þus geset wæs, þa wæron mid
gitsunge beswicene na þæt an his find ac eac swilce his frind, and him
æfter foran and hine geond ealle eorðan sohton ge on dunlandum ge on
wudalandum ge on diglum stowum, ac he ne wearð nahwar funden.
 8.1. Ða het se cyngc scipa gegearcian and him æfter faran, ac
hit wæs lang ær ðam þe ða scipa gegearcode wæron, and Apollonius
becom ær to Tharsum.
 8.3. Ða sume dæge eode he be strande.
 8.4. Þa geseah hine sum his cuðra manna se wæs Hellanicus
genemnod, se þe ærest þider com.
 8.5. Þa eode he to Apollonium and cwæð: Wes gesund, hlaford
Apolloni.
 8.6. Ða forseah he Apollonius cyrlisces mannes gretinge æfter
ricra manna gewunan.
 8.8. Hellanicus hine eft sona gegrette and cwæð: Wes gesund,
Apolloni, and ne forseoh ðu cyrliscne man þe bið mid wurðfullum
þeawum gefrætwod.
 8.10. Ac gehyr nu fram me þæt þu silfa nast.
 8.11. Þe is soðlice micel þearf þæt þu ðe warnige,
forðam þe ðu eart fordemed.
 8.12. Ða cwæð Apollonius: Hwa mihte me fordeman, minre
agenre þeode ealdorman?
 8.13. Hellanicus cwæð: Antiochus se cyngc.
 8.14. Apollonius cwæð: For hwilcum intingum hæfð he me
fordemed?
 8.15. Hellanicus sæde: Forðam þe þu girndest þæt þu
wære þæt se fæder is.
 8.16. Apollonius cwæð: Micclum ic eom fordemed?
 8.17. Hellanicus sæde: Swa hwilc man swa ðe lifigende to him
bringð, onfo se fiftig punda goldes.
 8.18. Se ðe him bringe þin heafod, onfo se hundteontig punda
goldes.
 8.19. Forðam ic ðe lære þæt þu fleo and beorge
þinum life.
 8.20. Æfter þysum wordum Hellanicus fram him gewænde and
Apollonius/ het hine eft to him geclipian and cwæð to him: þæt
wyrreste þingc þu didest þæt þu me warnodest.
 8.23. Nym nu her æt me hundteontig punda goldes, and far to
Antiocho þam cynge and sege him þæt me sy þæt heafod fram þam
hneccan acorfen, and bring þæt word þam cynge to blisse: þonne hafast
þu mede and eac clæne handa fram þæs unscæðþigan blode.
 8.27. Ða cwæð Hellanicus: Ne gewurðe þæt, hlaford,
þæt ic mede nime æt ðe for þisum þingum, forðon þe mid godum
mannum nis naðer ne gold ne seolfor wið godes mannes freondscipe
wiðmeten.
 8.30. Hi toeodon þa mid þisum wordum.
 9.1. And Apollonius sona gemette oðerne cuðne man ongean hine
gan þæs nama wæs Stranguilio gehaten.
 9.2. Hlaford geong Apolloni, hwæt dest ðu þus gedrefedum
mode on þisum lande?
 9.4. Apollonius cwæð: Ic gehirde secgan þæt ic wære
fordemed.
 9.5. Stranguilio cwæð: Hwa fordemde þe?
 9.5. Apollonius cwæð: Antiochus se cyngc.
 9.6. Stranguilio cwæð: For hwilcum intingum?
 9.7. Apollonius sæde:Forðam þe ic bæd his dohtor me to
gemæccan, be þare ic mæg to soðe secgan þæt heo his agen
gemæcca wære.
 9.9. Forðam gif hit gewurðan mæg, ic wille me bedihlian on
eowrum eðle.
 9.10. Ða cwæð Stranguilio: Hlaford Apolloni, ure ceaster is
þearfende and ne mæg þine æðelborennesse acuman, forðon ðe we
þoliað þone heardestan hungor and þone reðestan, and minre
ceasterwaru nis nan hælo hiht, ac se wælreowesta deað stent ætforan
urum eagum.
 9.14. Ða cwæð Apollonius: Min se leofesta freond
Stranguilio, þanca Gode þæt He me fliman hider to eowrum gemæran
gelædde.
 9.17. Ic sille eowrum geceasterwarum hundteontig þusenda mittan
hwætes gif ge minne fleam bedigliað.
 9.18. Mid þi þe Stranguilio þæt gehirde, he hine astrehte
to his fotum and cwæð: Hlaford Apolloni, gif ðu þissere hungrigan
ceasterwaru/ gehelpest, na þæt an þæt we willað þinne fleam
bediglian, ac eac swilce, gif þe neod gebirað, we willað campian for
ðinre hælo.
 10.1. Ða astah Apollonius on þæt domsetl on ðare stræte
and cwæð to ðam andweardan ceasterwarum: Ge tharsysce ceasterwaran, ic
Apollonius se tirisca ealdorman eow cyðe þæt ic gelife þæt ge
willan beon gemindige þissere fremfulnesse and minne fleam bediglian.
 10.5. Wite ge eac þæt Antiochus se cyngc me aflimed hæfð
of minum earde, ac for eowre gesælðe gefultumigendum Gode ic eom hider
cumen.
 10.7. Ic sille eow soðlice hundteontig þusenda mittan hwætes
to ðam wurðe þe ic hit gebohte on minum lande.
 10.9. Ða ða þæt folc þæt gehirde, hi wæron bliðe
gewordene and him georne þancodon and to geflites þone hwæte up
bæron.
 10.11. Hwæt ða Apollonius forlet his þone wurðfullan
cynedom and mangeres naman þar genam ma þonne gifendes, and þæt
wyrð þe he mid þam hwæte genam he ageaf sona agean to ðare ceastre
bote.
 10.14. Þæt folc wearð ða swa fagen his cystignessa and swa
þancful þæt hig worhton him ane anlicnesse of are.
 10.16. And on ðare stræte stod and mid þare swiðran hand
þone hwæte heold and mid þam winstran fet þa mittan træd, and
þaron þus awriten: ðas gifu sealde seo ceasterwaru on Tharsum Apollonio
þam tiriscan, forðam þe he þæt folc of hungre alesde and heora
ceastre gestaðolode.
 11.1. Æfter þisum hit gelamp binnon feawum monðum þæt
Stranguilio and Dionisiade his wif gelærdon Apollonium ðæt he ferde on
scipe to Pentapolim þare ciriniscan birig, and cwædon þæt he mihte
þar bediglad beon and þar wunian.
 11.4. And þæt folc hine þa mid unasecgendlicre wurðmynte
to scipe gelæddon, and Apollonius hi bæd ealle gretan and on scip
astah.
 11.6. Mid þi þe hig ongunnon þa rowan and hi forðwerd
wæron on heora weg, þa wearð ðare sæ smiltnesse awænd færinga
betwux twam tidum and wearð micel reownes aweht, swa þæt seo sæ
cnyste þa heofonlican tungla and þæt gewealc þara yða hwaðerode
mid windum.
 11.11. Þartoeacan coman eastnorðerne windas and se angrislica
suðwesterna wind him ongean stod and þæt scip eal tobærst.
 12.1. On ðissere egeslican reownesse Apollonius geferan ealle
forwurdon to deaðe, and Apollonius ana becom mid sunde to Pentapolim þam
ciriniscan lande and þar up eode on ðam strande.
 12.4. Þa stod he nacod on þam strande and beheold þa sæ
and cwæð: Eala þu sæ Neptune, manna bereafigend and
unscæððigra beswicend, þu eart wælreowra þonne Antiochus se
cyngc.
 12.7. For minum þingum þu geheolde þas wælreownesse
þæt ic þurh ðe gewurde wædla and þearfa, and þæt se
wælreowesta/ cyngc me þy eað fordon mihte.
 12.9. Hwider mæg ic nu faran?
 12.9. Hwæs mæg ic biddan oððe hwa gifð þam uncuðan
lifes fultum?
 12.10. Mid þi þe he þas þingc wæs sprecende to him
silfum, þa færinga geseah he sumne fiscere gan.
 12.12. To þam he beseah and þus sarlice cwæð: Gemiltsa me,
þu ealda man, sy þæt þu sy; gemildsa me nacodum, forlidenum.
 12.14. Næs na of earmlicum birdum geborenum.
 12.15. And ðæs ðe ðu gearo forwite hwam ðu gemiltsige,
ic eom Apollonius se tirisca ealdorman.
 12.16. Ða sona swa se fiscere geseah þæt se iunga man æt
his fotum læg, he mid mildheortnesse hine up ahof and lædde hine mid him
to his huse and ða estas him beforan legde þe he him to beodenne hæfde.
 12.19. Þa git he wolde be his mihte maran arfæstnesse him
gecyðan, toslat þa his wæfels on twa and sealde Apollonige þone
healfan dæl þus cweðende: Nim þæt ic þe to sillenne habbe and ga
into ðare ceastre.
 12.22. Wen is þæt þu gemete sumne þe þe gemiltsige.
 12.23. Gif ðu ne finde nænne þe þe gemiltsian wille,
wænd þonne hider ongean and genihtsumige unc bam mine litlan æhta and
far ðe on fiscnoð mid me.
 12.26. Þeahhwæðre ic mynegie þe, gif ðu fultumiendum
Gode/ becymst to ðinum ærran wurðmynte, þæt þu ne forgite mine
þearfendlican gegirlan.
 12.28. Ða cwæð Apollonius: Gif ic þe ne geþence þonne
me bet bið, ic wisce þæt ic eft forlidennesse gefare and þinne gelican
eft ne gemete.
 13.1. Æfter þisum wordum he eode on ðone weg þe him
getæht wæs oð ðæt he becom to þare ceastre geate and ðar in
eode.
 13.3. Mid þi þe he þohte hwæne he byddan mihte lifes
fultum, þa geseah he ænne nacodne cnapan geond þa stræte yrnan, se
wæs mid ele gesmerod and mid scitan begird and bær iungra manna plegan on
handa to ðam bæðstede belimpende.
 13.6. And cliopode micelre stæfne and cwæð: Gehyre ge
ceasterwaran, gehyre ge ælðeodige, frige and þeowe, æðele and
unæðele, se bæðstede is open.
 13.9. Ða ða Apollonius þæt gehirde he hine unscridde
þam healfan scicilse ðe he on hæfde and eode into ðam þweale, and
mid þi þe he beheold heora anra gehwilcne on heora weorce, he sohte his
gelican, ac he ne mihte hine þar findan on ðam flocce.
 13.13. Ða færinga com Arcestrates, ealre þare þeode
cyningc, mid micelre mænio his manna and in eode on þæt bæð.
 13.14. Ða agan se cyngc plegan wið his geferan mid þoðere,
and Apollonius hine gemægnde swa swa God wolde on ðæs cyninges plegan
and yrnende þone ðoðor gelæhte, and mid swiftre rædnesse geslegene
ongean gesænde to ðam plegendan cynge.
 13.18. Eft he agean asænde; he rædlice sloh swa he hine
næfre feallan ne let.
 13.19. Se cyngc ða oncneow þæs iungan snelnesse þæt he
wiste þæt he næfde his gelican on þam plegan, þa cwæð he to
his geferan: Gað eow heonon.
 13.22. Þes cniht, þæs þe me þingð, is min gelica.
 13.22. Ða ða Apollonius gehyrde þæt se cyning hyne herede,
ne arn rædlice and genealæhte to ðam cynge and mid gelæredre handa
he swang þone top mid swa micelre swiftnesse þæt se cyngc wæs
geþuht swilce he of ylde to iuguðe gewænd wære, and æfter þam on
his cynesetle he him gecwemlice ðenode.
 13.27. And þa ða he ut eode of ðam bæðe, ne hine
lædde be þare handa and him þa siððan þanon gewænde þæs
weges þe he ær com.
 14.1. Ða cwæð se cyningc to his mannum siððan Apollonius
agan wæs: Ic swerige þurh ða gemænan hælo þæt ic me næfre
bet ne baðode þonne ic dide todæg nat ic þurh hwilces iunges mannes
þenunge.
 14.4. Ða beseah he hine to anum his manna and cwæð: Ga and
gewite hwæt se iunga man sy þe me todæg swa wel gehirsumode.
 14.6. Se man ða eode æfter Apollonio.
 14.6. Mid þi þe he geseah þæt he wæs mid horhgum
scicelse bewæfed, þa wænde he ongean to ðam cynge and cwæð: Se
iunga man þe þu æfter axsodest is forliden man.
 14.9. Ða cwæð se cyng: þurh hwæt wast ðu þæt?
 14.10. Se man him andswerode and cwæð: þeah he hit silf
forswige, his gegirla hine geswutelað.
 14.11. Ða cwæð se cyngc: Ga rædlice and sege him þæt
se cyngc bit ðe þæt ðu cume to his gereorde.
 14.13. Ða Apollonius þæt gehyrde, he þam gehyrsumode and
eode forð mid þam men oð þæt he becom to ðæs cynges healle.
 14.15. Ða eode se man in beforan to ðam cynge and cwæð: Se
forlidena/ man is cumen þe ðu æfter sændest, ac he ne mæg for
scame in gan buton scrude.
 14.17. Ða het se cyngc hine sona gescridan mid wurðfullan
scrude and het hine in gan to ðam gereorde.
 14.19. Ða eode Apollonius in and gesæt þar him getæht
wæs ongean ðone cyngc.
 14.20. Ðar wearð ða seo þenung in geboren and æfter
þam cynelic gebeorscipe and Apollonius nan ðingc ne æt, ðeah ðe
ealle oðre men æton and bliðe wæron, ac he beheold þæt gold and
þæt seolfor and ða deorwurðan reaf and þa beodas and þa cynelican
þenunga.
 14.24. Ða ða he þis eal mid sarnesse beheold, ða sæt sum
eald and sum æfestig ealdorman be þam cynge.
 14.26. Mid þi þe he geseah þæt Apollonius swa sarlice
sæt and ealle þingc beheold and nan ðingc ne æt, ða cwæð he to
ðam cynge: ðu goda cyngc, efne þes man þe þu swa wel wið gedest, he
is swiðe æfestful for ðinum gode.
 14.29. Ða cwæð se cyngc: þe misþingð.
 14.30. Soðlice þes iunga man ne æfestigað on nanum
ðingum ðe he her gesihð, ac he cyð þæt he hæfð fela
forloren.
 14.31. Ða beseah Arcestrates se cyngc bliðum andwlitan to
Apollonio and cwæð: ðu iunga man, beo bliðe mid us and gehiht on God
þæt þu mote silf to ðam selran becuman.
 15.1. Mid þi ðe se cyning þas word gecwæð, ða
færinga þar eode in ðæs cynges iunge dohtor and cyste hyre fæder
and ða ymbsittendan.
 15.3. Þa heo becom to Apollonio, þa gewænde heo ongean to
hire fæder and cwæð: ðu goda cyningc and min se leofesta fæder,
hwæt is þes iunga man þe ongean ðe on swa wurðlicum setle sit mid
sarlicum andwlitan?
 15.6. Nat ic hwæt he besorgað.
 15.7. Ða cwæð se cyningc: Leofe dohtor, þes iunga man is
forliden and he gecwemde me manna betst on ðam plegan, forðam ic hine
gelaðode to ðysum urum gebeorscipe.
 15.9. Nat ic hwæt he is ne hwanon he is, ac gif ðu wille witan
hwæt he sy, axsa hine, forðam þe gedafenað þæt þu wite.
 15.11. Ða eode þæt mæden to Apollonio and mid
forwandigendre spræce cwæð: ðeah ðu stille sy and unrot, þeah ic
þine æðelborennesse on ðe geseo.
 15.13. Nu þonne gif ðe to hefig ne þince, sege me þinne
naman and þin gelymp arece me.
 15.15. Ða cwæð Apollonius: Gif ðu for neode axsast
æfter minum naman, ic secge þe ic hine forleas on sæ.
 15.17. Gif ðu wilt mine æðelborennesse witan, wite ðu
þæt ic hig forlet on Tharsum.
 15.18. Ðæt mæden cwæð: Sege me gewislicor þæt ic
hit mæge understandan.
 16.1. Apollonius þa soðlice hyre arehte ealle his gelymp and
æt þare spræcan ende him feollon tearas of ðam eagum.
 16.2. Mid þy þe se cyngc þæt geseah, he bewænde hine
ða to ðare dohtor and cwæð: Leofe dohtor, þu gesingodest; mid þy
þe þu woldest witan his naman and his gelimp, þu hafast nu geedniwod his
ealde sar.
 16.6. Ac ic bidde þe þæt þu gife him swa hwæt swa ðu
wille.
 16.7. Ða ða þæt mæden gehirde þæt hire wæs
alyfed fram hire fæder þæt heo ær hyre silf gedon wolde, ða
cwæð heo to Apollonio: Apolloni, soðlice þu eart ure.
 16.9. Forlæt þine murcnunge and nu ic mines fæder leafe
habbe, ic gedo ðe weligne.
 16.10. Apollonius hire þæs þancode, and se cyngc blissode on
his dohtor welwillendnesse and hyre to cwæð: Leofe dohtor, hat feccan
þine hearpan and gecig ðe to þine frynd and afirsa fram þam iungan his
sarnesse.
 16.14. Ða eode heo ut and het feccan hire hearpan, and sona swa
heo hearpian ongan, heo mid winsumum sange gemægnde þare hearpan sweg.
 16.16. Ða ongunnon ealle þa men hi herian on hyre swegcræft
and Apollonius ana swigode.
 16.17. Ða cwæð se cyningc: Apolloni, nu ðu dest yfele,
forðam þe ealle men heriað mine dohtor on hyre swegcræfte and þu ana
hi swigende tælst.
 16.20. Apollonius cwæð: Eala ðu goda cyngc, gif ðu me
gelifst, ic secge þæt ic ongite þæt soðlice þin dohtor gefeol on
swegcræft, ac heo næfð hine na wel geleornod.
 16.22. Ac hat me nu sillan þa hearpan; þonne wast þu þæt
þu nu git nast.
 16.23. Arcestrates se cyning cwæð: Apolloni, ic oncnawe
soðlice þæt þu eart on eallum þingum wel gelæred.
 16.25. Ða het se cyng sillan Apollonige þa hearpan.
 16.26. Apollonius þa ut eode and hine scridde and sette ænne
cynehelm uppon his heafod and nam þa hearpan on his hand and in eode and swa
stod, þæt se cyngc and ealle þa ymbsittendan wendon þæt he nære
Apollonius ac þæt he wære Apollines ðara hæðenra God.
 16.30. Ða wearð stilnes and swige geworden innon ðare
healle.
 16.31. And Apollonius his hearpenægl genam and he þa
hearpestrengas mid cræfte astirian ongan and þare hearpan sweg mid
winsumum sange gemægnde.
 16.33. And se cyngc silf and ealle þe þar andwearde wæron
micelre stæfne cliopodon and hine heredon.
 16.35. Æfter þisum forlet Apollonius þa hearpan and plegode
and fela fægera þinga þar forð teah, þe þam folce ungecnawen
wæs and ungewunelic, and heom eallum þearle licode ælc þara þinga
ðe he forð teah.
 17.1. Soðlice mid þy þe þæs cynges dohtor geseah
þæt Apollonius on eallum godum cræftum swa wel wæs getogen, þa
gefeol hyre mod on his lufe.
 17.3. Ða æfter þæs beorscipes geendunge cwæð
þæt mæden to ðam cynge: Leofa fæder, þu lyfdest me litle ær
þæt ic moste gifan Apollonio swa hwæt swa ic wolde of þinum
goldhorde.
 17.6. Arcestrates se cyng cwæð to hyre: Gif him swa hwæt
swa ðu wille.
 17.7. Heo ða swiðe bliðe ut eode and cwæð: Lareow
Apolloni, ic gife þe be mines fæder leafe twa hund punda goldes and feower
hund punda gewihte seolfres and þone mæstan dæl deorwurðan reafes and
twentig ðeowa manna.
 17.11. And heo þa þus cwæð to ðam þeowum mannum:
Berað þas þingc mid eow þe ic behet Apollonio minum lareowe and
lecgað innon bure beforan minum freondum.
 17.13. Þis wearð þa þus gedon æfter þare cwene
hæse, and ealle þa men hire gife heredon ðe hig gesawon.
 17.15. Ða soðlice geendode þe gebeorscipe, and þa men ealle
arison and gretton þone cyngc and ða cwene and bædon hig gesunde beon
and ham gewændon.
 17.17. Eac swilce Apollonius cwæð: ðu goda cyngc and earmra
gemiltsigend, and þu cwen, lare lufigend, beon ge gesunde.
 17.19. He beseah eac to ðam þeowum mannum þe þæt
mæden him forgifen hæfde and heom cwæð to: Nimað þas þing mid
eow þe me seo cwen forgeaf and gan we secan ure gesthus þæt we magon us
gerestan.
 17.22. Ða adred þæt mæden þæt heo næfre eft
Apollonium ne gesawe swa raðe swa heo wolde, and eode þa to hire fæder
and cwæð: ðu goda cyningc, licað ðe wel þæt Apollonius þe
þurh us todæg gegodod is þus heonon fare, and cuman yfele men and
bereafian hine?
 17.27. Se cyngc cwæð: Wel þu cwæde.
 17.27. Hat him findan hwar he hine mæge wurðlicost gerestan.
 17.28. Ða dide þæt mæden swa hyre beboden wæs, and
Apollonius onfeng þare wununge ðe hym getæht wæs and ðar in eode
Gode þancigende ðe him ne forwyrnde cynelices wurðscipes and frofres.
 18.1. Ac þæt mæden hæfde unstille niht, mid þare lufe
onæled þara worda and sanga þe heo gehyrde æt Apollonige, and na leng
heo ne gebad ðonne hit dæg wæs, ac eode sona swa hit leoht wæs and
gesæt beforan hire fæder bedde.
 18.4. Ða cwæð se cyngc: Leofe dohtor, for hwi eart ðu
þus ærwacol?
 18.5. Ðæt mæden cwæð: Me awehton þa gecnerdnessan
þe ic girstandæg gehyrde.
 18.7. Nu bidde ic ðe forðam þæt þu befæste me urum
cuman Apollonige to lare.
 18.8. Ða wearð se cyningc þearle geblissod and het feccan
Apollonium and him to cwæð: Min dohtor girnð þæt heo mote leornian
æt ðe ða gesæligan lare ðe þu canst.
 18.11. And gif ðu wilt þisum þingum gehyrsum beon, ic swerige
ðe þurh mines rices mægna þæt swa hwæt swa ðu on sæ forlure
ic ðe þæt on lande gestaðelige.
 18.13. Ða ða Apollonius þæt gehyrde, he onfengc þam
mædenne to lare and hire tæhte swa wel swa he silf geleornode.
 19.1. Hyt gelamp ða æfter þisum binnon feawum tidum þæt
Arcestrates se cyngc heold Apollonius hand on handa and eodon swa ut on ðare
ceastre stræte.
 19.3. Þa æt nyhstan comon ðar gan ongean hy þry
gelærede weras and æþelborene, þa lange ær girndon þæs
cyninges dohtor.
 19.5. Hi ða ealle þry togædere anre stæfne gretton þone
cyngc.
 19.6. Ða smercode se cyng and heom to beseah and þus cwæð:
Hwæt is þæt þæt ge me anre stæfne gretton?
 19.8. Ða andswerode heora an and cwæð: We bædon gefirn
þynre dohtor and þu us oftrædlice mid elcunge geswænctest.
 19.10. Forðam we comon hider todæg þus togædere.
 19.10. We syndon þyne ceastergewaran of æðelum gebyrdum
geborene.
 19.12. Nu bidde we þe þæt þu geceose þe ænne of us
þrym hwilcne þu wille þe to aðume habban.
 19.13. Ða cwæð se cyngc: Nabbe ge na godne timan aredodne.
 19.14. Min dohtor is nu swiðe bisy ymbe hyre leornunga, ac þe
læs þe ic eow a leng slæce, awritað eowre naman on gewrite and hire
morgengife; þonne asænde ic þa gewrita minre dohtor þæt heo sylf
geceose hwilcne eowerne heo wille.
 19.18. Ða didon ða cnihtas swa and se cyngc nam ða gewrita
and geinseglode hi mid his ringe and sealde Apollonio þus cweðende: Nim nu,
lareow Apolloni, swa hit þe ne mislicyge, and bryng þinum
lærincgmædene.
 20.1. Ða nam Apollonius þa gewrita and eode to ðare cynelican
healle.
 20.2. Mid þam þe þæt mæden geseah Apollonium, þa
cwæð heo: Lareow, hwi gæst ðu ana?
 20.3. Apollonius cwæð: Hlæfdige, næs git yfel wif, nim
ðas gewrita ðe þin fæder þe sænde and ræd.
 20.5. Ðæt mæden nam and rædde þara þreora cnihta
naman, ac heo ne funde na þone naman þar on þe heo wolde.
 20.6. Ða heo þa gewrita oferræd hæfde, ða beseah heo to
Apollonio and cwæð: Lareow, ne ofþingð hit ðe gif ic þus wer
geceose?
 20.8. Apollonius cwæð: Na, ac ic blissige swiðor ðæt
þu miht ðurh ða lare, þe þu æt me underfenge, þe silf on gewrite
gecyðan hwilcne heora þu wille.
 20.11. Min willa is þæt þu ðe wer geceose þar ðu silf
wille.
 20.11. Þæt mæden cwæð: Eala lareow, gif ðu me
lufodest, þu hit besorgodest.
 20.13. Æfter þisum wordum heo mid modes anrædnesse awrat
oðer gewrit and þæt geinseglode and sealde Apollonio.
 20.14. Apollonius hit þa ut bær on ða stræte and sealde
þam cynge.
 20.15. Ðæt gewrit wæs þus gewriten: þu goda cyngc and
min se leofesta fæder, nu þin mildheortnesse me leafe sealde þæt ic
silf moste ceosan hwilcne wer ic wolde, ic secge ðe to soðan þone
forlidenan man ic wille.
 20.19. And gif ðu wundrige þæt swa scamfæst fæmne swa
unforwandigendlice ðas word awrat, þonne wite þu þæt ic hæbbe
þurh weax aboden, ðe nane scame ne can, þæt ic silf ðe for scame
secgan ne mihte.
 21.1. Ða ða se cyningc hæfde þæt gewrit oferræd,
þa niste he hwilcne forlidene heo nemde.
 21.2. Beseah ða to ðam þrim cnihtum and cwæð: Hwilc
eower is forliden?
 21.3. Ða cwæð heora an se hatte Ardalius: Ic eom forliden.
 21.4. Se oðer him andwirde and cwæð: Swiga ðu; adl þe
fornime þæt ðu ne beo hal ne gesund.
 21.6. Mid me þu boccræft leornodest and ðu næfre buton
þare ceastre geate fram me ne come.
 21.7. Hwar gefore ðu forlidennesse?
 21.8. Mid ði þe se cyngc ne mihte findan hwilc heora forliden
wære, he beseah to Apollonio and cwæð: Nim ðu, Apolloni, þis gewrit
and ræd hit.
 21.10. Eaðe mæg gewurðan þæt þu wite þæt ic nat,
ðu ðe þar andweard wære.
 21.11. Ða nam Apollonius þæt gewrit and rædde and sona
swa he ongeat þæt he gelufod wæs fram ðam mædene, his andwlita eal
areodode.
 21.13. Ða se cyngc þæt geseah, þa nam he Apollonies hand
and hine hwon fram þam cnihtum gewænde and cwæð: Wast þu þone
forlidenan man?
 21.15. Apollonius cwæð: ðu goda cyning, gif þin willa
bið, ic hine wat.
 21.16. Ða geseah se cyngc þæt Apollonius mid rosan rude
wæs eal oferbræded, þa ongeat he þone cwyde and þus cwæð to
him: Blissa, blissa, Apolloni, for ðam þe min dohtor gewilnað þæs
ðe min willa is.
 21.20. Ne mæg soðlice on þillicon þingon nan þinc
gewurðan buton Godes willan.
 21.21. Arcestrates beseah to ðam þrym cnihtum and cwæð:
Soð is þæt ic eow ær sæde þæt ge ne comon on gedafenlicre
tide mynre dohtor to biddanne, ac þonne heo mæg hi fram hyre lare
geæmtigan, þonne sænde ic eow word.
 21.25. Ða gewændon hie ham mid þissere andsware.
 22.1. And Arcestrates se cyngc heold for ðon Apollonius hand and
hine lædde ham mid him, na swilce he cuma wære ac swilce he his aðum
wære.
 22.3. Ða æt nyxstan forlet se cyng Apollonius hand and eode
ana into ðam bure þar his dohtor inne wæs and þus cwæð: Leofe
dohtor, hwæne hafast þu ðe gecoren to gemæccan?
 22.6. Ðæt mæden þa feol to hyre fæder fotum and
cwæð: ðu arfæsta fæder, gehyr þinre dohtor willan.
 22.7. Ic lufige þone forlidenan man ðe wæs þurh ungelymp
beswicen, ac þi læs þe þe tweonige þare spræce, Apollonium ic
wille, minne lareow, and gif þu me him ne silst, þu forlætst ðine
dohtor.
 22.10. Se cyng ða soðlice ne mihte aræfnian his dohtor
tearas, ac arærde hi up and hire to cwæð:Leofe dohtor, ne ondræt
þu ðe æniges þinges.
 22.13. Þu hafast gecoren þone wer þe me wel licað.
 22.13. Eode ða ut and beseah to Apollonio and cwæð: Lareow
Apolloni, ic smeade minre dohtor modes willan.
 22.15. Ða arehte heo me mid wope betweox oðre spræce þas
þingc þus cweðende: þu geswore Apollonio, gif he wolde gehirsumian
minum willan on lare, þæt þu woldest him geinnian swa hwæt swa seo
sæ him ætbræd.
 22.19. Nu for ðam þe he gehyrsum wæs þinre hæse and
minum willan, ic for æfter him.
 48.1. Ða wæs hyre gecyd, þe ðar ealdor wæs, þæt
þar wære cumen sum cyngc mid his aðume and mid his dohtor mid micclum
gifum.
 48.3. Mid þam þe heo þæt gehirde, heo hi silfe mid
cynelicum reafe gefrætwode and mid purpran gescridde and hire heafod mid
golde and mid gimmon geglængde and mid micclum fæmnena heape ymbtrimed
com togeanes þam cynge.
 48.7. Heo wæs soðlice þearle wlitig, and for ðare micclan
lufe þare clænnesse hi sædon ealle þæt þar nære nan Dianan
swa gecweme swa heo.
 48.9. Mid þam þe Apollonius þæt geseah, he mid his aðume
and mid his dohtor to hyre urnon and feollon ealle to hire fotum, and wendon
þæt heo Diana wære seo giden for hyre micclan beorhtnesse and wlite.
 48.12. Þæt haliern wearð ða geopenod and þa lac wæron
in gebrohte and Apollonius ongan ða sprecan and cweðan: Ic fram cildhade
wæs Apollonius genemnod, on Tirum geboren.
 48.15. Mid þam þe ic becom to fullon andgite, þa næs nan
cræft, ðe wære fram cynegum began oððe fram æðelum mannum,
þe/ ic nu cuðe.
 48.17. Ic arædde Antiochus rædels þæs cynges to þon
þæt ic his dohtor underfenge me to gemæccan.
 48.19. Ac he silfa wæs mid þam fulestan horwe þar to
geþeod and me þa sirwde to ofsleanne.
 48.20. Mid þam þe ic þæt forfleah, þa wearð ic on
sæ forliden and com to Cyrenense.
 48.21. Ða underfengc me Arcestrates se cyngc mid swa micelre lufe
þæt ic æt nyhstan geearnode þæt he geaf me his ancænnedan
dohtor to gemæccan.
 48.24. Seo for ða mid me to onfonne minon cynerice and þas mine
dohtor, þe ic beforan ðe, Diana, geandweardod hæbbe, acænde on sæ
and hire gast alet.
 48.26. Ic þa hi mid cynelican reafe gescridde and mid golde and
gewrite on ciste alegde þæt se þe hi funde hi wurðlice bebirigde, and
þas mine dohtor befæste þam manfullestan mannan to fedanne.
 48.29. For me þa to Egipta lande feowertene gear on heofe.
 48.30. Ða ic ongean com, þa sædon hi me þæt min dohtor
wære forðfaren, and me wæs min sar eal geedniwod.
 49.1. Mid þam þe he ðas þingc eal areht hæfde,
Arcestrate soðlice, his wif, up aras and hine ymbclypte.
 49.2. Ða niste na Apollonius ne ne gelifde þæt heo his
gemæcca wære, ac sceaf hi fram him.
 49.4. Heo ða micelre stæfne clipode and cwæð mid wope: Ic
eom Arcestrate, þin gemæcca, Arcestrates dohtor þæs cynges, and þu
eart Apollonius, min lareow, þe me lærdest; þu eart se forlidena man
ðe ic lufode na for galnesse ac for wisdome.
 49.7. Hwar is min dohtor?
 49.8. He bewænde hine þa to Thasian and cwæð: þis heo
is.
 49.9. And hig weopon ða ealle and eac blissodon, and þæt
word sprang geond eal þæt land þæt Apollonius, se mæra cyngc,
hæfde funden his wif, and þar wearð ormæte blis, and þa organa
wæron getogene and þa biman geblawene, and þar wearð bliðe
gebeorscipe gegearwod betwux þam cynge and þam folce.
 49.14. And heo gesette hyre gingran þe hire folgode to sacerde,
and mid blisse and heofe ealre þare mægðe on Efesum heo for mid hire
were and mid hire aðume and mid hire dohtor to Antiochian, þar Apollonio
wæs þæt cynerice gehealden.
 50.1. For ða siððan to Tirum and gesette þar Athenagoras,
his aðum, to cynge.
 50.2. For ða soðlice þanon to Tharsum mid his wife and mid
his dohtor and mid cynelicre firde, and het sona gelæccan Stranguilionem and
Dionisiadem and lædan beforan him, þar he sæt on his þrimsetle.
 50.5. Ða ða hi gebrohte wæron, þa cwæð he beforan
ealre þare gegaderunge: Ge tharsysce ceastergewaran, cweðe ge þæt ic
Apollonius eow dide æfre ænigne unþang?
 50.8. Hi ða ealle anre stæfne cwædon: We sædon æfre
þæt þu ure cyng and fæder wære and for ðe we woldon lustlice
swiltan, for ðam þe þu us alysdest of hungre.
 50.10. Apollonius þa cwæð: Ic befæste mine dohtor
Stranguilionem and Dionisiade and hi noldon me þa agifan.
 50.12. Ðæt yfele wif cwæð: Næs þæt wel, hlaford,
þæt þu silf aræddest þa stafas ofer hire birgene?
 50.14. Ða clipode Apollonius swiðe hlude and cwæð: Leofe
dohtor Thasia, gif ænig andgit sy on helle, læt þu þæt cwicsuslene
hus and gehir ðu ðines fæder stæfne.
 50.16. Ðæt mæden ða forð eode mid cynelicum reafe
ymbscrid and unwreah hire heafod and cwæð hulde to þam yfelan wife:
Dionisia, hal wes þu.
 50.18. Ic grete þe nu of helle geciged.
 50.19. Ðæt forscildgode wif þa eallum limon abifode, þa
ða heo hire on locode, and seo ceastergewaru wundrode and blissode.
 50.21. Ða het Thasia beforan gelædan Theophilum, Dionisiades
gerefan, and him to cwæð: Theophile, to þon þæt þu ðe gebeorge,
sege hluddre stæfne hwa ðe hete me ofslean.
 50.24. Se gerefa cwæð: Dionisia min hlæfdige.
 50.24. Hwæt, seo burhwaru þa gelæhton Stranguilionem and
his wif and læddon buton ða ceastre and ofstændon hi to deaðe, and
woldon eac Theophilum ofslean, ac Thasia him þingode and cwæð: Buton
þes man me þone first forgeafe þæt ic me to Gode gebæde, þonne ne
become ic to þissere are.
 50.29. Heo ræhte þa soðlice hire handa him to and het hine
gesund faran, and Philothemian, þare forscildgodan dohtor, Thasia nam to
hyre.
 51.1. Apollonius þa soðlice forgeaf þam folce micele gifa to
blisse, and heora weallas wurdon geedstaðelode.
 51.2. He wunode þa þar six monðas and for siððan on scipe
to Pentapolim, þare cireniscan birig, and com to Arcestrates þam cynge,
and se cyng blissode on his ylde þæt he geseah his nefan mid hire were.
 51.6. Hi wunodon togædere an gear fullice and se cyning
siððan, Arcestrates, fulfremedre ylde forðferde betwux him eallum and
becwæð healf his rice Apollonio, healf his dohtor.
 51.9. Ðisum eallum ðus gedonum eode Apollonius, se mæra
cyngc, wið ða sæ.
 51.10. Þa geseah he þone ealdan fiscere þe hine ær nacodne
underfengc.
 51.11. Þa het se cyngc hine færlice gelæccan and to ðare
cynelican healle gelædan.
 51.12. Ða ða se fiscere þæt geseah þæt hine þa
cæmpan woldon niman, þa wende he ærest þæt hine man scolde
ofslean.
 51.14. Ac mid þam þe he com into ðæs cynges healle, þa
het se cyningc hine lædan toforan þare cwene and þus cwæð: Eala
þu eadige cwen, þis is min tacenbora, þe me nacodne underfenc and me
getæhte þæt ic to þe becom.
 51.17. Ða beseah Apollonius se cyng to ðam fiscere and
cwæð: Eala welwillenda ealda, ic eom Apollonius se tirisca, þam þu
sealdest healfne þinne wæfels.
 51.20. Him geaf ða se cyngc twa hund gildenra pænega and
hæfde hine to geferan þa hwile þe he lifede.
 51.21. Hellanicus eac þa to him com, se him ær cydde hwæt
Antiochus cync be him gedemed hæfde, and he cwæð to þam cynge:
Hlaford cyng, gemun Hellanicus, þinne þeow.
 51.24. Ða genam hine Apollonius be þare hand and arærde hine
up and hine cyste and hine weligne gedide and sette hine him to geferan.
 51.27. Æfter eallum þisum Apollonius se cyngc sunu gestrynde
be his gemæccan, þone he sette to cynge on Arcestrates cynerice his
ealdefæder.
 51.29. And he sylfa welwillendlice lifede mid his gemæccan
seofon and hundseofonti geara and heold þæt cynerice on Antiochia and on
Tyrum and on Cirenense, and he leofode on stilnesse and on blisse ealle þa
tid his lifes æfter his earfoðnesse.
 51.33. And twa bec he silf gesette be his fare and ane asette on
ðam temple Diane, oðre on bibliotheca.
 51.35. Her endað ge wea ge wela Apollonius þæs tiriscan,
ræde se þe wille.
 51.36. And gif hi hwa ræde, ic bidde þæt he þas
awændednesse ne tæle, ac þæt he hele swa hwæt swa þar on sy to
tale.

END_TEXT

Leof
B4.2.
Vision of Leofric: Napier 1907-10, 182-6.



 1. Her gesutelað ða gesihðe ðe leofric eorl gesæh.
 2. Him þuhte to soðan on healfslapendon lichaman, na eallinga
swylce on swefne, ac gyt gewisslicor, þæt he sceolde nede ofer ane swiðe
smale bricge, & seo wæs swiþe lang, & þær arn swiðe feorr
beneoðan egeslic wæter, swylce hit ea wære.
 6. Ða þa he mid þam gedræht wæs, þa cwæð him
stefn to, Ne forhta þu.
 7. Eaðe þu þa bricge oferferest.
 8. Mid þam þa wearð he sona ofere, nyste he hu.
 8. Ða þa he ofere wæs, þa com him lateow ongean & hyne
lædde to anum swyðe wlitigan felde & swyþe fægeran, mid swetan
stence afylled.
 11. Þa geseah he swyþe mycele weorud swylce on gangdagan, &
þa wæron ealle mid snawhwitum reafe gescrydde, & þæt on þa
wisan þe se diacon bið þonne he godspell ret.
 13. & wæs an þæra on middan standende on
mæssepreostes reafe, swyþe heah & swyðe mycel ofer eal þæt
oþer folc.
 15. Ða cwæð se latteow, Wast þu hwæt þis seo?
 16. Nese, cwæð he.
 16. Hit is Sanctus Paulus, hæfeð nu gemæssod, &
bletsað nu þis folc.
 17. Ða lædde he hine furðor þæt hi coman þær
þær sæton six arwurðlice menn, swiðe wurðlice gefrætewod.
 19. Ða cwæð heora an, Hwæt sceall þæs fula mann on
ure færræddene?
 20. Þa andswarode him oþer & cwæð, He mot beon mid us,
he is niwan gefullod þurh dædbote, & he cymð to us on þære
þriddan gebyrtide.
 23. Ða wæs eac his gewuna þæt he wolde swyþe lytel
drincan, þeah he mid gebeorum bliðe wære; & þænne he wiste
þæt menn fæste slæpen, he wolde on dihlum stowum hine georne
gebiddan.
 25. Ða wæs he æt Cristes cyrican mid þam cyninge; þa
spræc he on æfen wið þone cyrcward & hine georne bæd þæt
he hine inn lete þænne he þa dura cnylde; ac he þæt forgymde for
his/ druncennysse.
 29. Ða þa he to þære dura com & þær langsumlice
swyðe cnucede & georne cunnode, hwæðer he hi on ænige wisan undon
mihte, ne mihte na.
 31. Ða he þæne cyrcward gehyrde ofer eall hrutan, þa ne
wænde he him nanes incymes, ac feng þa on his gebedo, swa his gewuna
wæs, for þær wæs an forehus æt þære cyrcan duru.
 34. Ða on þam gebede wearð seo duru færincga geopenad,
& he þa sona in eode, & hine to his Drihtene gebæd up ahafenum
earmum.
 36. Ða warð his leohtbora afyrht swyðe, & gefeall him in
anan heale &, mid þære forhtnæsse þæt hine ofereode, slæp.
 37. Ða geseah he full gewisslice þæt he stod on middan
þære flore aþenedum earmum mid mæssereafe gescrydd, & hæfde
grene mæssehacelan on him beorhte scinende, & he þæs swyðe
wundrode.
 41. Eft hit getimode æt oðrum sæle þæt he wæs mid
þam kynge æt þære ylcan stowe.
 42. Ða dyde he swa his gewuna wæs, eode to cyrcean mid his
þreom cnapan, þa þa oðre men slepon; & he hine þa gebæd,
ealswa his gewuna wæs.
 44. Þæt wæs swa neh Sancte Dunstanes byrgenne swa he
nest mihte.
 45. Ða wurðen þa twegen cnapan sona on slæpe, & se
þridda wacode swiðor for ege þonne for his gebedum.
 47. Ða gehyrde he færinga swyðe ungerydelic gelyd þam
gelicost/ swylce þæra muneca setl færlice feollon ealle togedere, &
wæs æfre swa leng swa hluddre & menigfealdre & ungeryddre.
 50. Ða æfter langum fyrste geswac þæt gehlyd.
 50. Þær wæs innan þære cyrcean byrnende blacern.
 51. Þa scean þær færinga leoht inn æt þam eastende,
swylce niwe mona arise, swa þæt hit lihte under þære rode swyðran
earme, þe stod ofer þæt weofed.
 54. Þa wæs hit swa leng swa leohtre, swa lange hit leohtode,
þæt þæs blacernes leoht næs nan þing gesyne, & þæt swa
þæt hit lihte geond ealle þa widgyllan cyrcan.
 56. Swa lange hit wæs þa on ðam, þæt he hit ne dorste
na lengc behaldan, & hit asanode þa on þa ylcan wysan þe hit ær
wæxende wæs, swa ðæt he geseh eft þæt blacern leoht, &
þæt oðer geswac.
 59. & se ofdrædda cnapa þæt eal mid him geseah &
hyrde, swylce hit to gewitnesse wære; & þa oðre slepon &
þæs nan þing nyston.
 62. Neh þon ylcan sæle se cing leg æt Sandwic mid scipum.
 62. Ða wæs his gewuna þæt he wolde ælce dæge habban
twa mæssan, butan hit ma wære, & ealle his tida togædere, ær he
ut eode.
 65. Þa eode he ymbe sume neode, þa mæssede man þam cynge
æt Sancte Clementes cyrcean.
 66. Ða cwæð he to his geferan þæt hit betere wære
þæt hig þa mæssan hæfdon.
 67. & he þa inn eode, & him man sona hrymde; & he
þa sona eode binnan þone weohstal on norðhealfe, & se cyng stod on
suðhealfe.
 69. Ða wæs þær an þrilig wahrægl & swyðe
þicce gewefen þæt hangode bæftan þam weofode.
 71. & stod þær an medmycel rod on ðære eorðan on
ðam norðeasthyrnan; & wæs swa mycel þæs treowes gesyne swa
wolde beon god hande brad beneoþan þam wahrifte; & se oðer dæl
wæs betwyx þam wahrifte & þam wahe.
 74. & se preost mæssode be cruce.
 74. Ða geseah he ofer þa rode ane hand swylce heo bletsode;
þa wende he ærost þæt sum man hine bletsode, for þam seo cyrce
wæs eall folces afylled; þa næs þæt na swa.
 77. Ða beheold he hit þa gyt geornor, þa geseah he ealle þa
rode swa swutole, swylce þær nan þing beforan nære, & wæs seo
bletsiende hand styriende & wendende upward.
 80. Þa forhtode he & tweonode him hweðer hit swa wære,
swa nim þuhte.
 81. Ða mid þæs modes tweonunge þa æteowde heo him swa
swutole swa he his agene geseon mihte; & wæron fægere fingras smale
& lang, & þæra nægla toscead & se greata lira beneoðan
þam þuman eall wæs gesyne & fram þam littlan fingre toweard
þæs earmes, & sumne dæl of þære slyfe.
 85. Ða ne dorste he hit na leng behealdan, ac heng þæt
heafod adun, & hit þa geswac þæra bletsunga.
 87. Þæt wæs neh þam þe þæt godspel wæs
gerædd.
 89. Feowertyne nihton ær his forðsiðe he foresæde þone
dæg þe he sceolde cuman to Cofantreo to his langan hame, þær he on
restet; & hit aeode eall swa he sæde.
 91. <foreign>Requiescat in pace</foreign>.

END_TEXT

Sol I
B5.1.
Solomon and Saturn (I): Cross and Hill 1982, 25-34.



 0.1. Her kið hu Saturnus and Saloman fettode ymbe heora wisdom.
 0.2. Þa cwæð Saturnus to Salomane.
 1.1. Sage me hwer God sete þa he geworhte heofonas and
eorðan.
 1.3. Ic þe secge, he sætt ofer winda feðerum.
 2.1. Sage me hwilc word ærust forðeode of Godes muðe.
 2.2. Ic þe secge: <foreign>fiat lux et facta est lux</foreign>.
 3.1. Saga me for hwilcum ðingum heofon sy gehaten heofon.
 3.2. Ic ðe secge, for þon he behelað eall þæt hym beufan
byð.
 4.1. Saga me hwæt ys God.
 4.2. Ic þe secge, þæt ys God þe ealle ðing on hys
gewealdum hafað.
 5.1. Saga me on hu fala dagum God geworhte ealle gesceafta.
 5.2. Ic þe secge, on VI dægum God gesceop ealle gesceafta.
 5.3. On þam ærostan dæge he gesceop leoht.
 5.3. On þam æfteran dæge he gesceop þa gesceapu ðe
þisne heofon healdað.
 5.4. On þam þriddan dæge he gesceop sæ and eorðan.
 5.5. On þam feorðan dæge he gesceop heofonæs tunglon, and
on ðam V dæge he gesceop fixas and fugelas and on ðam VI dæge he
gesceop deor and nytenu, and Adam ðone ærostan man.

 6.2. Ic þe secge, fram IIII steorrum.

Ad
B5.2.
Adrian and Ritheus: Cross and Hill 1982, 35-40.



 0.1. Adrianus cwæð to Ritheus.
 1.1. Saga me hu lange wæs Adam on neorxnawange.
 1.2. Ic þe secge, he wæs þrittine gear.
 2.1. Saga me on hwilcne dæig he gesingode.
 2.2. Ic þe secge, on frydæig and on þone dæig he was
ær gesceapen, and on þam dæge he eft asweolt and for þam Crist eft
þrowede on þam dæge.
 3.1. Saga me on hwæðere Adames sidan nam ure Drihten þæt
ribb þe he þæt wif of geworhte.
 3.3. Ic þe secge, on ðære winstran.
 4.1. Saga me hwær sæt ure drihten þa he geworhte heofonan
and eorðan and ealle gesceafta.
 4.3. Ic þe secge, ofer winda fiðerum.
 5.1. Saga me hwær is seo eorðe þe næfre sunne on ne
scean, ne mona, ne næfre wind on ne bleow, nane tid dæges ne ær ne
æfter.
 5.3. Ic þe secge, seo eorðe is in þære readan sæ ofer
þære eode Israela folc of Egipta hæftnode.
 6.1. Saga me hwær scyne seo sunne on niht.
 6.2. Ic þe secge, on þrim stowum; ærest on þæs hwales
innoðe þe is cweden Leuiathan and on oðre tid heo scynð on helle and
þa ðridda tid heo scynð on þam ealond þæt is Glið nemned, and
þar restað haligra manna saula oð domesdæig.
 7.1. Saga me for hwam scyne seo sunne swa reade on ærnemorgien.
 7.2. Ic þe secge, for þam ðe heo kymð up of þære
sæ.
 8.1. Saga me for hwam byð seo sunne swa read on æfen.
 8.2. Ic þe secge, for þan þe heo lokað ufan on helle.
 9.1. Saga me hu mycel seo sunne sy.
 9.2. Ic þe secge, heo ys mare þonne eorðe for þam heo byð
on ælcum lande hat.
 10.1. Saga me hwilc sy seo sunne.
 10.2. Ic þe secge, Astriges se dry sæde þæt hit wære
byrnende stan.
 11.1. Saga me hwæt þæs liuigendan mannes gleng sy.
 11.2. Ic þe secge, þas deadan swat.
 12.1. Saga me hwilc sunu wræce ærest his fæder on hys
moder innoðe.
 12.2. Ic þe secge, þære næddran sunu, for þam ðe seo
moder ofsloh ær þane fæder, and þonne ofsleað þa bearn eft þa
moder.
 13.1. Saga me hwilc bisceop wære ærest on þare ealdan æ
ær Cristes tokyme.
 13.2. Ic þe secge, Melchisedech and Aaron.
 14.1. Saga me hwilc bisceop wære on þære niwan æ.
 14.2. Ic þe secge, Petrus and Iacobus.
 15.1. Saga me hwilc man witegode ærest.
 15.2. Ic þe secge, Samuel.
 16.1. Saga me hwa wrat bocstafas ærest.
 16.2. Ic þe secge, Mercurius se gigant.
 17.1. Saga me hwa sette ærest wineardas of þe hwa dranc
ærest win.
 17.2. Ic þe secge, Noe.
 18.1. Sæga me hwa wære ærest læce.
 18.2. Ic þe secge, Aslerius se wæs cwæden.
 19.1. Sæga me hwæt sint þa twegen men on neorxnawang and
þas gelomlice wepað and beoð unrote.
 19.3. Ic þe secge, Enoc and Helias; hi wepað for þam ðe hi
sceole cuma on ðisne middangeard and beon deade þeah hy ær þone deað
longe yldon.
 20.1. Saga me hwær wuniað hy.
 20.2. Ic þe secge, Malifica and Intimphonis; þæt is on
simfelda and on sceanfelda.
 21.1. Saga me for hwam si se hreuen swa sweart þe ær wæs
hwit.
 21.2. Ic þe secge, for þy þe he eft ne gehwirfde to Noe in to
þære arke þe he ær of gesend was.
 22.1. Saga me for hwam se hrefen þurh gehyrsumnisse geþingode
þæt he ær þurh ofermodignisse agilte.
 22.3. Ic þe secge, þa he fedde Heliam þa he in eode to þam
westenne/ and him þenode.
 23.1. Saga me hwær byð mannes mod.
 23.2. Ic þe secge, on þam heafde and gæð ut þurh þone
muð.
 24.1. Saga me hwilce wihta beoð oðre tid wifkinnes and oþre

 24.3. Ic þe secge, Belda se fisc on sæ and Viperus seo
næddre and Coruus se fugel, þæt is se hrefen.
 25.1. Saga me for hwam seo sæ si sealt.
 25.2. Ic þe secge, for þam þe Moyses wearp on sæ þa tin
word ðære æaldan æ, þa ða he worhte þa breda for þam þe
Israela folc wurðedon deofolgild.
 26.1. Saga me hwæt sindon þa twegen fet þa þeo sawul
habban sceal.
 26.2. Ic þe secge, Godes lufu and manna and gif heo ðæra
naðer nafað þanne byð heo healt.
 27.1. Saga me on hu manegum fiðerum sceal seo sawul fleogan gif

 27.3. Ic þe secge, feower, glæwnisse, geþwærnisse,
strengþe, and rihwisnisse.
 28.1. Saga me, hwilc man wære dead and nære acenned and
æfter þam deaðe wære eft bebyried in his moder innoðe.
 28.3. Ic þe secge, þæt wæs Adam se æresta man, for
þam eorðe wæs his moder and he wæs bebiriged eft in þære
eorðan.
 29.1. Saga me þære burge naman þær sunne upgæð.
 29.2. Ic þe secge, Iaiaca heo hatte.
 30.1. Saga me hwæt hatte þæt þær heo on sætl
gæð.
 30.2. Ic þe secge, Iainta hit hatte.
 31.1. Saga me hwilc word wæs ærest.
 31.2. Ic þe secge, drihten cwæð, gewurðe leoht.
 32.1. Saga me hwæt is hefegost mannum on eorðan.
 32.2. Ic þe secge, hlafordes yrre.
 33.1. Saga me hu fela si fleogendra fugela kynna.
 33.2. Ic þe secge, twa and fiftig.
 34.1. Saga me hwæt nædderkinna si on eorðan.
 34.2. Ic þe secge, feower and þrittig.
 35.1. Saga me hwæt fisckinna si on wætere.
 35.2. Ic þe secge, six and þrittig.
 36.1. Saga me hwa gesceope ealra fisca nama.
 36.2. Ic þe secge, Adam se æresta mann.
 37.1. Saga me hu fela wæs þære kempena þe Cristes hregel
dældon.
 37.2. Ic þe secge, seofon heora wæron.
 38.1. Saga me feower stafas dumbe.
 38.2. Ic þe secge, an is mod, oðer geþanc, þridde is stef,
feorðe is ægesa.
 39.1. Saga me hwæt sint þa þreo ðinc ðe nan mann butan
ne mæig beon.
 39.2. Ic þe secge, þæt is wæter and fyr and isen.
 40.1. Saga me hwa Godes naman nemnede ærest.
 40.2. Ic þe secge, deofol.
 41.1. Saga me hu wæs Crist acenned of Maria his meder.
 41.2. Ic þe secge, ðurc þæt swiðre breost.
 42.1. Saga me hwa dyde þæt sunne stod ane tid dæiges.
 42.2. Ic þe secge, Iosue hit gedyde in Moyses gefeohte; þeo dun
hatte Gabaon þe heo onstod.
 43.1. Saga me hwæt byð betst and wyrst.
 43.2. Ic þe secge, mannes word.
 44.1. Saga me hwæt þam men si leofust on his life and laðest
æfter his deaðe.
 44.2. Ic þe secge, his willa.
 45.1. Saga me hwæt deð þæt swete wurd.
 45.2. Ic þe secge, hit gemanifealdað mannes freondscype and
stilleð mannes feond.
 46.1. Saga me hwylc byð se leasa freond.
 46.2. Ic þe secge, he byð mannes gefera to beode and nang to
neodþærfe.
 47.1. Saga me hwæt onscunað se seoca man þe ær him gesund
lufode.
 47.2. Ic þe secge, þam seoca men byð mete lað þe him
ær was leof and his eagum byð leoht lað þe him æror wæs leof.
 48.1. Saga me on hwam mæig man geseon mannes deað.
 48.2. Ic þe secge, twege manlican beoð on mannes eagum; gif
þu þa ne gesihst þonne swilt se man and bið gewiten ær þrim
dagum.

Sol II
B5.3.
Solomon and Saturn (II): Menner 1941, 168-71.



 1. Saturnus cwæð, Ac hu moniges bleos bið ðæt deofol
and se Pater Noster ðonne hie betwih him gewinnað?
 2. Saloman cwæð, ðritiges bleos.
 3. Saturnus cwæð, Hwæt sindon ða ærestan?
 3. Saloman cwæð, ðæt deofol bið ærest on
geogoðhade on cildes onlicnisse, ðonne bið se Pater Noster on haliges
gastes onlicnisse.
 5. Ðriddan siðe bið ðæt deofol on dracan onlicnisse.
 6. Feorðan siðe bið se Pater Noster on stræles onlicnisse
ðe <foreign>brahhia dei</foreign> hatte.
 7. Fiftan siðe bið ðæt deofol on ðystres onlicnisse.
 8. Sixtan siðe bið se Pater Noster on leohtes onlicnisse.
 9. Seofoðan siðe bið ðonne ðæt deofol on wildeores
onlicnisse.
 10. Eahteoðan siðe bið se Pater Noster on ðæs hwales
onlicnisse ðe leuiathan hatte.
 11. Nygoðan siðe bið ðæt deofol on atoles swefnes
onlicnisse.
 12. Teoðan siðe bið ðonne ðæt Pater Noster on
heofonlicre gesihðe onlicnesse.
 13. Enleftan siðe bið ðæt deofol on yfles wifes
onlicnesse.
 14. Twelftan siðe bið se Pater Noster on heofonlicre byrnan
onlicnisse.
 15. Ðreoteoðan siðe bið ðæt deoful on sweordes
onlicnesse.
 16. Feowerteoðan siðe bið se Pater Noster on gyldenre byrnan
onlicnisse.
 17. Fifteoðan siðe bið þæt deofol on bremles
onlicnisse.
 18. Sixteoðan siðe bið se Pater Noster on seolfrenes earnes
onlicnesse.
 19. Seofonteoðan siðe bið ðonne ðæt deofol on sleges
onlicnisse.
 20. Eahteoðan siðe bið se Pater Noster on seolfrenes earnes
onlicnesse.
 21. Niogonteoðan siðe bið ðæt deofol on fylles
onlicnisse.
 22. <foreign>XX</foreign> siðe bið Pater Noster on Cristes onlicnesse.
 22. On <foreign>xxi</foreign> siðe bið ðæt deofol on ætrenes fugeles
onlicnisse.
 23. On <foreign>xxii</foreign> siða bið ðæt Pater Noster on gyldenes earnes
onlicnisse.
 24. On <foreign>xxiii</foreign> siða bið ðæt deofol on wulfes onlicnisse.
 25. On <foreign>xxiiii</foreign> siða bið se Pater Noster on gyldenre racenteage
onlicnisse.
 26. On <foreign>xxv</foreign> siða bið ðæt deofol on wrohte onlicnisse.
 27. On <foreign>xxvi</foreign> siða bið se Pater Noster on sybbe onlicnisse.
 27. On <foreign>xxvii</foreign> siða bið ðæt deofol on yfeles geðohtes
onlicnes.
 28. On <foreign>xxviii</foreign> siða bið se Pater Noster on arfæstes gastes
onlicnesse.
 29. On <foreign>xxviii</foreign> siða bið deoplicor gehwyrfed ðæt deofol on
deaðes onlicnesse.
 30. Saloman cwæð, Domlicor bið ðonne se Pater Noster
gehwyrfed on Dryhtnes onlicnesse.
 32. Saturnus cwæð, Ac hwa aspyreð ðæt deofol of hefones
holte and hine gebringeð on ðara Cristes cempena fæðmum ðe ðus
hatton, Cherubin and Seraphin?
 34. Saloman cwæð, Uriel and Rumiel.
 35. Saturnus cwæð, Ac hwa scotað ðæt deofol mid
weallendum strælum?
 36. Salomon cwæð, Se Pater Noster scotað ðæt deofol mid
weallendum strælum, and seo liget heo bærneð and tacnað and se regn
hit ufan wyrdeð and ða genipu hit dweliað and se ðunor hit ðrysceð
mid ðære fyrenan æcxe and hit drifeð to ðære irenan
ræccenteage ðe his fæder on eardað, Satan and Sathiel.
 40. And ðonne ðæt deofol swiðe wergað, hit seceð
scyldiges mannes nieten oððe unclæne treow, oððe gif hit meteð
ungesenodes mannes muð and lichoman and hit ðonne on forgietenan mannes
innelfe gewiteð, and ðurh his fell and ðurh his flæsc on ða eorðan
gewiteð, and ðanon helle westen gespyrreð.
 45. Saturnus cwæþ, Ac hulic heafod hafað se Pater Noster?
 46. Salomon cwæð, Pater Noster hafað gylden heafod and
sylfren feax, and ðeah ðe ealle eorðan wæter sien gemenged wið ðam
heofonlicum wætrum uppe on ane ædran and hit samlice rinan onginne eall
middangerd mid eallum his gesceaftum, he mæg under ðæs Pater Nosters
feaxe anum locce drige gestandan.
 50. And his eagan sindon <foreign>xii</foreign> ðusendum siða beorhtran ðonne
ealles middangeardes eorðe, ðeah ðe hio sie mid ðære beorhtestan
lilian blostmum ofbræded, and æghwylc blostman leaf hæbbe <foreign>xii</foreign>
sunnan, and æghwylc blostma hæbbe <foreign>xii</foreign> monan, and æghwylc mona sie
sinderlice <foreign>xii</foreign> ðusendum siða beorhtra ðonne he ieo wæs ær Abeles
slege.
 56. Saturnus cwæð, Ac hulic is ðæs Pater Nosters seo
wlitige heorte?
 57. Saloman cwæð, His heorte is <foreign>xii</foreign> ðusendum siða
beorhtre ðonne ealle ðas seofon heofonas ðe us syndon ofergesette, ðeah
ðe hie sien ealle mid ði domescan fyre onæled, and ðeah ðe eall
ðeos eorðe him neoðan togegnes byrne.
 60. And heo hæbbe fyrene tungan and gyldene hracan and leohtne
muð inneweardne, and ðeah ðe eall middangeard sie fram Adames frymðe
edniowe gewurden and anra gehwelc hæbbe ða <foreign>xii</foreign> snyttro Habrahames and
Isaces and Iacobes, and anra gehwylc mote lifigan ðreo hund wintra, ne magon
hie ðære tungan gerecnesse ne hire mægnes swiðmodnisse aspyrian.
 65. Ond his earmas siendon <foreign>xii</foreign> ðusendum siða lengran ðonne
ealles middangeardes eorðe oððe beamas, ðeah ðe hie sien mid ðy
beorhtestan wyrhtan folmum tosomne gefeged and anra gehwylc ende sie fram
oðrum to ðam midle mid ðy gulliscan seolfre oferworht and mid ðam
neorxnawonges compgimmum astæned, and his handa twa hie sint bradran ðonne
<foreign>xii</foreign> middangeardas ðeah hie sien ealle tosomne gesette.
 71. Ond se halga cantic he hafað gyldene fingras and ðara is
anra gehwylc synderlice þritigum ðusendum dæla lengran ðonne eall
middangeard oððe eorðe.
 73. And on ðæs Pater Nosters ðære swiðran handa is
gyldennes sweordes onlicnis ðæt is eallum oðrum wæpnum ungelic.
 75. His leoma he is hlutra and beorhtra ðonne ealra heofona
tungol oððe on ealre eorðan sien goldes and seolfres frætwednessa and
fægernessa, and ðæs dryhtenlican wæpnes seo swiðre ecglast he is
mildra and gemetfæstra ðonne ealles middangeardes swetnissa oððe his
stencas.
 79. Ond seo wynstre ecglast ðæs ilcan wæpnes he is reðra
and scearpra ðonne eall middangeard ðeah he sie binnan his feower hwommum
full gedrifen wildeora, and anra gehwylc deor hæbbe synderlice <foreign>xii</foreign> hornas
ierene and anra gehwylc horn hæbbe <foreign>xii</foreign> tindas ierene and anra gehwylc tind
hæbbe synderlice <foreign>xii</foreign> ordas and anra gehwilc sie <foreign>xii</foreign> ðusendum siða
scearpra ðonne seo an flan ðe sie fram hundtwelftigum hyrdenna
geondhyrded.
 85. Ond ðeah ðe seofon middangeardas sien ealle on efen
abrædde on ðeoses anes onlicnisse, and ðær sie eall gesomnod
ðætte heofon oððe hell oððe eorðe æfre acende, ne magon hie
ða lifes linan on middan ymbfæðman.
 89. Ond se Pater Noster he mæg ana ealla gesceafta on his
ðære swiðran hand on anes weaxæples onlicnisse geðyn and
gewringan.
 90. Ond his geðoht he is spryngdra and swyftra ðonne <foreign>xii</foreign>
ðusendu haligra gæsta, ðeah ðe anra gehwylc gæst hæbbe
synderlice <foreign>xii</foreign> feðerhoman and anra gehwylc feðerhoma hæbbe <foreign>xii</foreign>
windas and anra gehwylc wind twelf sigefæstnissa synderlice.
 94. Ond his stefen heo is hludre ðonne eall manna cynn oððe
eall wildeora cynn, ðeah ðe hie sien ealle on ðone munt gesomnod ðe sie
in ðære lengo ðe seo line ðe wile þrie and þritigum siða ealle
eorðan ymbehwyrft utan ymblicggan.
 97. Ond ðeh ðe ðæron gesomnod sie eall ðætte heofon
oððe hell oððe eorðe æfre acende, and anra gehwylc ge ðara
cweðendra ge ðara uncweðendra hæbbe gyldene byman on muðe, and
eallra bymena gehwylc hæbbe <foreign>xii</foreign> hleoðor, and hleoðra gehwylc sie
heofone hearre and helle deopre, ðonne gena ðæs halgan cantices se
gyldena organ he hie ealle oferhleoðrað and ealle ða oðra he adyfeð.
 104. Saturnus cwæð, Ac hulic is ðæs Pater Noster.
 104. Saloman cwæð, hafað gyldene fonan, and seo fane is
mid <foreign>xii</foreign> godwebbum utan ymbhangen, and anra gehwylc godweb hangað on
hundtwelftigum hringa gyldenra.
 107. Ond ðæt æreste godweb is haten <foreign>aurum celæstium</foreign>,
ðam ðiostro ne magon hundtwelftigum mila neah gehleonian.
 109. Ðonne nemnað englas ðæt æftere godweb <foreign>spiritum
paraclitum</foreign> in ðam godwebcynne bið Sanctus Mihhael gescyrped on domes
dæg.
 110. Ðonne nemnað englas ðæt ðridde godwebb
<foreign>pastoralices</foreign>, ðæt godwebb wæs on ðæs godwebbes onlicnisse ðe
ieo ymb mines fæder Dauides columban hangode on ðeosum ilcan temple.
 113. Ðonne is ðæt feorðe godwebb haten <foreign>solacitum</foreign>,
ðæt godweb wæs on ðæs godwebbes onlicnisse ðe geo Abimelech, se
goda cining, brohte Criste to lacum and to ansægdnesse.
 116. Ðonne is ðæt fifte godwebb haten <foreign>uita perpetua</foreign>,
ðæt godwebb is ðonne ðære halgan ðrinisse.
 117. Ðonne is ðæt syxte godwebb haten <foreign>sacrificium dei</foreign>,
ðæt is ðonne on eallra deora onlicnesse.
 118. Ðonne is ðæt seofoðe.

Let 1 (Sisam)
B6.1.
Boniface to Eadburga: K. Sisam 1953, 212-223.



 1. Her sagað on þissum bocum þæt domne Wynfrið sende
þis gewrit ærost to þissum leodum, bi sumum preoste se wæs þrage
forðfered and gehwyrfde þa eft to his lichaman.
 3. He sæde þæt he bicome to þisse þeode, and þæt
he spæce wið ðone preost, and he me þa rehte þa wundorlican
gesihðe þa þe he geseah þa he wæs buton lichaman, and þis he me
rehte eall his agene worde.
 7. He cwæð þæt him geeode þurh nedbade þæt his
lichama wære seoc geworden, and he wæs semninga þy gaste benæmed.
 9. And him þuhte þæt hit wære on þære onlicnysse
þe him man þa eagan weccende mid þicce hrægle forbrugde, and þa
semninga wæs seo bewrigennys onweg anumen, and þa wæs him ætywed on
gesihðe ealle þa þing þe him næfre ær gesegen næron ne
onwrigen, and him wæs æghwæt swiðe uncuð þæt þe he geseah.
 13. And þa æt nyxtan wæs eall seo swearte bewrigennis
aworpen fram his eagum, þa þuhte him þæt eall þes middaneard wære
gesamnod biforan his lichaman gesihðe, and he sceawode eall folc, and ealle
eorðan dælas and sæstreamas, under anre gesihðe.
 17. And him þuhte þæt þa englas wæron swilce hig
byrnende wæron, þa þe hine læddon ut of þam lichaman, and he ne
mihte nænig þinga locian on hig for þære micclan beorhtnesse þe hig
mid ymbseted wæron, and hig sungon swiðe wynsumum stefnum and swiðe
geswegum, and hig cwædon, <foreign>Domine, ne in ira tua arguas me, neque in furore
tuo corripias me</foreign>, þæt is, Drihten, ne þrea þu us in þinum yrre, ne
þu us ne steor in þinre hatheortnysse.
 25. And he sæde þæt hig hine abrudon up in þone lyft, and
he þa geseah fyr beornan ymb ealles þyses middaneardes ymbhwyrfte, and se
leg wæs forðblæstende mid swiðe unmætre micelnysse, and he wæs
swiðe egeslic upastigende, and næs eall þes middaneard, þa ic hine
sceawode, buton swilc he wære on anes cleowen onlicnysse, and eall his
weorc, and ic geseah þæt þæt fyr wolde blæstan ofer ealne
middaneard, gif se engel ne sette Cristes rode tacen ongean þam fyre, and
þonne gestilde hit, and se leg swiðrode on micclum dæle.
 33. And ic wæs swiðe unaræfnedlice geþræsted on minum
eagum for þisses micclan brynes ege, and me wæs ealra swiðost seo
gesihð forstynded for þara scinendra gasta beorhtnesse, and þa æthran
þære beorhtan gesihðe an engel minum heafde, and ic wearð þurh
þæt gescyld and gesund gehealden fram þara lega sceaððignesse.
 39. And he sæde, on þære tide þe he wæs of his
lichaman/, þæt þyder wære gesamnode of lichamum swa micel menego
forðferedra sawla swa he ne wende þæt ealles mennisces cynnes nære
swylc unrim menego swilc þæt wæs.
 42. And he sæde eac þæt þær wære micel meniu æt
awergedra gasta, and eac þam beorhtum englum þe þær gesegene wæron,
hig hæfdon micel geflit wið ða awyrigdan gastas bi þam soðfæstan
sawlum þe þær wæron utgongende of lichaman, and þa deoflu wæron
wregende/ þa sawle, and hig wæron heapiende hiora synna pund on hio, þa
englas/ wæron ladiende and lihtigende hiora synna.
 49. And se man sæde þæt he sylf gehyrde ealle his
godwyrcnisse and his agene synna, þa þe he of his giogoðe gefremede,
oððe þæt he on receleaste gefremode, þæt he nolde his synna
andettan, and þæt he on ofergitolness gefremode, oððe þæt he
eallunga nyste þæt hit to synna oðlengde, and ælc þara synna cegde
his agenre stefne wið hine, and hio hine hig ardlice þreadon, and anra
gehwilc þara synna þe he of his iugoðe gefremede, on ænigum hade
þær wæs forðgeboren on hiora midnesse, and hio wæron þus
sprecende, Sum cwæð, Ic eom þin gitsung þe þu unalyfedlice
gegitsodest wið Godes bebodu.
 58. Sum cwæð, Ic eom idel gilp þe þu mid mannum gylplice
ahofe.
 59. Sum cwæð, Ic eom leasung in þære þu gefirenadest
þær þu wære ligende.
 60. Sum cwæð, Ic eom unnyt word þe þu idelice
gespræce.
 61. Sum cwæð, Ic eom gesihð þurh þa þu gefirenadest.
 62. Sum cwæð, Ic eom gemanes and ungehersumnes, þær þu
ealdum gastlicum mannum ungehyrsum wære.
 64. Sum cwæð, Ic eom drupung and sleacnis þe þu wære
receleas in haligra gewrita geornesse.
 65. Sum cwæð, Ic eom swiciende geþoht and unnyt gamen, þe
þu oðra manna lif eahtodest and þin agen lif forlete, and ic þe ofer
gemet on cyrican and buton cirican gebisgode.
 68. Sum cwæð, Ic eom slapolnis mid þam þu wære
geþricced, þæt þu late arise Gode to andettenne.
 69. Sum cwæð, Ic eom unnytnys, and hig him on sædon manega
þing þissum gelic.
 71. And ealle þa þe he on his lifes dagum lifigende gefremode,
þe he areceleasode to andettenne, and manige synna þær cirmdon swiðe
egeslice wið hine þa þe he næfre ne wende þæt hio to synnum
oðlengdon, and þa awyrigdan gastas wæron geswege eallum þam synnum,
and hig wæron hine swiðe heardlice wregende, and hig wæron secgende
ealle þa stowe and ealle þa tide þe hig þa mandæde on gedydon.
 77. And he þær geseah eac sumne þara manna þe he ær
gewundode/ þa hwile þe he lifigende wæs, and se man lifde þagyt, and
to gewitnesse his yfela he wæs þider gelæded, and sio wund wæs open,
and þæt blod wæs stemende, and he wæs cegende his agenre stefne and
hefiestu/ edwit cweðende, and he stælde þæs blodes gyte swiðe
wælhreowlice, and he tealode and heapode micel meniu synna on hine, and
þa ealdan feond trymedon and sædon þæt he wære hira gewealdes and
hira hlytes.
 85. Þa ladedon me min þæt lyttla mægen þa þe ic
earma and unmeodumlice gedyde.
 86. Sum cwæð, Ic eom fæsten þe he his lichaman on
aclænsode wið ðam yfelan geornissum.
 87. Sum cwæð, Ic eom hluttor gebed þæt he geat in
Drihtnes gesihðe.
 89. Sum cwæð, Ic eom untrumra þegnung, þa he mildelice
siocum gedyde.
 90. Sum cwæð, Ic eom sealmsang þone he Gode gedyde to bote
his unnyttra worda, and swa him cegde anra gehwilc þæra mægna, and
wæs hine beladigende wið his synnum, and þas þe þe wæron eac
miccligende þa engellican gastas, and me wæron þas mægnu
bescyldigende þa þe her trymedon, and me wæron þa mægnu miccle
maran geþuht þonne ic æfre wende þæt ic hig on minum mægne
gefremman mihte.
 97. And he sæde eac þæt he geseage on þissum nioðeran
middanearde fyrene seaðas, and þa wæron swiðe egeslice up
blæstende, and he geseah fleogan ingemang þam fyrenen lege þa earman
gastas, þa wæron on sweartra fugela onlicnissum, and hig wæron
hiofigende and wepende and gristbitigende mid menniscre stefne hiora agene
fyrhtu, and þæt andwearde wite, and hig gesæton hwilum lythwon on
þæra seaða ofrum, and hig fiollon eft æfre heofigende in þa
seaðas.
 104. Þa cwæð him an to of þam halgan englum, þeos lyttle
rest getacnað þæt ælmihtig Drihten syleð þissum sawlum celnisse
and reste æfter þam toweardan domes dæge.
 107. And se man gehyrde under þam seaðum, in þære
nioðeran helle, swiðe egeslic granung and swiðe micelne wop þara
hiofigendra sawla.
 109. Þa cwæð him to an þæra engla, þeos granung and
þes wop þe þu her gehyrest in þisse nioðeran helle, þæt syndon
þa sawla þe hiom næfre to ne cymð Godes seo arfæste miltse, ac hio
sceall cwylmian se eca leg.
 113. And he þær geseah eac on sume stowe swiðe wundorlicre
fægernisse, and þær blissode swiðe fægera sawla menigu, þa
laðedon hig hine þæt he come to hiora gefean, gif him alyfed wære.
 116. Þa com þanon swiðe micel sweg, and se wæs on swiðe
micelre swetnysse, þis þonne wæs þæra eadigra gasta oroð.
 117. Þeos stow þonne wæs be þan þe englas him sædan
þæt hit wæs se mæra niorxnawang.
 120. And he þær geseah fyren ea, sio wæs gefylled mid
weallende wite, and hio wæs eall inneweard byrnende, and hio wæs on
wunderlicre fyrhtu, and þær wæs an treow ofer þa ea on brycge
onlicnysse.
 123. Þonne efstan þa halgan sawla to þære bricge fram
þam gemote þe hig æt wæron, and hig gyrndon þæt hig oferforen
þa ea.
 125. Þonne ferdon hig sume swiðe anrædlice ofer þa
bricge.
 125. And sume hig wurdon aslidene of þam triowe, þæt hig
befeollan in þa tintregan ea, sume hig befiollan in fotes deopnesse, sume mid
ealne lichaman, sume oð ða cneowu, sume oð ðone middel, sume oð ða
helan, þonne symble wæs þara sawla æghwilc biorhtre þonne hio ær
wæs, syððan hio eft coman up of þære picenan ea.
 130. Þa cwæð an engel to him bi þam feallendum sawlum,
þis syndon þa sawla þe æfter hinsiðe sumere arfæstre clænsunge
bihofiað, and Godes miltsunge, þæt hig syn him wyrðe to bringenne.
 134. And he sæde þæt he þær gesege scinende weallas,
þa wæron on micelre biorhtnesse and on wundorlicre lengu and on
ormættre heannesse.
 136. Þa cwædon þa halgan englas, þis is sio halige and sio
mærlice ceaster Hierusalem, in þære gefægniað symble þa eadigan
sawla and þa halgan gastas.
 138. And þonne þa sawla coman ofer þa ea, þe ic ær big
sæde, þonne efstan hig eallum mægne wið ðissa wealla.
 140. He þonne sæde þæt hig wæron swiðe beorhte
scinende, and he sæde þæt him wurde for þisse micclan beorhtnesse his
eagena gesihð forstynted, þæt he nænig þinga locian ne mihte on
þa beorhnesse.
 144. Sæde eac þæt þær cumen wære sumes mannes sawul
to þam gemote se wearð dead in abboddomes þegnunge, and sio wæs
swiðe wlitig gesegen.
 146. Þa gegripon þa deoflu þa sawle, and hig sædon
þæt hio wære hiora hlytes and hiora anwealdes.
 147. Þa andswarode him an of þam halgan englum and cwæð,
Ic eow nu gecyðe hraðe, ge earman gastas, þæt þios sawul ne bið
eowres/ gewealdes.
 150. Þa mid þy þe þis gecweden wæs, þa com þær
færlice micel heap swiðe hwittra sawla, and þus wæron cweðende,
þes abbod wæs ure ealdor, and us ealle he gestrynde Gode mid his lare, and
he bið alysed for þissum weorðe, and he ne bið eowres anwealdes.
 153. Þa gefuhton þa englas wið ðam deoflum, and þa englas
þa geeoden on þa deoflu þæt hig generedon þa sawle of þara
awerigdra/ gasta anwealde.
 156. Þa þreade se halga engel þa deoflu, and cwæð, Wite
ge nu þæt ge genamon þas sawle buton rihte, gewitað ge nu, earman
gastas, nu in þæt ece fyr.
 158. And þa se engel þis gecweden hæfde, þa ahofan þa
awyrigdan deoflu swiðe ormætlicne hiaf, and hig wurpon hig sylfe mid
cwealmlicre flihte on þa byrnende seaðas, and hig coman eft æfter
lyttlum fæce in þæt gemot, and hig fliton bi manna sawla gewyrhtum.
 163. And hig fliton eac bi þara manna gewyrhtum þe in þissum
life mislice lifiað.
 164. And he sæde eac, on þa tid þe he wæs buton lichaman,
þæt he mihte sceawian þa men þa þe wæron mid synnum besmitene,
and eac þa þe wæron mid halgum mægnum Gode þeowigende and mid
arfæstnyssum hæfdon ælmihtigne God.
 167. And he geseah þæt þa Godes men wæron symble
biscyldende fram þam englum, and þa englas wæron to him geþeodde mid
sibbe and mid lufu.
 170. And he sæde bi þam mannum þe wæron gefylde mid
manfullum synnum, þæt þær wæron symble deoflu to þam geþeodde,
and he sægde þonne se man syngode, oððe on worde oððe on dæde,
þæt þa deoflu þæt singallice sædon þam wyrrestan deoflum, and
þæt hig hit brohtan mid hleahtre in hira midnesse.
 174. And he sæde þonne se man firnode þæt þa deoflu
brohtan ælce synne onsundran þam oðrum deoflum to gewitnesse, and he
sæde þæt se diofol semninga þa synne gelærde þone man, and
þæt he hig eft semninga gecydde þam deoflum.
 179. And he sæde þæt he geseage grindan her on worulde an
mægden on anre cweorne.
 180. Þa gesioh hio licgan oþres mægdnes lorh wið hig,
swiðe fægre awrittenne, mid fagum flese.
 181. Þa forstæl hio hine.
 182. Þa wæron þa deoflu sona gefylled mid swiðe
ormætlice gefean, and þær urnon sona fif þa wyrrestan deofla and
sædon þa stalu to scylde in þara oðra deofla gemote, and hig wregdon
þa stale to scylde, and sædon þæt þæt mæden wære
fyrenfull.
 185. And sæde eac þæt he þær gesege sumes ealdes
preostes sawle on micelre unrotnesse se wæs lyttle ær dead, and þam he
þegnade þonne he læg on his feorhadle, and he me þa bæd þa he
wæs sweltende þæt ic bæde his broðor þæt he friode sum
mænnen for hine þæt wæs hiom bæm gemæne.
 190. Þa ahead he hit him, ac his lices broðor for his gitsunge
agælde/ þa bene and nolde hig gefyllen.
 191. Þa wæs his sawul on þære hextan sworetunge, and
wæs/ wregende hire þone ungetriowan broðer, and hio hefiglice hine
þreade/.
 194. And þa þis wæs eall þuss gespecen and gesceawod, þa
bibudon þa eadigan englas þæt his sawul ahwyrfde eft buton yldinge to
his lichaman and he þa gecydde eall þæt him þær æteawed wæs
gelyfedum mannum; and þam þe hit bismorodan, þonne forwyrnde he þam
þære segene.
 198. And sumum wife he gerehte hire synne, sio wæs eardigende in
feorþiode, and he hire gecydde þæt hio mihte geearnian, gif hio sylf
wolde, þæt hire wære ælmihtig God miltsiend.
 201. And sumum mæssepreoste he gerehte ealle þas gastlican
gesihðe.
 202. Þæs mæssepreostes nama wæs Bogia, and se hine
gelærde þæt he þa gesihðe mannum cydde.
 203. And he gecydde þam preoste þæt he wæs iu for manegum
wintrum bigyrded for Godes lufan mid iserne gyrdelse, and næs him þæs
nænig man gewita.
 206. And he sæde þa he eft sceolde to his lichaman, þæt
he þa nænigre oðru wiht swa swiðe onscunode on ealre þære
gesihðe þe he geseah swa his agenne lichaman, ne him nan þing swa ladlic
þuhte ne swa forsewenlic, and he næfre gastanc hiardran fulnes þonne him
þuhte þæt se lichama stunce, buton þam deoflum and þam byrnendum
fyre þe he þær geseah.
 211. And him þa wæs biboden þæt he hwyrfde to his
lichaman in dægred, and ær he eode of his lichaman æt þam forman
hancrede.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Let 2 (Kluge)
B6.2.
De sanguine [an excerpt]; letter to Brother Eadweard: Kluge 1885a, 62-3.



 1. Her geswutelað on ðisum gewrite hu God ælmihtig forbead
mancynne ælces cynnes blod to etenne.
 2. God cwæð to Noe æfter þam mycclum flode: þære
sæ fixas and þære eorðan nytenu ic sylle eow to bigleofan, buton
þæt ge heora blod neþicgon.
 4. Witodlice þæra nytena blod ic ofgange æt eowrum handum,
and þæs mannes lif þe ofslagen byð ic ofgange æt his slagan:
swahwaswa mennisc blod agyt, his blod byð agoten.
 6. Eft cwæð God to Moysen : ic eom eower God ðe eow lædde
of Egypta lande.
 7. Neþicge ge nanes nytenes blod on eowrum mettum, ne fugela ne
oðra nytena; ælc ðæra manna ðe blod ytt sceal losian of his folce,
beo he inlenda beo he ælðeodig; forþanðe on þam blode is þæs
nytenes lif.
 10. Swahwaswa fehð fugel oððe deor þæra þe mannum to
mettum synd alyfede, ageote heora blod on ða eorðan and swahwaswa þæs
blodes hent and him to mete macað, he losað of his folce.
 12. Eft we rædað on Canonibus þæt nan nyten þe to mete
sceal, nebyð clænlice acweald, buton þæt incunde blod ðe anbutan
þære heortan is ut yrne.
 14. Þeah hit beo geblodegod on sumum lime and þæt liflice
blod ut ne yrne, hit byð swaðeah to astorfenum geteald.
 16. Ic secge eac ðe, broðor Eadweard, nu ðu me þyses
bæde, þæt ge doð unrihtlice, þæt ge ða Engliscan þeawas
forlætað þe eowre fæderas heoldon and hæðenra manna þeawas
lufiað þe eow ðæs lifes neunnon and mid ðam geswuteliað þæt
ge forseoð eower cynn and eowre yldran mid þam unþeawum þonne ge him on
teonan tysliað eow on denisc ableredum hneccan and ablendum eagum.
 21. Nesecge ic na mare embe ða sceandlican tyslunge buton
þæt us secgað bec, þæt se beo amansumod þe hæðenra manna
þeawas hylt on his life and his agen cynn unwurþað mid þam.
 24. Ic bidde eac þe, broðor, forþamðe þu byst uppan lande
mid wimmannum oftor þonne ic beo, þæt þu him an þing secge gif ðu
for sceame swaþeah hit him secgan mæge; me sceamað þearle þæt ic
hit secge ðe.
 26. Ic hit gehyrde oft secgan and hit is yfelsoð þæt þas
uplendiscan wif wyllað oft drincan and furþon etan fullice on gangsetlum
æt heora gebeorscipum; ac hit is bysmorlic dæd and micel higeleast and
huxlic bysmor, þæt ænigman æfre swa unþeawfæst beon sceole
þæt he þone muð ufan mid mettum afylle and on oðerne ende him gange
þæt meox ut fram and drince þonne ægðer ge þæt ealu ge þone
stenc/, þæt he huru swa afylle his fracodan gyfernysse.
 32. Ic nemæg for sceame þa sceandlican dæde, þæt
ænigman sceole etan on gange, swa fullice secgan swa hit fullic is; ac
þæt næfre nedeð nan ðæra manna ðe deah.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Let 3 (Ker)
B6.3.
Scribbles: Ker 1957, 319-20.



 1. Midnewinter ic scolde cuman ham.
 1. Þa axode he me hwæþer me wære leofre þar be
wæs/.
 2. Þonne on cristes cyrcan.
 2. Þa sæde ic þæt me wære leofre on cristes cyrcean
þonne þar be westan swa hit æfre gewyrðe, amen.
 2. Seo hlæfdige.
 3. Cing ceolnoðe on ece yrfe.
 4. Gyrnað embe gretað gramm.
